html:
• ABOUT

    With an industrial chic vibe, black and white decor, and clean lines greeting diners, 1 Tyrwhitt Bistro & Bar is savoury Italian dining done right. Don’t expect all the gimmicky frills other Italian restaurants bring because this place is about two things: the food and the drinks. So what you can expect, and should totally look forward to, is delicious hand-tossed, thin crust pizzas crisped to perfection (the Black Truffle Egg Pizza is a must-try), authentic, home-made pastas, and a wine list that’ll beckon you for days! (Aug 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Garden Vegetable Soup, Caprese Salad, Crispy Mild Wings, Meat Lovers Pizza, Black Truffle Egg Pizza, Black Pepper Ribeye Steak, Carbonara Bacon, Panna Cotta

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/one-tyrwhitt-bistro-bar

  • ABOUT

    1-Altitude offers a dazzling view of the city’s skyline. With a wide menu of food and drinks, 1-Altitude provides diners with a mesmerising wine and dine experience right in the heart of Singapore. The best place to be during sundown, visit 1-Altitude for post-work shenanigans. Kickstart your meal with a delicious plate of Creamy Fish Laksa Pasta. Rich and tasty, the pasta combines the well-loved classic carbonara sauce with the local spicy broth, packing a punch of flavour in every mouthful. Another interesting rendition of sweet and savoury flavours is the Bak Kwa Carbonara Pasta. Sharing options at 1-Altitude are also aplenty with their array of food platters. The Satay Platter is a hot favourite, with marinated beef, pork and chicken skewers served with warm rice cakes. As the night progresses, expect rounds of great classic cocktails and alcoholic spirits as well as delectable bar bites while the live band serenades you. (Jul 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Creamy Fish Laksa Pasta, Bak Kwa Carbonara Pasta, Satay Platter, Truffle Mushroom Pizza

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/1-altitude
name: 1-Altitude

html:
• ABOUT

    Located on Sentosa island, 1-V:U promises a dining experience like no other. Just a four-minute walk from the Wings of Time show and accessible via Imbiah station along the Sentosa Monorail, 1-V:U is the crown jewel of The Outpost Hotel. Open for breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner, the 60-seater luxe-casual dining room offers front-row access to the live culinary theatrics through an open kitchen by the team of chefs, led by Ace Tan.The Communal Menu is interestingly themed "Terra" (land), and "Aqua" (sea), to put the spotlight on their meats and seafood dishes respectively.Standouts include the refreshing Grilled Tiger Prawns, served in a chilled lemongrass galangal prawn broth, along with avocado and glass noodles. If you prefer red meat, be sure to try the Beef Tartare with Confit Yolk, drizzled with smoked sesame dressing, and served with scallions and nashi pear. The day club on the other hand is an exquisite oasis for sun-seekers seeking an escape from the city bustle. With daily DJ sessions on deck bringing Deep House and Soulful beats all the way from day to night, 1-V:U is where it's at for the endless summer vibes. Cool off with a signature cocktail in hand, while grooving to poolside beats as you take in the unparalleled panorama of the island. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jospered Octopus, Glazed oyster blade steak, Red snapper fillet

  • ADULT-EXCLUSIVE SUNDAY BOTTOMLESS BRUNCH PARTY

    Set to recur every Sunday, Singapore’s first and only rooftop dining destination transforms into an adults-exclusive bliss-out escapade from day to night; an endless Sunday made for thirsty party-goers. Giving everyone’s favourite Sunday activity a facelift, 1-V:U Restaurant presents the adults-only Social Brunch. Mingle with old friends and make new ones while diving into a plethora of boozy offerings alongside an extensive brunch menu. From 12 noon to 3.00 pm, be treated to unlimited servings of appetisers and brunch dishes, one main and one dessert as well as three hours of endless Prosecco, wine and access to the decked-out DIY Bloody Mary and cocktail stations ($98++). Whether you’re curing that hangover from partying too hard the day before or looking to kick up your brunch game a notch with a breakfast tipple, swirl up your very own Bloody Mary and Sunny Mary cocktails with a variety of garnishes, ranging from strawberries to - for an extra kick - kimchi. The brunch gets the ball rolling with free-flowing starters, such as the Mr. Mussel of sourdough toast layered generously with pickled mussels and kimchi slaw, the Coconut Lime Ceviche served atop a crisp nori cracker and an amped up Potato Salad with generous chunk of crab and cucumbers doused in a umami-laden seaweed emulsion. The mains will see the moreish Seared Chicken Thigh doused in a XO Capers Sauce and served with an array of fried baby potatoes, corn, cauliflowers and mizuna, a plant-powered pasta of Asian Pesto Capellini with garlic shoots, and, celebrating the boutenous offerings of the ocean, a Seafood Platter of grilled octopus, tiger prawns and clams doused in a piquant pepper emulsion sauce. Round off the indulgent affair is crowd pleasing Chitose Strawberries with Rum Sponge Cake and Yoghurt Sherbet and a tropic-inspired Caramel Pineapple topped with Coconut Rocks and Coconut Lime Ice Cream for the dessert.When: Every Saturday & SundayTime: 12-3pm Price: • $68++/ pax (Brunch only) • $98++/ pax (Brunch + 3 Hours free flow Prosecco, DIY Bloody Mary station, housepour wines, juices and soft drinks)

    Located on the lobby level, 10 SCOTTS exudes an aura of elegance and relaxation with its contemporary yet classic décor. 10 SCOTTS, one of the few restaurants in Singapore with an address that is perfect for that business coffee meeting, afternoon high tea or leisurely evening cocktail amidst home-like space that exudes luxury.   • THE BUZZ

html:
• ABOUT

    13% Wine Bistro was founded on a shared love of fine wine, great food, and the unpretentious atmosphere of vineyards across Europe. Snugly nestled on the second floor, simple furniture and walls loaded with frames fade into the background as the enormous chalkboard panel listing specials and recommendations draws your attention. Warm bulbs and aqua lights tracking along the 8-metre mosaic bar set a cosy scene whilst diners peruse the special Iberico and cheese counter, or take their seats and eagerly await the delicious parade of contemporary European cuisine and international wines to come. Whether you're an expert or just starting out, 13% Gastro Wine’s drink list will take you on a pleasant wine-tasting journey as you dig into delicacies like Tatins, grilled Black Iberico "la Pluma" marinated with cured Iberico ham, or the Coca Iberico (featuring Coca bread topped with Comté cheese, Iberico Ham, Portobello, roasted tomato & garlic sauce and fresh herbs). Sharing boards are also available to stave off hunger pangs between tipples - an absolute necessity! It's all the pleasures of vineyard wine tasting without the high prices and stuffy snootiness. (Apr 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Unwind over post-work drinks at this new wine bar, which flaunts a wide variety of vinos from all over the world. The wine list includes reds from Spain, France and Lebanon, as well as fortified wines from Portugal. Pair these with delectable bar bites such as endive tatins (a baked upside-down pastry), falafel and fries fried in beef fat." -Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Angus Burger, Coca Tomato, Baked Camembert, Gougères, Selection of Cheese and Cold Cuts

html:
• ABOUT

    Chef Alvin Leung might have earned himself international fame with his famous ‘Sex on the Beach’ dish, but you don’t have to worry about konjac-based ‘condoms’ filled with ham jus on the menu here. Instead, Leung takes things down a notch and puts his focus on turning out charcoal-grilled items and interesting sauces. You’ll want to order the Singapore-style Laksa, Leung’s tribute to our little red dot. The slippery noodles are dipped in a rich gravy made from a generous amount of prawn shells and coconut milk, with tea-smoked quail eggs and tempura tiger prawns that elevate this humble dish. The Whole Boston Lobster in Thai Dressing is another dish that shows off a creative sauce — this time, made from fish sauce, lime and chilli, and diced mangosteens and tomatoes. For lighter, more refreshing fare, try the Sashimi of Hamachi. The fleshy slices are plumped up with a zesty calamansi gel, ponzu sauce, and a smattering of slightly bitter and crunchy garlic chips. Come for the creative cooking without gimmicks. (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Keep your eyes on this restaurant for some good interpretations of local and Asian cuisine.” -Lifestyle Asia Singapore

  • THE LOBBY LOUNGE AFTERNOON TEA RESERVATIONS

    For The Lobby Lounge Afternoon Tea Reservations, please click on this link.

    Yellowfin Tuna Akami, Foie Gras Kaya Toast, Pork Prime Rib ‘Bak Kut Teh’, Black Angus Beef Short Rib, Pandan Soufflé

  • KEMPINSKI SUNDAY BRUNCH

    The decadent epicurean experience is now broken down across multi-courses of bespoke selections brought to the table, each underscored by Demon Chef Alvin Leung’s signature dishes. When: Every SundayTime: 12-3pmPrice:• $138++ per adult and $69++ per child* • With sparkling wine beverage +$48 • With champagne beverage +$68 • With vintage beverage +$118 *Children aged between 6 and 12 years old

Enjoy free-flowing cocktails, spirits and sparkling wine, as well as the signature Boodle Fight Feast - a hearty char-grilled platter of tender meats, succulent seafood and fresh vegetables, all served on a fragrant banana leaf a la Filipino-style. When: Every last Saturday of the monthTime: 12-3pmPrice: $158++ per person

html:
• ABOUT

    History breathes beneath the floorboards and inside the walls of this beautiful bar at the Sofitel smack in the middle of the Central Business District. As a nod to the rich maritime history of the area around the hotel, this luxe bar was named 1864 after the year the historic Tanjong Pagar Dock Company was founded, and it evokes equal parts modern luxury and old-world glamour. In the day, it is a breakfast and tea lounge, serving up eggs, Viennoiseries, coffee, and high-tea platters. At lunchtime, treat yourself to tapas with a French-Asian profile, think spicy Scallop Brochette, ikura-studded Salmon Crostini, and smoky Kurobuta Pork Yakitori served up with cold soba noodles. By the night-time, all the good vibes come together to turn the space into a sexy wine and cocktail bar, serving hotel guests alongside the city’s swanky barflies, turning out barrel-aged cocktails and premium wines faster than you can say “martini”. The signatures here include a regal Cognac Old Fashioned, the Martinez, a forgotten classic made with gin and cherry liqueur, and a cheeky Coconut Negroni that puts a Singapore spin on the international favourite. Luxury, elegance, and a quiet spot to while away the day: they don’t often make hotels like this anymore, steeped in old-world charm and flawless hospitality. (Nov 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “A plush lobby bar that’s the perfect place for a quiet nightcap. Sip on champagne or barrel-aged cocktails as you enjoy the intimate setting, and revel in the joy that you’re not fighting for a seat at a bar unlike the masses walking up and down Tanjong Pagar.” -Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Honey Cheesecake, Chestnut Choux, Coffee Jivara, Marinated Top Shell with Pickled Cucumbers in Pie Tee

• ABOUT

    1927 Rooftop Pool & Bar is a luxe hotspot, delighting guests with fashionable and entertaining social experiences including their renowned monthly pool parties. There are summertime vibes all year round with an infinity-edged rooftop pool, sun lounges and DJ decks. The poolside playground's award-winning mixologists are elevating Singapore’s nightlife with their seductive signature cocktails paired with chef's selection of small and large bites. Nibble on summertime classics such as the SO Hot Chix Wings and Crispy Shoestring Parmesan Truffle Fries, or satisfy your cravings with the SO Tower, a stacked Wagyu Beef Burger topped with SO Sauce. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Barcelona Bikini, Beef Sliders, Iberico Ham, Confit Eggplant

  • PROMOTIONS

    RHUM SO/CIETY Promotion Encouraged by the love of Rhum, that beautiful golden elixir of joy. A passport for Rhum if you will, our Thursday tastings, for 30 people at a time, will have a Rhum expert waxing about the Rhum brand of the day, and all that makes it special. You’ll get a Welcome Rhum Cocktail of the day, some bar bites, 5 tasting portions, and 20% off drinks the rest of the day on your bill. Limited to 30 seats, so hurry book your entry now!When: first Thursday of every monthTime: 7:30pm onwardsPrice: $45++ per person | $40++ per person for pre-payment and non-refundablePromotion includes: - Welcome 1927 Signature Cocktail - Rhum Masterclass inclusive 5 samples of selected Rhum 15ml - Bar Bites - 20% off drinksTerms & Conditions: - Kindly indicate 'RHUM' under 'Special Requests' when making a reservation to enjoy the promotion.

An urban oasis in the heart of the Central Business District, 1927 Rooftop Pool & Bar invites you to indulge with all year round summer time vibes alongside an infinity edged rooftop pool and lush greenery. Ladies Night just got SO/ fun! html:
• ABOUT

    Explore the different combination of flavours with 21 on Rajah unique spread of Mediterr-Asian Buffet. Indulge in familiar street delicacies while exploring Mediterranean’s exotic flavours. Think a rijsttafel (rice table)-inspired sumptuous buffet spread filled with Mediterranean favourites such as Traditional Greek Salad with Marinated Feta Cheese and Black Olives, Grilled Lamb Chop with Garlic-Mint Sauce and Eggplant, Okra and Tomato Tagine. In additional to the ice crustacean bar and the carving station serving the restaurant's signatures NZ Prime Beef Rib-Eye with 21 On Rajah Signature Homemade Sauces and Slow-Cooked Salted Salmon in Tamarind Sauce, there is a new station featuring items such as Seafood and Chicken Paella, Tortilla de Patatas Espanola (Spanish Omelette with Potatoes) and assorted pizzas. Weekend dinner brings along an up the notch delights of Arabic Mezza and Antipasti Station and an addition of Snow Crab in the Ice Crustacean bar. Not forgetting Chef’s recommended favourites such as Slipper Lobsters in Chili Crab sauce, Ikan Panggang, Braised Crabmeat Ee-fu Noodles and 21 on Rajah special Basmati Rice. End your night with a sweet treat at the churros station and chocolate fondue where you may also find a selection of French and local pastries and 21 On Rajah's beverage highlights. As one of the premier Halal-certified buffets in the city, its east meets west food and vibe makes it a truly unique concept. (Aug 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "This is possibly the only restaurant in the neighbourhood where you'll find paella, tapas and sangria on the menu. There is Southeast Asian fare to be had as well, and in a thoughtful nod to the rich heritage of the neighbourhood, local favourites too." -Singapore Tatler "It's rare to find exotic flavours around Balestier. Plus it's pretty affordable." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Singapore Laksa, Roasted U.S. Angus Beef Prime Rib-Eye, Nonya Kuehs, Sago Melaka, Durian Mousse

html:
• ABOUT

    2D1N Soju Bang is the sister restaurant to the popular Korean BBQ joint Ssikkek, located just upstairs. At 2D1N, the focus is on authentic, homely Korean cuisine. The Ginseng Chicken Soup, for instance, is a comforting dish featuring a plump, tender chicken simmered in a nourishing broth infused with slices of spiced ginger and spring onions. Meat lovers will also love the Korean steamed spicy chicken. A healthier alternative to the deep-fried version, the meat here is tossed with the same sweet spicy sauce, and steamed until tender. Potatoes, carrots, and onions are accompaniments that turn this dish into a hearty stew. Of course, the Kimchi Pancake is another not-to-be-missed classic. The crisp edges of the fried pancakes are perfect to nibble on, while the tangy slivers of kimchi nestled in the fluffy pancake help to cut through the richness of the dish. Wash it all down with a glass or two of sweet Makgeolli. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ginseng Chicken Soup, Beef Galbi Soup, Korean Steamed Spicy Chicken, Kimchi Pancake, Korean Ramen with Kimchi Soup

  • href

  • ABOUT

    A savoury twist to Singapore's food scene focused on affordable but quality experience, 49 Seats has been in the F&B industry since 2012 and has established a strong local presence. It is recognised for its fusion style meals with a slight twist of local flavour. 49 Seats, the pioneer of Tom Yum Pasta as well as Fish and Chips with Tom Yum Sauce in Singapore, is our go-to for foods full of spicy and savoury flavours. Apart from their groundbreaking tom yum dish, 49 Seats is also famous for their Creamy Smoked Duck Pasta, which is one of the most popular smoked duck dishes on the market. Founded on the belief of creating a fun and friendly environment, 49 Seats offers a casual dining experience that continues to serve quality food to the guest's heart. With a price that is comfortably affordable to all, customers get to enjoy their fusion food at any time of the day. (Feb 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

html:
• ABOUT

    Following the philosophy that good food can also be affordably priced, 5 Senses Bistro serves up comfort dishes, reminiscent of mama’s cooking. The kitchen team takes pride in the food they cook, as seen from the attention to detail — Carbonara, for instance, an all time favourite pasta dish with slivers of juicy bacon, cook to al dente, precise 62°C poached egg finishing off with freshly grated parmesan cheese. The restaurant’s signature dish, Confit French Duck Leg & Pan Seared Norwegian Salmon, are also a delight to tuck into. For a heartier, full bodied main course, try the 150 Days Grain-Fed Angus Braised Beef Cheek. The beef is cooked for long hours so that the meat is meltingly soft and fork-tender, suffused with a rich, heady flavour from the gravy. Be sure to save some space for dessert. Classics like the Apple Crumble and a delicious, warm Chocolate Lava Cake are sweet comforts to indulge in at the end of the meal. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Carbonara, Confit French Duck Leg, Pan Seared Norwegian Salmon, 150 Days Grain-Fed Angus Braised Beef Cheek, Apple Crumble, Chocolate Lava Cake

html:
• ABOUT

    Rebranded itself to emphasise its focus on fresh seafood and good service, Cafe 56 is now known as 566 Seafood. Come here for their impressive variety, with fish, prawns, lobsters, scallops and more cooked in almost every style you can dream of. You'll have a hard time deciding whether your live-caught Garoupa should be steamed in soy sauce or coated in sweet and sour sauce. The poultry and beancurd dishes are equally strong contenders, with firm favourites being the Pan-Fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Honey Sauce and Braised Homemade Beancurd. Even humble dishes like porridge are jazzed up with the addition of a succulent lobster. Another reason that makes this place a gem is its ambience. Tucked away in Mandai estate, its offbeat location and pared back interiors bring back memories of the good ol' kampong days. Patrons can choose among three themes to dine in — jungle, kampong and Chinese banquet — adding a quirky touch to an already amazing dining experience. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab, Curry Fish Head, Hakka Rice Wine Claypot Chicken, Pan-fried “Kurobuta” Pork Chop with Honey Sauce, Braised Homemade Beancurd with Bamboo Charcoal and Mushroom

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    NA

• PRESS RELEASE

    Sitting at the top of Andaz Singapore at Level 38, 665°F is the hotel’s premium steakhouse, where you can take in the rich interior inspired by classic Savile-Row tailor shops and stunning views of the Singapore skyline. Named after the temperature of the Pira oven and grill in which sits in the heart of a show kitchen, 665°F is a cosy dining experience specialising in gourmet prime cuts and sustainable seafood. (Aug 2019)

  • CHEF'S SIGNATURE

    Wagyu Beef Salad, Grilled King Crab Leg, Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, Rangers Valley Beef Tomahawk, A4 Kagoshima Wagyu Striploin, Apple Wood Smoked Wagyu Brisket, Lamb Chop with Harissa Marinade

html:
• Good For

    Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions

  • ABOUT

    Located along Singapore’s bustling nightlife lane along Cuppage Road, 6ix 6ix serves up delectable Chinese cuisine along with a host of alcoholic beverages. The ideal place for a quick get together among family and friends, 6ix 6ix’s wide variety of skewers are always great for chilling over beers or as a starter to a sumptuous feast. Well-known for the Mala Grilled Fish, the restaurant has an array of other fiery and tongue-numbing dishes that will have you going back for seconds. A milder version, the Chilli Oil Grilled Fish, is best suited for sharing among friends who have different spice tolerance levels. Drenched in spicy sauce, the fish is juicy and extremely flavourful. Order a couple of Sichuan delights such as the Pork in Fragrant Chilli Oil, Kung Pao Chicken, Mapo Tofu, and more to complete the fiery Sichuan experience. For those looking for tasty one dish meals that afford you more bang for your buck, the Mala Noodle Soup and Egg Fried Rice are classic favourites that are filling and satisfying. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mala Grilled Fish, Pork in Fragrant Chilli Oil, Kung Pao Chicken, Mala Noodle Soup

    Enjoy 50% off at 6ixty 7even Restaurant & Bar when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • ABOUT

    Featuring a thoughtfully designed food menu that brings diners on a gastronomic adventure, 6ixty 7even Restaurant & Bar specialises in plating up mouthwatering European cuisine in small sharing plates with a modern twist. Coupled with an extensive range of wine, whisky, sake, beers and cocktails, this humble restaurant and bar along Neil Road aims to delight and tease your discerning palates with good food and great wines. Start off small with the restaurant’s luxe offerings of modern contemporary tapas. Farmed in QianDao lake, the Caviar Oscietra is one of the world’s most expensive delicacies served here with Bilinis, Creme Fraiche and condiments for maximum flavour. Seafood lovers can opt to kickstart their meal with a serving of French Fines De Claire Oyster or Live Maine Lobster for a taste of the freshest catch from the ocean before diving into more ocean delights such as the Sea Urchin, Hokkaido Scallop or Chilean Sea Bass. For those in search of meaty options to satisfy their carnivorous cravings, we recommend ordering the 89 degrees Braised Wagyu Brisket to indulge in bone marrow, parmesan potato espuma and jamon tuile. Other equally tantalising meat dishes include the Iberico Pork “Presa” and Steak Tartare. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Caviar Oscietra, French Fines De Claire Oyster, Hokkaido Scallop, Steak Tartare

  • href

Menus: Takeaway Bundle Menu  Set Lunch Menu  Menu  Karaoke Pricing
html:
• ABOUT

    Forget your usual seedy KTV lounge, this spot is the new place to be. Serving a selection of delicious international bites alongside KTV entertainment, this spot is sure to give other lounges in Singapore a run for their money. With sharing plates and individual portions on offer, diners can sing late into the night without fearing that they will go hungry. There is a snack menu with nibbles such as the Signature Truffle Fries, which are deep fried till golden brown and crisp, then drizzled with truffle oil and topped with parmesan cheese for an extra touch of richness. For something a little heartier, opt for the Spam Fries - deep fried luncheon meat topped with parmesan cheese and garlic mayo dip. The Lychee Smoked Duck Pizza is another must-try. This unique dish incorporates the fruity sweetness of lychee into a meaty pizza dish. The combination may look odd on paper, but the sweet and smoky flavours combine to make a delicious dish. Not as adventurous? The Mac & Cheese is another option. Made with soft elbow pasta topped with bacon and baked with cheese, this dish is rich and sure to fuel you through a marathon singing session. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lychee Smoked Duck Pizza, Mac & Cheese, Signature Truffle Fries, Honey Paprika Wings

  • TAKEAWAYS & DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways & delivery instead. Takeaway Operating Hours Mon-Sun: 11.30am-11pm Promotion- 15% off for all menu items except for tarts and cakes

name: 7th Heaven KTV & Cafe

html:
• ABOUT

    Korean BBQ is all about the meat, but at some barbecue joints, you end up scarfing down generic slabs of meat with little to no character or flavour. Not at Eight Korean BBQ, a sleek, industrial-chic barbecue joint at swanky Shaw Centre that prides itself on its meat know-how. Here, the focus is on exquisite cuts from premium varieties of beef and pork. They’ve sourced super-rare Mangalitza pork that has a rich meatiness and beautiful, flavourful fat, as well as Toriyama Wagyu beef, the “rolls royce” of high-end Japanese beef known for its buttery texture and flavour. In true Korean style, you can have your meats seared unadorned, coated in a punchy marinade, or served up in a nourishing stew. The restaurant’s name is drawn from its signature dish, the Eight Colours Set, which brings eight portions of pork belly, each a different colour, from pink and unseasoned to a spicy, fiery red that signals its heavy gochujang flavour. Premium choices abound, a kind of choose-your-own-adventure Korean BBQ experience. Stop by for funky Korean BBQ and experience some of the best meat the world has to offer! (Aug 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “If you like your food to come with a twist… you would like Eight Korean BBQ… I like the herbal marinade, which is made with aromatic basil, rosemary and other herbs... as well as the garlic flavour.” -SoShiok

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Flower Pork Set, US Prime Short Rib, Army Stew, and Makgeoli

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/eight-korean-bbq
name: 8 Korean BBQ (Shaw Centre)

Address: 6 Eu Tong Sen Street#02-79/90The CentralSingapore (059817)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    My oh my do we love some Korean grilled meats. Our latest craze? None other than E!GHT Korean BBQ, located at The Central at Clarke Quay. The exclamation mark in lieu for the letter ‘i’ is warranted at E!GHT Korean BBQ, as any food lover would get understandably hyped up over its tantalising array of impeccable BBQ meats. Pork features front and centre here, and we encourage guests to go whole hog. Grab a few friends and partake in the signature 8 Colours Set, where thick strips of pork belly are marinated eight different ways, with wine, ginseng, garlic, miso, and red pepper paste. If you were wondering why the pork here is so rich and tender, it’s because the establishment only uses the famous Mangalitsa pork from Hungary, better known as the ‘Kobe beef of pork’. Searching for something comforting? Then why not order up one of E!GHT’s many stews? Top picks include Beef Kimchi Stew, Seafood Bean Paste Stew, and the Army Stew. Finally, complete your meal with some grog, whether it be Korean Hite Beer or Korean Raspberry Wine. Prepare to feast like kings in this industrial chic Korean grill, where you won’t even have to lift a finger as the attentive service staff do all the cooking right in front of your eyes. (Jun 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “This is a full-service restaurant, which means the staff handles all the BBQing for you so just sit back, relax, and feast.” –Honeycombers

    Enjoy 10% off at 8 Korean BBQ (The Central) when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    8 Colours Set, Beef Kimchi Stew, Seafood Bean Paste Stew, Army Stew

Menus: Breakfast Menu  Lunch Menu  Teatime Menu
html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    For breakfast, fuel your day with our Breakfast Platter, a morning classic of 9th avenue. Filled with so much goodness, our croissant packed with smoked salmon, egg mayo and greens. Accompanied with a side of hearty granola yoghurt and potato, mushroom cheese gratin. Complement it with our specially curated beverages to provide you with various options, it will give you the boost of energy to keep you moving throughout the day! For lunch, get ready to be spoilt for an expansive array of choices. Seafood Minestrone, Blacken Beef Salad to Texas Popeye Waffle and Mascarpone Mousse with Breton Shortbread. There is definitely something for everyone to enjoy! Need a little pick me up in the afternoon? No worries, we got you for tea time! Perk yourself up with our all-time favourites, Premium Chocolate Tart and Pistachio Financier. Couple it with our brewed beverages for a warm and cosy feeling or our cool refreshment! (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    For appetisers, Seafood Minestrone and Blacken Beef SaladFor mains, Pesto ‘Salmo Salar’ and Texas Popeye WaffleFor desserts, Dulcey Panna Cotta with Citrus Curd & Banana Sorbet, ‘Chouxlynder’ and All Time Favourite Sourdough for any time of the day snack

html:
• Good For

    Business Meetings, City Views, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    Bringing in Northern and Eastern Indian Cuisine with a hint of fusion delight, this fine-dining bistro is here to impress your tastebuds with good flavour and a boozy time. Aapon's menu offers vegetarian and non-vegetarian options to suit every guest's taste. As a starter, try their Assorted Gol Gappa Shots, in which you can enjoy a taste of everything in each of the 5 assorted flavoured puffed flour balls. With a whole menu dedicated to the Biryani options, Aapon's Biryanis must not be missed. Go for their Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani if you're looking for something filling to share, full of fragrant spices and large chunks of chicken that go well with firm rice. We recommend ordering this with sides to share so that you really enjoy the full experience at Aapon. There is also Vegetable Biryani available at Aapon so that vegetarians can experience the same delicious taste. A hearty and filling dish, packed with seasonal vegetables, it pairs perfectly with any curry or chutney. As far as main dishes go, Aapon's Mutton Shank Nihari is our favorite. Served with fall-off-the-bone tender mutton and a delicate Nihari sauce, the savoury and saucy bone marrow is sure to send you to umami heaven. For vegetarians, try their Palak Paneer, a thick creamy gravy with spinach and cottage cheese that will melt on your tongue and is the perfect accompaniment to any rice dish or bread. To top off your meal here, try the Bengal Caramelised Yoghurt (Lal Misti Dahi), a sweet Bengali treat with a curd-like texture. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Assorted Gol Gappa Shots, Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani, Vegetable Biryani, Mutton Shank Nihari, Bengal Caramelised Yoghurt (Lal Misti Dahi)

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/aapon
name: Aapon

html:
• Good For

    Casual Dining, Drinks

  • ABOUT

    Offering a fine selection of Japanese and Australian wagyu, Aburi-EN specialises in “aburi”, partially grilled meat. The pride and joy of the restaurant, its A4/A5 Miyazaki wagyu has consecutively clinched Japan’s “National Wagyu Award” three times. Harvested from carefully selected pigs which enjoy a natural diet of chestnuts and other nutritious food, the restaurant’s Buta Don bowls feature hearty servings of tender juicy meat with a sweet nuance. Pop by during lunch to enjoy a bowl of Premium Buta Don with a mini bowl of asari miso soup and pickles. Alternatively, choose to add on a healthy bowl of greens or an Okinawa Onsen Egg to compliment your meal! Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the Wagyu Stamina Don. Topped with a beautiful Okinawa egg, this don is a tasty mix of grilled miyazaki, Australian wagyu and mixed vegetables. Other mouthwatering rice bowls here include the Chicken Nanban Don, Unagi Jyu and Aburi Salmon don. For those who prefer a steaming warm bowl of noodles to satiate your cravings for authentic Japanese food, the Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen and Wagyu Niku Udon comes highly recommended. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Premium Buta Don, Wagyu Stamina Don, Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen, Wagyu Niku Udon

  • ABOUT

    Offering a fine selection of Japanese and Australian wagyu, Aburi-EN specialises in “aburi”, partially grilled meat. The pride and joy of the restaurant, its A4/A5 Miyazaki wagyu has consecutively clinched Japan’s “National Wagyu Award” three times. Harvested from carefully selected pigs which enjoy a natural diet of chestnuts and other nutritious food, the restaurant’s Buta Don bowls feature hearty servings of tender juicy meat with a sweet nuance. Pop by during lunch to enjoy a bowl of Premium Buta Don with a mini bowl of asari miso soup and pickles. Alternatively, choose to add on a healthy bowl of greens or an Okinawa Onsen Egg to compliment your meal! Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the Wagyu Stamina Don. Topped with a beautiful Okinawa egg, this don is a tasty mix of grilled miyazaki, Australian wagyu and mixed vegetables. Other mouthwatering rice bowls here include the Chicken Nanban Don, Unagi Jyu and Aburi Salmon don. For those who prefer a steaming warm bowl of noodles to satiate your cravings for authentic Japanese food, the Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen and Wagyu Niku Udon comes highly recommended. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Premium Buta Don, Wagyu Stamina Don, Kyushu Tonkotsu Karamiso Ramen, Wagyu Niku Udon

  • ABOUT

    Constantly on the hunt for the best wagyu in town, Aburiya is the true champion of Japanese wagyu beef. Visit the Japanese restaurant located at Boat Quay to embark on a real Japanese wagyu beef journey in more ways than one. Drop by in the afternoon to have a go at their delicious don sets that are affordably priced. Served with a cup of hot tea, salad, and a bowl of piping hot miso soup, the Wagyu Roast Beef Don set comes in two sizes to cater to different preferences. Topped with radish, spring onions and a generous amount of beautifully marbled wagyu meat, the fluffy grains of Japanese rice complements the tender beef and makes for a sumptuous lunch. For those looking to satisfy their carnivorous cravings, the wagyu set menu is perfect for sharing between two pax. Indulge in an intimate meal with a platter of Kazoku Mori. A mix of wagyu short rib, wagyu loin, pork belly, pork cheek and sausage, this generous platter is accompanied by egg soup, assorted kimchi, vegetables and more for a satisfying meal. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Roast Beef Don, Kazoku Mori, Aburiya Salad, Tegutan Ramen

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in Southbridge Hotel in Singapore’s Chinatown is abV@Southbridge, a modern restaurant bar that serves up a wide range of alcohol. From craft beers to premium spirits, abV also boasts a delicious menu that’s sinfully indulgent, equally affordable, and guaranteed to satisfy your tastebuds. It’s the perfect place for an evening to catch up with friends, or if you’re simply looking for a place to let loose after a long day at work. With a vibrant, chic ambience, you’ll feel right at home relaxing with a glass of alcohol that can be paired with any dish on their menu. Specially curated by their executive chef, abV@Southbridge has created signature dishes best paired with their drinks. Try their meaty Ham Hock, a deliciously oven-roasted pork knuckle with crispy, crackling skin. It’s the perfect dish paired with a smooth glass of vodka, enhancing both the drink and the taste of the dish. Fan favourites include their OP Ribs, oven prepared and bathed in a delicious BBQ and Red Wine sauce, or their Blue Mussels Pasta, if you’re hankering for some seafood. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bloody Mary, Charred Iberico Pork Jowl, OP Ribs, Blue Mussels Pasta, Ham Hock

  • ABOUT

    Acoustics Coffee is guided by the simplicity of providing a restorative safe space for customers. They infuse quality and natural ingredients into their menu and provide a “sound” environment for relaxation and conversation over coffee and food. Serving all-day brunch, go for their Breakfast at Acoustics for a taste of all their best breakfast offerings, including maple glazed bacon. For the sweet tooth, have a go at their signature Acoustics Pancakes, generously adorned with nutty crumble and fresh banana slices that are guaranteed to fill you up. Acoustics also offers a dinner menu from 5pm to 9pm every Friday and Saturday, so if you’re in the area, do pop by to enjoy indulgent dishes like their saucy Chilli Crab Pasta and Mint Pesto Steak. A must try is their Grilled Baby Back Ribs that are deliciously sous vide for 12 hours, giving them a delightfully tender bite and smoky flavor. Or go for something fusion, the Laksa Cream Pasta that gives local flavours a different take. If you can’t get enough of their Laksa Cream Pasta, you can order their Crispy Tofu Puff stuffed with laksa chicken on the side to indulge your laksa fix. With fresh ingredients and healthy cooking methods like sous vide, eat to your heart’s delight without breaking the waistline or your diet. To finish off your meal, Acoustics Deconstructed Cheesecake is the cherry on top to sweeten the deal. Pair this with one of their signature cocktails like Litchi for a boozy finish. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Breakfast at Acoustics, Acoustics Pancakes, Grilled Baby Back Ribs, Laksa Cream Pasta, Acoustics Deconstructed Cheesecake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/acoustics-coffee-bar
name: Acoustics Coffee Bar

html:
• ABOUT

    If you’re on the prowl for truly authentic Italian food, look no further than Acqua e Farina. This charming, tastefully decorated restaurant will welcome diners with warm, positive vibes from the moment they step in (think lots of wood and brick in the interiors). Lovely décor wouldn’t mean very much without great grub, though, and we’re happy to say that Acqua e Farina’s mouthwatering list of Italian treats, made from produce mostly imported from Italy, is an absolute delight. Luxuriate in Italian culinary heaven with dishes like the signature Pizza Acqua e Farina, with its delectable toppings of salami, tomato, mozzarella, ricotta cheese, and sautéed spinach. Each bite will unleash a delicious medley of flavours, and before you know it you’ll be chowing down with unexpected enthusiasm and speed! The pastas aren’t to be sneezed at either – the Spaghetti ai Gamberi is bound to impress with its helpings of oh-so-fresh prawns and a spiciness that gives it extra ‘kick’. Finally, few meals are complete without a dessert to round things off – and if you’re unsure of what to get, why not try the Piatto di Dolci? This platter contains mini portions of Crème Brûlée, Lava Cake, Panna Cotta, and Tiramisu, providing you with a very well-rounded coda to your meal. There are many other dishes on the restaurant’s hefty menu that aren’t mentioned here, so why not nip down and check it out sometime soon? You won’t regret it, we promise! (Feb 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “If it’s Italian food you’re after and you’re particular about authenticity, Acqua e Farina will check all the boxes for you. And, its extremely reasonable price point is just the cherry on top.” -Honeycombers SG

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pizza Acqua e Farina, Piatto di Dolci, Spaghetti ai Gamberi, Bistecca al Pepe Verde, Risotto ai Funghi, Linguine ai Frutti di Mare

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/acqua-e-farina
name: Acqua e Farina

html:
• ABOUT

    Get ready to embark on a sensational culinary experience at ADDA as the best dishes from India take on a fun, contemporary twist. Relax and soak up the ambience in the restaurant’s comprehensive concept of a restaurant, bar and lounge, all rolled into one. A fun take on the popular Indian street food, the Pani Puri is a plateful of sweet and savoury fried puff pastry balls filled with spiced mashed potato. Made for the discerning palate, this dish is a must try here at ADDA. Topped with caramelised cottage cheese and spiced salsa queso, the Adda Nachos features crunchy and thick homemade gram flour nachos loved by all. Served with a side of avocado salsa, the Prata Quesadillas comes stuffed with peppers and cheese for the vegetarians. A non-vegetarian option is also available on the menu. Pair your meal with a heady cocktail mix artfully crafted by the restaurant’s master mixologist, or opt for The Spice Adda experience with a melange of signature ADDA cocktails and a carefully curated wine list of over 50 options. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pani Puri, Adda Nachos, Prata Quesadillas, Charred Laksa Salmon

  • ABOUT

    Located along the iconic Robinson Road, Aether House is the go-to place for exceptional wines, amazing craft coffees, and authentic French cuisine. Boasting a chic interior and a relaxed atmosphere, it’s the perfect place for wine enthusiasts, coffee lovers, and foodies to meet and share their passion for the art of living. Start off your dining experience with their Petits Plats, or small bites. We recommend the La Truite De Rivière which consists of cured trout, grapefruit, and fennel — perfect with a glass of white wine. Or have a go at their L'escargot which are tender snails baked in herbs and garlic butter. Splurge a little and try out their Le Foie Gras, a creamy homemade foie gras terrine on sourdough toast. All their small bites are amazing paired with wine, so be sure to check with their friendly staff for the best accompaniments with each dish. If you’re overwhelmed with choices, go for the chef’s tasting menu. You get to sample three to five small bites specially curated by the chef paired with a glass of wine or two. If you’re there for a night out with friends, go for their cheese and charcuterie. You get to curate your very own charcuterie board to share. To end off your meal, have a little bit of everything with their Le Café Gourmand, an assortment of six mini sweets to indulge your sweet tooth. For coffee lovers, try out their Tasting Flight for a sample of everything. For tea lovers, go for their unique flavours like Cabernet Tea, or Pinot Noir Tea. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Le Truite de Rivière, Le Foie Gras, Le Café Gourmand

name: Aether House

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Afterglow is a plant-based restaurant that champions a pure food movement. We believe that food is made to grow from a seed, into a fruit or herb according to its kind. At Afterglow, we try to use as many natural ingredients as possible that are good for your body and the environment. With 8 years of experience in the local Singapore F&B scene, Afterglow aims to be Asia’s top plant-based brand. We create meaningful experiences through the food we serve, the community we’ve partnered with and the lives that have been and will be impacted by pure plant-based food. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Afterglow Kimchi Avo Rolls, Teriyaki "Meat"balls, Lentil Flaxseed Nuggets, Tom Yum Zoodles, Raw Crispy Lasagne, Cauliflower Steak, Raw Chocolate Salted Caramel Fudge, Raw Cheesecake

  • THE BUZZ

    "One of the newer additions to Singapore's growing list of vegetarian-friendly places, Afterglow (thanks to its industrial-chic interiors) go-to spot for raw food has some impressive plates like an addictive spicy raw nut "cheese" dip made from cashews." -Honeycombers "These guys serve unique salads, wraps and deconstructed sushi bowls that are not only wheat-free, sugar-free, and dairy-free but are darn delicious too! Their more-ish desserts, such as their delectable Salted Caramel Chocolate Fudge Cake, will have you questioning all your preconceptions of healthy food not being tasty." -Sassy Mama Singapore "Vegan-friendly creations take center stage at this new farm-to-table raw food eatery that offers plenty more than just wholesome grub, from fine wine to locally made products like vintage bicycles." -SG Now "These guys and gals only use fresh wholesome non-processed ingredients with a focus on raw food and farm-to-table style dishes. They also make everything from scratch including cold pressed juices, nut butters and cheeses and crispy rosemary crackers." -Urban Journey

• PRESS RELEASE

    Ah Hoi's Kitchen is all about authentic Singaporean cuisine, bringing diners the true flavours of Singapore with expertise built over more than 20 years of heritage. Serving only the freshest seafood prepared with traditional recipes, this dining institution has made a name for itself for its Sri Lankan Crabs perfected with the culinary team's unique Singapore Chilli Crab recipe, as well as iconic local dishes including Fried Black Pepper Kway Teow and Salted Egg Prawns. Other signature dishes featured on the menu include Steamed Sea Perch with Crispy Bean Crumb, Salted Egg Baby Lobsters, Seafood Claypot Mee Tai Bak, Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg and Poached Spinach with Conpoy and Trio Egg, as well as Stir-fried Kenya Beans with Dried Shrimp and Garlic. The dining experience is complete with classic local desserts such as Yam Paste, Ice Kacang and Durian Chendol. Tucked away on top of Tanglin Mall, Ah Hoi's Kitchen offers an airy, sun-kissed al fresco setting with great poolside views. (Jan 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "We highly recommend the honey glazed ginger chicken. Sweet and tender, the chicken pieces are sumptuous, while ginger slices gave the dish flavor and prevented the sweetness from being overpowering. It's a must try." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ah Hoi’s Chilli Crab, Black Pepper Crab, Salted Egg Crab with Crispy Yam, Steamed Sea Perch with Bean Crumb, Fried Black Pepper Beef Kway Teow, Durian Chendol

  • 1-FOR-1 BABY LOBSTER AND JUMBO TIGER PRAWNS (4 MAR TO 29 MAY)

    Seafood lovers can look forward to the ultimate indulgence with a 1-for-1 promotion on Jumbo Tiger Prawns and Baby Lobsters at only $68++ at Ah Hoi's Kitchen at JEN Singapore Tanglin. Each dish features 500g of fresh delectable shellfish. The seafood feast is made more irresistible with value-added offer 10 Baked Oysters at $38++ (U.P $50++) for every order of the 1-for-1 seafood.     A member of Marriott Bonvoy, dine in a menu of bold culinary offerings grounded in highly-lauded chef Akira Back’s signature philosophies. Delight in an unexpected and exploratory culinary style of modern Japanese cuisine as chef reinvents the traditional Japanese playbook of dining with a menu where elegant melding of cultures inspires the evolution of culinary tradition. Signatures include Tuna Pizza, thinly-sliced fresh Tuna by pairing it with an umami aioli with a sprinkle of truffle oil atop the delicate crust. The classic Korean dish of Yukhoe is elevated with Tajima wagyu striploin served with nashi pear and sesame soy, topped with a quail egg yolk and seaweed caviar.Discover Akira Back’s signature flavours, where the show is not just in the mouth. (Feb 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    In our minds, a culinary gem hidden in plain sight would be the best way to describe Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments. Synonymous with its Italian name, 'the Village', this unpretentious Italian Trattoria situated along Bukit Timah is known by its fans for its warm service and rustic Italian fare. Despite its modest interior of dark wood floors and tiled bricks, the food at Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments is second to none. It should come as no surprise though, judging by Chef Mimmo's insistence on using only the freshest ingredients and making most of the dishes from scratch! Diners are in for a real treat as Chef Mimmo brings his Italian roots to the plate with a range of classic Napoleon dishes such as Parma, Quattro Formaggi and Bufala Pizza - a thin crusted tomato based pizza baked to perfection and topped with arugula, slices of fresh bufala mozzarella and cherry tomatoes. Fancy some light evening breeze while sipping on a glass of Bordeaux? Al Borgo @ Alocassia Apartments' al fresco dining area is a hit with its regulars, and it's easy to see why. Imagine enjoying some great Italian food with a glass of wine in hand, while the sun sets in the background. I guess that's what the Italians mean by 'La Dolce Vita'. (Sept 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Rustic flavours that warmed our hearts included the spaghetti in a rich tomato base flanked by clams, mussels and shrimps, served piping hot in parchment paper; Contadina pizza crowned with four cheeses, salami, mushrooms, peperoni and red capsicum; and a lamb stew doused in a red wine-laced crimson tomato sauce." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Papparadelle Al Cinghiale, Filetto di Manzo alla Brace, Gamberoni, Tagliolini al Nero Seppia, Pizza Contadina, Pizza Parma, Quattro Formaggi, and Bufala, Tiramisu

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2015 and 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    A sunny retreat that has been an East Coast staple for 20 years, Al Forno really knows what it's doing when it comes to fresh Italian favourites. With all the Italian options in Singapore, it's no wonder the competition is stiff enough to see many a restaurant come and go, but Al Forno has stood the test of time and tastiness with a beautifully simple philosophy. Take the freshest Italian ingredients, make dishes that people know and love, and the diners will come. And while it's now a common claim to source ingredients like vine ripened whole tomatoes and peppery parmigiana directly from Italy, Al Forno was the first to do so, with exclusive imports since 1995. That means the dishes here have been tasted, tweaked and perfected so that you can't go wrong with anything on the diligently genuine, yet approachable menu. The Linguine All' Aragosta, more commonly known as Lobster Linguine, is a house favourite, featuring salty capers and olives punctuating a naturally sweet red sauce made from cherry tomatoes. Succulent chunks of lobster tail and thick noodles of linguine soak up the sauce perfectly. For more of that divine signature sauce, go for the Spaghetti Cartoccio, which is studded with a mix of shelled seafood and baked up in a decadent foil package for two. From the pizzas, the Pizza Con Carne is a knockout, with all forms of meaty deliciousness arranged neatly atop the authentic foldable crust. The Pizza Rollo is a great starter or family pick, featuring a melt of ricotta, spinach and ham all rolled up. Looking quite charming atop their trademark checkered tablecloths, all the dishes taste as good as they look! (Mar 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The pizza is the real draw, although good antipasti and pasta are also on the menu. It doesn't really matter what pizza you choose, it's the homemade crust, tomato sauce base, good cheese and wood-fired oven that make it great." -SG Asia-City

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Linguine All' Aragosta, Spaghetti Cartoccio, Pizza Al Forno, Pizza Rollo, Pizza Con Carne

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2015 and 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    If you aren’t in the know, the dim and unassuming interiors or covered doorways of the eateries along Amoy might baffle and leave you wondering if there really are plenty of food options here – perhaps one of the reasons why the bright spaces of ALATI will inevitably catch your eye. From the invitingly open arched doors to the signature blues and whites of the Mediterranean coating the interiors, everything, including the food, will transport you to Greece. For full authenticity, the produce is brought here, fresh from the Aegean Sea, and items on the menu are crafted by hand, which might explain the depth of flavour in dips like Taramosalata (fish-roe cream) and Melitzanosalata (smoked eggplants with walnuts). Of course, there’s more than pita and dips on the menu. Fill up on amazing Salt-Baked Fresh Fish, grilled gems like the Octopus and Squid – simply named but complex on the tongue – and mains like Kotopoulo Souvlaki (grilled chicken with fried potatoes and yoghurt) as well as Mousaka (minced beef, eggplant, potatoes and béchamel sauce). Even their drinks menu boasts Greek tipples like Mastiha and Ouzo, an uncommon sight in Singapore. Bring on the influx of Japanese and American diners to our shores, we’re not complaining, but it’s nice to see more unusual cuisines, that prove deliciously authentic, opening up in the heart of the city! (Feb 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "On the food front, the claim to fame is that their seafood is flown from the Aegean every week, making the signature salt-baked fresh fish ($50-$70), topped with a lemon caper sauce, an especially attractive proposition." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Octopus (XTAPODI), Salt-Baked Seasonal Greek Fish, Calamari Souvlaki, Beef Souvlaki, Mousaka

• ABOUT

    Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant prides itself on being the purveyor of fine Mediterranean, Turkish, and Middle Eastern dining. With indoor dining as well as alfresco seating in historic Kampong Glam, be treated to impeccable Turkish hospitality while you feast on dishes that are meticulously prepared from only the best ingredients.The menu is extensive, featuring hot and cold appetisers, pide, kebabs, mains, desserts, and more. The Meze Tabagi is a great introduction to the cuisine, with an assortment of popular mezes and a side of hot Turkish Lavas Bread.For mains, specialities include the Adana Kebab, a grilled skewer of marinated minced chicken, the Kuzu Pirzola, grilled lamb chops with homemade gravy, and the classic Moussaka. Choose from the wide range of Turkish breads to go along with the protein-heavy dishes too, from classic sourdough to ones topped with melted cheese.The desserts are equally tempting and will definitely satisfy anyone with a sweet tooth. If we had to choose a favourite, it would be the Kunefe, a thin vermicelli pastry baked in soft cheese and soaked in syrup. Wash all the goodness down with a comforting pot of traditional apple tea. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Meze Tabagi, Adana Kebab, Kuzu Pirzola, Moussaka, Kunefe

  • BOOKINGS

    For reservations of 7 people and above, please contact the restaurant directly.

    The AlcoVault Bistro & Whisky Bar, aka the Alcohol Vault. Over 500 rare and everyday whiskies, natural wines, Gins, Vodkas, Tequila, craft beers, draught beer, and stout, cocktails…you get the idea. Pair that with delicious mouth-watering carefully crafted tapas, steaks, lamb chops, and our DAMN GOOD Chicken wings guarantees you get the best food and a whole lotta alcohol. The friendliest, fun, rock loving atmosphere and people completes the night of your lives. Immerse yourselves in a fun and colorful environment with a good ol bottle of whisky and drown those weekday blues away. Not much of a whisky fan? Fret not! The bar has a wide variety of alcoholic beverages ranging from brandy to Gin and Vodkas. If you prefer to drink by the jug, check out fancy cocktail menu options such as the Vodka Lime Spritzer, Long Island Tea, or Sangria. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    T-bone Steak, Lamb Chops, Damn Good Chicken Wings, and The Overwhelming Amount of Alcohol at Your Disposal For Any Occasion.

  • ABOUT

    Nestled along the bustling Keong Saik district, Alegria serves up non-traditional Latin Asian cuisine, with Asian and European influences. Hailing from one of the hottest dining spots in Manilla, Philippines, “Alegria”, which translates to joy and happiness in Spanish, is a restaurant and bar that serves unique dishes that are partly non-traditional, partly deconstructed with a playful expression that leaves diners room for discovery! Start your meal with signature starters such as Alegria’s refreshing Ceviche with Tuna, scallop, and menu drizzled with ponzu, Pao de Quiejo (freshly baked Brazilian cheese bread served warm with basil butter) and Nacho, a crispy large masa chip made in-house with prawn bits, cheese on a bed of guacamole spread, served with a Salsa Rioja dip. Available in sharing portions to spread the joy among family and friends, and whet your appetite before indulging in the mains. For mains, diners can look forward to the Duck Inasal, featuring parilla grilled duck breast, inasal sauce, pickled kohlrabi, and fennel, served with fragrant coconut sakura ebi rice. Seafood lovers can relish in Pulpo, octopus sous vide for five hours which keeps the texture tender yet to the bite. Enjoy this with home-styled Mamak mole, pickled ancho potatoes with muscovado bacon crumble! It’s tacos galore here at Alegria! We recommend selecting a good mix of Alegria’s signature tacos (tortilla made in-house) on offer to have a bite of everything! From seafood favorites such as prawn in squid ink batter paired with kimchi to meaty delights including Sisig pork belly, seared beef and Barbacoa chicken satay, Alegria’s taco selection is set to satisfy all your cravings. Wrap up your meal with our freshly made churros and dulce de leche - some say it’s the best they’ve tried! Lastly, the Alegria experience wouldn’t be complete without a drink or two of their signature cocktails, and an array of tipples. Vegetarian options are available too. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Koreana Taco, Sisig Taco, Ceviche, Nachos, Pulpo, Churros, Duck Inasal

    A cocktail bar tucked between two heritage Peranakan shophouses along Emerald Hill, Alley Bar is an architectural gem that seamlessly weaves old world charm with contemporary design for a cosy and inviting atmosphere. Serving up a mix of stellar cocktails and non-boozy drinks, Alley Bar’s photo-worthy cocktails will definitely have you reaching out for more. Perfect for after-work socials or gatherings with friends, the bar has a wide variety of happy hour classics and cocktails for all. Despite its retro flair, courtesy of its classic contemporary furniture pieces combined with a selection of vintage art framed in statement frames - that will steal a few moments from conversations even among long-lost friends with some drinks. (Mar 2022)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Conceived as the culinary hub of the hotel, Alley on 25 is Andaz Singapore's all-day dining venue that aims to recreate the fluid, spontaneous experience of Singapore street dining - in the sky.Icehaus Guests hankering after a light meal can head to Icehaus, an outlet inspired by kitchens of a bygone, pre-electricity era, when food was kept cool in wooden cabinets filled with ice slabs. Icehaus focuses on cold dishes such as Scottish Smoked Salmon with chive crème fraiche, charcuterie, seafood, salads, sandwiches and desserts, with specialist dessert machines dishing up Italian soft-serve ice cream and shaved ice.Smoke & Pepper Smoke & Pepper, the largest dining destination at Alley on 25, showcases Asian-inspired barbecued specialties prepared over an open-fire barbecue grill. Dig into succulent BBQ grub such as Grilled Diver Scallops, Grilled Squid with Green Chili and Shiso Pesto, and more.The Green Oven The Green Oven is where classic international favourites fare prepared from the heart of the kitchen - our giant green-colour Beech oven. Dig into to family-sharing styled comfort dishes like braised lamb shank, claypot baked chicken, black mussels and even dark chocolate brownies. (Feb 2019)

• ABOUT

    If you believe that the essence of dining is all about indulging in the finest cuisine with your closest companions, you will love Alma by Juan Amador. Here, a casual atmosphere and astonishing creations reveal the culinary brilliance of the highly-acclaimed three-Michelin star chef, Juan Amador. Situated on the leafy grounds of Singapore’s Goodwood Park Hotel on Scotts Road, the menu at Alma by Juan Amador reads like a roster of contemporary European dishes heavy with Asian influence. Places tend to fill up quickly at this Michelin one-star restaurant in Orchard, so wait no more and reserve a table today! For Asian-influenced modern European cuisine in the Orchard district of Singapore, look no further than Alma by Juan Amador – the brainchild of the eponymous Spanish-German chef with three Michelin stars to his name. Helmed by executive chef Haikal Johari, whose illustrious career saw him establish the renowned Water Library restaurants in Bangkok, Thailand, Alma (which means “soul” in Spanish) takes you to the heart of dining with extraordinary, masterful creations like the signature monkfish cheek with saffron, mussel and artichoke. You’ll find this Michelin one-star restaurant on the tranquil premises of the Goodwood Park Hotel, a heritage building on Scotts Road in Singapore’s commercial heart of Orchard. Over 300 wine labels, including several from Robert Parker’s 100-Point list, will spoil wine lovers with a penchant for European-Asian fare at Alma by Juan Amador, so don’t hesitate to approach its amiable crew if you need a recommendation. Additionally, drinks and snacks are available at Bar@Alma and if you’re coming in a group, you might want to request the private room. (May 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The pigeon breast - plump, tender and juicy - is perfectly roasted under a crust of "purple curry" spices, a blend of aromatics such as coriander, mustard, ginger and fennel. On top are tiny dots of coconut and mango purees, as well as diced fresh mango. And then there is the inky chocolate sauce that adds a deep, moreish flavour to the dish." -SoShiok "A matador of fine dining, Juan Amador has brought his bravado and ingenuity to our sunny shores, joining in the fray of celebrity chefs that have already brought their brands to Singapore." -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pigeon with Mango, Coco, Purple Curry; Toothfish with Cauliower, Turron, Lime; Gambas with Al Ajillo

• ABOUT

    Almost Famous Craft Beer Bar is a minimalist beer bar tucked away in CHIJMES. Also known as the "Apple store" of craft beer bars, you can expect a warm ambience and Instagram-worthy food and decor. With 16 rotational beers on tap, you’ll be spoiled by choice as you try beers from all over the world like Singapore’s Brewlander & Co., Australia’s Pirate Life Brewing, and Vietnam’s Pasteur Street Brewing Company. What’s a round of beer without some wings? Try Almost Famous Craft Beer Bar’s chicken wings, which come with a light spicy and tangy butter sriracha sauce, a yuzu soy garlic sauce, and more. Our favourite’s has to be the Har Cheong Gai version, where the wings are marinated for 48 hours in a shrimp paste blend. Other highlights include its East-meets-West pasta dishes, like the Creamy Tiger Prawns Laksa Linguine, and the Chili Crab Shrooms Linguine. Besides beers, specialty Gin & Toni cocktails are also available along with non-alcoholic options such as Seedlips Spice and Tonic. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mala G&T, Creamy Tiger Prawns Laksa Linguine, Har Cheong Gai Wings, Chili Crab Shrooms Linguine

html:
• ABOUT

    Here’s a spot that will liven up your Instagram feed. From the folks behind A Poke Theory, Alter Ego is the evil twin of the beloved healthy eating joint on Boon Tat street. Serving Poke Bowls till evening, and indulgent grub with booze afterward, everything on the menu screams #foodporn. The brunch menu is a sight to behold - featuring everything from decadent desserts to brunch staples with a twist. Artfully created thickshakes are available in a range of flavours - from peanut butter to matcha. The Matcha Maniac is particularly noteworthy for its lush green colour and generous serving of rich chantilly cream. If sugar isn’t your thing, the Pokecado Toast comes in the same lovely green shade, with velvety smashed avocado on sourdough topped with spiced roasted cashews and crispy tempura batter. Prefer some bubbly? The bar bites are as indulgent as poke is healthy. From Southern Fried Chicken Skin to local favourite Har Cheong Kai starting from just $4, you could be forgiven for wanting to try them all in one sitting. Their Happy Hour deals are pretty darn great as well - an array of $6 bottled beers and cold pints going from $10 and up. In a place like this where both food and drinks appease those at either ends of the clean or indulgent eating spectrum, you'll find solace in knowing it'll hit all the right spots. (Apr 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Leave your diets at the door. Opened by the same sibling duo that brought you A Poke Theory, the evil sister outlet Alter Ego takes on the same industrial-chic concept and gives it a darker twist on all fronts.Swing by during the day and you'll be served similar offerings to A Poke Theory, with their famed smoothie bowls and highly Instagrammable (and delicious) Hawaiian poke bowls they've become known for on Boon Tat Street. But by dusk, the restaurant does a complete 180 and takes on a darker persona as the menu dishes out sinful grubs such as their Loaded Taters ($13), which is loaded with jalapeno cheese sauce, maple-glazed bacon and sour cream; their Chilli Cheese Dog ($17) that's topped with a sweet & spicy house-made beef mince, sour cream and gooey cheddar cheese." - SG Asia City "I’m still dreaming about the Braised Shortrib Grilled Cheese ($16) which was 100% worth every single calorie. Toasted to perfection and served with a homemade tomato dip, the marriage of melted gruyere and taleggio cheese was UNREAL.With insane food flavour combinations, craft alcohol and lots of heart to boot, Alter Ego, you’re welcome to rip my diet plan to shreds any day." - Seth Lui

• ABOUT

    Nestled in the corner of Namly Place, Amano is a vibrant Italian restaurant serving up delicious pizzas and pastas, handmade with love. Start your meal on a high note with a wide selection of antipasto and salads. The Arugula Salad is a refreshing combination of nutty leafy greens, tomatoes, and slivers of prosciutto tossed in a zesty lemon dressing. The Italian Meatballs are good for sharing, with juicy beef meatballs in a tangy tomato sauce. Ordering a pizza is a must here, as each pie is lovingly handmade with fresh ingredients. The Pepperoni is a classic favourite, while adventurous palates will favour creative pizzas such as the Burrata, with fresh cheese, sweet tomatoes and pesto, or the Prawn & Bacon with an interesting Surf & Turf spin topped with juicy tiger prawns and crispy bacon. There’s also a good selection of pastas and grilled meats to choose from. The Mushroom Risotto is a top hit amongst vegetarians, while meat-lovers will enjoy grilled US Duroc Pork Chop and Ribeye Steak with mushroom sauce. Save some space for dessert — the warm Chocolate Lava Cake boasts a molten center that is not to be missed. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Italian Meatballs, Burrata Pizza, Prawn & Bacon Pizza, Mushroom Risotto, US Duroc Pork Chop, Chocolate Lava Cake

• PRESS RELEASE

    Welcome to the newest after-work hangout in town – Amazing Hokkaido – where the service is warm, and the atmosphere always cheerful. Amidst blaring Japanese tunes and incessant chatter, smiley wait staff scurry in traditional garb to serve up menu delights flown in daily from Hokkaido, a region well-known for its fresh seafood. The 100-seater establishment, tucked in the dining enclave of Robertson Quay, works with a selection of gourmet partners to serve up a plethora of Japanese offerings. Signatures include the Muroran Yakitori, a classic Hokkaido dish with skewered onion and pork; Melty 7 Kinds of tsukune, chicken skewers served with a variety of savoury toppings; Tokujo Assorted Hokkaido Fresh Sashimi platter, which includes sashimi favourites like tuna akami, fatty tuna, and sea urchin. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Melty 7 Kinds of Tsukune, Muroran Yakitori,Tokujo Assorted Hokkaido Fresh Sashimi

    Amber West, a student operated restaurant, brings affordable gourmet selections prepared by student chefs and served by student servers, to those who visit the in-house fine dining training restaurant, located right in the heart of ITE College West’s vast campus at Choa Chu Kang. The restaurant serves to train students in an authentic learning environment at affordable prices and features a tantalising collection of dishes, both Western and Asian cuisine with a twist. Specialising in Asian and Western cuisine, the restaurant serves up four course meals that will definitely get you bang for your buck. (Dec 2020)

  • ABOUT

    Step inside the classy and chic Ambling Turtle, a double-storey modern Peranakan Cafe that brings a fresh look to traditional Peranakan cuisine. Bringing brunch and tea time delights infused with authentic Peranakan flavours, you’re in for a nice treat at this chill cafe. For starters, we recommend their Pulled Beef Rendang Set. Choose from either a croissant or a sourdough to complete this hearty meal, and savour the taste of the smokey, tender beef grilled to perfection. If you’re looking for a more ‘lemak’ option, Ambling Turtle’s Nonya Chicken Curry Set makes for the perfect sharing dish among friends. For those wanting just a taste of each, go for Ambling Turtle’s Croissant Sliders. Featuring Nonya Chicken Curry, Satay Chicken, and Pulled Beef Sliders, their croissant sliders are an absolute stroke of genius. Enjoy delicious meaty goodness sandwiched between a buttery flakey croissant that brings out the sweetness of the meat. For dessert, end off with Go Home, Ambling’s Pandan Buttermilk Waffle served with coconut soft serve. The best part? They’re also topped with adzuki beans and chendol jelly to make a creamy, sweet dessert that pays homage to the original flavours. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pulled Beef Rendang Set, Nonya Chicken Curry Set, Go Home, Pulled Beef Croissant Slider, Orh Nee

  • ABOUT

    For a name that conjures up images of covert military or law enforcement stake-outs, Ambush has a decidedly gentle ambience. Its ambitious menu, however, is nothing short of fierce. Giant platters of sausage (the Oktoberfest Platter) sit comfortably next to fragrant Spanish Paella, and the Signature Fish and Truffle Chips are mentioned in the same breath as Risotto with Pancetta & Foie Gras. If you have ever wanted to eat everything that Europe has to offer in one sitting, this is the place to be. In the words of its founder, Stanley Ng, Ambush offers a “whistle-stop tour of all the best that European food has to offer...Start in France, continue through Spain, then relax with a moreish dessert and coffee in Italy – and be home in time to plan your next gastronomic adventure!” Short of teleporting from one European city to another, Ambush is really your best bet for an eating tour of Europe in a single meal. (Aug 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oktoberfest Platter, Ambush’s Paella, Signature Fish and Truffles Chips, Bruschetta, Tiramisu, Risotto with Pancetta & Foie Gras

  • ABOUT

    Located at Hong Leong Building, Ameising Bar & Dining is situated in the middle of the CBD. Offering a full menu of Japanese tapas, sashimi, rice and soba bowls, as well as bar snacks, it’s a great place for lunch, dinner, and post-work drinks with colleagues. While it’s a casual place, they’re serious about their food. The main highlights are their kushiyaki selections, with grilled skewers that include Shiitake Truffle Yaki and Ebi Mentaiko Yaki for those who want to up their ante. Mains include the Unagi Kebayaki and Garlic Fried Rice, the latter a staple of any good teppanyaki joint. And yes, their teppanyaki selection heats things up with Surumeika Teppanyaki, with squid and butter soyu. Even if you’re just here for drinks, you’ll be tempted by their selection of bar snacks on offer. Have the best of everything with the Ameising Platter, consisting of Amaebi, Tako, Popcorn Chicken, Kawa Karaage, and Curry Samosa. For something lighter, opt for the Sashimi Platter instead. Lunch includes wallet-friendly options such as the set lunch of grilled selections or sashimi, which comes with salad, miso soup, rice, and pickles. If you prefer a fuss-free alternative, their rice, noodle, and grain bowls pack a punch — we recommend their Poke Bowl Soba, Quinoa Bowl, and Ribeye Soba. Their fully stocked sake collection even has a helpful sake meter value to help you narrow your choices from sweet to dry. Ameising Bar & Dining’s Cocktail Diary Series features different cocktails on Wednesdays, so look out for it! (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shiitake Truffle Yaki, Surumeika Teppanyaki, Ameising Platter, Ribeye Soba

  • PRESS RELEASE

    The gastronomic stretch of Hong Kong Street, lined with the city's top restaurants and bars, has new company in the form of Amò, the smart-casual Italian eatery and bar by established restaurateur-chef Beppe De Vito of the ilLido Group. Located at 33 Hong Kong Street, Amò continues the group's mission to elevate the Italian dining scene in Singapore, by combining Italian traditions with contemporary innovation at a high perceived value. Short for "amore", the restaurant is named after the colloquial term of endearment used across Italy regardless of dialects and regions. In the same spirit, Amò is a union of Italian cuisine and people, designed as a social destination where the best culinary influences from all parts of Italy come together, for groups of friends to gather over antipasti, big plates and pizzas to share. (Jun 2017)

• ABOUT

    Experience authentic Korean cuisine with exquisite drinks when you drop by ANJU at Tras Street. Bringing you the finest liquor straight from Korea, dive into a unique dining experience with the restaurant's specially curated list of fine Korean fare. Chef favourites here include Galbi Jjim, Domi Carpaccio and Yuk Hoe. Start your meal with a bowl of crispy Bori Prawns. Deep-fried to a golden brown, these crunchy prawns are served up with green baby garlic shoots for maximum flavour. For those who love a good mix of sweet and savoury, the Black Bean Mascarpone is a delicious dish not to be missed out on! Layered on a fluffy piece of oven-baked sourdough is a generous spread of mascarpone with sweet Siritae Beans and chive oil - the perfect way to whet your appetite. Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying your carnivorous cravings with the Young Gae. Featuring an oven-roasted baby chicken with a boneless and butterfly cut, this fuss-free dish is marinated with Yuja sauce for an authentic taste of Korea. Wash down your meal with a refreshing glass of Legendary Beauty to enjoy the beautiful aroma of Omija and Cornus berries. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Bean Mascarpone, Domi Carpaccio, Hogam Jeon, Galbi Jjim, Legendary Beauty

html:
• ABOUT

    Bringing you drinks from around the world spanning the disco era of the 70s and 80s, coupled with mouth-watering delights from the iconic Yellow Pot, Anouska’s Bar showcases top shelf spirits, premium wines, local craft beers, artisanal Chinese teas and cocktails expertly injected with nostalgic Eastern influence. You are in for an eccentric, elegant surprise as you enter the bar, which includes large golden fans and strong hues of black, gold and yellow, layered with Oriental screens and calligraphy wallpaper from Anouska’s personal collection. Bask in old-world charm while enjoying craft cocktails and an abundance of delightful Chinese fare with an innovative twist. Infusing house-made chrysanthemum cordial with Tanqueray London dry gin for hints of flowery notes, the bar’s trademark cocktail, Escape to Kaifeng, is a must-try. Inspired by the flower of Kaifeng in China, this intoxicating mix is refreshingly delicious. On Her Majesty’s Secret Service is a playful tribute to designer Anouska Hempel — a former Bond Girl from the 1969 namesake film — in the form of a dry gin martini tipped with yuzu and green tea bitters. Fans of the iconic martini can also try three unique variations of the Bond-approved classic with Martini Triad, a tasting flight of the bar’s signature martinis — including a dirty martini clouded with house-made pickled green chilli and brine. The Hong Long Choc is a seductive swirl of whisky, chocolate liqueur, aromatic bitters and Lapsang Souchong — perfect for chocolate lovers to satisfy their cocoa cravings. Bringing the creativity and style from the adjoining Singapore Chinese Icon, Yellow Pot, Chef Sebastian has created an ingenious offering of Chinese fare made for both intimate gatherings and larger groups. Favourites include Fried Prawns with Bonito Aioli or the highly addictive Sichuan-style Popcorn Chicken — all paired perfectly with Anouska’s favourite drinks from around the world. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Escape to Kaifeng, Chen Pi Collins, Signature Roast BBQ Duck, Fried Enoki Mushroom Masala, Fried Sesame “Wuxi” Pork Rib

    Anti:dote is a stylish and modern cocktail bar with a progressive selection of concoctions that appeals to the most discerning taste buds. Combining the craftsmanship of traditional bartending and the artistry of experimental mixology techniques, classic recipes are reinterpreted with contemporary flair. At Anti:dote, drinks crafted with premium spirits and housemade bitters, liqueurs and sodas are paired perfectly with innovative modern tapas. Experience a fine selection of handcrafted cocktails concocted by our talented team of mixologists. Known for serving afternoon tea in our iconic chest of drawers, diners can now indulge in monthly-themed sweet treats and bite sized sandwiches from 12pm to 5pm daily. Amuse Bouche and free-flow Fitz Brut Sparkling/Rose are available to complement your afternoon tea at Anti:dote. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The interior is modern and lush, think velvet sofas, interesting light installations and clean lines. Every savoury bite and sweet treat is perfectly put together and the experience, simply sublime. This is the ideal venue for a girlie afternoon, but don’t let the fun stop there — why not hang around for a cocktail at the bar as day turns into night?” - SethLui.com

  • DISHES AND DRINKS WE LOVE

    Heirloom Tomato, Kirk's Fish N' Chips, Grilled Scallop, Scotch Egg, Bread & Butter Pudding, Pimms Cup, Savile Row, Donkey Kong, The Thinker
