    In 2003, Aoki Restaurant was established as a joint venture between Owner Chef Kunio Aoki and the Les Amis Group. This 36-seater restaurant offers the ultimate fine dining experience in Japanese haute cuisine. Aoki reopened in June 2017 with a brand new look by Japanese interior designer, Yasuhiro Koichi. The pristine interior features panels of Kumiko Zaiku, an intricate traditional Japanese woodwork as well as geometric patterned doors and wall panels, embodying the essence of Zen minimalism. Owner Chef Kunio Aoki presides over the sushi bar and kitchen. His culinary style is traditional, yet with modern undertones that keep his creations refreshingly contemporary. Unstinting in his demands to serve only the best produce sourced directly from Toyosu Market and other artisanal suppliers from all over Japan, he has garnered a loyal following over the years. Aoki is located at Shaw Centre, beside the group’s flagship restaurant Les Amis. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Thin Sliced White Sashimi with Truffles, Wagyu Sirloin Steak, Prawn Tempura, Kagoshima Beef Croquette, Hamaguri Clam Clear Soup

• ABOUT

    Brought to you by the team behind Atlas Coffeehouse, Columbus Coffee Co. and Lunar Coffee Roasters, Apollo Coffee Bar is every cafe hopper's dream. A long list of brunch items, mains, desserts, and artisanal coffees make up the menu, while whitewashed walls and natural sunlight make a perfect backdrop for some Insta-worthy shots. Start your day right with the Breakfast Burger, with creamy cheddar scrambled eggs, spicy aioli, caramelised onions and bacon between brioche buns and a side of crispy tater tots. The Wurst Rosti, that comes with a cheesy sausage and sunny side up eggs, is also a favourite. If you're looking for something heartier, the variety of Small and Large Plates will not disappoint. The Pork and Pear Tartine is a unique choice. This open-faced sandwich is topped with roasted pears, bacon, caramelised onions, and ricotta. For some trusty comfort food, go for the Wagyu Cheeseburger or Mushroom Bacon Carbonara. No meal is complete without a sweet treat, and Apollo's selection of waffles and soft serves does just the trick. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Breakfast Burger, Wurst Rosti, Pork and Pear Tartine, Butterscotch Banana Waffle

• PRESS RELEASE

    "Park Hotel Alexandra is proud to introduce a stunning new bar – Aqua Luna – which sits high above the hustle and bustle of the busy streets of Alexandra. This gorgeous oasis is perched on the seventh floor of the hotel and sits beside the shimmery blue waters of the hotel’s 25-meter infinity pool. Featuring a spectacular ceiling-to-floor glass enclave, Aqua Luna easily seats 56 guests at its marble-white central bar and comfortable high-tables and chairs positioned around its rim – all affording revellers a 180-degree view of the beautiful surrounds. By day, guests munching on a light lunch can take in the striking view of the treetop canopy of the Southern Ridges in all its fresh, green glory. By twilight, the space is transformed into an eye-catching watering hole where the stage is set daily for the viewing of the magnificent golden-hued sunset. As the sky darkens, the scene changes once again with the moon and sparkling lights of the Queenstown precinct morphing into the backdrop for a relaxing evening. The entire experience at Aqua Luna is heightened by a stellar line-up of speciality cocktails that were meticulously conceptualised to reflect the laid-back and easy-going vibe by day and the sensual and chill-out atmosphere by night." (Dec 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chorizo & Onion Flatbread, Truffle Polenta Fries, Alexandra Sunset Cocktail

  • ABOUT

    Located in one of Singapore’s most historic clubs, this elegant establishment serves delicious modern European comforts that will transport you to the heart of Europe. Resplendent amidst lush greenery, Arbenz brings a unique alfresco dining experience to diners. For appetisers, start off with Hand-Cut Beef Tartar & Brioche. A classic European delight, this light dish uses the freshest ingredients to really bring out the sweet and savoury flavours of the Tartar. Trying to cater to a wider group, Arbenz serves vegan and vegetarian options too. For mains, go for their Taro Gnocchi. This creamy dish is made with sweet potato pasta tossed in a Garlic Sage Cream Emulsion. For a ‘meatier’ vegan option, their Signature Australian Eggplant Steak hits all the flavour profiles for a savoury and sweet dish with a side of pea hummus. Have a little fun and go for the Fondue Bourguignonne. Cook beef tenderloin cubes to your perfect doneness before dipping in a range of condiments. A dish for two, do call ahead if you want to try out this traditional swiss dish. For a sampler, approach their friendly service staff for a 5-Course Tasting meal at only $128. Kick back and relax in this luxurious refurbished terrace for a chill dining experience that will feed your wanderlust. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Vegan Tartare, Foie Gras, Swiss Style Porcini Mushroom Risotto, Pan Seared Cod Fish, Dutch Milk Fed Veal Rack

• ABOUT

    Who says you have to travel for dinner with a view? This lush spot proves otherwise. Nestled in the greenery of Mount Faber, this restaurant exudes a sense of tranquility that’s hard to replicate elsewhere. Inspired by the Latin word for a leafy enclosure, this restaurant is a haven from the rush of the city and is the perfect place for a relaxed dinner for two. The menu features a range of dishes made with wild ingredients, as well as continental comfort food. The Chilli Crab Potato Skins are a hot favourite. Featuring deep-fried potato skins stuffed with classic chilli crab gravy, this dish is crisp and delicious, and goes perfectly with a cold beer. Prefer something a little healthier? Opt for one of the delicious salads. The Wild Mushroom Salad is made with a mix of mushrooms topped with greens, tomatoes and balsamic vinegar. The flavour of the tender mushrooms is rich and goes perfectly with the crisp greens. For dessert with a twist, try the Chempedak Bread & Butter, a bread pudding that is made with butter and croissants, chempedak, and vanilla ice cream. Mildly sweet, velvety and perfect for sharing, this dish the perfect way to end a decadent meal. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab Potato Skins, Classic Caesar, Wild Mushroom, Braised Beef Cheek, Tomahawk Pork Rib, Fisherman’s Stew, Rack of Lamb, Smoked Duck Mushroom Ragout, Chempedak Bread & Butter

• ABOUT

    Authentically Turkish, Arkadas Cafe greets you with lush greenery and an impressive cascading waterfall. Enter this hidden oasis to enjoy quality traditional dishes such as Yaprak Sarma with Rice in Vine Leaves, Chicken Doner Kebabs, and more. An appetiser featuring flavoured rice rolled up with vine leaves, squeeze some lime over the Yaprak Sarma for maximum flavour. Similar to lasagna, the Moussaka is a generous portion of cheese and minced beef, layered with eggplants and baked to perfection. The Chicken Doner Kebab is a great lunch option for the health conscious. Thinly sliced and snugly bundled up, the slices of doner kebab are accompanied by a medley of vegetables in a crisp wrap. Order a pot of Turkish Tea while waiting for dessert. Light, aromatic and refreshing, this delicious hot beverage is served in a traditional glass cup. For something sweeter, the Apple Tea is a cold and fruity drink that helps to dispel the relentless heat of Singapore. Wrap up your meal with a traditional dessert like Baklava for an authentic Turkish experience. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yaprak Sarma with Rice in Vine Leaves, Moussaka, Chicken Doner Kebabs, Apple Tea

    Nestled in Little India, Aromas of India guarantees a wide array of delicious Indian delicacies with every visit. Boasting a special menu on selected days of the week, the restaurant offers nourishing soups and traditional favourites such as Chicken Tikka and Tomato Garlic Soup. Traditionally famous for its savoury tandoori dishes and exotic curries, Aromas of India features fresh dishes made from whole, natural ingredients that are served piping hot. Start your meal with a bowl of Creamy Mushroom Soup before tantalising your tastebuds with the restaurant’s signature Butter Chicken. Besides these two staples, the restaurant also offers lamb, vegetarian, seafood, rice and biryani dishes. Pick the Mango Lassi, Sweet Lassi or Salted Lassi to complement your meal from Aromas of India’s wide selection of juices and speciality drinks. Apart from being famed for its food, the restaurant also offers high tea, regarded as one of the best in Singapore. Dedicated to serving authentic and the best of Indian cuisine, Aromas of India is truly a foodie's paradise. (Feb 2020)

• ABOUT

    Hidden away from the rip-roaring CHIJMES lies Ashino, a cosy ten-seater restaurant that successfully recreates the experience of dining in a bespoke sushi restaurant in Tokyo. And no details have been spared here, from the decor that features a sushi counter fashioned from a 180-year-old block of hinoki cypress wood to the imported ingredients flown in from Japan. Heading this restaurant is none other than Taku Ashino, whose precision and meticulousness help elevate the delicate ingredients them spectacular. Having trained in various sushi restaurants in Tokyo for over a decade, Ashino pays careful attention to making the ingredients sing, grilling his fish over a binchotan grill instead of a gas torch, as well as cooking a blend of Hokkaido and Niigata rice in a traditional iron rice pot with Mount Fuji water to achieve the perfect texture of rice. Whether you choose a set or omakase menu for lunch, rest assured that you’ll be in good hands. Signature sushi classics make an appearance, from the delectable melt-in-your-mouth Fatty Tuna to the Fresh Salmon Roe that provide bursts of flavour when you bite down on it, leaving you with nothing but a smile on your face. Eschewing ostentatiousness and swankiness, Ashino is a culinary gem that delivers up delectable sushi not to be found anywhere else in this city. (Dec 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    While most sushi restaurants boast about the freshness of their fish, there’s no one better in Singapore than Ashino to tell us about the importance of aging seafood a couple days. After all, his restaurant specializes in the procedure. -SG Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fatty Tuna, Charcoal Grilled Keiji, Fresh Abalone Shabu Shabu. Fresh Salmon Roe, Fresh Uni

    Bringing the art of drinking from the House of Astor in New York to St. Regis, Astor Bar impresses with an inspired selection of over 40 cocktails and signature rituals. Featuring a New York cocktail mail, have a sip of the Big Apple in the heart of town as you indulge in a list of specially curated cocktails that pays homage to five of New York City’s well known neighbourhoods. Diners can expect to be greeted by hospitality, grandeur, and elegance the moment they enter the bar. Decorated with some of the world’s finest artworks, sip on heady concoctions presented in distinctive glassware exclusively designed for Astor Bar by world renowned glassware producer John Jenkins. From local infusions to spirit-free cocktails and your favourite glass of Bloody Mary, it’s never too early for a cocktail. If you’re looking to get a buzz from visiting Lower Manhattan, raise a toast to Little Germany’s Weisse Garten. A sophisticated blend of beer, spirits and hearty European fruits and grains, this sweet mix of Irish whiskey and lager is the perfect way to end your day. Other exciting beverages include the Capitan’s Cure, Manhattan Club and Korean Square. (Apr 2021)

The leisure destination of choice and a radical playground for the elite and discerning crowd, Atico’s lounge invites patrons to live the high life from day to night perfectly. Open daily, meet us at the top. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Argentinian Beef Bagel Burger, Shiro Ebi, Cold Cuts

    What to know: We're cheating a bit with this one, as 1-ATICO is actually three concepts in one. (The more the merrier, right?) Perched 56 stories above the street, this splashy new penthouse rooftop is home to contemporary Argentenian steakhouse FIRE, Japanese-Peruvian gastrobar FLNT and glitzy, futuristic nightclub 1-Atico Ultra-Lounge. No matter which route you choose, you'll be treated to panoramic views of the sparkling city skyline thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows that line just about every wall in the place. What to order: Patagonian red prawns ‘Parrilla’ (FIRE), warm wagyu-uni sushi (FLNT) and anything bubbly (1-Atico Ultra-Lounge)

html:
• ABOUT

    Fans of popular cafe Assembly Coffee can now flock to its sister business, Atlas Coffeehouse. Situated in one of the city's lushest, chillest spots, it's just a stone's throw from the Botanic Gardens and the quiet estates of Bukit Timah. It's the perfect spot to while away an afternoon. Think handsome industrial-chic decor overlooking greenery and a nice cup of coffee. It's especially popular with students from the nearby campuses, so the vibe is young, hip, and friendly! What really hits the spot is cafe grub done well and with flair. There's lots of hearty fare here: massive all day breakfasts, beautiful caramelized bacon on waffles, and soul-warming bowls of pasta. Save some room for sweets! The Butterscotch Banana Pancakes - toffee-like bananas on a massive fluffy pancake - is to die for. It's not a cafe without a good, piping-hot cup of java. Brewed from a custom blend by local roasters 2Degrees North, the coffee here is robust and punchy in all the right places. (Sep 2016)

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2019 - CAFE OF THE YEAR

    Our diners have voted Atlas Coffeehouse as Cafe of the Year in Chope Diners’ Choice 2019.

  • THE BUZZ

    "Atlas only opened its doors in mid-January, but dishes like creamy mushrooms on sourdough, scrambled eggs, and glazed salmon and a fried egg with crisped edges on soba noodles are their early stars." -Time Out Singapore "Cafe hoppers have been flocking to Atlas Coffeehouse, the sister cafe to Assembly Coffee in Evans Road. It is good for those who want a change from the usual cafe fare." -SoShiok

    Start your day with a piping hot cup of Java as you read the news, or have it to-go if you're in a hurry. Atrium Bar 317 is the place for you to get your morning coffee and treat yourself to a buttery croissant or a delicious muffin! In the evening, stay a little longer as we transform into a chic hotel bar and enjoy our signature Mojito. Check out the bar snack menu for delicious offerings such as the wildly-loved Chicken Satay! (Mar 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Delight your taste buds and dine in elegance at the Atrium Lounge with their iconic seating pods floating over a reflective pool. Located on the first floor of Pan Pacific Hotel, this innovative lounge serves an extensive menu to satisfy any cravings for any time of the day. Enjoy a colorful ‘Sea-riously, No Squidding’ sandwich with a side of crispy Puff Potato Churros for a quick and delicious bite. Generously heaped with crab and topped with tobiko on a squid ink bread, this creative dish serves all the delicious ocean and umami flavours with every bite. For local favourites, go for a brothy, savoury Prawn Noodle Soup sweetened with fresh tiger prawns and tender pork belly. Or try their comforting Wagyu Beef Pho for a premium version of the classic Vietnamese dish. For meatier options, Atrium’s BBQ Baby Back Ribs is a crowd favourite. Combine the tender fall-off-the-bone meat with the chapati and green papaya salad that comes with it to make a delicious wrap. Energise yourselves with a refreshing afternoon tea at the Atrium with their Japanese-Inspired Tea. Get pampered with a delicious host of sweets and savouries that will transport you to the tranquil Japanese countryside. From the famed Japanese Egg Sandwich and Milk Butter Roll to a sweet and creamy Matcha Azuki Monaka, feast on a variety of artfully created small bites and desserts with friends for a truly harmonious experience. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sea-riously, No Squidding, Prawn Noodle Soup, BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Matcha Azuki Monaka

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Delight your senses at Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium's halal-certified Atrium Restaurant, an all-day dining a la carte and buffet establishment that serves an extensive selection of International flavours and local favourites. Atrium Restaurant also offers takeaway and delivery at a flat rate islandwide. Note:• Please note that our restaurant crew reserves the right to check your vaccination status and entry will be denied if dining-in requirements are not met.• Deposits are required for bookings made for Saturday & Sunday (lunch) and Friday & Saturday (dinner). Upon receiving your reservation, the restaurant crew will reach out to you directly to furnish more information. We seek your help in maintaining a safe dining experience for everyone. Thank you and we look forward to your visit soon! (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    NEW! From 2 April 2022, embark on an extended Ramadan feast with a thematic buffet spread from Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium.Back by popular demand, diners will be treated to a wholesome spread of Korean delights at Atrium Restaurant.Ranging from perennial favourites such as Tteokbokki, Pajeon (Pancake) and Kimchi Ramen, to stews seen in K-dramas - Ginseng Chicken Soup, Spicy Seafood Stew and Beef Brisket Soybean Paste Stew, to desserts such as Mango Bingsu and Injeolmi Rice Cake, the spread got bigger and better from last year! All dishes are Halal-certified and are available in our buffet menu, along with the restaurant's top orders – Freshly shucked Oysters, Salmon Sashimi, Freshly-made Prata, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Laksa, and Traditional Ice Cream with Bread or Waffle. A prayer room is also available just minutes away from the restaurant.

    Nestled along Amoy Street, Avenue 87 is a contemporary joint serving up Asian and fusion delights perfect for quick lunches or after work socials. Designed to be a semi-casual cozy hangout spot, Avenue 87 is a great place for good food and conversation. A restaurant full of surprises, Avenue 87 was founded on chefs Alex Phan’s and Glen Tay’s love for creating fusion dishes between modern and traditional Singaporean cuisine. The menu features the chefs’ creative combination of different flavours as well as an innovative offering of a variety of beverage blends. (Sep 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Awadh brings the best cuisine of Northern India right to your doorstep. Eat like Awadhi royalty as you indulge in dishes cooked in the “Dum Pukht” style, in which ingredients in dough-sealed containers are slowly-cooked over a low flame. This process allows each individual component to gradually release their flavours, creating dishes that are not only flavorful and potent, but also connected to cultural history and tradition. Located in The Centrepoint, Awadh is the perfect destination for gastronomes from all walks of life, serving a wide array of meat, seafood and vegetarian dishes. Be sure to try the Paya. These trotters are seasoned with a diverse mix of spices and left to cook overnight over a slow fire, creating a flavourful and tender bite. Awadh also has vegan options such as the “Impossible” kebabs or curries. Committed to showcasing the culinary heights of Northern India, the menu at Awadh changes with each season, and is unique to the festivals that mark the month. Thus, Awadh promises each and every diner and new and wholly unique experience. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Galawat Kebabs, Paya, Shorba and Kulcha

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/awadh
name: Awadh

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Awfully Chocolate started as a cake shop selling only one cake - a simple dark chocolate cake between layers of dark chocolate fudge. Chocolate with a distinct roast. Real cake one can bite into, rich in taste yet moist and light. Not just mouthfuls of mousse or cream. Not overly sweet but something you could eat over and over again and not get tired of. Today, we have grown from one indie store into a group of shops, cafes and restaurants bearing our love for dark chocolate. At Awfully Chocolate cafes, we serve our desserts the way we believe they should be experienced. Many of the cakes are served warm with a scoop of our chocolate ice-cream, and recommend with a contrasting artisanal tea or gourmet coffee, or for the connoisseurs, mocha royale or classic dark chocolate. (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    All Chocolate Cake, Super Stacked Chocolate Cake, Hei Ice-cream Single Scoop, Classic Dark Chocolate

  • href

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Started in 1998 selling only the All Chocolate cake, Awfully Chocolate has grown from one indie store into a group of shops and cafes bearing our love for chocolate, both in Singapore and overseas. The flagship Awfully Chocolate store in Singapore — and the very first Awfully Chocolate Bakery & Cafe concept — offers a contemporary selection of well-loved comfort Brunch plates and fresh pastries baked live. The cafe also serves up a hearty dinner set menu for only $25, and (of course) Singapore’s Favourite Chocolate desserts. Step in not just for the wholesome, delicious food and desserts, but also a whole new Awfully Chocolate experience elevated by the Bakery & Cafe’s chocolate taps. Fresh chocolate is tempered and used to make decadent chocolate drinks including the signature Really Fresh Chocolate Milk — a must-try in the cafe. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Bakery Club Brunch, Truffle Cream Eggs, Angus Brisket, Singapore Borscht and Really Fresh Chocolate Milk

  • ABOUT

    Baba Chews is a restaurant inspired by our vibrant neighbourhood - Katong. The name “Baba Chews” pays homage to Mr. Chew Joo Chiat (1857–1926), a wealthy local Chinese landowner and philanthropist, known as the ‘King of Katong’ for his contributions to the local community. Our restaurant sits on the site of the former Joo Chiat Police Station (1928 – 1987), built by the British in the late 1920's when Singapore was still a British Colony, which was granted conservation status by the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) of Singapore for its architectural & heritage value. Baba Chews serves a diverse menu of Mod-Sin (Modern Singaporean) dishes, local favourites, and Western comfort dishes along with quality brews from Common Man Coffee Roasters & TWG tea, beers and alcoholic beverages. Popular items include our 'Kopi C' Flavoured Bbq Pork Spareribs, Chicken Rendang Lasagne & Ondeh Ondeh cake. (Aug 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The all-dining restaurant, Baba Chews Bar and Eatery, offers a range of both modern and traditional cuisine from the Straits of Malacca, Western favorites and local delights like the mouth-watering Ayam Buah Kelauk (chicken braised in a thick, spicy tamarind gravy with buah keluak nus) and Foie Gras Tau Kwa Pau." -SG Now "In keeping with the local theme, be sure to enjoy coffee from beans roasted by local specialty coffee roasters Common Man Coffee Roasters, tea from TWG Tea, and innovative local cocktails." -Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    X.O. Pork Belly Char Siew Rice Bowl, Chicken Rendang Lasanga, Peranakan Pulled Pork Burger, Chilli Crab Tagliatelle

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in a corner of Lichfield Road, Baci Baci (or kiss kiss in English) is the place for you if you’re looking to relax with a glass of wine and a nice meal. Soak in the rustic, welcoming ambience of the restaurant as you wait for your food to arrive, and take in the tasteful wine bottle displays – it’s the perfect refuge for those looking to unwind from the stresses of city life. Of course, ambience would mean little if the food wasn’t up to par, and at Baci Baci, even the most exacting of diners will find little to complain about. Dig into a plate of Risotto Baci Baci, and savour every forkful of delicious crustacean goodness. Generous in taste, it’s a fresh pasta dish that you won’t be forgetting in a hurry! The Costolette di Agnello , or grilled lamb rack, will delight meat eaters with its tenderness, its succulence, its flavorsome juiciness. Fair warning, try and resist the urge to wistfully nibble at the bones when you’re done – it’s that good. Amidst the sea of Italian restaurants in Singapore, Baci Baci stands out for its quiet authenticity and intimate warmth. With good food, good drink, and good service – you’ll want for nothing here. (Apr 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    Singapore Tatler - Best Restaurant Award 2016 & 2017

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cacciucco, Antipasto, Submarine Pizza, Risotto Al Nero, Costolette di Agnello, Branzino Al Forno

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    Build your own bara chirashi bowl here at BAFO! Located in Tanjong Pagar, BAFO provides a wide range of base selections which includes BAFO signature umami-flavoured rice, mesclun salad, cold soba, and Japanese premium rice. Feel free to choose your freshly served fish, a variety of toppings, and sauces. Come to BAFO and fill yourself with a bowl packed with nutrients, omega, and protein! (Dec 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Situated in the hip and buzzy Tiong Bahru neighbourhood, this charming restaurant and taverna draws upon the rich culinary history of the Eastern Mediterranean basin to conjure up scrumptious dishes that will leave you wanting more. Authenticity is the foundation of BAKALAKI's cooking, and the eatery prides itself on importing traditional ingredients from the motherland to incorporate into their meals. Start your meal with any one of the restaurant's mouthwatering dips. The classic Tzatziki is one of our favourites, featuring cucumbers, garlic, and olive oil folded into a refreshing light Greek yoghurt. Other winning appetisers include the Kalamari Tiganito, where a straightforward dish of crispy fried squid is enhanced with a dash of lemon juice. Indecisive diners should opt for the Mixed Grilled Meat Platter, available for sharing between two to four diners. Here, you get to sample all the best grilled meats, which include beef and kebab skewers, chicken yiros, lamb chops, meatballs, and beef sausages. Love what you ate? Why not take home a slice of Greek heritage and culture from the adjoining deli? The array of delicacies up for sale include cheeses, olives, honey, pulses, sauces, herbs, traditional sweets, and Greek wines. When done well, Greek cuisine can be downright phenomenal. So expect nothing less when you dine at BAKALAKI Greek Taverna - you have our word for it. (Jun 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tzatziki, Spanakopita, Moussaka, Beef Souvlaki, Paidakia (Grilled Lamb Chops), Htapodi (Grilled Octopus), Mixed Grill Fish & Seafood Platters, Baklava, Loukoumades (Greek Doughnuts)

html:
• ABOUT

    Where ‘Thai-riffic’ meets ‘Indo-licious’, Bali Thai is the perfect combination of Thai and Indonesian cuisines in one place! A halal-certified restaurant chain in Singapore known for serving authentic delights in a family-friendly setting, it’s a great place for a hearty meal. Whet your appetite with one of their many starters. A dish that comes highly recommended, the Appetiser Platter comes with prawns cakes, chicken satay and crispy chicken, making it a tasty spread for sharing. Wrapped in fragrant pandan leaf, the Pandan Chicken is also another traditional delight that consists of juicy scented coriander chicken. Move on to the signature Phad Thai with Satay. A Thai staple not to be missed, this delicious mix of stir-fried noodles with eggs, vegetables and tofu is tossed in a delectable blend of spices for that extra kick of flavour. The skewered sticks of succulent meat complements the dish by adding different layers of texture and flavour. Other mouthwatering dishes include the Mee Goreng with Satay, Fried Kway Teow and Nasi Goreng Istemewa. Conclude your meal with the restaurant’s refreshing bowl of Sago Gula Melaka for a genuine fusion dining experience. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Appetiser Platter, Phad Thai with Satay, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Sago Gula Melaka

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/bali-thai-causeway-point
name: Bali Thai (Causeway Point)

The skewered sticks of succulent meat complements the dish by adding different layers of texture and flavour. Other mouthwatering dishes include the Mee Goreng with Satay, Fried Kway Teow and Nasi Goreng Istemewa. Conclude your meal with the restaurant’s refreshing bowl of Sago Gula Melaka for a genuine fusion dining experience. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Appetiser Platter, Phad Thai with Satay, Nasi Goreng Istimewa, Sago Gula Melaka

html:
• ABOUT

    We weren't certain it could be done, but BAM! has updated the staid tapas trend back to its former glory, with loud Japanese flavours turning up the volume on dishes that have been there, and done that a few times over. With a hip culture tailor-made for Tras Street, BAM! hits all the high notes. Merging two cuisines is hardly groundbreaking, however BAM!'s inspired blending of Spanish tapas with small plates that are meant to be shared, and a Japanese sake-flowing izakaya, is spot on. The category is a bit hazy - is it a tapakaya? sakapas? - but whatever you choose to call it, the dining experience here is nothing short of uproarious. The digs are adequately cool kid-chic, with the requisite hipster trimmings of concrete and not much else. Nude bulbs and the underbelly of the dining room's wiring are starkly exposed. Despite the naked decor, BAM! is not blushing at all with a boldly confident gastronomic vision and spot-on flavours. The vibe draws on the hearty camaraderie of Spanish bars with the real world grit of izakayas, for a pitch-perfect air of laidback dining. The menu reads like a daily market billboard, hailing the freshest and peak-season ingredients. There are some mainstays though that have earned their permanent placement. The Pasta a la Plancha with Prawn and Sake Butter is next-level umami, with just enough acidity from the wine. And sake doesn't just make a one-time appearance, with a glassed-in cooler of both popular and hard-to-find brands. The resident sake sensei will not only pair your dishes with ample pours, but will show you how to really make the most of it, encouraging you to drizzle the wine into the luscious Kampong Egg with crispy squid and punchy chorizo, another menu regular. As its name suggests, BAM! is loud and proud of its excellent fusion angle. The hip setting, top-notch food, and unique sake spin, make it deserving of its exclamation point. (Aug 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Savour small plates like Calamari "A La Plancha", Beef Tongue and Rostit Sauce while you sip on their specialty sake cocktails (they're all good - we couldn't pick a fave!)." -Honeycombers "Former chef de cuisine of the now-closed Santi at Marina Bay Sands, Pepe Moncayo has just set up Bam! - a modern diner which sees an unusual mix of sake and tapas, like kampong egg with fried calamari and chorizo, and market fish tartar with burrata. Date night, we hear your call!" - Sassy Mama Singapore "Kampong egg with chanterelle mushroom and ham is a delicious concoction of umami, smoky-sweet yolkiness. Another must-try is the sous vide pig's ear with creamy burrata and anchovy vinaigrette." -Expat Living "What will draw return visits is the Mushroom Rice With Scallop And Idiazabal Cheese. Everything comes together so well - the sweet, lightly seared scallop; the full-flavoured stock the rice is cooked in; the crunchy bits of mushrooms embedded in the rice; and the stretchy, melted Spanish cheese. Every mouthful brings so much pleasure to the palate that I find myself eating it slowly, wishing the experience would not end." -The Straits Times "Serving food from the Mediterranean with a Japanese state of mind, Bam!'s spin on the whole sharing plates and smaller portion trend incorporates sake into the mix, led by executive chef Pepe Moncayo's belief that sake turns up the dial on the fifth taste: umami" -Time Out Singapore

  • SATURDAY BRUNCH (3 APR ONWARDS)

    When: Every Saturday from 3 April onwards Price: $88++ per person *Add on Canadian Oyster with Ponzu, Kimchi & Seagrapes at $6/pc or 1/2 dozen for $30 *Additional $58 for free-flow of Sparkling Wine, White and Red Wine for 2 hours Time: 12-2pm, last pour at 2:15pm Terms & Conditions: • The menu is fixed. • Free-Flow of drinks only for 2 hours, last pour at 2:15pm. • We can only cater to children 4yo and above. • Menu subject to change based on ingredients availability. Click here to view the menu

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Thai cuisine has long been a firm favourite with many Singaporeans, and Bangkok Jam goes a good way towards satiating the nation’s cravings. Offering up a smorgasbord of delectables that are sure to make your mouth water, this restaurant expertly tempers classic Thai spices and cooking techniques with a modern sensibility for a combination that works. Have an appetising serving of the restaurant’s Tod Mun Pla, and savour the explosion of flavours with every bite you take – you won’t be forgetting these fish cakes in a hurry, that’s for sure - or dip your spoon into a delightfully spicy bowl of Tom Yum Goong, which comes with helpings of sweet and juicy prawns to add on to the sour tang. If you’re a dessert person, then the Tap Tim Krob, or red rubies topped with coconut ice cream, will be a perfect, refreshing way to end your meal. You won’t regret having the crowd-pleasers either, like the heavenly Khao Neaw Ma Muang (mango sticky rice), with its pleasantly chewy and fragrant rice. Although it’s perfectly understandable if all your attention is focused on trying not to stuff your face with the goodies on offer at Bangkok Jam, or if you’re actually doing the deed and completely disregarding your surroundings (we get it), do take some time to soak in the ambience. With its casual décor reminiscent of a crowded street in the Thai capital, it’s hard not to be charmed. So make a booking at Bangkok Jam soon – you won’t regret it! (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tod Mun Pla, Tom Yum Goong, Peek Gai Tod Nam Pla, Khao Na Pla, Khao Neaw Ma Muang, Tap Tim Krob

• ABOUT

    Think there's nothing more to baos than those run-of-the-mill coffee shop snacks? Pay a visit to Bao Makers, try some of their innovative creations, and let your eyes and taste buds be opened to the all the delicious possibilities the bao has to offer. With mouth-watering items incorporating everything from beloved local flavours to japanese-inspired fillings, you're sure to fall back in love with the humble bao. Sink your teeth into the oh-so-sinful Salted Egg Chicken Bao and feel the crunchy exterior of the deep-fried bao give way to a soft, fluffy middle as the signature salted egg sauce and tender, juicy fried chicken flood your mouth with a myriad of heavenly tastes and textures. Just thinking about it is getting us hungry! If you're looking for something more subtle and gentle on the palate, try the Salmon Mentaiko Bao, featuring fried salmon, cod roe sauce, tobiko, and cheese. It's an umami bomb that will leave you craving more. Baos aren't all they have to offer though. Be spoiled for choice with their extensive menu of salads and artisan rolls, as well as a plethora of Japanese rice bowls by day and heavier, meat-based dishes by night. Top all that off with speciality coffees, sakes, and red and white wines for one satisfying meal. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Mentaiko Bao, Salted Egg Chicken Bao, Chilli Crab Bao, Crabmeat Beancurd, Kecap Manis Chicken, Beef Cubes with Goose Liver Sauce, Cookie Bomb

  • TAKEAWAY/DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant is available for takeaways/delivery.

• ABOUT

    A modern take on the Singapore-style coffee shop bar, come to Bar Bar Black Sheep for a laidback experience. Located along Cherry Avenue, Bar Bar Black Sheep features a casual coffee shop setting offering a range of dishes across Thailand, North Indian and Western. Relax and unwind at Bar Bar Black Sheep with the bar’s wide range of beer, ciders, wines, and cocktails. Try their exclusive beer, the Black Sheep Ale, as well as at Bar Bar Black Sheep only Sheep Shape Wines. Prepared freshly and at a great value by various independent food operators, the extensive menu is best enjoyed with a wide variety of drinks on offer. Great with beers, the Tandoori Platter features large prawns, fish, chicken tikka and a kebab of your choice. Also great are their wide variety of naans, from Butter and Cheese Naan, to Sesame and Kashmiri Naan. From the Thai Kitchen, Wok-Grilled whole squid and Pad Thai is a must try! Bar Bar Black Sheep also serves up alcoholic pints such as SweetWater Brewery Seasonal Tap, Brewdog Punk IPA and Asahi Super Dry Black as the perfect beverage to pair your meals with. Staying true to the local coffee shop culture, here’s one place you don’t have to pay GST and service charge. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Sheep Ale, SweetWater, Tandoori Platter, Kashmiri Naan, Briyani, Wok-Grilled Whole Squid, Pad Thai

• ABOUT

    A modern take on the Singapore-style coffee shop bar, come to Bar Bar Black Sheep for a laidback experience. Relax and unwind at Bar Bar Black Sheep with the bar’s wide range of beer, ciders, wines, and cocktails as you wine and dine with your choice of Thai, European or North Indian cuisine. Located at Robertson Quay, Bar Bar Black Sheep brings to diners a comprehensive by the river dining session filled with a variety of alcoholic beverages to quench your thirst! Prepared freshly and at a great value by various independent food operators, the extensive menu is best enjoyed with a wide variety of drinks on offer. Great with beers, the Tandoori Platter features large prawns, fish, chicken tikka and a kebab of your choice. Popular choices include exclusive Black Sheep Ale and Sheep Shape Wine. Gaining popularity is the locally brewed Crossroads Brewery Singapore Summer Ales, that has a distinctively bittersweet aftertaste. Available anytime of the day, the Frizzante 1754 by the glass is a well-balanced and bubbly Prosecco perfect for pairing meals with. Besides serving unique craft taps, Bar Bar Black Sheep also serves up alcoholic pints such as 1644 Blanc, Carlsberg Danish Pilsner, and Asahi Super Dry Black as the perfect beverage to pair your meals with. Aside from dining in, the craft taps beer are also available for takeaway. Staying true to the local coffee shop culture, here’s one place you don’t have to pay GST and service charge. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Butter Chicken, Tandoori Platter, Pad Thai, Wok-Grilled Whole Squid, Roast Beef Bruschetta, Singapore Wings, Brewdog Punk IPA, Crossroads Summer Ale, Black Sheep Golden Ale

    Bar Bar Q presents itself as a brand that cares about its food and promises a fun, cosy dine in experience with loads of good fusion food and alcohol – the First restaurant live band bar to bring in Tsingtao and Cass beer on tap, alongside good whiskeys, cognac, Soju and special Korean cocktails. Signature dishes include famous Black Kurobuta Pork, Mala Popcorn Chicken, Korean and Taiwanese soups and stews, Chinese and Japanese fusion skewers and the BARBARQ Special Fried Wings is a dish not to be missed!!! Located in the heart of Singapore at Suntec City Tower 4 (where the fountain of wealth is situated) both cosy indoor and alfresco dining are available. With amazing food and gracious services, we hope you will enjoy a genuine moment connecting with someone you care. (Feb 2022)

    Bar Rouge takes crowning residence at the pinnacle of the city’s tallest hotel on the 71st floor of Swissôtel The Stamford. Enjoy cocktails and bar bites with unparalleled cityscape panoramas featuring iconic local landmarks including the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay and watch the sunset turn into a mesmerising star-studded skies. Bar Rouge Singapore has carved a name for itself in the city’s dynamic nightlife scene since its arrival, combining high-altitude views with great value drinks and high-octane entertainment – from dusk till dawn. (Feb 2019)

    Bar-beque is a prison-themed bar concept and zi char restaurant that located along Prinsep Street. Bar-beque offer diners an unique experience of being captured and captivated with the set up of prison cells. They have furnitures which are the exact replica of a prison cell. Hence, even the cocktails are literally served through a pigeon hole similar to how an old prison would do so. Whether if you are looking for a place to chill or a place for a hearty meal, Bar-beque is the go to place! (Jan 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Bar-Roque Grill at the Amara Hotel is the actualisation of a dream many years in the making. Chef Stephane Istel was determined to open his own restaurant by the time he was thirty-five years old, and the food on offer at the modern rotisserie and bar provides an intimate insight into the experiences that have made the man. The heart of the menu, of course, is made up of the meats from the rotisserie. Both the French Free Range Chicken and Australian Pork knuckle have won rave reviews, and we could definitely understand why. But don't fixate on just those items though, because while the rotisserie may be the heart, Chef Stephane's deft touch and heartfelt recipes are the soul of what's on offer. Whether it be the tarte flambee, signature to his home town of Alsace, or his mother's apple pie recipe, there's a delicate balance of tradition and modernity in the food and the decor that makes the entire experience undeniably unique. And when you finally look up from your empty plate, sated and satisfied, contemplate the open kitchen and the stoic, rustic materials of stone, wood, and cement. There's a soft harmony to the design that maintains an elegant poise, a perfect mirror to the generous food served by Chef Stephane paired with the impeccable service directed by manager Kori Millar. It's a restaurant born of dreams, love, and togetherness, and their motto, "Love on the Plate" couldn't be any more apt. (Jul 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "There is nothing fancy, just everyday French fare, but it is food like this that one does not tire of. I went for dinner twice in a week and enjoyed the second visit as much as the first one, even with repeat dishes. Dishes such as the tarte flambee, which looks like a thin, rectangular pizza but with quite different toppings, win my heart at the first bite." -The Straits Times "The menu is French-influenced but not strictly so. A Spanish-leaning octopus salad makes a showing on the lunch menu, a Moroccan-accented lamb shank with couscous at dinner. But the real stunners are the chicken, lamb and beef dishes crafted around the Rotisol, an electric-powered rotisserie oven that can hold up to 60kg of meats." -The Business Times "When you eat here, you feel like you’re part of a family dinner, with Chef Stephane jovially bringing sharing feast platters to the table himself. The "made with love" feel of the mostly Alsatian dishes is evident from the care Stephane takes with his ingredients and preparation – all meat is brined first for moist succulence." -Expat Living "The eclectic but tasteful mixture of styles, chosen by co-owner Kori Miller (former GM of Sky on 57), is likewise reflected in its French-inspired menu by her partner, chef Stephane Istel (formerly of db Bistro Moderne), which combines traditional cooking methods with the innovative use of ingredients."- Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Seafood Platter, Char-Grilled Octopus served with Arugula, Tomato Confit, Almonds, and Romesco Coulis, Free Range Chicken, "Mom's Recipe" Apple Pie

  • SUNDAY BRUNCH MENU

    Check out our new Sunday Brunch! From our famous house Dry Aged Steaks, Organic Eggs Benedict, sweet french treats like Freshly Baked Scones and Honey French Toast to Champagne - POL ROGER BRUT @ $88.When: Every SundayTime: 11am-3pm Click here to view the menu.*Regular menu will not be available at this time.

  • MICHELIN BIB GOURMAND 2017 / 2018

    Bar-Roque Grill has been given a Bib Gourmand Award! Don't miss the chance to experience a Michelin-awarded restaurant!

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence from 2015 to 2019 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Step into Bar.Celona, a modern, chic tapas bar and restaurant by Robertson Quay. Serving delicious Spanish finger food and 12 kinds of bubbly cava (Spanish sparkling wine) cocktails to pair, this Spanish concept is a haven for after-work drinks or dates. With special oyster deals on Tuesday, freshly shucked Oysters are a hit at Bar.Celona, at affordable prices. Serving a delicious menu with vegan-friendly options, you’re spoilt for choice with a spread that pairs perfectly with any drink of the night. Start off with their creamy Goat Cheese with Stuffed Piquillo Peppers to share, or the classy Pan Tumaca with Jamon — toasty bread topped with tomatoes and Jamon ham. Bar.Celona brings their Octopus Carpaccio to the next level with slivers of tender octopus drizzled with olive oil that melt in your mouth. For a closer to home experience, their Gambas Al Ajillo brings a comforting garlicky shrimp dish that’s ready to send you into a food coma, best paired with a Lychee Rose Bouquet Cocktail. Moving on to meats, Bar.Celona’s Duroc Pork Chop with Smoked Pineapple Salsa and Mash is great for sharing over drinks. For single portions, go for their Chicken Mini-Taco with Smoked Pineapple Salsa for a saucy, meaty meal to satiate your hunger. To end off your experience at Bar.Celona, go with their signature Basque Burnt Cheesecake and finish your meal on a sweet note. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oysters, Goat Cheese with Stuffed Piquillo Peppers, Pan Tumaca with Jamon, Lychee Rose Bouquet Cocktail, Duroc Pork Chop with Smoked Pineapple Salsa

  • ABOUT

    Located at 21 Duxton Hill, Barcelona is a Cava (Spanish wine) haven (the first of its kind in Singapore) serving up a dynamic range of specialty Cavas. From Rosato and Selecte to Brut Nature and Brut Nature Reserve, all the Cavas Barcelona doles out are sourced from Can Paixano, Barcelona and are guaranteed to be the most authentic! Paired with their delightful gourmet tapas like their Chili Crab Dip or their signature Jamon Platter, and you’ve got an outta-this-world meal fit for a king! (Dec 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fresh Oysters, Jamon Platter, Nachos with Beef and Cheese, Truffle Fries, Baked Figs with Blue Cheese, Chili Crab Dip, Steak Ribeye and Veggies, Cavajito, My Passion Cocktail

  • LADIES NIGHT (EVERY WEDNESDAY)

    Every Wednesday, ladies get to enjoy a FREE bottle of Cava for every group of 4 women. What's more, enjoy Irish oysters, sumptuous tapas like Octopus, Jamon, Garlic Prawns, and more will be made available! Ladies night kicks off at 5pm, and lasts till midnight.

• ABOUT

    Famed for their beef, burger and beers, Barossa is the perfect Australian-inspired restaurant and bar for meat lovers to satisfy their carnivorous cravings! Unpretentious, laid-back and rustic, the inviting ambience of the restaurant makes it a great place to chill out after a hard day’s work and tuck into hearty Australian fare. Made only with the freshest ingredients and premium grades of Australian beef, the restaurant menu features a wide selection of dishes alongside an extensive range of fine wines and champagnes. Relish in Warrnambool striploin, deep-fried pork knuckle, lamb short loin chops, and stuffed mozzarella cheese pearl with The Carnivore Platter. A colourful plate of meaty goodness, fried bites and salad, this huge platter is sure to fill you up. Other signature dishes include the Beer Battered Fish and Chips, BBQ Berry Ribs, Char Grilled Rib Eye, Beef Ragout Pasta and more. Apart from a fine selection of meaty delights, vegetarian options are also available at Barossa. The Barrosa Salad and Wild Mushroom Pizza are crowd favourites and must-orders whenever you pop by the restaurant. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Carnivore Platter, Char Grilled Rib Eye, Beef Ragout Pasta, Wild Mushroom Pizza

  • PRESS RELEASE

    basdban is a literal translation of a Sichuanese slang () which means awesomeness. At basdban, we aim to break away from the typical Sichuanese food that you can find locally by offering authentic flavours with a western twist. Here we provide an East-meets-West fusion where we bring the best of both worlds in dishes meant for sharing that is the usual setting in every Chinese family dinner. basdban is a restaurant that is perfect for all occasions; family gatherings, chill session with your friends, unwind with colleagues after work & date night with your special someone. At basdban, we serve rock’n’roll Sichunese food. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Barramundi en Papilotte, Chopped Chili Prawn Aglio Olio, Flaming Chili Beef, Sichuanese Skewers

html:
• ABOUT

    With a beautiful view of the beach, and a bustling atmosphere, it’s easy to sit back and relax in Basil & Thyme. The food here leans towards the fiery side of Thai cuisine, so come prepared to take the heat. Start your meal with some appetisers to share, such as Satay Gai (chicken with peanut sauce) skewers, or some Tod Mun Goong -- fried prawn patties with a side of sweet and sour plum sauce for dipping. Love curries? The ones at Basil & Thyme don’t shy away from the heat. Tuck into Kaeng Daeng, a creamy and spicy combination packed with your choice of chicken, beef, or seafood. For milder versions, try the Kaeng Khiew Hwan Gai, a lighter green curry that is more gentle on your tastebuds. Be sure to also order a side of roti (flat bread) to sop up all the spicy, creamy gravy. The classic Pad Thai ranks high on the must-try list. Here, the stir-fried noodle dish is redolent with a smoky char, tossed with a generous helping of plump prawns, fresh seafood, or chicken. An interesting rice dish to try is the Khao Tom Pla, a watery congee made from soft-boiled rice with slices of tender fish. Be sure to save some space for dessert as well. The crowd-favourite Khao Niao Mamuang is one of the best versions of mango sticky rice in town, drizzled with a fragrant and rich house-made coconut cream. (Jun 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Satay Gai, Tod Mun Goong, Kaeng Daeng, Pad Thai, Khao Niao Mamuang

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Basque Kitchen reopens at iconic Fullerton Waterboat House New home opens a fresh chapter for the Michelin one-star restaurant by Chef-Patron Aitor Jeronimo Orive April 2021, Singapore - Where ships entering the harbour of Singapore came for fresh water, now gastronomes flock to for a fresh new dining experience. Introducing Basque Kitchen — back after a brief hiatus — in its new home at the historic Fullerton Waterboat House. The second home marks the beginning of a new chapter for Basque Kitchen. Established in October 2018 as Singapore’s first Basque-centric restaurant celebrating the country’s indigenous culture and produce, Basque Kitchen was awarded its first Michelin Star in the 2019 edition of Michelin Guide Singapore. In the new location, Chef-Patron Aitor Jeronimo Orive — alumni of the Michelin-starred kitchens of The Fat Duck in London, Mugaritz in San Sebastián and Neura in Bilbao — and his team continue to stay true to the produce-driven culinary philosophy that their customers love, executed with even greater finesse while remaining approachable. The Basque gastronomic experience is also more immersive, with a pintxos bar and lounge welcoming diners to unwind over a flute of cuvee champagne created especially for the restaurant, and to tease the tastebuds with the diverse range of light bites. In the semi-open kitchen, a duo of handsome Josper grills, custom-designed for the restaurant, anchor the space, offering diners a glimpse of the deliciousness to come. Within the 38-seat main dining hall of the new Basque Kitchen, a private dining room that seats eight makes a perfect venue for small, discreet gatherings. Basque Kitchen will also host the exclusive members-only space for American Express Centurion and Platinum Card Members, called Platinum at Basque Kitchen. Comprising 18 seats at the dining hall and 18 seats at the pintxos bar, the dedicated space boasts the finest views of the Fullerton waterfront. Centurion and Platinum Card Members will also enjoy priority reservations, and a suite of complimentary experiences including valet service and welcome drinks. An Immersive Experience Premier design agency Grey Matters, the same behind the likes of Cloudstreet, Tippling Club, and W Maldives, draws on the elements of Earth, Water, Fire, Air — also considered the four cornerstones of Basque cooking — to create a space that marries rusticism with modern sophistication. Think the juxtaposition of charcoal stained oak floorboards against plush velvet banquettes; the cool of gleaming embossed metal detailing balanced by the buttery softness of cream-hued leather; rippled glass creating a dance of light as water does; contoured lines all around, reminiscent of the coast of the Basque country, facing the Bay of Biscay. Dressed in a harmonious palette of charcoal greys, warm orange and oaky tones and given accents of gold and copper, it’s a space that is as invitingly comfortable as an old friend’s home as it is elegantly refined and fitting of special occasions. The pinxtos bar and lounge that seats 33 persons sets the tone for enjoyment. From the a la carte menu comes exquisite offerings such as artisanal Sanfilippo anchovies — perfected over 125 years by five generations of a Cantabrian family and exclusively available in Singapore at Basque Kitchen — served simply with tomatoes atop crisp curasao flatbread; a classic dish of goose barnacle slivers served with tender nuggets of sous vide abalone, piparras olives, piquillo peppers; and a moreish wagyu burger with amera tomato, pickled cucumber, caramelised onions and epoisses cheese. Apart from the authentic light bites served on bar plates made by Catalan tableware design studio Luesma & Vega, patrons can also indulge in oysters served four ways, or caviar by the tin before moving on to the main meal. In the dining room, a tasting menu is offered exclusively for lunch and dinner (from $158++ for lunch to $248++ for dinner). Crafted using painstakingly sourced Basque produce, complimented by premium seasonal ingredients from Japan — such as deep sea fish, uni and scallops, the menus also showcase house-aged beef. In the aging fridge — two to three times bigger than before — prime cuts such as Australian and Japanese wagyu are meticulously dry-aged for a minimum of 45 days. Following the style in the Basque country, the team also sources for beef from mature livestock about eight years of age — that which presents intensely deep and complex flavours and textures. Charcoal-grilled items anchor the tasting menus: such as Charcoal grilled blackspot bream and razor clam dressed in a typically Basque Donostiarra sauce made from the classic San Sebastián style pil pil; and a charcoal grilled old beef loin, its rich flavours amplified by a smoked garlic mousseline and a drizzle of truffle jus. Accompanying these are inspired items such as a jelly of tomato essence served with a tomato sorbet and Japanese fruit and micro tomatoes, and a sea anemone served with bomba rice and sea succulents, finished with a fragrant chive aioli — further demonstrating the breadth and depth of Chef Aitor’s evolved and elevated repertoire. Complementing the food is an expanded beverage list personally selected by General Manager Vincent Jaureguiberry. The industry veteran who has passed through the doors of Pierre Gagnaire in France and Saint Pierre Restaurant in Singapore looks beyond prized vintages and awards to find the true merit in good wines. He sees wines as expressions of the people behind each bottle, and takes the effort to meet the winemakers. As such, Basque Kitchen’s list of over 600 wines is a unique collection comprising of fine and rare wines from both prestigious houses and small producers. Each bottle also represents a moment in Vincent’s wine journey — and that of the restaurant’s wine service team. Some highlights from the collection include a vintage juice made from an apple variety native to the Basque country, commissioned by the restaurant, a terroir-driven French Basque natural cider from Domaine Bordatto, exclusive to Basque Kitchen; and an exclusive vintage collection from Basque winery Artadi. Of note is also the Jean Louis Vergnon Champagne “Conversation”, a blanc de blanc produced especially for Basque Kitchen in the renowned Cote des Blanc, homeland of the oldest and most mineral Chardonnay. Patrons can also look forward to weekly vineyard highlights, with wines offered by the glass, to be introduced at a later stage. On the list is also an extensive range of sherries, from crisp Finos to nectar-like Pedro Ximenez. Connoisseurs will take delight in exquisite drops such as those from celebrated Andalusian sherry maker Bodegas Pérez Barquero. The Solera Fundacional 1905 and Solera Cincuentenario 1955 from the 116 year-old bodega are considered guardians of a classical, extraordinary style, and at Basque Kitchen sherry enthusiasts will have the opportunity to sample the Amontillado 1955 and Oloroso 1955 from the Solera Cincuentenario series of the house, amongst other noble selections. “Basque Kitchen by Aitor is a celebration of Basque heritage, but it is also a celebration of the hearts and minds of our team,” shares Chef Aitor. “Every dish is a loving tribute to my own grandmothers; and every bottle marks a personal moment in the wine journey of our sommeliers. We hope not just to intrigue you with an immersive gastronomic experience, but also touch your heart with every drop and morsel presented.” (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chorizo Brioche Bun, Chocolate, Vegetable Bomba Rice, Golden Snapper

  • ABOUT BASQUE KITCHEN: A CELEBRATION OF HERITAGE AND PASSION

    Basque Kitchen by Aitor is a fine dining restaurant that showcases contemporary Basque cuisine reinterpreted by Chef-Patron Aitor Jeronimo Orive. Housed within the historical building of The Fullerton Waterboat House, it comprises a pinxto bar and lounge, a dining room and a private room, boasting fine views across the waterfront. Basque Kitchen by Aitor is open for both lunch and dinner, offering an exclusive tasting menu for each of the sessions.

  • ABOUT CHEF-PATRON AITOR JERONIMO ORIVE: A SON OF BASQUE COUNTRY

    A proud descendant of Basque Country, Aitor’s love for cooking was cultivated at a young age. One who grew up on rustic homecooked fare lovingly prepared by his grandparents — his paternal family hailing from the Basque region of Andaluci´a, and his mother’s family from the Southern Basque region of Biscay — Aitor naturally took to cooking as an expression of his heritage. He further honed his skills as a culinary professional at some of the most iconic restaurants of the world, including Basque Country’s own Mugaritz, Neura in Bilbao, and The Fat Duck in London. Combining past and present culinary influences on a plate, he presents a repertoire of dishes that celebrates classic Basque flavours and produce, and pays homage to his two grandmothers — the greatest inspirations in his life. Yet his cuisine is current and accessible to a global audience. Through the application of contemporary cooking techniques and novel ingredient pairings inspired through his travels and experiences around the world, he injects a modern, cosmopolitan dimension into his renditions of Basque cuisine. In October 2018, Aitor — having travelled from Europe to Australia and finally to Singapore — collaborated with Unlisted Collection for his first solo endeavour. Basque Kitchen by Aitor, Singapore’s first Basque-centric restaurant, was unveiled as a celebration of the Basque Country’s rich bounties and culinary heritage. Passionate about developing young talent, Aitor also sees the restaurant as a platform for nurturing the future leaders in the F&B industry. Working alongside him are local talent such as Chef de Cuisine Azrin Rahman — one half of the team that did Singapore proud at the 2019 International Catering Cup by clinching the Silver Trophy; and Junior Sous Chef Leong Tan, both of whom have worked with him since the opening of Basque Kitchen by Aitor in 2018.

  • MICHELIN GUIDE SINGAPORE 2021

    Basque Kitchen by Aitor has been awarded 1 Michelin Star.

• ABOUT

    Bayswater Kitchen offers informal, happy seafront dining with an approachable seafood-centric menu. Located right by the waterfront at the scenic Marina at Keppel Bay, Bayswater Kitchen is a celebration of all things related to the sea, from the bountiful fresh produce to the laidback and relaxed atmosphere that being by the seaside inspires. Featuring an extensive a la carte menu and bi-weekly set lunches that celebrates seasonality and freshness, Bayswater Kitchen introduces you to the simple pleasures of seafood cooked honestly yet creatively to enhance their inherent flavours and textures. Bayswater Kitchen is all about the joy of social interactions, so meat lovers and vegetarians will not be left out as the menu will also feature grills, pasta and vegetarian options that are perfect for sharing. Highlights from the menu include Tuna Tartare; chargrilled Octopus; Seared Beef Tataki; Butcher’s Platter; Grass-Fed Hanging Tender; as well as a Fisherman’s Feast with seasonal seafood served with handmade Linguine. Enjoy Bayswater Kitchen’s Sunday Brunch By The Bay where diners can choose from sumptuous a la carte items including Mussels & Clams In A Pot, Fisherman’s Feast, Grilled Bacon Cheese Burger, Chef’s Seafood Platter, with options to add in a free-flow drinks package of Prosecco or Champagne. If you fancy, you can even stay on for more seafood as Bayswater Kitchen opens for Sunday dinner as well. If you just want to grab a quick nibble, Bayswater Bar also serves up small bites in the evenings daily which can be washed down with cocktails, beers, wines and other fun tipples. This alfresco bar is ideal for star-gazing and breezy social catch-ups. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The restaurant is located at Keppel Bay and presents a seafood-centric repertoire.” –Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jumbo Crab Cakes, Lobster Bisque, Chef’s Seafood Platter, Braised Ox Cheek, Linguine Vongole, Margaret River Angus Grain-Fed Tenderloin

• PRESS RELEASE

    Beach Road Kitchen, a member of Marriott Bonvoy presents a unique Chefs-on-Show buffet which elevates the dining experience with a feast for the senses highlighted by Chefs' specialty passaround and roving live station that teases the palate. Don't miss out top picks from the menu including Seafood on Ice, Charcoal Grilled Meats, Italian Gourmet Pasta and Pizza as well as signature desserts from the Patisserie! The festive buffet available till 2nd January 2022 features a plethora of holiday favourites highlighted by a Christmas carvery live station of Beach Road Kitchen’s traditional whole roasted turkey and honey glazed ham. For the sweet tooth, enjoy unlimited servings of sweet treats featuring logcakes, maple pecan pie, pumpkin cheesecake and more! (Nov 2021)

  • NOTE TO DINERS

    The hotel is committed to providing our valued customers with a safe environment that aligns with new protocols for the current circumstances. Certified SG Clean by the Singapore government, the hotel’s measures and actions include temperature checks of all guests and associates, enhanced cleaning and disinfection, queue management and safe distancing of tables and seats.

    There is no better way to spend a Sunday over a bubbly brunch buffet with free flow champagne, wines, cocktails & beer. If you’re looking for a brunch that appeal to different whims and fancies, Beach Road Kitchen's Champagne Brunch is the place to head to. Apart from bottomless champagne that keep conversations flowing, a feast for the senses beckon with a Cheese and Charcuterie Station, Seafood on Ice of Oysters and Shellfish varieties, Alaskan King Crab, freshly baked crisp crust Pizza topped with innovative ingredients, Charcoal Grilled-to-order meats, a spread of Local Favorites and a dazzling array of Dessert Showcase. Sleek and smart during the week we roll up our sleeves and loosen our ties on the weekends with spit roasts and ice-cold beer as we take in the breezy afternoons on our sun-kissed terrace. Get ready for The Beacon, get ready for the finer things in life. (Mar 2017)

html:
• ABOUT

    Be prepared to be won over by Bearded Bella, a cute little cafe located on Craig Road that is as charming and quirky as its name suggests. At this lavender-hued shophouse, this eatery serves up Melbourne-style coffees, pristine-looking cakes, and hearty cafe bites. Don’t be surprised to spot a fair number of coffee aficionados at this joint. Under the helm of Bearded Bella’s, a former Singapore National Barista Championship winner, baristas are taught how to craft each cup of joe with great precision and care. Then pair your coffee with a Spiced Scramble. A clever take on scrambled eggs, this cafe gussies this dish up with turmeric and truffle, alongside the medley of mushrooms, kale, and dehydrated tomatoes. And there isn’t any foul play to be had with the cheekily-named Fowl Play, which combines crumbled chicken thigh, charred miso corn, roasted cauliflower, and sage into one delightful dish. Looking for something sweet? Then check out the sweet and citrusy Donut Sliders, composed of yuzu and chocolate ice cream, crushed Tim Tam’s, raspberry, and basil coulis. A perfect blend of great bites, pleasing ambience, and Aussie-style coffees, Bearded Bella is making a name for itself with its unique flair and style. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spiced Scramble, Fowl Play, Donut Sliders, Smashed Avocado, Iced White Coffee

• ABOUT

    Rooted in the belief that food and drinks bring people together, Beast & Butterflies — the hotel’s main dining hall — is a flamboyant social space where all manner of creature comforts are satiated. The restaurant serves up dishes that seamlessly meld influences from East and West, showcasing Modern Asian Cuisine that bring diners on a discovery of social, communal dining. Social barflies can quench their thirst with artisanal cocktails prepared by in-house mixologists, as the 13-metre bar counter offers a meeting point for fellow travellers to swap stories on exciting adventures to be found just outside of the river. (Dec 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “I'd suggest you save the money and order the Simply Scallop, a more generous starter of Hokkaido scallop carpaccio with a yuzu and ginger marinade. Bits of crispy deep-fried garlic and a touch of shallot oil give it a Cantonese flavour that works marvellously.” –The Straits Times

• ABOUT

    A new restaurant and lounge concept featured in a Bukit Pasoh shophouse and attached garden, offers tasting menus for a quick bite or full degustation experience all expertly paired with wine and cocktails. The passionate new project from Caroline Tan and Douglas Williams focuses on providing an elevated attention to detail into the music, culinary and beverage offerings and in melding these 3 so the sum equals more then the individual parts. The music will flow as easing of restrictions of Singapore allow.The culinary program focuses on offering exquisitely conceived and expertly prepared small plates constructed based on Asian and Australian haute cuisine influences which focus on the simplicity of balancing flavours, enhanced through cooking with our Binchotan wood fire Bertha oven and Konro grill. Our curated selection of spirits and extensive bitters collection, serve as the basis for our contemporary cocktail program. Where restraint and nuance allow us to offer elegant and delicious cocktails, while still showcasing the flavours intended by the distillers, winemakers, and brewers. Masterful concoctions regardless of your preferred taste palate, taking you down a voyage or pure ambrosia. Musically we provide a sonic experience featuring Devialet Phantom speakers, Technics 1200 turntables for maximum enjoyment of our extensive vinyl collection. The soulful style provides background Jazz fusion with influences from hip hop and R&B, curated by our music director DJ Shigeki. (Sep 2021)

    Bertha Ash Biscuits, Nambanzuke, Tontoro Pork Cheek, Ice Kacang

html:
• ABOUT

    Bedrock Bar & Grill is a modern grill and steakhouse with quality dining and service. Decorated with unfinished wood and rough granite elements, the entire space is warm and intimate. Diners sink into the plush, custom-made leather booths, ready for a delicious meal shared with friends and loved ones. As a fine testament to the quality service and memorable dining experiences provided to guests over the years, Bedrock Bar & Grill swept a series of awards in the 2020 edition of the prestigious Haute Grandeur Global Restaurant Awards, including ‘Best Steakhouse in Asia’, ‘Best Grill in Asia’, ‘Best Wine Selection in Singapore’, and ‘Best Restaurant Manager on a Global Level. Distinguished chefs with a great respect for tradition and premium quality meats were heavily involved in the crafting of Bedrock Bar & Grill's award-winning menu. Wood-grilled, smoked hot, cold, with exotic spices, or just keeping things classic, the selection of meat cuts and seafood is sourced from farms in the USA, Japan, and Australia for superior quality and sustainability. If the entire table is feeling adventurous, the Tomahawk Steak is one for the picture books! Coming in at around 1.4 to 2kg per serving, this grilled, 400-day grain-fed F1 long-bone wagyu ribeye beauty feeds at least 3 people comfortably. If you would prefer to have a steak to yourself, the Bedrock Pepper Steak, a 300g ribeye cap served with a mouthwatering black peppercorn sauce, is a surefire way to ensure a return visit. Charred to perfection on the outside, while remaining juicy on the inside, it's no wonder that this dish has gained a large following. (Nov 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Save your appetite for the famous Bedrock Tomahawk steak. Served with the bone in, the 400-day grain fed F1 long-bone wagyu beef ribeye comes with five sauces: red wine, Bedrock chilli oil, classic béarnaise, wholegrain whisky mustard and chimichurri. The meat comes perfectly grilled; the outer flesh has a more charred finish, while the middle and inner bone parts are juicer and fuller in flavour." -Asia Tatler Dining "We started off with roasted marrow on toast - a simple but stunning appetizer with beef bone marrow served on warm bread. We also used our bread to dip in the delicious applewood-smoked tomato soup with basil mascarpone. From the mains, the US tenderloin jumped up immediately from the menu and it didn't disappoint; it was everything a steak should be - succulent, tender and flavorful." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    An apt reflection of the land and sea elements of its idyllic coastal location, Bedrock Origin serves up only the finest chops and dry-aged steaks along with mouthwatering seafood selections on the grill and in the raw bar to bring the sumptuous taste of the oceans to your tables. Combining natural ingredients with the procurement of high-quality meats and classic cooking techniques, indulge in a variation of meaty menu options whipped up to honour the natural, rustic flavours of Earth and the natural world. Bring your dining experience to the next level with the restaurant’s expansive selection of alcoholic beverages. Hailing from all over the region, take your pick from the specially curated aisles of fine wines and traditional whiskies from around the world. We recommend pairing your steak with the right wine, or one of Bedrock Origin’s classic whisky-based cocktails to end off your meal on a heady note. Chef recommendations here include Aged Kühlbarra Barramundi Tail, Turbot On The Bone, Roasted Bone Marrow Beef Tartare, Kingfish Sashimi, Line Caught Tuna Collar, Kobe Wagyu Striploin, Dry-Aged Australian Barley Fed Striploin, Plant-Based Beef Wellington, and Spicy Brussels Sprouts. Featuring an outdoor terrace, sheltered outdoor verandah, spacious indoor seating area, and private rooms, drop by Bedrock Origin to indulge in a casual dining affair, away from the intensity of the big city! (Sep 2021)

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Bee’s Knees draws inspiration from the highly social, evolved behavior of bees. Located on the ground level of The Garage, Bee’s Knees aims to pollinate the Singapore Botanic Gardens with warm hospitality and sincere service. Family-friendly café and bistro by day and casual hangout spot by night, Bee’s Knees is a fun and comfortable idyll to stop and relax in the Gardens. The restaurant's seven round-topped entryways are elegantly screened with glass, creating a cheery interior of clean-lined functionality. Different materials and finishes on walls and floors efficiently demarcate areas, and graphic colors and botanical patterns enliven the space. Bee’s Knees menu offerings range from eggs, croissants, salads, fruit bowls, pizzas, pasta, sandwiches, snacks, waffles, ice cream, pancakes, coffee and drinks with a wide variety of food and beverage options. ‘Bee social,’ ‘bee connected’ is the friendly promise here.

  • THE BUZZ

    "Located on the ground floor of a restored heritage garage in the Botanic Gardens, Bee's Knees is the sort of place you can bring your dog after a morning run. They do easy fare like eggs, waffles, pizza, pasta and an extensive selection of sandwiches and salads." -SG Now

    Located along Serangoon Road, Bei Fang Ren Jia is a Chinese restaurant serving a huge variety of Northern Chinese food and Szechuan mala options. Perfect for casual dinings and group gatherings, the restaurant is known for introducing exciting new dishes to their extensive selection of authentic Chinese offerings for a tasty dining experience. Diners should not miss out on the HomeFarm Stewed Chicken in Ground Kettle, Northeast Barbecue, and ChongQing Mala Grilled Fish. Another fiery specialty dish that will surely spice up your meal is the Signature Red Chilli Wonton. Drenched in red chilli oil, the handmade wontons taste even better than it looks. Pair with a plate of Egg Fried Rice to enjoy a filling meal. Pick your kind of soup here at Bei Fang Ren Jia with the different nutritious options on offer. The Scrambled Egg Tomato Soup is a delicious option great for both kickstarting your meal. Other equally mouthwatering options include the Seafood Soup and Soup and Spicy Soup. (Sep 2021)

    Set on the historic Bussorah Street with a picturesque backdrop of the majestic Sultan Mosque, this award-winning boutique Arabic lounge serves up some of the finest Lebanese and Middle Eastern cuisine in the city. All key spices and herbs are imported from the finest shops in Lebanon, making it that little bit more authentic! Entice your senses with their famed mouth-watering mezza infused with olive oil, spices and herbs. Other crowd favourites include the Mixed Grill Kebab Platter and the Sizzling Kefalotyri Cheese with Caramelized Onions. On weekends witness their bellydancer dance to the beat of Arabic music while you dine, indoors or alfresco! They have recently won the coveted TripAdvisor Travellers Choice Award in 2020, Singapore's Top Restaurant (by Wine & Dine for the third year in a row) & are listed as one of TimeOut's Recommended restaurants for 2020. (Feb 2021)

    Mixed Grill Kebab Platter, Mezze Platter, Kunefe, Hummus, Falafel

• ABOUT

    An offshoot of the immensely popular Bella Pizza, its sister restaurant next door, Bella Pasta takes the pizza kitchen’s fine nose for good flavour, steady Italian-trained hands, and generous love for everything rich and creamy, and dishes out a heavy-hitting menu of delicious pasta plates. If you’ve ever chowed down on the deluxe pizzas at Bella Pizza, you know you’re in for a treat. Here, there’s a full Italian menu including pastas and charcoal grilled meats, turned out by a highly-trained team of chefs drawn from top Italian restaurants all over the island. Dine alfresco to really soak up the Robertson Quay vibes, but also because pasta tastes better with a side of people watching - and you’ll be doing a lot of people watching, because one plate won’t be enough. Think chewy batons of Cavatelli pasta tossed with wilted spinach and salty Parma Ham or a bountiful Linguine Frutti de Mare, a garlicky toss-up of linguine and tender shrimp, clams, and squid. One of the highlights is a beautiful, generous portion of Pappardelle Boscoiala, ribbony strips of pasta in a rich, tomato-based mushroom sauce. Beyond pasta, fill up on their hefty charcoal grilled meats and seafood. A particularly attractive Grigliata Gamberi E Calamari sees smoky grilled squid and fleshy big prawn served with little other than a squeeze of lemon and their own juices with fresh arugula. River breeze, hot pasta, and the capable hands of an Italian kitchen - Singapore rarely gets better than this. (Mar 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Located along the river at Robertson Quay is sister restaurant of well-loved pizzeria Bella Pizza, Bella Pasta. Importing majority of its ingredients from Italy, owner Antonio Manetto believes in serving authentic Italian fare without localizing recipes.” -Gourmet Adventures

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Linguine Frutti de Mare, Pappardelle Boscoiala, Cavatelli Con Prosciutto E Spinaci, Grigliata Gamberi E Calamari.

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.
