• ABOUT

    Along Robertson Quay, which overflows with one great foodie option after another, this winning pizzeria stands out for its excellent gourmet-inflected pizzas, made lovingly with Italian ingredients and exacting Italian taste. Grab a seat in the alfresco area and you could almost be on a Roman street, soaking up the sights, sounds, and, most importantly, smells. Here, the pizza is made fresh by hand in the Neapolitan style, meaning the crust has the perfect balance between chewiness and crispiness. That sweet spot is probably why the pizzas here are regularly touted amongst some of the best in town. Obviously it’s not just about the crust: imagine the sinful appeal of a pizza crowned by wobbly mounds of creamy Burrata cheese, or topped with an elegant fan of thinly sliced salmon on a bed of spinach. If all that’s too rich, reach for the bright flavours of anchovies, capers, and tomatoes in their Napoleon pizza, or the simple pleasures of Gorgonzola, browned onions, and Mozzarella in the Pizza Cipolla. There’s also pastas, like the especially indulgent Truffle-bomb, Fettuccine Salciccia Fe Tartufo, where noodles are tossed in a truffle cream, topped with freshly-shaved black truffle. It’s very hard to top the joy of pizza, but here it becomes an art. (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Some say that Bella Pizza tops the list of best pizza places in Singapore. You can certainly taste the freshness and quality of the ingredients they use in their pizzas” -The Asian Parent.com

• ABOUT

    Opened with the aim of giving locals a taste of the French patisseries of old, this spot serves up cakes, pastries, and delicious mains. Located on Upper Thomson Road, this is the perfect place for weekend hangouts with friends and casual brunches. Grab a chair, soak in the relaxing atmosphere, and treat yourself to some delicious grub. Dig into one of their signature waffles. The Hojicha Molten Waffle. Made with roasted matcha and topped with Kurogoma Ice Cream, this dish is both Insta-worthy and delicious. The earthy, smoky flavour of the matcha in the pancake adds depth to the sweetness of the ice cream, with each bite melting in the mouth. Diners who prefer something savoury will enjoy the Chicken Parmigiana. A classic pub grub dish jazzed up with jalapeno and mozzarella cheese, this is the perfect option to enjoy with a pint of beer. Lighter snacks are also available in the form of soups, and various fried items. The Spam Fries are a popular option, and it’s not hard to see why. Made with chunks of luncheon meat deep fried to crisp perfection, these “fries” are an excellent option for barflies to snack on. For something a little closer to home, opt for the Chilli Crab Fries. Crisp fries topped with chilli crab sauce and chunks of crab, this unique side will have you licking your fingers (and lips!) long after the last bite. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab Fries, Spam Fries, Hojicha Molten Waffle, Chicken Parmigiana

    Started in 1978, Beng Hiang Restaurant has since established itself as one of the best Hokkien restaurants in Singapore. The interior's simple, homely decor is a nod to the type of fare served here, with unpretentious and hearty Hokkien dishes done right. The piping hot soups are sure to start your meal on the right note, with creations like Fish Maw with Crabmeat and Stewed Black Chicken Herbal Soup. Continue the feasting with a variety of meat, seafood, vegetables, and rice and noodle dishes. Don’t miss traditional Hokkien favourites such as Oyster Omelette, Kong Ba Bao (savoury braised brisket in a steamed bun), and Suckling Pig. The Hokkien Mee is a must-try too, with springy noodles and fresh seafood coated in a generous portion of smoky and umami gravy. There are even premium selections such as Braised Whole Abalone and Drunken Lobster for that special occasion. End your meal on a sweet note with the Peanut Soup with Dough Fritters or Cheng Teng. For a little extra indulgence, opt for the Double Boiled Bird's Nest Soup. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Maw with Crabmeat Soup, Stewed Black Chicken Herbal Soup, Oyster Omelette, Kong Ba Bao, Hokkien Mee, Double Boiled Bird's Nest Soup

• ABOUT

    Defying odds in a difficult year, 'Beng Who Cooks' shows us all that dreams can still come true. The 'Bengs' in question are Jason Chua and Hung Zhen Long, and in 2020, they moved their operations from their Hong Lim Hawker stall into a brand new restaurant on Neil Road. The new premise sports a sleek and industrial theme that allows it to transition from a bistro in the daytime to a fine dining experience at night.The revamped concept comes with two brand new menus. Their lunch menu featuring reasonably priced rice and salad bowls is a more casual concept to cater to the easygoing office and gym crowd. In contrast, their dinner degustation menu is done omakase style for fine dining aficionados.Chef Jason takes inspiration from his family in the form of dishes such as 'Son of a Fruit Seller' seeing how his parents sold fruits for a living, and 'Siew Ting's Cake' which is a dessert named after his mother. Visit often as the menu is often refreshed to keep things novel. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crab's Well, Bak Chor Rice, Son of a Fruit Seller, Happy Ending

• ABOUT

    If you find yourself craving the vibrant flavours of Malay cuisine, head to Bijan Restaurant. This homely eatery serves up familiar, comforting flavours with plenty of homemade touches. The Popiah Goreng, for instance, is an appetiser not to be missed. The vegetable spring rolls are made in-house, and deep-fried until crispy. Perfect for dipping into a house-made spicy chilli sauce. Another popular appetiser is the Daging Bungkus Kukus. This rare treat features a fluffy pancake, filled with juicy ground meat marinated with herbs and bathed in a housemade gravy, If you’re craving a bowl of hot soup, be sure to try the restaurant’s signature Sup Ekor Sapi Bijian. This savoury soup is redolent with freshly ground spices, and chock-full of tender braised oxtail. For mains, Bijan serves a selection of Western and Malay classics, with the occasional fusion dish. The Spaghetti Rendang, for instance, is the perfect dish for diners who crave a little pasta, but still want to inhale the aroma and heartiness of beef rendang. From the wok, expect fluffy rice infused with Malay herbs over roaring flames. The smoke-kissed Traditional Kerabu Rice Bijan is packed with flavour, and served with crackers for garnish and strips of juicy beef. Also good from the Mains selection is the Gulai Lemak Daging Salai Dengan Jantung Pisang. Made the traditional way, this hearty stew features fresh banana flower cooked in a turmeric gravy, with slices of fork-tender chargrilled Australian sirloin. Be sure to save some space for dessert as well. The Banana Fritters with Coconut Ice Cream is a gourmand’s dream, where golden-brown sweet pillows of fruit are topped with a creamy coconut ice cream, and drizzled with a rich gula melaka. Order this one to share. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Popiah Goreng, Daging Bungkus Kukus, Traditional Kerabu Rice Bijan, Gulai Lemak Daging Salai Dengan Jantung Pisang, Fried Mee Mamak, Banana Fritters with Coconut Ice Cream

    Located in the heart of glamour, Binary is a 45-seater gastro-bar with an alfresco terrace overlooking Orchard Road. Based on the concept of two, it offers a binary approach to cuisine bringing to the table Asian and Western flavors at their dynamic best. Classic recipes from Asian and Western kitchens are discerningly curated, with guests taking their pick of either option or simply choosing both as the dishes are perfect for sharing. An extensive wine list at superb quality-for-value prices complements the food along with bespoke cocktails and craft beers. Binary's edgy intimate vibe makes it seductive for a solo respite from retail therapy, chatty catch-up with friends, or for date nights - an oasis in the city for hanging out and having a good time. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Iberico Pluma, Fried Burrata, Binary Craft Brew, King Prawn, Wagyu Striploin

    Enjoy up to 30% off at Bincho at Hua Bee when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions.Click here to purchase.

  • ABOUT

    Bincho at Hua Bee, quite literally tucked away in a disguised heritage coffee shop near Tiong Bahru, is an attention-grabbing new spot by famed restaurateur Loh Lik Peng. Inspired by a yakitori-ya in Osaka, the all-in-one Japanese yakitori restaurant by Chef Asai Masashi is a true find for more than one reason!  Head down the Moh Guan Terrace alley and around the back of the unassuming Hua Bee stand to find a metal door with small, wiry Bincho lettering. Then down the rabbit hole you go, transitioning briskly from the traditional neighbourhood feel to the likes of an underground bunker, complete with rough edges, shady lighting, and oxidized copper tones. Take a seat at the marble bar for a front row seat to all the grilling action, or the domed booths to get your drink on, like the restaurant's most notable fruit, herb and sake-centric cocktails from the resident barkeep. With both food and drink menus largely in-flux at the whim of the chef and cocktailier, it's best to go with the daily recommendations. Food wise, get ready for a smoky experience of grilled goodness and smoky delights. With a menu inspired by the 24 micro-seasons in Japan, expect only the best produce of the season being featured on the menu. Available all year round, try the restaurant's famed protein - the tori (chicken), popular cuts like wings, breast and thighs masterfully executed over the bincho-tan charcoal. Or for a unique experience, chicken tail, cartilage, heart, gizzard, liver and cockscomb. (Apr 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Fronting the store is a seemingly inconspicuous old-school mee pok stall. Venture further in and you'll discover a modern open-concept yakitori bar, helmed by Chef Asai Masashi, and a cocktail bar, with playful Japeritifs concocted by Stefan Ravalli of The Library." -Honeycombers "It's all about omakase (chef's selection, with sets from $50-$80), with Head Chef Asai Masashi turning out a variety of small plates (chicken tsukune with egg yolk; salmon avocado yukke wrap with seaweed; lots of grilled meat and veggies) most of which are cooked over the charcoal grill." -SG Now "Bite-sized chicken breast morsels retain their juices and get a pleasant hit of wasabi; chicken wings are split and splayed for easier eating and enjoyed with a salty-fragrant condiment of minced yuzu and pepper; tender morsels stripped from the back of a chicken's neck are very good; and grilled chicken thigh gets added kick from black chilli pepper and sweet mustard seeds." -The Business Times Chicken finds unexpected pride of place on the menu. The yakitori shio platter sees grilled soft chicken bone, gizzard, and breast, lightly seasoned with salt and served with a contrasting trio of mushroom salt, wasabi, and yuzu peppercorn." -Asia Tatler Dining

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yakitori Dishes (Chicken Parts), Stuffed Mentaiko Wings, Miyazaki Style Grilled Chicken Necks, Seasonal Vegetable Platter, Tsukune with Egg Yolk

    Enjoy up to 30% off at Bincho at Min Jiang when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • ABOUT

    Nestled behind a lush foliage of greenery, Bincho at Min Jiang brings delicious skewers of smoke-kissed meat to the Dempsey enclave. The restaurant is chic in frosted glass panels, a vaulted roof, and copper-hued accents, with Japanese folk songs as the soundtrack to your dinner. All meats and vegetables are grilled over the restaurant’s signature Bincho-tan, Japanese white charcoal. For the best experience, order the Yakitori Platter to share. Here, you’ll find every bit of chicken — from safer parts like thigh and wing, to the lesser-ordered neck and tail — grilled to charred perfection. This second Bincho outfit also has new menu items, such as the Uni Shabu Shabu. The light, creamy broth is infused with Japanese sea urchin, forming the base for an array of succulent seafood like prawns, oysters, and abalone. Get your daily dose of greens with the Yasai Maki (vegetable rolls), where wafer-thin slices of pork and beef are wrapped around yam, corn, and mushrooms, then grilled over an open flame. Wash it all down with cups of sake, or some rare Japanese whiskies. (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yakitori Platter, Uni Shabu Shabu, Grilled Japanese Squid with Liver Sauce, Yasai Maki (Vegetable Rolls), Snow Crab Fried Rice

html:
• ABOUT

    A binomial is composed of two parts that form a single one. With that, Binomio Spanish Restaurante, is the combination of two vital concepts in the Spanish cuisine: Tapas and Restaurant Quality food inspired by the traditional Spanish taste is served. One can experience an elegant and warm service that is sure to leave unforgettable personal memories. Head chef Gonzalo Landin has worked with the biggest names in the culinary world, in some of the world’s best restaurants since graduating from London’s Le Cordon Bleu. At Binomio, Chef Gonzalo takes classic Mediterranean dishes and adds the skills and techniques he’s learnt from the masters. Binomio’s focus on traditional Spanish cuisine allows Gonzalo to do what he cherishes most - putting his Spanish identity on a plate. (Dec 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "On the tapas menu, expect usual favourites like the patatas bravas ($10), the tortilla de patatas or Spanish potato omelette ($8), and gambas al ajillo, or garlic fried prawns ($14), as well as less commonly seen dishes like the salmorejo Cordobes, or chilled tomato soup with egg and ham ($8)." -The Business Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Croquetas Binomio, Grilled Cuttlefish served with Sofrito, Slow-cooked Beef Short Ribs with Cauliflower Puree, Squid Ink Paella, Traditional Spanish Roasted Suckling Pig

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2015 and 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

• SAVE UP TO 5% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    Enjoy up to 5% off at Birds of a Feather when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • PRESS RELEASE

    It’s easy to mistake Birds of a Feather for yet another pretty cafe. The space is filled with natural light from two air-well openings, and hand-crafted art pieces and copper pipes are a chic finish to the walls here. But the dishes here are far from the typical Eggs Benedict or pancake stack. Instead, the food is a delicious fusion of Western with Sichuan influences. Take the Yuxiang (fish fragrance). The sauce is traditionally made by frying doubanjiang, garlic and ginger with pickled chilli, served with meaty eggplants. At Birds of a Feather, the same dish comes with an extra layer of mozzarella cheese, and a generous sprinkle of mantou crumbs. If you’re a big fan of spicy food, items like the Fortune Skewers are a must-order. This crowd favourite has gotten a new twist, and now comes with a fiery Sichuan red oil. Birds of a Feather specially pick their spices from Chengdu’s spice market, and these are laboriously fried with chillies to create this house-made oil. Not all Sichuan dishes are numbingly spicy, either. The Sichuan Oxtail Soup is a light, clear broth, akin to the familiar pig’s trotters soup. Chinese herbs and fresh leek infuse this comforting soup with plenty of flavour. Just looking for a relaxed night out, with drinks and some simple grub? The street food-inspired selection is the perfect bar snack. Definitely order the Charcoal Grilled Pork Bits. Inspired by barbecued pork belly skewers sold along the streets, Birds of a Feather does a luxe version with Duroc pork belly, crispy rice crackers, charred green chilli, and Japanese sweet potato. (July 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Inspired by the laid-back teahouses of Chengdu, the café tastefully makes use of lush greenery and eclectic design pieces to create a space you won’t mind unwinding at from morning till late” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pig Ear Mosaic, Fortune Skewer in Sichuan Pepper Broth, Sweating Mussels, Hot & Sour Chazuke

    Biseryu Japanese Restaurant is a new restaurant concept with over 12 popular and famous award-winning restaurants from different parts of Japan represented under one roof. Taste the exotic Gyutan or Ox tongue from the famous Senri restaurant in Sendai or if lamb is your preferred red meat, then come try Shibaura Genghis Khan’s Grilled Lamb Don. For something out of the ordinary, savour the ever popular Omurice (omelette rice) set and try the fragrant pan-fried egg omelette over Japanese Niigata rice. We will also be serving alcohol throughout the day but a must try is our signature Aperol Spritzer with Sparkling sake! There will also be a carefully selected range of sake for your enjoyment. If you are looking for a cosy no fuss Japanese restaurant with good ambience and friendly servers with exceptional tasting food, look no further! Biseryu is also a great place to entertain your guests as well as having group gatherings. (Jun 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Lamb Don, Gyutan (Ox Tongue), Omurice, Aperol Spritzer

html:
• ABOUT

    Bistro G is a bistro concept headed by chef Gwen Lim of Patisserie G and chef Christopher Grilo of Bakery Artisan Original. Together, they boast an impressive resume of experience in managing Michelin starred restaurants in Singapore and across the globe. Take your pick of an Assorted Bread Basket, the Cold Cut Platter, or a steaming bowl of the Soup of the Day to kickstart your meal. Filled with mini croissants, baguette, sourdough and onion sea salt rolls, the bread basket is a great starter perfect for sharing. With so many varieties of bread to choose from, there is something for everyone. A signature item on the menu, the Beef Wellington is made up of tenderloin, oxtail ragu, mushrooms encased in a puff pastry that rewards with a burst of exquisite flavours when bitten into. Another worthy contender you simply have to order is the Lobster Roll. Dressed with lemon mayonnaise dressing and infused with fresh herbs, the tender and juicy canadian lobster makes for mouthfuls of delight. Wrap up your meal with a decadent Chocolate Choux Puff for a sweet ending. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Assorted Bread Basket, Beef Wellington, Lobster Roll, Chocolate Choux Puff

• PRESS RELEASE

    Led by one of the most respected veterans of Singapore’s F&B industry, Chef Otto Weibel, Black Marble brings the best of farm to table for its discerning diners. With over 16 years of culinary experience under his belt, Head Chef Jay Siaw has a special expertise in working the char grill. Look forward to an irresistible selection of meats from Australia, Japan, and USA, all char grilled to perfection. Black Marble believes in using the freshest ingredients harvested at their peak. All our sauces and jus are lovingly from scratch in our kitchens, so no detail is spared. No secret to those who appreciate the finer things in life, clink your glasses of sublime wines to go along with our hearty fare at great prices. Join us at Black Marble – where food, people and passion come together for moments of magic. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    30 Days Dry Aged T-Bone, A4 Japanese Kagoshima Beef, Angus Tenderloin, New Zealand Sea Bream with Crispy Skin

html:
• ABOUT

    Big on flavours and huge on joy, Black Pearl Steakhouse offers the best Western cuisine featuring a tantalising collection of dishes that are made for gatherings of friends, colleagues and family. Located along Upper East Coast Road, the restaurant’s all-encompassing menu caters to every palate. From salads to steaks, there’s something for everyone here at Black Pearl Steakhouse. Aside from premium steak cuts, the restaurant's menu also boasts a selection of pasta, delectable French-inspired mains, as well as mouth-watering desserts. Incorporating modern elements into classic dishes, the restaurant’s signature Wagyu Beef Burger with Fries delights both the young and old. Tender and juicy slices of beef fill up fluffy buns and are served with a side of thinly sliced and well-seasoned fries. For those with a big appetite, opt for an add-on of Tiger Prawns or a Sunny Side Up to have a taste of all that Black Pearl Steakhouse has to offer. If you prefer dining with courses, go for the four-course meal dinner set. Comprising a starter, main, dessert and drinks, you can expect nothing but the best from the restaurant's signature dishes. (Mar 2020)

  • ABOUT

    Following its name, Black Society’s interior and theme is luxe and stylish. Boasting an elusive atmosphere, it brings an air of mystery as you dine exquisite Chinese cuisine. With an extensive menu, feast on classic favourites honed to perfection. For warm starters, try their Honey Crispy Eel for a sweet and light dish that’s great for sharing. Or sample on their Soft Shell Crab Salad for a more unique dish. Soups are a must-try at Black Society, and we recommend their Mini Buddha Jump Over The Wall. This savoury and rich soup is guaranteed to fill you with warm and comforting vibes. For mains, Black Society serves a plethora of dishes and you can choose from luxury ingredients from Alaskan King Crab to Ancient Drunken Chicken. For seafood dishes, choose from delectable sauces that you can pair your choice ingredients with. If you’re looking for a luxurious dish, try their lobster sashimi and taste the sweet, fresh flavours of the ocean. Meats and Poultry cover a large area of their menu too, and one of our favourites is their Stir-Fried Frog Leg with Kung-po Sauce. Savoury, salty with a hint of spice, the sauce mixes perfectly with the sweet and tender frog meat. For grains, try their Crispy Intestines Congee. The light and chewy meat pairs amazingly with fragrant stewed congee for a steamy bowl of goodness. Wash down the greasiness of the meal with their Cucumber, Lime and Pu Er Tea to end off your meal on a light and refreshing note. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Honey Crispy Eel, Soft Shell Crab Salad, Ancient Drunken Chicken, Stir Fried Frog Leg with Kung-po Sauce, Crispy Intestines Congee

  • ABOUT

    Serving artisanal dim sum with a dash of western delights, Black Society Dimsum Kitchen (Great World)'s modern and refreshing take on old classics puts this casual dining concept on the map. Feast with all senses as you soak in this black-centric themed cafe. Crafting artisan dim sum almost too decadent to eat, you're in for a delicious treat at Black Society Dimsum Kitchen (Great World). Enjoy their Almond Cream Mangosteen, a deep-fried dim sum fashioned into a mangosteen look-alike that injects a bit of fun into your meal. One of their other specials - Chilled Mango with Century Egg Glass Roll- is an unorthodox mix of ingredients. Savour sweet, sour and savoury notes that blend together in a happy marriage of flavours, all wrapped up in rice paper. Have fancy dumplings with their Netted Potstickers, or try out their Chilli Crab Tart - the latter a whole new way of incorporating Singapore's famous Chilli Crab flavours into dim sum. If you're gunning for a more western-centric meal, try Black Society Dimsum Kitchen (Great World)'s Pee Wee Potatoes for starters. Fork-tender potatoes are drizzled in a delicious house-made sauce and topped with scallions. For mains, we recommend their Funghi Fettuccine in Truffle Creamy Sauce for a satisfying and luxurious meal. Beat the heat with MASA's delicious chilled desserts - our recommendation: Mango Pomelo with Vanilla Ice Cream. This sweet yet mild dessert helps balance out all the heavy flavours from your feast. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilled Mango with Century Egg Glass Roll, Almond Cream Mangosteen, Chilli Crab Tart, Pee Wee Potatoes, Mango Pomelo with Vanilla Ice Cream

    The brainchild of the masters at Black Society Dimsum Kitchen, a Chinese and Western dining concept that features artisanal dim sum. Like Black Society Dimsum Kitchen adopts a flair of sophistication in everything they do. Serving a fresh take on traditional dim sum, we recommend trying their Dim Sum Tasting Platter which gives a refreshing spin on your regular dim sum favourites.The concept of eating with your eyes makes Black Society Dimsum Kitchen stand out, with elegant dishes to impress. Try dim sum that's almost too cute to eat — their Q Bird Shu Mai is shaped like a bird's nest, while their sweet Rose Red Bean Baozi stands out with an Instagram-worthy presentation. For mains, their Chinois Bento features a small selection of dishes that gives you a little bit of everything. From crispy codfish with shredded ginger to spinach pancake, there's bound to be something you find that's worth coming back for.Their signature Fish Maw Cordycep Flower Fish Beancurd Chicken Soup Rice Noodle is a delicious dish filled with nutritional and hearty ingredients to nourish your body, leaving you with comforting goodness.For dessert, end off with an elegant Absolut Sin Parfait with Rainbow Cotton, a colourful and sweet ice cream dessert that will leave you tickled pink. html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Blu Kouzina (Dempsey), a favourite destination for authentic Greek cuisine in Singapore for the past few years, is moving to a new location on Dempsey Hill. The new space brings together elements of Greek mythology and design along with Singapore's Chinese heritage and its colonial past. Stepping through the entrance, graced with two Mycaenian Lions, onto the black-and-white tiled floor and surrounded by the decorative Meander pattern, one isn't only transferred to Greece's rich ancient culture. The patterns also strike a familiar tone with designs seen in ancient China as well as Singapore's black-and-white houses. It's a marriage of culture that will make you feel at home as you settle for a culinary adventure a world away. The combination of past and present continues in the menu, where fresh and quality ingredients are used in dishes both traditional and creatively contemporary. (Apr 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The rib-sticking grilled lamb chop, served with a casserole of grilled, oregano-flecked seasonal vegetables and doused heavily in olive oil, is first rate." -Time Out Singapore "By marrying their passion for the food of their native Greece and the family’s signature olive oil, the proprietors have created a warm environment that will take you on a short journey to Greece." -Appetite Asia "Eggplant cooked Greek style was definitely an exotic taste for us - the dip was slightly creamy and pleasant on the tongue. A personal favourite was the fava yellow lentils with fresh onion, oregano and extra virgin olive oil. The dish was savoury, subtly sweet and dangerously addictive." -So Shiok

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tzatziki, Bifteki Stin Sxara, Baklava

• ABOUT

    Indulge in a truly Greek experience with quality Mediterranean food and fine Greek wines at Blu Kouzina. Recognised as one of the oldest Greek restaurants in Singapore, this outpost in the east was born out of the founders’ love of sharing a hearty meal with friends. The restaurant’s expansive menu also features a host of vegan, gluten and vegetarian options, making it a great option for groups with multiple dietary needs. The Kale Wonderland Salad is a yummy vegetarian option that dresses kale, pomegranate, cucumber, tomato, onions, bell peppers, mint and sunflower seeds in a generous caesar sprinkle. Other delicious vegan salads include the Horta and Fasolosalata. Love meat as much as you enjoy veggies? Fret not, Blu Kouzina has multiple options that will satisfy your carnivorous cravings. The Grilled Meat Board features a premium selection of fillet mignon, sirloin and lamb loin with fresh herbs for the ultimate indulgence. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kale Wonderland Salad, Horta, Grilled Meat Board, Grilled Chicken

  • ABOUT

    Boasting interiors which draw inspiration from Asia’s rich tapestry of cultures, Blue Jasmine is a casual yet chic restaurant that serves up the best of Southern Thai and Esarn cuisine at Holiday Inn Singapore Little India. The restaurant’s rustic red bricks and crisp white tiles form a minimalist backdrop to the Blue Jasmine’s colourful Peranakan Kebaya digital print centerpiece, creating a stylish atmosphere in which diners can enjoy great Thai cuisine.The menu features a wide selection of dishes, all inspired by the traditional flavours of Thailand, as well as its bustling street food culture. The Southern Roasted Chicken is a favourite - chicken is marinated in a cornucopia of aromatic Thai herbs and spices, before being roasted till all the flavours are absorbed. Sink your teeth into a piece of the Southern Roasted Chicken, and you’ll be amazed at how heaven can exist on a plate! As for desserts, the Blue Mango Sticky Rice is a modern twist on a Thai classic. Of course, the stars of the show are ripe and juicy mangoes. Butterfly pea flowers are used to colour the accompanying glutinous rice a bright, vibrant blue. Paired together, the sweetness of the mangoes is perfectly counterbalanced by the sharpness of the blue sticky rice - a timeless combination! What are you waiting for? Awaken your senses with the delectable dishes available at Blue Jasmine!

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Blue Mango Sticky Rice, Phad Kee Mao, Red Ruby, Southern Roasted Chicken, Tom Yum Goong

html:
• ABOUT

    A popular destination for chilli crab lovers, Blue Lotus Chinese Eating House in Quayside Isle, is the perfect escape from the urban jungle that is Singapore's city centre, and a well-loved departure from your usual chilli crab hotspots. Garnering rave reviews for their skillfully prepared dishes, it's pretty clear that this joint is more than just a dining destination with a stunning view. The Blue Lotus Signature Chilli Pomelo Crab - what can be considered their claim to fame - has people flocking from far and wide just for a taste. Simmered with lemongrass and curry leaves, and with just enough chilli to give it a kick - it's one creation we can't get enough of. And don't even get us started on their Wok Fried Kagoshima Wagyu Beef Tenderloin served with peppercorn. Using half-cooked well-marbled beef which is then put into a heated stone bowl to finish cooking, get ready for a piping hot bowl of deliciousness. To end the meal opt for one of their unique dessert choices. The Lemon Gelo served with a lime sorbet, one of our favourites, is a refreshing treat. With an invigorating citrus punch and a sweet jelly base, it's one dessert you'll be craving for days to come! (Mar 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The Blue Lotus Signature Chilli Pomelo Crab has none of the ketchup-laden gravy thickened with egg found in many seafood restaurants. Instead, the sauce is a concoction of chopped herbs and spices such as lemongrass and curry leaves, with just enough chilli to give it fire without scorching the tongue. Meaty pieces of a whole Sri Lankan crab, usually weighing about 1.5kg, are stirred into this delicious mix until just cooked and its sweet flesh infused with its aromatic herbs and spices." -The Straits Times "Another standout dish, the wok-fried Kagoshima wagyu beef tenderloin with peppercorn, onions and chives, arrives perfectly juicy and redolent with smoky, aromatic and peppery flavours. This dish is perfect with rice." -Singapore Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Fried Salmon Skin, Crispy Fried Squid Tentacles, Blue Lotus Signature Chilli Pomelo Crab, Wok Fried Kagoshima Wagyu Beef Tenderloin, Poached Chinese Spinach, Crispy Fried Durian Ice Cream, Lemongrass Gelo

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/blue-lotus-chinese-eating-house
name: Blue Lotus Chinese Eating House

Address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #01-72/73 Changi City Point Singapore (486038)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    BLVD in Changi is the Easternmost offering of the popular Boulevard brand of outlets, which in-the-know revellers recognise for the brand’s style of quirky luxury and personable service. This is the perfect joint for a chic lunch or late-afternoon tipple that accidentally spills into a long dinner. Kick off with small plates like Kampong Fried Chicken Wings, Salted Pepper Squid, Masala Spiced Fried Fish Cutlets, and Butter Chickpeas, which will give you a sense of the sure-handed East-meets-West cuisine on offer here. Mains evolve into comforting plates like DIY pasta plates where you match your favourite pasta to your favourite sauce. Dunk some Fettuccine in their delectable Meatball Pomodoro Sauce or a heady Puttanesca, or have some Pappardelle tossed up in that Roman classic: Cacio E Pepe, a humble but gut-punching mix of fresh cheese and insane amounts of black pepper. Their state of the art Beechwood Stone Hearth turns out perfect pizzas, and the flavours here are bolder than you might get at other pizzaries. Think a no-holds barred Anchovies pizza, strewn with melty buffalo mozzarella and sous-vide eggs, or a salty Pepperoni e Salami, the twin sausages of Italian life paired with capers and piquant tomatoes. For a more carnal approach, order off the grill, with numbers like a juicy New York Strip Steak and a tender Baby Lamb Rack Au Jus sure to sate your carnivorous streak. Craft beers, Japanese whiskies, and punchy cocktails may have to do in place of dessert, because the night is young, and what else are you going to do with that food coma? (Feb 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Butter Glazed Salmon, Sage Brine Iberico Pork, Hand Cut Double Friend Fries, Kampong Fried Chicken Wings, Black Correct Cake, Masala Spiced Fried Fish Cutlet, 3 Chef's Choice Meat, Mushroom Truffle Crema, Classic Hamburger

html:
• ABOUT

    Inspired by Manhattan’s classy uptown vibes, BLVD @ Bayfront brings to diners a differentiated dining experience with premium quality gastronomic offerings and first-class hospitality service. Boasting an unrestricted view of the Marina Bay Waterfront, the restaurant offers an unparalleled wine and dining experience under the stars accompanied by breathtaking panoramic views of Singapore’s iconic central boulevard area. Designed for guests to network, kick back and relax, the classic bar is decked with flamboyant bottles of all assortments. Before getting down to business, order the Chicken Gyoza to fill your stomach. A popular bar bite, the pan-fried dumplings are stuffed with juicy chicken and drizzled with sesame soy vinaigrette. A serving of eight pieces, there’s more than plenty to go around! If you’re still feeling peckish after a hearty round of delicious dumplings, the Seared Sirloin Cubes are a good choice to add to the table. Mains on the menu include stone-fired pizza, mini burgers as well as a plethora of pasta options. With teriyaki sauce, Japanese mayonnaise and slapped between two fluffy brioche buns, the tender, melt in your mouth chicken is the star of the Teriyaki Chicken Buns, a must-order dish. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Gyoza, Seared Sirloin Cubes, Teriyaki Chicken Buns, Mushroom Linguine

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Unwind with an aromatic Cuban grill-out at Bob's Bar and celebrate the end of a long work week with a distinctive experience. Escape to a tropical paradise, leaving the bustle of the city behind and let the tantalising aromas of fresh and zesty herbs captivate your senses as you unwind in the warm glow of sunset at Bob's Bar's elegant alfresco terrace. Enjoy succulent grilled meats marinated in flavoursome spices and pair them with authentic Caribbean sauces and condiments. Then wash it down with handcrafted cocktails like our signature Bob's Fresh Pressed Mojito or the Sentosa Sling, which is our unique twist that pays respect to Singapore's famous sling. (Mar 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Bob's Bar, situated next to the picturesque infinity pool, offers lounge lizards a plush drinking haven." -Luxury Insider

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bob’s Old Fashioned, Hemingway Daiquiri, Navegante Rum

  • ELEVATED CRAFT COCKTAILS AT BOB’S BAR

    Amidst lush tropical forests and pristine coastal landscapes, Bob’s Bar at Capella Singapore offers a revitalisation of craft cocktails, informed by the vibrant colours and nuances of our local culture and heritage. Each with its own distinct story to tell, Bob’s Bar’s refreshed menu of elevated cocktails are handcrafted with a modern approach to flavour combination and sustainability. Florals, fruits and botanicals are the mainstay of this showcase as the flavours profile a seamless blend of spirits and aromatics. Cocktail connoisseurs and curious tipplers alike can look forward to savouring a range of innovative cocktails. Golden Bells, whose namesake derives from the bright yellow trumpet-like flowers found scattered throughout Sentosa Island, is made with Arquitecto tequila, Mancino Bianco Ambrato, Crawley’s pineapple & almond syrup, egg whites and a seasonal citrus topped with mint leaves, promising a hint of bittersweet, zingy finish. An island retreat calls for a relaxing yet zesty beverage such as the Electric Mango, a unique combination of Mackintosh blended scotch, Pierre Ferrand dry curacao and Mathilde Peche liqueur, topped with salted mango cheeks, Crawley’s agave syrup and lemon juice. Just like with food, a little bit of salt can enhance the flavour of a cocktail. The Peacock Punch, a non-dairy milk punch with oodles of comforting spice, maltiness and a smooth aftertaste, is concocted with Rebel Yell Bourbon and Pinot noir mixed with chai tea, oat milk, gula melaka and a dash of lemon. Combined with the rich heritage and old-world charm of the hotel and its location, Bob’s Bar nestles within the heart of Capella Singapore, offering an idyllic respite from the bustle and buzz of the city. Bob’s Bar offers tapas-style bar bites and bespoke cocktails, and is open from 3.00p.m. to 10.00p.m. daily.When: DailyTime: 3-10pm

html:
• ABOUT

    We are a modern Argentinian cocina in Singapore’s Club Street neighborhood serving modern Argentinian dishes, masterful steaks, natural wines, and cocktails in a fun, lively atmosphere. Dining at Bochinche is a journey. From bold flavours to delicious discoveries, savour a world of unique meats, curated from the best in Argentina, Spain, and Japan. At the core of the restaurant, our charcoal griller allows us to showcase traditional Asado techniques. Kissed by fire, and forged by culture-rich recipes, our menu brings forth delicious fare enhanced by cooking with fire. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Asado, Empanadas de Carne, Croquetas, Sea Bass Ceviche, Tomates, Cangrejo, Ojo de Bife, Pulpo, Dulce de Leche

  • THE BUZZ

    "As with the restaurant's trademark execution of deep, bold flavors, the updated menu features only the best ingredients from the world, served up in signature small plates just like before." -Luxury Insider "Keeping elements of traditional Argentinian bistro, the restaurant has an open kitchen bar in the center of the main dining area, merging its own take of the modern with their new classic hot and cold starters and chargrilled Argentine main courses." -SG Now

  • SEAR THE WORLD: JAPAN (20 & 21 APR)

    The smokiest affair in Singapore this April, buckle up as we take off to the first destination in our Sear The World series: the land of the rising sun – Japan. This series will see an ode to rice, where you’ll get to experience the beautiful coalescence of Argentina’s masterful Asado culture with the highly scoured A4 Wagyu fed on rice cultivated on the slopes of Mount Aso in Japan. Sourced from one of the exclusive 12 Wagyu farmers in the Satsuma Valley.Our Executive Head Chef Fabrice crafted a 3-course menu that revolves around grains, so look forward to buttery & tender Satsuma Gyu A4 Sirloin Beef Don served with Argentina’s Bomba rice and paired lusciously with Japanese rice wine – sake. The menu also includes signature Japanese highlights marrying vibrant Argentinian cuisine. When: 20 & 21 April 2022Time: 7pm | 7:45pmPrice: $169.65 per personCancellation Policy: We have a strict no refund policy for cancellations 48 hours prior to event date, and no-shows. Refunds will be made for any cancellations 48 hours before event.

    Simply Bodelicious for the food we serve. A humble Bar and Bistro located in the urban Biopolis science hub of Singapore. Crowd gathers for simple and unpretentious foods with chilling drinks. Bodacious offers a great place with generous seating for patrons to sit back and relax to enjoy varieties of foods from bar snacks to Alfresco Dining. It's definitely a great place for your corporate events, birthday celebrations, or tying knots with your loved ones. (Aug 2021)

  • ABOUT

    A modern and contemporary bistro tucked along Telok Ayer street, Boeuf Singapore is a restaurant that specialises in dishing up delicious beef alongside a selection of fine wines sourced from all over the region. Drop by with your loved ones and pair your favourite cut of beef with an exquisite bottle of red or white for a memorable meal here at Boeuf Singapore. Explore beef in a variety of culinary styles with the restaurant’s team of experienced chefs. With three different signature cuts featuring the bone, short ribs and asada ribeye, meat lovers can look forward to satisfying their carnivorous cravings with these meaty goodness served up with yummy sides such as grilled toast and celeriac puree. Start off your meal with a cured board of pastrami, bresaola wagyu and air-dried olive oil to whet your appetite. For those who like their steaks grilled to perfection, we recommend moving on to the Australian grass fed Prime Angus. End your meal on a sinfully sweet note with the restaurant’s selection of decadent desserts. Chocolate lovers should go for the Tiramisu or Choco de Coco for the ultimate indulgence. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Board, Prime Angus, Choco de Coco, Tiramisu

html:
• ABOUT

    The Boiler brings the concept of the American seafood boil to its second outlet at the Esplanade, complete with all the traditional spices, side dishes and cracking crustaceans and a stroke of culinary genius called the Lobsicle. There's casual, and then there's Boiler-style casual. The kind of casual that lets you get down and dirty, in the tastiest way possible, with your meal. The Boiler features a laidback set up, allowing you to choose your fresh seafood to be boiled to order. You can go a la carte, but the Bombdiggity Bag with Dungeness crab, prawns, mussels, sausages and corns offers tons of bang for your buck. Next, choose a sauce ranging from slightly piquant to can't-feel-your-lips spicy. Your sack of goodies is prepared and then poured directly onto the paper-topped table. Formality is tossed aside along with the shells as you dig in to get to every nook and cranny of the succulent seafood, taking the phrase "finger-licking good" very literally. Bibs and phone covers are included. Located near the tourist attractions like the Singapore Flyer and Merlion, The Boiler is a real find for lunch, when the usual seafood feast is fine-tuned to the mid-day meal. Tidy but still decadent dishes like Signature Fish & Chips, the Ultimate Burger with caramelized onions and Crispy Prawn Pasta Prawn Pasta Soup are great options. Any-time Sides like Salt & Pepper Crispy Chicken, the succulent fried Lobsicle on a stick, Sweet Potato Fries, and Momma's Scoop with an indulgently creamy cheesy dip are all worth the calorie splurge. After all, it's not every day that you get to go elbow deep into amazing Louisiana-style seafood. So head on down and live it up! (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Momma's Scoop, Sweet Potato Fries, Bombdiggity Bag, Signature Lobsicle, Southern Chicks & Waffles, Signature Fish & Chips, Boiler's Ultimate Burger, Prawn Pasta Soup Crispy Prawn Pasta

  • HAPPY HOUR PROMOTION

    Irresistible Happy Hour deals still on! Come on down with your friends for a drink or two! When: Monday to SundayTime: 5:30-8:30pmWhat: Kronenbourg Tower 3L @ $55 (U.P. $75) | Draft Beer from @ $10 (U.P. $16.90) Terms and Conditions: - Not valid with any other ongoing promotions, discounts or vouchers - The Boiler Seafood Bar and Beer management reserves the right to terminate the promotion and change or vary the promotional terms and conditions at any time without prior notice

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2019 - HOTTEST GROUP DINING

    Our diners have voted The Boiler as Hottest Group Dining in Chope Diners’ Choice 2019.

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • FREE LOBSTER BIRTHDAY DEAL

    Happy Boiling Times Continue on Your Birthday! The Boiler will still be giving out Free Lobsters to birthday babies in 2020! Terms and Conditions: - Reservations must be made through The Boiler's website/Facebook - Valid from 1 Jan to 31 December 2020 - The diner whose birthday month falls within the current month must be present. Physical official documentary proof with Photo (NRIC/ Passport/ Driver's license etc) must be shown to enjoy the offer - Limited to 1 redemption per Birthday celebrant and while stocks last - 1 Free Boston Lobster with purchase of a Boiler’s Bombdiggity Bag for the birthday celebrant. Multiple birthday celebrants for the same table can enjoy a Free lobster for each Bombdiggity Bag ordered - Not valid with any other ongoing promotions, discounts or vouchers - Dine in only - Exclusively for members of The Boiler. *Complimentary sign up can be done on the same day. - The Boiler Seafood Bar and Beer management reserve the right to terminate the promotion and change or vary the promotional terms and conditions at any time without prior notice.

html:
• ABOUT

    Situated among the hustle and bustle of the lively crowds in Boat Quay, Bollywood Spice is an exciting restaurant and bar that is perfect for business meetings, casual drinks, private meetings, and more. Grab your friend and head on over to Bollywood Spice for a quick drink after work with the bar’s extensive alcohol options. Enjoy Asian, North Indian, and Middle Eastern cuisines as you bop your head along to Bollywood music beats. Indulge in a basket of Potato Chunks. Steamed and deep fried to perfection, this dish features Russet potato bits rubbed with paprika. Slapped between two fluffy brioche buns, the marinated chicken patty is cooked with Thai herbs and decorated with lettuce and tomato, then finished off with a tasty dressing of onion and spicy mayo to make up the signature Grilled Thai Chicken Burger. Made for sharing, the Pita and Hummus Platter is a classic Middle Eastern delicacy dished up with grilled chicken, wholemeal pita bread, tahini hummus and salad for a hearty meal. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Potato Chunks, Grilled Thai Chicken Burger, Pita and Hummus Platter, Bollywood Triplesome Sliders

html:
• ABOUT

    Modelled after Western casual dining, this family-friendly paradise in Sentosa is the perfect place for a pint after a long day in the sun. This relaxed spot offers an array of hearty European and Mexican classics, as well as unbelievable offers on their booze, which means that diners who enjoy their tipples will love this restaurant. Seafood lovers are sure to enjoy the Pasta All'Astice - a hearty lobster pasta dish made with noodles cooked in seafood stock and topped with tomato and sprinkled with parsley. The seafood stock gives the pasta noodles a flavourful facelift, and the tangy combination of tomatoes and parsley adds vibrance to the dish, giving it a appealing appearance. For something to share instead, opt for the Neapolitan Caprese Pizza - made with tomato and buffalo cheese for a unique flavour that will leave you wanting more. Prefer something a little more fiery? The contemporary Indian menu is sure to deliver. With everything from Butter Chicken Masala to Paneer Saagwala on offer, there’s something for everyone, regardless of dietary requirements. While tucking in to the delicious dishes, be sure to check out the amazing alcohol on offer as well. The beer of choice is San Miguel, but there is also wine, vodka, and rum for seasoned connoisseurs. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pasta All'Astice, Neapolitan Caprese Pizza, Butter Chicken Masala, Paneer Saagwala

html:
• ABOUT

    The brainchild of Chef Paik Jong Won, one of Korea’s most successful and renowned celebrity chefs, BORNGA has anchored itself as a popular household favourite! With an empire of more than 33 branches in Korea and three stellar outlets in Singapore - a meal at this global Korean BBQ chain is sure to be a treat! Focusing on delivering the most authentic Korean cuisine with a wide selection of quality dishes and generous portions at affordable prices, expect some spectacular eats. They’ve got all the BORNGA signatures like Haemul Pa Jeon and Woo Samgyup, a secret (and patented) recipe created by Chef Paik that takes thinly sliced beef and drenches each piece in their signature BORNGA dressing aka Woo Samgyup Sauce. Imported from Korea, trust us when we say you won’t find any other place in Singapore who can replicate the magic that comes out of BORNGA! (Dec 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The décor is sleek, with clean lines and simple furniture. So simple, in fact, that you don’t even have to lift a finger in barbecuing your dinner - a nifty server is assigned to your table to cut, grill and serve your meats.” -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Woo Samgyup, Budae Jjigae, Haemul Pa Jeon, Jap Chae, Mansinchang Samygyeopsal in Spicy Sauce, Nokdu Samgyetang

html:
• ABOUT

    Pamper your taste buds at Boss Bistro & Bar with good food and great drinks. Serving diners a wide range of Western bistro food at affordable prices, Boss Bistro & Bar has a huge menu of a variety of draught beers on offer to complete your night. Start off with a bowl of Hearty Greens. Nutritious and delicious, this bowl features a healthy mix of grilled chicken ,greens, tomatoes, walnut and almond flakes topped off with a light balsamic dressing. A vegetarian version of this dish is also available on the comprehensive menu. Follow up with the bistro’s Signature Roasted Pork Belly. Served with mesclun salad and french mustard, this mouthwatering dish is a hearty serving of succulent roasted pork belly that will surely satisfy all your carnivorous cravings. Seafood lovers can indulge in the delectable Seafood Pot or a platter of crispy Calamari Rings, served with home-made tartar sauce. Alternatively, the Seafood Pomodoro is a tantalising combination of prawns, squid, mussels, and clams drizzled in home-made pomodoro sauce before being speckled with Italian herbs and parmesan cheese for extra flavour. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hearty Greens, Seafood Pot, Signature Roasted Pork Belly, Seafood Pomodoro

html:
• ABOUT

    A traditional Japanese restaurant that specialises in sushi, sashimi and omakase, Botan Japanese Restaurant is helmed by well-known chef Thomas Kok. Executing every dish with creativity and passion, chef Thomas believes in using only premium ingredients for an authentic taste of Japan.Great for intimate dinners or casual dates, the Signature Set serves two with a variety of dishes that make up the appetisers and mains. Kickstart your meal with a bowl of Signature Pitan Tofu. An interesting take on tofu, the cold tofu was garnished with fish role, spring onion and bits of finely chopped century egg. Drenched in a fragrant mixture of sesame and century egg sauce, this dish is a delightful start to the omakase meal.Another tasty dish on the set is the Ikura Onsen. An egg-on-egg concept that is beautifully executed, the ikura complements the mellow onsen egg, leaving a mildly sweet aftertaste. The melt-in-your-mouth assorted sashimi is definitely the highlight of the set. Refresh your palate at the end of a heavy meal with a scoop of Hokkaido Ice Cream before leaving happy and satisfied. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Pitan Tofu, Ikura Onsen, Assorted Sashimi, A5 Miyazaki Wagyu Beef

  • ABOUT

    Nestled within the Botanic Gardens, Singapore’s first UNESCO Heritage site, Botanico has enchanted diners with its beautiful 1920s Art Deco conserved architecture with its lush indoor hall and air-cooled outdoor garden terrace bar, surrounded throughout by greenery. Botanico’s cuisine is rooted in contemporary European methodology and integrated with Asian inflections, where dishes are served bistro-style, with influence from herbs and spices from our vantage point in Southeast Asia, some of which are grown in the Botanic Gardens. Look beyond the familiar fare and you’ll discover an intersection of culinary craft and respect for cultural ingredients, such as “Assam Laksa” Ceviche where a green chilli-pomegranate cold seabass ceviche meets the spicy tanginess of assam laksa, cooled with savoury shrimp paste ice cream and scented with ginger flower. Soak in the garden zen with a swirl, hand-picked from a medley of premium and adventurous wine selection, or sit back with botany-inspired tipples such as the Garage Gin’onic or Thyme Lemonade. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    "Assam Laksa" Ceviche, Seasonal Oysters, “Taco”, Asparagus Tempura, "Assam Pedas" Snapper, 65° Kurobuta Pork Belly, Lemongrass Panna Cotta, Ondeh Ondeh

  • ASIA’S BEST 50 2021 – ESSENCE OF ASIA

html:
• ABOUT

    Straight from the backstreets of Tokyo, Box n Sticks is a hidden home-style Japanese izakaya which is located just a few streets away from well-known Haji Lane and offers value-for-money lunch sets by day and a relaxed izakaya by night. In the afternoon, it draws in the lunch crowd with its value-for-money lunch sets and small plates. The Bara Chirashi Don — an assortment of fresh sashimi chunks, tamago, and tobiko on sushi rice — is a crowd favourite. For something unique, go for the fusion Asari Aglio Olio that comes with a generous serving of clams. Even the Salmon Mentaiko Don gets a twist with the addition of crispy tempura crumbs. Each main course also comes with one or two complimentary sides and a drink so you definitely won't leave hungry. As the sun sets, the menu expands to include maki rolls, kushiyaki (grilled skewers), yaki mono (grilled meats), and more. The kushiyaki is a must-try. Choose from a wide array of meats and vegetables such as the Gyu Niku with Pineapple, Ebi Butter, Bacon Mochi, and Sweet Corn Teriyaki. No trip to an izakaya is complete without tipples to pair with the food, and Box n Sticks certainly doesn't disappoint with its selection of draft beers and sakes. With the food and drinks nailed, all you need are your buddies for a great night out. Box n Sticks is highly recommended and heavily featured in media as one of the best Japanese dining place to visit for good value and quality food. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bara Chirashi Don, Asari Aglio Olio, Salmon Mentaiko Don, Kushiyaki

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways instead. Takeaway Operating Hours: Mon-Sun: 12-9:30pm Promotion: 30% off entire menu for takeaway Menu: Takeaway Menu

    BQ Bar is a laid-back, welcoming venue with a lounge-style atmosphere. We’re a riverfront bar in the centre of the city offering an energetic, upbeat ambience and your choice of comfortable interior or relaxed al fresco seating. At BQ Bar, the experienced team takes pride in recognising faces, anticipating the needs of guests and making them feel at home. Enjoy the best of sport while taking advantage of our daily Happy Hour (11am - 8pm!) or sharing a naan pizza or party platter from Dharma’s Kebabs. Over the years, we’ve become a staple destination in Boat Quay that offers quality service, relaxed surroundings, and plenty of reasons to drink and unwind. (Jun 2021)

(Apr 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Inspired by heritage and tradition, borne of luxury and refinement, Brasserie Les Saveurs at The St. Regis Singapore provides a refuge of timeless elegance and discerning taste, dedicated to the art of culinary excellence and classic epicurean experiences. Delight in modern interpretations of classic French cuisine and enjoy a showcase of entrees which include Pâté en croûte, a pastry-enveloped terrine comprising pork and foie gras pate flavoured with pistachios, herbs and onion compote, served chilled to reveal its fullest flavours. For an alternate taste, the Escargots de Bourgogne is a choicest option, with its nutrient-rich snails poached in a court bouillon then baked in “beurre d’escargots”, allowing the buttery sauce to melt completely into the meat.   Other epicurean moments features exceptional signatures such as Legine Australe of Patagonian Toothfish with Bell Pepper Piperade, Chorizo and Rocket Pesto, and a convivial platter of Cote de Boeuf, a wonderful 1kg of robustly flavoured beef prime rib paired with roasted potatoes, mixed vegetables, mushrooms and bearnaise sauce. From gastronomic signature experiences, vibrant afternoon tea, to indulgent Sunday Champagne brunch, Brasserie Les Saveurs brings destination dining to a new level, with masterful, personalised service. (Feb 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The restaurant in the lobby of The St. Regis doesn’t disappoint in terms of the ambience—high ceilings, ornate furnishings and a great garden view.” -Singapore Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Foie Gras Terrine, Salade de Crabe Royal, Thon Rouge a la Plancha, Bisque de Homard, Porc Iberic, Loup de Mer, Selle d’Agenau, Tarte au Chocolat, Fraisier

  • ST. REGIS SUNDAY CHAMPAGNE BRUNCH

    Sundays at Brasserie Les Saveurs are a gourmet haven for the most discerning of palates. Featuring a tailored menu refreshed periodically, the afternoon gourmet indulgence showcases an impressive line-up of meats and seafood aplenty, headlined by exceptional Chef’s Signatures. Further elevate brunch affair with a bottomless flow of your choice Champagne from the Champagne Barons de Rothschild series. When: Sunday Time: 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm Price: • Champagne | From $198.00++ per person • Wine | $168.00++ per person • Non-alcoholic | $138.00++ per person • For the little ones | $75.00++ per child (4 - 12 years old)Click here to view the menu!

  • ABOUT

    Head down to this cosy neighbourhood bistro and crack open a cold one with friends while indulging in a range of savoury snacks. Kickstart your meal with a Cheese Platter to share a delicious assortment of French and Italian cheese accompanied by seedless grapes, figs, dried fruits and nuts with family and friends. Meat lovers can opt for the Grazing Board. Filled with parma ham with rockmelon, buffalo mozzarella, tomato and fresh basil, smoked salmon with dill, duck rillette with grilled baguette, there’s something for everyone on this scrumptious platter! Move on to select your favourite alcoholic drink and pair with the plethora of tasty bar snacks options for an unforgettable night out. A classic Singaporean favourite, the Mantou Slider features juicy sea shrimps and fiery chunks of Singapore chili crab sandwiched between fried golden buns. For those looking for a zesty wasabi kick, the Wasabi Crab is a yummy crab dip with golden dumpling skin peppered with smoked paprika power. Other flavourful bites include the Prawn Paste Chicken, Oyster Popper and Baked Chicken Ball. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cheese Platter, Mantou Slider, Prawn Paste Chicken, Oyster Popper

html:
• ABOUT

    Finish your evenings with a delicious dinner and a bucket of ice cold beer when you drop by Bread, Beer & Brez'n. Available all day long, the down to earth sanctuary serves up a wide range of tasty German delicacies alongside an impressive collection of beer garden classics at wallet friendly prices. A full meal here comprises one main dish accompanied with two sides. Marinated with herbs and spices, the White Wine Garlic Roasted Half Chicken is a fragrant dish that packs a punch of flavours. Sink your teeth into the juicy meat to taste the tantalising explosion of a harmonious combination of spices and herbs. Recommended side dishes include the Roasted Vegetables and Potato Salad. For those dining in groups, the Funghi Pizza is a great go-to option that is drizzled with an extra dash of truffle oil. Vegetarians will be delighted to know that there are also vegan dishes here at Bread, Beer & Brez'n. Served with a huge portion of salted fries, the Vegan Burger is a mouthwatering dish that even non-vegetarians will love. End your meal on a sweet note with the plethora of cake options on offer. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    White Wine Garlic Roasted Half Chicken, Funghi Pizza, Vegan Burger, Schöfferhofe

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Since its inception in 2006, Brotzeit has emerged as a culinary force to be reckoned with. Loved for spinning up authentic German meals and ice-cold beers, Brotzeit can often be seem packed with the food-loving, beer-guzzling crowd at all hours of the day. There’s nothing more German than huge swirling hunks of sausage. So there’s little surprise to see Brotzeit featuring a wide array of such sausages, the showstopper being the Thuringer Pork Sausage, which comes with a generous heaping of mashed potatoes, sauerkraut, and sweet onion sauce. But the Sausage Platter, another fan fave, serves all the top hits from the kitchen, from grilled pork, spicy chicken, to the garlic pork sausages. Want something other than sausages? Then have your pick of hearty dishes that include the traditional Goulash Soup, so authentic any German grandmother would approve of it. Featuring generous chunks of tender beef in a herb-tinged soup, this soup is perfect on a rainy night. And the Crispy Oven Roasted Pork Knuckle is another must-try. A Brotzeit staple, this pork shank is oven-roasted until it achieves its fork-tender perfection with a crispy layer of crackling skin to boot. And wash your meal down with a beer or two, and you have all the ingredients for what is just about to be your next perfect meal. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Oven Roasted Pork Knuckle, Sausage Platter, Signature Brotzeit Platter, Wiener Schnitzel

  • ABOUT

    Originating from “the land down under”, Brunetti in Kallang is a bustling gelateria, cioccolateria, and pasticceria offering a little something for everyone. From cakes and pastries to breakfast and savouries, even the most finickiest of eaters will find something to indulge on at this popular Tanglin hotspot. Not sure what to try first? Check out their breakfast offering of Home-made Muesli. Served from 9am and onwards, this healthy and flavourful treat with Greek yogurt, home-made preserve, fresh berries, and milk will have you feeling energized the entire day. Offering heartier options as well, the Brunetti team also dishes out some killer Eggs On Toast, Grilled Herbed Salmon, decadent cannolis, a mouthwatering Pear & Crumble Cheesecake, and tons more! (May 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “A Melbourne import that’s known as much for their coffee as they are for their repertoire of pastries, this 140-seater channels an Italian vibe with their signature biscotti and cannoli, as well as tarts, macarons and even gelato.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

• ABOUT

    Inspired by chef and restaurateur Olivier Bendel’s experience in being the first to expand and popularise Belgium’s signature ‘mussels and fries’ restaurant concept throughout France, this elegant bistro aims to do the same on our sunny shores. In addition to Mussels and Fries, it serves a wide selection of comfort food from the Benelux region of Europe. Needless to say, the Moules-frites is a must-try here. Plump, juicy gems of the sea are cooked in a sauce of your choice, alongside a generous portion of golden fries. Bring along your appetite so you can indulge in the hearty servings that come in 500g, 750g, or 1kg portions. Another favourite is the Tarte Flambée, an oven-baked flatbread from Alsace. BTM does it three ways: Smoked Bacon and Caramelised Onion, Escargot and Parsley Butter, and Porcini and Comté. End your meal on a sweet note with a selection of traditional French desserts, including Grand Marnier Soufflé and Tarte au Citron. For a little extra indulgence, pair your dishes with a glass of wine or cocktail. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mussels and Fries, Fresh Oysters, Smoked Bacon and Caramelised Onion Tarte Flambée, Grand Marnier Soufflé

    Gather your friends and enjoy our Happy Hour specials with 1-for-1 housepour wine (red and white), housepour spirits (gin, vodka, rum and whisky) AND Stella Artois beer!When: Thu-SunTime: 2-5pm

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Indulge in a sumptuous spread of fresh seafood-on-ice such as poached prawns, mussels, and clams, Western delights and Asian favourites. Take a trip down memory lane at our nostalgic heritage corner, and feast on quintessentially Singaporean dishes such as laksa, soto ayam, and more! Prepare to save some rooms for our dazzling dessert selections such as the signature durian pengat, Nyonya kueh, and other sweet delights! Dinners are a piping hot steamboat affair at The Buffet! Sweeten the MSG-free broths with an impressive selection of fresh seafood such as flower crabs, mussels, clams, and premium steamboat staples such as fresh vegetables, meat and yong tau fu. Don’t miss out on our ‘live’ cooking station dishing out the signature herbal drunken prawn a la minute; it does not get any fresher than this! With the signature durian pengat and wide array of decadent cakes, dainty sweet treats at the dessert station, you can satisfy your sweet tooth here too! (Jul 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The Buffet Dinner is a steamboat buffet served during dinner daily with a wide range of seafood like drunken prawns, oysters and yong tau foo among other perennial favourites." -Asia One "The Asian Buffet Lunch selection offers a slew of hot oriental fare including black pepper crab, soups, a carving station, a selection of sushi, and a sugar rush of a dessert section with evergreen favorites such as Nonya kuehs and durian pengat." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Herbal Drunken Prawns, Monthly Specialty MSG-free Soup Base, Flower Crab, Durian Pengat

html:
• ABOUT

    Mention to Singapore foodie friends that you have found a tiny down-to-earth place where, for the past 16 years, the owners themselves have put their own Asian twist on mind-blowingly amazing Italian food, and it’s likely that the name Buko Nero will pop up. One-of-a-kind in terms of its compact dynamism, Buko Nero prides itself on serving food that they themselves would want to eat, if they were the customer. The wife, Tracy, who is Singaporean, handles the front of the restaurant, while the husband, Oscar, an Italian, is the chef. Together, they have created something that is semi-legendary in the Singapore dining scene because of the quality of food and the waiting list for this restaurant. Top of the list of recommendations for this unique establishment is the Buko Nero Tau Kwa Tower with sauteed vegetables and Asian dressing, which was created as a stacked dish consisting of vegetables such as parsley, carrots, and enoki mushrooms layered atop a big piece of tau kwa (firm tofu). Kecap manis (Indonesian sweet soya sauce) is drizzled over it, giving the entire concoction an extra oomph. Deceptively simple, this dish has won fans because of its unique flavour combination and freshness of vegetables used. The Baked Fillet of Cod, which is presented with a crust made of olives and a sweet bell pepper coulis, has also won praise for its simple yet effective use of basic ingredients. For cosy Italian fare in the heart of Singapore, it is hard to find a more intimate, homely dining experience than this well-loved restaurant that serves food straight from the heart. (Aug 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “...the biggest draw has always been husband-and-wife team Oscar and Tracy Pasinato, who run the tiny dining room like a trattoria: the Asian-inflected Italian menu changes regularly.” -Time Out Singapore “The Venetian chef Oscar Pasinato prepares only 26 dinners nightly (Tuesday through Saturday) at his unpretentious Buko Nero, 126 Tanjong Pagar Road, (65) 6324-6225. Devoted fans book weeks ahead to enjoy his nuanced amalgams of Italian and Asian cuisine in the small, sparsely decorated white space.” -The New York Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Buko Nero Tau Kwa Tower with Sauteed Vegetables and Asian dressing, Artisanal Rigatoni Pasta with Sausages and Fennel Seeds Ragu, Creamy Porcini Mushroom Soup with White Truffle Oil Drops, Baked Fillet of Cod with Olives Crust in a Sweet Bell Pepper Coulis, Dark Chocolate Tart with Homemade Peanut Butter Gelato

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    NA

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    Helmed by chef de cuisine, Denis Lucchi, Buona Terra on Scotts Road is a stunning example of immaculately interpreted classic Italian fare in the heart of the city. Sourcing only the freshest ingredients, diners can expect to be delighted by the gastronomic journey that is guaranteed to unfold From the Seppia, a salad with cuttlefish prepared using the sous-vide method, to the mouth-watering Filetto di Manzo made from high-quality Cape Grim beef tenderloin - the artfully crafted dishes presented are creative expressions of Northern Italian cuisine at it’s finest. Even the simply dressed Rombo is worth raving about. Using fresh line caught wild Turbot, filling it with Sicilian Red Prawn, and topping it off with black rice crust - it’s got immense flavour without being overdone. And as always, no Italian dining experience is complete without a plate of pasta so be sure to save room for their Tagliolini ai Pioppini. Made of homemade truffle tagliolini and baby oyster mushrooms - it’s one delectable dish you won’t want to miss out on! (May 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Helmed by chef Denis Lucchi, a Lombardy native and Garibaldi Group alum, everything is top notch, from the whisper-level, formal service - the dining room is handily managed by expert sommelier Gabriele Rizzardi, who also provides recommendations from his wine cellar brimming with exclusive Italian labels - to the plates of beautifully-constructed food." -Time Out Singapore

  • MICHELIN GUIDE SINGAPORE 2019

    Buona Terra has been awarded 1 Michelin Star.

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/buona-terra
name: Buona Terra

  • ABOUT

    burger bar new york is a place that feels just like home. We fly in our very own USDA beef, butchered in-house every single day to bring you the freshest burgers and pastrami sandwiches you will find here in Singapore. Whether you are looking for incredible burgers, authentic pastrami, an all-day breakfast, vegetarian burger options, unique craft beers, personally selected and flown in ourselves..whilst listening to the best music from the 70's and 80's music with family and friends...this is the place for you!Breakfast favourites at the Burger Bar are The Stack - which features generously stacked pastrami, hashbrown and 2 fried eggs. Another popular option is the BB Brekkie Burger which includes beef patty, bacon and fried eggs for a hearty meal.You get to choose between full or half meat portions for their pastramis. The Rachel is a crowd favourite. It comes with spicy coleslaw to cut the salty flavours of the meat and topped with swiss cheese, you can not get enough of it. For a beefier option, go for their Crown Royale that’s guaranteed fit for a king. With 3 beef patties, pastrami and cheese, this whopping sandwich is best shared, or feast your heart out with this hefty burger.On the menu is a varied selection of burgers for meat lovers, such as Bacon Hamburger, Cheeseburger, and Jalapeno Bacon Cheeseburger. For vegetarians, there are Portobello Burger and Fried Camembert Burger to fulfill your burger cravings. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Stack, BB Brekkie Burger, The Rachel, The Crown Royale, Jalapeno Bacon Cheeseburger, Portobello Burger

• ABOUT

    Restaurant critics generally give new restaurants 3 to 4 months to "hit their stride". Well at Burlamacco Ristorante, there's none of that. Opened in November 2012, this new Italian favourite has been making waves from day one, and already has a legion of fans, an endless list of favourable reviews, and quite frankly, an entire menu of delectable Italian delights. Chef Gabriele Piegaia is an old hand at the Singapore restaurant scene, honing his skills in Michelin-starred kitchens across Italy, then learning the nuances of the Singaporean palate at Senso, Hotel Michael, and most recently, as the executive chef of Alkaff Mansion. Adhering to the golden rule of "what you see on the menu is what you see on the plate", the signature dishes are authentic, direct, and robust. Ingredients are allowed to shine, and there has been no compromise on quality and execution. (Apr 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The food is not to be taken lightly – Piegaia showcases his Tuscan heritage to the fullest with Southern Italian dishes like the traditional Tuscan fish and seafood soup ($36), with a bouillabaisse-like broth, the linguine with lobster in spicy arrabbiata sauce ($26) and slow-cooked fremantle octopus with fava beans ($22), as well as the highly recommended slow-cooked beef short ribs ($30)." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fritto Misto, Battuta, Involtino, Fegato, Linguine, Capellini, Pappardelle, Tonnarelli, Cacciucco, Manzo, Tagliata, Agnello, Tiramisù, Pannacotta, Tortino, Fondente

html:
• ABOUT

    An Italian restaurant nestled at the ground floor of 217 East Coast Road in Singapore, Burlamacco Ristorante presents an authentic dining experience with traditional Tuscan cuisine. Served with a delightfully modern twist, the wide variety of mouthwatering dishes and excellent wines are carefully crafted to give your palate a sure treat. From early morning to mid afternoon, stop by Burlamacco Ristorante to enjoy a plate of Eggs Royale. Sitting on a platter of smoked salmon, two perfectly poached eggs are accompanied with a pesto hollandaise sauce on a fluffy piece of sourdough. Pair this hearty platter with a Yoghurt for a filling meal. Served with freshly diced fruits, granola, fruit preserves and a spoonful of acacia honey, the artisan greek yoghurt is as delicious as it is nutritious. Main dishes here include the Tagliata and Pesce Burro. For those looking to satisfy their pasta cravings, a wide selection of different pastas awaits. Prepared with different traditional Italian cooking methods, each pasta will certainly bring you on a gastronomic journey for an authentic taste of Italy. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggs Royale, Tagliata, Pesce Burro

    Gustavo Lapasta and Burrata Joy by Garibaldi are the combinations of two concepts, coming together and providing a place for families, friends, and couples to meet and enjoy their time together whilst surrounded by good food. Gustavo, in Italian, actually means “what I used to appreciate”. This allows us to focus on getting people to savour and indulge in the cuisine we appreciate and delight back home with our family and friends. Furthermore, Burrata Joy highlights the connection between appreciating traditional, authentic ingredients in the presence of others. With an explosion of flavour oozing from the Burrata cheese and an outburst of pleasure from the people around us – we aim to create joy. (Jan 2022)
