html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Known for a contemporary take on the bar & grill concept with an Asian twist, Butcher Boy redefines comfort food and classic cocktails for the inspired diner. Its newly revamped food and libations menu promises to tantalise with fresh, novel creations that spotlight local produce as well as ingredients that are sustainably sourced.Boasting exciting flavour combinations, the revamped menu follows the prevailing format of Small Plates and Snacks, Baos, Buns, Dumplings, hearty meats and decadent desserts, designed to be shared in a communal dining style. Kick off with a series of new small plates - Nori Pie Tee, where dressed tuna tartare with chives are served in crispy seaweed pie tee shells, and garnished with marinated ikura and wasabi cream cheese mayo, presenting an elevated and creative twist on the popular Peranakan appetiser. Inject a jolt of vibrancy to your meal and opt for the Scallop Ceviche, featuring anumami-laden Vietnamese dressing of lime juice, fish sauce, red chilli and freshly chopped shallots and finished with a creamy wasabi avocado puree.When at Butcher Boy, one should never skip the meats. One of the latest creations, the Josper-grilled Lamb Rack, is served Tandoori style with a marinated red curry and boasts a flame-kissed crust, while the classic signature Pastrami Beef Short Ribs is slow-cooked at 58°C for 48 hours to achieve optimal tenderness. Ensuring that the team keeps up with the evolution of the guests’ preferences of having less meat, vegetarian options such as Grilled Padron Peppers with smoked burrata and garlic sesame crumbs have been added to the menu while the Karana Jackfruit and Mushroom Pot Stickers, made from plant-based product, Karana, has long been a crowd favourite. Another perennial mainstay on the menu, the Warm Chilli Crab with Mantou Buns is sure to delight purists with the generous serving of sweet crab meat drenched with an authentic, signature chilli crab sauce with a side of homemade mantou buns fried to perfection. Wind up the meal with some sweets — both recent additions, the creative and delicious Pandan Ice-cream Sandwich, features coconut ice cream sandwiched between puff pastry, pandan kaya and sprinkles of yuzu gel; and an intriguing Charcoal Pavlova teeming with fresh fromage blanc, lime sorbet and finished with lime zest and dried raspberries. Butcher Boy’s popular Sunday Roast continues to be available every Sunday from 12.00pm – 4.00pm. Be prepared to be spoilt with a selection of Chicken, Beef, Pork & Lamb Roasts, served with a platter of trimmings, Yorkshire Pudding, Carrot Miso Mash and the signature Szechuan Brussel Sprouts. Other than drinks specials, Sunday Roast promises good tunes, good company and seriously good grub.The establishment’s new cocktail offerings feature redefined classic libations with a touch of the tongue-in-cheek. Freshen things up with Haw Yeah! ($22++), an elevated take on the Ramos Gin Fizz with basil-infused gin laced with tropical elements of mango and cucumber. The Butterfly Effect abides by the Asian-inspired theme with a combination of butterfly pea flowers infused with vodka, in-house berry blend and ginger syrup. Those looking for a post-dinner option will enjoy Lucky No.7, made with a blend of Brandy, Kahlua & chocolate liqueur. House favourites retained on the menu include Cymbo, a fiery twist on the classic Margarita with the use of jalapeno-infused tequila and a slight hint of agave; as well as the spirit forward Negroni-inspired No.47; and Holy Smokes, a modern twist on the classic Old Fashioned with coffee infused blended malt whisky which is smoked to perfection with apple wood chips. Alongside the list of cocktails, the beverage menu also offers a selection of wines, sakes and beers as well as mocktails. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Nori Pie Tee, Lamb Rack, Pastrami Beef Short Ribs,Karana Jackfruit and Mushroom Pot Stickers, Warm Chilli Crab with Mantou Bun

  • THE BUTCHER'S BRUNCH, A SUNDAY ROAST

    Craving a hearty Sunday Roast? Look no further. Brined for six hours, our free-range, organic roast chicken comes with a chestnut herb brioche stuffing, keeping the whole chook moist and juicy. Be prepared to be spoilt with a selection of Chicken, Beef, Pork & Lamb Roasts. Served with a platter of trimmings; Yorkshire Pudding, Carrot Miso Mash and our signature Szechuan Brussel Sprouts, you're better off coming in stretchy pants. There will be plenty of drink specials to keep your day going. Expect good tunes, good company & seriously good grub. Our Sunday Brunch Menu runs every Sunday from 12pm till 4pm, our regular dinner menu following. When: Every Sunday Time: 12-4pm

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be opened for takeaways instead.

  • href

    Helmed by new Chef de Cuisine, Jordan Keao, the vibrant Butcher's Block offers an avant-garde wood-fire dining experience, expressing the elemental affinity and finesse of cooking with wood-fire. The new menu draws on Chef Jordan's Hawaiian heritage and deep passion for wood-fire cooking, featuring the finest selections of meats, seafood and vegetables from around the world, elevated to perfection with exceptional wood-fire cooking. In the stylishly adorned restaurant, take in the sight of specially curated produce proudly showcased in The Vault before watching our chefs transform these ingredients on custom-built ovens and grills in an Open Kitchen setting. In the skilful hands of the chefs, each dish is ingeniously transformed by wood-fire through embracing the variety of nuances that fire offers, adding exceptional dimensions of appeal and thoroughly enticing the senses. Complement the dining experience with over 200 premium labels of wines, including a meticulous selection of natural wines, from The Library. (Sep 2021)

  • WEEKEND BRUNCH OFFER

    Enjoy our weekend brunch specialties like Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict, French Toast with Salted Caramel, Croque Madame with 18-month Joselito Iberico, and fresh l’Antilope Normandy Oysters in addition to the regular a la carte menu. Elevate brunch with Sommelier’s Selection, a 90-minute complementary flow vinous experience of specially handpicked wines for your weekend midday indulgence.When: Sat-SunTime: Brunch, 11:30am-2:30pmClick here to view the menu! We thank you in advance for your understanding and patience.

    The Butcher's Wife is that rare thing: a cozy backstreet bistro where vibrant colours are matched by dynamic flavours in dishes that enchant the palate while challenging preconceptions. Come and discover the joy of natural wines, the cleansing power of fermented ingredients and the exceptional talent of a chef committed to pushing the boundaries of balanced, gut-friendly, 100% gluten free cuisine. (Jan 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "If you're living the gluten-free lifestyle in Singapore, you're no doubt thrilled that the scene is picking up the momentum. The latest restaurant where you can actually indulge? The Butcher's Wife, which is all about delicious European comfort food in a lovely setting." -Honeycombers "The Butcher's Wife offers an eclectic menu that tries to defy what gluten-free cuisine can be. The place is a godsend for the gluten intolerant. Everything on the menu is free of gluten, even the pastas, breads, desserts and beer." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in The Flow mall along East Coast Road, Butter & Spice dishes out authentic North-Indian fare at wallet-friendly prices. From the glowing belly of the tandoori comes a delicious spiced grilled chicken, enjoyed in half or full portions if you’re hungry. Make sure to share the Fish Tikka, a sumptuous treat of charred fish cubes that have been marinated in tandoori spices for that hint of heat. Love seafood? The Prawn Chatpata is a popular favourite, with juicy prawns cooked with black pepper, onions, and green chilli, and a dash of lime juice for that refreshing citrusy kick. Sop up the rich gravy with a selection of tandoori-grilled naan, available in classic flavours like cheese, garlic, and butter. Try the Kashmiri Naan if you have an adventurous palate — the flatbread with dry fruits is a sweet savoury treat that goes well with the thick curries here. Butter & Spice is also one of the few Northern-Indian restaurants to serve set menus. Each set meal comes with a side of basmati rice and naan, perfect for the days when you’re looking for a quick fix. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tandoori Chicken, Fish Tikka, Prawn Chatpata, Kabuli Channa Masala, Kashmiri Naan, Kadai Paneer

html:
• ABOUT

    Busy Bussorah Street plays host to a bunch of Middle Eastern restaurants, and Byblos Grill is one of the true hidden gems amongst them. Helmed by Chef Mohamad Salim, who brings true craft and authenticity to his Lebanese cuisine, made with imported Lebanese ingredients and spices, and served up in a truly homey style. In the tradition of a true mezza, begin with a sharing platter of some of the most beautiful hummus in town: topped with a party of pine nuts, herbs, minced lamb, and olive oil, this creamy hummus, eaten with crisp pita, is heaven on earth. Alongside that, a mezze platter of Babaganoush, Labneh, Moussaka, and Arabic Salad, gives you extra pita-dipping options, and all this before the main course of grilled meats. From fragrant, smoky Lamb Kofta to tender Shish Taouk (chicken breast in a zesty marinade), nothing speaks of the Middle East quite like its stunning array of grilled, marinated meats. But it’s the charcoal-grilled Lamb Chops, paired with spicy harissa, grilled vegetables, and rice that makes for a truly climactic moment: the smoky, meaty flavours are brought out perfectly by the zingy harissa, and the meat comes off the bone in chewy, tender bites. A vibrant meal in one of the most vibrant parts of Singapore, Middle Eastern fare is making a comeback: come see why! (Jun 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “This hidden gem in Bussorah Street serves authentic Lebanese food” –Vanilla Luxury

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hummus, Mezze Platter, Lamb Kofta, Chicken Kofta, Shish Taouk, Falafel Wrap, Lamb Chops

html:
• ABOUT

    béni, a French term which translates to "blessing", offers one of the most exclusive epicurean experiences available in Singapore, showcasing fine authentic French cuisine with a Japanese touch. Helmed by Executive Chef Kenji Yamanaka, who has built up a formidable gamut of experience with a portfolio that includes stints at three-star Michelin restaurants Georges Blanc in Vonnas, France, and L’Osier in Ginza, Tokyo, this charming eatery has earned several accolades including the prestigious 1-Michelin Star. Chef Kenji's thoughtfully crafted discovery menus feature fresh produce, with meats and fish sourced and flown in from artisanal producers in Japan, and seasonal fresh vegetables from France. Highlights include Kenji's signature Amadai dish. The Amadai fish from Kyoto Prefecture is cooked in the traditional "Matsukasayaki" style where the scales are left on the fish and fried to a crisp resembling pine cones. This gives the fish a very unique combination of crispy and tender textures. While the cooking method remains the same, Chef Kenji comes up with new flavours to pair the Amadai with, based on the season, a reflection of his dedication to the craft. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For me, the new Beni is an improvement in many ways. I shall be very surprised, therefore, if it does not retain its star. Or even gain a second one." -The Straits Time "The service is assured yet warm, confident yet convivial and creates a dining experience that's relaxed and enjoyable as a fine dining meal should be." -Asia Tatler Dining

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    King of Green Hiro Gyokuro, Foie Gras, Yonezawa Beef, Kobe A5 Wagyu, Charentais Melon, French Rhubarb Clafoutis

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Fusion Japanese and Sake galore is what Boruto delivers. Located a stone’s throw away from the CBD and styled as a modern day Izakaya, the double-storey, industrial chic establishment is helmed by Chef Patrick Tan, owner of Japanese robatayaki restaurant Tamashii Robataya. The first floor of Boruto offer foodies a casual dining experience by dispensing out a plethora of shareable dishes from their Italian-Japanese menu like Hotate & Kanpachi Carpaccio, thinly sliced Hokkaido Scallops & Amberjack, and Risotto Croquettes, delicious stuffed potato croquettes with Tomato Risotto. Translating into “Vault” in Japanese, the name Boruto is a nod to the bank that operated in the same premises and the original bank vault, still functional, sits on the second floor and now securely showcasing the most premium bottles of Sake available. Here, Sake Connoisseurs can enjoy the novelty of walking into the Vault, selecting from a range of up to 30 of the most high-end Sakes available and enjoy a more exclusive experience! (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Tamashii Robataya have just opened Boruto across the street - a chic but unassuming sake/tapas bar with a welcoming vibe and a food menu that shows more thought than just how many things one can deep fry and over-salt to make people drink more.” -The Business Times "Dimly-lit and furnished with huge sake barrels from floor to ceiling, Boruto reminded us of Tokyo’s upper-class tachinomi (standing) bars, except there are seats here, of course. Founded by Patrick Tan, owner of one of the best robatayaki restaurants in Singapore, Tamashii Robataya, this new sake bar has already garnered a steady following, most of whom are Japanese expats." -Honeycombers "You’d expect a bar in the middle of a karaoke strip to be all fried chicken and spam fries. But away from the buzz of Circular Road, along the sedate walkways of South Bridge Road, an art-gallery-turned-sake-bar called Boruto has opened with a menu of inventive Asian-inspired tapas that is an outright rebellion to the notion of bar food." -City Nomads "Known as vault in Japanese, Boruto does not just boast about a comprehensive menu of exciting Japanese tapas, it has over 80 different sake brands, 50 of which are exclusively stocked here, including a woozy range of high-quality junmai daiginjo and daishiki." -Asia Style Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tako Wasabi, Ebi Maki with Burrata Cheese, Ise Ebi, Cold Angel Hair Pasta, Foie Gras Nashi with Cipollini onions, Wild Mushroom Pappardelle, Miso Braised Short Ribs, Wagyu Beef Tartare.

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • ABOUT

    Serving as a rendezvous for coffee and brunch during the day and a lively hangout for intimate wine and dine sessions during the night, Cafe Aux Bacchanales offers the best of both worlds in a single spot at Plaza Singapura. Exuding a rustic and nostalgic charm, the charming 60-seater space is well-known for their daily rotating menu that brings diners on a gastronomic adventure into French cuisine. Brunch options include Pastries, Sandwiches, and a selection of healthy salads. A classic French delicacy, the Galette au Jambon & Champignon is a scrumptious rendition of the country’s popular sweet and savoury crepes. Served with fried enoki mushrooms, parmesan cheese, shoulder ham, and molten egg yolk, dig into the soft and fluffy crepes for a delicious meal anytime of the day. For ice cream lovers, the Crepe au Chocolat will definitely delight your taste buds. Drenched in a rich chocolate sauce, this decadent dish comes with a generous scoop of chocolate ice cream for an extra chocolatey affair. Other equally tantalising dessert options include the Paris Brest and the Tart au Citron. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Galette au Jambon & Champignon, Crepe au Chocolat, Paris Brest, Tart au Citron

    Pre-purchase Chope Vouchers for Café Iguana and get 10% off. This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • ABOUT

    One of the first places in Singapore to make Mexican food hip and part of the buzzing nightlife at Clarke Quay, Cafe Iguana is a favourite among night-birds drawn to its high-energy atmosphere (helped along by joyful Mexican music played through the speaker), strong, frosty drinks, and friendly crowds. They’re famous for their well-endowed margaritas, including their house favourites that come in sweet and tart flavours like peach, lime, and Soursop, though more premium numbers, mixed up with top-shelf tequilas, are also available if you’re looking for something complex to nurse through the night. Before the binge-drinking, line your stomach with the hearty Mexican fare on offer. Think soft corn tacos filled with tender red snapper, fatty pork carnitas, or shredded steak, perfect with a dash of salsa and pico de gallo. If you’re looking for something heftier, full plates are available too, featuring chow like a Mulato Rib Eye, a chargrilled cut of Australian beef that’s intensified with Mexican spices and a fiery chili sauce, served alongside beans and rice. The house specialty is the Green Chile Stew, made with pork in a rich broth of chile verde, served with tortillas and rice, for a hearty, spicy centrepiece that’s perfect for sharing. Take down the heat with an icy margarita, or a smoky Mezcal cocktail, and soak up the riverside vibes: the night is only beginning. (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Camarones al Diablo, Quesadillas, Shredded Steak Tacos, Flank Steak Fajitas, Red Snapper Enchilada, Ancho Chile Chocolate Cake

  • ABOUT

    At Cafe Q Classified, you’re guaranteed to be satisfied with their delicious menu that serves excellent food and new exciting pairings from different cuisines, all in one place. Serving an eclectic menu from local to Japanese to European dishes, find something for everyone here at Q Classified. It's no secret that they incorporate fresh seafood into delicious dishes for every palate here. Try out their Japan Bay Oyster Omelette for a dish that combines premium ingredients with local flavours. Made with plump, fresh Japan Bay Oysters, this gooey dish is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with oysters that burst in your mouth with fresh ocean flavour. Highly addictive, you might even call for more than one serving. The menu has a broad selection of sweet and savoury flavours so you can experience the different textures from each dish. One of their most popular menu items are their fluffy, chewy Baby Pancakes. Whether you prefer savoury or sweet pancakes, this is the perfect sharing dish. The star here is the Dutch Baby Pancake with Red Ruby topped with coconut ice cream. The bejeweled dish, with its striking tapioca cubes, is creamy and full of flavour with different textures coming together in perfect harmony, from chewy tapioca balls to soft ice cream. For mains, their Wagyu Rib Eye served with Foie Gras and Onsen Egg with Rice is a must try. Melt-in-your-mouth meat is paired with creamy foie gras that makes this dish an umami bomb. When paired with a steaming bowl of rice and egg, this dish is satisfying and filling without overpowering your taste buds with complex flavors. If you like seafood, you can’t go wrong with Lobster Uni Tagliatelle with Black Truffle. A luxurious dish, full of truffle aromas, this dish is naturally sweetened from the lobster and infused with ocean flavours from the creamy uni. A cold beverage like the well-known Korean Dalgona Coffee would be a nice addition to your meal to enhance it with its hint of roasted taste. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Dutch Baby Pancake with Red Ruby, Japan Bay Oyster Omelette, Wagyu Rib Eye served with Foie Gras and Onsen Egg with Rice, Lobster Uni Tagliatelle with Black Truffle, Korean Dalgona Coffee

    California is calling and man does it feel sweet. California Republic, the latest concept from The Dandy Collection, brings you through a 1960's retro-cool vibe. The venue takes one back to the sweet warmth of the Californian sun, woodie surf wagons, and sunken living rooms. Embodying the laid-back spirit of the Golden State, California Republic brings a bold, bright and fresh approach to Italian-inspired cuisine. The food is kneaded and rolled lovingly by hands. Our dedicated team of artisans takes paying homage to this cross-cultural cuisine seriously. We are not reinventing the wheel here, the food is simple, comfortable, and creative. It celebrates the coast and the farm equally and is the perfect match for a scene looking for clean living, of body and soul. Like the culture mix, the food will translate this beautiful natural collision, exactly what California has always stood for.California Republic is a trip. You will have to see it to feel it. (Mar 2022)

html:
• ABOUT

    Warm, full-bodied, and complex are often adjectives people use describe the beloved and traditional Peranakan cuisine. At Candlenut, this uniquely Southeast Asian cuisine is getting its time in the limelight thanks to chef-owner Malcolm Lee’s deft work and skill that garnered him a Michelin star two years in a row. With high ceilings, clean lines, and plenty of sunshine, it’s almost impossible to feel stressed in the relaxed and laidback atmosphere that Candlenut exudes. While this 92-seater establishment includes a private room for more intimate dinners, guests also have the option of sitting in the al fresco area for a night under the stars. There are a fair number of classic Peranakan dishes on a menu that spans across 40 appetisers, mains, and desserts. Be prepared to fall head over heels for standouts such as the Red Lion Snapper, accompanied by fresh chilli sambal and charred garlic chives. The King Tiger Prawn, featuring local ingredients such as gula melaka coconut sauce, lemongrass, and Thai basil, is also another hit. Of course, indecisive eaters can always go for the playfully-named Ah-Ma-Kase tasting menu to sample a little of everything. With a new home at the ultra-hip COMO Dempsey, Candlenut promises a night (or afternoon) filled with contemporary Straits-Chinese cuisine amid the lush greenery that is Dempsey Hill. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The chap chye is the standout because of its simplicity. The vegetables are stewed 'til they achieve the perfect texture - a cross between chewy and melt-in-the-mouth." -Time Out Singapore "The food is also a reflection of Lee's deft use of ingredients from the South-East Asian pantry. Our wing bean salad is a refreshing crunch of red radish, prawns, cashews, lemongrass and crisp anchovies, all tossed in a zesty calamansi lime dressing. The sweet flesh of perfectly grilled king tiger prawns is complemented by a coconut sauce that is given extra depth with the addition of caramel-edged gula melaka." -The Peak Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Kueh Pie Tee, Westholme Wagyu Beef Rib Rendang, Blue Swimmer Crab Curry, Buah Keluak Fried Rice, Red Lion Snapper Fillet with Black Green Mango Sambal, King Tiger Prawn with Fresh Chilli Sambal, Classic Chendol Cream, Textures of Coconut

    Serving yummy plates of omurice at pocket friendly prices since 2002, Canteen Bistro is a casual western style restaurant nestled in the heart of town at Singapore Management University. Featuring an impressive spread of burgers, pasta and meat dishes, the restaurant is a great hangout spot with friends as their snack menu offers multiple dishes great for sharing. The Combo Platter is the best way to have a taste of everything on the snack menu. With four types of flavoured fries, Fried Chicken Wings, Fried Calamari and Tempura Prawns, there’s something for everyone on this platter. For an indulgent meal, go for the Wagyu Beef Burger. Accompanied with a generous serving of fries, the wagyu beef is tender and melts in your mouth. Slapped between two fluffy buns and drizzled with a delicious sauce, take a bite to enjoy a burst of savoury flavours. Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with a plate of Grilled Chicken Chop. Grilled to perfection, the chicken chop is covered in a rich, bold black pepper sauce and comes with a side of fresh salad and fries. Other signature items on the menu include the Creamy Salmon linguine, Crispy Chicken Cutlet and Pulled Pork Burger. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Combo Platter, Wagyu Beef Burger, Grilled Chicken Chop, Creamy Salmon Linguine

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in Kampong Glam, Cappadocia Turkish Restaurant is dedicated to serving quality interpretations of classic Turkish dishes. Kick things off with the Karisik Kebab Maxim. This indulgent culinary creation features a magnificent feast of succulent lamb, beef, and chicken kebabs with a side of butter rice and vegetable salad, and has fast become one of the restaurant's signature dishes. For the health-conscious food lover, their Chicken Shawarma Sandwich will do the trick. Stuffed with sliced shawarma chicken, lettuce, and pickles, the sandwich is lightly drizzled with garlic sauce and lightly toasted. The Tabbouleh is yet another nutritious option, featuring a delightful bowl of fresh chopped Lebanese parsley mixed with bulgur, tomato, onion, lemon juice and topped off with extra virgin olive oil. End off with a fan favourite sweet treat - the Kunefe Turkish Dessert. Made out of thin vermicelli pastry baked in soft cheese and syrup, this each delightful morsel is worth its waiting time! (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Shawarma Sandwich, Karisik Kebab Maxim, Tabbouleh, Kunefe Turkish Dessert

html:
• ABOUT

    A Bukit Timah favourite for mouth-watering pastas and authentic pizzas, Capri Trattoria & Pizzeria is an Italian eatery we’re certain everyone will love. Offering a warm and rustic ambiance, along with an authentic region-centric menu, it’s one spot that’s got traditional Italian eats in the bag! With something on the menu for everyone, Capri Trattoria’s à la carte menu is where most people will want to start. From seafood fans who’ll find the Gamberi e Cappesante alle Erbe, warm prawns and scallops with mediterranean herbs, remarkable to the meat eaters who’ll yearn to devour the Cotoletta alla Milanese, a juicy 300g bone-in deep-fried breaded veal chop, substantial eats is what this Italian eatery is all about! (Mar 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Always harbouring a weakness for a Caprese, we of course started off with this. A spot-on serving size with melt-in-your-mouth buffalo mozzarella and juicy tomatoes.” -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gamberi e Cappesante alle Erbe, Asparagi dello Chef, Carpaccio di Pesce, Insalata di Rucola, Scialatielli di Capri, Ravioli di Vitello, Risotto Gamberi e Porri, Trionfo di Mare, Calzone, Classic Tiramisu’

    The restaurant will be opened for takeaways instead.Takeaway Operating Hour: Daily, 11am-9:30pm

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    The “Captain” behind the brand is former chief marine engineer turned restaurateur Kenneth Koh, whose global expeditions from shore to shore sparked inspirations for steaming tiers of fresh seafood goodness. "We only buy from suppliers who are committed to sustainable fishing practices and the long term protection of sea life. We pride ourselves in bringing in the best so that we can serve the best." - Kenneth Koh. Through his exposure to a myriad of seafood cuisines worldwide, he found that steaming fresh seafood in a tower is not only a healthier option but also the purest indulgent method. When trickles of seafood essence condense into the soup base, it sets itself apart as a deep ocean flavoured broth perfect for a wholesome feast! (Feb 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Will surely delight seafood and shellfish lovers." - Miss Tam Chiak "I pick the kimchi stock, which the server recommends, and it turns out to be excellent... In fact, one of my companions declares that it is his favourite part of the meal." - The Straits Times "...can we just repeat how much we enjoyed the premium nine-tier tower? You’d realize that you are getting a lot of value and premium seafood for the price you are paying." - Lady Iron Chef "A different dining experience, best to experience together as a group... Time to jio your kakis!" - Daniel Food Dairy

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mentaiko Lobsters, Rock Salt Baked Sri Lankan Mud Crabs, Cheese Baked Scallops, Butter Grilled Bamboo Clams, Fresh Raw Oysters, Steamed King Prawns

html:
• ABOUT

    Forget the meat-and-potatoes steakhouse. A lively Brazilian churrascaria is what you should seek for an eventful and delicious evening out. The idea is simple. You sit down, and passadors bearing skewers of grilled premium meat, carve moist slivers directly onto your plate. Beef, chicken, lamb, fish – there's no need to limit yourself. It's an endless flow of meaty goodness where all you have to do is sit, and eat. And eat. And eat. Just when your palate is starting to feel a little jaded, you order a portion of grilled caramelised pineapple whose sharp, tangy sweetness is the perfect way to whet your appetite all over again. All so you can get back to those delicious cuts of meat. Don't just be dazzled by the succulent barbecued meats, rotisserie-cooked to perfection. There's also a buffet spread that shouldn't be overlooked! With staples like salads and pastas, it's where you should turn to if you feel that you've met your match on the protein front. The meat though, is undeniably the draw of this restaurant, and with a name like Carnivore, that shouldn't be a surprise. Stationed near the archways of the iconic CHIJMES pavilion, this Carnivore outlet is undeniably unique. Softened by the backdrop of the gorgeous white chapel, the outdoor dining option here is a must, creating an incomparable ambience that makes this unique dinner experience all the more special. So sharpen those claws and polish those canines my friends, because there's no better place to meet. (Aug 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Rump Cap, Chimichurri Sauce, Bacon Wrapped Chicken, Brazilian Cheese Bread

  • SAFETY & HEALTH MEASURES

    To comply with COVID-19 safe management measures, the buffet counter will be closed. We have made slight adjustments to the concept of a semi-a la carte system. This time, let us do the walking. You'll place orders for the soup, cold & hot dishes, desserts and condiments and we will serve them to you as many times as you wish, straight to your table. Carving stations will be set-up closeby to your table, plated, and served. Customers must adhere to the following during this period: - Safe-distancing of 1 meter from other guests. - Temperatures will be taken before seating. Guests with temperatures of 38C and above or are experiencing coughs / runny nose will be unable to remain. - Masks must be worn within the premises, even whilst seated, and may only be removed when food & drinks are consumed. - Safe Entry check-ins must be performed before seating and check-outs upon leaving.

  • BUFFET PRICING

html:
• ABOUT

    Comfortable, friendly and affordable, The Carpenters Bar is a humble shop dedicated to serving Asian fusion Oceania cum European cuisine by plating up modern yet Western classics. Swing by for a fuss free meal any time of the day with your kids or furry little ones and unwind with the bar’s extensive selection of fresh draught beers, a wide selection of bottled beers, a specially curated wine menu or non alcoholic beverages. On a low carb diet? The Carpenters Bar has got your back with a plethora of nutritious yet delectable menu options that will fill you up! Meat lovers can go with either the Naked Beef Burger or Chicken Breast with Capsicum Creamy Sauce. Served with a generous heap of greens and baby potatoes, the latter is a hearty portion of tender beef patty topped with scrambled egg and black pepper sauce that delights. Try pairing with the Surf & Turf Platter on casual dinner dates for an evening filled with wings, steaks, sauteed big prawns, pan seared fresh squid and corn on cob you definitely won’t forget. Other finger-licking dishes made for sharing include the bar bites such as the Pan Fried Japanese Gyoza and Calamari. Throw in a Singapore Hot! Pizza into the mix to spice up your meal with chunks of fiery chicken cube before wrapping up your meal with a glass of bubbly for an unforgettable dining experience. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Naked Beef Burger, Surf & Turf Platter, Pan Fried Japanese Gyoza, Singapore Hot! Pizza

html:
• ABOUT

    If you think Italian cuisine is all about rich pastas and creamy sauces had by dim lighting in a cozy dining room, Caruso Ristorante will make you think again. In place of exposed brick and traditional white table cloths, Caruso features crisp, white stone arches, an airy bar and dining room, and bright citrus walls. Its concrete floors, sleek furniture and two storey-foyers are modern, while mainstays of Italy are sprinkled about, with poppy Italian tunes playing and vintage photos of the restaurant's namesake singer dotting the wall. While the interiors exude an air of Southern Italy, the flavours from the dishes that fly out of the kitchens here will truly transport diners to the heart of Puglia at first bite. Start your meal right with La Burrata, Puglia’s renown burrata cheese with wild rocket and cherry tomatoes, or sink your teeth into the beautifully fresh and tart octopus salad Insalata Di Polipo. Follow that with famous lamb dishes that Puglia is famous for: the Pappardelle Con Ragu Di Agnello features slow braised lamb that’s cooked for 8 hours and served over homemade pasta, while Costolette Di Agnello Al Timo brings you gorgeous thyme-roasted lamb chops with artichokes, spinach, and roasted potatoes. With the brilliant lightness of all the dishes, saving room for dessert isn't a concern. And with dessert just as light and perfect as the rest of the meal, we were left wishing it did not have to end. (Nov 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A fitting name for a restaurant run by experienced chef Chef Franco Lorello, this cosy space is great for families and corporate dinners. Enjoy the ultimate italian dining experience with its authentic Italian cuisine, serving dishes from Vitello Tonnato, Tiramisu, Panna Cotta Alle Fragole, made with ingredients directly imported from Italy." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    La Burrata, Insalata Di Polipo, Pappardelle Con Ragu Di Agnello, Costolette Di Agnello Al Timo, Tiramisu

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/caruso-ristorante

    In line with the local government’s latest initiatives to curb the spread of the covid-19 coronavirus, The Carvery has implemented necessary social distancing measures at our restaurant. In addition to spacing out the seating arrangements, we have taken the additional step of changing our buffet to a la carte and set menu. The safety and well-being of our guests and staff remain our top priority, and we will continue to provide hospitality as and when it is needed. We seek your kind understanding during this time, that if you must meet for social gatherings, to keep your party small and intimate. With these measures in place, we hope to provide a safe and welcoming environment where you can still enjoy a great meal in good company. (Mar 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "As its name implies, there are some pretty good roast meats and all the accoutrements of a fine British-style roast dinner, and then some. There is nothing lacking in the way of quantity." -TODAY "The Carvery impresses with its roasted selections and dishes like the in-house dry-aged prime rib as well as crispy pork knuckle." -Lifestyle Asia

• ABOUT

    In Singapore, the best food is always tucked away in hard-to-reach places, and that seems to be the case for Casa Roma, which is hidden away in quiet Bukit Timah, some 15 minutes away from the mania of Orchard Road. The space, done up to resemble a bustling Roman trattoria, is homey, rustic, and welcoming, and a large mural of Roman landmarks reminds you that you’re here to tuck into the hearty food of this storied city. Here, they offer a traditional multi-course Italian meal, which you kick off with some pasta, like the classic Spaghetti Alla Carbonara and little pillowy Ravioli stuffed with cheese and served with Parma ham, before diving into its meaty mains. Choose from dishes like a crisp-skinned Branzino al Pomodoro, a fillet of bass served with piquant capers and salty anchovies in a light tomato sauce, or a hefty Vitello Al Funghi Porcini, a tender veal loin grilled to perfection then dressed in a creamy porcini sauce, all delicious paired with one of the restaurant’s great beers or wines. A sweet ending is compulsory, so end the night with a Budino Al Latte, a milky creme caramel, or the ubiquitous but irresistible Tiramisu.It’s time to gear up for your very own Roman holiday, transported to Rome not by plane, but by delicious Italian plates. (Jul 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Casa Roma is the sort of place where you keep returning to for a few favorite dishes.” -SG Magazine

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gamberoni alla Griglia, Conchiglie con Pollo e Pomodorini Secchi, Tagliatelle ai Funghi Porcini, Risotto ai Funghi Porcini, Mixed Cheese Platter, Ravioli Magro Panna E Prosciutto

html:
• ABOUT

    Learning Cassia is located near the southernmost point of continental Asia probably evokes images of beach-goers with cocktail glasses basking in the sun, sand and sea. Cassia surprises diners by offering a gorgeous view overlooking Sentosa, with the sprawling cityscape an impressive backdrop. Definitely considering dining outdoors, it's surprisingly cool in our tropical climate! That is probably kudos to the lush greenery on the island, which makes a trip to Capella feel like a trip out of Singapore. Cassia is as much a feast for the eyes as much as it is for your belly. Admire the colonial architecture of Capella Hotel while sampling their must-try dim sum like the Steamed Barbecued US Kurobuta Pork Bun, or the Hong Kong-style Peking Duck. Recipes are based upon traditional, regional cooking and blended with haute Cantonese technique. The chic décor of the restaurant compliments beautifully with (and definitely brings out the best in) the haute yet classic cuisine Cassia serves so well. (Jun 2012)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wok-Fried Carrot Cake with XO Chili Sauce, Double Boiled Thick Chicken Broth Soup, Peking Duck, Wok-fried Wagyu Beef, Steamed Charcoal Barbecued Avinyó Omega 3 Pork Bun with Black Truffle

  • CASSIA PRESENTS A SELECTION OF TANTALISING YUM CHA BREAKFAST DELIGHTS

    Starting this 24 January 2022, Cassia will be launching a special breakfast Yum Cha menu where guests can indulge in exquisitely handcrafted Cantonese dim sum classics with fresh ingredients, curated by our Dim Sum Chef Chow Nga Ming.Start your day with a delectable selection of traditional Yum Cha favourites such as the Steamed Truffle Char Siew Bao made with Spanish Iberico pork and black truffle, and the Pan-Fried Carrot Cake prepared with dried scallops, Chinese sausage and dried shrimps. Paired with Cassia’s signature housemade XO Chilli sauce, these dim sum delights will be sure to impress. When: 24 January 2022 onwardsTime: 8am-10am (Mon-Sun)Price: $58++ per personGuests staying with Capella may enjoy this luxurious breakfast at an additional $10 per person if their stay is inclusive of breakfast

• ABOUT

    A contemporary fish grill and raw bar by Andrew Walsh’s Cure Concepts, Catfish offers an Asian fusion menu that highlights the best finds from the region. Helmed by head chef Erik Gustafsson, the restaurant is focused on serving dishes that are complex yet easy to enjoy. Its menu elevates the natural flavours of the ocean with innovative culinary techniques, resulting in delicious Asian fare that combines elements of French and Swedish cooking. The culinary team focuses on techniques and matching flavour profiles to present shareable plates divided into ‘Snacks’, ‘Raw’, ‘Small’, ‘Fish’, ‘Vegetables’, ‘Others’ and ‘Desserts’. Quality takes precedence at Catfish. Ingredients such as mussels and fish are scouted from neighbourhood markets to ensure the freshest pick of the produce. The Squid and Chicken Wing Ramen is a must-try, with ramen noodles recreated with squid confit and topped with black truffle shavings. A toast to try is the Sesame Prawn Toast which uses Argentinian red prawn and scallop mousse for a textured take, topped with decadent uni and caviar. Another must-try is the Scallop Green Apple, Hokkaido Scallop Ceviche of apple, citrus, clementine and yogurt dressing with a dash of dill oil and toasted almond. Above and beyond the wonderful seafood dishes, you can expect an eclectic selection of hand-crafted cocktails and highballs with a twist of Asian flavours. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Squid and Chicken Wing Ramen, Sesame Prawn Toast, Scallop Green Apple

  • href

  • ABOUT

    This little gem hidden in the charming Upper Thomson Estate brings contemporary fusion food together with spacious yet cozy interiors for maximum chill vibes. This all-day brunch concept cafe is also pet-friendly, so your furbabies can come along too. Diving straight into delicious brunch specials, go for their Chicken and Croffles Set to start off your day right. Soft and fragrant croffles are served with a side of butter maple syrup for an indulgent sweet treat and paired with delicious fried chicken that balances out the sweet with salty flavours. For a more local-inspired brunch favourite, go for the Otah Bruschetta. Fluffy sourdough is oven-baked with a spicy thick slab of moist muar otah and topped with gooey melted cheese to complete the dish. Hearty, spicy, and full of otah goodness, this toast is highly addictive with a fiery punch.Pasta dishes that shine through are their Sakura Cream Tagliatelle. Cooked with flavours of the ocean in mind, al-dente pasta is tossed in a creamy mentaiko sauce and topped with fresh seafood like clams and prawns, making this dish savoury and flavoured with the natural sweetness of the seafood. It’s also sprinkled with flakes of dried ebi on top for an extra dimension of flavour.For a healthier yet equally tasty option, go for their Spinach Cream Tagliatelle. The umami cheese cream sauce is cooked with tender spinach leaves and asparagus, creating a hearty dish that serves a delicate crunch. Topped with parmesan for an extra depth to its textures, this dish is scrumptious whilst allowing you to feast on the healthier side.For desserts, go for their fragrant and coconut-y Ondeh Ondeh Cake. Light and pillow-soft sponge cake is drizzled with sweet and fragrant gula melaka, and topped with roasted coconut flakes for added texture. Deliciously indulgent, finish off your meal on a sweet note with this pandan delight. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken and Croffles Set, Otah Bruschetta, Sakura Cream Tagliatelle, Spinach Cream Tagliatelle, Ondeh Ondeh Cake

    Get ready to unleash your inner cavemen and satisfy all your meaty desires. Started by Yvonne Ng, Cavemen Restaurant & Bar is a top-notch butchery, restaurant and bar that boasts a range of meats, cheese, groceries and wines at pocket-friendly prices. After you’re done shopping, why not take a breather and spend an afternoon tucking into the well-curated meat-centric dishes this place has to offer? As expected of any good butchery, the meats here are simply to die for. Take, for example, the perfectly Josper grilled Tochigi A3 Ribeye Wagyu. Served with your choice of sides and sauce, this delectable hunk of meat is well known to all meat-lovers out there. Other stellar options also include the Miso Cod and Crab Meat Angel Hair Pasta. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Miso Cod, Grilled Surume Ika, Crab Croquette, Orange Roughy, Crab Meat Angel Hair

    Want to learn about the ABC's and 123's of coffee? Join us for a fun and interactive coffee barista workshop! You will also be learning about 6 different types of coffee roast in this workshop with our award-winning coffee machine, the Black Eagle. Even better, you might get the chance to learn from our master roaster, the world champion for the World Coffee Show!THREE MAIN THEMES OF THE BARISTA COURSE 1. The different types of coffee 2. What is a Coffee Barista? 3. Learning the basics of Barista techniquesCOURSE CONTENT Module 1:Theory on Origin of Coffee, Trivia and Process Module 2: Sensory Coffee Tastings with 6 different blends from around the world Module 3: Pratical on Coffebean Grinding and Espresso based coffee making Module 4: Pratical on Latte Art TechniquesDate: Wednesday or SaturdayTime: 11.30amDuration: 9 HoursVenue: 1 Magazine Road, #01-01, Central Mall, Singapore (059567)Price: $480nett per pax* [Comes with a complimentary $100 Central Perk Voucher]Buy your tickets now! *This event is claimable with your Skillsfuture creditsTerms of Use: - Tickets purchase only through Chope, limited availability. - Claimable under Skillsfuture credits. - Strictly no refunds will be entertained.

  • ABOUT

    You probably grew up seeing the gang on Friends spend half their lives at this fictional New York cafe, and now it's your time to experience it for yourself. A full-fledged replica of the hit TV show's punnily-named Central Perk (after New York's Central Park, get it?) cafe is now taking waves of Friends fans on a nostalgic pilgrimage. It's uncanny how true-to-life this cafe is, and you'll feel just like you're on the set of Friends with its weathered couch and cozy ambience. Sort through your romantic crises, tell silly stories, and fantasise about your favourite characters walking in through the door as you tuck into hearty plates with gourmet touches, cheekily named after characters and catchphrases from the show. Joey's Fisherman Stew is a hearty pot of mussels, clams, octopus, salmon, and prawns in a rich, slow-cooked broth. Janice's Oh My God Baby Back Ribs features free range Iberico pork for an extra fatty, tender finish. Rachel fans will dig the appropriately healthy Rachel "Green" Salad, a Mediterranean toss-up of pesto, olives, feta, and compressed fruits. Roast chicken and Chandler devotees will enjoy Chandler's Thanksgiving, a gravy-doused bird served with a side of, ahem, "Chanberry" sauce. It's all puns, good food, and fond TV memories here at Central Perk cafe, where you can recreate the show to your heart's content while tucking into great food and the enthusiastic company of other devotees. (Dec 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "If you're a fan, we're certain you'll have few complaints once you find yourself naturally whipping out your phones to re-enact scenes from the series." -Honeycombers "Central Perk cafe definitely lives up to the hype. Not only does the place look down right spot-on to the scenes in FRIENDS, the food also shines on its own. There are many parts of the cafe that are photogenic and Insta-worthy too. Surely, these perks are enough reason for you to go to Central Perk?" -Seth Lui

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Joey's Fisherman Stew, Ross & Rachel's Breakup Pizza, Heavy Fudge Chocolate Mudcake, Janice's Oh My God Baby Back Ribs, Phoebe's I Can’t Eat Meat Steak, Chandler's Thanksgiving, Joey's You're My Everest Turkey

  • CAFE HAPPENINGS

    The Smelliest Cat Award Win up to $10,000 in cash and the chance to be Central Perk Singapore's resident singer-songwriter. Auditions and Open Mic Night begins January 2017.When: Every alternate Thursday, 7:30 to 10pmPlease check with the restaurant for more information.How You Doin'? Night Feeling lonely? Make plenty of new friends during our "How You Doin'?" nights, coming soon to Central Perk. Watch this space.F.R.I.E.N.D.S Trivia Night A gripping game to show off your F.R.I.E.N.D.S knowledge. Think you have what it takes? Stay tuned for more details.

    Chang Korean Charcoal BBQ cuts above the rest. At Chang, we strive to provide a variety of health-conscious choices. Our specially-designed menu includes traditional, yet modernized foods to satisfy the taste buds. Having set in mind the foods we prepare are for our dedicated loved one, we strive to present culinary delights of Korean traditional dishes. Adapting modern taste to the very authentic taste wouldn’t be easy without passion. Chang Korean BBQ has been remarked as one of the luxurious places opted for fine dining experiences, occasions and corporate dinners. Serving delectable and authentic Korean cuisine, Chang BBQ continues to be a culinary delight and serves up exceptionally crafted Korean dishes. (Jul 2019)

  • ABOUT

    If you can’t get enough of these deep-fried delights, there’s finally a place to sate your cravings. Founded in Osaka in 1971, this historic restaurant pays homage to the beloved Japanese dumpling. The recipe was perfected by Kenzo Nishi and the basic ingredients have not been modified since. Every single dumpling is filled with the right amount of filling and is fried to crisp perfection without a hint of greasiness. The gyoza here are stuffed with a variety of fillings and topped with everything from cheese to citrus sauce. Vegetarians will be glad to know that Cabbage Gyoza is also on the menu. Diners looking for a unique dish can try the Ponzu Buta Gyoza - a delicious serving of pork gyoza drenched in a citrus and ponzu sauce. The combination may sound off-putting to some, but don’t knock it till you’ve tried it. The sharp citrus flavours cut through the richness of the meat and creates a contrast that will leave your taste buds wanting more. Curious carnivores should opt for the Tebasaki Gyoza - two pieces of chicken stuffed with gyoza meat. The chicken is crisp and flavourful, and when combined with the gyoza filling, this is a dish you’ll want to have seconds of. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ponzu Buta Gyoza, Tebasaki Gyoza, Cabbage Gyoza, Onsen Egg & Cheese Gyoza, Negi Gyoza

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/chao-chao-gyoza-cuppage-terrace
name: Chao Chao Gyoza @ Cuppage Terrace

html:
• ABOUT

    If you can’t get enough of these deep-fried delights, there’s finally a place to sate your cravings. Founded in Osaka in 1971, this historic restaurant pays homage to the beloved Japanese dumpling. The recipe was perfected by Kenzo Nishi and the basic ingredients have not been modified since. Every single dumpling is filled with the right amount of filling and is fried to crisp perfection without a hint of greasiness. The gyoza here are stuffed with a variety of fillings and topped with everything from cheese to citrus sauce. Vegetarians will be glad to know that Cabbage Gyoza is also on the menu. Diners looking for a unique dish can try the Ponzu Buta Gyoza - a delicious serving of pork gyoza drenched in a citrus and ponzu sauce. The combination may sound off-putting to some, but don’t knock it till you’ve tried it. The sharp citrus flavours cut through the richness of the meat and creates a contrast that will leave your taste buds wanting more. Curious carnivores should opt for the Tebasaki Gyoza - two pieces of chicken stuffed with gyoza meat. The chicken is crisp and flavourful, and when combined with the gyoza filling, this is a dish you’ll want to have seconds of. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ponzu Buta Gyoza, Tebasaki Gyoza, Cabbage Gyoza, Onsen Egg & Cheese Gyoza, Negi Gyoza

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/chao-chao-gyoza-royal-square
name: Chao Chao Gyoza @ Royal Square

html:
• ABOUT

    Italian bistros are a dime a dozen, but rarely do you happen upon one boasting a large, well-executed menu with an equal number of classic dishes and inventive new recipes. Chapter 55 is a homely little spot with friendly service and delicious food that will transport you straight to the heart of Rome. The Bonito Pizza is a fusion dish made with Tonkatsu sauce, bonito flakes and ham, which has a unique umami taste that gives the cheesy pizza base a new dimension of flavour. While the main items are certainly tempting, the true highlight of the menu are the desserts. There is a variety of waffles with gelato on offer - from Salted Caramel to Butterscotch Banana. The Chapter 55 Gelato Waffle, however, is simple and perfectly delicious. Served with fresh fruits cooked in cinnamon sauce and Chantilly cream, this dish is the perfect way to end off an authentic Italian meal at this cosy bistro. "I never say no to Gelato." Chapter 55 is known for producing its own small batches of artisan Gelato In-House. We have now created over 60 different flavors. Our Gelato are produced Fresh Daily using Premium Grade Ingredients. (Jun 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Helmed by two brothers from the UK, Char aims to revolutionise the roast meat scene in Singapore with a balance of traditional and innovative flavours. Their rendition of the roasts are indeed drool-worthy. Think: Melt-in-your-mouth slices of char siew slathered in a sweet and savoury glaze, crackling pork belly roasted to golden brown perfection, and tender yet crispy jasmine-infused roast duck. Besides roast meats, they have an impressive array of Chinese appetisers, soups, and mains to satiate your hunger. Seafood fans will love the Passionfruit Prawn Ball, where crunchy deep-fried prawns are coated in a refreshing passion fruit dressing. Even humble carb dishes get a makeover, such as the Char's Special XO Sambal Fried Rice and Crispy Egg Noodles with Kurobuta Pork. Don't forget to throw in a comforting bowl of Char's Signature Double Boiled Chicken Soup, a flavourful broth brimming with tender pieces of chicken and scallops. As a nod to the founders' hometown, British ales, ciders, and drafts complement the dishes and provide a unique dining experience. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Char Siew, Crispy Roast Pork Belly, Jasmine Roast Duck, Soya Sauce Chicken, Passionfruit Prawn Ball

html:
• ABOUT

    Indian cuisine is diverse and unique, and few restaurants in Singapore have captured the true essence of quintessential Indian dining. Kurry Korner is set to change that, however, with a wide variety of dishes that combine techniques and ingredients from all over India. Think Tandoori Chicken, Palak Paneer, and Vindaloo Curry. Health-conscious diners will be happy to note that all the food here are free of MSG, artificial colours, and preservatives. The ingredients used are also fresh, which ensures that dishes are wholesome and delicious. Whet your appetite with some Kurry Korner Chicken Soup. This Insta-worthy starter is just oozing with flavour. Made with chicken, thickened with cream, and spiced with garlic, the smell of this dish alone will have you salivating. Rich and earthy, this is the perfect pick-me-up on a rainy day or for when you just need some comfort food. For a taste of the South, try the Chettinad Chicken - a searing curry made with red chilli and sauteed coriander seeds best enjoyed with some steamed Basmati rice. Craving dessert? You can’t go wrong with the Gulab Jamun, caramelized milk dumplings floating in a sweet cardamom syrup. Every bite explodes with delightfully sweet filling, and makes for the perfect way to end your meal. (March 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Paneer Butter Masala, Butter Chicken, Goan Fish Curry, Vegetable Briyani

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/charcoal-grill-and-bar-by-kurry-korner

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in a rustic shophouse amidst the hustle and bustle of the Central Business District, Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar takes diners on a mouthwatering journey full of excellent margaritas and dazzling tapas. With its superior picturesque view over Boat Quay and delicious food, dining at Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar is always a treat! The menu contains an extensive selection of traditional tapas as well as vegetarian options to cater to any dietary restrictions. The Almejas Y Mejillones is a longstanding favourite – fresh clams and mussels are marinated in a sweet white wine, resulting in heaven on a plate! The Gambas Pil Pil is great for those craving something more spicy – large, fresh prawns are cooked in a hot, sizzling sauce, setting your tastebuds on fire! Of course, the more substantial main course options are equally exciting. The Signature Baby Back Ribs (available in 2 serving sizes) are scrumptious – pork ribs are stone-grilled until the the flavours are locked in, then glazed with a secret barbecue sauce. Served with sides of coleslaw and fries, the meat falls off the bone as you sink your teeth in. Charlie’s Tapas Grill & Bar is immensely popular among the working crowd, so don’t wait too long before making your reservation! (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “A restaurant and bar serving Latin and Spanish cuisine as well as a wide range of tequilas and margaritas.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rosemary Lamb, Quesadillas, Squid-Ink Paella, Jamon Serrano, Patatas Bravas

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    At Chat Masala we are dedicated to bringing the hot and vibrant flavours of India to the spice-loving people of Singapore’s East Coast. Come and join us at our colourful premises on Upper East Coast Road and experience a true taste of India, where our chefs blend together exciting colour and flavour combinations for a culinary sensation that will have your taste buds crying out for more! Whether you want to spice up your life with a fiery curry or are seeking out something a bit milder but still equally as delicious, our menu caters to all tastes with plenty of options for the veggies too. Some of our most popular dishes include the Mama Mia Mussels (fresh and juicy mussels cooked in a sauce that fuses together flavours from the east and west) and our spicy masala chicken. You’ll find plenty of starters and sides on our menu, as well as an array of delicious desserts to conclude your meal with. Craving some authentic Indian cuisine in Singapore? Book a table at Chat Masala! We look forward to serving you soon. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Biryani, Chicken Kebab Roll, Dahi Aloo Chaat, Palak Paneer, Tandoori Platter

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/chat-masala

html:
• ABOUT

    Chatterbox marks a grand return after 5 months of renovation, celebrating its Golden Jubilee last year (51 years) with a brand-new space, menu and dining experience, located at level 5 of the newly minted Hilton Singapore Orchard. Diners can partake in a new menu of inventive iterations of Asian specialties, with signature dishes such as the legendary Mandarin Chicken Rice, and Lobster Laksa, or the rick in wok hei favourites of Seafood Hokkien Mee, and Beef Hor Fun, as well as evergreen must-haves- Chatterbox Rojak and Signature Coconut Ice Cream.The entrance walkway leading into Chatterbox is a botanical mural depicting local floral and fauna by local artist and illustrator Tan Zi Xi with her Instagram handle @messymsxi, it is a continuous narrative of a similar mural commissioned for Chatterbox Hong Kong, this elegant illustration depicts Singapore’s local greenery. The interior is characterised by a soothing and inviting palette of woody browns, pastel green and creamy hues, the understated and chic restaurant exudes a relaxing and calming vibe –sun-lit by day, and intimate and cosy by night.Perfect for a family meal, a get-together with friends, celebrations, date nights, or even business meals. With the many types of seating from booths to counters, or private dining room, they have got you covered. Some quirky design elements that are distinctly Singaporean are also cleverly incorporated into the space –such as old-school ventilation blocks which serve as partitions, and white square tiled tabletops that are a nod to the familiar HDB void deck tables.Chatterbox’s 15-seat bar area – an intimate spot that you can order a pre-meal tipple such as Chatterbox’s Punch, that is a 21-day infused gin with banana, chilli, cinnamon, vanilla, and lemon, along with other delicious cocktails, craft beers, wines and champagnes of course. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Laksa, Seafood Hokkien Mee, Beef Hor Fun, Sea Perch with Burnt Green Chilli, Lemon Butter Tiger Prawns

    Aiming to create a space that is all about the best produce cultivated by local and global farmers who work tirelessly to bring this to the table, Chef’s Table by Chef Stephan Zoisl brings gourmet food, premium ingredients, fine wine, and more to Tras Street. Through a range of menu offerings, the Chef Stephan draws on his creativity and imagination to present a dinner crafted with the freshest produce and seasonal ingredients. Kick back and leave yourself in good hands as you savour incredible recipes and exceptional bottles from the experts! (Jan 2016)

  • ABOUT THE MENU

    The daily changing menu that is based on 4, 6, or 8 courses, and the idea of "no repetition" and "no signature dishes" - to always get a new culinary experience when dining at Chef's Table by Chef Stephan. Vegan, vegetarian, dairy free menus are offered as well.

  • ACCOLADES

    Chef's Table by Chef Stephan has been awarded:• Wine & Dine Singapore's Top Restaurant - 1 star (2016-2019)• Restaurant Association of Singapore Star Award - Best Western Restaurant 2017 (Casual Dining)• Restaurant Association of Singapore Star Award - Best of the Best 2017 (Casual Dining) • 2 house of stars - Wine & Dine - Singapore Top’s Restaurant 2019/2020 • 2019/2020 Wine & Dine - Wine List Awards - Bronze • 2020/2021 Edition of Tatler Dining by Singapore Tatler’s Best Restaurants• 2019 Travellers Choice Winner - TripAdvisor• TripAdvisor Traveller's Choice Best of the Best 2021

  • ABOUT

    Looking for somewhere to indulge your spice cravings? Look no further. Sichuan food is known for its fiery flavours, but there are not a lot of restaurants that can serve up authentic nosh like this place can. From searing soup bases to healthy stews, there’s something for everyone at this centrally-located spot. Adventurous patrons looking for the spiciest dish can refer to the number of chillies next to its name on the menu to gauge its spice level. Daredevils can start with the Secret Recipe Spring Frog, a delicious dish of chilli, frog meat, and a combination of secret sauces. The dish has a spicy, salty flavour that pairs perfectly with white rice. A little less ambitious? Start with the Griddle Cooked Trotters and work your way up. Diners who wish to steer clear of the spice will be glad to know that there is a wide variety of healthy soups available. The Duck Soup with Sour Radish is a simple dish that is easy on the digestive system is a touted to have a “cooling” effect on the body. For something a little moreish, opt for the Chengdu Style Trotter Soup. This dish is richer due to the use of pork, and comes with a serving of vegetables. (May 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Griddle Cooked Trotters, Secret Recipe Spring Frog, Chengdu Style Trotter Soup, Duck Soup with Sour Radish, Saute Spicy Chicken

• ABOUT

    Tickle your senses at Cherki with their delectable range of modern Peranakan dishes. Featuring a twist on traditional Peranakan flavours to excite discerning palates, this casual hideaway along Straits Boulevard draws inspiration and roots from Singapore’s heritage to bring specially crafted cocktails and nyonya flavours to your table. A bowl of fusion delights, the Sambal Lava Eggs with Petai is cooked with fragrant petai beans, cincalok, and homemade sambal, providing just the right amount of sweet and spice. Tastier than your usual french fries, the Chilli Beef Rendang Fries elevates the classic staple with a fiery chilli rendang that infuses Cherki’s unique selection of addictively zingy spices. For mains, we recommend a hearty bowl of Foie Gras Duck Confit Rice. A mouthwatering mix of Western and Asian ingredients, dig into fragrant fried rice topped with foie gras, shredded duck and foie gras for an enjoyable meal. Pasta lovers can go for the Coconut Prawn Linguine, Braised Mushroom Beef Linguine or Laksa Lobster Linguine. Wrap up your meal with the restaurant’s rendition of the Crab Meatball Soup to cleanse your palate. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sambal Lava Eggs with Petai , Chilli Beef Rendang Fries, Foie Gras Duck Confit Rice, Laksa Lobster Linguine

• ABOUT

    One of the most beautiful restaurants in Singapore, Cherry Garden offers an eclectic menu of Cantonese cuisine, presented with artistic modern flair. Entered via a striking antique doorway, the restaurant has been designed according to Feng Shui. Charcoaled teak panels and slate floors recreate the look of a splendid Oriental residence. Using fresh, seasonal produce, the menu changes regularly but always offers authentic Cantonese dishes. A varied wine list features a balanced selection of old and new world wines specially selected to match the menu. A wide selection of Chinese teas is also available. In addition to our main dining area, we have three private dining rooms. Lotus and Jasmine seat up to 12 guests each and can be combined. Bamboo is larger and can seat up to 24 guests. (Jan 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The spread brims with Canto classics like thick congee studded with shredded chicken and century eggs, homey double-boiled winter melon soups, silken drunken chicken and crisp prawn dumplings." -Time Out Singapore "Dishes you should not miss trying are the BBQ meat platter; wasabi prawns, Kurobuta pork, steamed cod with soy sauce, and cream of avocado served with walnut ice-cream." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Peking Duck with Traditional Condiments, Chinese Crepes & Homemade Sauce, Honey-Marinated Baked Cod Fillet with Black Pepper, Pan-Fried A4 Miyazaki Wagyu Beef Sirloin with Garlic Barbecue Sauce and Sautéed Vegetables, Five Grain Fried Rice with Cantonese Pork Sausage & Vegetables

  • ABOUT

    Cheval Cafe | Bar | Bistro (Bukit Merah) offers an expansive range of homely and delectable bistro food. Start your meal with a fresh platter of Clams In White Wine. Dished up with a generous slice of fragrant garlic bread, the fresh clams are a great way to whet your appetite. Cheese lovers should opt for the Lobster Mac & Cheese. Topped with a succulent piece of big, juicy lobster, this cheesy meal is bound to excite your taste buds! Other pasta favourites include the Bacon Carbonara Linguine and Seafood Aglio Olio Capellini. Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the Wagyu Striploin Steak peppered with fried garlic bits for an extra crunch. Bring your little ones along and treat them to a hearty Fish & Chips meal with juice and ice cream. Vegetarian options are also aplenty. A nutritious and tasty mix of brussel sprouts, capsicum, cherry tomatoes, corn and mushrooms, the grilled trio vegetable skewers have an aromatic smoky flavour profile guaranteed to delight. Wrap up your meal with a Burnt Cheesecake for a sweet ending. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Mac & Cheese, Wagyu Striploin Steak, Seafood Aglio Olio Capellini, Burnt Cheesecake

html:
• ABOUT

    Named after the French word for horse, this restaurant serves up a range of brunch staples and mains in an upscale setting boasting an expansive view of the rolling greens of the turf club. This is the perfect spot for brunch with friends on the weekends, or a casual lunch date. The Smoked Salmon Salad is an excellent option for diners who are watching their waistlines. Made with tender pieces of smoked salmon tossed in crunchy greens, this dish is best enjoyed with one of their classic cocktails or the ever-popular Frozen Margarita. Not a fan of alcohol? Fear not, as the mocktail options are just as numerous. We like the Shirley Temple for it’s citrus flavour sweetened by a hint of Grenadine syrup. For something a little moreish, opt for the Sea Meets Land - the perfect dish for meat and seafood lovers. Think surf n’ turf, but more upscale - this dish is made with treasures from land, like foie gras and ribeye steak, as well as tiger prawns and scallops. This dish is large enough to be shared by two people. Don’t like sharing? Dig into one of their pasta dishes instead. The Crab Meat Marinara Spaghetti is a crowd favourite, and features juicy chunks of crab meat tossed in a tangy tomato sauce. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cheval Platter, Waffle Sandwich, Truffle and Wild Mushroom Carbonara, Sea Meets Land, Lobster Bisque

• ABOUT

    There are plenty of Chinese restaurants in Singapore, but few can offer the innovative dishes that Cheval Chi Bao does. Look past your run of the mill Curry Fish and Hong Kong Roast Chicken, Cheval Chi Bao draws on ingredients from other cuisines to create drool-worthy dishes using traditional techniques. With its inviting atmosphere and pocket-friendly prices, this is the perfect place to take your friends for a catch-up session over lunch or dinner. Dig into the crowd favourite dish like Grandma's Prawn Ball - a dish that warms up your heart and gives you that nostalgic dining experience with your loved ones. Take advantage of their extended happy hour and grab a pint at half-price before 9pm on weekdays! Diners who prefer non-alcoholic beverages have the option of the ever-popular Thai Iced Milk Tea, as well as a range of fruit teas. Cheval Chi Bao Platter - Pandan Chicken or Thai Fish Cake are the perfect options for adventurous diners.  Choose 3 items from a wide range of platter with only $23 to satisfy your various appetites. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hong Kong Roast Chicken, Curry Fish (Whole Red Snapper), Sweet & Sour Pork, Signature Truffle Fried Rice with Egg & Crispy Shredded Dried Scallops, Crispy Homemade Tofu with Minced Pork

    Located in Kensington Square, Cheval Whiskey Cocktail Bar boasts a wide range of whiskeys from both European and Asian regions, and Whiskey lovers can experience the intricacies in our distinct malts. If you are looking for something more "throat-friendly", try out some of our gins or cocktails selections. Featuring a quiet and cozy VIP room, it is a great place for celebrations and events, or even just a casual hang-out to catch up with close friends or family. Start off your evenings with one of the classics whiskeys, such as Chivas or Johnny Walker on the rocks, coupled with delicious offerings from our snack menu; or go wild with one or more of our more exclusive options, like the Nikka or Kavalan. (Jun 2021)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Welcome to Chez [pronounced ‘shay’] West! A contemporary training restaurant located within ITE College West. We offer both traditional and modern French dishes prepared by aspiring Technical Diploma students in Culinary Arts with Restaurant Management. Chez West features a menu of traditional and modern French dishes prepared by aspiring chefs enrolled in ITE College West’s Technical Diploma in Culinary Arts with Restaurant Management. A training restaurant located on campus, it provides students with the opportunity to perfect cooking techniques learnt in the classrooms. The interior of the restaurant exudes charm through its minimalist and contemporary finishing. Chez West delights diners with cuisine showcasing different French cooking techniques. Dress code and reservations are required. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Vichyssoise, Beef Oyster Blade, Duck Breast, Lemon Meringue

html:
• ABOUT

    It seems that Korean fried chicken has cemented its place in the Hallyu revolution, and fans of the crispy treat have had good cause to rejoice since the introduction of Chicken Up. Moist, tender, and coated with that addictive thin, crunchy, less greasy coating, Chicken Up's exact technique is a closely guarded secret. While the classic version holds a special place in our hearts (and stomachs), those who enjoy a little spice should head straight for their signature Spicy Up and the milder, sweeter YangNyum style. Fried chicken in Korea is often accompanied by alcohol beverages but those not looking to take advantage of the restaurant's beer and soju offerings can easily content themselves with a traditional bingsu dessert instead. (Nov 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The meat is allegedly marinated for twelve hours and then cooked using the venerated Korean double-fry method. The exterior is crunchy, the inside moist, pleasantly juicy; and it's not overly sauced." -SG Now

    Winner of Best F&B establishment casual dining 2019 (Epicurean Star Award Singapore ) Chico Loco prides itself on delivering on taste without compromising on health with their concept of ‘dirty healthy plates’. A meal here would be incomplete without their signature rotisserie chicken. Undoubtedly the star of the menu, this bird has been slow-roasted with Chico Loco’s signature herb blend for over an hour. Dip into any of their house-made sauces to enjoy a taste of Mexico and enjoy your mains alongside a selection of sides such as a refreshing Thai-inspired slaw. The lamb is also note-worthy. Each bite is beautifully tender with the perfect meat-to-fat ratio that just melts in your mouth. Making a debut on the new menu after much demand are Tacos that The Loco Group are known for. Choose from 4 different delicious fillings such as the pulled rotisserie chicken, pulled slow cooked "barbacoa" lamb or mexican-spiced jackfruit. Finish your meal with crispy hot Churros or a guilt-free natural Coconut Soft Serve. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Not Your Average Nacho, Rotisserie Chicken & Lamb, Mexican ’Elotes’ Street Corn, Tacos, Grilled Marinated Chicken Thigh Burger, Chico Slaw, Churros and Coconut Soft Serve

    Established in 2008, CHILLAS Indian Restaurant specializes in authentic North Indian Cuisine. They’ve built a household name for themselves with a loyal following as they’ve never failed to satisfy the taste buds of their customers. You’ll be spoilt for choice at CHILLAS Indian Restaurant, as the robust menu boasts a wide array of meat and vegetarian dishes. The house specialty tandoori meats, marinated and cooked until perfection in the tandoor, is definitely not to be missed. Vegetarians can choose from a variety of Paneers cooked in different curries, Shahi Malai Kofta, mixed vegetables and cottage cheese dumplings simmered in a creamy almond sauce. And of course, well-loved staples like Fish Head Curry, Chicken Tikka Masala and Prawn Vindaloo are guaranteed to leave you with a happy belly! (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shahi Malai Kofta, Fish Head Curry, Chicken Tikka Masala, Prawn Vindaloo

    A Chinese seafood restaurant in Chinatown, this eatery serves up a mix of Chinese cuisine and old school tze char dishes like Chilli Crab and Sambal Kang Kong. Chinatown Seafood Restaurant aims to serve the masses, both locals and tourists alike. If you’re in the area looking for a drink, go to Chinatown Seafood Restaurant for delicious tze char goodness with beer on tap! Our favourite combo: a plate of fragrant Yang Zhou Fried Rice and Salted Egg Yolk Prawns to share over a few pints of beer. If you’re looking for a quick and easy lunch spot, they serve a good selection of dim sum dishes to satiate your hunger and satisfy your tastebuds. A fan favourite that you must try is their Xiao Long Baos, deliciously steamed and filled with soupy meaty goodness. Try their Potstickers if you’re in the mood for something fried. The best part? They pair so well with beers and liquors on hand for a chilled out drinking session. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Singapore Chilli Crab, Black Pepper Crab, Singapore Laksa, Shelled Prawns with Salted Egg Yolk, Xiao Long Bao

html:
• ABOUT

    Nothing is as you’ll expect when you come for a meal at Chinoiserie. A scallop har gow, for instance, is not just a plump sliver of scallop wrapped in a starchy white parcel. Instead, you’ll find your ‘dim sum’ presented as a light, fluffy scallop mousse, piped onto a hotate shell with a layer of crab bisque. There’s something new to discover each time you have dinner at Chinoiserie. Chef Justin Quek is no stranger to fine dining cooking, and he’s taken his knowledge of French techniques and married it with his penchant for Asian flavours. Menus here are prix fixe or a la carte, and you’ll find seasonal ingredients like French Challan ducks and Manjimup black truffles. But rather than roasted in their own fat, the gamey ducks, are tossed in a wok and cooked over roaring flames to medium rare. Vegetables like artichokes and asparagus are stir-fried Asian-style, rather than served as a Western salad. Popular favourites here include a wild coral cod fillet, seared till the scales are crispy and served in a sweet-sour sauce, as well as French poussin stuffed with claypot rice. Leave room for the desserts — the banana flambé in rum and salted gula java ice cream is a great way to end an ever interesting meal. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Duck Foie Gras Xiao Long Bao, Steamed Scallop and Sea Urchin Har Gow, Crispy Scales Wild Coral Cod Fillet, Claypot Rice, Banana Flambe in Rum with Salted Gula Java Ice Cream

  • THE BUZZ

    “(Justin Quek) adopts an unorthodox approach: cooking ingredients that are not typically associated with Chinese cuisine with Chinese cooking methods.” -Michelin Guide SG, July 2018.

  • $45 EXECUTIVE LUNCH

    Enjoy a sophisticated French-Asian lunch at CHINOISERIE. The 3-course meal starts off with your choice of Warm Crispy Soft Crab Salad or Jerusalem Artichoke Velouté, followed by tantalizing Main Course options which include Organic Chicken braised in 'Vin Jaune’ or Daily Catch of the Day. Finish off with a specially curated Seasonal Dessert. When: Monday-Friday, not applicable for weekends or PHs Price: $45++ Click here to view the menu

• ABOUT

    Well-known for its extraordinary sushi and sashimi, Chojiro serves a wide range of grilled and tempura dishes to satisfy your cravings. A snugly hidden gem in Telok Ayer, this affordable conveyor belt sushi restaurant from Osaka is staffed by a team of six experienced Japanese sushi chefs that plates up high-quality sushi offering you more bang for your buck. Nigiri lovers should definitely kickstart their meal with the Tuna Nigiri and Shrimp Nigiri. Served atop expertly rolled rolls of fluffy short-grained rice, the fish is fatty and luscious while the prawns are juicy and succulent. The classic Salmon Nigiri is also not to be missed out on! Plump and slightly chewy, the slices of raw fish are perfectly seasoned. For those feeling adventurous, you can opt for the Kyoto Style Pressed Mackerel Sushi. Packed with black fungus and mushroom bits, the slices of sushi are fragrant and extremely flavourful. Fancier options include the Hanahitohira Set. This exquisite meal includes as many as 10 different sushi such as Ikura Gunkan and Tuna Otoro Nigiri alongside traditional favorites such as the Chawanmushi. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shrimp Nigiri, Kyoto Style Pressed Mackerel Sushi, Hanahitohira Set, Chawanmushi
