    Chong Qing Grilled Fish presents the best of grilled fish with Sichuan hotpot as well as other classic and modern renditions of authentic Sichuan cuisine. With its first dining concept set up in 2010, Chong Qing Grilled Fish is the first in Singapore to brings to the local F&B scene the best representation of the vibrancy and multiplicity of Chong Qing cuisine. To sum up, the brand represents ‘A Celebration of Cultures’, fusing authentic Chinese cuisine with innovative modern creation; taking diners on a gastronomic and cultural experience. Chong Qing cuisine has always been known for its deliciously bold flavors, unapologetically rich, savory and spiciness. The soup base is packed with heavenly flavors of the stock and various ingredients have been sensibly incorporated for that added richness to appeal to the younger crowd and elderly folks. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Grilled Fish, Dry Pot Willow Mushroom, Hot-Plate Mutton with Cumin, Offal Slices, Spicy Chicken Cubes, Sichuan 'Water-cooked' Beef in Fragrant Chilli Oil

• ABOUT

    Brought to you by the same guys who own homegrown culinary behemoth PS.Cafe, Chopsuey Cafe promises an East-meets-West escapade with its intriguing bevy of traditional Chinese dishes and creative new takes on favourites which pay homage to the relief and fond memories of tucking into comfy Chinese food while abroad. Tucked away within hip Dempsey Hill, Chopsuey is situated within a charming black-and-white colonial-style building. Take a seat within and enjoy the wide selection of traditional and creative dim sum handmade daily and steamed-to-order. From the humble Traditional Har Gao and Char Siew Pau to the more decadent Crispy Lobster Wantons and Orange Duck Dumplings, we love all of them. Don’t forget to enjoy a few of the brunch specials, featuring the likes of the tantalising Bully Beef & Crackling Egg Pie and the irresistible Chopsuey Big Breakfast, where generous portions of crispy bacon, eggs, sesame-soy mushrooms, sweet & sour baked beans, and other wholesome goodies are served up on a platter piping hot. As for mains, the Hainanese-inspired Cooky’s Pork Chop with Chips & Edamame as well as the Steamed ‘Lasagna’ of Snapper & Tofu are hot favourites that you cannot miss. Wash it all down with a refreshing cocktail, concocted with the freshest fruits, herbs, and spices from the region. One thing’s settled, for your favourite Chinese dishes with a twist, look no further than Chopsuey Cafe. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Traditional Har Gao, Crispy Lobster Wantons, Orange Duck Dumplings, Cooky’s Pork Chop with Chips & Edamame, Szechuan Pepper Chilli Chicken, Steamed ‘Lasagna’ of Snapper & Tofu

    Hidden away in the Bukit Timah enclave, this quaint cafe has been serving up classic French dishes since 2002. The menu boasts a variety of brunch items, tartines, mains, and desserts, making it a perfect stop at any time of day. The all-day brunch plates offer the ultimate comfort food experience. Regular patrons swear by the Eggs Benedict, where two perfectly poached eggs and ham sit on toast, drizzled with creamy hollandaise sauce. For those who prefer something sweet to start the day, go for the French Toast that's drizzled in a berry compote, or pick from a selection of freshly-baked pastries. Other quintessential French favourites include the Croque Monsieur, an open-faced ham sandwich topped with melted cheese, and the Quiche of the Day. No meal would be complete without a serving of their savoury Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream, or the burnt goodness of a Crème Brûlée. The cafe also doubles up as a baker, with homemade loaves displayed in rustic wooden baskets. You won't be able to resist picking up a few on your way home. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggs Benedict, French Toast, Croque Monsieur, Quiche of the Day, Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream

html:
• ABOUT

    Located on a quiet side street off Newton Circus flanked by towering apartment blocks is a very unlikely building. The structure is a sight to behold: through an ancient Chinese gateway with giant roaring lions guarding either side of its doors lies the Chui Huay Lim Club. Founded in 1845 as a place for prominent Teochew families to meet, you wouldn't guess the site's 166-year history from the brand new building that just opened in October. The home of Singapore's oldest Teochew community club, you can be sure that dining at Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine restaurant is one of the most authentic Teochew experiences possible. Run by the JUMBO Group of Restaurants, the food here has been refined to perfection by the keen eyes of generations of critical Teochew matriarchs. Classic dishes range from Cold Crab to Braised Duck, but for variety you'll also find some familiar favourites like Boiled Live Prawns and Chilli Crab. The seafood comes from tanks lining the restaurant, and was some of the best steamed pomfret the Chope Team has ever had. The house specialty though is clearly the Teochew Style Roasted Suckling Pig, which multi-generations seem to flock to the restaurant for day after day. Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine offers traditional cuisine in a comfortable and tasteful setting - a must-try dining experience for your entire family, and you don't even need to be a member of the club! (Feb 2012)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Crab, Braised Duck, Boiled Live Prawns, Chilli Crab, Teochew Style Roasted Suckling Pig, Fish Maw Soup with Crab Meat, Teochew Braised Duck, Deep Fried Ngoh Hiang, Claypot Braised Beancurd with Seafood, Braised Conpoy with Eight Vegetarian Treasures, Orh Nee, Encrusted Deep Fried Yam Sticks

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    Placing beauty at the heart of everything they do, Chura Sushi Bar prides itself on the artful presentation of freshly picked quality ingredients that provide a beautiful feast for your senses. Carefully shaped and crafted by the bar’s team of highly skilled sushi chefs, enjoy an authentic Japanese dining experience complete with intoxicating cocktails adorned in captivating blossoms and hues. Kickstart your meal at Chura Sushi Bar with their signature Chura’s Signature Roll Sushi. Garnished with sea urchin, caviar and ikura, this eye-catching creation is served as a delectable bite-sized Temari form that contains a tasty mix of fresh tuna and salmon sashimi. Other deliciously colourful sushi options include Rainbow and Spider. Mentaiko lovers will definitely fall in love at first bite with the Aburi Salmon Mentaimayo. Glazed with a generous layer of mentaiko sauce that is lightly torched, this signature salmon roll is a must-try menu item. Create beautiful memories with family and friends at Chura Sushi Bar with its vast array of sushi and bar bites when you take your pick from the nigiri sushi, spoon sushi and chirashi bowls. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chura’s Signature Roll Sushi, Rainbow, Spider, Aburi Salmon Mentaimayo

• ABOUT

    Imagine walking along the busy streets of an Indian town, chomping heartily on some crispy samosas while slurping up some refreshing lassi, a welcome respite from the hot Indian sun. Now, experience incredible India not too far from home as Chutney Mary transports you there with their popular Indian street-style delights. We hear their piping hot chaats are consistent crowd favourites and we instantly see why. Choose from more than 10 options hailing from all across India, but we recommend the Bhel Puri, a tantalising combination of crispy flour pancakes and puffed rice served with onions and potatoes mixed with spices. Meat-lovers will enjoy the interesting selection of kebabs and scrumptious mains like Butter Chicken, Goan Prawn Curry and Raan Peshawari, a spring lamb leg marinated in yoghurt, herbs and spices. Vegetarians alike have a wide selection to choose from, but we say go for the Allu Gobi Mattar, a gorgeous dish of potatoes mixed with yummy cauliflower and green peas. Pair your dishes with some Naan or Dum Biryani, wash it all down with a Mango Lassi, and there you go, satisfying Indian food at reasonable prices doesn’t take a trip to India to find! (Jul 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pani Puri, Pav Bhaji, Dokla, Shammi Kebab, Tandoori Chicken, Raan Peshawari, Goan Prawn Curry, Butter Chicken, Allu Gobi Mattar

    Whenever you dine at The CIA Top Table restaurant, you are helping to support the future of the food service and hospitality industry. As an independent, not-for-profit college, The CIA directs its resources right back into our core mission – to provide the best professional culinary education to thousands of students each year in our degree, professional development, and food enthusiast programs. The students who have prepared and served your meal today are fulfilling their degree requirements at The CIA. We encourage you to engage them in conversation, ask them about their education experience, and provide any useful feedback that can help them improve their performance and your overall dining experience. (Aug 2019)

    Specialised marts are fast becoming the norm here - if you've never browsed through the quirky and unusual items in a Japanese grocery store, you're really missing out - and Cibo is undoubtedly one of the best we have. If you're a nonna at heart, their extensive range of quality basics to more artisanal ingredients and drinks imported straight from Italy, will have you in raptures of joy. Neatly displayed in the modern store, the open wood and metal shelves stand out against the white exposed brick walls, and invite you to browse the aisles stocked with things you'd never find in our general supermarkets. But as all good nonnas know, nothing beats actually trying the products. The good news is - you won't have to go far! Cibo cannily provides a menu of handmade dishes like Lasagna and Ravioli Porcini & Tartufo (homemade egg pasta stuffed with porcini and truffle in creamy sauce), appetisers like Tagliere di Addettati (a selection of cold cuts) and Puccia, their own special sourdough sandwich stuffed with Italian special varieties, as well as a long list of pizzas. If you're simply peckish, their fresh cheeses and wines make for a good snack as well.Perhaps this really is your first foray into specialised marts. In which case, Cibo's friendly staff, attractive mix of traditionally Italian items, modern grocer décor, and unpretentious Italian classics, will have you glad to say 'Ciao'. (Jan 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Puccia, Ravioli Aragosta & Granchio, Bolognese, Tagliere di Affettati, Porcini Pizza

• ABOUT

    CIN CIN derives its name from the sound of clinking glasses amidst lively celebrations. Located in the heart of the Tanjong Pagar district, CIN CIN is the perfect spot to raise a toast to the good life. With delicious bar bites and close to 100 different labels of gin sourced from across the globe, what's there not to love? The bar food menu is tightly curated, while also maintaining multiple choices for vegetarians. The Truffle Fries are a surefire crowd-pleaser - delicious french fries are tossed with roasted garlic aioli, shaved parmesan and sliced truffles, resulting in a dish that is simply divine! The Gruyere Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms is another tempting delight. Button mushrooms are encrusted in panko crumbs, before premium gruyere cheese is melted all over it. Served with a roasted garlic aioli dip, this mouthwatering dish will be gobbled up before you know it. The Spicy Sriracha Buffalo Wings are a modern take on an old favourite. Breaded chicken wings are deep-fried and then dunked in the universally-beloved Sriracha Ketchup sauce till deliciousness oozes out of every bite. Apart from enjoying the bar bites straight up, diners will definitely not want to miss trying a tipple or two from CIN CIN's extensive bar menu! (Jun 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "You can choose from well over a dozen gins as your base, followed by mixers that include a variety of tonics, soda waters and ginger beer. There are 14 types of bitters to choose from and while they're optional, it's hard not to want to experiment with things like Bittermens Orange Cream Citrate and Dr Adam Elmigirab Dandelion & Burdock." -The Peak "Other options are pretty well executed, like the toothsome black cod ceviche ($20) and the pulled pork sliders (with a bit of Dijon bite, $16)." -SG Now "Some recommended gins to try include the Del Gin Professore Madame ($17 glass, $200 bottle), The Corsair Steampunk ($22 glass, $300 bottle) and the Sipsmith VJOP (Very Junipery Over Proof) ($22 glass, $300 bottle). The characters of these gins are so unusual it'll surprise even the most seasoned of gin drinkers." -Time Out Singapore

  • SAVE 50% WITH CHOPEDEALS

• ABOUT

    Take respite from Singapore’s sweltering heat at Citrus By The Pool, a cosy, air-conditioned restaurant with large windows letting in lots of natural light. Conveniently located at the Woodlands Swimming Complex (a 10-minute walk or short drive from both the Woodlands and Marsiling MRT stations), Citrus By The Pool is a great for a relaxing meal or a casual tea with friends.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers plus Fusion mains, thirst-quenching drinks, and desserts at pocket-friendly prices. The star of the menu is the Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, where the spicy and piquant flavours of a Thai classic have been expertly interpreted into a contemporary pasta dish, replete with fresh prawns, mussels, and squid. Dare to be bold and different with the Chef’s specialty BIG Boss Burger which consist of a tender and juicy beef + mutton (BM) patty, accompanied with crispy fried onions, sliced tomato, cucumber, crispy lettuce and purple cabbage slaw, smothered in the all-time favourite satay sauce on charcoal buns. Of course, no meal is complete without dessert and the Molten Chocolate Lava Cake is not to be missed. These incredibly decadent individual chocolate cakes with oozing molten centres are the best way to end off a great meal. Citrus By The Pool is an ideal option for all kinds of celebrations and every meal in between. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Seafood Pasta, BIG Boss Burger, Cajun Lamb Rack, Catch of the Day, Smoked Duck Breast, Molten Chocolate Lava Cake

  • ABOUT

    A heartwarming destination where diners gather to celebrate their kinship and love for exceptional cuisine, Clan 7 is a modern day Chinese restaurant that seeks to present the best of culinary craftsmanship through an innovative repertoire of traditional classics. Specially curated for your dining pleasure, the delicious menu presented by Clan 7 looks forward to offering an unforgettable dining experience for you and your loved ones. Begin your meal with a few cold starters or hot dishes to whet your appetite. We recommend ordering the Fish Otah and Fish Skin in Cone. Bundled up in different flavoured wafer cones, the tender fish otah and crispy fish skin is topped off with a tasty in house sauce for the ultimate indulgence. Other equally innovative dishes include the Shredded Kampung Chicken with Truffle, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg Yolk and Smoked Cod Fish Fillet. Aside from traditional plates of Smoked Char Siew Ribs and Sweet and Sour Pork dishes, Clan 7 also serves Western styled meat dishes such as your well loved angus steak. For those looking to satisfy their steak cravings, the Chef’s Special of Australian Angus Tomahawk is a hearty portion of mouthwatering meat marinated in spicy sichuan flavours you simply cannot miss out on! Another chef’s special at the restaurant, the Spicy Fried Diced Beef is a great sharing dish that features Australian 150 days grain fed Wagyu M7. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Otah and Fish Skin in Cone, Smoked Cod Fish Fillet, Chef’s Special of Australian Angus Tomahawk, Spicy Fried Diced Beef

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/clan-7

html:
• ABOUT

    Clan Cafe brings the essentials of good living into one ethereal space. The all-day menu delivers nourishing fare that comforts both the palate and the soul with its selection of brunch favourites and East-Asian inspired plates. Start the day off right with a healthy homemade granola, or nosh on brunch staples like smashed avocado toast to a good classic fry-up – eggs any way you like – to stay energised throughout the day. Beyond the usual brunch fare, expect hearty offerings with distinctive Asian inflections. Indulge in an irresistible bowl of mussels in an aromatic coconut curry with crusty garlic bread – perfectly paired with a crisp white wine, tuck into a wholesome miso-roasted salmon brown rice bowl with seaweed and pickled lotus root, or settle for a crowd-pleasing pastrami sandwich with crispy shoestring fries. Enjoy a moment of calm from the daily grind with a slice of your favourite chocolate cake or kueh salat, complemented with a cup of coffee by Papa Palheta or invigorating tea blends by A.muse Projects. Recharge with a variety of locally-brewed kombuchas and cold pressed juices, or relax and unwind with an elegant selection of wines, craft cocktails and premium gin & tonics. A tropical respite in the heart of the Chinatown precinct, the cafe is here to host your daily breakfast conversations, lunch meetings, and gatherings all throughout the day. The cafe extends to a tropical floral concierge by This Humid House – set against a whimsical botanical mural by Ripple Root. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cage-Free Fry Up, Steamed Mussels, Miso Roasted Salmon, Pastrami Sandwich

    The Cliff redefines traditional Italian dining by constant innovation with an expressive appeal. Amidst views of lush greenery, The Cliff presents Cali-Italian dining with fresh produce, authentic flavours and an easy-going vibe. The Cliff dishes out an extensive selection of handmade pizzas, pastas and other Italian favourites delicately paired with the finest selection of premium wines. With exquisite Italian fare traditionally handmade yet with creative touches, expect an elevated experience at The Cliff. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Selections of Pizzas: Tonno Picante, Fruitti Di Mare, Sunrise, Diavola, Hawaiian, Pancetta Cacio E Pepe

  • LA PIZZA ROSSA & BIANCA PROMOTION

    Cooked to perfection in a wood-fired oven, these handmade pizzas have a puffed up pillowy edge that is fluffy and light, blistered from the intense heat. Every pizza is made on the spot and is a testament to Jeremy Barragan’s dedication for fresh produce. Savour crowd favourites like the tonno picante and fruitti di mare to unique flavours like sunrise and diavola, and even his special take on the traditional hawaiian pizza with pineapple slices, pancetta and jalapeno for that spicy kick. html:
• ABOUT

    Glocal is a poor man’s portmanteau for the glamourous local gastronomy presented at The Clifford Pier at The Fullerton Bay Hotel. How else to describe the dizzyingly gorgeous lobby, fluttering with hushed, 5-star service? You’d never know this spot once harboured one of the city’s original bustling ports of call for maritime trade. Since 1933, ships would be warmly greeted with savoury local specialties dished out by floating hawkers. Honouring that charming bit of history, The Clifford Pier acts as a showstopping backdrop for all-day Southeast Asian nibbles.It’s hard to imagine the glittery shores of Marina Bay hosting anything other than the sleek luxuries it's known for, The Fullerton Bay Hotel being its crown jewel. As such, it’s a lovely thought that The Clifford Pier pays respects to the rich tradition of the Bay’s enterprising currents, showcasing the best that Old Singapore has to offer then and now. And The Clifford Pier isn’t paying tribute with just a local-tinted menu, but rather a fully educated selection including rich Laksa, Soup Kambing, The Pier's Lobster Roll, Heritage Bites and Wagyu Rendang.However the homey cuisine doesn’t collide with the frothy aesthetic of the cavernous dining room. As if plucked from the set of a Baz Luhrmann film, the lushly appointed space is swathed in nautical hues of mineral blues, sandy buffs and rich textures. Under ivory arches with a view of the bay, the familiar cuisine at The Clifford Pier is just the opulence you’d expect from The Fullerton Bay Hotel. (Oct 2016)

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2019 - MOST ROMANTIC RESTAURANT

    Our diners have voted The Clifford Pier as Most Romantic Restaurant in Chope Diners’ Choice 2019.

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

• ABOUT

    The first global outpost of the famous New York institution, Singapore's Clinton Street Baking Company is like a cleaned-up, swisher version of the slightly weathered original that, over almost three decades, has won ceaseless crowds over with its comforting brunch options and charming East Village bonhomie. Already a popular favourite amongst in-the-know brunch crowds here, the Singapore outlet at quiet Purvis Street offers an understated variation of the bustling New York experience. All the classics from its savoury-sweet Southern-style brunch menu are here in Singapore: crispy-skinned and tender Buttermilk Fried Chicken served on maple-kissed waffles, and fluffy hotcakes slicked with warm maple butter then paired with your choice of tangy blueberry compote, chocolate chunks, or banana walnut. What's brunch without some eggy indulgence? Other New York staples include the ubiquitous Eggs Benedict, here served over a crumbly Southern buttermilk biscuit, and hearty Huevos Rancheros - fried eggs in a party of Mexican beans, guacamole, sour cream, and tomato salsa, all topped with a heap of Monterey Jack, then broiled to cheesy perfection. The unspoken crowning glory here is the brunch cocktails you can get round the clock for that real "Sex and the City" touch of weekend revelry; Mimosas, Bellinis and Whisky Sours paired with your carby breakfast keep Brunch O' Clock going before you sensibly sober up with a bracing black coffee and hit the town. (Nov 2016)

  • SAVE 10% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    Enjoy 10% off at Clinton Street Baking Company when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • THE BUZZ

    "The pancakes absolutely live up to the hype. The blueberry-studded stack, served with more blueberries in the form of a compote and a small ramekin of warm maple butter on the side, is every bit worth the price." -TODAY "Standout dishes include the Southern Breakfast: the perfect way to trade your weekend hangover for a food coma with its comforting combo of eggs, sugar-cured bacon, cheese grits, and fried green tomatoes." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken & Waffles, Pancakes with Warm Maple Butter, Eggs Benedict, Southern Breakfast, Huevos Rancheros, Clinton Street Omelette, Blueberry Pancakes

• ABOUT

    Nestled in the Bukit Pasoh conservation area, Clos Pasoh is a chic reimagining of the French brasserie for today's urbane food and wine lover. Both its menu and wine list reflect current tastes for seriously good things sourced with intent and expertise presented in an unpretentious, casually sophisticated style.Hidden away on the second floor of a heritage building built in the early shophouse style circa 1840, it is named for the clos (meaning a "walled vineyard" in French) and the pasoh (a nod to its location and the Malay name for earthen pots used to store water and rice). Every space - from the Dining Room to the Terrace, Wine & Cheese Room and Chef's Table - cradles guests in effortless luxury that is designed to take you from tête-à-têtes and power lunches to lazy weekend brunches and lively nights on the town. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Foie Gras, Tête de Veau, Trippes et Caviar, Bisque Coco-Homard, Pot-Au-Feu, Volaille aux Écrevisses, Mont Blanc Cassis, Chariot de Riz Au Lait

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Celebrated Chef Rishi Naleendra proudly unveils his highly-anticipated new undertaking, Cloudstreet, a showcase of thoughtful, expressive dishes and immaculate service distilled through an unrivalled culinary experience. What started as a chance encounter between Chef Rishi and Gareth Burnett, Cloudstreet's General Manager, resulted in the genesis of a concept that reflects the duo's shared desire to create a dining room that exists on the philosophy of true hospitality. Joined by Sommelier Vinodhan Veloo, whose expertise has led him to devise the wine programs at Michelin-starred venues, they have forged the perfect team to see this vision to fruition. Guests can expect a progressive yet sophisticated approach to gastronomy - marrying disparate cultures and influences in an exuberant expression, it champions ingredient-driven cuisine and seasonality. The food is enhanced by a wine list featuring around 350 natural and classic style wines which pay homage to some greats alongside small, independent winemakers from around the world. The restaurant has a strong focus on beverage pairings both alcoholic and temperance. (Jul 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "When a new restaurant comes along as wonderful as Cloudstreet, the perfectly acceptable, understandable, and professionally condoned course of action is to shout about it from the highest heritage shophouse rooftop." -Lifestyle Asia"Chef Naleendra's style is accessible fine dining that comes from his heart. It's dreamy, tasty and heartwarming. If this is what being on a cloud tastes like, maybe we don't want to get off." -The Business Times"Speaking of drinks, be sure to have a look at Sommelier Vinodhan Veloo's wine list featuring 350 labels of natural and classic style wines. Lured from Odette, he's gone to great lengths to ensure that diners can understand what they're drinking – if they want to – with helpful notes on the wine jargon on the margins." -City Nomads

• ABOUT

    An inviting and progressive wine bar located on Club Street, Club Street Wine Room brings to the lively alley an exciting repertoire of tipples and comfort food. Designed to welcome diners in for an evening filled with heady alcoholic delights, the dining room area features a large skylight over a communal bar area that gives the quaint shophouse a sense of airy openness by day and intimate candlelit ambience by night. This vibrant 45-seater wine bar is right up your alley if you’re on the hunt for delicious and innovative fine dining with a twist. With something for every palate, the wine room’s catalogue spans across multiple regions to invite imbibers on a journey of discovery and exploration for a swirling good time. Fancy a quick bite accompanied by good wine? Club Street Wine Room delivers with elevated comfort bites and hearty main courses specially curated to indulge diners in a tasty experience. A whopping full kilogram of aged beef on the bone seared to perfection and plated up with dried beef fat potato terrine frites, the Steak Au Poivre is a great choice for red meat lovers. Classic bar bites offered here include the Oysters Grilled with Bacon Jam, Truffle Potato Cheese Fries, and Catfish Deli Pork Sausage Roll. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oysters Grilled with Bacon Jam, Truffle Potato Cheese Fries, Steak Au Poivre, Sea Soul No. 4

html:
• ABOUT

    Sometimes, we forget we live in the Tropics, where people travel miles to for their summer vacations. When that happens, we need places like Coastes to remind us what life can be like as an islander, eating and drinking on one of the nicest beaches we have to offer. Situated along a golden stretch of Sentosa's Siloso Beach, Coastes offers rustic charm and a casual, laid-back beach vibe where the sunbeds and deck chairs flow right to the water's edge. This breezy beach bar serves premium beers, house pour spirits, and hearty beach food. It has been a popular spot for families with young children precisely for the kid-friendly food as well as for couples on romantic dates and beach bums who would enjoy the stretch of lovely warm sand. Coastes is the perfect place to chill while indulging in good ol’ comfort food, so tuck into the generous servings of mouthwatering burgers, pizzas, pastas, and delicious fresh seafood, and soak in the resort island-feel and carefree vibe. The meals here are soul-warming and homely, so with the sun, the sand, and the sea, we can't think of a better island getaway less than an hour away from the heart of the city. (Sep 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “We all know kids get restless at restaurants, but rarely will you see them wanting to leave Coastes. The reason? It’s located right on the sand of Siloso Beach on Sentosa.” -Expat Living Singapore “This laid back rustic café-meets-beach bar is a great spot for wee ones to jump in the waves or build sandcastles on the beach, while mama and papa munch on breakfast classics like Waffles, Eggs Benedict or Pancakes…” -Sassymama

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seafood Stew, Coastes Chicken Wings, Eggs Benedict

• ABOUT

    Originated from Bangkok, COCA Restaurant first opened its doors in Singapore in 1987 and remains well-known amongst Singaporean diners as an established Thai-Chinese hotpot restaurant. By marrying authentic Thai cuisine with traditional elements of Cantonese home-style cooking, it is COCA’s distinctive flavours which resonated well with many through the decades. Take your pick from COCA’s scrumptious House Specialties such as Fish Glue, Shrimp Paste and Handmade Dumplings, along with an endless array of fresh seasonal vegetables, meat, and seafood offerings. Be spoilt for choices, only at COCA! (Aug 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "COCA is a revered institution in the area of steamboats - good, fresh ingredients, special recipe chilli dip, and wide selection of side dishes to add diversity to the steamboat menu." -Singapore Dine

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Deep Fried Prawn Paste, Spicy Thai Silver Noodle Salad, Pad Thai

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Restored the shophouse at the corner of Geylang Lorong 25, we were inspired to keep the space open but yet create a comfortable and casual dining experience.At Cochon, we specialise in everything pork, from our signature spareribs to beer-marinated pork belly. Our meats are smoked in-house and then tenderly cooked for hours to ensure that our guests can enjoy the most perfect fall-off-the-bone standards. Don't forget to pair meats with our pocket-friendly wines and Belgian draft beers for an even more wholesome experience! For side-dishes to round out your meals, feel free to try our Cochon coleslaw, mac & cheese, Japanese corn cob, truffled parmesan fries and baked potato.It’s a simple idea - Cochon. And sometimes, simple great food and drinks in good company are just what we all need. (Oct 2021)

    Craving for authentic Thai food and delicious mookata? Cocokata offers both at affordable prices! This humble eatery dishes up a variety of mouthwatering Thai classics and as many as five unique sauces for mookata fans to enjoy. The Mookata Value Set is a must-try menu option for those on casual dates or family gatherings. Made for two or four diners, choose from everyday favourites such as cheese tofu, crabstick, mama noodles alongside other meat, seafood and vegetable options to cook and enjoy with the restaurant’s signature in house sauces. We recommend going for the Coconut Spicy Sauce for the perfect burst of savoury and fiery flavours. Non-spice lovers will also fall in love at first dip with this fiery sauce blended with the sweetness of coconut. Moderately spicy, this well-balanced sauce is a yummy accompaniment to any meal! Spice up your meal with a plethora of tasty sides such as the Signature Chilli Prawn, Red Curry Pork and Crispy Pork Belly available here. (Aug 2021)

• ABOUT

    CLOVE, the all-day dining destination at Swissôtel The Stamford, is set to transform into a CoComelon world, where children can immerse themselves in a fully interactive dining experience alongside their parents.With some tables creatively converted into booths and designed as school buses, little ones will be thrilled to be having their meal on a bus ride and using their own set of CoComelon branded utensils as they tuck into a selection of their favourite characters’ treats such as the TomTom Favourite Burger, served with a side of French fries and salad with freshly harvested vegetables from the hotels’ very own on-property Aquaponics farm and Bingo Paw Bun. Grown-ups can enjoy dishes such as the Watermelon Waldorf salad or share the tomato Soup in CoComelon Bun with their children.Indulge in CoComelon-inspired beverages and desserts such as the CoCo-CaDo smoothie and Cody’s Mochi Yoghurt Pop and Wheels on the Bus Oreo milkshake.Adults and children alike are also in for a treat with the CoComelon Itsy Bitsy Bites, available all day. For the next birthday party, the thoughtful and fun CoComelon Party Pack is must-have for every little CoComelon fan! Set on placemats featuring a maze and colouring activity, children can have fun while learning and playing with their parents during mealtimes. They can participate in activities within the playpen or explore an imaginary musical journey via floor stickers that resemble a piano keyboard throughout the space to create their own adventures with their favourite characters off screen. Available exclusively at this one-of-a-kind café in the world, parents can purchase a wide array of specially curated CoComelon merchandise and toys for their children to engage with their favourite characters in new ways following the staycation experience. This includes an interactive JJ plush doll, a pack of CoComelon figures as well as house and school-themed playsets. What’s more, balloons will be available for purchase to the excitement of your little ones; and CoComelon-themed posters, hanging mobiles, standees and a colourful photo wall of all your kids’ much loved CoComelon characters against a backdrop of Singapore’s most iconic spots will create Instagrammable moments and capture great memories for the entire family. (Jan 2022)

html:
• ABOUT

    Fuelled by a strong passion and love for Singapore's well-loved dishes, The Coconut Club was set up to bring diners a truly local experience.Served with a hearty portion of coconut rice, anchovies, peanuts, cucumber, fried egg and sambal, pick from a variety of different sets of ingredients to customise your authentic Nasi Lemak adventure.Seafood lovers will be happy to know that the restaurant offers a variety of fresh seafood dishes. Don't leave without trying the Sambal Tumis Sotong. Stir-fried in a fiery chilli paste, each piece of squid is coated with the perfect amount of sambal tumis with cherry tomatoes for a great kick. Their Sambal Lala dish is another winner in our books. The Venus clams are doused in a signature secret sauce before being left to sizzle in the pan.One other noteworthy dish aside from the traditional Chendol and classic Nasi Lemak, is the Homemade Otah. The Coconut Club's rendition in the form of charcoal-grilled fish paste with chunks of batang fish and traditional herbs and spices, wrapped in banana leaf. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ayam Goreng Berempah Set, Gado Gado, Homemade Otah, Iga Bakar, Terung Assam Manis

    An award-winning and dynamic specialty coffee concept from Hong Kong, The Coffee Academïcs was launched in 2015 and is pioneering a new wave of coffee concepts – boundaries are pushed, blends are perfected and beans are brought to flavourful life, all within the most stylish and social of café backdrops. Sourcing world-class coffee beans with a score of 92 to 94 points by the World Coffee Review – a “Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate” of the coffee world – their beans have achieved the distinct honour of being ranked highest in Asia and top three in the world. The Coffee Academïcs is the place to visit to satisfy your caffeine needs and to score your brunch goals with globally-inspired menu offerings. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Academics Breakfast, Smoked Salmon & Hash, Crispy Fish Fillet Tacos, Umami Pasta, Academics Cinnamon Churros

• ABOUT

    Located on the fifth floor of Peninsular Excelsior Hotel, Coleman’s Cafe takes its name from the eponymous street it is located on. With both indoor and outdoor seating, the buffet spread here is a feast of local to international delights. For starters, tuck into the slices of sashimi or seafood on ice. Craving a lighter start to the meal? Opt for a simple salad or soup to whet your appetite. No buffet is complete without a live carving station, and Coleman’s Cafe checks this box. Head to this station for hearty cuts of meat, with chef’s recommendations being the skewers of lamb, chicken, salmon or prawn. Get a selection of these as well as a side serve of fried potato sticks and salad for a balanced and satisfying meal. Don’t miss out on the DIY Ice Kachang for dessert! (July 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Scallop Salad, US Black Angus Tenderloin, Five Spice Lamb Rack, Atlanic Cod, Thai Red Curry Chicken, Japanese Katsudon, Banana Spilt

  • ABOUT

    With an elegant gold and royal blue interior, Collezione Lan offers authentic Italian cuisine that is sure to impress. Serving classy Italian fare at affordable prices and tasteful decor, Collezione Lan is the perfect place for casual dining with friends and family. To start off, go for their Burrata Cheese Salad. The creamy burrata is served atop a delicious toss of rocket, diced tomatoes and mangos with a drizzle of balsamic vinaigrette. The luxurious cheese creates a perfect blend of textures with crunchy fresh vegetables that whets your appetite for more to come. Other starters to try include their Mussels with Garlic Bread. Served with juicy plump mussels and addictive gravy, this creamy, garlicky dish is a must-order for sharing. Known for their wood-fired pizzas, Collezione offers a generous selection of flavours to choose from, all made with fresh ingredients. Parma Ham Pizza is their all-time signature, featuring savoury ham slices that are charred to perfection on top of thick, gooey cheese. If you're looking for a local twist, try their Chilli Crab Pizza. It’s served over a savoury sauce base with just the right amount of spice and generously topped with succulent crab meat. Diners looking for a meatier option can opt for their 150 grain fed Grilled Angus Ribeye. This delicious slab of meat is basted with a buttery sauce that brings out the meat's natural sweetness and perfectly complements its strong flavor. Collezione Lan's pristine leather seating, warm ambience, and authentic Italian cuisine make it a great place for a good meal at an affordable price. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Burrata Cheese Salad, Mussels with Garlic Bread, Parma Ham Pizza, Chilli Crab Pizza, Grilled Angus Ribeye

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/collezione-lan
name: Collezione Lan

html:
• ABOUT

    Curated with quality and the freshest ingredients, Collin’s seeks to bring together family, friends, and loved ones during meal times to indulge one's company with the language of love. With a dedication to making great food accessible and affordable, the restaurant’s carefully selected menu delights your taste buds through wholesome cooking. Established since 2012, Collin’s is an award-winning F&B local brand that has grown to be a household name with multiple outlets across Singapore. Visit Collin’s at Marina Square to enjoy freshly prepared meals. Dig into a hearty bowl of Manhattan Seafood Chowder with a piece of fragrant Homemade Garlic Bread to kickstart your meal. Featuring creamy tomato chowder, prawn, mussel, squid, baby clam, and an assortment of colourful vegetables, the latter is a piping bowl of comfort, perfect for any day. For cheese lovers, the Gouda Cheese Sticks is a deliciously cheesy choice that is sure to have you raising your hand for seconds. Other signature dishes fall under the restaurant’s extensive menu of pasta, meat, pizza, and desserts. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Manhattan Seafood Chowder, Gouda Cheese Sticks, Collin’s Special, Caramelized Banana Creme Brulee

html:
• ABOUT

    At first glance, Colony looks like yet another hotel buffet restaurant, but a clever hand with the interior blends the nostalgia of a bygone British-colonial era with more modern trappings. Partitions, vintage furnishings, and a smattering of tartan and houndstooth prints provide the charm, but it’s the impressive gastronomic journey that will keep you coming back for more. The seven kitchens and accompanying 'live cooking stations' highlight the best of local cuisines and include Chinese, Indian, Indonesian, Malaysian, and Western dishes. You'll be inundated with choice - fresh seafood, perfectly grilled meats, laksa and other signature Singaporean dishes, dim sum, breads baked the traditional Tandoor way, and a wide variety of pastries and desserts. Wash it all down with refreshing juices or seek out Colony's resident mixologist to whip up specialty cocktails like the "Bengal Brew" or the "Governor's Invitation". Diners looking for buffet options that cover the expansive culinary heritage of Singapore will not be disappointed. (Nov 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "They've probably got one of the best oyster spreads we've seen in a while, shucking Normandy, Irish and Fine de Claire varieties, among others. There are also the obligatory live cooking stations that whip up everything from fine dining dim sum morsels to tasty fried rice with cereal prawns and a fiery sambal belachan. The creamy laksa is supposed to be a must-try." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fresh Oysters & Sashimi, Foie Gras, Colony Laksa with Homemade Lobster Ball, Hainanese Chicken Rice, The Upper Crust

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2021 - BUFFET RESTAURANT OF THE YEAR

    Our diners have voted Colony (The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore) as 'Buffet Restaurant of the Year' in Chope Diners' Choice 2021.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/colony-the-ritz-carlton-millenia-singapore
name: Colony (The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore)

html:
• ABOUT

    From the folks that brought you Lunar Coffee Brewers and Atlas Coffeehouse, comes this classy addition to the Upper Thomson cafe strip. Named after the great explorer Christopher Columbus, this sizeable spot serves up dishes inspired by a range of cuisines - this is not your usual cafe fare. The Soft-Shell Crab Burger is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Fluffy brioche buns encase a crisp deep-fried soft shell crab patty topped with delicious furikake eggs and caramelised onions. The curly fries on the side go perfectly with the rich burger. Another popular, albeit lighter, option is the Salmon Soba Noodles. Made with poached salmon, bouncy soba noodles, and topped with cilantro-lime nori yogurt, this dish is tangy, gentle on the palate, and won’t undo any diet plans you may have. For something a little sweeter, opt for the Candied Bacon Buttermilk Waffle, a soft waffle served with bacon that has been tossed in sugar - the unique sweet and salty flavour combined with the tenderness of the waffle makes for a delicious and memorable dish. Cafe junkies after their caffeine fix will be glad to know that Columbus offers specialty coffee from local roasters Two Degrees North. From a smooth latte to a sophisticated v60 filter brew, the rigorous standards and consistency held by the team is the foundation of their success. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Low & Slow Beef Brisket, Breakfast Steak & Eggs, Smoked Salmon Benny, Cereal Prawn Pasta, Beef Bolognese

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/columbus-coffee-co
name: Columbus Coffee Co.

Menus: Takeaway Menu  Menu  Fajitas Lunch Special (Tue-Fri)
html:
• ABOUT

    Feast on a spread of classic Mexican favourites at Comida Mexicana! In a sign of the restaurant’s dedication to authenticity and quality, the dishes served are made from scratch using fresh ingredients imported directly from Mexico and the US. Expect dishes that are as much a feast for the eyes as they are for the stomach – vibrant colours abound in lip-smacking creations such as the Chipotle Sweet Potato Bowl. Start off with a serving of Chile Con Queso, an addictive combination of jalapenos, melted red cheddar and jack cheese, as well as onions and tomatoes. This one will tickle your taste-buds and get your appetite all whetted and raring to go. For your main, you can’t go wrong with a good helping of Carnitas, or traditional Mexican pulled pork. This yummy dish comes with warm corn tortillas, salsa rojas, salsa verde, and guacamole – a real scrumptious option that’s worth every cent, if you ask us. Finish off on a high note when you scarf down a sweet treat such as the Kahlua Tiramisu, which gives a distinctively Mexican twist to this beloved Italian classic. Strong in flavour and extremely indulgent, there are few better ways to end your meal. If you’re up for good Mexican grub, Comida Mexicana is the place to visit. (Nov 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The salted caramel pina colada bread pudding… is a must-try — you don’t have to share it if you don’t want to give up any part of the rum- and cream-soaked brioche mixed with pineapples and served with coconut ice cream, salted caramel sauce and toasted coconut shavings.” -Coconuts Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Burrito with Chipotle Cream Sauce, Carnitas, Mexican Yucatan Chicken, Enrollados, Kabrita, Chimichanga, Mashed Avocado Sopes, Chorizo with Red Wine

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be opened for takeaways instead.Promotion: Enjoy 15% off all takeaway orders for store pickups, and island-wide delivery on our website

html:
• ABOUT

    Have you met Stan? The man of the people, Stan is a no-nonsense straight-talker who champions good coffee done right. That’s the promise behind the unpretentious cafe Common Man Stan, located in the heart of the Central Business District, and boy has the establishment succeeded at delivering what it set out to do. Brought to you by the people behind Common Man Coffee Roasters, Common Man Stan is a mecca for those who love their cups of joe. Aside from turning out Instagram-worthy cups of espresso, Common Man Stan also boasts cutting edge brewing gear and tapped in nitro cold brew and tea! Whether you’re an early riser who prefers to kickstart the day with a hearty breakfast or a late owl who crawled out of bed just in time for lunch, Common Man Stan has you covered. Have your pick with a freshly made New York Bagel topped with herb garlic or sun-dried tomato cream cheese. We also can’t get enough of droolsome Potato & Leek Rosti, which is perfectly paired with wild mushrooms, gruyere and chilli poached eggs on toast. So if you’re in need of a midday caffeine boost or a scrumptious meal, swing on down to Common Man Stan. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    New York Bagels, Broiche French Toast, Common Man Fluffy Pancakes, CMCR Full Breakfast, Grilled Juicy 'Chilli' Chicken, Cubanos Sandwich, Common Man Burger

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/common-man-stan
name: Common Man Stan

html:
• ABOUT

    Sharing its space with Stage Music Bar, this spot is a coffeehouse by day and live music venue at night. Founded with the aim of giving communities a free space to meet and mingle, this casual joint in the heart of the city is perfect for everything, from casual weekend brunches to serious business meetings. Serving coffee approved by the Specialty Coffee Association, the brews here are sure to impress connoisseurs. Heading here for breakfast? Brave the Pancake Tower, a pile of thick, fluffy pancakes topped with a range of ingredients, such as fruit and crumbled cookies. Seafood lovers can opt for the Crab Wrap, a tortilla wrap filled with mesclun salad and a generous portion of lightly sweet crab meat. For something a little moreish, be sure to try the Chicken Aglio Olio, a light dish of linguine topped with smoky grilled chicken and seasoned with chilli flakes. Lightly spicy, flavourful, and filling, this is a great option for lunch. Watching your waistline? The Spanish Flying Fish might be what you need. Light barramundi is fried to crisp perfection and served with searing pico de gallo and salsa. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    B&B Waffles, Classic Carbonara, Sunny Egg Croque Madame, Yummie Sarnie, Toastwich

html:
• ABOUT

    Clean, contemporary, and healthful. That’s the philosophy underpinning the cooking at COMO Cuisine, a dining establishment that formerly existed as a pop-up but has now found a permanent home on the chic grounds of COMO Dempsey. By drawing inspiration from the region’s rich culinary heritage, the restaurant surprises and astounds with its clever use of Asian ingredients and techniques. Perennial favourites include the heaping Our Big Raw Salad, which features a guilt-free indulgence of fresh and raw fruits and vegetables. There are a number of featured dishes inspired by the Indian subcontinent, such as the crunchy Samosas stuffed with spiced lamb and topped with a sweet and tangy mango chutney. Or opt for the Lamb Kofta, which has a hint of smokiness from the tandoor that’s fired by coconut charcoal. To make dining a family-friendly affair, the restaurant shies away from predictable kids’ menus. Instead, COMO Cuisine encourages young diners to expand their palates by choosing any dish that is served in a smaller portion. Designed by Italian architect and designer, Paola Navone, COMO Cuisine’s decor is a stunning interplay of light and elegant elements to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. Come for the innovative food, but stay for the warm ambience and truly exceptional dining experience that makes you feel like royalty. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "It's easy to find at least one dish on COMO Cuisine's menu that you'll take a fancy too. More importantly, the flavours are light enough not to give you a food coma." -Epicure Asia "Executive Chef Timothy de Souza has worked in numerous exotic locales including Turks and Caicos, the Maldives, Japan and Australia, and he brings this experience to the table at COMO Cuisine with a fusion of flavours in dishes that are fresh, modern and pay homage to Singapore's culinary traditions." -Urban Journey "Come for the food but stay for the feel-good vibes; ambiance reigns at Como Cuisine." -SG Now "The bright and light food is also captured in the restaurant's ambience. In the day, sunlight filters in through French windows that also offer views of a little landscaped garden outside." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kingfish Sashimi, Our Big Raw Salad, Lobster Roll, Snapper Curry, Maori Lakes Lamb Cutlet, Burrata Tartine, French Toast, Chocolate

  • ABOUT

    It’s easy to lose track of which bar is which amidst the slew of hotel bars in Singapore. Not so for Cook & Brew, which stands out from the rest with its vast selection of craft beers, mouthwatering nosh, and tasteful aesthetic (think dark red leather bar stools and a black marble-topped bar). The food isn’t any run of the mill finger food; rather, take your pick from a range of skilfully-cooked local and international delights that will be sure to impress even the most discerning palate.Kick start your meal with bar bites including Pad Thai Fries, a delicious combination of sweet potato fries tossed in a heady mix of pad thai sauce and freshly squeezed lime, adorned with chicken, prawns, crushed peanuts and dried sakura shrimps, and Whipped Buffalo Milk Ricotta, Truffle Honey and Grilled Bread – whipped to create a delicate texture and sweetened with truffle honey to complement the crusty grilled sourdough, alongside a selection of craft beers. For dessert, you definitely can’t go wrong with the decadent Baked Sticky Date Pudding.It’s hard not to have a wonderful time at Cook & Brew, with its quality eats and tipples (don’t forget to make use of the beer pairing suggestions for your dish). Don’t just take our word for it though - head down sometime soon for an exquisite dining experience you won’t forget! (Dec 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Alternatively, and for a local twist, the Hawker Burger sounds epic. Think char siew-style pork jowl and crispy pork belly served atop a beef patty with sambal mayonnaise, pickled chillies, and fries tossed in chilli. Get. Us. One. Now.” -Honeycombers SG

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Whipped Buffalo Milk Ricotta Cheese, Roasted Arctic Cod, Beef Pot Roast, Pad Thai Fries, Baked Sticky Date Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    The dim lighting and chocolate-brown leather sofas at this intimate bar sets the mood for a dram (or two) of whisky. Which, of course, is the drink du jour here at The Cooperage. The extensive drinks menu is a tome of bounded pages filled with different whiskies from around the world, starting from affordably-priced 12-year-old malts from Glenfiddich and Glenrothes. You’ll find usual suspects like the Macallans, Hibiki, and Nikka on the menu, as well as rare bottles such as the Bowmore Mizunara. On the food front, tuck into canapes, donburi bowls, as well as pastas to go with your smoky spirits. The Spicy Prawn And Scallop Aglio Olio is tossed in a fiery, umami-packed oil, with plump crustaceans served with their heads on so you can suck out all the rich juices. There’s also a creamy Carbonara loaded with generous slivers of fried bacon, and Salmon with Spicy Mentaiko donburi garnished with gleaming ikura pearls. For heartier mains, order the Duck Confit. The fork-tender duck with a crispy skin is swathed in orange sauce, and comes with a fragrant truffle mash and a side salad -- a generous portion that’s enough for two to share. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    12-year-old Glenfiddich, Old Fashioned cocktail, Spicy Prawn And Scallop Aglio Olio, Salmon with Spicy Mentaiko Donburi, Duck Confit

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be opened for takeaways instead.Takeaway Operating Hour: 11.30am-2pm

• PRESS RELEASE

    Amongst the hustle and bustle at the heart of Little India’s Syed Alwi Road, a Chindian restaurant is spicing up the vibrant Indian food scene with a new chef and a new menu. Copper Chimney, the 10-year-old Syed Alwi flagship which prides itself in its distinctive North Indian and Chinese Indian cuisine, has gotten a fresh new interior on Level 2 with cosy private dining rooms and a revamped menu since CEO Adnan Bamboat took over in 2014. Diners can choose from a wide variety of vegetarian and meat dishes on the new menu. For vegetarians who want to try something different from the popular paneer variations, they can tuck into the Methi Malai Mutter, a creamy Punjabi dish of peas cooked in fenugreek leaves and spices. The Veg Jaipuri, a Rajasthan dish featured in Copper Chimney’s newly revamped menu, consists of a colourful medley of spring vegetables, simmered delicately in piquant cream, and served on a bed of peppered papad shards. Seafood and meat lovers can tuck into Copper Chimney’s Fish Tikka Masala, one of the most popular Indian dishes in the United Kingdom, and the Mutton Roganjosh, a delightful Kashmiri dish that’s brimming with flavours of fennel, ginger and marked by a striking red hue. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Tikka Masala, Mutton Roganjosh, Veg Jaipuri, Chicken Lollipop, Rumali Roti, Sizzling Brownie with Ice Cream

    Tongue-in-cheek is fine, especially when taste-in-mouth is this good. With a bold name like Coq & Balls, you'd expect merry vibes and strong drinks, and you'd be right. With a variety of beers & ciders - bottled and draught - from the US, Japan, Britain, France, Germany, and also local original brews, the list reads like the United Nations of beer. Also featuring ciders, single malt whiskeys, cheeky cocktails, wines and sake, Coq & Balls has always been generous in letting you pick your poison. With raw, modern furnishing, an eclectic mix of jams and TV screens ready for the big game, it made sense that the owners drew inspiration from Melbourne's alternative bar scene. So we were not surprised to see filling tapas like Lemongrass Wings, Popcorn Chicken & Nachos, even a special Thai cuisine to escort our drinks. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lemongrass Chicken Wing, Chicken Quesadilla, Coq’s Delight Pizza, Green Curry Chicken, Minced Pork Basil and Fish & Chips

html:
• ABOUT

    Dining at Coriander Leaf is akin to taking an unforgettable culinary journey through Asia, where memories of authentic flavours and journeys are evoked as friends, loved ones, and dining companions share in an exceptional sensory experience together. Established in 2001, the Coriander Leaf brand is one of the most recognised names in Singapore’s food and beverage industry, and with its delectable Pan-Asian cuisine, it comes as no surprise! The menu is divided into five flavour profiles: fresh, familiar, spicy, umami, and sweet. While each dish is amazing, the standout is the Samia’s Signature Frontier Chicken with Coriander Seeds, Chilli , Yoghurt Cream, Arugula, and Lemon - it’s a dish that guests return to Coriander Leaf for time and time again! Otherwise, the Charcoal Grilled Baby Lamb Chops, Harissa, Yoghurt, Dried Chilli Paste, Pickled Onions is a crowd favourite too! The mélange of flavours ranging from the spicy dried chilli paste to the zesty harissa, sour pickled onions and milky and creamy yoghurt is truly a treat for your stomach! With time-tested dishes that have diners returning for more, it’s no wonder that Coriander Leaf stayed on as one of Singapore’s most loved restaurants! (May 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Don't miss the toothsome soft shell crab with salted duck egg yolk ($16) and the Nepalese chicken momo dumplings ($10) that come bursting with a peppery dipping sauce.” -SG Now “Unsurprisingly, the standouts are dishes that have a personal connection to both Ahad and Latiff. The charcoal-grilled baby lamb chops (S$29) marinated in harissa, yoghurt and dried chilli paste, which made its way over from the previous menu, is consistently succulent, tender and flavoured with just enough heat, spice and acidity.” -Today

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Watermelon, mint, pomegranate, Turkish white cheese (v), Pomelo, green mango, coriander leaf, chili-lime dressing, Samia's signature frontier chicken, coriander seeds, chilli, yogurt cream, mizuna, lemon, Miso marinated silver cod, Braised beef brisket, kimchi, daikon slaw, steamed bun, Charcoal baby lamb chops, harissa, yoghurt, dried chili paste, pickled onions, Soft shell crab, salted duck egg yolk sauce, curry leaves, Bulgogi wagyu short ribs, wok-fried bean sprouts, sesame, Spiced Valrhona lava cake, teh tarik ice cream, White rabbit, ice cream sandwiches

Address: 1 Cluny Road Singapore Botanic Gardens EJH Corner House (Nassim Gate Entrance) Singapore (259569)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Founded in 2014, Corner House is the articulation of a culinary vision by creative restaurateur and wine aficionado Renny Heng. Its name references the eminent botanist E.J.H. Corner, whose former abode is now a fabled, irreplaceable Black and White Colonial House and the sophisticated setting for a Michelin-starred restaurant. Its location in the UNESCO World Heritage Site Botanic Gardens sets the stage for a multi-layered meal that combines its storied past, the botanical bounty of the world, and a future that looks towards exhilarating, modern French-Asian interpretations by Executive Chef David Thien from Bordeaux

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Since taking the helm of Corner House in March, just two weeks before stringent Covid-19 measures took hold of the island-state, Executive Chef David Thien has spent his time dreaming up culinary journeys for returning guests. Even while the restaurant team contributed to feeding frontline heroes during this period, Chef Thien was inspired to compose a poem for the description of a mystery dish. Finally, with the lifting of dining-in restrictions on 19 June, Corner House is thrilled to reopen to the public with a daringly original new menu that showcases its prowess in contemporary seasonal cuisine. Since its opening in 2014, Corner House has earned multiple recognitions including the award of one-Michelin-star since 2016 and a rise to #42 on Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants 2020 list. The appointment of French-Chinese-Mauritian David Thien ushers in a fresh perspective as he debuts an exploratory world of fine flavors, inspired by his adopted home of Singapore since 2007. The eagerly anticipated new menu at Corner House showcases intimate sessions where Chef Thien prepares dishes inspired by personal stories, thoughts, and memories. The dining experience is designed to inspire and surprise. He elaborates, “My hope is that guests develop a deeper appreciation and connection with the food that they eat, relishing the thought behind it.” The menu continues to be organized by three, five, and seven-course sets for lunch, and five, seven, and chef’s course for dinner. Guests are presented with chapters authored by chefs, detailing stories accompanied by visuals that delve into each ingredient or concept. The menu is dynamic and everchanging to adapt to the seasons, sources, and customers. (Jun 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    Singapore Michelin Guide 1 Star - 2016, 2017, 2018 Asia's 50 Best Restaurants - 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019 "I was invited to the official opening lunch and returned on my own for dinner afterward. At both meals, there wasn't a single bad dish. Everything on the plates was carefully crafted with high-quality ingredients and a lot of finesse, with results ranging from good to excellent." -The Straits Times "Restaurant trends seem to be swimming away from fine dining fanciness in favor of casual fun. Corner House is a nice bridge between the two with haute cuisine dished up with a comfy vibe." -Time Out Singapore "Uber romantic space aside, the food certainly lives up to all its refined glory. The chef manages to beautifully balance proteins and veg without relegating one or the other as the supporting actor in a given dish." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chef David’s Archard, Wagyu2ways, Rendang, Canapé, Koo Chye, Chicken Satay, Risotto & Mont Blanc

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence from 2016-2019 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favorite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • OMAKASE PRICE LIST

• ABOUT

    For a spot that dishes out classic Swiss cuisine, head to Coucou (Swiss Restaurant). This no-frills restaurant serves a good selection of Swiss cold cuts and cheeses, from Canton of Fribourg and Bern to Valais & Vaud.While cold cuts are a delicious start to the meal, the rosti selection here is also not to be missed. The Potato Rosti with Beef Patty, for instance, is a hearty affair showcasing a generous minced patty blanketed in melted Swiss raclette cheese and some onion confit.For mains, try the Fillet of Trout cooked Geneva-style — with salty capers, butter, and lemon for a kiss of citrus. Also good is the Zurich-style Ragout, where your choice of veal or chicken is grilled until tender and swathed in a creamy mushroom sauce. End dinner on a sweet note with Ovaltine Mousse served with shards of spiced gingerbread. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Canton of Fribourg cheese, Potato Rosti with Beef Patty, Fillet of Trout in Geneva Style, Zurich style Ragout, Ovaltine Mousse

html:
• ABOUT

    Dubbed online as "the celebrity hotpot restaurant", Coucou is a welcome entrant to Singapore's much-loved hot pot scene. A subsidiary of famous Taiwanese hot pot brand, Xiaobuxiabu, this mid-high end hot pot concept serves a combination of Taiwanese flavours and, what's come to be a Singaporean staple, bubble tea. With a wide variety of broths on offer, you're in for a treat at Coucou. You can enjoy up to three broths as bases at one go, with signature flavours including their Taiwan-style Spicy Soup, Coconut-Chicken Soup as well as their Bovine Bone with Tomato Soup. Once you're selected your soup base(s), we recommend both their Beef Chuck Roll and melt-in-your-mouth Lamb Chuck to thicken the broth and satisfy those meat cravings. For seafood lovers who want to experience the best of both worlds, their Assorted Beef and Seafood Platter hits the spot. Consisting of seafood like mussels, salmon, and razor clams, this bountiful platter is jam-packed with ocean delights. Regular hot pot favourites like Mashed Prawn Paste also feature on the wide menu.That’s not all - complete your meal with a fragrant cup of freshly brewed Taiwanese tea. Be it their Classic Milk Tea or their Wax Gourd Tea with Da Hong Pao, there's bound to be a delicious option to quench your thirst. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bovine Bone with Tomato Soup Base, Beef Chuck Roll, Assorted Beef & Seafood Platter, Wax Gourd Tea with Da Hong Pao, Pu Er Bubble Tea

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the Fullerton Hotel Singapore’s sunlit atrium lobby, The Courtyard is the lively setting for a leisure dining with delicious local and international specials or traditional three-tier English afternoon tea of savouries and sweets. In line with government regulations, please note that the sale and consumption of alcohol in all food and beverage establishments are prohibited after 10.30 p.m. daily. The safety and well-being of our guests and team members are our top priority at The Fullerton Hotels and Resorts. We have set up rigorous cleanliness practices and safe distancing measures at our restaurants to ensure that you can experience an enhanced level of protection.(Jul 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Fullerton Club Sandwich, The Fullerton Burger, PB Signature Fries.

  • FLAVOURS OF JAPAN IN THE COURTYARD

    Our sun-dappled atrium is the perfect oasis for a leisurely lunch. Begin with sashimi and maki platters followed by a choice of hot and cold appetisers. For your main course, delicious options include Chirashi Don, Beef Kakuni and more, served with miso soup. Round off the meal with a refreshing dessert – your choice of a fresh melon platter with sorbet, or green tea ice cream with adzuki red bean. Priced at S$48++ per person. Add on S$8++ per person for free-flow green tea; and S$10++ for a carafe of sake.When: Mon-Fri (excluding PH)Time: 11:30am-2pmPrice: S$48++ per person Add on S$8++ per person for free-flow green tea | S$10++ for a carafe of sake

html:
• ABOUT

    Cosily ensconced along Waterloo Street, Crossings Cafe is a casual dining spot with a social cause — giving back to charity and providing employment opportunities for the disadvantaged. From the menu, tuck into comfort nosh such as Mushroom Soup, Crossings Laksa, or a hearty Fish & Chips. A bowl of creamy soup, laced with slivers of chunky mushrooms, is a warm, fuzzy way to start the meal. Laksa and curry are two popular Asian staples, and they grace the menu at Crossings Cafe with much aplomb. The Crossings Laksa, in particular, is a crowd-favourite; thick rice noodles in a rich coconut curry gravy is packed chock-full of plump fishcakes, springy tau pok (beancurd), prawns, and crunchy bean sprouts. For a Japanese-inspired take on a classic, the Miso Pork Burger showcases a juicy slab of miso-marinated pork belly sandwiched between toasted buns. In the mood for something heartier? Tuck into the chef’s signature Fish & Chips served with crisp, fluffy fries. Or try the Truffled Mac & Cheese, where smoky bacon and pasta are baked together in a blanket of golden cheese, with lashings of fragrant truffle oil. Wash it all down with fresh juices, or a Belgian Trappist beer. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crossings Laksa, Miso Pork Burger, Truffled Mac & Cheese, Signature Chilli Crab Pasta, Fish & Chips

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/crossings-cafe
name: Crossings Cafe

Menus: A La Carte Menu  Set Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    The décor is modern, but still recognisably Chinese, and boasts plenty of seating meant for large groups. No surprises there since even the name draws inspiration from the dining table, a central anchor in the life of a typical Chinese family. Likewise, the menu features plenty of favourites and an abundance of sets that might make ordering for your passel of folks that much easier. Think Baked Crab Shell stuffed with Seafood Paste, Sautéed Beef Cube in Black Pepper Sauce, Deep Fried Butter Prawn, Braised Ee-fu Noodle with Live Prawn in Black Truffle Oil and Pan-fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Teriyaki Sauce. It’s a smorgasbord of delectable items ranging from the tried-and-tested abalone and fresh seafood to meats and vegetarian creations jam packed with flavour. The name ‘Crystal Jade’ is a crowd favourite in all its iterations and, given the quality and ambience of Crystal Jade Dining IN, it looks like its stellar track record remains yet to be beat! (May 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Decor-wise, the restaurant looked impressive with its grand red hallway, stunning sea view, huge windows and scarlet interior.” -SG Now “This restaurant chain is well known for good Chinese cooking, and Crystal Jade Dining In is definitely no exception to the rule. The kitchen staff are capable and the menu has an adequate selection of the usual Chinese cuisine.” -Singapore Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Baked Crab Shell stuffed with Seafood Paste, Sautéed Beef Cube in Black Pepper Sauce, Pan-fried Kurobuta Pork Chop with Teriyaki Sauce, Deep Fried Butter Prawn, Sauteed Scallop with Walnut in Spicy Sauce, Braised Ee-fu Noodle with Live Prawn in Black Truffle Oil, Homemade Crispy Seafood Spring Roll with Portuguese Sauce

html:
• ABOUT

    Walking past the grand entrance of Crystal Jade Golden Palace and into the equally opulent dining space, 'sumptuous' may very well be the only worthy description. In true Crystal Jade style, the décor boasts neutral colours, underscored by shades of berry, and eye-catching light stands. It's a timeless ambience, bold enough to have you steeped in admiration, but subtle enough that it doesn't take away from the main highlight - the food. It is the modern, prettily plated Chinese dishes that are, for the most part, comforting in their familiarity, but will occasionally throw you for a loop with unexpected ingredients or presentations. Hint: some of the dim sum pastries come in quirky forms! Sample the Combination of Chilled Foie Gras with Japanese Sake, Chilled Abalone & Crab Meat Salad, or Sautéed Carrot Cake with XO Sauce. Like some of its other sibling restaurants, the menu boasts multiple pages dedicated to a variety of premium ingredients, from bird's nest, abalone, and shark's fin to exquisite soups like Buddha Jumps Over The Wall and live seafood such as lobster, Sri Lankan crab, or succulent prawns and fishes. The selection is truly vast - a blessing when catering to a range of tastes and diets - and the urge to order more than you can stomach will be strong. The next time a family occasion rolls around, this restaurant should top your list of places to go! (May 2016)

  • SAVE 10% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    Enjoy 10% off at Crystal Jade Golden Palace when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • THE BUZZ

    "This is a place where you can dress up for a night out but it's not so pretentious that one feels uncomfortable just hanging around in weekend clothes. Busy waiters buzz around delivering plates of steaming food and are always friendly and extremely helpful with ordering and cheerfully eager to interact with diners." -SG Now

html:
• ABOUT

    At Crystal Jade Jiang Nan, the food of the region south of the Yangtze River is firmly on display here. Best known for its skillfully crafted snacks and delicacies, this cuisine leans towards subtle and light flavours that will nevertheless tantalise your tastebuds. With bamboo shoots being one of the region’s most cherished crop, it’s inevitable this ingredient would make its way onto the menu. Under the deft hands of the chefs, this eatery spins this humble ingredient into culinary gold, creating dishes such as the intensely fragrant Stewed Bamboo Shoot and Deep-fried White bait in Wuxi Style. The delicious yet nutritious Double-boiled Chicken Soup is another dish that will undoubtedly impress any health-conscious diner. Meanwhile, one cannot pass up on the Crystal Jade Steamed Assorted Flavours Xiao Long Bao. These little balls of perfection come in an assortment of flavours which include salted egg yolk, chilli crab, and mushroom. For those with a sweet tooth, prepare to indulge in the many desserts that include the Pan-fried Red Bean Pancake and Osmanthus with Wolfberry Cake. There may be no lack of Chinese food in Singapore, but for discerning foodies like us, Crystal Jade Jiang Nan holds a special place in our heart thanks to its unique regional fare and swift service. (Aug 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cheesy Crisp Mochi Ball, Pu-Er Tea Smoked Crispy Duck, Sautéed Spicy Shredded Pork with Assorted Mushrooms & Asparagus, Poached Fish with Mustard Greens in Hot & Sour Broth, Stir-Fried Shredded Glazed Cabbage with Shiitake Mushroom,

    Like a grand dame that’s stood the test of time, Crystal Jade Palace remains an elegant mainstay in one of the most iconic malls along Orchard Road. The neutral colours and dark woods create a timeless ambience as points of light from the magnificent crystal chandeliers sparkle off the reflective surfaces of marble and glass. But what’s looks without substance? Crystal Jade Palace’s classy décor is only superseded by their masterful Chinese cuisine. Be spoilt for choice from authentic Cantonese dim sum, congee, appetisers, traditional roasted classics like Peking Duck and Suckling Pig to Bird’s Nest, Abalone, Lobster and Live Seafood. Crystal Jade Palace seeming endless iterations of family favourites makes a clear winner for families looking to order items like Roasted Peking Duck, Sautéed & Deep Fried Whole Live Garoupa, Double boiled Whole Yellow Melon Soup with Assorted Seafood, Fried Rice with Seafood & wrapped in Lotus Leaf, Pan-fried Beef Fillet with Lingzhi Mushroom and more! It takes a lot to remain constant in Singapore’s culinary scene but Crystal Jade Palace sure makes it look easy! (May 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The interior of the restaurant is modern, with palatial red wood carvings separating different sections of the restaurant...The service staff are attentive and helpful with recommendations. The overall dining experience is commendable.” -Singapore Tatler

    Crystal Jade Suckling Pig, Roasted Crispy Pork Belly, Roasted Peking Duck, Sautéed & Deep Fried Whole Live Garoupa, Double boiled Whole Yellow Melon Soup with Assorted Seafood, Braised Superior Bird’s Nest with Crab Meat and Crab Roe, Braised Whole Fresh Australian Abalone with Oyster Sauce, Baked Australian Live Lobster with Superior Stock, Pan-fried Beef Fillet with Lingzhi Mushroom, Braised Seasonal Vegetable with Crab Roe, Braised Three Types of Vegetable in Oyster Sauce, Braised Lingzhi Mushroom with Vegetable with Mushroom, Fried Rice with Seafood & wrapped in Lotus Leaf, Crystal Jade Palace Fried Rice, Deep-Fried Rice Roll with Salted Egg Yolk Shrimp

    Cuban fare may just have found its way to our shores, but it’s already developing a growing fanbase. Cuba Libre- named after the highball rum and coke cocktail - aims to cater to that fanbase and create new converts with its selection of seafood platters and Spanish-inspired meals. Located in the party central of Singapore, Clarke Quay, this is the perfect place to go for a hearty pre-drink meal or a tipple or two to fuel your wild night out. Cuba Libre at Clarke Quay has an extensive selection of whisky, gin, tequila, and much more at affordable prices, so you can drink to your heart’s desire. Offering a new menu with healthy and contemporary Latin American fare, their irresistible signature dishes include the famous Mojito Chicken and Seabass Ceviche that will make your tummy growl for more. Explore the Cuban culinary cuisine with Cuban sandwiches, Roasted Butternut Squash Soup, Argentine Style BBQ Pork Ribs and so many more! (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mojito Chicken, Ropa Vieja, Nachos, Garlic Prawns, Summer Crab Rolls, Colombian Empanadas, Beef Rendang Croquetas

Serving up a mouthwatering fusion of flavours derived from a variety of Western, Malay, Italian, Chinese & Fusion dishes. With our range of salads, antipasti, seafood & meat dishes as well as fantastic pizzas and pastas, your party would surely find something that fits everybody across the table. In addition, we also do indoor and outdoor catering, mini buffets, bentos, themed parties and cater to events for all occasions. (Sep 2019)
