• PRESS RELEASE

    Curate Cucina Pisana will embody the magic of authentic Pisan cuisine, a province in the heart of Tuscany that is well known amongst Singaporeans for the Leaning Tower of Pisa, Italian renaissance art and famous vineyards. As Pisan cooking embodies traditional rustic recipes combining influence from all over Italy, Curate Cucina Pisana retains this diversity of Pisan cooking while introducing a modern and comforting home-cooked twist to its dishes. Apart from using seasonal seafood from both Pisa’s coastal regions, the restaurant will also feature hearty and rich flavours of its seasonal game meats and game birds such as venison, pigeon and quails from its mountainside. The beauty of Pisa lies in its cuisine that pairs beautifully with the magnificent wines from the province, all of which can be experienced in Singapore’s very own Curate Cucina Pisana. Only at Curate Cucina Pisana will guests be introduced to the finest Pisan produce specially imported from the region. From prized truffles specially sourced from the three-generational family-owned Savini Tartufi farm in the province of Pisa, to top quality olive oil originating from the hilly terrains of the Pisan mountains, unique Tuscan cured meats well known for their incredible savoriness, and the coveted Pecorino and cheeses from the town of Volterra, the restaurant takes its guest on a gastronomical journey around the Pisa province. For lovers of pasta, Curate Cucina Pisana brings to table freshly hand-made pasta made from the best Italian Durum wheat Semolina, as well as traditional pasta from the Martelli, a family-run pasta business that still retains its pasta-making traditions since 1926. At Curate Cucina Pisana, Chef de Cuisine Davide Bizzarri will showcase delicious artisanal produce from his hometown of Pisa and its neighboring locale in his cooking. Inspired by his childhood growing up in Pisa, where cooking is a daily family affair that is deeply ingrained in the Pisan way of life, Chef Bizzarri aspires to bring authentic Pisan passion in home-cooked delicacies to Curate Cucina Pisana. By creating this sense of coziness and comfort in the culinary experience at the restaurant, diners will leave with their hearts and bellies full. Having obtained two culinary degrees in Pisa under the guidance of famed Chef Andrea Lorenzi and trained under the direction of renowned celebrity chef brothers Enrico and Roberto Cerea for five years, Chef Bizzarri will combine his refined culinary expertise with fresh seasonal ingredients to create an unforgettable taste of home in Pisa throughout the seasons. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Merluzzo, Risotto Tartufo, Fusilli di Pisa, Gigli

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Join chef-owner Andrew Walsh on a journey through his Irish heritage with Nua Irish cuisine at CURE. Representing his take on the evolution of Irish cuisine, the name takes inspiration from the double meaning of the word Nua: Old Gaelic for Irish and modern Irish for new.His vision and efforts have proved successful with CURE clinching its first star at the Michelin Guide Singapore 2021 as well as being selected for The World’s 50 Best Discovery list. The restaurant’s success in garnering these awards during a challenging time for the industry is a sheer testament of the team’s unwavering resilience, dedication, and passion for their craft.Together with head chef Maksym Chukanov, the zealous chef has included up to 85% of Ireland’s best in one expressive menu. Matched elegantly with cocktails with Irish spirits and fine wines, Nua meanders through the island’s colorful history and mysteries, with heartwarming snippets of Walsh's growing years. (Sep 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The team cleverly freezes fennel in granita shards to colour a deconstructed strawberry shortcake with tinges of refreshing anise. For a session that only claims to offer four courses, we’re fed beyond sated with seven plate changes, including a stellar one of quail, juicy, breaded rolls of quail and ricotta kiev, garlic milk and leek ash." -Time Out

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Irish Blue Mussels, Cider, Parsley; Potato, Seaweed, Caviar; Potato Crisp Sandwich; Oat cookie, Jameson Cream

    Curry Bowl is a casual diner specialising in — you guessed it — curries! A variety of vegetarian and non-vegetarian curries are served, with favourites including the Butter Chicken Masala, Paneer Tikka Masala, and Prawn Chettinad Gravy. Don't forget to order a basket of fluffy naan to soak up all the leftover gravy at the end of the meal. Besides curries, a wide range of appetisers, tandoori, rice dishes, and more are available. For something unique, try the Mutton Kola Urundai with spice-flavoured mutton meatballs, or the Honey Paneer. If you’re looking for classics done right, you can’t go wrong with Chicken or Mutton Biryani. Wash all that spicy goodness down with an ice-cold Sweet Lassi or comforting Masala Tea. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Butter Chicken Masala, Prawn Chettinad Gravy, Mutton Kola Urundai, Chicken Tikka Briyani

• ABOUT

    With its famous heritage in the basement of Ming Arcade, Cuscaden Bar & Bistro is serious about infusing deep Asian flavours into hearty street food. Invite family and friends down to this unpretentious hide-out to enjoy popular crowd favourites over a fresh pint of Heineken or Guinness draught beer. Start off with a basket of Cuscaden Original Wings. Known for its deliciously tender meat, dip each piece into a saucer of the bistro’s in-house Sambal Kicap Manis for a flaming good time. For a sweet yet savoury option, the Honey Mustard Wings is a friendly favourite among both the young and old at Cuscaden Bar & Bistro that delights with a sinfully sweet honey glaze mixed with mustard. Bite into one to savour the wonderful burst of flavours from this harmonious mix. If you’re feeling brave or have a spice crave, we recommend going for the Sambal Bawang Wings, but be warned - they are extremely hot. Alternatively, you can choose the half or full dozen servings of scrumptious Sriracha Wings that are specially marinated and tossed in sriracha sauce. Apart from the wide variety of wings options available at the bistro, meat lovers can also satiate their carnivorous cravings with signature favourites such as The Qushy Burger and The Cuscaden Cheeseburger. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cuscaden Original Wings, Honey Mustard Wings, The Qushy Burger, The Cuscaden Cheeseburger

    If you’re a fan of mala hotpot (who isn’t?), you’ll want to book your seats at Da Long Yi. This Chinese export is well known for its fiery soup base, which comes with oil or butter to cut through the richness of the broth. The food portions here are generous as well. Pick from the usual platters of US beef or wagyu, Kurobuta pork belly or loin, as well as slices of lamb. The golden straw mushrooms are a universal favourite among the selection of vegetables, along with leafy greens such as spinach or Chinese cabbage. Fans of the six-second beancurd skin roll will also find this available on the menu here. Simply dip the golden beancurd roll into the soup to sop up all the flavours of the broth. Enjoy your meats and vegetables with your choice of condiments, from cut chilli to sesame oil and chopped coriander. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kurobuta Pork Belly, Golden Beancurd Rol, Handmade Meat Balls, Vegetable Platter

• ABOUT

    With a live pasta-making station and a lively Italian wood-fired oven, dining at Da Paolo Dempsey Restaurant & Bar is a visual treat. For lunch, pick from a selection of Italian cold cuts and cheeses, or nibble on some antipasti like fresh calamari or burrata cheese with smoked eggplant puree. Healthy eaters will also love the Wholesome Kale Bowls, topped with delicious options such as Baked Salmon and Avocado Rice, or Beef Romanesco. Come dinner, load up on freshly made pastas and pizzas. The Butternut Pumpkin Mezzelune is a vegan’s dream come true, with a light cashew cream and pumpkin carpaccio piped into delicate half-moon shaped pasta. Also good is the Spicy Lobster Tagliolini, featuring slipper lobster, a sweet tomato sauce, and plenty of garlic. Fancy a pie? The 8-Cheese Pizza is a different take of the usual quattro formaggi — with twice the cheesy goodness, and some smoked date cream and truffle honey to balance out the richness. Save some space for the Tiramisu. Light, fluffy, and dusted generously with cocoa powder, this dessert is a sweet treat to be savoured at the end. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Baked Salmon and Avocado Kale Bowl, Butternut Pumpkin Mezzelune, Spicy Lobster Tagliolini, 8-Cheese Pizza, Tiramisu

    Da Paolo Gastronomia makes everyday Italian experiences convenient — an espresso in the morning, sharing a platter of antipasti with friends, aperitivo hour, and gelato post-dinner, just like in Italy. From freshly baked sourdough bread to fresh pasta, antipasti, tiramisu, and beyond, our abundant selection is made in our kitchen daily, ready to take home. Our retail section stocks pantry essentials, from Piedmont through Tuscany, and all the way to Puglia. We take great care in selecting the best and cooking from the heart so that you can simply enjoy everyday Italian with family and friends. (Aug 2021)

    This laid-back bistro serves only the best countryside dishes with their own take on classic flavours. For starters, go for their Sambal Cheese Fries for a spicy kick and local flavour. Or have their Honey Garlic Tater Tots to share for a more savoury profile. Serving not your usual pastas, signature dishes at Daddy’s are their Chilli Cream Linguine Pasta tossed in a spicy cream sauce and their Brown Butter Penne that’s full of buttery fragrant goodness. For mains, go for their Country Fried Steak for a deliciously cheesy take on your classic striploin. If you’re looking for an element of fun for your dishes, go for their Suka Hati Chef Roy. This mysterious dish is entirely up to the chef and you are definitely in for a pleasant surprise. Other fun dishes to try are their World's Swedishiest Swedish Meatballs made from their own special blend and their Daddy’s Spiced Chicken Pizza that’s seasoned with mesquite spices. Served with a special secret sauce, this pizza is not one for the fainted heart, but every bite is guaranteed to be full of delicious flavour. Exciting beverages to try are their specially concocted Butter Beer and Flor Ale, with flowery notes and a smooth finish. To end off your meal, Daddy’s offers weekly surprises for their desserts, so do remember to take a look at what’s in their fridge. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sambal Cheese Fries, Chilli Cream Linguine, Brown Butter Penne, Country Fried Steak, Suka Hati Chef Roy

    Specialising in Japanese-Western fusion, Daizu cafe mixes minimalist white and wood interiors with bold flavours. This lifestyle cafe is centered around the holistic usage of soy, nutrition, and sustainability in daily living, and tastefully combines these flavours with Western cuisine. Serving brunch until 3pm, enjoy their creamy Tamago Ikura Sando that’s great for a boost of protein and a certified umami flavour bomb. Other brunch offerings to try include the Bratwurst Kare Roll, which combines soft brioche rolls, a juicy bratwurst, and a house specialty curry aioli topped with fried onions. This juicy roll is great for any on-the-go meal that will satiate your hunger. For small plates, we recommend sharing their all-time crowd favourite Mentaiko Fries that combines that robust fish roe sauce, torched till perfection on a plate of perfectly fried crispy fries. Other must-tries at Daizu are their all-day Fresh Cut Bowls, featuring a healthy selection that leaves you torn between choices. Try Daizu’s Spicy Bara Chirashi Bowl, consisting of fresh, spicy marinated sashimi and topped with ikura and edamame, as well as the Kaisendon, adorned with thick slabs of salmon, maguro, unagi, and ebi make for a delicious indulgent meal. Pastas at Daizu are also a must-try. For seafood lovers, enjoy their fragrant Garlic Butter Sakura Ebi for a savoury ocean delight. Or go for their umami vegan Creamy Mushroom Kombu that might just turn you vegan! (March 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tamago Ikura Sando, Bratwurst Kare Roll, Mentaiko Chicken Dumplings, Spicy Bara Chirashi Bowl, Garlic Butter Sakura Ebi

    Located within the heart of Singapore, Dallas Restaurant & Bar is a contemporary bar-bistro concept with outlets at two prime locations in the central business district. A popular hangout spot for Singaporeans, expatriates and tourists alike, their Boat Quay outlet is the perfect choice for a mouthwatering lunch, a delectable dinner or just casual drinks. Dive into a tasty basket of Truffle Fries! Sprinkled with grated parmesan and truffle oil, these thick and crunchy fries are a huge hit among the young and old. Another all-time favourite is the Dallas Chicken Wings. Marinated, seasoned and chargrilled, the wings come paired with a homemade Dallas devil & ranch sauce that adds a wonderful burst of flavour. Looking for a larger bite? Served with Dallas fries and coleslaw, their Classic Wagyu Burger comes highly recommended. The hearty bun features American cheese, tomato, lettuce and caramelised onions atop a tender wagyu beef patty. For bigger gatherings, sharing platters such as the Quesadillas Platter and The Dallas Platter are noteworthy too. Offering an irresistible variety of culinary delights along with a great selection of fine wines, Dallas Restaurant & Bar is also a great venue to host corporate events, private parties and live sports screenings. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Fries, Dallas Chicken Wings, Classic Wagyu Burger, Quesadillas Platter

    Dancing Crab is at it again! With a new location at Orchard Central, they’re rolling out the same intense Creole flavors at the Turf Club now smack-dab in the middle of the city. Inspired by New Orleans, Louisiana, you can expect only the freshest shellfish, specialty lobsters, dungeness crab, and various other seafood critters to be hitting the table. All packed with tons of flavour, these babies are perfect for pairing with just about anything. So go ahead and order the Spicy Cajun Fries, the Seafood gumbo, and the Beer Batter Cajun Calamari! Don’t forget to come prepared just in case those bold flavours take a liking to your clothes by leaving the white shirt behind. This is one place you want to get down and dirty! (June 2015)

Don’t worry though, they’ve got the same country-style Cajun recipes, flavours, and spectacular seafood favourites we fell in love with at the other outlets - so expect the same great treats! We're talking about their Combo Bags bursting with prawns, clams, potatoes, corn and sausages, crowned with your choice of Sri Lankan crab, Dungeness crab or lobster. Add in their signature Dancing Crab sauce, and you've got hours a good eating. Irresistible sides like the Spicy Cajun Fries, Seafood Gumbo, and the Beer Batter Cajun Calamari are definitely a must-try so don’t forget to put in a few orders - you’ll be thanking us later.     Dating Fish is a musically themed restaurant that serves both an ala carte menu and also buffets. Staying true to the name, the restaurant offers free KTV sessions that can be enjoyed alongside their mouth-watering food and dining. It is an ideal venue for both business meetings in their private dining rooms and also for gatherings amongst family and friends. An evening spent here is guaranteed to leave a lasting and memorable impression for all. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Pepper Prawn, Grilled Fish, Marmite Chicken, Spicy Chilli Prawn

  • ABOUT

    Transforming traditional Indonesian cuisine into modern fusion, Daun Bistro highlights the best of Indonesian cuisine in their reimagination of classic favourites. Tapas to start off with is their Daun Nachos Cheese Emping, crispy Belinjo nutcrackers are generously topped with melted nacho cheese, resulting in an unexpectedly delicious combination of flavors. The bitter crackers are the perfect complement to the savoury cheese sauce, creating a combination that’s highly addictive and perfect for sharing with friends over a cool pint of beer. If you're looking for heartier dishes, try their Tahu Isi. Tofu puffs are stuffed with minced prawns, chicken, and vegetables before being fried to golden perfection. The result is these crispy, savoury, and meaty parcels encased in delicious tofu skin. It is another signature dish of Daun Bistro for good reason. The must-try main dish here is the Ebi Tempura Crazy Fried Rice/Indomie. This dish provides an explosion of flavour, whether you choose to have it with rice or noodles. Classic Nasi Goreng or Indomie is stir-fried in their special spice blend and topped with flakey Ebi Tempura, creating a delectable dish you can’t get enough of. Boasting a wide alcohol selection, try something new like a Virgin Butterfly Mojito to add some color and fun to your experience here at Daun Bistro. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Daun Nachos Cheese Emping, Tahu Isi, Ebi Tempura Crazy Fried Rice/Indomie

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    A visit to db Bistro & Oyster Bar at The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is a religious experience for devout burgerists. In-the-know foodies make the pilgrimage from all over the world for the Original db Burger - a gargantuan top sirloin creation famously filled with foie gras and braised short ribs in a Parmesan bun embrace. It is a marvel to see, with a taste that can only be described as heavenly. But burger nirvana is not only achieved with indulgent ingredients. Every element of the dish from the construction to the condiments will make you a believer in intelligent design. After all, db Bistro & Oyster Bar was established by a virtual deity in the culinary world, Chef Daniel Boulud. As such, his virtuosity is evident in each creation that leaves the kitchen. And despite its larger-than-life reputation, db Bistro & Oyster Bar manages a down-to-earth, modern bistro feel. With an updated crimson and mahogany theme and faultless service, the Bistro personifies chic French dining. The Original db Burger certainly draws the most devotees, but the comfortable dining room also hosts business gatherings, Marina Bay shoppers and Singapore visitors. The menu features exquisite bistro classics - Coq Au Vin, Tartare, Oysters, Duck Confit - all done so well that it will become your new standard for future imitations. It's no wonder db Bistro & Oyster Bar is on the universal foodie bucket list, and to answer your prayers, your seat is now just a click away. (Oct 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Anyone who enjoys seafood straight from its shell will get the best quality at DB Bistro. We recommend starting with their juicy fried oysters, best enjoyed with their tropical Mazuizumi sake-based cocktail, Passion Fruit Bubble Tea." -Lifestyle Asia "Best Burger" - Chope Diners' Choice Awards 2015 "The Coffee Napoleon ($18) is one of my signature desserts. It is a collaboration between dB Bistro & Oyster Bar's executive chef Jonathan Kinsella and myself. It is also my favourite creation so far." -Mandy Pan, The Sunday Times "DB Bistro's spin on the traditional Napoleon consists of various layers and textures of coffee praline, with dark chocolate cream, hazelnut and a local touch of gula Melaka ice cream." -The Peak

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seasonal Oysters, Signature Seafood Platter, Maine Lobster Roll, Steak Tartare, Coq Au Vin, Herb Roasted Organic Chicken, The Original db Burger

  • href

    An Asian fusion restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown, DD Eatzakaya is a fun-loving bistro and cocktail bar boasting tapas, charcoal grilled yakitori, Asian fusion dishes and more all in one place. Pamper yourself with our very own Chili crab with Man Tou when you drop by the restaurant. Alternatively, have a flaming good time with family and friends as you indulge in DD Eatzakaya’s wide selection of tapas on your plates. Bestsellers include Soft shell prawn, Stew Ox-Tail with Truffle, Sakura Ebi with Angel Hair and Charcoal Battered Barramundi. For yakitori lovers, you can have a set of 3 sticks ($15.80) or 6 sticks ($25.80), grilled over the hot charcoal by our inhouse Chef Luca. MUST TRY our Mongolia Grass-Fed Lamb, Chicken Tsukune and Roasted Unagi which will paired well with your favorite alcoholic beverages for an unforgettable meal. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Soft shell prawn, Stew Ox-Tail with Truffle, Sakura Ebi with Angel Hair and Charcoal Battered Barramundi

• PRESS RELEASE

    Our focus at Decker Barbecue is to serve the most #legit American BBQ in all of Singapore, smoked the traditional way, just like in Texas! We proudly own the only A.N. Bewley smoker in Asia, hand-built in Texas. We cook using wood only: no gas, no electricity, no shortcuts. Look forward to a meaty affair with our delicious Brisket, Spare Ribs, Buffalo Wings, Chopped Beef, and much more. The perfectly smoked meats are tender, juicy, and bursting with flavor. On weekends, treat yourself to the best turkey you’ll ever have or the aptly-named Dinosaur Rib, a succulent 600-gram bone-in beef rib. Amp up your meat order with classic all-American side dishes made in-house daily such as the Brisket Beans, Cornbread, and of course, Mac ‘N Cheese. End off with the Banana Pudding with an authentic southern dessert that we just can’t get enough off. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Brisket, Burnt Ends, Dinosaur Rib, Spare Ribs, Mac 'n Cheese, Brisket Beans

  • ABOUT

    Helmed by Michelin-starred chef Carles Abellan, Dejavu Bar is the first Asian outpost of the iconic Barcelonian concept. This elevated neighbourhood all-day tapas bar tucked away along Prinsep Street offers a buzzy atmosphere accompanied by unfussy service and sublime tapas. Featuring high quality Spanish products and a variety of authentic tapas dishes, discover the best of Spain’s viticulture with these curated offerings. Start off small with a platter of Truffle Fries or Popcorn Chicken before diving into the fresh catch of the day with the bar’s signature Fish & Chips. A hearty serving of fries and fish fillet, this delightful one meal dish tastes even better than it looks! Other innovative dishes here include Milk Ramen and Mala Fried Rice. Topped with generous chunks of perfectly diced seafood pieces, this fiery bowl of fried rice is a great way to end your night on a high note. Alternatively, drop by for a fuss-free afternoon pick-me-up from the bar’s wide selection of sandwiches. The Kani Mayo Sandwich and Fried Chicken Sandwich are signature favourites recommended for a quick snack. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Fries, Milk Ramen, Mala Fried Rice, Kani Mayo Sandwich

    At Delhi Express, you will find all your favourite classic Indian dishes in one place. Located along 1 Hoe Chiang Road, the restaurant is within walking distance of Tanjong Pagar MRT. Here, we serve crowd favourites like Butter Chicken, Mutton Briyani and Chicken Tikka. It opens from 11am to 10pm, perfect for professionals and executives looking to satisfy any Indian food cravings during lunch and after-work hours. (Jul 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    This classy spot in Sunshine Plaza is the first offshore outlet of the beloved cafe which has been making waves in the Japanese dining scene for nearly a decade. The dishes on offer here are based on traditional dishes from all over Japan - from Osaka to Sendai, and the menu includes classics such as Hakata Black Curry and Ox Tongue Steak Don. The Avocado Quattro Cheese Wagyu Burger is perfect for health nuts who are looking for something moreish. The Wagyu Burger is cooked to your desired doneness, topped with creamy avocado and a decadent helping of cheese. The buns are soft, fresh and have an added crunch from the sesame toppings. The Hakata Black Curry is a unique dish of rice, vegetables, and thick gravy. The curry is made with miso, chicken and pork broth, and spices. Mix the steamed rice that comes with this dish with the curry and vegetables provided for a dish that is filling, healthy, and flavourful. Adventurous diners can opt for the Ox Tongue Steak Don, a beloved delicacy of Sendai. The meat is grilled to perfection and is tender and juicy, which goes perfectly with the fresh steamed rice the dish comes with. (June 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    100% Kuroge Wagyu Avocado Quattro Cheese Burger, Wagyu Hamburg Steak Set, Ox Tongue Steak Don, Roast Beef Don, Hakata Black Curry

html:
• ABOUT

    For many foodies, the name Jean-Georges Vongerichten needs no introduction. Best known for his skills as a chef and restaurateur, this culinary superstar owns a deep stable of restaurants that have gathered critical accolades and Michelin stars alike. Lucky for us, Jean-Georges has now created an effortlessly elegant restaurant with The Dempsey Cookhouse & Bar. Set in the midst of vibrant COMO Dempsey hub, this 160-seater establishment puts an elegant spin onto Western fare. All the magic happens in its open kitchen where cooking is elevated into a performance art. Notable signature dishes made famous by Jean-Georges appear on the menu here, be it the rich Egg Caviar that’s composed of a warm and oozy egg capped off with caviar and herbs, or the decadent and heavenly Black Truffle and Fontina Pizza. On a hot day, there’s nothing cooler than a bowl of Tomato Gazpacho that’s enhanced with a drizzle of olive oil. Fans of seafood will also appreciate the Maine Lobster, accompanied with baby corn and a smoked chili-almond condiment. And we can’t think of a better way to end the meal than with a glass Lychee Raspberry Bellini. Refined and elegant, The Dempsey Cookhouse & Bar will be a thrill for anyone who relishes in a dining experience well done. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Standout dishes with an Asian slant include the crispy salmon sushi, perked up with chipotle mayonnaise. The salmon slivers sit atop mounds of rice grains that are crisp and golden on the outside. The hamachi sashimi with chilli and lime is an embodiment of fresh and simple food done right." -The Peak Singapore "For the main course, I am most impressed with the Prosciutto Wrapped Pork Chop. The meat is a tad tough because it is not Kurobuta or Mangalica - premium meats that, I confess, have spoilt my palate. But the cooking cannot be faulted - the meat is pink in the centre, the way it should be. The distinctive saltiness from the ham gives the pork an extra dimension of flavour." -The Straits Times "Would the food be pretentious? Overpriced? Heavy and French? I was delighted to discover dishes that perfectly suit our tropical climate while still retaining Chef Vongerichten's elegant sensibility and passion for a wide range of flavours." -Sassy Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Egg Caviar, Crispy Salmon Sushi, Rigatoni with Meatballs, Black Truffle and Fontina Cheese Pizza, Roasted Beef Tenderloin, Prosciutto Wrapped Pork Chop, Peach Cobbler, Salted Caramel Ice Cream Sundae

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/the-dempsey-cookhouse-and-bar
name: Dempsey Cookhouse and Bar, The

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled along a row of shophouses on Prinsep Street, Der Biergarten, ‘The Beer Garden’ in German, has been attracting quite the crowd for its accessible and mouthwatering German beer and dishes. Inspired by the traditional beer gardens typically found in the Bavarian region, the unassuming space is perfect for an intimate dinner or post-work drinks. Tuck into German classics like the Goulasch Souppe, a luscious and nutritious beef stew served with fluffy German bread, or the traditional Sausage Platter, featuring a medley of different sausages along with the typical German sides of mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. The Roast Pork Knuckle, a famed favourite, is an oven-roasted pork hock served with dark beer gravy, mashed potatoes, and sauerkraut - a definite crowd pleaser as well. Crispy, crackling skin gives way to tender, succulent meat accentuated by the bittersweet notes of the dark beer gravy. Looking for finger food to accompany the drinks instead? Tantalising bar bites such as the Boxing Drumlet or the Deep-Fried Mushroom Fritters are the perfect partners-in-crime to traditional draft beers such as the world-famous Paulaner Original Munich Hell. If you aren’t looking for a beer, a bevy of other options including an eclectic wine and cocktail list, are available as well. Guess it’s time to make a trip down for a tipple or two soon! (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “An old-fashioned beer garden with German pub grub, live music and ice cold beer. Expect usual suspects like roasted pork knuckle, chicken schnitzel, sausage platters and bar snacks like Bavarian pasta spatzle, chili padi-infused curry wurst and honey-glazed chicken wings.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Goulasch Souppe, Roast Pork Knuckle, Sausage Platter, Boxing Drumlet, Deep-Fried Mushroom Fritters

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/der-biergarten
name: Der Biergarten

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled in the Malay enclave on Kampong Glam is the gorgeous restaurant serving up delicious Turkish dishes. With blue-tiled walls and oud music in the air, you’d be forgiven for thinking you were in Ankara when you first enter this restaurant. The smell of fresh flatbread and stews, as well as the welcoming atmosphere of this restaurant make this the perfect place for a hearty meal with family and friends. The Patlican Musakka is a classic Turkish item that is not to be missed. Made with chicken or lamb, eggplant, potato, and topped with a generous helping of cheese, this rich dish is baked in a claypot for maximum flavour. Earthy, buttery, and delectable, this is an absolute must-try for diners who are new to Turkish cuisine. If you’re looking for a Turkish take on a classic dish, look no further than the Pasta Carbonara. Made with some additional herbs and spices and without the addition of bacon, this is a Middle Eastern rendition of the classic Italian dish and just as good as the original.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Meze Tabagi, Saksuka, Testi Kebab, Kasarli Kofte

html:
• ABOUT

    A heartwarming cuisine that fills the stomach and soul, Teochew food is the culinary balm we need on cold rainy days. And when the craving for this notable cuisine hits, there’s no better place to go than Di Wei Teochew Restaurant. This humble eatery, which first opened its doors in 2014 at the Singapore Botanic Gardens, has now expanded to a grand colonial bungalow that’s located in Seletar Aerospace Park. Sit around one of the restaurant’s round table and be amazed by the seemingly endless amounts of food that Chef Khoo Tai Guan and his team puts out. The menu at this restaurant is built around lightly-flavoured delicacies made from only the freshest ingredients the kitchen staff can buy. If you come here on any given day, don’t be surprised to see dishes such as the Teochew Cold Crab, deep-fried Prawn Balls, or crispy Pork Rib Yam Rings flying out of the kitchen doors. Craving something more luxurious? Then be sure to give the Crayfish Porridge or the Pomfret Porridge a try. At Di Wei, Chef Khoo takes the classic and cherished Teochew dishes and modernizes them for the new generation. (May 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Teochew Cold Crab, Liver Roll, Prawn Balls, Pork Rib Yam Ring and Yam Paste with Gingko Nuts or Pumpkin

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/di-wei-teochew-restaurant
name: Di Wei Teochew Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Dian Xiao Er’s decor is meant to look like one of those old-school Chinese inns you see in movies -- you know, the sort where Shaolin Warriors stop at, mid-journey, on their quest for justice and peace. Timber furniture, carved wooden screens, red cloth aplenty, you half expect an epic fight to break out in Dian Xiao Er, with kungfu kicks and wine barrels flying around. Except the only fight one can imagine here is over the famous Herbal Roasted Duck that has been the mainstay of the Dian Xiao Er menu for the last 12 years. The dark herbal gravy that the duck comes bathed in is made of 10 Chinese herbs that include codonopsis root, foxglove root, and licorice root. This gravy is said to have a calming effect while relieving mental stress and revitalizing energy. We were definitely very energized after eating this duck, not least because of its succulence and moistness. The duck skin itself is also crispy and adds a satisfying crunch to the dish. Paired with fragrant steamed rice, the flavours of this dish are strong, but not overpowering. Try the other dishes on the menu as well; Dian Xiao Er specializes in traditional Chinese comfort food such as melt-in-the-mouth Dong Po Pork and refreshing Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce. For a taste of traditional Chinese inn food, Dian Xiao Er is the place to go. (Sept 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Herbal Roasted Duck, Mongolian Spare Ribs, Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce, Dong Po Pork, JiangNan Baked King Prawn

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/dian-xiao-er-bedok-mall
name: Dian Xiao Er (Bedok Mall)

html:
• ABOUT

    Dian Xiao Er symbolizes a pit-stop for travelers (customers) to rest and replenish their energy fully before setting off to continue their hectic journeys again. Dian Xiao Er not only provides to the travelers a place of warmth, satisfaction and happiness as they indulge in the delectable dishes, it is also a place for them to interact and build relationships with one another. Dian Xiao Er also symbolizes an element of blessing and fellowship as everyone is brought together in Dian Xiao Er. The ambience at Dian Xiao Er is intentionally planned to be rustic and raw with the careful selection of materials to complement the freshness of the herbal roast ducks which are prepared and roasted in the display kitchen daily. Customers can expect to experience a choice of dining ambience varying from dining inside a traditional Chinese inn to dining inside a rustic timber shed at the foot of a stone cliff. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Herbal Roasted Duck, Mongolian Spare Ribs, Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce, Dong Po Pork, JiangNan Baked King Prawn

• ABOUT

    Dian Xiao Er symbolizes a pit-stop for travelers (customers) to rest and replenish their energy fully before setting off to continue their hectic journeys again. Dian Xiao Er not only provides to the travelers a place of warmth, satisfaction and happiness as they indulge in the delectable dishes, it is also a place for them to interact and build relationships with one another. Dian Xiao Er also symbolizes an element of blessing and fellowship as everyone is brought together in Dian Xiao Er. The ambience at Dian Xiao Er is intentionally planned to be rustic and raw with the careful selection of materials to complement the freshness of the herbal roast ducks which are prepared and roasted in the display kitchen daily. Customers can expect to experience a choice of dining ambience varying from dining inside a traditional Chinese inn to dining inside a rustic timber shed at the foot of a stone cliff. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Herbal Roasted Duck, Mongolian Spare Ribs, Silver Cod Fish in Superior Soy Sauce, Dong Po Pork, JiangNan Baked King Prawn

html:
• ABOUT

    The idea of halal dim sum may be surprising to some, because really, what is dim sum without the iconic char siew bun or xiao long bao? However, The Dim Sum Place might just change your mind, with its mouth-watering array of Cantonese snacks with a local twist. In fact, with the eatery being flooded with customers every night, we dare say it's been given the Singaporean stamp of approval. The menu features an impressive variety of dishes, including steamed, baked, and fried dim sum, noodles, seafood, and roasted meats. Their rendition of the char siew bun is a crowd favourite, with tender braised duck slathered in the same sweet and savoury sauce we all know and love. Other must-try items are the Salted Egg Custard Bun, Vermicelli Roll with Roasted Duck Cha Shu and Herbal Duck. Make sure to leave room for dessert too. From comforting yam paste to indulgent honeycomb cakes, you wouldn't want to sit this one out. Oh and did we mention it opens till 5am on Fridays and Saturdays? It’s definitely the perfect spot for late-night feasting with your besties. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Baked Bun with Roasted Duck Filling, Molten Salted Egg Custard Bun, Vermicelli Roll with Roasted Duck Cha Shu, Peking Duck Wraps

    The Dining Room at Sheraton Towers is proof positive that ground floor dining can be just as panoramic, if not more so, as restaurants perched atop lofty heights. The ambiance is made serene with cascading waterfalls, rock pools, and sculptured gardens just outside the windows; it almost feels like you’ve escaped to another country. Beneath the high ceilings lies an intimate dining area where diners partake in familiar Asian favourites such as the signature Sheraton Towers "Fried or Gravy" Laksa, Crabmeat Fried Rice and tantalising sweet treats like Ice Burger. (Sep 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    “In addition to the groovy man-made waterfall, this hotel coffeehouse that has been around since 1985 is well-known for its cakes and desserts. Expect signature items like the crabmeat fried rice…the Sheraton Towers ice burger and mud pie to stay.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crabmeat Fried Rice, Lobster Spaghetti Arrabiatta, Beef Cheek Rendang, Mee Siam, “Fried or Gravy” Laksa

    The small and neat 1,800 square-foot restaurant comes complete with a European Meat Showcase and Chiller for its Dry Aged Meat to cater to its Gourmet Loyalists. This meticulous Dry-Aging procedure allows the enzymes to break down the connective tissues in the muscles, leaving behind a surprisingly higher concentration of natural flavors that consumers get to savor- the tasty and tender goodness of Dry Aged cuts. Choose from beautifully cooked main courses such as Pappardelle with Dry Aged Black Angus Ragout with Porcini Mushrooms, 45 Days Home Dry Aged Corn Fed Traditional Fiorentina Steak or our 30 Days Dry Aged Black Angus Burger with Parmesan Chips and Tomato Salsa on Rosemary-Garlic Bun. (Aug 2016)

• ABOUT

    The Flagship outlet of District 10 Bar & Restaurant located at UE Square boasts of a main dining hall, a private dining room and an extensive bar. On top of keeping some of Bonta’s bestselling items, the menu is refreshed with classic Italian dishes as well as a more extensive wine list with boutique labels. District 10 Bar & Restaurant continues to offer an extensive menu of substantial and value-for-money fare.Luca Pezzera, the group’s Executive Chef and Partner, explains that District 10’s gastrobar concept works well with the separate outdoor and indoor spaces. “Our outdoor area appeals to diners who want a casual ambience with the option of bar bites and lots of great cocktails. For the indoors, we take things up a notch by offering a more gourmet menu. This allows our guests to have the option to choose between the different dining experiences” (Aug 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Boasting nature as an ongoing theme at its original location just off Bukit Timah Road, District 10 has relocated to a space across the street from Robertson Walk and taken on a completely new persona. We’d recommend the Kopitini's ($16) instant caffeine jolt for drinkers who are looking to make it a late night; best not try one on a weeknight though, as we found out the hard way." -Time Out Singapore "Must-tries include the house specialty, District 10 salad ($12) that satisfies with a mix of lettuce, mushrooms, feta cheese and roasted roma tomato with balsamic dressing drizzled in just the right amount." -Singapore Dine

    Enjoying a relaxed, convivial atmosphere, Dolce Vita puts a uniquely modern twist on the alluring flavours of authentic Italian cuisine. Passionate about retaining the true spirit of traditional Italian cuisine, Dolce Vita features the freshest of produce and the finest seasonal ingredients, which are translated into delicious daily creations. Providing the perfect setting for a memorable experience is Dolce Vita’s elegant décor that exudes a sophisticated and chic vibe. Unwind in the spacious main dining area and catch a glimpse into the chefs’ culinary world through a feature wall with vertical windows. A stone finish backdrop and black granite countertop at the bar further accentuate its luxe character as diners peruse an outstanding collection of fine wines meticulously curated by the award-winning sommelier. Complete with floor-to-ceiling glass windows leading to an outdoor alfresco area, Dolce Vita regales guests with picturesque views of the city’s skyline to complement the wonderful menu. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "At first glance, the place may look like a casual poolside joint. But Mandarin Oriental’s signature restaurant, Dolce Vita, is an understated destination for contemporary Italian cuisine." -Appetite Asia

• ABOUT

    Escape the hustle and bustle of the city at this semi-alfresco restaurant at One North. They specialise in Asian and Western cuisine, serving up a variety of dishes like Angus Beef Hor Fun, Chongqing Grilled Fish, Lasagna, and Seafood Aglio Olio. While the dishes may seem simple at first glance, they ultimately pack a punch in the flavour department. The interior also boasts a well-stocked bar, adorned with premium wines and spirits from around the world, and a draft beer tap for beer enthusiasts. Their proudest creations are, however, their selection of house-concocted cocktails such as the Ice Kachang cocktail, Gin Bramble, and Donna Colada. The next time you're in the area, pop by to get your fill of comfort food and a drink or two. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Angus Beef Hor Fun, Chongqing Grilled Fish, Lasagna, Seafood Aglio Olio

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Inspired by the vibrant piazzas at the heart of every Italian town and the exquisite flavours of contemporary Japanese cuisine, Dopo Teatro, signifying “After theatre” in Italian, is where a slice of traditional Italian cuisine meets modern interpretation. Here you will find a beautiful ensemble of old and new, featuring a wholesome menu using premium Japanese ingredients that embodies the best of the distinctively Italian way of life. Immerse in the repertoire of classic Italian fare innovated from the building blocks of traditional recipes, from antipasti, soups and salads, to house-made pastas and hand-stretched pizzas. Watch as our culinary artists bring traditional dishes to life with a playful touch of Japanese Italian magic. Start your meal on a high note with the Stu¬ed Ikameshi; featuring succulent Japanese squid stuffed with seafood miso risotto, shellfish velouté, pickled onion, crispy ebi sakura, herb emulsion and tobiko. Seafood lovers can opt for the Fisherman’s Catch; a hearty plate of the freshest catch-of-the-day, including golden fried ocean prawns, calamari, shishamo and tempura soft shell crab. Nestled within Esplanade, Dopo Teatro offers a modern dining experience an urban Italian escape along the waterfront, from marbled walls to warm hanging lights indoors, complemented with a breezy alfresco dining area to soak in the picturesque city night views. A theatrical dining experience treat awaits you at Dopo Teatro. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Stu¬ed Ikameshi, Fisherman’s Catch, Yuzu Cured Grilled Prawns

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    When you arrive looking for The Dragon Chamber, you will find yourself at the entrance of a Kopitiam where patrons are sipping beer and having a bowl of noodles—just an ordinary street food stall. “This must be the place,” you say to yourself. The hostess then gestures you toward the beer fridge as if to offer you a drink. But instead of pulling out a tasty cold brew, the fridge door opens up into a portal into another realm like something out of a real-life Alice in Wonderland. “This is where you must continue alone,” says the hostess, as the fridge door opens into a street alley that transports you into the braised underbelly of the “Long Tang” that is The Dragon Chamber. Things are not always as they appear. Secretly located within a brightly coloured Kopitiam, The Dragon Chamber is a hidden restaurant. What may look like a regular beer fridge in a kopitiam is actually a secret door that opens up into its own inner recesses. Reminiscent of Chinatown gambling dens and secret society hangouts, the walls of The Dragon Chamber are covered with artwork from local and regional artists such as Sabotage, Mister Tucks, and Riandy Karuniawan, referencing past and recent Chinese tradition from a globalist, counter-culture point of view. The Dragon Chamber offers an unconventional menu serving “guerilla style” food, representing dishes that are not typical banquet style Chinese food. Among its own wild concoctions from The Dragon Chamber’s test kitchen, the underground restaurant also brings back age-old Chinese dishes that never caught on in mainstream restaurants, because of unconventional ingredients. Yet the flavours are immense. Contrasting lovable Chinese-American recipes, The Dragon Chamber pushes the diner’s comfort zone with adventurous dishes that may even shock diners with unusual Chinese techniques of nose-to-tail animal preparation. One such dish is the Dragon’s Claw. Touted as one of the restaurant’s signature dishes, it features a Crocodile Foot braised in Chinese herbs, served on a bed of greens and a literal ring of fire. Bearing a taste similarly close to chicken, the meat is tender and sweet. Its skin is painstakingly descaled with a torch, revealing a thick and rich layer of collagen that coats the succulent herb-marinated meat with a soft and sticky texture, adding a consistent mouthfeel to every bite. If crocodile foot and mammal innards might be too adventurous for some, we also offer more conventional favourites such as Firecracker Chicken and Wagyu Truffle Hor Fun. Not a space for political correctness and mellow elevator music, the restaurant recommends not bringing any overtly conservative in-laws you might have. Make your way down to The Dragon Chamber, we dare you to enter the bowels of Chinese cuisine to discover your true gastronomic self. (Sept 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Dragon’s Claw, Crocodile Foot braised in Chinese herbs, Wagyu Truffle Hor Fun, Dragon Mountain, Firecracker Chicken, Cheeseburger Eggrolls

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/the-dragon-chamber
name: Dragon Chamber, The

html:
• ABOUT

    Drinks & Co, stalwarts of the Club Street scene, have powered into the original nightlife enclave: Holland Village. Riding on their celebrated bottle-shop plus bistro concept, the group has devised a more French brasserie approach for this Village outpost, with a menu devised by chef Adama Koita. Open with a classic Cold Cut Charcuterie Board, a playground of your favourite cured meats including pork rillettes, chorizo, and salami, served up with crunchy cornichons and artisanal bread. There’s also an Artisanal Cheese Platter to go with the bright, robust wines on offer from the shelves. Mains here come in the form of smoky grilled meats. Think hearty steaks like the Grilled Ribeye served with a medley of seasonal vegetables and red wine jus, or the New Zealand Rack of Lamb served up with French ratatouille and a salad of puffed rice. Other mains take a more British gastropub turn, with a Classic Fish & Chips, featuring beer battered Sea Bass, and Bangers & Mash made with fatty Kurobuta Pork Toulouse Sausages, crowning the menu. Dessert is a classic Chocolate Lava Cake affair, though you should also get the Raspberry Dome, an elegant, tangy confection, and make a double-dessert night of it. After all, this place is all about sharing, and with vibes this good, you’ll definitely want to bring a friend or two along for the ride. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The C° Wagyu Burger, Signature Mix Meat Platter, Grilled Coconut Corn, Cold Cut Charcuterie Board, Smoked Salmon Pizza, Classic Fish & Chips, Raspberry Dome

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/drinks-co-kitchen-holland-v
name: Drinks & Co Kitchen (Holland V)

html:
• ABOUT

    The original Club Street bottle-shop concept has been a long-standing favourite amongst discerning night owls in Singapore, and here the people behind Drinks & Co have expanded down the street into a larger space. Also expanded is their food menu, with an extensive grill section. This is definitely a more dressed up version of the brand, perfect for dates and big groups, especially since the heaving portions here demand to be shared. Off the grill comes the Co Wagyu Burger, enrobed in melty cheese and served with freshly-baked buns for mouthfuls of perfection. Then there’s the Char Grilled Beef Skirt Steak, still smoking at the edges as it arrives served up with a zingy chimichurri sauce and fluffy fried potatoes. If you’re looking for a more restrained booze and bites situation, the elegant tapas menu here is the right fit. Think delicate little Shrimp Beignets with a twee and old fashioned cocktail sauce, or Burrata Cheese & San Daniele Ham for a little hit of creamy, salty, gooey goodness to go with some bubbly. Then there’s the Fried Brava Potatoes with Chili Mayo & Ricotta Cheese for a carb bomb that’s actually worth it. Meanwhile, booze is available by the bottle at super friendly prices, a deal that’s increasingly hard to find in this city. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Drunken Farmer, one of Singapore's leading authority on all things natural wines by lifestyle collective Spa Esprit Group, is brewing up its signature brand of unadulterated funk to natural wine lovers and families living in the east with the launch of a second sourdough-focused bistro and natural wine bar concept in the colourful Joo Chiat neighbourhood on the East Coast.Riding on the success of turning Common Man Stan—the CBD outpost of Common Man Coffee Roasters—into a 'two-faced concept' earlier this year, the recently opened Joo Chiat joint of the specialty coffee roaster and cafe is set to undergo the same day-to-night transformation from cafe by day to natural wine bar and bistro by night, adding more colour to the familyfriendly estate's vibrant dining scene with a wholesome and gut-friendly package of sharing plates and quaffable natural wines.Curated with a focus on feeding the posse of wine-loving pals or family nights out, the menu at Joo Chiat brings in a small but sumptuous introduction of new dishes. Adding on to the widely-received sourdough-centered menu conceived back in its Le Vin Levain days, diners can first line their bellies with snacks including the anchoring signature Sourdough Karaage (S$20) for a juicy crunch of slow-marinated then sourdough battered chicken thigh chunks with a zingy homemade kimchi mayo; seasoned and skewered Prawn Sticks (S$20) that are best enjoyed with drizzles of smoke paprika aioli, and a perennial Sharing Spread Platter (S$22) of pita bread served alongside a hearty trio of avocado cream, pumpkin hummus and seeds praline for dips.Indubitably integral to the experience at Drunken Farmer is its diverse and ever-growing collection of natural wines that span across the spectrum of red, white, rosé, orange and sparkling. Wine lovers in search for a convivial watering hole in the east can look forward to a rotation of 14 labels available by-theglass (from S$18) for fresh discoveries at every return, or have their pick from a bottle selection of over 80 labels (from S$87) that is well on its way to offering the largest selection of orange wines and pèt-nat in Singapore. For the unintiated or adventurous, the Farmer’s Selection (S$50) offers three glasses curated by our natural wine experts to help begin your natural wine journey or simply pair with your meal. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chorizo Pizza, Sharing Spread Platter

Fermented with love to give you the best natural wines and sourdough pizzas.Started as a passion project with a whole lotta kung fu in the backroom of Tiong Bahru Bakery, Drunken Farmer @ Stanley Street makes crazy-delicious sourdough pizzas and fermented snacks paired with extraordinary natural wines. All our cheeses and butter are handmade in our kitchen using milk of Singapore's very own cows. Indigenous ingredients sourced from local farms go into our dips and sauces. That’s real, handmade action to create food that’s 100% good for your gut. Our name is inspired by the drunken kung fu masters, a reminder of the mastery and skill behind the natural wine farmers and bakers that influence our cuisine. (Oct 2021)

• ABOUT

    Roast duck or duck pie? At this modern Chinese restaurant by the TungLok group, you can have both. Using ducks from Silver Hill Farm Hill in Ireland — known to breed the ‘wagyu’ of ducks — the juicy, tender meat is the result of feeding the birds well and keeping them in a spacious environment. Try the duck typical Asian-style, roasted in a combi-oven with herbs, wine and spices. Or a savoury Duck Broth, an intense bone soup that is packed with flavour. From the Western side of the menu, the Duck Confit & Waffle is a fun twist on the typical fried chicken and waffle combo. The fork-tender meat is drizzled with maple syrup and a generous slab of butter that melts over the hot, fluffy waffle bed. Another must-try is the Duck Pie, where buttery shortcrust pastry is wrapped around thick slices of juicy duck meat. Pure decadence in every bite. (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Here’s where Duckland differs from its rival Chinese-style duck restaurant chains — It also offers hipster angmoh dishes, like the Duck Confit & Waffle… a Duck Pie...and Spaghetti Duck Bolognese.” - 8 Days

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roast Duck, Duck Confit & Waffle, Duck Fried Rice, Duck Pie, Irish Lamb Stew

• PRESS RELEASE

    Dum Pukht is derived from Persian meaning 'air-cooked' or 'baked'. The Dum Pukht cooking uses a round heavy-bottomed pot. There are two main aspects to this style of cooking, roasting and maturing of a prepared dish.In this style of cuisine, herbs and spices play an important role. The process of slow roasting gently releases maximum flavour. The sealing of the Handi's lid is wrapped with dough to achieve maturing. Cooking slowly in its juices, the food retains all its natural aromas and becomes imbued with the richness of flavours that distinguishes the dish. Par-cooked food is kept in Handi with a minimal amount of water. The lid is placed and sealed with a paste of flour and water. The flames are put out, leaving a bed of hot coals. The heat creates the steam, the steam condenses and rolls down the curved walls. In other words, the steam is choked before it can escape, leading to the term 'Dum Pukht'. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tamatar Shorba, Warki Paratha, Dum Ke Aloo Bharwan, Tandoor Veg Platter

Specializing in Modern European cuisines and with a great selection of wines, the restaurant is curated specially for communal dining, complete with Instragram-worthy cocktails, views and photo points to take in with your favourite people! html:
• ABOUT

    You can almost hear a sea-breeze at this cozy cafe and restaurant. The charming nautical-themed decor and handsome wooden touches throw you straight into a seafaring fantasy right in the middle of King Albert Park. It’s the perfect mid-shopping getaway for those tired feet and hunger pangs: expect comforting nosh and hearty cafe grub, alongside an invigorating cup of strong coffee. Except this isn’t your usual cafe fare. There’s a healthy amount of kitchen wizardry at work here. Think of hefty appetizers like their signature Treasures in a Bun, a pillowy steamed bun stuffed with slow-braised pork belly done up with caramelized ginger chili sauce and crunchy fried shallots. This is matched with fiery Thai-influenced salads like the Pomelo Pick Me Up, a salad of tender poached prawns tossed in a zingy sweet chili lime dressing, dressed with peanuts, and scattered with tart pomelo gems for a true party in the mouth. Mains here go straight to comfort food territory with numbers like the Lobster Submarine, a buttery roll filled with poached lobster that’s dressed with lemony mayo, crunchy tobiko, and crunchy vegetables. For something even heftier, and more indulgent, get the Foie Gras Wagyu Burger, which hits all the luxury eating sweet spots: meltingly fatty foie gras crowns a juicy Wagyu patty that’s sandwiched between fluffy brioche buns and held together by a lovely onion marmalade and mushrooms. If there’s room for dessert, the Chocolate Cherry Dome, a beautiful confection of chocolate, berries compote, strawberries, and meringue, will seal the deal on your visit. Pop by for their High Tea too for tiers of similarly elegant desserts and a quiet afternoon in one of the city’s most charming neighbourhoods. (Oct 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pomelo Pick Me Up, Treasures in a Bun, Foie Gras Wagyu Burger, Lobster Risotto, Pasta Truffle Blackbeard Chocolate Cherry Dome

• ABOUT

    The people behind Singapore’s favourite steakhouse, Jack’s Place, bring you Eatzi Gourmet Bistro, a Halal restaurant that serves up tasty Western plates. Here, there’s everything from Jack’s Place’s classic hot-plate steaks to all-day breakfasts, a little bit of everything for the whole family. Whether it’s house favourites like sizzling cuts of New Zealand Grass Fed Beef, or tangles of spaghetti in rich seafood sauce, all the hallmarks of the Jack’s Place experience are here. There are even some special local flavour options like a zingy Sambal Steak, a tender cut of beef served up with a chunky sambal sauce, and savoury Nasi Goreng served up with satay and prawns. Apart from mains, there’s also a hefty selection of delicious appetizers, like juicy mushrooms stuffed with slipper lobster and crab or crispy batons of deep fried chicken meat luncheon meat, as well as an array of milkshakes, smoothies, and waffles, to keep you sated whether you’re in search of a light afternoon bite, a sweet treat at tea time, or a more substantial family dinner. With its extensive menu and commitment to providing variety, it won’t be a surprise if this becomes your go-to destination for birthdays to anniversaries, and everything in between. (Feb 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ribeye Steak, Sambal Steak, Mushrooms with Slipper Lobster and Crabmeat, Seafood Spaghetti Marinara, Nasi Goreng with Prawns & Chicken Satay

• ABOUT

    Presenting a diverse and interactive dining experience at the stunning Pan Pacific Singapore, Edge, a multifaceted buffet restaurant, showcases a culinary tour of Singapore and the Pacific Rim right in the heart of the city. Offering a whopping seven live food theatres, as well as a la minute presentations which include an extensive array of Asian and Pacific delicacies inspired by umami rich flavours and sophisticated cooking techniques from the region, Edge goes above and beyond the typical hotel buffet in every sense. They even give diners the opportunity to observe and connect with the chefs while exploring the substantial selection of almost 120 dishes and 35 desserts, and well, if that's not going above, beyond, and possibly over the "edge", we don't know what is! (Mar 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "One of those rare buffet restaurants offering a mind-boggling variety of cuisines without compromising on quality." -SG Now "What we especially loved about the space at Edge is just how big it is! Whether you want a big table for a long lunch with a few families, or prefer a smaller gathering with the hubby, the restaurant has so many nooks and crannies and is so filled with happy chatter that it's perfect for everybody - with kids or without." -Sassy Mama SG "Do you have a clear-cut favourite buffet restaurant in Singapore? I thought I did. But after recently trying out the fare at Edge in Pan Pacific Singapore, there is now a strong competitor for my buffet affections." -The Straits Times

  • ABOUT

    This vegetarian restaurant has been around since 2007, and if that isn’t a testament to its food, we don’t know what is. Located just steps from the iconic Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, this eatery has a menu that could easily convert any carnivore. The restaurant’s motto, meatless does not mean tasteless, is echoed in many of the menu items, which are made with plant-based meat alternatives that are just as good, if not better than the original. The Marmite Vegetarian Pork Ribs are a chef specialty, and made with soy and yeast extract. While it may not sound very appealing, the combination of rich soy meat and earthy Marmite makes for a delectable combination - perfect as a snack or as an accompaniment to some freshly steamed jasmine rice. Another dish worth trying is the Vegetarian Peking Duck. The clever use of fresh yam fried to crisp perfection to make the “duck meat” and the delicious taste of the of the dish itself are enough to convince you that you’re chowing down on real meat. Hankering for some treasures of the sea? Fret not, as they’ve got that on the menu as well. Try the Thai Sauce Cod Fish - a spicy sour dish of mock fish meat doused in a Thai-inspired dressing. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Thai Sauce Cod Fish, Vegetarian Peking Duck, Marmite Vegetarian Pork Ribs, Nyonya Fish, Wasabi Prawn

    Get ready for a fiesta of flavours at El Mero Mero X Senor Taco in CHIJMES as they dish out unique dishes with surprising ingredients sourced directly from Mexico and a wide selection of Tequila, Mezcal, Spanish spirits, cocktails, beers, wines, and more!With an open-kitchen concept greeting diners looking to be seated indoors and a stunning terrace for those looking to soak in the sun, El Mero Mero X Senor Taco’s got a little something for everyone. Take their sensational menu for instance. Structured around the two seating plans of the restaurant, you can either enjoy the Terrace Menu or relish in the Cocina Menu. Both menus feature small plate offerings, traditional tacos, Josper grilled favourites, and a plethora of desserts. The San Remo Prawn Ceviche with sea urchin, mango, and chili is a personal Chope favourite, and pairs along quite well with the Tiger Prawn Tempura Taco loaded with coconut, mango, and cabbage on a freshly prepared corn tortilla.For dessert, we suggest ordering a big slice of El Mero Mero X Senor Taco’s signature Tequila Pecan Pie. Served with a generous scoop of cinnamon ice cream - it’s just the zesty ending the meal calls for! (Dec 2015)

html:
• ASIA'S 50 BEST BARS 2017

    Employees Only Singapore has been named #17 in Asia's 50 Best Bars 2017, voted by the most knowledgeable and travelled members of the bar industry, drinks media and mixology experts from across Asia.

  • ABOUT

    With noted New York restaurants popping up all over Singapore, it’s quickly beginning to feel like the city is turning into a satellite state of the Big Apple. But with nightlife legends like Employees Only leading the charge, there’s very little to complain about. Loved by night owls in New York for its kooky, offbeat service, strong classic cocktails, and delicious comfort food, this West Village institution is now in Singapore, headed by one of the original bosses, the affable Igor Hadzismajlovic. Employees Only’s Singapore outpost is the bar’s first such international undertaking, and has landed at swish Amoy Street, to join the belt-of-sin’s constellation of upmarket speakeasies. Past the friendly door-keeps, you’re greeted by a surly, turban-wearing fortune teller (don’t ask) before you go through velvet curtains into a Moulin-Rouge-esque carnival of raucous chatter, Motown, and the chaotic sounds of a busy bar. The crowd is one of the friendliest in town, standing-room only on the best of nights with plenty of good booze to keep conversations going. Sip on one of the bar’s superb classic Manhattans as you scoot over to your table and sit down to a supper of comforting favourites like the joint’s famous Bone Marrow Poppers and Hand Cut Steak Tartare. Earlier in the night, dinner plates include a Roasted Half Chicken adorned with cauliflower, capers, and parsley, a tender Porterhouse Pork Chop with black eyed peas and savoy cabbage, and a grilled Whole Rainbow Trout. But with accolades including Spirited Awards’ “World’s Best Cocktail Bar”, Employees Only Singapore guides your focus to the well trained bar-team, led by veteran bartender Steve Schneider, which turns out classic cocktails and new signatures made from a hefty selection of boutique spirits, house-made syrups, tinctures, and other goodies. Employees Only is all good: the vibes, the food, the drink, and, employees or not, we’re glad it’s in Singapore! (Jan 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “You can expect raucous late-night partying and friendly hospitality—the last batch of revelers will be served warm cups of chicken soup upon closing.” -SG Magazine “Choose to have your fortune read or squeeze through the mingling crowd to the back of Employee’s Only Singapore for a table – like the original New York cocktail institution of the same name, this local off-shoot is a favourite among F&B folks to gather and unwind.” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Half Roast Chicken, Bone Marrow Poppers, Hand Cut Steak Tartare, Whole Rainbow Trout, Ribeye Steak, Manhattan, Ginger Smash

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    The Privé Group's first foray into Chinese cuisine, EMPRESS snags a prime spot in the Asian Civilisations Museum. Offering up waterfront dining, the restaurant boasts an excellent view of the Singapore River. A theme of mixing old and new flows throughout the restaurant and nicely echoes the design philosophy of the museum. It's contemporary interior and vibrant décor contrasts with the colonial facade, and diners will surely enjoy the juxtaposition of casual dining whilst nestled in the confines of a formal museum. This trend continues with the menu. EMPRESS features dishes that are a mainstay of Cantonese cuisine but does so in a way that blends good ole' Cantonese flavours with more modern touches. Don't worry, you'll still be able to recognize items from dim sum to their signature roast meats. Speaking of which, the Triple Roast Platter, which showcases Spare Ribs, Char Siew, and Roast Pork, all of which are carefully cooked to retain that perfect level of juiciness, is a team favourite! EMPRESS is also one of the first few restaurants in Singapore to give an Asian-slant to Impossible Meat – the Impossible Meat Gyozas and Kway Teow are truly delicious. EMPRESS also bucks convention with their Western-style salads and plated desserts including the decadent Sticky Date & Longan Pudding. On weekends and public holidays, EMPRESS also offers a sumptuous dim sum buffet which you can pair with champagne for an indulgent treat. All in all, EMPRESS hopes to eradicate the notion that Cantonese cuisine can be a bit stuffy, and you'll no doubt agree once you experience the relaxed environment and accessible dishes. (Mar 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "While EMPRESS is sleek with an upbeat vibe, old school elements like rattan-backed dining chairs and round wooden tables with lazy Susans add nostalgia." -The Business Times "EMPRESS succeeds easily in marrying traditional Cantonese cuisine with a modern dining concept." -Honeycombers "EMPRESS though, has got it just right. Keeping some of those traditions but embracing a relaxed, unstuffy and modern approach too. Definitely a restaurant to add to your go-to list." -Expat Adventures

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab Mantou Buns, King Prawn Dumpling in Supreme Broth, Wok-Charred Broccoli & Broccolini Salad, Seared Angus Beef Tenderloin Cubes, Triple Roast Platter, Hokkaido Scallop & Prawn ‘Mapo’ Tofu, Dragon's Breath Angus Beef Hor Fun, Sticky Date & Longan Pudding, Pandan Crème Brûlée

html:
• ABOUT

    Touted to be Singapore’s first ‘restaurant with rooms’, The English House is designed to give diners a taste of what it’ll be like dining in the home of British legend Marco Pierre White. Lush green foliage at the entrance gives way to dimly-lit interiors decked with Terry O’Neill photographs, while jazz music plays softly in the background. From the menu comes British classics like fish and chips and beef wellington. The former is no greasy battered fish served in a newspaper cone; instead, White brings in top-grade English turbot, lightly-battered and served with thick, golden chips cooked in beef fat. Order mains like the Grilled Rib of Black Angus Beef and the Honey Roast Belly Pork Marco Polo to share. The Honey Roast Pork Belly comes piping hot in a claypot, where four generous slabs of unctuous meat lie on a bed of fried kway teow. The smoky rice noodles, together with the marbled meat and crunchy pieces of crackling are a wonderful combination that will keep you coming back for more. Save some space for desserts — portions are dainty enough to have one all by yourself. Top picks include a wobbly English Egg Custard that tastes like a refined egg tart, or opt for a lighter dish of Champagne Poached Pear with a luscious creme vanilla. (Feb 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “As far as the food goes, this is a house worth visiting.” -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish and Chips, Honey Roast Belly Pork, Prime Black Angus Beef Wellington, English Egg Custard, Champagne Poached Pear

  • PRIVATE DINING ROOM

    - $1,000 minimum spend- Sits up to 5- 1940s Rolls Royce boardroom antique table- Custom surround sound- Ideal for corporate/business meetings, lunches and dinnersKindly reach out to the restaurant directly for more private dining room enquiries. html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the vintage brownstone Kam Leng Hotel on Jalan Besar, this restaurant exudes retro charm, even from the exterior. From the twinkling lights illuminating the signboard to the pop art illustrations of Chinese ladies with coiffed hair adorning the menu, stepping into this restaurant is like going back in time. The concept may be dated, but the food certainly isn’t. Founded solely on the principle of enjoying life while it lasts, this spot serves up delicious nosh at an affordable price. Chef-Owner Joel lives by one principle, and that is making the most of precious moments by enjoying some of the best food life has to offer. Therefore it’s no surprise that the menu here consists of hearty local comfort food such as the Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, and XO White Fish Soup. The Curry Chicken is a must-try. The chicken is cooked in a special blend of spices till it is tender enough to fall off the bone, giving the dish a richness that is reminiscent of zi char stalls in the olden days. The Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon is a great option for diners who love hawker food. Made with thin stands of vermicelli tossed in a smoky, savoury homemade sauce, and topped with a generous portion of melt-in-your-mouth braised pork, this is the perfect dish to warm you up on a cold day. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, Salt-baked Whole Barramundi, Chef Joel's BBQ Pork Cheek

html:
• ABOUT

    Staying true to his local roots, owner and head chef Joel Ong, continues to keep our Singaporean traditions alive with his wok. Innovating his menu with unique twists and simple tweaks, Chef Joel brings his brainchild — Enjoy Eating House and Bar to the neighbourhood of Stevens. Situated away from the hustle and bustle of city life, Enjoy at Stevens will spot a familiar yet modernistic experience. Established since 2018, Enjoy's regulars will be familiar with their hearty recipes, inherited from Chef Joel's grandma, that are zhng-ed to give a contemporary interpretation of zi char delights that come with a strong wok hei flavour. With a new elevated menu meticulously curated by the Enjoy team, one can expect an array of quality selections exclusive to the latest flagship outlet such as the Classic Yu Sheng Ceviche, White Pepper Alaskan King Crab, Popiah Garden, and more. So get seated, it's seriously time to ENJOY now! (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grandma's Te Kah Bee Hoon, Singapore Style Chilli Prawns, White Pepper Alaskan King Crab, Salt-baked Whole Barramundi

  • ABOUT

    Step inside Entrance Bar and find yourself in a classy, modern contemporary establishment known for their Ippin-Ryori style Japanese-European fusion food and molecular gastronomy-inspired cocktails. Only operating in the evenings, it’s the perfect place for post-work drinks as you kick back in an elegant space. Taking pride in presentation, Entrance has come up with a creative and avant-garde menu of cocktails to boast. Diners can expect an experience like no other as they feast on a liquid buffet of cocktails that pairs so well with their Japanese-European menu. Snack on their nori seaweed, a tasty, crunchy delight that’s great to pick on as you sip on perfectly executed cocktails. Our favourite is their Matcha Trance, an elegant green drink with notes of bittersweet matcha. Looking for more than a snack? Entrance’s Salmon Tacos are addictively good. Enjoy the taste of smoky salmon mixed with your usual toppings all in a single taco shell. Pair this with a lovely Elderflower Haku Cocktail for a floral and refreshing taste, or go for something stronger with their Entrance Gin Roll. For a meatier option, try out their Jamon Iberico Brioche, a buttery toasted bun with slices of Iberico shaved on top. It’s the ultimate indulgence — we recommend pairing this with a Yogin Dark Sea Salt Crumble to complement the salty and savoury flavours. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Matcha Trance, Salmon Taco, Nori Seaweed, Elderflower Haku Cocktail, Yogin Dark Sea Salt Crumble

    Inspired by cafés and bars of Italian origins in financial districts of metropoles such as New York City and Sydney, this cheerful gastrobar is a dining destination offering wholesome mains, great bar bites and a wide range of sides and desserts. With an extensive menu full of gut-satisfying food, Erwin’s Gastrobar is bound to wake up the palate of its diners! Appealing dishes such as hearty burgers, pastas, fresh salads and pizzas will help to pique all senses. M After a hard day’s work, chill out over happy hours with our Paulaner beers on draft, quality Italian wines and Prosecco by the glass or carafe at great value and also imported specialty beers by the bottles. Erwin's Gastrobar is the go-to venue for coffee breaks, breakfast, lunch, happy hour drinks and dinner with colleagues and friends.     Enjoy sizzling steaks and an assortment of dishes fresh off the grill at Escape Restaurant. Located poolside at level 6 of One Farrer Hotel, mouthwatering grilled entrées and burgers are served alongside an array of side dishes and cocktails amidst a casual al fresco setting or in the air-conditioned dining room. Perfect for family occasions and get-togethers with friends. (Aug 2021)

  • 20% OFF DINE & DIVE EASTER SUNDAY BRUNCH BUFFET (17 APR)

    Pack your sunnies and grab your buddies for a picture perfect brunch! Chef Marcus Tan and his team present a culinary escapade for families and friends with an a la carte buffet selection featuring smokin’ grill favourites, brunch staples and egg-citing Easter-inspired signatures! Get ready to feast, quench your thirst with bottomless tipples and make a splash in the pool! Experience a laid-back scintillating BBQ and start light with a refreshing bowl of Papaya Salad with Grilled Prawn, Butternut Squash Bisque, Potato Salad with Salted Egg York, Forest Mushroom Pasta with Smoked Duck, and fresh bakes including an assortment of rolls, baguettes and quiche loaded with spinach, feta and charred red capsicum. Hop by the artisanal egg station and order up your style of egg, prepared the way you like it. Choose from an array of accompaniments such as ham, bacon, mushroom and more. Can’t seem to make up your mind? Go for the classic Egg Benedict featuring buttery English muffins, warm poached eggs topped with a heavenly hollandaise drizzle - a hallmark of weekend brunches! Fresh off the smokin’ hot grill, you will find the perfectly grilled Black Angus Beef Ribeye with a dash of thyme sea salt, Char-grilled Huli Huli Chicken tenderly marinated with Sriracha, Smoky Chicken Sausages and Bratwurst, fall-off-the-bone BBQ Pork Spare Ribs, Barramundi Fillets with Honey Miso and aromatic Roasted Garlic. Experience the farm-to-table concept with delightful sides prepared using the fresh produce harvested at One Farrer’s urban farm. Embrace the freshness in our farm-grown vegetables such as the forest mushrooms, capsicum, asparagus, zucchini and more, an absolute delight with grilled meat. Get egg-cited with Easter-themed patisseries like the traditional Hot Cross Bun, Cheeky Chicky Carrot Cake, Bunny Green Velvety Cake and chocolate-centric treats like the Egg Nest Chocolate Royale and Chocolate Easter Eggs. Feast your eyes on these innovative desserts handmade by our talented pastry chef - the decadent Candied Bacon Brownies Slab; fudgy with a well-balanced sweet and salty taste, and the Popcorn Cheesecake; crunchy on the top and bursting with flavours that you will not be able to resist! Little ones enjoy heaps of fun at the Décor-it-yourself Cookies Corner, designing their very own cookies with tri-colour whipped cream, sprinkles, assorted jellies and candies. Top this all by winding down with a refreshing dip in our Olympic-size pool and enjoy a splashin’ good time with your family and friends! A haven for al fresco dining experiences, Escape provides the perfect venue for brunch with loved ones with its lively ambience, so make your weekend plans with us today!When: 17 Apr 2022Time: 12-3pmPrice: $68++ per person• Top up for Free-flow Beverages (selected alcoholic / non alcoholic drinks) $30++ for 1 hour of Free-Flow of Beverages | $50++ for 2 hours• Kids 7yrs old to 12yrs old dine at half price.• Kids below 7yrs old dine for free.• Complimentary usage of Swimming Pool.
