html:
• ABOUT

    If you're a tapas lover, you've probably already met, fallen for, and likely tried to marry Esquina, a charming hole-in-the-wall restaurant wrapped around a corner of Jiak Chuan in Keong Saik. With nostalgic Spanish kitchen curios and rough-hewn textures, the final product is a modern depiction of an urban canteen in Seville. Esquina has seen two chef changes since its founding, but the tradition of strong flavours and Spanish flair continues on with Executive Chef Carlos Montobbio. Born in Barcelona, the 28 year old has over ten years of experience despite his youth, including time spent in Michelin-starred restaurants, which accounts for the sophistication of the food and plating. While the second storey offers a quieter and equally quaint setting, you might prefer to sit around the frenetic open kitchen on the ground floor to marvel at the works of art being created not two feet away. Perfectly tender Grilled Spanish Octopus, the deceptively plain-sounding Spanish Omelette, and more unique Wagyu Beef Intercostals are just a few of the delicious plates you can find on the six-sectioned menu. The tiny digs may leave you without a seat if you haven't made a reservation, but Esquina is definitely worth the wait. (Jan 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Labeling Esquina's food simply as "tapas" doesn't seem to do it justice. The dishes are gastronomic and visual works of sheer creativity, skill and passion. One of the dishes that has remained on the menu is the Spanish Breakfast - a slow cooked egg served with bravas sauce, cubed and creamed potato and crispy Iberico ham. If you're looking for an authentic taste of Spain in this tapas bar, then this is the perfect dish for you." -Asia Tatler Dining "The concise placemat menu, augmented by a counter of daily fish and seafood specials, is overseen by executive chef Andrew Walsh, a former Pollen Street Social sous-chef. The food is an interesting interplay of classic and playful. There's a nicely textured but unseasoned Spanish classic omelette, or a gooey-good slow-cooked egg with bravas tomato sauce, potatoes and crispy jamon iberico." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Spanish Octopus, Esquina's Spanish Omelette, Crispy Baby Squid, Sardines with Samfaina, Pigeon with Forest Berries Escabeche, Basil Sorbet & Strawberries

    Estate is the residential all-day dining restaurant of Hilton Singapore Orchard. Located on level five in the communal heart of the newly opened hotel, Estate showcases culinary experiences and flavours from around the world, while elevating familiar regional favourites that resonate with local residents.Under the watch of a highly skilled team of passionate chefs led by Hilton Singapore Orchard’s Director of Culinary Vijayakant Shanmugam, Estate delivers a sophisticated buffet dining experience similar to an à la carte-style restaurant. At Estate, each dish is exquisitely plated for individual serving as the chefs are big on presentation.Central to Estate’s dining experience are the residential-style open kitchens that set the stage for a live display of culinary showmanship as the chefs whip up tantalising dishes à la minute in full view of guests. Many components of the dishes at Estate are prepared from scratch using laborious techniques to yield maximum flavours, promising an indulgent selection of epicurean delights that focus on quality over quantity.Estate also flaunts a beautiful range of handcrafted desserts that are masterfully curated and exquisitely plated, delivering an experience reminiscent of a high-end patisserie. Sweet endings include a combination of bite-sized treats to sliced or whole cakes, a selection of local delights, and à la minute live station dishing out warm sweets – think melt-in-your-mouth pancakes. html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled in an elegant and cosy setting along Duxton Hill, Etna serves up modern Italian cuisine with a Sicilian touch. Dining here is almost like dining in a good friend’s living room — the intimate 40-seater is warmly lit, and has a homely vibe to it. For appetisers, the Parmigiania de Melanzane is a good way to whet the appetite, with its baked eggplants layered with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. The meaty aubergines are soft, bathed in a sweet tomato sauce perfect for dipping into with some focaccia bread. Pastas here are simple yet delicious. A popular dish is the lobster ravioli, with butter pistachio cream and prawns, as well as the carbonara, which comes with a dollop of caviar and mullet roe, generously sprinkled with a crack of fresh black pepper. Etna’s specialty is the housemade pizzas, with a crispy base that supports fresh ingredients like mushrooms, artichokes and mixed seafood. For dessert, the classics don’t disappoint. Get the tiramisu, and pair the creamy layered treat with a scoop of gelato to end the meal on a sweet note. (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Linguine al Granchio, Lasagna alla Bolognese, Stracotto, Dentice Stufato, Etna Pizza

• ABOUT

    Nestled in an elegant and cosy setting in East Coast, Etna serves up modern Italian cuisine with a Sicilian touch. For appetisers, dig into the Parmigiania de Melanzane, where baked eggplants are layered with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil. The meaty aubergines are soft, bathed in a sweet tomato sauce perfect for dipping into with some focaccia bread. Pastas here are simple yet delicious. A popular dish is the lobster ravioli, with butter pistachio cream and prawns, as well as the risotto calamari, where al dente rice grains are mixed with squid, sea urchin and crispy leek. For mains, tuck into Italian classics like the Fiorentina steak. The juicy T-bone steak is big enough for two to share, with a side of roasted vegetables and mashed potatoes. For dessert, the classics don’t disappoint. Try the traditional Sicilian cannoli stuffed with ricotta cheese and candied fruits for a sweet ending to your meal. (Aug 2018)

html:
• ABOUT

    Restaurant Euphoria is the showcase for Gastro-Botanica, the culinary philosophy by celebrated chef Jason Tan. The name ‘Euphoria’ and the Chinese character ‘’ in the logo convey the promise of delight, wonderment, and enduring memory awaiting the diner. With Restaurant Euphoria, Chef Jason introduces Gastro-Botanica 2.0, the elevated iteration of his original cuisine that showcases carefully sourced and prepared premium vegetables, meats and seafood, where prominence and elaboration are given to botanical elements of vegetables, tubers, herbs, spices, and fruits. Version 2.0 introduces botanical essences to create base sauces known as Gastro-Botanica Essences – La Symphonie de Légumes. In doing so, Chef Jason radically departs from the foundational ‘mother sauces’ of French haute cuisine, thus blazing the trail for further innovation. Euphoria features completely new 2.0 creations, along with Chef Jason’s signature dish of the Cévennes onion in four ways called ‘My Favourite Vegetable’. Located in vibrant Tras Street, the restaurant recreates a lush garden within its heritage shophouse interior, setting the stage for a gastronomic journey with a ground-breaking chef at the peak of his craft.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oignon doux des Cévennes, Oignon Jamboree, Maine Lobster, Patin Fish

  • ABOUT

    Evan's Kitch prides itself on offering a modern-asian menu that is quality conscious.It serves a diverse menu with all-day breakfast and brunch options that are perfect for casual dining at any time. Brunch favorites at Evan's Kitch include their Evan's Style Duck Leg & Maple Syrup and their Steak & Eggs. Featuring 36 hours stewed duck leg with housemade hoisin sauce and furikake topping, their Duck Leg & Maple Syrup is a breakfast for the kings. Their Steak & Egg includes juicy grain fed ribeye served with fresh sourdough bread and a sunny side up that’s guaranteed to fuel you up for the day. Our tip: break the yolk and use it as a dip to go with the meat and bread. The Asian Chilli Parmesan Wings are perfect for sharing. Served with scallions, furikake, and housemade chilli jam, these wings are finger licking good and addictively hot. The main dish to try is their Spiced Salmon Fillet with a tart lemon butter gravy as well as their Fettuccine with North Malaysia Beef Rendang. The beef rendang is melt-in-your-mouth tender and perfectly complements the creamy pasta. End your meal off on a sweet note with their Fried Banana (Kueh Kodok) Singapore Heritage Food. The highlight of the dish - their handcrafted liquor banana jam that adds a delicious layer of flair and flavour to the dessert. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Evan’s Style Duck Leg & Maple Syrup, Steak & Eggs, Asian Chilli Parmesan Wings, Spiced Salmon Fillet, Fried Banana (Kueh Kodok) Singapore Heritage Food

• ABOUT

    Eventasty is not your ordinary noodle house. Each bowl serves hand-pulled noodles for the best texture, and soups that are meticulously boiled to extract the most flavour. Their signature soup base is the tomato one, with the flavour and nutrients of seven tomatoes enriching every bowl of soup. Choose to have it three different ways: With braised beef shank, braised wagyu beef, or vinaigrette ebiko. Other comforting bases are the beef bone soup that has been boiled for eight hours, as well as the mushroom sauce. You can even choose the type of noodles you want: Thin, thick or flat. If you're still feeling hungry after a hearty portion of noodles, Eventasty offers a range of side dishes such as Lava Egg, Cucumber and Beancurd Skin Salad, and Marinated Beef Shank that are guaranteed to leave you satisfied. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised Wagyu Beef Noodle with Tomato Soup, Braised Wagyu Beef Noodle with Beef Bone Soup, Mushroom Braised Beef Shank Dry Noodle, Cucumber and Beancurd Skin Salad

html:
• ABOUT

    Unleash your inner Kingsmen with ExciseMan Wine & Whisky Bar. Unique for a specialist bar, head down to discover the world of wine and whisky with their extensive collection and expert knowledge. Impress your clients by booking their exclusive rooms that’re furnished with luxurious Chesterfield sofas, antique dining tables, and old-world memorabilia to fully experience the atmosphere. Or just swing by for an evening pick-me-up with friends or colleagues to enjoy a glass of whisky. Unsure of what to order? The ExciseMan’s knowledgeable bartenders are there to assist with recommendations that suit your taste, offering beverages regardless of brand, age statements, rewards, rarity, or price. Despite not being a cocktail bar, The ExciseMan is renowned for its Negroni and Gin & Tonic, where they use premium ingredients and liqueurs. For fuss-free drinks, go for cocktails like their Whisky Highball or Hot Toddy. Feast on their small bites like Truffle Siu Mei or Vegetarian Gyozas as you sample different kinds of alcohol. If you’re eyeing their wine selection, you should definitely order their deliciously crafted Cheese Platter to go with it. For something heavier, their Lasagne, available in both beef and vegetarian options, are highly affordable, cheesy, and satiating. Best paired with a glass of red wine or whisky to fully bring out the savoury notes of the creamy sauce. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Negroni, Whisky Highball, Hot Toddy, Truffle Siu Mei, Vegetarian Gyozas

• ABOUT

    When we think of pizza, we think of a solid, golden, crispy crust, fresh, just-off-the-vine tomatoes blended to make a savoury sauce, and endless amounts of cheese, and that’s exactly what Extra Virgin Pizza in Asia Square delivers. With flour shipped straight from Italy and tomatoes imported from “the golden state”, it’s no wonder why with every bite we feel so entranced by the authentic and harmonious flavours.The creations by Extra Virgin Pizza are famous for evoking all of your taste buds and with starters like Baked Oyster Mushrooms crowned with tarragon gremolata, it only makes sense that you come prepared to indulge. The Oven-Fired Clams, another popular starter on the menu, are drizzled with white vermouth sauce and enlivened with garlic, making for the perfect introduction to the meal.As for their glorious pizzas? You probably should gather all your friends so you can try all the amazing concoctions. From the Peace Be Ragu, a crowd-favourite for meat-lovers, to the Secret 'Stache, a bronte pistachio pesto-based pizza topped with pumpkin, rocket, ricotta salata, fior di latte and lemon citronette - the endless unique options make this pizzeria stand out from the rest.Pair any of the pizzas with their cocktails, beers (on tap or bottled), a cuppa of specialty coffee roasted by Papa Palheta, or a glass of wine. (Apr 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    “It's more than just dough and cheese at these gourmet pizza joints: expect lovingly hand-crafted pizzas with an imaginative array of toppings and perfectly blistered crust.” -SG Now “With flour imported from Italy and tomatoes from California, this lethal combination makes for a perfectly balanced, thin, soft and slightly crispy beauty.” -Urban Journey

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bufala Margherita, The Breakfast Club, Secret 'Stache, Material Girl, Peace Be Ragu, Aloha'm

    Step into casual and cool vibes here at The Fabulous Baker Boy. A cafe, bakery and restaurant all in one, the eatery presents an all-day breakfast brunch menu and a riveting array of fabulous cakes. Featuring classics with a twist, the expansive menu includes artisanal baked goods such as sourdough bread, croissants, quiches, cookies and cakes. With more than 14 cakes to choose on, diners will be spoilt for choice. Pair popular menu items such as the Pumpkin and Ricotta Ravioli with Burnt Butter and Sage with delicious smoothies, milkshakes, ice cream and chocolate-based beverages. For the cheese lovers and health conscious, the Roast Chicken and Pesto Grilled Cheese Sandwich is The Fabulous Baker Boy’s house sourdough bread slices filled with a tasty three cheese mix of cheddar, parmesan, mozzarella, roast chicken and herbed pesto. Served with a piping hot bowl of Roasted Tomato or Cream of Mushroom Soup, this delicious brunch menu option is sure to leave diners coming back for more. Other signature brunch menu items include the Cinn Bun Pancakes, Fab Fry Up and Uncle Jimmy’s Fish & Chips. (Jan 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Chilli crab and Hainanese chicken rice have become the hallmark of Singaporean-Chinese cuisine. But, head to Famous Treasure for a taste of lesser-known dishes that are a nod to Singapore’s melting pot of cultures. Dinner starts with little saucers of tangy pickled papaya and sour plum-infused tomatoes that are meant to whet your appetite for the savoury plates to come. A dish of Steamed Empress Chicken is a well-loved Cantonese favourite. The fresh, plump chicken is lightly salted and steamed, drizzled with Shaoxing wine and soya sauce, then garnished with julienned ginger for a hint of heat. Also, try the Whole Steamed Fish with sour preserved vegetables, peanuts, and roast pork in a brown sauce for an uncommon pairing of ingredients. Carbs are a must-have at every Chinese restaurant, and the Teochew-style Kway Teow Fried with Chye Poh and Kai Lan is a humble dish redolent with wok hei (a complex, charred aroma). The flat rice noodles are tossed with preserved radish and chopped Chinese broccoli, then skillfully cooked at high heat over roaring flames for that deep, smoke-kissed flavour. Apart from its extensive food menu, Famous Treasure also offers a vast selection of wines and whiskies, including limited editions such as a Balvenie 30-year-old Scotch as well as a 30-year-old Glenglassaugh. Sip on these rich, smoky spirits that are the perfect complement to a meal here. (Feb 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Get your zi char fix in cool comfort at this downtown eatery.” -The Business Times, Jun 2018

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in Greenwood Avenue, Farangse is the go-to for comfort French food tinged with a Thai flair. Start the meal on a refreshing note with dishes such as tuna ceviche dressed in a zesty calamansi vinaigrette. If you want something more, go all out for indulgent French classics like the Burgundy Escargots Baked in Garlic Herb Butter, or Pan-Seared Foie Gras With Apple Chutney and Blinis. Meat-lovers are in for a treat at Farangse, which leans towards a beef-centric menu. Tuck into the Braised Beef Cheek with Red Wine and Mushrooms, a flavourful dish where the meat is simmered in a rich wine sauce until fork-tender and paired with earthy mushrooms, for a treat. Steaks are also done well in this French-Issan outfit, with crowd favourites such as grass-fed beef striploin and tenderloin char-grilled to perfection and served with a dollop of silky mash. Another favourite is the grilled iberico pork, dressed in lashings of honey and sweet roasted vegetables on the side. Be sure to save some space for dessert as well - the warm apple tart with a scoop of house-made vanilla ice cream is reminiscent of grandma’s cooking. For a fusion sweet treat, go for the Thai mango sticky rice. (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pan-Seared Foie Gras With Apple Chutney and Blinis, Braised Beef Cheek with Red Wine and Mushrooms, Black Cod Fish & Chips, Deep-Fried Thai Pork Neck Nahm Jim, Warm Apple Tart with Vanilla Ice Cream

    Fat Bird offers diners Sichuan-style cuisine featuring the restaurant’s signature dish, a comforting pot of specialty chicken soup. With as many as eight different signature pots to choose from, customise your very own bowl of hot pot with your pick of flavour, meat type, spice level, and accompanying sides. Come down to experience the fun of eating Chongqing hot pot with the exquisite dry wok culinary method with your loved ones! Chef recommendations here include the Chicken Stew in Pig’s Stomach Hot Pot and the Spicy & Fragrant Chicken Pot. Featuring a pot of aromatic broth with a generous portion of chicken, slices of chicken stomach, and a slew of herbs and spices, the Chicken Stew in Pig’s Stomach Hot Pot is a robustly flavoured dish that is nourishing and comforting. Spice lovers looking for a fiery kick will enjoy the Spicy & Fragrant Chicken Pot. Bubbling with as many as 13 different herbs and spices, have a spicy affair with this unique mala rendition that Fat Bird offers. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Stew in Pig’s Stomach Hot Pot, Spicy & Fragrant Chicken Pot, House Special Chicken, Beef Brisket

• OMAKASE RESERVATIONS

    For Omakase reservations, please click on this link.Fat Cow introduces two new menus to its Omakase category, allowing more diners to enjoy this unique epicurean experience. The premium category, SUMIRE (Lunch) at $138++ from 3 February 2022 onwards and 10th Year Anniversary Wagyu Omakase (Dinner), boasts the freshest air-flown seasonal seafood and stunningly-marbled wagyu beef imported from various Japan's finest prefectures.When: Tuesday to SundayMenus• Sumire Menu - 12:30pm• 10th Year Anniversary Wagyu Omakase Menu - 7:15pm (Available till 16 January 2022)

  • ABOUT

    Fat Cow is an award-winning modern fine-dining Japanese restaurant by Refinery Concepts, it has received ‘Best Japanese Restaurant Fine Dining’ Award at the RAS Epicurean Star Awards in 2019 and Chope Diner’s Choice ‘Best Restaurant of The Year” Award for two consecutive years (2018, 2019). Opened in 2011, its calm interior is founded in the concept of wabi-sabi – the art of finding beauty in things modest, simple and humble. At the eight seater omakase counter, the Chef's Table brings a contemporary and creative approach to seasonal fresh produce. Fat Cow is led by veteran Tokyo-born Chef Shigeru Kasajima. The luxurious Japanese restaurant serves an extensive handpicked selection of finest Wagyu from reputable farms in Japan. For a customised experience, you can enjoy Wagyu prepared in various Japanese methods such as Shabu-Shabu or Sukiyaki. Its bar menu features list of Japanese-inspired cocktails and shochu infusions, curated wines and sakes for an enjoyable wine and dine experience. (Aug 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Start with nigiri or sushi before the main event - the beef. This restaurant specialises in various grades of Wagyu from three prefectures in Japan, along with breeds from Australia and the US. The meat is charcoal grilled but you can also opt for sukiyaki or shabu-shabu. Service is delightful and the layout of the intimate, immaculate room lets you watch the team in action." -Michelin Guide Singapore. "At this Japanese-inspired steakhouse, food remains of top quality, served by knowledgeable staff who easily rattle off recommendations on what cuts of beef to have. Lunch sets offer good value, such as The Fat Cow Donburi bowl featuring tender slices of charcoal-grilled beef with onsen egg and shredded leeks over perfectly cooked rice." -The Peak

  • 21 DAYS DRY-AGED A5 NAGASAKI WAGYU PREMIUM DONBURI

    Fat Cow introduces the new 21 days Dry-aged A5 Nagasaki Wagyu Premium Donburi Probably the only Donburi that serves Dry-aged Japanese Wagyu in Singapore, the A5 Nagasaki Wagyu, aged for at least 21 days for its exceptional taste and fine texture, comes served with Caviar, Ikura, Foie Gras and an Onsen Egg topped on the restaurant's signature Fat Rice.Limited servings are available daily. First-come-first-delivered basis.

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2019 & 2021 - RESTAURANT OF THE YEAR

    Our diners have voted Fat Cow as 'Restaurant of the Year' in Chope Diners' Choice 2019 and 2021.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Fat Cow Wagyu Sandwich, Saga A5 Wagyu, 21 Days Dry-aged Nagasaki A5 Wagyu Striploin, Fat Cow Premium Donburi, Donabe Fat Rice, Fat Cow’s Daiginjo Label

Designed to reflect Istanbul’s opulent café culture – think velvet navy chairs, wooden rafters lined with gold and Arabic mosaic embedded in the walls – it’s grand without being gaudy." - TimeOut Singapore

• PRESS RELEASE

    Fatboy's provides a casual and laid back atmosphere for diners of all ages to dine in tune to sixties oldies providing a picture of the forgotten malt and soda shops of old. The 45-seater restaurant has a mix of old school benches and modern high tables to complete it's casual look. Fatboy's The Burger Bar was opened with the aim whooping up authentic home made burgers to hungry folks. Fatboy's menu features hamburgers recipes that are authentic and defines what a real burger should be according to the brothers. Additionally, Fatboy's also feature a build-your-own-burger menu where you can choose how you want your burger. Choose from a wide array of buns, patties, add-ons and sauces to create your very own gourmet burger. Fatboy's has grown since running multiple outlets in Singapore, Malaysia and China. More outlets in Asia are also in the pipeline. (Aug 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Helmed by Hong Kong veteran chef Li Kwok Kwong, this elegant restaurant decorated with gold leaf ceilings serves up Cantonese masterpieces that are exquisite in presentation and taste. The extensive menu features perennial favourites like Chinese barbecued meats and dim sum, as well as nourishing double-boiled soups that are a staple in Cantonese cuisine. The Double-Boiled Black Chicken Soup with Fish Maw and Cordyceps Flower is lovingly prepared from a stock of Chinese Jin Hua ham, pork shoulder, and old fowl that is simmered over low heat for six hours to coax out deep, rich flavours. For mains, the signature dishes at Feng Shui Inn are a must-try. Chilled Prawn with Lemon Sauce is given a modern twist with a side of fluffy lobster pancakes, drizzled with salted egg yolk and buttercream sauce. Order also the Pan-Fried Wagyu Beef in Teriyaki Sauce, where cubes of tender and juicy medium-rare steak are tossed in a sweet sauce. Other must-tries include Pan-Seared Japanese Kurobuta Pork Loin, as well as Roast Quail Drumstick in Black Truffle Sauce. For carb-loves, ‘Kampong Uncle’ Fried Rice in Hot Pot is a sizzling dish with delicious crispy bits at the bottom of the claypot. End the meal on a sweet note with traditional desserts like Double-Boiled Hashima with Red Dates and Double-Boiled Almond Cream with Glutinous Rice Balls. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Double-Boiled Black Chicken Soup with Fish Maw and Cordyceps Flower, Chilled Prawn with Lemon Sauce, Pan-Fried Wagyu Beef in Teriyaki Sauce, Pan-Seared Japanese Kurobuta Pork Loin, Double-Boiled Hashima with Red Dates

  • ABOUT

    The Fine Line offers Western food in large portions for sharing that makes for a great gathering place. Enjoy the best grilled meats in town while drinking some beer at The Fine Line. Start off your meal with the Steamed White Clams, despite being a main course in itself. Cooked in a white wine sauce and served with white bread, this hearty dish is perfect for sharing and best eaten hot. For a heavier option, go for their Australian Home Stead Sirloin that’s served with your sauce of choice and grilled for the smoky flavour that enhances the flavour of the prime cut. Alternatively, go for their New Zealand Lamb Rack that’s melt-in-your-mouth tender and full of thick, juicy goodness you can’t get enough of with each bite. Pizzas are a must-try here, and they go hard on the flavour department. A crowd favourite - Prosciutto De Parma, is made with tangy tomato sauce, arugula and generously topped with thin, savoury and salty slices of Prosciutto ham. For a vegetarian option that’s just as equally delicious, opt for the Assorted Mushroom Pizza that brings delightful earthy flavours together with truffle cream and cheesy mozzarella. In addition to their regular pasta offerings, their Beef Bolognese is a particular standout. Classic minced beef that’s juicy, mixed with a perfect pomodoro sauce and topped with Parmesan cheese, this dish is a force to be reckoned with in the flavour department and is something you can never go wrong with. With its extensive drink menu, you can find a beverage to suit your every need, from Draft, Craft, and Bottled Beers, to Spirits and Champagne. The Fine Line is the perfect place for boozy nights out with good food and wonderful drinks. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Steamed White Clams, Australian Home Stead Sirloin, New Zealand Lamb Rack, Prosciutto De Parma Pizza, Beef Bolognese

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/the-fine-line-boat-quay
name: Fine Line @ Boat Quay, The

html:
• ABOUT

    We like to think ourselves as simple creatures, wanting nothing more than an easygoing night of sharing a hearty meal and cold brew with friends. And that’s where The Fine Line @ Holland Village fits in, emerging as one of our favourite hangouts in the bustling neighbourhood of Holland Village.A gastropub after our hearts, The Fine Line @ Holland Village turns out platters of Western food and booze at severely affordable prices. Kick off your night with yummy appetisers such as the Homemade Crab Cakes that come accompanied with a bright mango salsa. You can’t go wrong with the diner’s Salt & Pepper Squid. Here, squid seasoned with salt, pepper, and sugar, is given a quick saute´ in garlic chilli. Famished? Then BBQ Baby back Ribs might be up your alley. Available in either half or full rack, these ribs are slathered in a secret (hint: it’s phenomenal) BBQ sauce and served with a side of baked potato, mashed potatoes, or fries. Out of the many bottled beers available, we like the Californian Sharkinator IPA best for its citrusy notes and refreshing aftertaste.So gather your friends, chomp down on some shared plates of pizzas and fries, and while the night away in this inviting food joint. (Jun 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Crab Cakes, Salt & Pepper Squid, BBQ Baby Back Ribs, Pork Burger, Sharkinator IPA

html:
• ABOUT FIRANGI SUPERSTAR

    Firangi Superstar is an exuberant, soulful, whimsical love letter to India, written with the curiosity of a sojourner, the adulation of a rock fan, the enthusiasm of one seeing the world, not for the first time, but with new eyes. It is the coming together of conversations, encounters, and memories tied to this vibrant, magical land. The food here is not Indian as you know it, but Indian through another lens. Classics take on unexpected forms in the hands of Head Chef Thiru Gunasakaran, as they are reworked with a unique eye and modern approach.Fuelled by the memory and influences of the food that he is most familiar with - what he ate at home and growing up; and shaped by his Western culinary background, Chef Thiru's creations are authentically inauthentic. That is, rooted in history and tradition, but executed in a refreshing and playful way. What arrives on the plate gives rise to expectations that are immediately belied by the first mouthful - things are not what they seem but still, flavours are familiar and beckoning. To accompany these moments is a selection of explorative concoctions of Indian flavours and international spirits.Firangi Superstar is not so much a restaurant as an intense visceral adventure. Don't take our word for it. Come experience it yourself. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beirut Bhatura, This Is Not Aloo Gobi, Prata Waffle, Salvador Thali, Indian Saddle, Fenugreek Manhattan, Mai Tai

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/firangi-superstar

• ABOUT

    A contemporary Argentinian restaurant that specialises in a variety of wood-fired cooking to produce a plethora of sumptuous dishes, FIRE @ 1-ATICO is passionate about creating legendary gastronomic creations. Diners can look forward to a feast of fire, where superior standard and top shelf meat cuts, seafood and vegetable-based dishes are all cooked to perfection. Striving for authenticity and excellence, the restaurant constantly produces beautiful and modern presentations of authentic Argentinian recipes and methods by working closely with a taste panel from the Embassy of Argentina in Singapore that was exclusively established for the restaurant. Start by ordering your favourite bottle of red or white from the carefully curated list of the wines of Argentina before diving into the appetisers. Seafood lovers can satisfy their cravings with the Mud Crab ‘Rescoldo’, Patagonian Red Prawns ‘Parilla’ or the New Zealand Mussels ‘Caldero’. Air flown all the way from New Zealand, the fresh green lipped mussels are steamed in a heady mix of white wine, bay leaf and thyme and finished off with a fragrant garnish of garlic butter crumb. The restaurant also offers a set menu for couples or for groups of five, filled with the restaurant signatures and well-loved dishes. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mud Crab ‘Rescoldo’, Patagonian Red Prawns ‘Parilla’, Black Cod ‘A La Plancha’, Crispy Argentine Style Artichoke

  • ABOUT

    The first Korean firewood chicken place in town, Firewood Chicken Korean Restaurant treats diners in the East to an authentic spread of Korean chicken, alongside a variety of fun fusion dishes. Hailing from the shopping streets of Myeongdong, this deep fried dish pays homage to Korea’s street food. Aptly called Myeongdong Chicken, this traditional fried chicken is moist on the inside and crispy on the outside, affording diners with savoury juiciness with every bite. The Charcoal BBQ Chicken is another signature favourite that features bite sized marinated chicken paired with tteokbokki, finished off with a deliciously fiery pool of hot and spicy sauce that’s guaranteed to bring you maximum delight. For spice lovers, rise to the challenge with the Samyang Spicy Hot Chicken Noodles. The intense heat is sure to satisfy your cravings. Sweet Spicy and Garlic Soy options are also available. Pair these with the restaurant's authentic Jeju beer to complete the Korean dining experience. Favourites include the Namsan Mountain Brew and Jeju Baengnokdam Brew. If you’re ready to get down and dirty, the DIY Rice Ball is a delicious bowl of rice, tobiko and chicken meld that is extremely filling and absolutely scrumptious! (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Charcoal BBQ Chicken, Samyang Spicy Hot Chicken Noodles, DIY Rice Ball, Namsan Mountain Brew

  • ABOUT

    Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with First Grill @ 18 Pahang Street today! Skillfully using the Josper grilling technology to bring out the charred smoky flavour of the different cuts of meat, reserve your seats now to sink your teeth into succulent pieces of juicy Iberico Pork meat and Premium Black Angus Tomahawk today. Before digging into the first grill, start off with a creamy bowl of English Clam Chowder Soup to whet your appetite. Alternatively, the Smoked Duck Breast Salad is a great mix of greens you can munch on while waiting for your mains to be grilled. Served with mashed potatoes and house greens. seafood lovers should move on to the Salmon Steak or Seabass. For those dining in groups, the Seafood Paella is a tasty option that is large enough to serve up to three pax! Other sharing platter menu options that offer more bang for your buck include the Combo Mix Platter and Fanta Sea. Besides the variety of meat options available, First Grill @ Pahang Street also caters to vegetarians with non meat dishes such as the Mushroom Creamy Truffle Pasta, Tomato & Cheese Pizza and more. Pair with a bottle of bubbly for a complete dining experience. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    English Clam Chowder, Salmon Steak, Combo Mix Platter, Fanta Sea

    With its red carpet entrance, Fish Pool at The NCO Club is an electrifying champagne, caviar, and oyster bar embellished with an elegant aquatic diving pool showpiece for the city's glamorous rendezvous and events. Be mesmerized by the venue and indulge in its raw bar selection, complemented by award-winning champagne. The finest oysters, available in platters of 6 or 12, come straight from brackish waters in France and are freshly shucked for diners. Buttery, briny, and tender, this is the perfect treat to accompany a glass of bubbly. Prefer something more substantial? The Kinglas Scottish Salmon is a generously portioned meaty treat. The smooth salmon flesh is sliced fresh and served cold, the way salmon should be. The Oscietra Caviar pairs perfectly with any of the champagnes available and is best enjoyed with a Mother-of-Pearl spoon. The soft, small grains are tender and briny and are countered by the sharp sweetness of champagne. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oscietra Caviar, Kinglas Scottish Salmon, Oyster Platter

• PRESS RELEASE

    Nestled within Punggol Park’s luxuriant foliage, Five &2 is a restro-bar that is committed to our community members – our customers, our employees and the underprivileged. Sustenance is the cornerstone of one’s body and mind development, yet not everyone has access to such basic provision. We are thus dedicated to reaching out to the underprivileged in our midst, so they too can enjoy good nutritional food necessary for productive and positive living. Five &2 partner family welfare groups in our vicinity to provide complimentary nutritious meals to families from resource-poor backgrounds. By embracing disruptive technologies to create an inclusive workplace environment at Five &2, we are also able to provide equal job opportunities for all, including persons with disabilities and ex-inmates, creating a sustainable and meaningful future for the different multitudes in our community. For customers, we focus on bringing hearty cuisines with drinks of great value in an inclusive environment. Some customers’ favourites include Singapore Laksa, Fish & Chip, Dried Tom Yum Seafood Linguine, Carbonara, Vongole in Light Cream Sauce and Chendol. If you are a fur-parent, you can also enjoy a great meal at our alfresco dining area while your fur-kids dig into pet-treats sold onsite! (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Singapore Laksa, Fish & Chip, Dried Tom Yum Seafood Linguine, Carbonara, Vongole in Light Cream Sauce,Pumpkin Tart

• ABOUT

    What's a chef with a serious love for excellent French cuisine and years of experience working in renowned kitchens to do? Open up his own restaurant, of course. Chef Alexandre Lozachmeur's Fleur De Sel is a quaint shophouse space outfitted with aged French furniture and a bar, whilst an open-concept kitchen provides tantalising glimpses into the culinary behind-the-scenes. There aren't a lot of seats, a blessing when you're trying to have an intimate meal, so diners are guaranteed lavish amounts of attention in the form of carefully prepared, complex dishes, warm service, and much more. Find yourself enamoured by a la carte options and set menus filled with incredibly detailed French classics like Le Homard (poached Maine lobster, fork mashed ratte potatoes, chives, bisque jus, and basil oil), L'agneau (8 hour slow cooked Lamb rump with garlic, Green peas, organic carrots, and rosemary lamb sauce), and Les Saint-Jacques (pan seared scallops, mushrooms, arugula, Parma ham, and chicken jus). Distressed over what to order? You'd be more than welcome to partake in Chef Alexandre's degustation experience instead, where delightful seasonal ingredients do their best to blow you away. Constantly evolving fine French fare, cosy elegance, lovely ambience, we could go on and on, but we thought we'd leave some of Fleur De Sel's impressive list of top qualities for you to discover on your own! (Apr 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A cozy space featuring an open-concept kitchen, this restaurant is helmed by French chef-owner Alexandre Lozachmeur, who has worked at the Spoon restaurants and Alain Ducasse Au Plaza Athénée, as well as for seven years in Singapore at establishments like Au Petit Salut and Brasserie Les Saveurs." -SG Now "You know a restaurant is good if you've only got to the amuse bouche and you're already planning to return. This small restaurant in a restored shophouse exudes minimalist elegance with its dark wood panelling and clean white lines." -Expat Living "The interior of the restaurant is simple yet classy, the open bar/open kitchen layout works to their advantage. Think a perfect location for a corporate cocktail events." -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Les Saint-Jacques, Le Homard, La Truite, Le Cabuillaud, Le Lapin, L’agneau, Le Boeuf, Les Assortiments, Le Baba

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    As Singapore’s only Nikkei gastrobar, FLNT @ 1-ATICO presents a unique dining experience for a high-energy social spot for friends to bond over elevated cocktails, artisanal sakes and innovative cuisine. Featuring an open kitchen concept, the magic takes place in the buzzy kitchen which takes center stage in the restaurant, where a plethora of sharing plates is prepared with immaculate precision over a binchotan-fueled grill. Inspired by the flavours of Nikkei culture in Peru, the Japanese Sumiyaki Grill offers affordable lunch sets. Served with momotaro, miso soup and a light snack , pick from three delicious Japanese menu options for a satisfying and fulfilling meal. The Nikkei Bara Chirashi Don is a popular dish that features the chef’s selection of the multiple kinds of fresh sashimi, topped over rice and peppered with amarillo, avocado and corn nuts. Sashimi lovers rejoice as small plates of sashimi, ceviche, tataki and momotaro are available over at the raw bar here at FLNT @ 1-ATICO. Indulge in delectable flavours of your favourite fish with the Sashimi of the Day platter that comes in either a small plate of three of five different types of fish. Wrap up your meal with a dish from the sumiyaki grill. Grilled over a curated selection of white and charcoal binchotan, the Tsukune is a flavourful dish of minced chicken and cheese that will surely have you coming back for seconds. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Nikkei Bara Chirashi Don, Sashimi Of The Day, Tsukune, Shishito Yaki

  • ABOUT

    Florian Italian Restaurant & Bar brings the ethos of la Serenissima Venice, right into the heart of Singapore. Dine with us to experience the perfect combination of traditional Italian food & sensorial pleasure, exciting the visuals, tastes, and senses. Whether you are craving the best pizzas in Singapore, a memorable plate of pasta, or a fresh platter of seafood, you are guaranteed to leave the Florian with a delighted belly and a cheerful heart. Bringing the Venetian cichetti bar experience to Singapore, Florian Italian Restaurant & Bar serves great bites and an exciting range of cocktails and wines from all over Italy. For those with a sweet tooth, the Ikura Espresso Cup is a harmonious combination of coffee and egg pudding topped with salmon roe for an extra crunch. Looking for a dish that everyone loves? The Tartufo Fries is a classic crowd favorite that never fails to delight. Tossed with fresh truffle, the hand-cut shoestring fries are the perfect dish to munch on while waiting for the main dishes. What’s a gastronomic trip to Italy without pizza? Fermented for a minimum of 48 hours for an ultra light crust, Florian’s Romana style pizza is a must-try. Chef recommendations include the Margherita, Tartufo Porcini and Quattro Formaggi. Florian, Italian Restaurant & Bar, a trip into the city will never be the same again. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mortadella Blue, Ricci Di Mare, Ikura Espresso Cup, Margherita Pizza

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Restaurant Jag, has announced the launch of Flow Bar with celebrated Master-Mixologist, Ricky Paiva as it reclaims and reinvigorates its cocktail offering. Flow Bar, according to JAG co-owner Anant Tyagi, has been set up to nurture and forge a community for professional, distinguished bartenders to curate innovative drinks for their guests. To kick-off this initiative, Ricky has been invited to put his stamp on the second-floor bar and transport his regulars and uninitiated on a whimsically spirited journey with his three-pillar craft cocktail menu. Manning the bar personally, Ricky will conjure up a combination of timeless classics and carefully constructed progressive cocktail menu that will undergo seasonal changes with the aim of pushing Singapore’s award-winning cocktail scene to greater heights. Describing his latest partnership, Ricky said, “I’ve known Anant for many years and what he and Chef Jeremy are doing at JAG is phenomenal. When they shared their idea of re-energizing their drinks program, it was an opportunity I just had to grasp. Flow will be a very collaborative approach. We want JAG diners to feel welcome upstairs for a pre and/or post-dinner drink and we want our guests to enjoy JAG as well. Our goal 2 is to create a cohabitational space with a seamless dynamism for our guests across both floors. While the cocktails and hosting are my territories, our bar-bites menu will be an inspiration for my cocktail recipes and Chef Jeremy’s culinary genius. Each plate will reflect my Californian vibe – fresh, light, seasonal with Jeremy’s signature French refinement.” (Aug 2021)

  • COCKTAILS WE LOVE

    Burnt Lemon Whisky Sour, Darke & Stormie, Jesse James, Peppered Pineapple

• ABOUT

    A perennial favourite on the Singapore culinary scene, FLUTES has continued its preeminence long after moving from Fort Canning to its stately post at the National Museum of Singapore. The setting lends an air of well-deserved authority to FLUTES, where the kitchen is seasoned with both wit of contemporary styling, and wisdom of classic Anglo-European gastronomy. A beautifully appointed dining room is drowned in natural light by day, from parallel rows of tall, arched windows. In the evening, the terrace is backed by the historic building's stunning facade. It's unsurprisingly the choice for many a romantic evening and impressive lunch, serving cuisine that's frequently regarded as among the city's finest. Any foodie worth their salt would agree! (May 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A solid interpretation of contemporary Australian cuisine artistically presented with generous servings even the foie gras is perfectly pan-fried to balance firmness against its tendency to melt in one's mouth and release its rich flavours." -Asia Tatler Dining "Flutes is right up there among Singapore's most romantic restaurants, with fantastic food, an extensive (mostly Australian) wine list, and is located in a central location to boot. Conclusion: One of Singapore's best." -SG Now "Located at the Singapore National Museum, Flutes offers modern cuisine done to exacting standards. The smart-casual restaurant's signature dishes include the must-try Wild Fire Spiced Rack of Lamb and the popular Duck Confit, along with classic desserts such as the Sticky Date Pudding with Butterscotch Sauce and the Yorkshire Pudding" -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

• PRESS RELEASE

    A new Indian tapas restaurant and bar is all geared up to be the next culinary star at the heart of Kampong Glam. Flying Monkey will offer diners delectable dishes of contemporary pan-Indian cuisine served tapas style, as well as classic international cocktails with an Indian twist on flavours. As the only full-fledged kitchen and bar situated amidst the bustle of Bussorah Street, Flying Monkey is also one of the few restaurants in the vicinity to have bespoke cocktails available. Their best-selling small plate dish is the Galouti Kebab ($14). The word 'Galouti' means to melt in one's mouth, and this dish truly lives up to its name.This was achieved by mincing the meat no less than 13 times, then marinating the meat with certain spices and unripe papaya. Other tapas signature dishes include Tandoori Chicken ($10) marinated in yogurt and spices; Tulsi Cod ($15) or Cod Fillet marinated with basil creating a greenish hue charred in the Tandoor; Calamari 65 ($10), a spin on 'Chicken 65' that is relished in Indian cuisine and would complement their cocktails well; and crispy Truffle Naan ($14) served with paneer mousse and pear chutney. Big Plate highlights include Quail Musallam ($26), which features a whole quail slow-cooked and served on Kashmiri Pulao, and Nalli Gosht ($26), which is a lamb shank cooked overnight and bathed in a creamy peanut-cashew curry served with garlic naan. For dessert, diners can enjoy Jalebi ($10), a traditional crispy Indian Pretzel dipped in aromatic syrup. Freshly made from the kitchen, it is served warm and topped off with a sprinkle of Pistachio. (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "This Indian restaurant serves contemporary dishes such as Quail Musallam ($26), slow-cooked quail served atop a bed of yellow Kashmiri rice. It also offers a wide variety of cocktails and wines. Highlights include the whisky-based The Flying Monkey cocktail ($18). With its colourful wall murals and neon-lit signs, the restaurant is also a feast for the eyes." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Galouti Kebab, Calamari 65, Quail Musallam, Nalli Gosht, Goa Mamma Lassi, Yo Yo Mani

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/flying-monkey
name: Flying Monkey

html:
• ABOUT

    Like a magician with a particular flair for showmanship, Spanish maestro Nandu Jubany of Michelin-starred Can Jubany fame, produces a gastronomical spectacular of sorts, cloaked by the industrial facades of Hong Kong Street. With his lovely assistants Jordi Noguera of Foodbar Dada lineage, and Dario Nocentini plucked from the Catalunya bar, Jubany conducts quite a show of Spanish culinary arts. The restaurant has just the fitting look, with zany motifs reminiscent of Picasso, materialized as if from a dreamscape. Pepper grinder light fixtures and super-sized sculptures of familiar faces float above the dining space. A vintage motorcycle adorns the walls, and the food too has a quirky appearance that eclipses the unexpectedly classic flavours. Jubany introduces Catalan folk cuisine, and with a wave of the wand, adds brilliant Asian twists. The black Mediterranean paella is filling yet nuanced in taste, and the patatas bravas and tomato bread both show a different side of the traditional tapas dishes. On the more Asian end of the spectrum, the Thai razor clams are delightfully piquant, while the roasted duck with orange zest dumplings show the chef's hubris in remaking local favourites. The varied menu even includes gluten-free options like the chocolate hamburger, a dessert indicative of the humourous approach FOC takes to dining. From the bar, brilliantly innovative cocktails are not in short supply. The menu is a clear demonstration of Nocentini's flexing of his creative muscles, using such unique ingredients as Matcha powder, cornflakes vodka, and galangal rum (though not all in the same drink). If the name of the restaurant sounds like the slip of the tongue could be a dangerous one, it’s not an unintentional coincidence. Meaning fire in Catalan, FOC certainly plays with fire both in its name, its daring dishes, and its unapologetically unconventional approach to nouveau dining. (Sep 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "FOC pushes out conceptual tapas dishes with a modern edge, including some Asian flavors. Drinks-wise, don't be surprised by Dario's kooky creations with equally cheeky names. If Catalunya was anything to go by, he'll no doubt pair incongruent ingredients to make one mean cocktail." -SG Now "Another Michelin-gilded chef sets up a tapas outpost here in Singapore - this time it's Chef Nandu Jubany, behind the one-starred Can Jubany in Barcelona. Ex-Foodbar Dada Chef Jordi Noguera takes up the executive chef post, promising a menu of punchy Spanish flavours on small plates and mixed drinks conjured with the award-winning inventiveness of ex-Catalunya barman Dario Nocentini." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Toasted Bread with Tomatoes, Mushroom Croquettes, Cod Fish Puff Fritters, Octopus Galician Style, Watermelon Gazpacho with Smoked Olive Oil Ice Cream, Scallops "Ceviche", Spanish French Toast with Vanilla Ice Cream, Madame Butterfly, Blacked Out In Bangkok

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    FOC Sentosa brings a taste of the Mediterranean spirit to Singapore's premier beach destination, with a cosmopolitan and exuberant beach restaurant and bar. Inspired by Barcelona's vibrant beach culture, FOC Sentosa delights with an elegant, yet relaxed atmosphere, combined with exquisitely prepared Mediterranean cuisine focusing on fresh and delectable grilled produce from the sea and soil, paellas, summery signature cocktails and carefully selected sunny wines. The resplendent interiors are completed by breezy beach hammocks, plush cabanas, a pool deck and plenty of space to lounge. FOC Sentosa is the new destination for effortless beachside living and events. (Sep 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggplant with Sobrassada Sausage, Parmesan Cheese & Honey, Iberian Pork Paella with Spring Onion Foam, Mediterranean Turbot with Roasted Cauliflower, Oreo XXL, Ibiza Martini, Matcha Colada

html:
• ABOUT

    One of the best-hidden secrets in town is the vintage wonderland that spreads out across China Square every weekend, and this new cafe and bistro, sharing this love for quaint old things, offers a menu of hearty favourites inspired by Bangkok vintage markets, where great food and quaint knick knacks rub shoulders. If you’ve ever found yourself hankering for those sweaty Bangkok nights hunting for great vintage finds, with a yummy Thai snack in hand, this place will jog those memories and fill your tummy at the same time. Scrumptious Thai street food takes center stage here. Think chicken wings stuffed with minced meat and vegetables, little parcels of pandan-infused grilled chicken, crispy fish skin coated in salted egg yolk on a bed of vermicelli, and Fried Prawn Cakes served with sweet and sour plum dip. Heftier plates include set meals of Massaman chicken curry, steamed fish, and rice, or lychee red curry sweetened with pineapples, tomatoes, and filled with tender mounds of duck. For some extra heat, Thai salads like vibrant pomelo salad, little juicy pips tossed with peanuts, lime, shrimp, and chilies, and a zingy three mushroom salad with enoki, shimeji, and oyster mushrooms tossed in a chili lime dressing. In addition, we also offer a wide variety of vegetarian and vegan friendly and healthy options such as Buddha Japchae Bowl and Salt & Chilli Aubergine & Tofu as well as an authentic new monthly Chef's Specials of truly Thai Salads "Yum and Tum", (i.e. Flower Crab Salad, Cockles Salad), Prawn Sashimi & Royal Kapi Rice that will bring Thailand to your palate from the very first bite. A surprise Thai food gem in the middle of Telok Ayer, in gorgeous vintage trappings, this Instagram worthy spot is perfect for a Sunday afternoon lunch amidst antique and vintage shopping haunts. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Angel Wings, Pomelo Salad, Crispy Fish Skin, Massaman Chicken Curry, Three Mushroom Salad, Lychee Red Curry, Papaya Salad

html:
• ABOUT

    Here at the elegant lobby of the Grand Copthorne Waterfront is its premier dining destination, Food Capital, an international buffet that spans the gamut of everyone's favourite food offerings from all over the world, with a great view of the Singapore River to boot. Open a meal here with selections from its cold seafood bar that ranges from shucked oysters to freshly sliced sashimi and sushi, then move on to its impressive rotisserie section featuring a hulking beef stripling and super gourmet slow-cooked veal shank served with a truffled potato mousseline. The local selections here are especially good, featuring a beautiful tureen of chili crab and the famous Grand Copthorne Laksa, followed at the end by a selection of local kueh like ondeh ondeh and kueh lapis sagu, which you can pair with Western petits fours and parfaits. All this gluttony takes place in a gorgeous and sophisticated dining area with massive windows looking out onto the world outside. The view is best on a bright Sunday morning, just in time for the restaurant's luxurious brunch buffet. Head down to the Waterfront and get your tummy filled! (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "There's a good reason why the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel refers to its Sunday brunch buffet as borderless - the food offerings are that extensive." -Smart Parents SG

html:
• ABOUT

    If you value freshness and quality of your meals, then Food Exchange is the surefire place to hit up. Comfortably nestled in Novotel Singapore on Stevens, this sleek eatery spins up a plethora of fresh healthy eating plates, allowing you to tuck into a delectable food while overlooking the view of the hotel's infinity pool. At Food Exchange, the delicious plates of food start flying out the kitchen doors at the crack of dawn, as chefs churn out a generous and overflowing bounty of food to satiate eaters young and old. Have your pick from a wide selection of fresh breads, pastries, cereals, as well as regional and international specialities. For lunch and dinner, the staff turn their focus on regional cuisines, offering a tempting fusion of Asian and Western Dishes. Dishes are skilfully prepared using freshest regional ingredients at the open kitchen. Dining with out-of-towners? You'd want to introduce your guests to beloved local dishes such as the Beef Rendang and Nasi Goreng. Or if you love indulgent weekend brunches, then Food Exchange has got you covered, with a menu that encompasses fresh sashimi and seafood, and hot cooking stations serving up Egg Benedict, Foie Gras, Beef Rump, Baked Salmon Laksa as well as BBQ and Grill. Food Exchange is on a mission to prove that hotel food doesn't have to be stodgy, and they sure do deliver. (Jun 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mee Goreng, Beef Bulgogi, Slow Cooked Beef Cheek, Giant Wagyu Beef Burger

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Housed in Singapore’s oldest yet still progressive museum (National Museum of Singapore), Food For Thought exudes heritage charm and grandeur, with lots of natural light. Playing to the mantra of ‘Share the Good Times’, the restaurant’s appearance honours Singaporean traditions through an emphasis on stories. Food For Thought's space invites you to share conversations about our city’s past, present and future. The beautiful marble table tops, wall mosaic and wooden chairs are a homage to the home-style dining rooms and kopitiams in which many Singaporeans grew up with. Due to Food For Thought's museum locale, you’d find carefully curated items and exclusive Singaporean tales on the feature shelf in the atrium of the restaurant too. Food For Thought serves up hearty, community-inspired bistro fare – honest food in Southeast Asian flavours with a globalised influence. Their menu showcases unique food dishes inspired by exhibits within the museum as well, so be sure to check back often! (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "It's a cute space, featuring retro marble laminate tables and kopitiam-style wall mosaics. The food's simple, plentiful and good: Caveman-sized slabs of hoisin har cheong baby back ribs and plush baked Milo Godzilla pudding, modelled after the rich coffee shop sip." -SG Now "For a space in a museum, Food For Thought at the National Museum of Singapore gets pretty packed, however, and for good reason. The eatery does cafe fare with a distinctive identity, from Singapore-style recreations of standards to Asian-fusion takes on local classics." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Full Works, Mixed Berries Cream Cheese Pancake, Roast Beef Salad, Lemon Dill Fish & Chips, Soft Shell Chilli Crab Linguine, Spicy Pulled Pork Linguine, Ma Ling Fries, Old School Apple Pie

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    If the blaring Cantonese remixes, neon lights, and painted pigs on the walls didn’t give it away, this is not your typical Chinese restaurant. Established by radio veterans “The Muttons” in collaboration with the celebrated Old Airport Road Hawker stall Roast Paradise, this restaurant is the perfect place to go to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Cantonese Roast Meat is the name of the game here, and diners looking for a delicious plate of meat to stick their forks in will not be disappointed! Honeyed Char Siew with crisp edges is an excellent option for diners who are new to Cantonese Roast Meat. Cooked with a deliciously tantalising honey glaze atop a slab of tender pork meat, this dish is juicy, mildly sweet, and is best enjoyed warm. The Roasted Char Siew is another option that is perfect for seasoned connoisseurs. The meat is flame-grilled for maximum flavour, giving it a slick glaze and smoky flavour. Not a fan of pork? The Fook Kin Tofu is a silken tofu dish topped with salmon roe and cooked with traditional spice and sauces. This dish is tender, flavourful, and best enjoyed with a bowl of steamed rice. For something a little crunchier, opt for the Golden Lotus Root Chips - thin slices of lotus root fried to crisp perfection. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Golden Lotus Root Chips, Honeyed Char Siew, Roasted Char Siew, Fook Kin Tofu

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    The brainchild of Chef-Owner Rishi and Group Beverage Manager Vinodhan Veloo, FOOL is a modern wine bar that champions unpretentious and explorative drinking. Its exuberant personality is a nod to the ‘cheeky’ DNA that permeates Chef Rishi’s concepts, and harmoniously marries exceptional wines with playful plates, all of which are seamlessly distilled through the group’s signature friendly hospitality.As a celebration of the diverse artisanal and quality focused wine producers from around the world, FOOL features an edgy and dynamic wine list, with a global and eclectic mix of classic styles as well as modern wines from rising stars in the industry. This unconventional list, presented in a magazine-like design, brings a refreshing approach to wine exploration and incorporates pop-culture references in its thematic categories that showcase the stories and passion behind every bottle. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Liver Eclair, French Brown Crab, Spaetzle Cacio, Idargra Lamb Saddle, Westholme Wagyu Hanging Tender, Wattleseed Rum Baba

  • ABOUT

    Dempsey welcomes a new bar to the hood in the form of Foresta, a newest drinking hole dishing out Asian delights. To begin, whet your appetite with the Spicy Butter Prawns. Buttered up and spiced for that additional kick, this flavour-packed starter will keep you wanting more. Another starter worth trying are their Sambal Sausages. Slightly sweet and spicy, this lip-smacking dish gives you just the right kick. Moving on to the mains, savour Foresta’s Asian plates spruced up with a local twist. Sample their signature Padaiyappa Rice, named after Indian superstar Rajini. The delectable dish is available in three flavours of chicken, mutton, and combination. For drinks, quench your thirst with Foresta’s very own Petta Bomb Shots. An exciting concoction of tequila, jägermeister, and vodka, you’re sure to get high on these unassuming shots. Every Friday and Saturday, harmonious notes from the live band can be heard serenading guests as they wine and dine. Exuding a cosy ambience, Foresta makes a great new spot for hangouts with friends and family. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Butter Prawns, Sambal Sausages, Buffalo Wings, Padaiyappa Rice, Laksa Goreng

  • ABOUT

    Located along Bussorah Street, The Fortune Cookie is a two-storey halal Chinese restaurant eager to bring halal Chinese cuisine to all. The restaurant features dishes that have been thoughtfully created by the team of Chinese chefs and seeks to introduce yummy fusion dishes to the community. The Peking duck, a staple in Chinese cuisine, is enjoyed best with the Lotus Duck Rice. A delicious mix of sausages and shiitake mushrooms with fried rice, this fragrant dish is topped with a generous amount of Peking smoked duck. Another decadent twist on a local dish is the Beef Ribs Bak Kut Teh. Stewed in a mixture of herbs, spice and Chinese Yam, the ribs are doused in traditional sauce. Pair these lip smacking dishes with the restaurant’s interesting range of halal wines, such as the Merlot Red and Chardonnay White to elevate your dining experience. You simply can’t leave without trying the restaurant’s famous Fortune Cookie. Customised to contain a mixture of English lines, popular Singlish phrases as well as well-known Malay proverbs in English, these fortune cookies are specially crafted to spark conversations between friends and families. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fortune Cookie, Lotus Duck Rice, Beef Ribs Bak Kut Teh, Lobster Laksa Singapura, Merlot Red

  • ABOUT

    Indulge in delicious seafood here at Fortune Court with meals of excellent quality featuring quality consistent seafood that tastes great every single time!Have your favourite crab your way with the restaurant’s wide variety of sauces and cooking methods. Steamed with egg white and topped with roasted and fried garlic, enjoy a tasty mix of fresh, juicy crab meat bursting with garlic mix flavours when you opt for the Garlic Mix and Egg White option. For spice lovers, the Shrimp Paste Curry Leaves Crab is a mouthwatering alternative to the local Singapore Chilli Sauce favourite. Pair with a fragrant bowl of Seafood Silver Fish Fried Rice for a delicious seafood feast. Other signature sides to complement your meal here include Seafood Tofu, Fried Mini Squid, Braised Sweet Corn Soup and more.Drenched in gong bao sauce, the “Kungfu” Prawn features huge prawns that are cooked to perfection. Another popular crowd favourite is Fortune’s Signature Prawn. A unique platter served in a creamy pumpkin sauce, this dish is the restaurant’s bestselling seafood speciality loved by many. Wash it down with a cup of Fresh Coconut to end your meal on a refreshing note. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shrimp Paste Curry Leaves Crab, Seafood Silver Fish Fried Rice, Fortune’s Signature Prawn, Fried Mini Squid

    Sunlight spills through the ceiling-to-floor glass windows at this beautiful all-day dining restaurant, with a stunning view of the Singapore River to boot. There's a slightly better view inside, though, of heaving platters of delicious food, all at your disposal. Treat yourself to tantalizing local, Southeast Asian and international cuisines with the choice of dining indoors or at the sheltered al fresco dining space. (Jan 2021)

    You’ll be unsurprised to hear that at Frenchie Wine Bar we’re very passionate about French food and wine. We’re only a small wine bar and restaurant on Tras Street in Tanjong Pagar, but we prepare classic French dishes with the finest, freshest ingredients we can find to bring you the most authentic tastes from one of Europe’s most loved cuisines. We have a wide variety of French wines that we’ll be happy to tell you all about and help you pair with your food. Why not reserve a table online and come and pay us a visit? We can’t wait to welcome you. (Mar 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Frieda, named after the daughter of the Kempinski brand founder Berthold Kempinski, is a casual dining German restaurant that knows how to entertain. On one side is the Daybar and Frieda Garden, a relaxing botanical dining area complete with palm trees. This bright garden venue beneath the glass atrium is ideal for lunch with a friend, complete with refreshing wine or German beer on tap. But Frieda really turns on the charm come 5pm with its daily selection of Happy Hour offers. Frieda Restaurant, on the other side of the walkway, is a cosy dining space for German fare just as you would have it at home. You can’t go wrong with the crispy Pork Knuckle, succulent Veal Schnitzel or the deliciously savoury Pretzel Dumplings. It’s all so sinfully decadent, and even though you know you shouldn’t, you will be glad you did. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Traditional “Wiener Schnitzel”, Semolina Pudding with Sour Cherry Compote, Grandma’s Potato Cream Soup with Leek and Croutons, Housemade Bread & Butter, Pork Knuckle, Veal Schnitzel, Pretzel Dumplings

  • SIGNATURE DISHES

    • Pork Knuckle at Frieda Slow oven-roasted Crackling Pork Knuckle Beerjus ($39), served with Sauerkraut and Pretzel Dumpling • White Asparagus at Frieda Widely celebrated in Germany during the spring season, the sweet and tender white asparagus has landed in Frieda. Indulge in a hearty Cream of White Asparagus Soup with Sourdough Croutons and Green Chervil Oil; or enjoy the fresh harvest poached and served with Housemade Hollandaise Sauce and New Potatoes. • Traditional Wiener Schnitzel at Frieda A breaded veal cutlet pan-fried to perfection served with potato salad and a refreshing Gurkensalat of thinly sliced cucumbers, sour cream and aromatic dill and parsley ($37).

html:
• ABOUT

    Riding the ever popular K-Wave comes this affordable and delicious restaurant in the north. Serving up a range of popular classics like Korean Fried Chicken, Bibimbap, and even Korean BBQ items, diners are sure to be spoiled for choice here, and if you weren’t a fan of Korean food before, you sure will be after a visit here! Diners who enjoy the hotpot will be glad to know that there is a range of flavours available. The Pork Backbone soup base is popular with diners, and there is also a Chicken Ginseng option for diners who prefer something a little healthier. Seafood lovers can opt for the Grilled Saba fish, a sizeable whole fish grilled with a smoky and rich flavour. The meat is good on its own, but is best enjoyed with a bowl of freshly steamed rice. The Kimchi Fried Rice is the perfect dish for diners who are going solo. Stir-fried rice with pickled cabbage, chicken, and various other vegetables, this dish is spicy, crunchy, and surprisingly healthy. Sipping on some Soju? There are some Korean bar bites that go perfectly with that! The Stir-Fried Octopus is a spicy, chewy dish that pairs well with the sweet coolness of soju. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Backbone Stew, Budae Stew, Stir-fried Octopus, Seafood Pancake, LA Galbi

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/friends-tasty-korea
name: Friends Tasty Korea

html:
• ABOUT

    Feast on traditional favourites at Friends Wok & Bak Kut Teh with their signature renditions of the classic local delight. Slow brewed with pork bones for two hours to extract the innate flavours of each ingredient, the rich and flavoursome broth comes in two different flavours: a herbal Klang and local Teochew style. Diners can also find unique and inspired takes on the traditional broth in the menu. Opt for the Lamb-Kut Teh or Herbal Frog Leg Soup for a different but equally delicious dining experience. Complete your meal with a seafood dish from the restaurant’s comprehensive menu. Choose from fresh seafood specialties such as Thai-style Steamed Sea Bass, Thai-style Steamed Squid or Steamed Clams to satisfy your seafood cravings. Friends Wok & Bak Kut Teh also whips up steamed selections great for sharing, such as Canton Chee Cheong Fun, Butterfly Bun, Ham Chim Peng, and yummy handcrafted baos. With so many flavours to choose from, pick your choice of sweet or savoury for a tasty lunch or a mouthwatering afternoon tea session. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lamb-Kut Teh, Thai-style Steamed Squid, Canton Chee Cheong Fun, Butterfly Bun

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/friends-wok-bak-kut-teh
name: Friends Wok & Bak Kut Teh

html:
• ABOUT

    Frog Meat Fish Head is named quite literally after the famous Chongqing hotpot. Needless to say, it is the restaurant's speciality, using only quality fish and frog legs to ensure the meat remains tender when cooked. Those who can handle the heat should go for the Mala Fish Head and Frog Leg Soup, with its lip-numbing yet addictive broth. If not, the pork and tomato-based soups are just as tantalising. Gather your friends and order a variety of other hotpot ingredients as well, from homemade meatballs to beef slices and veggies, and have fun dunking them into the piping hot soups. Besides hotpot, the eatery also serves a range of cooked dishes like Cereal Prawns, Stir-Fried Clams, and Casserole Crayfish. What makes this restaurant truly unique is their DIY bubble tea station, where you'll get to fill your cup with as much boba as you want before topping it up with creamy milk tea. You couldn't ask for a better ending to a hotpot meal. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mala Fish Head and Frog Leg Soup, Cereal Prawns, Stir-Fried Clams, Casserole Crayfish

html:
• ABOUT

    Another place with hawker roots turned 2-in-1 eatery, Fu Lin Bar & Kitchen serves its famous style of yong tau foo during the day before switching over to fusion Asian tapas and a menu of alcohol at night. Fair warning though, if you’re expecting the healthy type of yong tau foo with plenty of soup and boiled ingredients, turn back now. Their best-selling version of yong tau foo involves deep frying the typical tofu and meat options till they turn deliciously golden, before you slurp it all down with a bowl of thick vermicelli noodles and signature braised mushroom gravy. Alternatively, the ingredients can be boiled but, if you’d like to have your calories and eat healthy too, stick to deep frying and add a portion of vegetables instead.Mid-afternoon is when the yong tau foo disappears but their Asian-inspired tapas won’t leave you missing it too much. Smoked Duck Peking Wrap, Lamb Rack, Mala Beef Slices and more, their small plates combine both western and Asian flavours with gusto, certainly a far cry from the more humble morning fare. Order dishes to share, get lost in their extensive sake menu, and settle in for a meal amidst industrial chic settings. (Nov 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fu Lin Yong Tau Foo, Crabmeat & Prawns Fried Rice, Smoked Duck Peking Wrap, Lamb Rack, Mala Beef Slices

  • THE BUZZ

    “…you can get your same yong tau fu for lunch (with the same quality of food, the same pick-your-own-ingredients counter and the same attentive aunties) among chic surrounds at lunch. But the place turns into a full-fledged tapas restaurant and bar at 3pm.” -SG Now

html:
• ABOUT

    Inspired by the coastal prefecture of Fukui, Fukui Omakase features Japan’s seasonal produce. Situated within a shophouse located along Mohamed Sultan Road, step into modern interiors that exude comfort and elegance. Get ready to be transported to an exclusive corner of Japan where a gastronomic dining experience awaits you. Seat yourselves down in comfy custom made Brazilian leather chairs to enjoy an uninterrupted view of head chef Pa’an and his team at work. With over 20 years of culinary experience under his belt, watch as Chef Pa’an cooks up a storm in the restaurant’s open kitchen to present simple yet bold cuisine showcasing traditional cooking methods that bring to diners’ tables refined flavours of premium Japanese ingredients elevated by his own modern twists. Lunch and dinner omakase set meals available here usually include an appetiser, sashimi, grilled dishes, a donburi or hot plate coupled with a soup and dessert. Flowing with the seasons, the menu refreshes monthly to feature Japanese produce at its peak. Hence, diners can look forward to a different variety of sushi and sashimi delights every single visit! (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

     Shinju, Kokoro, Kazumi

  • ABOUT

    Fukusen is a sashimi and donburi restaurant in Singapore. Serving an extensive menu, Fukusen prides themselves in ensuring only the freshest ingredients are used, with seafood specially airflown from Japan twice a week. The best part? Fukusen’s prices are wallet-friendly as well! Start your meal with one of their delicious appetisers — we recommend their silky smooth Pitan Tofu. For a more umami-licious starter, try their Spanish Carpaccio. Choose from a selection of fresh sashimi that’s generously garnished with ikura. One of the more unique selling points of Fukusen is their omakase style menu — offering omakase choices for their sashimi and donburis. If you’re looking for a quick lunch, the bento sets are a fan favourite and perfect for a lovely indulgent meal. We recommend trying the Omakase Donburi. As a side, go for their Foie Gras Mushroom Yaki, a deliciously light and creamy dish that complements any main. Along with their omakase-style menu, Fukusen operates as a full-fledged omakase concept by night, with prices starting as low as $100. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tempura Moriawase, Omakase Sashimi Moriawase, Momo Maki, Omakase Chirashi, Uni Negitoro Don

html:
• ABOUT

    Pop art and graffiti line the walls of this intimate and funky Modern-European restaurant in the swish dining enclave of Telok Ayer. Occasional Asian elements punch up the flavours here, a selection of small plates and smoky grilled mains all blessed with the smoky perfume of an imported Josper charcoal grill. The mains are super meaty-heavy so lighten up with some green small plates to share. A refreshing and crunchy Endive & Shallot Créme-Blue Cheese Salad is a good way to start, filled with bittersweet endive, walnuts, and creamy studs of fruity blue cheese livened by an orange-balsamic vinaigrette. Or start the meat-fest early with creamy Bone Marrow, paired with refreshing white wine jelly, a piquant tomato salsa, and chips of deep fried garlic. Once the mains come along, it’s a parade of beautiful grilled meats and seafood. Think chewy and sweet baby octopus given a rapid sear under the grill before being tossed with squid ink rice, a paprika-spiced rouille and sweet sun-dried tomato. Savour the rare treat of a Free-Range Yellow Chicken, roasted and deboned then served with olives, tahini, lentils, and a curry brown sauce for some exotic Middle-Eastern flair. Bone-In Beef Short Ribs accompanied by zingy beetroot and pickled potato will satisfy the meatiest cravings, but go slightly overboard with a Tomahawk, not of beef, but pork, a giant chop served with roasted pineapple that’s been infused with rum. A good, practically festive meal served in hip, Instagrammable surroundings, fr is one of the great gems of downtown dining. (Nov 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “With a nice selection of grilled meats and seafood, friendly service, and a pleasant atmosphere of music and chatter, this restaurant is a great place to chill out after work.” -The Smart Local

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Iberico Pork Secreto, Freshwater Prawns, Duck Foie Gras, Bone Marrow, Prime Ribeye, Scallops, Prawns & Chorizo Rice, Iberico Pork Tomahawk

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • ABOUT

    We all love a good grill, and fr does it like a pro. Located at Jalan Besar, fr serves up small plates of smoky delights with delicious Southeast Asian flavors, all elegantly charred on an imported Josper grill. Heavy on its flavors, we recommend their small plates so that you’re able to taste a little of everything. Start off your samplers with Baked Camembert Cheese and order their Smoked Duck Breast or Octopus Leg to go with. We guarantee a gloriously creamy, cheesy, and savory hybrid dish to start off your dining experience. Their mains are just as highly-raved. Their Grilled Lamb Ribs hit just the right spot. Go big with their Caveman Supper Sharing Platter. It’s a meat lover’s paradise with pork, lamb, and chicken — it’s like being in the Flintstones in modern times. fr takes it up another notch with their extensive drinks menu. Go for their Boozy Buffet that lets you drink until you drop while you feast on delicious meats, or opt for their cocktails and wines. To top off your gastronomical experience, try their Chocolate Lava Cake with Coconut Ice Cream to end on a sweet note. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Octopus Leg, Bone-In Shortribs, Josper Meats Trio, Caveman Supper, Passionfruit Pana Cotta

html:
• ABOUT

    Since 1999, G7 Sin Ma Live Seafood and Frog Porridge has been on a mission to provide the best frog leg porridge in Singapore. From its first humble bowl of porridge, it has expanded its menu to include premium live seafood and various zi char dishes. A good frog leg porridge is a foodie's dream, with tender chunks of meat marinated in a savoury combination of soy sauce, spring onions and spices, accompanied by a starchy bowl of rice congee to balance out the flavours. It's no wonder that it's been ranked highly in Singapore's list of comfort foods. The one at G7 is even cooked the traditional way, in a clay pot to preserve its taste and nutritional benefits. While you might have come for the iconic dish, you won't be able to resist trying other highlights like the Chilli Crab, Drunken Prawns, Bamboo Clams and Marmite Pork Ribs. After all, who can say no to live seafood and zi char dishes done right? (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Frog Leg Porridge, Chilli Crab, Drunken Prawns, Bamboo Clams and Marmite Pork Ribs

  • TAKEAWAY/DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    NA
