• ABOUT

    Gabbar Bistro & Bar Clarke Quay is the most hotly anticipated addition to Singapore’s bustling party destination Clarke Quay. Gabbar is a One-Stop Food and Live Entertainment Venue for Foreign Expats, Tourists, and Big Groups. Seating Capacity of over 120+ pax Indoor and Outdoor. Gabbar takes Indian Dining to a new exciting level with Melt-in-the Mouth spicy Chicken/Lamb Tikka’s, Hot Mutton Kebabs, Spicy Tandoori dishes and Mouth-Watering Curries from North India, while you enjoy your meal - a renowned Live Music Band pumps up Bollywood and Commercial Music till midnight. Post-midnight the place turns into a foot-tapping, beer-fueled and fun-filled destination for Foreign Expats and Tourists as an International Bollywood and Commercial House DJ take control and lets you unwind to Retro and Commercial House Music till 3:00 AM. The Bar is stocked with Rare Single Malts for the Exclusive few from across the lands, Crafted Beer, and Bottled Beers are always on offer. The Wine list is curated to match the Spicy Rich North Indian Cuisine, please ask staff for Gabbar’s offers and recommendations. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Chicken Tikka, Fish Amritsari, Rogan Josh, Achari Paneer

    A popular destination for a romantic date night, Garibaldi Italian Restaurant & Bar is one of our favourite spots when it comes to an intimate dining experience pulling out all the stops. From the complimentary olives and cheese spread upon entering to the attentive service and remarkable dishes - venturing out to to this oasis on Purvis street is a sure treat from the get-go. The a la carte menu, hand crafted by Chef-Owner Roberto Galetti, is a force to be reckoned with. Bringing together fresh produce and authentic recipes to create traditional and delightful Italian dishes - the team here has definitely mastered the art of pasta. Their Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Scallops and Sardinian Bottarga, as well as the Ravioli Al Funghi Porcini stuffed with veal and porcini mushrooms are undeniable proof. Though we’re not sure what exactly takes mainstage (because the entire menu is so impressive), the dolce and formaggi (also known as desserts) offerings are also worth taking a look at. With an artisan selection of gelato, Pannacotta Fragole Balsamico, and Tiramisu’ of Mamma Bice on the menu - one thing is certain, dessert never sounded so good! (Jan 2016)

  • ABOUT

    Surrounded by the lush garden views of Rochester Park, Gary’s Restaurant and Bar serve up Italian cuisine with a flair of japanese notes. You will be immersed in a whole new world that will delight your senses. A taste of Italy, reimagined. Pastas at Gary’s are a crowd-favorite and irresistibly delicious. Their Lobster Risotto is a creamy affair that’s not too overpowering and tastefully seasoned to perfection with morsels of sweet lobster meat. If you’re looking for a hint of alcohol, Gary’s Mediterranean Seafood Pasta brings a medley of seafood with a healthy dose of brandy to bring out the fresh ocean flavour. For mains, their Wagyu OP Rib is cooked to your liking and comes with a range of sauces to choose from, from their confit potato to beef jus. If you’re looking for something more indulgent, Gary’s Silver Hill Duck is cooked to tender perfection and served with red wine jus that enhances the flavour of the meat. This dish is a pre-order, so get your orders in ahead of time if you’re in the mood for duck. To finish off your meal, go for their Nougat Parfait that is sinfully indulgent and oh so satisfying with fresh berries drizzled with caramel sauce. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Risotto, Mediterranean Seafood pasta, Wagyu OP Rib, Silver Hill Duck, Nougat Parfait

    Set within bustling Keong Saik Road, Gaston epitomises the French 'joie de vivre' with its convivial atmosphere and vibrant setting. The all-day bistro and wine bar evokes a sense of being in the heart of a kitchen in Burgundy; expect authentic, comforting French fare and delicious wines combined with exceptional hospitality. Deeply rooted in the Burgundian heritage, embrace classic homemade specialties from the region including Jambon Persillé, Truite a l’Aligoté and Éclair au Cassis. With dishes crafted with the utmost respect for tradition, enjoy the freshest, seasonal ingredients sourced directly from artisanal producers at Gaston. A meal isn't really fulfilled without a glass of wine - look forward to an extensive selection of quality, great value wines of close to 350 labels from France and beyond. Committed to ensuring that the wine programme is highly accessible, varied and exciting, most of the wines are sourced directly from the vintners themselves. With an extensive wine-by-the-glass selection of up to 15 wines, as well as a rotating 'Wine Flight of the Week', there is something for everyone from novices to seasoned drinkers. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truite a l’Aligoté, Éclair au Cassis

• ABOUT

    If you like your night outs buzzing with action, then GEM Bar is the place for you. It’s hard to miss this rowdy bar located at the intersection of Ann Siang Hill and Club Street, with pulsating music and an exciting buzz that surrounds it. The cocktail menu here is bound to be a source of amusement, with the creative names the GEM Bar team have come up with. Fancy a pretty cocktail? Flower Song Served In A Teapot, a delicious mix of vodka and chrysanthemum tea, is perhaps one of the sweeter names here. Kyoho Pornstar will have you chuckling while wondering how else you can ask for this drink without blushing. But the sexy gin-based cocktail, mixed with Kyoho grape juice, prosecco, elderflower and lychee, is hard to resist. Order some bar snacks to go with the cocktails, like the Salted Egg Chicken Karaage and the GEM Bao served with chilli con carne and cheddar cheese. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Egg Chicken Karage, GEM Burger, The Nutmeg & Clove Bao, 7 Sins of Yishun, Perfection, Mojito Grande, The R & K

• ABOUT

    Gemma Steakhouse offers the best of the Mediterranean, in steak! Inspired by the best steakhouses, this premier Italian social dining destination is a concept by the ilLido group that seeks to provide a dynamic dining experience with its contemporary Italian food and beverage program in a trendy, festive atmosphere. Helmed by well-known Italian chef owner Beepe De Vito, Gemma Steakhouse presents a delicious variety of dishes for diners to feast their eyes and stomachs on. For starters, the Homemade Tagliolini accompanied by Smoked Sardines, Amalfi Lemon, and Bottarga is a yummy small portion perfect for starting off any meal with. Move on to the mains and dive into large format steaks and prime meats such as the T-Bone Fiorentina Steak. Dry aged for 30 days and grain fed for 200 days, this hearty portion of meaty goodness will definitely satiate all meat lovers carnivorous cravings! Enjoy with a side of Tripled Cooked Potato Chips before wrapping up your meal with a sweet serving of Grilled White Peach, Chantilly Cream, Rhubarb, Peach & Thyme Sorbet. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tea Smoked Atlantic Salmon, T-Bone Fiorentina Steak, Tripled Cooked Potato Chips, Poussin Chicken

html:
• ABOUT

    A place where health and wealth align, nourish your body with whole foods that are as close to nature as it is intended to be with low human interference. Genius Central Singapore is a place for entrepreneurs, change-makers, health-conscious and digital nomads. This restaurant caters to gluten-free, dairy-free, vegan, vegetarian, egg-free, and nut-free options. Headed by Chef Ilham Tahirov, a renowned figure in the whole foods scene, Genius Central Singapore’s culinary team is dedicated to preparing meals that are delicious, healthy, and most importantly, house-made. We take pride in creating food items in-house, from our sauces to raw desserts to locally-farmed produce. This goes the same for our meat options, where we ensure that we only serve high-quality organic chicken; prawns, and fish wild-caught, that is, they are caught in their natural environment by fishermen. Ingredients such as organic basmati rice, gluten-free soy sauce, wolfberry, haricot fine beans, and gluten-free batter can be found in the extensive menu. To get your day started for breakfast, start with a Smoothie Bowl or our famous Smashed Avocado, a healthy breakfast seasoned in Himalayan pink salt that sits on a 36-hour fermented toast, sprinkled with house-made dukkah and balsamic glaze, and topped with a chunky tomato salad and fresh herbs. For lunch, our popular Falafel bowl from the Longevity Bowls section makes a great lunch option. It is filled with a variety of mixed mesclun, cherry tomato salsa, tabouleh, traditional hummus, beetroot hummus, house-made falafel, mixed herbs, avocado, house-made plant-based raita, house-made flatbread, dukkah. Looking for something to fill your tummy after a long day? Genius Central also has you covered. Mains include the Creamy Mushroom Pasta, a healthier version to the traditional Italian favorite, a dish which Genius Central uses cashew milk to create the creamy texture. Guests can also opt for gluten-free pasta. Khichdi is something that will fill your belly, with yellow mung lentils and plant-based raita cooked together with organic basmati rice. Genius Central Singapore’s menu also extends to desserts. Indulge your sweet tooth with raw bars such as the Cranberry Slice, Peanut Butter Slice, as well as options like the Vegan Chocolate Mudcake and Vegan Chocolate Cake. With ample electrical outlets and table space, the restaurant is uniquely designed to accommodate any party size of guests. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Flavour of Asia Bowl, Mexican Bowl of Glory, House Hot Smoked Salmon Risotto, Khichdi

  • ABOUT

    Located in the heart of Boat Quay, Georgetown Penang Tze Char & Craft Beer is a short and scenic walk from Clarke Quay MRT. Providing quality food and drinks at an affordable price, the restaurant whips up mouthwatering Penang Tze Char that perfectly complements the craft beers on offer. Promising amazing Penang seafood at incredibly low prices, relish in Penang comfort food when you head down to the restaurant. Must-try dishes include the Thai Style Curry Fish Head, Kungfu Pork Ribs and more! Elevate your dining experience to the next level when you pair these fiery dishes with fine wines, gin or Brewlander Craft Beer — available on the menu. Alternatively, diners can indulge in a lip-smacking session with the restaurant’s signature Rendang Crab. Skillfully prepared by award-winning chef, Geroge Tan, the juicy and succulent crab meat is coated with a flavourful layer of Indonesian spicy gravy to excite your senses. Another innovative offering here is the Crispy Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg Yolk Sauce. Drenched in a rich golden sauce, the soft shell crab is accompanied by a row of shiny golden mantou buns. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Thai Style Curry Fish Head, Kungfu Pork Ribs, Rendang Crab, Crispy Soft Shell Crab with Salted Egg Yolk Sauce

  • ABOUT

    Indulge in good food and great vibes at Georges @ TS with the beach bar’s rustic charm and refreshing ocean views. Dig into grilled Western favourites whipped up by experienced chefs, or make a toast to new friendships. No one is a stranger at Georges, and if you are, this is the place where strangers become friends! Toasted to perfection and slathered with creamy garlic butter, the Garlic Bread Basket is a popular crowd favourite that delights all. Other menu options from the nibbles section that would satisfy your western cravings are the Crispy Chicken Strips and Georges Sliders. Stuffed with bacon and cheese, the Georges Sliders feature a trio of mini beef burgers that taste even better than they look. Offering more than just grilled delights, diners can look forward to enjoying authentic Indian fare such as the Tandoori Chicken Tikka and Butter Chicken Makhani to savour a taste of the traditional naan paired with either a side of nutritious salad or mint yoghurt. Featuring Anderson’s rich vanilla ice cream, end your meal on a sweet note with the Molten Lava Cake. A decadent treat made for those with a sweet tooth, this irresistible blend of both chocolate and ice cream is the perfect treat to wrap up any meal! (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

  • ABOUT

    Capitalizing on Singapore’s scenic coasts and waterways, the Georges group of bars and grill restaurants are all situated at prime waterfront locations for that gorgeous night out. The Pasir Ris Park branch, Georges @ The Cove, blends in with the relaxed Pasir Ris vibe and lush surrounding greenery to give you a welcome escape from the city. Think a sea breeze in your hair, a cold beer in your hand, and hearty food in your tummy. This charming, rustic beach house right on the eastern edge of the island has great views of the coast and starlit sky. If you’ve been feeling cooped up in the city, this breezy escape is just a quick drive away. The vibe may be chill and relaxed, with the occasional sports match screened on TV, but the food is not lightweight. Whether it’s a smoky platter of ribs, sausages, and spicy braised lamb; George’s popular crispy fried wings, or even a flame grilled tenderloin, the extensive, meat-forward menu will make sure you leave well fed. And if you’re in a big group, even better: order a massive beer tower to go with those succulent ribs and you’ve found yourself one of the sweetest spots on the island. (Sep 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “With its low-key ambience, comfort food (slabs of beef steak and beer battered fish and chip galore) and ice cold draft beer, it’s no wonder the lads love this friendly neighbourhood bar.” -Honeycombers

• ABOUT

    When you think of Thai food you don’t exactly think of Singapore’s Raffles Place, but that’s soon to change because tempting Bangkok eats is exactly what you get when dining at Gin Khao! Meaning “eat rice”, Gin Khao brings rice front and center with dishes like Prawn & Green Mango Relish served with Thai Rice Crackers, Khao Nuea Phat topped with spicy stir-fried beef, and with desserts like the ever-so-sweet Mango with Black Sticky Rice. That’s not all though! The amazing street food offerings are perfect for indulging so pick one (or all) and enjoy bold eats like fried noodles, Tom Yum Chicken wings, Deep-Fried Squid and more! (Jun 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

html:
• ABOUT

    The fun and patriotic Gin Khao Bistro is full of dining surprises, where you will find the national flag not on the roof but served up on a plate in the form of a striped red-white-blue cake. Combine its exotic creative food with its relaxing location at the Sentosa Cove in Quayside Isle and you have the perfect spot for a quick Thai getaway without even leaving Singapore. Take a seat at the restaurant’s extensive outdoor dining area to enjoy the views of the luxurious villas and ease into the relaxing rhythm of the docked yachts bobbing along gently in the cove. With a restaurant name that humbly means “eat rice” in Thai, you can expect simple home-style Thai comfort food such as Juicy Chicken in Green Curry Broth, sour and spicy Tom Yum Seafood Soup that is served with rice or rice crackers of course. Make sure you leave room for Gin Khao Bistro’s modern and innovative interpretations of traditional Thai dishes. Pineapple is replaced with watermelon to produce a refreshing and sweet version of the fried rice dish in Khao Phat Dtaeng Moe. For the adventurous foodie, go for a spicy dessert experience with the Green Curry Gelato with Sticky Rice. Visit Gin Khao Bistro to give your mind and palate a Thai-flavoured break. (Nov 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Seafood Soup, Juicy Chicken in Green Curry Broth, Thai Style Grilled Pork Belly, Stir-Fried Squid with Runny Salted Egg, Khao Phat Dtaeng Moe, Mango Served with Black Sticky Rice, Green Curry Gelato

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is a buzzy bistro-style restaurant and wine bar in the heart of Singapore’s Arts District making it the ideal spot to mix and mingle and make new friends in the city. The cosy venue serves happy hour prices all day, where patrons can choose from more than 90 varieties of wine, sparkling or champagne by the glass, all starting from a pocket-friendly price of just $6++ per glass and $30++ by the bottle. Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is an in-vogue escape that offers something for everyone. Service evolves throughout the day, starting with a morning buffet spread accompanied by takeaway breakfast options. Perfect for those on the go, lunch is an easy fix with a two-course set priced at $15++. For steak-lovers, premium quality beef such as Pure Black Angus and Australian Wagyu M5 are available at affordable prices – go for the dry-aged selection if it suits your palette. Want to bring the Ginett experience home? Wine and cheese can be purchased on retail, with prices starting from $30+ for wine bottles and $18+ for a selection of 2 cheese. Ginett Restaurant & Wine Bar is the perfect place for a city escape, just a stone’s throw away from the Orchard Road, Bugis and City Hall entertainment and business districts. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Le Confit de Canard, Steak Frites, Scottish Salmon, La Joue de Boeuf, 1-Meter Cold Cuts and Cheese Board, Beef Tartare, Australian Wagyu Steak

    Weekly Specials at Ginett - Weekdays Set Lunch: 2-course set lunch at $15++ - Meat Mondays: Meat platter for 2-3 pax at $49++ , includes half rotisserie chicken, Black Angus ribeye, Kurobuta pork chop, and lamb chop served with potato wedges and black pepper sauce - Ladies Night Tuesdays: Every group of 4 ladies receives 1 bottle of rosé - Wine Down Wednesdays: 1-for-1 on selected bottles of French Grand Cru wines - Oyster Frenzy Thursdays: Fresh Fine de Claire oysters at $1++ per piece, while stocks last - Brunch Till You Drop Weekends: A la carte brunch menu, top up $15++ for 2 hours of free-flow mimosa - Cheese to Sundays: 1 complimentary bottle of house wine with every order of the 5-cheese platter

    Drawing inspiration from Singapore's culturally-rich ethnic enclaves of Kampong Glam, Little India and Chinatown, as well as the country's history as a Straits Settlement, Ginger at PARKROYAL on Beach Road presents a sumptuous buffet spread featuring an array of well-loved crabs, seafood on ice, alongside a live carving roast meat station, and selections of pastries and desserts, all crafted by Executive Chef Vincent Aw. (Aug 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Needless to say, I was thoroughly satisfied by the end of my dinner - the wide selection of quality seafood and delish local fare is worth every single penny - and calorie." -Honeycombers

html:
• ABOUT

    The glories of Thai street food abound at this unassuming eatery along bustling Cuppage Terrace, calling out to the barflies looking for some comforting grub to ease along the night. With its selection of classic Thai bites, ranging from smokey street food to hearty home-style fare, Ginger Thai has it all. Tuck into some classic fiery Green Curry, or a savoury-sweet Massaman Chicken Curry featuring tender chunks of chicken cooked in a red curry with seasonal fruit. Or get a plate of the Ginger Signature Wings, aromatic deep fried chicken wings marinated with fragrant ginger spices. For some comfort food, get a serving of Basil Chicken, minced chicken tossed up with chili and holy basil for a heady and spicy kick, perfect over some steaming white rice, or even Black Pepper Glass Noodles, vermicelli noodles marinated in Thai garlic and sauteed with lots of fresh pepper. Don’t forget the quintessential Tom Yum Soup, served with your choice of seafood or chicken, but either way bursting with the bright, piquant flavours of Thai herbs and spices, and a zesty finishing of lime. If you’re feeling nostalgic, a plateful of Pineapple Rice, perfectly-cooked rice steeped in pineapple, spices, and herbs for a mild, gentle warmth, and lots of savoury-sweet goodness. It’s the perfect foil to all those rich sauces and flavour. This is some of the most authentic Thai food in the heart of town! (Oct 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Thai Prawn Popcorn, Mango Salad, Tom Yum Glass Noodles, Suicide Ginger Chicken, Curry Soft Shell Crab

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways instead.Takeaway Opening HoursMon-Sun: 12pm-11pmPromotionFree can drink with every takeaway order

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Ginger.Lily is a sophisticated, botanical-inspired oasis in the newly opened Hilton Singapore Orchard. Located adjacent to Estate, the hotel’s residential all-day dining restaurant on level five, Ginger.Lily presents a multi-faceted lounge and bar experience that seamlessly transforms throughout the day.The radiant space accented with natural daylight from the lofty ceilings is an ideal setting for the whimsical afternoon tea experience, a daily ritual at Ginger.Lily. Embark on a four-part journey through savoury, sweet, thirst, and take me home that promises an elevated experience for the most discerning guests.After sundown, indulges the senses and unwind over Ginger.Lily’s botanical-inspired craft cocktails feature floral tinctures and infusions. The bar also offers a fine selection of beverage options for all settings and occasions, from craft beers to handpicked wines and champagnes, accompanied by a snack menu that features small plates of delectable bites. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmone Tartare with Avocado, Spicy Yellow Fin Tuna Noodle Salad, The Ginger.Lily

html:
• ABOUT

    The latest addition to the variety of Japanese restaurants in Singapore, Ginza Shinto brings the best cuisine from the Land of the Rising Sun to the heart of Singapore. Located along Mohamed Sultan Road, Ginza Shinto is a contemporary Japanese sushi and omakase restaurant where fresh produce and rich flavours are the secrets to a hearty meal. The restaurant has separate menus for lunch sets, a la carte appetisers and sashimi platters. The Omakase menus are also updated biweekly to incorporate the freshest produce of the week. Watch the chefs in action as they expertly prepare a variety of different Japanese delights to tantalise your tastebuds. Diners can expect an extra creative touch to your dishes, elevating the traditional tastes of authentic Japanese favourites. A truly unforgettable combination of nigiri and mini roasted, crispy rice puffs, look out for the Forget Me Not Nigiri Sushi for a wonderfully textured contrast and burst of flavours. Best enjoyed by mixing the egg yolk with beef sauce, dip the Miyazaki A5 Wagyu into the sauce for a tender mouthful of premium wagyu meat. Other signature treats include the Ikura Uni Don. Crowned with fresh salmon roe atop fluffy Japanese rice, the dish is a delicious mouthful of fatty minced tuna and sea urchin. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Forget Me Not Nigiri Sushi, Miyazaki A5 Wagyu, Ikura Uni Don, Sashimi Platter

• ABOUT

    Located in Singapore’s Central Business District, Gourmet Italian Osteria is inspired by the love of a simple yet generous Italian way of cooking. Setting out to recreate the same sense of community you feel while feasting at a typical Italian family table, chef David Marchioro revisits classic recipes to reinvent innovative dishes filled with fresh, contemporary flavours for an exclusive experience. A popular choice, the Polpette comes in four pieces with your choice of beef, chicken or tuna. Shaped into small balls and enriched with parsley, eggs, garlic and cheese, dunk these Italian meatballs into a special house sauce for a delicious burst of flavours. For those who prefer a hearty platter of small bites, the Tramezzini Selection offers Italian triangular sandwiches made with chevy, crustless white bread. Move on to signature favourites such as the Vitello Tonnato and Tagliatelle al Ragu in the four course meal before ending on a sweet note with the Tiramisu cake. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pizza Fritta, Caponata di Melanzane e Stracciatella, Rigatoni alla Carbonara, Braised and crusty beef cheek, Tiramisu

    Located in the heart of Jalan Besar is Glacier, decked in an all-white, minimalistic look.Opened by the masterminds behind bagel house Onalu, Glacier offers a fresh menu that takes on a farm-to-table concept, with microgreens and herbs harvested from their in-house hydroponics. Serving up a modest but delicious brunch menu, Glacier’s baked and breakfast foods are must-tries for everyone. If you’re working in the area, we recommend picking up Glacier’s French Toast and a cup of their specially blended, floral Lucky Basterd Blend to start your day right. Seasonal bakes include their delicious Matcha White Chocolate Babka, which is dense and creamy — definitely not to be missed! For lunch, we recommend their delicious Salmon Mentaiko Truffle Bowl. Savour every bite of decadent umami truffle rice topped with gooey sous vide egg. Get healthy with their specially made Kombucha, a deliciously floral mixture that’s a great pick me up to give you that boost of energy. Every part of the menu is truly well thought out and specially crafted. Incorporating a deliciously floral and botanical-themed menu, Glacier’s sweets are a specialty treat. Taste notes of floral in their gelato and waffle — you’re sure to be getting a burst of spring with every bite. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Glacier French Toast, Salmon Mentaiko Truffle Bowl, Smoked Salmon and Avocado Toast, Glacier Big Breakfast

    Wish you could have a quick getaway from the hustle and bustle of everyday life? Glean Cafe offers you just that and more! With an all-day dining menu that focuses on hot brunch favourites, this casual cafe tucked away along Braddell Road is specially designed for refreshing gatherings and comfortable meals, making it an ideal spot for a quick pick me up lunch or afternoon catch ups over coffee with friends. Be it a fuss free brunch session or hearty morning feast, the cafe’s wholesome menu of mouthwatering bites will definitely delight! Available daily from 11am till 8pm, dig into a platter of Assorted Sausages to indulge in a variety of pork and chicken hotdogs cooked with Moscato, apple cider and spices. For those on the hunt for fluffy pancakes drizzled with honey and sunflower seeds, the cafe’s Famous Waffles is the perfect savoury treat to kickstart your mornings with! Topped with whipped cream and mango cubes, you simply can’t miss out on ordering this signature favourite whenever you drop by Glean Cafe. Pasta lovers would be delighted by the cafe’s innovative selection of fusion spaghetti. Slow cooked with homemade Rendang paste and tomato ragout, the Chicken Rendang Ragout Pasta is specially crafted to afford diners a localicious time. (Aug 2021)

    A marriage of cooking styles, Peranakan cuisines combine the preparation techniques of both traditional Chinese and Malay cooking. This unusual pairing gives Peranakan cuisine its distinctive taste, filled with exciting flavours from the use of local herbs and spices. Located in Funan, Singapore's latest lifestyle destination in the heart of the Civic District, Godmama is a modern Peranakan restaurant for guests who are looking for an uplifting and lively dining experience. Offering a contemporary setting with both indoor and alfresco dining options, Godmama delivers both authentic Nyonya cuisine and innovative Peranakan food creations in a vibrant atmosphere. With uncompromising quality for authenticity and honouring our Godmama's treasured recipes, every dish we sere you is legacy on a plate. From our hands, to yours. (Jun 2019)

    Babi Assam, Popiah, Beef Rendang, Sambal Sotong

html:
• ABOUT

    From the folks that brought you Hokkaido Manpei in Central Mall comes this dinner-only restaurant along the Mohammed Sultan stretch. This is one of only three restaurants in Singapore that offers motsunabe, a richer version of the beloved Japanese hotpot made with miso and offal. Another key ingredient in their dishes is beef intestines, which is incorporated into several of their small plate offerings, as well as several main dishes. The soft innards are cooked in a broth to bring out their flavour and collagen, and is said to be perfect for women looking to improve their complexion. Seafood lovers won’t be missing out either since Motsunabe will be dishing out creations like the Stir-Fried Squid with Salted Fish. This dish is a briny combination of tender fish meat and firm squid tentacles stir fried in a savoury sauce. Perfect with steamed rice or even on its own, this is one dish that showcases the best of the treasures of the sea. The Hakata-Style Sesame Mackerel is another delicious dish featuring soft fish flesh bathed in thick, earthy sesame sauce. With a fun environment, variety of dishes and a communal dining feel, this is the perfect place to unwind on weekends with family and friends without missing any of the action of the city. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hakata-Style Sesame Mackerel, Stir-Fried Squid with Salted Fish, Nagoya-Style Chicken Wings, Crab Cream Croquette, Grilled Eggplant

  • ABOUT

    Golden Peony is an award-winning restaurant which elevates Chinese fine dining to a whole new level. From their elegant plating, delicious flavours and excellent service, Golden Peony is already a favourite among businessmen who bring their clients there for lunch to seal the deal. Chef Ku Keung from Hong Kong never fails to impress guests with his innovative dishes and beautiful presentation. If you have been to a wedding banquet at this hotel, count yourself lucky to have tasted the wonderful cuisine here! Everything from the beancurd skin to the sauces and garnishes are handmade in the kitchen. The flavours are subtle and pair well together in their dishes. Aside from their cuisine, their top-notch attention to detail is evident in the decor, from the trademark peony images on the wall to the custom-made yellow shaw plates. Orchids are elegantly placed in vases on every table, and should you require a private room, Golden Peony's is inviting and tastefully furnished. Head over to this hidden gem and prepare to be blown away by their untraditional Chinese cuisine. (Jul 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "This stalwart in Cantonese cuisine offers some of the best dim sum in town. Golden Peony's special set menus are a draw, especially for those who have a taste for refined dishes such as the golden fried duck with Portugese sauce wrapped in filo pastry - yum." -SG Now

• ABOUT

    This long-standing Taiwanese restaurant is a place for family to gather over heartwarming and nostalgic fare. Known for its porridge buffet, Goldleaf has also launched their first-ever a la carte buffet featuring eight of the restaurant’s signature dishes that diners can enjoy in unlimited servings. Start dinner with a chilled portion of the Double Beancurd Platter, where century egg (imported from Taiwan) is sprinkled with pork floss, bonito flakes and a touch of soy. The contrast of smooth, cold beancurd with the piping hot Taiwanese porridge is a great way to whet the appetite! The Omelette with Chye Poh (salted preserved radish) is reminiscent of grandma’s cooking, where the golden, fluffy egg is filled with bits of salty, crunchy radish. Good to share are dishes like Steamed Pork Patty with Salted Fish, and the Braised Pork Belly with Preserved Vegetables. All items are cooked a la minute, upon order, so you can be assured of enjoying them fresh and piping hot off the stove! (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chye-Por Omelette, Honey Glazed Chicken, Goldleaf Prawn Rolls, Braised Pork with Preserved Vegetables, Steamed Pork Patty with Salted Egg Yolk

    Good Bites is the latest F&B brand under Citrus By The Pool, offering customizable healthy bowls. With the belief that food can be made healthy and delicious, Good Bites focuses on homemade recipes and preparation methods that retain and maximize the taste and nutritional value of the food. Customers can create their healthy bowl based on their nutrition goals and preferences. Located at the heart of Bishan Sports Centre, the café is a tranquil space surrounded by full-length windows that fill the space with natural light. The café seats up to 60 pax and is available for private events that can accommodate up to 80 pax. (Sep 2019)

    Herb & Citrus Chicken Bowl, Prawns with Pineapple Salsa Bowl, Smoked Salmon Soba Bowl

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the historic Katong Heritage district, this restaurant serves up delicious and authentic Peranakan delicacies made from natural ingredients. Many of the dishes consist of familiar flavours with a Straits Chinese twist. The menu was carefully curated by the owner-chefs who are both true blue Peranakans. Seafood lovers are sure to appreciate the range of seafood dishes on offer here. The Oven-Baked Nonya Sambal Barramundi is a popular dish perfect for sharing. The tender flesh of the barramundi is flavoured with traditional Straits Chinese spices, giving it a fiery bite that is best enjoyed with a bowl of steamed rice. For something a little less fiery, the Sticky Shiok Sotong is a great option. Made with a generous portion of springy squid, tossed in a mix of chilli and sticky sauce, this dish is the perfect accompaniment to a bowl of soup, and can even be enjoyed on its own. Looking for a unique take on a classic Singaporean dish? Look no further than the cheeky Chilli Full of Crab Tofu. The base of the dish is the beloved chilli crab, and beneath the tender whole swimmer crab is a large block of egg tofu that has soaked up the chilli broth. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chili Full of Crab Tofu, Good Time Carbonara, Oven Baked Nonya Sambal Barramundi, Fiery Claypot Bak Kut Teh, Hurry! Hurry! Chicken Curry

html:
• ABOUT

    For an unfussy but authentic Japanese lunch, Grand jetè izakaya is hard to beat. Named after the word for “rice” in Japanese, Grand jetè izakaya really cuts to the heart of the Japanese love affair with this fluffy grain: the focus at this Japanese-run joint is the delicious rice bowl, put together by the people who also run and own Kacyo, the upmarket Japanese restaurant at Bukit Pasoh Road. For seafood lovers, there’s a bountiful Barachirashi featuring sushi rice topped with chunks of tuna, salmon, swordfish, and ikura, matched only by a delicious Salmon Ikura Bowl generously topped with slices of tender fatty salmon and salty roe. Meatier affairs include the Stewed Miyazaki Pork Belly Bowl, think a rice-bowl equivalent of chashu ramen with chunks of fatty pork belly, stewed egg, and wakame seaweed atop rice. A beef equivalent, the Wagyu Yakiniku Rice Bowl, sees stewed beef and a crunchy green salad on rice. Tempura Rice Bowls and even a Japanese Curry Rice Bowls round up the menu here, a true testament to the delicious simplicity of the humble donburi. (Jan 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Ikura Bowl, Barachirashi, Miyazaki Pork Belly Bowl, Wagyu Yakiniku Rice, Tempura Rice Bowl

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/grand-jete-izakaya
name: Grand jeté izakaya

html:
• ABOUT

    Indulge in a timeless experience in the restored Grand Lobby of the iconic Raffles Singapore. The grandeur of floor-to-ceiling Victorian pillars, bathed in soft daylight streaming through the skylight make it a truly refined and unique destination for their signature Raffles Afternoon Tea.Enjoy a mouthwatering assortment of flavourful finger sandwiches and buttery scones, all made in house. Fragrant and delicate, The Grand Lobby's rose petal jam is worth every inch of sweetness. Don't miss the variety of cakes that are both light and airy, as well as dark and flavourful.Pair your small bites with The Grand Lobby's carefully curated collection of exquisitely perfumed international teas. We recommend the Rouge Opera, a mesmerising blend consisting of South African Red Rooibos with notes of red fruit and vanilla. For something lighter, try the Vert Provence, a green tea blended with Provencal fruits, with a fragrance that's both fruity and grassy. Alternatively, order a glass of bubbly that's sure to keep you in high spirits throughout the afternoon. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Scones with Clotted Cream and Rose Petal Jam, Rouge Opera Tea, Vert Provence Tea

  • A RAFFLES HERITAGE EVENING

    Wind down in the evenings with a set menu of local delights inspired by the rich flavours of Singapore's culinary history with A Raffles Heritage Evening. Be spoilt for choice with a sharing platter of Southeast Asian Tapas such as Singapore Chilli Crab Cake, Spicy Tiger Prawns and Sesame Shrimp Toast, before diving into well-loved local classics like Singapore Laksa and Hainanese Chicken Rice. End the meal on a sweet note with perennial favourites like Chendol, Ondeh-Ondeh or Coconut Bird's Nest Tartlets.Complement the evening with cocktails inspired by our lion city, such as Curry Chilli Fizz, a clever concoction of citrus and spices, or Silk-Road, Rye Whiskey accompanied with bitters and pandan syrup.

  • AFTERNOON TEA

    Classic Afternoon TeaEnjoy a timeless Raffles Afternoon Tea experience in The Grand Lobby. Indulge in exquisite finger sandwiches, home-baked scones and delightful sweet treats presented on a classic three-tier silver stand Price: $80++ per personMode of guarantee: $80++ per person Menu: Afternoon Tea Menu

  • SG-CLEAN CERTIFIED

Delight in an alluring spread of Red Bean Sakura Ice Cream Monaka, Coconut Raspberry Sakura Tartlet and Japanese Omelette with Ikura amongst other delights inspired by the colours and fragrances of the famous seasonal festivity.     Grapevine @ Guillemard is a casual bistro, bar and restaurant, tucked nicely in Guillemard and just outside the hustle and bustle of the city area. With our vast experience from our first outlet at Upper Serangoon Road, we continue to provide our customers with a wide variety of food and beverages. We serve a good selection of draft beers, chilled bottled beers, fine wines and whiskies from various regions. Our Western cuisine ranges from delicious bar food, hand-made pizzas, hearty hamburgers and classic main courses like Fish & Chips, Chicken Chop and Steak. In addition to our Western cuisine, we have introduced our Japanese Donburi bowls which have been well received by our customers. We believe in putting continuous effort and resources to serve an ever-improving selection of food and beverages for our customers. (Oct 2018)

    This no-frills neighbourhood bar along Upper Serangoon is hard to miss. The cheerful red walls decorated with paraphernalia, as well as the pool tables on display, are easy to spot when walking about this quaint neighbourhood. Food and drinks here are kept simple, but you’ll definitely enjoy tucking into favourites like an icy-cold, thick and chocolate-y Oreo Frappe. Or how about a refreshing frosty beer to go with the live screenings of soccer that are a highlight at this bar? The best bit — dress code is casual, which means you can saunter over to Grapevine in just shorts and flip-flops if you so desire. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grapevine's Platter, Spam Fries, Baked Garlic Oysters, Homemade Angus Burger, Iberico Pork Shogayaki, Craving for Seafood

html:
• ABOUT

    Sample the best of Indian cuisine at Gravy Restaurant and Bar. Within walking distance of Tanjong Pagar MRT, this authentic joint is a hit with the office crowd who work in the vicinity. To start, try the Kali Mirch Chicken Soup, a delicious chicken broth that is seasoned generously with black pepper to pack a flavourful punch. Don’t miss out on the Subz Desh Videsh, a medley of marinated vegetables grilled in the tandoor to fully extract the flavours. For the entrees, we recommend the Palak Paneer. A beloved Indian culinary classic of cottage cheese and creamy spinach gravy. Seafood lovers, look out for the Prawns Hari Mirch Masala - succulent tiger prawns cooked in zesty green chilli and mint sauce. The Lamb Biryani is beautifully set on a bed of fragrant Basmati rice and further flavoured with cinnamon sticks, cloves and other spices. End your meal on a sweet note with some Kulfi, a delicious dessert of homemade ice cream, saffron, pistachios, nuts and cardamom. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kali Mirch Chicken Soup, Palak Paneer, Lamb Biryani, Kulfi

    Though adventurous palates once had to journey to Bangkok for authentic flavours, these days you can find delicious Thai favourites including Seafood Pad Thai, Thai Iced Milk Tea, Mango Sticky Rice, and more in just about every corner of Singapore. However, even with all the Thai options, finding something truly delectable is a little tough - well, it was until we chanced upon Greathai in East Village. Serving up an array of Thai flavours, everything from a spicy Tom Yum Red Soup to a mind-blowingly delicious Masamann Chicken Curry, this little eatery is one of our go to spots when in the area. Along with the eats the service is impeccable so whether you're going with a group of two or twenty - one thing is certain, you won't leave here disappointed! (Mar 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Red Soup, Thai Styled Fried Kallan, Sweet & Sour Fish, Masamann Chicken Curry, Prawn Omelette, Thai Roasted Chicken, Thai Fish Cake, Sweet Tapioca with Coconut Milk

    The world’s first plant-based eatery and grocery concept store aimed at bringing a revolutionary food and lifestyle experience through the introduction of the most advanced global food-tech innovations, Green Common sets out to change the food mindset of Asia. As a wholesaler and distributor of vegetarian, vegan, organic and natural foods, Green Common believes that the future is plant-based and hopes to make change happen and make green common. Kickstart your meal with a bowl of their famous Meatless Meatballs. Featuring Omnimeat and Beyond Meat Meatballs drenched in marinara sauce, bite into one for a delicious burst of flavours! Love fries? Green Common offers a variety of different flavoured fries sure to satisfy your cravings. Choose to indulge in the Sweet Potato Fries, Potato Fries, or Omni Luncheon Fries with either a truffle, Thai chilli, BBQ or honey mustard dip. Salad options are also aplenty here at Green Common. Pick your favourite combination of veggie delights with the different salads. Popular choices include the Rainbowl, and Pomegranate and Orange Salad. (Jan 2021)

    Spice up your life with the variety of dining experiences that await you at Greenhouse. Boasting five different show kitchens that plate up tasty dishes featuring different cuisines, savour an array of authentic, multi-ethnic cuisine anytime of the day when you visit this forest-themed restaurant located within Dusit Thani Laguna Singapore. Get ready to dig into the array of food cultures made available by the exciting lineup of cuisines set to please the taste buds of discerning diners and embark on a gastronomic journey around the world. Here at Greenhouse, we proudly present to you menu options from our brand’s signature Thai cuisine, Yue cuisine, Punjabi Tandoor cuisine, Mediterranean cuisine as well as Japanese cuisine that will surely leave everyone spoilt for choice! Inspired by the Guangdong province, the Yue cuisine kitchen serves up a mouth-watering selection of Cantonese favourites such as house roasted meat, wok fried noodles and nutritious soups. Alternatively, those looking to fill up your tables and stomachs with a generous spread of yummy Thailand classics can opt for the Phad Thai Goong and quintessential Tom Yum Goong. Pizza lovers can look forward to indulging in a delicious selection of thin crusted, applewood fired sourdough pizzas. Hot favourites include the Porcini Mushroom with Truffle and Fontina and the Prosciutto Ham and Rucola. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Phad Thai Goong, Porcini Mushroom with Truffle and Fontina, Seekh Kebab, Hokkaido Scallops

    Greenwood Fish Market @ Asian Cuisine is your one-stop center for fresh seafood in Singapore. A meal here typically starts with entrees such as Homemade Spring Rolls, Crabmeat Omelette or Korean Squid to whet your appetite. Be it lobster or crab, there are plenty of options here at Greenwood Fish Market @ Asian Cuisine for you to choose from. Enjoy Russian King Crab Leg, Mud Crab and Live Boston Lobster, with your choice of sauce. Izakaya snacks are also available here. Seasoned with salt and chili, the Fried Edamame Beans are savory and satisfying. Have this with a plate of Salmon Belly for a complete Japanese-inspired dining experience. The star of the show at the restaurant is definitely the catch from the sea. Live mussels and clams are cooked in your choice of yellow Thai curry, sambal chili ginger and garlic steam or laksa, resulting in a flavorful plate of shellfish. Order a side of six pieces of mantou to enjoy the delicious sauce. (Mar 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled in the Greenwood housing estate just off Bukit Timah Road, lies an institution dedicated to fresh seafood. Judging by the army of loyal clientele who swear by it and visit on a regular basis, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah can't really be considered a hidden gem. However, if you haven't heard of it before, consider yourself now in on this open secret. It started originally as a fish market at 34 Greenwood Avenue with a small bistro at the back to cater to the appetite of its customers who couldn't wait to eat the day's freshest catch. It is testament to its popularity that it quickly outgrew its premises and expanded, offering a much larger dedicated dining room along with outdoor seating. Specialising in fresh seafood flown in from all over the world, daily deliveries ensure that you are getting only the best. You'll also be spoiled for choice with their truly impressive wine selection that boasts over 120 different bottles to perfectly complement any meal or budget. Staff are extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and always keen to recommend the freshest catch, cooked in a style that really brings out the natural flavours and textures of the fish. By taking a "less is more" approach, Greenwood Fish Market @ Bukit Timah lovingly showcases the freshest seafood and allows it to take center stage, where it belongs. (Oct 2011)

  • THE BUZZ

    "With a wide array of fresh seafood, house specialties, fine wines and responsive service to boot, dining at Greenwood Fish Market is a pleasure. The cold seafood platter is spectacular, a no-brainer for seafood lovers." -Asia Tatler Dining "Only the freshest seafood prepared to your specification. Freshly shucked oysters served with a twist of lemon, creamy mary point oysters from British Columbia and the Barron Point oysters measuring four to five inches. Feast on luscious black mussels sautéed with wine and garlic as well as a pan-seared lemon sole served with lemon butter." -CNNGo

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crab Cake, Hot Smoked Ocean Trout, Cold Seafood Platter, Marinara Linguini, Lobster & Beef, Seafood Rice, Red Miso Cod, House Fish & Chips, Blackcurrant Cheese Tart, Valrhona Chocolate Cake

• ABOUT

    Greenwood Fish Market has been an icon in the Bukit Timah neighbourhood for many years, and has since opened another outlet amidst the lush greenery of Dempsey. From the menu comes a delicious variety of fresh seafood, prepared in different styles at this outlet. True to Greenwood Fish Market "Sea to Table" philosophy, this Quayside Isle outlet continue to directly import seafood fresh from Canada, Holland, New Zealand, South Korea, and the United States to the kitchens in weekly shipments. Given the many sources for their produce, Greenwood has a vast selection of fresh seasonal fish, shellfish, live Maine lobsters and even Dungenese crabs. Using their very own smoker, they proudly produce in-house hot/cold smoked salmon, mackerel, sardines and pork belly to offer customers a taste that is unique to Greenwood. (Aug 2016)

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Stepping into GRETL German Burgergrill might feel like you’ve been transported to Germany. And if you’ve ever wondered how the Germans cook their burgers, you’ll find out here at GRETL German Burgergrill. On the menu is an extensive selection of burgers that span beef, chicken, vegetarian and vegan. A popular favourite is the Birkenwald, a combination of mushrooms and sour cream-scallion sauce. The Horntrager is a good way to show off how delicious going vegetarian can be, with a walnut pattie topped with crumbly feta cheese and a sweet fig jam. There’s a choice of sourdough or multigrain for buns, or you could go completely naked — with patties wrapped in lettuce and lots of salads. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gretl, Birkenwald, Fritten

  • ABOUT

    Born in Bangkok, this fashionable dining café has now opened up in Singapore, serving the same creative mix of food with great ambiance and amazing service. Whet your appetite with their creamy Galangal and Coconut Soup (Tom Kha), that’s filled with chunks of tender chicken. Or go for their savoury and silky smooth French Onion Soup, topped with melted cheese and served with french bread. For a twist on your regular Wontons, try out their Duck Wonton Soup and bite into wontons filled with juicy tender meat that’s drenched with delicious broth. For starters, try out their Complicated Noodle, a deconstructed dish that gives you noodle sheets, fresh lettuce leaves, minced pork sauce, and chili sauce to wrap on your own. This fun dish is great for sharing and a fun way to ‘play’ with your food whilst waiting on the mains. Mains not to be missed are their signature Spaghetti with Thai Anchovy and Spaghetti Vongole. Their Spaghetti with Thai Anchovy is sweet, spicy, and oh-so-satisfying to slurp on, with the anchovies enhancing the flavor of the dish. Their Spaghetti Vongole is also topped with Italian anchovy, which brings out a delicious smoky flavour that complements the white wine sauce. For dessert, finish off with their Famous Thai Mango Sticky Rice to end on a sweet creamy note. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Duck Wonton Soup, Galangal and Coconut Soup, Complicated Noodle, Spaghetti with Thai Anchovy, Thai Mango Sticky Rice

html:
• ABOUT

    Just a short walk away from Chinatown and Hong Lim Food Centre, Grids and Circles is a tranquil oasis right in the heart of the bustling CBD. The three-storey lifestyle cafe and workshop space is housed in a charming, modernised shophouse. The cafe inhabits the first floor while the upper floors feature a lifestyle store and private space dedicated to workshops, corporate events and lifestyle classes. The interiors across all three floors feature granite floors, white-washed walls, soft lights and wooden furniture to create a serene haven away from the stresses of the city. Coffee is a definite must and we just can’t have enough of the mouthwatering Western-Japanese fusion fare served up here. Varied, refreshing, and elevated, dishes here are executed with a touch of artistic flair that goes beyond your usual cafe grub. Take the Tamago Sando for instance, where fluffy Tamago-style eggs, paired with a konbu-infused mayo and pear sauce, are tucked snugly between toasted bread; or the Mondanyaki Beef Angus Slider, an intriguing cross between a burger and okonomiyaki that will have you coming back for more. For an instant pick-me-up on a rainy day, the Salmon Ochazuke does a perfect job; featuring a perfectly poached salmon slab atop some plump Kinmemai brown rice, salted plums, nori, and chopped shiso. A clear bacon dashi green tea stock comes on the side, to be poured across over the dish for a wholesome, healthy, and satisfying meal. Prefer something sweet instead? The Strawberry Wonderland, featuring a stack of fluffy pancakes and sprinkles of mint and basil will satisfy any sweet-toothed cravings. A perfect escape from the city complete with good coffee and delicious grub? Sign us up anytime! (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tamago Sando, Summer Pasta, Strawberry Wonderland, Matcha Affogato

  • ABOUT

    A contemporary Italian grill restaurant inspired by the summer outdoor grill known as grigliata, Griglia Open Fire Italian Kitchen recreates this magic with classic grigliata dishes roasted and cooked in a specially customised cast iron charcoal grill. Made for social dining sessions, these perfectly grilled dishes are served in smaller portions to allow diners to have a taste of the wide variety of menu options on offer!  Boasting a modern menu conceptualised by chef Andrea De Paola, and executed by head chef Federico Schiraldi, the dishes presented are prepared based on classic recipes with a modern contemporary twist dedicated to showcasing the unique culinary essence of the griliata. For the best dining experience, we recommend sharing a couple of appetisers before digging into a main from the open fire grill. The Rustic Bread is served with a tangy tomato sauce and extra virgin olive oil, a simple yet exquisite start to a meal! Other equally tantalising appetisers from the land and sea include the Beef Tenderloin Tartare, Hiika Squid, and House-Made Tagliolini. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rustic Bread, Beef Tenderloin Tartare, Hiika Squid, House-Made Tagliolini

Based on his guiding principle of tantalizing palates with cuisine where the purity of flavour and quality of ingredients is paramount, Chef Kenny Huang’s creations consist of appetizers and entrees that echo Italy’s charm juxtaposed with a Japanese touch. Expect to be greeted by a crescendo of flavours, moving you along an unforgettable gastronomical journey by the romantic Singapore River. (Nov 2021)

    Group Therapy began in 2011 as a collective events space within a restored shophouse along the gentrified Duxton Road. The space expanded into a day cafe and in 2013 found another home in the Katong neighborhood. In March 2020, we moved from Duxton to Cross Street Exchange, where we continue to serve as a cafe as well as an events space.We believe that the best form of nourishment is sought through inter-personal connections, where common values and ideals are forged. Through the comforts of our space, good food, and drink we hope that Group Therapy is the perfect setting and catalyst for such encounters. (Oct 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    This homely restaurant on Tai Thong Crescent is sure to remind you of meals at Grandma’s. From the inviting atmosphere to the delicious smells wafting from the kitchen, this is the perfect place to go for some fuss-free local delights. Named after the owner’s nickname and founded on her love for cooking and enjoyment of family meals, diners can expect large portions, authentic flavours, and comforting homeliness. This spot may be famed for its Assam Fish Curry - an aromatic dish that goes perfectly with rice - but there are plenty of other dishes that are just as noteworthy. The produce used is handpicked by Gu Ma daily, so diners can rest assured that they’re eating dishes made with the freshest ingredients. There are also some creative vegetable dishes, like the Crispy Bean Jal - which is made with thin strips of crispy deep-fried brinjal and French beans. The Stir-Fries Black Pepper Beef is another popular dish. Made with thin strips of meat stir-fried in a spicy sauce, this dish bursts with flavour with every bite. Save some room for the Black Glutinous Rice with Ice Cream, a delicious dessert made with sticky Taiwanese rice topped with a generous helping of ice cream for a unique take on a local dessert. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Glutinous Rice with Ice Cream, Assam Fish Curry, Stir-Fried Black Pepper Beef, Crispy Bean Jal, Siam Style Hot Plate Prawn

    Pre-purchase Chope Vouchers for Guccio Ristorante and get 10% off. This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Guccio, representing the surname – and hence, the origins of Chef Marco - will offer Executive Chef Marco Guccio’s culinary philosophy: an Italian fine dining cuisine journey, from a homemade, hearty cuisine to a global fine dining success. While using top ingredients is not unique per se, Marco’s signature cooking style is: in his cuisine, the core ingredient becomes the main actor in the opera. Each dish has one ingredient at the center of the flavor experience. While the presentations are at times a contrast of colorful and complex textures, Marco’s dishes create a balance of supporting flavors, similar to how supporting artists dance in harmony, in the background of the leading act. This philosophy is pushed to its boundaries at Guccio, with critics sometimes claiming that a blindfolded customer would always be able to recognize the chief ingredients in the dish she is eating. This style won chef Marco a Bib Gourmand from the prestigious Michelin Star Guide for two years in a row, in 2016 and 2017. Chef Marco welcomes you to his restaurant. Its décor is, once again, balanced and aims to be comfortable, while remaining in the background. At Guccio, customers will be at the center of the experience, with the colors and design elements to balance the surroundings. In the background of Marco’s main culinary signature style, Guccio will further differentiate itself by taking its diners onto a seasonal journey across the various regions of Italy, their fertile lands and their precious seas. At regular intervals, aligned with the four seasons of Europe, chef Marco will explore regional ingredients and recipes associated to each season, a unique opportunity to visit Italy even when 10,000 km away from it. Marco’s creation will be paired by the best Italian wine labels available. As for the culinary ingredients, Guccio will not focus so much on education about new ingredients or unknown brands, but on outright enjoyment of the best that Italy has to offer. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sicilian red prawns from Mazara, green pea coulis, lemon scented buffalo ‘ricotta’; Pan-seared Rougie foie gras, 70% Valrhona chocolate, red apple compote, raspberry; Linguine Spanner crab, marinated fresh tomatoes, grated roe ‘bottarga’ from Sardinia; Poached and pan-seared Sardinian octopus, seasonal vegetables, ‘salmoriglio’ dressing

  • ABOUT

    More than just your friendly neighbourhood bar, GudSht @ Cineleisure is a bottle store and bistro that whips up an array of sumptuous bites to put diners in a good mood with good food! Featuring Japanese fusion cuisine with a deliciously local spin, drop by for a taste of fun, experimental and bold flavours with the bar’s exciting menu of savoury and spice tingling bites. Lovingly flame-grilled over an expertly controlled fire, GudSht’s tasty skewers include some of the juiciest skewered chicken thighs, umami unagi skewers as well as buttered and grilled broccoli along with plump mentaiko Japanese scallops. These sticks of delight are undoubtedly the stars of the show at the bar that you simply have to try! Pair with the in-house favourite GudSht Wings for a flaming good time. Available in two flavours, Asian Classic and Shoyu Pepper, these fiery wings are sure to spice up your meal. Other fan favourites include the Fury Fries, Rice Cake Poppers, Yakiniku Beef Cubes as well as the fragrant Garlic Rice. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fury Fries, Rice Cake Poppers, Yakiniku Beef Cubes, Garlic Rice

• ABOUT

    A collaboration with Hong Kong’s Young Master Brewery and Chef Vinny Lauria, The Guild is a restaurant and bar serving contemporary comfort food and a comprehensive drinks selection with old fashioned hospitality and warmth. With a mission to celebrate the craft of small scale producers, the Guild highlights locally sourced ingredients, independent craft beer, all-natural wines, and cocktails based on small-batch spirits. Housed at 55 Keong Saik Road, the setting marries the conviviality of a Victorian public house with homey touches of a Peranakan shophouse. (Aug 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Freshly shucked Oysters, Smoked Mushroom Salad, General Tso’s Frog Legs, “Marrow” Bruschetta, Ham Dan Fried Chicken, BBQ Skate, Signature Mac n’ Cheese

html:
• ABOUT

    Introducing a progressive culinary collaboration with Blu Kouzina, Gully brings a modern twist to global street flavours and cocktails. Tucked along Hong Kong Street, drop by Gully today to curb your travel blues with a hearty serving of the restaurant’s range of platters, dips and meats. Begin your meal with a trio of wholesome Mediterranean inspired dips served alongside a platter of crispy Pita bread. Featuring a juicy portion of Taiwanese fried chicken marinated with Gully’s very own secret spice mix sandwiched between two soft pillowy fried buns, the Taiwanese Chicken Bun with Shallots & Arugula is another petite serving of sliders perfect to kickstart your meal. Don’t leave without trying the Greek Gyro. The restaurant’s very own take on the well-loved classic street food in Greece, this tasty menu option consists of tender yet succulent organic chicken drenched in a generous mix of home-made Tzatziki and sauce and smoked paprika. Made of perfectly striped yellow and green zucchini and crunchy walnuts together with lemon and cumin infused yoghurt sauce, the Zucchini Salad is a popular option among the young and old. Other signature favourites at Gully include the Street Skewers, Gully Burger and Fish Taco. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Greek Gyro, Zucchini Salad, Street Skewers, Gully Burger

html:
• ABOUT

    Stepping into Gunther’s is like entering a different world. It is a world of opulence, yet with a certain earnest simplicity and elegance. The Art Nouveau-inspired decor, with its highly stylised flowing, curvilinear designs of fauna and floral motifs, is stunning but not overwhelming, gorgeous without being showy. While the restaurant boasts furniture pieces from luxury brands, the overall sense one gets is of warmth and welcome. This sense of elegant simplicity is evident in the menu as well. Gunther’s fans will undoubtedly be familiar with signature dishes like the Cold Angel Hair Pasta that has earned the restaurant accolade after accolade since its opening. The Oscietra caviar is delicately scented with truffle, which marries the flavours of the dish together perfectly. The delectably crispy Suckling Pig with Kriek Beer Sauce is yet another favourite. While the dish itself is evocative of wedding dinners, come prepared to be amazed by the range of savoury flavours that is packed into Gunther’s rendition. Other carefully thought-out creations such as the Carpaccio of Wagyu Beef “Tartare” style are also delightful. The meat is served with crispy potato – a beautiful contrast against the marbled Wagyu beef. Likewise, the Floating Island of Champignon de Paris on Consommé of Poultry is a magical concoction with the rich taste of egg yolk and mushrooms in every mouthful. Apart from signature desserts like the delicious Fine Apple Tart “à la dragées” with Havana rum raisin ice cream or the warm soufflé with daily flavours, Gunther’s whimsical dessert creations are worth a try. Choose from 350 labels of wine to end your meal on a high -- it will be a suitably simple and elegant way to toast to an equally exquisite gastronomic experience. (Aug 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The owner-chef worked in some well-known restaurants in his native Belgium before coming to Singapore. He may describe his cooking as “simple, honest and down-to-earth" but typical dishes include angel hair pasta with Oscietra caviar, roast rack of black pig, and a fine apple tart. Many regulars wait until they’ve seen the tray of the day’s special ingredients before ordering, however. The two dining rooms are enlivened by some colourful art.” -MICHELIN Guide Singapore 2016 “Chef-owner Gunther Hubrechsen consistently puts out contemporary, simple yet refined French food.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Angel Hair Pasta, Oscietra Caviar, Beef Carpaccio, Bone Marrow, Braised Pork Cheek Grand-Mère, Charcoal Grilled Wagyu Steak, Roasted Suckling Pig

  • ABOUT

    Bringing the mastery of Sichuan dry pots in Singapore to your table, enjoy the best of Sichuan cuisine in a simmering pot full of flavours at Guo Jiang. Located along Mosque Street, bond with family and friends over traditional steamboat and skewered meats in an urban and chic setting. Take on the heat and challenge yourself with the restaurant’s variety of fiery soup bases. Boasting a huge selection of classic Sichuan skewers, there’s something for everyone at Guo Jiang. Popular steamboat favourites include the Golden Mushroom, Beef Ball, and Fresh Fish Slices. Simply mix and match your choice of fish, meat and vegetables into the pot of boiling broth and dig in! The Stir Fried Potato Slice with Eggplant and Long Beans is a mildly spiced dish perfect for sharing. Other sharing dishes include the Homemade Beef Jerky and Shredded Chicken with Chilli Oil. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Golden Mushroom, Beef Ball, Beef Jerky, Shredded Chicken with Chilli Oil

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the laidback Seletar Hills estate, this casual Italian eatery is the perfect place to kick back on the weekend with friends and family. With someone like decorated chef Peter Neo at the helm, diners can rest assured that they will be served the most authentic Italian classics. Meat lovers are sure to enjoy the Grilled Iberico Pork, served with a generous side of gravy. The juicy cut of pork is grilled to tender perfection and seasoned with herbs to make for the perfect main dish. Drizzle the meat with the accompanying gravy, grab a forkful of vegetables for some crunch, and tuck in. Prefer poultry? The Roasted Chicken With Porcini Sauce comes with hearty sweet potato and is large enough to be shared. The chicken meat is tender and juicy, and the accompanying gravy gives the dish an extra touch of spicy earthiness. For a sweet treat to end the meal, dig in to the Tortino Di Lava. This molten chocolate cake is what dreams are made of. From the rich chocolate that oozes out from the first cut to the velvety soft ice cream it is served with, this dish is a treat -in every sense of the word. (Nov 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Iberico Pork, Gustoso Pizza, Chicken with Porcini Sauce, Tortino Di Lava

  • ABOUT

    Pure creamy and melt-in-your-mouth indulgence. And no, we’re not talking about ice cream here. The Gyu Bar brings in one of the rarest wagyu in town — Wa-OH beef from the Kumamoto prefecture on Kyushu Island. If you’re wondering why this matters, imagine this: the super fresh air and pure, pristine waters make the perfect environment for grazing cows. The meat here is also extra-tender, thanks to a special blend of feed given to the animals. At Gyu Bar, you’ll find some surprising cuts as well as the usual ribeye and sirloin fillets. Try the tomo-sankaku (a cut near the bottom round). A considerably rare cut, the glistening meat is juicy and buttery, served with a crusty sear. A little dab of wasabi helps balance out the fattiness of the meat. There’s also shin-tama, which comes from the knuckle, as well as leaner cuts like short plate. Besides beef, Gyu Bar also offers other meats like pork neck or tontoro. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Karubi, Wagyu Tongue, Sirloin Steak, Pork Neck, Wagyu Tataki

  • THE BUZZ

    “At dinner time, a nice touch is taking your pick of a wall display of cute cups and having it filled with organic sake on the house.” -The Business Times, March 2018.

    We at Gyu-Kaku take pride in bringing you an authentic ‘Yakiniku’ (Japanese BBQ) experience. We serve premium ‘Japanese Wagyu’ and many other quality food items at reasonable prices. Our menus include mouth-watering appetisers, fresh salad, tantalising seafood items, desserts, beverages, and so much more. Come dine at Gyu-Kaku for that exquisite taste of Japan, served to you at your table! (Apr 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Consider Gyu-Kaku a meat-lover’s dream come true. This family-friendly Japanese yakiniku chain is all about the BBQ experience, with good meats and vegetables to match. Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. For meats, the Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. Enjoy your meats bursting with bold flavour? Try the selection of Harami here, where slices of beef are pre-marinated in garlic, shio, or spicy miso for an extra punch. Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour when grilled over charcoal. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. Dip your meats into the tasty choice of accompanying sauces -- a herby garlic butter, a grated radish ponzu, a spicy garlic chilli oil, and even sukiyaki truffle oil with a half-boiled egg. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Tofu with Banbanji Sauce, Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Kurobuta Pork Belly

html:
• ABOUT

    If you love meat, then make Gyu-Kaku a go to this weekend. Prime Japanese wagyu is the star on the menu here, and it’s easy to see why — the meat is tender and bursting with clean, beefy flavours, padded with extra marbling to give it that melt-in-your-mouth feel. Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. Otherwise, skip the preliminaries and make a beeline for the beef. The Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour when simply grilled over charcoal. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. Dip your meats into the tasty selection of accompanying sauces -- a herby garlic butter, a grated radish ponzu, a spicy garlic chilli oil, and even a sukiyaki truffle oil with a half-boiled egg. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Tofu with Banbanji Sauce, Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Kurobuta Pork Belly

html:
• Good For

    City Views, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    No stranger to the Yakiniku game, Gyu-Kaku offers an exciting menu with extensive options for the seasoned Japanese BBQ pros at attractive prices. For the big eaters, go for their buffet menu featuring Japanese and Australian Wagyu meats for maximum meat indulgence. Offering standard portions of chicken, beef, pork, and lamb as well, eat till you drop with their buffet menu that guarantees your bang for buck. Gyu-Kaku's menu includes delicious sides such as their Nama-su, a Japanese salad that is almost like the Chinese cucumber salad. If you decide to order free flow sides, be sure to order these dishes to fully experience their menu. The restaurant also offers Scallops in Butter and Soy Sauce as well as Shrimps in Garlic Butter as seafood options. If you’re looking for just meat, their dinner special offers delicious sets that will satiate your cravings. For beef lovers, go for their Wagyu Dinner Set which offers chunks of thick wagyu cuts from both Japan and Australia. Variety lovers can go for their Kurobuta Dinner Set instead, which offers different cuts of pork to indulge. For those who love Gyu-Kaku but don’t have time for grill, they also offer a lunch special with sets and donburis like the Beef Sukiyaki Teishoku and Oyako Don for a quick afternoon power meal. For noodles, pick up a steamy bowl of Wagyu Udon to keep you warm and energized throughout the day. They also offer BBQ Lunch Sets for those with more time, and with platters like the Meat Lovers Set that has a little bit of everything, you will be able to satisfy your mid day BBQ lust at Gyu-Kaku. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Scallops in Butter and Soy Sauce, Wagyu Dinner Set, Kurobuta Dinner Set, Beef Sukiyaki Teishoku, Oyako Don

html:
• ABOUT

    Gyu-Kaku aims to stand out from the many BBQ restaurants all over Singapore by bringing consumers an authentic Japanese yakiniku experience, and serves a range of premium meats - most notably, Japanese Wagyu - a premium cut of beef that is excellent on barbecues. Barbecue meats are not the only highlight of the menu here, though. Japanese appetisers and snacks are also available for diners who wish to dine on something a little lighter. The Choregi Salad is a mix of greens, cucumber, and mushrooms, and is a perfect accompaniment to the large menu of meat available. The Chicken Caesar Salad is also a must-try. Made with greens, spiced chicken, and cranberries and walnuts for an sweet crunch, this dish is refreshing and the perfect way to start your meal here. The meat selection is one of the widest available islandwide. Along with the aforementioned Japanese Wagyu, there is also Wagyu Kurubi, Kurobuta Pork, and Pork Belly in a variety of seasonings, including miso for an authentic umami taste and chilli oil for an extra kick. There is also a wide seafood selection - with fresh king prawn, scallops and squid available for grilling. Still feeling peckish after your meal? Opt for some ramen - Gomanegi Ramen is a popular choice. Tonkotsu ramen with egg and cha shiu, this dish is perfect to wash down the meat-heavy dishes from the barbecue. (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Beef Stew with Baguette, Choregi Salad, Camembert Cheese Skewers with Honey and Baguette, Australia Wagyu Thick Tongue, Gyu-Kaku Karubi (Tare)

html:
• ABOUT

    If you love meat, then make Gyu-Kaku a go to this weekend. Prime Japanese wagyu is the star on the menu here, and it’s easy to see why — the meat is tender and bursting with flavour, padded with extra marbling to give it that melt-in-your-mouth feel. Start the meal with some edamame and fried gyoza, and order up some asparagus and assorted mushrooms with cheese to add some greens to your meal. For meats, the Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. Fans of thick-cut meats will love the Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, which is juicy and full of flavour -- best enjoyed with a generous squeeze of lemon. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, as well as seafood such as King Prawns, Scallops with Butter and Soy Sauce, or Greenland Halibut. End the meal on a sweet note with Gyu-Kaku’s signature Milk Pudding, or some Matcha and Black Sesame ice cream. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Australian Wagyu Thick Tongue, Scallops with Butter and Soy Sauce, Gyu-Kaku Signature Milk Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    Enjoy grilling meats over burning charcoal, but not a fan of doing the whole set-up yourself? Head to Gyu-Kaku -- a family-friendly Japanese yakiniku chain that’s all about the BBQ experience, with good meats and vegetables to match. Prime Japanese wagyu is the star on the menu here, alongside other premium cuts of meats and an assortment of appetisers and crunchy salads. Start the meal with a light, refreshing dish of Cold Tofu with Banbanji sauce, a spicy sesame dressing that adds a hint of heat to the chilled beancurd. For meats, the Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi is a popular cut, particularly well-marbled and served in slices for simple grilling and enjoyment. There’s also the Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak if you prefer grilling an entire slab of meat on your own, and getting it to the right doneness. Enjoy your meats bursting with bold flavour? Try the selection of Harami here, where slices of beef are pre-marinated in garlic, shio, or spicy miso for an extra punch. Besides beef, Gyu-Kaku also offers a good selection of Kurobuta pork, from the belly cuts to the collar, and the jowl. There’s also a wide variety of seafood, with favourites like the butter scallops and jumbo prawns. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Tofu with Banbanji Sauce, Japanese Wagyu Chuck Karubi, Japanese Wagyu Premium Loin Steak, Harami (Spicy Miso), Kurobuta Pork Belly

html:
• ABOUT

    Two-time awardee of The Michelin Plate Singapore, Kappo Shunsui is a unique Kappo Restaurant that is like no other. Helmed by chef Shimuta “Shim” Kunihiko, the last apprentice of legendary Kyoto chef Hirata Tasaku, experience the incredible culinary showmanship and skills that will engage all five of your senses. With only 13 seats, booking a table here may be difficult, so be sure to book early to avoid disappointment. A fully omakase concept, your meal is entirely in chef Shim’s hands. For those in the mood for a fancy yet relatively easy lunch, go for Kappo Shunsui’s lunch omakase, a lighter version of their regular menu featuring six courses. Feast on a fresh selection of seafood that’s delicately prepared and presented before your very eyes. If you’re there for the whole experience, their 11-course omakase menu has you dining savoury and rich seafood dishes that are ready to blow your minds away. Simple yet elegant, each dish is prepared with the ingredient in mind, and you get to enjoy the taste of each dish in its entirety without too many overpowering elements. If you’re looking for a more luxurious meal, we urge you to go for their 11-course omakase menu. Bringing you rich and exotic dishes like caviar and melt-in-your-mouth bluefin tuna, this menu is for the most refined of taste buds. Feast on gourmet dishes as you enjoy chef Shim’s expert mastery that will enhance the quality of your meal. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lunch Omakase, 11-Course Dinner Omakase

  • ABOUT

    Habits Restaurant & Bar resides along Sembawang Road, making it a great place to dine for those residing in the North. A themed restaurant, the place whips up tasty Western fusion dishes in a cosy and comfortable setting. Start your meal with a sharing plate of Truffle Fries. Garnished with parmesan cheese and parsley, the thick cut fries are crispy and rewards diners with a satisfying crunch. Another sumptuous option would be the “NACHO” Average Chips. Drizzled in homemade salsa, cheddar and mozzarella, this interesting take on your classic bowl of chips is a great start to any meal. For those looking forward to a more filling appetiser, the Beef Sliders or Crab Cakes comes highly recommended. Move on to the mains with a fragrant bowl of Mushroom Risotto. Absolutely delicious, this dish features perfectly diced portobello mushrooms and is finished off with a dash of truffle oil. The Roasted Chicken is another worthy contender that is served with a side of mash, sauteed greens in a rich pan sauce. Made for the seafood lovers, the Seafood Aglio Olio is a fiery dish filled with generous portions of king prawns and scallops. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    “NACHO” Average Chip, Beef Sliders, Mushroom Risotto, Seafood Aglio Olio
