    We’re in a country where food is almost an obsession and new eateries pop up by the dozen, despite a landscape already saturated with restaurants. So when a dining establishment like Hai Tien Lo manages to capture the notoriously short attention spans of gourmands and draws in crowds consistently, you know it’s got to be something special. The dim sum menu features signatures like Steamed Charcoal Barbecue Pork Bun with Black Truffles and Steamed Pork and Prawns Dumplings with Fish Roe, but if baskets of bites don’t strike your fancy, the exquisite mains and sets are well worth a try. Further enhancing the dining experience are Executive Chef Ben’s new culinary creations of Double-boiled Mini Buddha Jumps over the Wall with Morel Mushrooms, Stir-fried Sliced Grouper with Salted Fish and Ginger Spring Onions, Braised Classic Whole Abalone and Beancurd accompanied with Broccoli in Supreme Stock and more. We think Hai Tien Lo – which means ‘stairway to heaven’ – was aptly named, indeed! (May 2019)

• ABOUT

    Singapore may be smoking hot, but there’s nothing like a heartwarming hotpot session to up the ante. At Hai Xian Lao, their exciting soup bases pack a fiery punch that you won’t forget. From the intense Mala broth to familiar flavours like Laksa, Tom Yum, and Chicken Broth, there’s something for everyone. If you ask us though, our top choice will have to be their thick and flavoursome collagen soup. Boiled using the freshest ingredients, the soup base sits patiently on the stove for eight whole hours before being served up as a rich, MSG-free soup. Sink into their plush leather chairs (yes, leather chairs), and you will find yourself spoilt for choice with a wide variety of fresh and quality produce available here. As you feast on your usual steamboat offerings, don’t forget to treat yourself with their premium selection that includes the likes of Kurobuta Pork Belly, US Wagyu Beef Striploin, Lamb Shoulder, and more. For those with a penchant for live seafood, you’ll be delighted to know that Fresh Oysters, Lobsters, Prawns, and Alaskan King Crabs await you! Whether you’re looking for some family fun, or for some comfort food, Hai Xian Lao won’t disappoint with their yummy soup bases, crazy variety of yummy steamboat offerings, live seafood, and quality meats! (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kurobuta Pork Belly, Spanish Pork Collar, Angus 150 Days Grain-fed Beef, Deer, Lamb Shoulder, Fresh Oysters, Fish Skin, Scallops, Sliced Dory

  • ABOUT

    Perched on the third level and boasting a cosy interior, the main draw of this spot is it’s restorative atmosphere, touted as the “best moment of your day.” Named after the birds of tranquility and longevity in Chinese and Greek folklore, the menu here is crafted with a focus on wellness and the healing effect of food. The menu seamlessly weaves in hints of Sichuan flavour into traditional European classics, so don’t expect the usual cafe fare here. An expert team of chefs from China and Singapore work together to create unique dishes that will leave you wanting more. The Cured Sausage Shakshuka is a rich and unique dish that will surprise you with every bite. Spicy sausage chunks cooked with corn, tomato, and mushrooms, this dish is spicy, sweet, and flavourful. Dip the accompanying slices of beetroot toast into the stew for an added burst of flavour. For something a little lighter, opt for the H&C Beef Caesar Salad, a delicious dish of tender braised beef tossed in a mix of greens and eggs. This dish is crisp and soft in equal measure, and for a salad, it’s pretty moreish. The fibre from the vegetables and the richness of the beef make this a good option even if you’re famished. (Oct 2018)

  • ABOUT

    The word ‘halia’ means ginger in Malay. While this is a reference to the world-famous Ginger Garden of the Singapore Botanic Gardens where the restaurant is located, the word itself has long been synonymous with comfort for many -- ginger tea, ginger massages. And if comfort is what you are looking for after a hard day at work or a long afternoon of relentless shopping, The Halia is the ideal place for you to kick back and relax in style. In the historic UNESCO World Heritage Site that is the Singapore Botanic Gardens, The Halia is an inviting space with lush foliage complemented by wood-carved tables and open verandas. This matches the menu well, as modern European cuisine with touches of Asian influences are on offer. Favourites include the Halia Chilli Crab Spaghettini and the Sticky Toffee Pudding with Butterscotch and Vanilla Ice Cream, so be sure to try them. The piquant flavours of the former ensure that you get a taste of one of Singapore’s most beloved dishes, while keeping your hands clean, and the latter is a throwback to a more decadent colonial past. In keeping with the name, ginger is very much on the menu, with the irreplaceable underground root used in main courses, salads and drinks. The health benefits of ginger are multifold, from relieving digestive problems such as nausea to aiding the loss of appetite, motion sickness, and pain. It certainly is comforting to have all these great upsides in mind as you sip a ginger-infused cocktail, take in the luxuriant foliage, and relax in The Halia. (Aug 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “With elegant yet casual surroundings highlighted by trees scattered around the place, it encourages a more communal dining experience with must-tries from small plates…” -Time Out Singapore “Great dining spot for businesses lunches, big gatherings, and even families with little ones.” -Honeycombers “For a charming place for a leisurely meal on a sunny day there are few restaurants better than Halia. With its gorgeous location in the Botanic Gardens, surrounded by greenery on the shaded deck or inside the more climate-controlled restaurant, Halia is the perfect retreat to enjoy good food and good company away from the usual bustle of city life.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Halia Chilli Crab Spaghettini, Sticky Toffee Pudding with Butterscotch and Vanilla Ice Cream, Sous Vide Chicken Leg, Celeriac Lagsana, Ginger Nougat Parfait

    From award-winning Omakase restaurant Takayama, Chef Taro Takayama introduces his new casual concept - Hanare by Takayama, which features signature favourites from his omakase menu. Hanare by Takayama caters to all, be it for business or pleasure, set in a more social and modern setting. • ABOUT

    Couched in the quieter parts of Orchard Road, Hanashizuku Japanese Cuisine serves up authentic Izakaya-style cuisine that won’t break the bank. The best part? Quality and freshness is the name of the game here, with seafood flown in thrice weekly from Japan while their extensive menu is prepared using only the finest ingredients. Paired with an ambience that’s both modern and elegant, Hanashizuku brings you a peerless dining experience. There are familiar eats such as Edamame but tickle your taste buds with their Octopus with Wasabi, Yamaimo Tanzaku (Japanese Yam) or the Buta Kimchi Nabe (Miso-flavoured & Kimchi Pork Clay Pot). We also definitely recommend going for their Carpaccio dishes like the Gyu Tataki Carpaccio (Sliced Row Beef with Garlic Ponzu Sauce). Classic choices such as the Salmon Ikura Don and Mentaiko Pasta are however just as delightful, a testament to the chef’s masterful skills. If you’re looking for some drinks, stop by and choose from an impressive selection of premium alcohol from specially imported Sake to Shochu and Japanese beer. You don’t have to thank us for this hidden gem! (Jul 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “With a slightly more contemporary menu, you’ll find that certain items such as ikura, salmon avocado rolls listed alongside classic sashimi moriawase, deep fried dishes and some excellent salads. What really surprised me about Hanashizuku is that the pricing is actually incredibly affordable considering the posh atmosphere and 5-star service.” -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Ikura Don, Mentaiko Pasta, Buta Kimchi Nabe (Miso-flavoured & Kimchi Pork Clay Pot), Wa Gyutan Shio Kosho Itame (Stir Fried Slice Wagyu Beef Tongue), Scallops Carpaccio with Ponzu Jelly and Truffle Salsa, Saikoro Steak

html:
• ABOUT

    Ever dreamt of being a part of a biking crew but you’re too worried that if you actually learnt to ride a motorcycle, you would quit your job for the thrill of the open road and never turn back? Well dream no more! Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks is here to fulfill your inner biker fantasies! Opened by two fellow bike enthusiasts, Handlebar achieves the atmosphere of a rough-and-ready bikers’ den while serving unpretentious, mouthwatering international and local favourites. One of the favourites on the menu is undoubtedly the Cocaine Wings: smothered in smoky barbecue sauce, and coming in various levels of spiciness, these lip-smackingly delicious chicken wings are highly addictive. The Ayam Panggang dish is an instant mood-lifter. A large piece of chicken is marinated with a cornucopia of traditional spices such as candlenut, ginger, lemongrass, and lime, before being grilled till perfection and served with rice and accompanying vegetables. It’s also a treat to realise that Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks has the traditional Hainanese Pork Chop available on its menu. Popular with the older generation, this dish is making a comeback and it’s not hard to see why - a delicious delicacy, it’s crispy on the outside but stays soft and juicy on the inside. Handlebar @ Gillman Barracks is strong on atmosphere and food, so treat yourselves today! (Mar 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cocaine Wings, Ayam Panggang, Hainanese Pork Chop, Righteous Pork Ribs

html:
• ABOUT

    Looking to be the most authentic traditional Korean barbeque restaurant in Singapore, HANJIP Korean Grill House is one of the biggest Korean barbeque restaurants in Singapore. Well-known for its extensive range of aged Australian Wagyu, USDA Prime Beef, as well as Kurobuta Berkshire Pork, the restaurant offers as many as seven different curated themed private dining rooms to elevate your dining experience. Be prepared for an ultimate grilling experience like no other, with top notch service provided by the attentive wait staff. HANJIP Korean Grill House aims to bring the distinguished taste of Korean barbeque to your tables with its delicious menu offerings. Start your meal with a thick slab of rich Australian Wagyu. Succulent and juicy, the beautiful marbling gives the tender steak a melt-in-your mouth texture that you’ll never forget. Choose to go with a piece of Wagyu Striploin or a Wagyu Brisket for a yummy experience. For those with a lighter palate, meat lovers can also look to satisfy their meat cravings with the Pork Belly, Pork Jowl or Pork Collar options. Complete your meal with a serving of Spicy Chicken Feet for an authentic Korean barbeque experience. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Striploin, Wagyu Brisket, Pork Belly, Spicy Chicken Feet

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hanjip-korean-grill-house
name: HANJIP Korean Grill House

Address: 80 Mohamed Sultan Road#01-04 The Pier at RobertsonSingapore (239013)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the heart of the trendiest entertainment district of Singapore, Hannibal European Grill and Bar is the perfect place for young professionals looking for a casual and laid back evening in town. With a selection of gourmet delights ranging from hamburgers, steaks, and meat skewers to thin-crust pizzas and Italian egg-based pastas, the bar attracts a cosmopolitan crowd of expats, locals, and fashionable night owls. The Cold Cuts Platter is a great way to kickstart your meal. Featuring parma ham, mortadella, salami, mixed vegetables and eggs, this tapas item is a simple, crowd-pleasing spread to share with family and friends. An innovative offering, the Bacon Cheese Rolls are made of crisp fried bacon stuffed with mozzarella and pistachio cream that gives a satisfying crunch when you bite into the rolls of cheesy goodness. Order the Risotto Seafood to savour tasty creamy rice mixed with seafood in a light tomato sauce. Other delectable options include the Beef Lasagna and Spring Chicken. Satisfy your carnivorous cravings with the plethora of charcoal grill options available at Hannibal European Grill and Bar. Take your pick of kebabs, burger, skewers or sausages for a hearty feast. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Cuts Platter, Bacon Cheese Rolls, Risotto Seafood, Beef Lasagna

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hannibal-european-grill-pizza-bar
name: Hannibal, European Grill & Pizza-Bar

html:
• ABOUT

    Hailing from Germany, this popular burger eatery has set up shop at Boat Quay, tantalising famished diners with its amazingly solid burgers, salads, and ice-cold cocktails. At this burger bar, drool-worthy burgers is the name of the game. Depending on your preference, they come plated on sourdough or multigrain buns. Not a fan of bread? Then go for the low-carb “naked” burger where your buns are substituted with lettuce and vegetables. A number of interesting ingredients span the menu so you won’t see a boring run-of-the-mill cheeseburger here. We’re especially fond of the ELSÄSSER Burger, which comes topped with brie and cranberries. Vegetarians and vegans won’t feel left out either, as this burger joint spins up a jaw-droppingly wide array of burgers well suited for every eater. One vegetarian favourite is the WOHLFEIN Burger, comprising a walnut patty, aged cheddar cheese, cranberries, and stuffed with more walnuts. Then wash down your burger bites with a cocktail or two, including the LEICHTSINN cocktail concocted from a intoxicating blend of Baileys, Amaretto, and raspberry. Toss away your stereotypical notions of German food, because HANS IM GLÜCK takes the standard American burger and gives it a finely-crafted German twist. (Aug 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "To ensure consistency and quality, the restaurant brings in its own range of housemade sauces, including vegan mayonnaise and orange mustard, as well as multi-grain and sourdough buns, which come frozen and are made exclusively for the chain, from Germany. For the beef patties, the restaurant opts for fresh Australian minced beef, with a 20 per cent fat-to-meat ratio. Its vegan patties are made with a mixture of corn, spinach, potato and carrots." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hans Im Gluck, Klassik, Birkenwald, Henne, Sommernacht, Wohlfein

html:
• ABOUT

    Stepping into Hans Im Gluck might feel like you’ve been transported into a German fairytale forest. You’ll spot a rustic Bavarian alps cottage at the entrance, whimsical wooden swing sets, and idyllic alpine landscape views from the windows. And if you’ve ever wondered how the Germans cook their burgers, you’ll find out here at Hans Im Gluck. On the menu is an extensive selection of burgers that span beef, chicken, vegetarian and vegan. A popular favourite is the Birkenwald, a combination of mushrooms and sour cream-scallion sauce. The Horntrager is a good way to show off how delicious going vegetarian can be, with a walnut pattie topped with crumbly feta cheese and a sweet fig jam. There’s a choice of sourdough or multigrain for buns, or you could go completely naked — with patties wrapped in lettuce and lots of salads. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hans Im Gluck, Klassik, Birkenwald, Henne, Sommernacht, Wohlfein

Cuisine: Chinese, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, BBQ
html:
• ABOUT

    With origins as a seafood distributor, you can trust that Happy Dining Seafood knows how to do seafood. Chinese seafood, in particular, with dishes that can be traced back to the Dongbei region of Northeast China. An underrated regional cuisine, it can be characterised by its use of pickled cabbage, potatoes, carrots, as well as wheat and corn instead of rice.The folks at this Chinese and seafood restaurant use fresh ingredients each time, offering an array of shellfish, fish, meat and vegetable dishes. Diners choose how they’d like their seafood to be prepared, and which sauce or broth to accompany — whether it’s 'hot & spicy', 13 spices, garlic or black pepper. Great for friends and families to share, the Seafood Platter is a mammoth creation, offering your favourite seafood staples in one set. The Baby Lobster is a juicy bite, while the Sea Bass in Soy Sauce tastes like something closer to home.Meat lovers can enjoy the spoils too, with Smoked Pork and Braised Pork Ear as some of the restaurant’s favourites. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seafood Platter, Sea Bass in Soy Sauce, Baby Lobster, Steamed Fish Head

Address: 26 Sentosa Gateway#01-209-214 The Forum, Sentosa Island Singapore (098138)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Located at Resorts World Sentosa, Hard Rock Cafe boasts a world-famous American menu that offers the best American bites with a mix of regional favourites. For starters, dig into the restaurant’s signature slow roasted wings tossed in classic buffalo or barbeque sauce. Whipped up with carrots, celery, and blue cheese dressing, each mouthful of tender, juicy chicken packs a punch of flavours. For those who love their chips, the Classic Nachos will definitely satisfy your cravings. Layered with ranch style beans and a four cheese sauce blend, dip the crispy tortilla chips into the cheesy mess for a delicious time! Don’t leave without taking a bite out of the burger that started it all. Featuring applewood bacon, cheddar cheese, crispy onion ring, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, the Original Legendary Burger is set to wow you in both size and taste. The Impossible Burger is an equally tasty rendition of the legendary steak burgers which are vegan friendly. 100% plant based, the burger is served with fresh toasted buns and a generous side of fries for an indulgent meal. End off your meal the American meal with a decadent slice of New York Cheesecake. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Classic Nachos, Original Legendary Burger, The Impossible Burger, New York Cheesecake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hard-rock-cafe-sentosa
name: Hard Rock Cafe (Sentosa)

html:
• ABOUT

    This gem of a London export needs no real introduction. The international franchise brings its brand of hard-pumping rock music, hearty food, strong booze, and top-notch entertainment everywhere it goes. This Singapore outpost, established in 1990, has the added advantage of being somewhat of an institution amongst late-night revelers at the lively Cuscaden area, a mix of interesting characters, a diverse mix of folks from die-hard rockers to curious tourists, all seeking the restaurant-bar's hearty food, hard-rocking local bands, and the raunchy humour of its resident standup comics. The memorabilia is what keeps the Hard Rock family united across the world, but put that aside for a second and consider the grub. Think American dive bar with a little upmarket touch: chicken tenders in a smoky glaze of hickory barbecue sauce and honey mustard, buffalo-style wings in a piquant dry rub served with the customary blue cheese and celery, and the franchise's famous fajitas filled with your choice of grilled meat, tangy pico de gallo, and melty cheese. For something heftier, there's also grilled steaks and a selection of meats from the smokehouse, think massive pork ribs and beef brisket in a tangy, hickory-spiked barbecue sauce. Good food, good times, and good music have always been part of the Hard Rock promise, and at this grand old dame of the late-night Orchard scene, the party never stops. (Dec 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Decked out in music memorabilia, this spot is home to the popular bands Enigma and Acoustic Trip. Try the American cuisine, before you dance to Top 40 hits and have a rocking good time. A claim to fame - the legendary Blondie has performed here." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fajitas, Pork Ribs, Beef Brisket, Classic Nachos, Tupelo Chicken Tenders, New York Strip Steak, Original Legendary Burger

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hard-rock-cafe-singapore
name: Hard Rock Cafe Singapore

html:
• ABOUT

    There’s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry’s, the music is always on point and the food’s always comforting. Laksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks — the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. If you’re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Laksa Popcorn Chicken, Otah Toasties, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Curried Lamb Shank, Beef Rendang

name: Harry's (Dempsey Hill)

html:
• ABOUT

    There’s something relaxing about hanging out in a bar, listening to the soulful voice of a singer on stage washing your workday blues away. At Harry’s, the music is always on point and the food’s always comforting. Laksa Popcorn Chicken, for instance, will win the hearts of all fried chicken fans. The crispy golden-brown nuggets of fried chicken are accompanied by a slightly spicy, piquant laksa mayonnaise that is so tasty, you might be forgiven for double-dipping. Keeping to the local trend, the Otah Toasties are also perfect beer snacks — the spicy fish paste is fragrant and generous, sandwiched between generously buttered slices of grilled toast. If you’re looking for a proper dinner, the Beer Battered Fish & Chips is a classic. Served with mushy peas and spiced fries, the chunky fillets of white fish are dipped in a light beer batter and fried to perfection. Also good is the Curried Lamb Shank or tender Beef Rendang, served with fragrant basmati rice. Wash it down with a pint of icy cold beer or a glass of wine. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Laksa Popcorn Chicken, Otah Toasties, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Curried Lamb Shank, Beef Rendang

html:
• ABOUT

    Hathaway in old English means someone who lives by a path across a heath, which in some way describes its location at Dempsey. Like the name, its menu seeks to capture the context of its time and place through the lens of modern Asian cuisine.Hathaway is influenced by the people and cultures of Asia. This is why they have decided not to serve pork or alcohol so as to try to be inclusive to our local communities, including the Malay community from which they draw inspiration from.For a full experience, the tasting menus for lunch and dinner will give you a thoughtful and cohesive flavour journey through the crossroads of Asia. It starts with their signature chee cheong fun paired with razor clams submerged in a miso kombu broth reduced down with sablefish bones. The meal climaxes with their signature ah nya's fish curry made with a heirloom recipe comprising magical proportions of galangal, candlenuts, and turmeric. The coda of seri muka paired with apom berkuah ice cream and pengat sauce will surely leave you feeling satisfied and thinking about your next visit.The ala-carte menu allows for choice and contains signatures like their Octopus Bakar & Sambal Udang as well as brunch favorites like the Pengat Pisang French Toast. Don't miss out on their non-alcoholic drinks like their house fermented Lychee Ginger Ale and White Muscato Kombucha which are a progressive and delicious take on no-low alcoholic drinks. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pengat Pisang French Toast, Hathaway’s Big Breakfast, Octopus Bakar & Sambal Udang, Ode to Plum Powder

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hathaway
name: Hathaway

html:
• ABOUT

    Located just a short walk from Bendemeer MRT station, they’ve already gained a loyal following within weeks of opening, and it’s easy to see why. Diners can sit back, relax, and unwind at this breezy bistro on Jalan Besar. Touting itself as an oasis for stressed city-folk, Haven Bistro serves up exciting Euro-Asian fusion fare at affordable prices. Forget overpriced eggs benedict and smoothies. Haven Bistro is redefining what it means to “brunch”, one plate at a time. The Haven’s Club is a signature sandwich and a must-try for first time visitors. Made with a slab of grilled chicken, tomato, lettuce, cheese, and egg, this dish is generously portioned and loaded with healthy ingredients, so it’s perfect even for guests who are watching their waistlines. The adorably named Crabby Wabby is another great option for when a sandwich won’t cut it. Made with perfectly al dente spaghetti and soft-shell crab, the flavours of the ingredients meld perfectly together. Craving something classic? The Piquant Fisc is right up your alley. Made with steamed rice and sambal fish, it’ll make you reminiscent of the simple times. The humble combination of fiery sambal and rice is an ode to the flavours of Singaporean cuisine. (April 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Piquant Fisc, Crabby Wabby, Haven’s Club, Pinky Salmon, Her-Bi-Game

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/haven-bistro
name: Haven Bistro

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Heart of Darkness is all about duality. Good and evil. Sane and insane. It is about big, bold, crafted brews that will challenge the way you think about beer; thirst-quenching session beers that will have you bouncing off the walls and hop bombs that will give you a kick-to-the-teeth, while still being balanced and delicious. Whatever your taste, we’ve got it. Our taproom is a communal eating and drinking experience, built around a vibrant, passion-filled menu and our tasty brews. We’ll have 20 taps on-site with 10 tried-and-true flagships, and 10 rotator taps - there will always be something new to tickle your taste buds. We put a whole lot of love into every brew, and our relentless pursuit of quality means that we use only the finest ingredients from around the globe. We are prolific brewers - having brewed over 220 different styles of craft beer since we opened in October 2016. A hoppy twist to a porter? Easy. A 10% ABV, 70 IBU Pilsner?! True story. A 123 IBU Indian Pale Ale? Definitely! Each and every beer is brewed to the same amazing standard of quality. Every. Single. Time. It’s our brewers’ mastery of balancing hops, malts, and yeasts that ensures quality and consistency. Here at Heart of Darkness, we’re all about the good life... Great food, even better beers and amazing service. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Crispy Cauliflower, Thai Crispy Chicken Skin, Trio Sausage, Yakitori Combo, Classic Top Shell, Vietnamese Grill Scallop

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/heart-of-darkness
name: Heart of Darkness

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Singapore’s leading nightlife establishment, Zouk Group, announces its latest venue, Sushi Ichizuke and Here Kitty Kitty Vice Den. The first of its kind in Singapore, the Japanese inspired, dual-concept offers a place for discerning guests to experience new level of hospitality and luxury. Located in Clarke Quay, Sushi Ichizuke and Here Kitty Kitty Vice Den will offer two distinct experiences highlighting the very best of Japanese cuisine and culture with an Omakase Sushi-ya and a cocktail driven bar concept. With travel off the cards for the foreseeable future, Zouk’s latest venture provides an element of escapism to the former glory days of Tokyo and the hospitality of the Oiran, a category of the high ranking courtesan in Japanese history. The sophisticated décor incorporates bold and creative elements, providing an immersive experience that boast an intimate and modern yet traditional feel. “During these uncertain times, we continually strive to provide our guests with refreshed and unique experiences, and look forward to providing an exceptional, one of a kind affair in Singapore with the launch of our latest concept,” said Andrew Li, CEO of Zouk Group. A throwback to the Golden Gai of the early 1900s 1950s, the ultra-luxurious nightlife experience at Here Kitty Kitty Vice Den is a contrast to its influence of the small alleys and interconnecting passageways of Shinjuku’s red-light district. The cocktail-driven space will houses three concept rooms, including the Cathouse, Mamasan Lounge and the Shibari Room, as well as a distinctive main bar lead by Head bartender Alistair Tan that offers guests a front-row seat to the action. With a menu featuring premium cocktails and a selection of Japanese inspired bites, the interior reflects a high-end Japanese experience, boasting different areas, each with a story and style to share. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Here Kitty Kitty Signature Maki, Wagyu Sando, Wagyu Aburi Sushi, Negitoro Tataki, Haku-hai, Watermelon Sugar, Here Kitty Kitty Martini

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/here-kitty-kitty

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Set in bustling Orchard Road lies a gem in Hibachi. Simple and minimalistic, Hibachi exudes Japanese modernity and charm. Serving a hybrid between Kappo and Izakaya food, fresh ingredients find justice over the warm chargrill fire. They are simply grilled over applewood dusted binchotan, leaving the meats and seafood with a smoky finish and boasting an undeniable umami flavour. Whet your appetite with meticulously prepared otoshi food and sides, and drink to your hearts content with a range of delectable wines and spirits. Hibachi also serves a hearty omakase featuring the exclusive Yukimuro Beef (Snow-Aged Beef) from Niigata, which is the restaurant's crown jewel. The cherry on top? Artfully curated Omakase desserts with a touch of French flair. Très chic.Dewa, Itadakimasu! (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Omakase, Braised Kurobuta Pork Belly, Grilled Niigata Snow-Aged Wagyu

    Dedicated to bringing you the finest ingredients directly from Japan, our company prides itself in our team’s ability to mark your dining experience with great flavours and presentation. We curate our menus to emulate classic yet contemporary dishes, expertly paired with an extensive beverage menu. Our singular aim is to create an immersive dining experience by stimulating the senses of our diners through taste, smells, colours and textures of the dishes in a comfortable environment. Have it your way at Hide. From customer favorite Whole Chicken Stuffed with Soy Truffle Butter Rice to Japanese A5 Wagyu Steaks, choose between our Teppanyaki and general dining experiences. We even have bento sets for the picnic crowd. (Oct 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away on Jalan Pemimpin lies The Hideout at District 20, a secluded bistro where you’re invited to let your hair down and put your feet up while relaxing over a pint of ice-cold beer or a plate of nosh. Decked out in leather sofas and a towering wall of liquor, this eatery has successfully created an environment that feels more like a good friend’s hangout nook. This is especially true on nights where the live music is played or English football is televised on the large screens, drawing a buzzy crowd of people who are just one conversation away from becoming your new friends. Then tuck into the restaurant’s extensive menu which spans a collection of burgers, bar bites, grilled meats, pasta, and even Japanese bento boxes. Some of the well-loved dishes (and deservedly so!) include the Warm Seafood Salad where scallops, shrimp, squid, and crab meat are served alongside warm garlic bread. The Sausage Sampler is sure to become your next favourite thing, with an expansive variety of meats that include chicken mushroom sausage, pork chorizo, veal bratwurst, among others. Featuring an intoxicating blend of cold brews, good nosh, and a lively crowd, The Hideout at District 20 is one of our favourite Marymount-based hangouts that injects a dose of much-needed fun into the neighbourhood. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

html:
• ABOUT

    With authentic royal Indian and Nepalese cuisines to satisfy discerning palates, Himalaya Kitchen is where lovers of Himalayan cuisine unite. Kickstart the meal with a piping hot bowl of comforting Tomato Soup before moving on to yummy starter dishes such as the Chicken Momo, Bhindi Fried and Chicken Pangra. Vegetarians are afforded a plethora of deliciously green menu options here as well. Crowd favourites would include the Vegetable Momo and Vegetable Spring Roll. Marinated in Nepali spices, the minced vegetables are delicately wrapped and steamed to bring out the exotic flavours of the royal Indian and Nepalese food. Another equally mouthwatering dish bathed in fiery spices would be the Choyala. Perfect for meat lovers, this plate full of diced roasted chicken cubes is a must-try menu item not to be missed out on! For those looking to savour an aromatic pot of classic curry, the Prawn Curry and Fish Curry are flavourful broths you can opt for to spice things up! (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Momo, Bhindi Fried, Choyala, Fish Curry

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/himalaya-kitchen
name: Himalaya Kitchen

    Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Private Functions

  • ABOUT

    Located in the old Lavender neighborhood, this hidden gem combines both retro charm and tasteful Japanese interiors for a wonderful night out, filled with good food and good drink. Bathed in glowy warm Japanese lights, Hinode Izakaya and Bar is the perfect place for a boisterous date or get-togethers. With a wide selection of alcohol from beers to hard liquor, Hinode is here to bring you on a gastronomical trip like no other. Choose from side dishes like their crispy Puffer Fish Skin or silky Pitan Tofu, or slurp down some fresh Oysters that leaves you craving for more. Serving seafood that’s deliciously ocean-fresh, indulges yourselves and feast on thick slices of sashimi to satisfy your cravings. For the best of everything, go for the 7-Kind Luxury Assorted Sashimi to truly experience a feast fit for a king which includes creamy Uni and melt-in-your-mouth Fatty Tuna Belly. If you fancy a bit of carb to go with, their Hinode Zeitaku Sushi comes with an assortment of premium seafood on sushi rice and wrapped with seaweed, so diners can go crazy on the raw seafood front here. For MakiMono, fan favourites are their Aburi Spicy Salmon Maki that comes with a smoky charred flavour that’s dangerously addictive, and their Dragon Maki Roll which features fried prawn and avocado rolled in their special sauce. If you’re looking for sides to share, go for an assortment of their Kushi Yakis, and nibble on delicious skewers like their Beef Cheese, Chicken Liver and Tiger Prawns - just to name a few. For mains, Hinode has a generous selection of dons and noodles to choose from. For first-time diners, we recommend their signature Garlic Fried Rice or their Gosai Don that comes with torched salmon, smoked duck, and eel that’s incredibly satiating and guaranteed to leave you with a lasting impression. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Puffer Fish Skin, Pitan Tofu, Hinode Zeitaku Sushi, Aburi Spicy Salmon Maki, Gosai Don

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hinode-izakaya-bar

  • ABOUT

    The Hinode Sake Bar and Grill is located in the heart of Chinatown and is the perfect spot to let your hair down and enjoy some drinks with friends or to soak in the bustling atmosphere with family and good food. Serving beer on tap and deliciously good food, Hinode’s menu is full of grilled delights. For appetisers, go for their smoky Tuna Tataki to share or have their grilled Ehire - the stingray fin is perfectly grilled to perfection, bringing out its sweet flavour. If you're into fried food, try their Hotate Tempura for sweet scallops fried in a flaky tempura batter. This delight is a crowd favourite and pairs amazing with a cool pint of beer. For a meatier option, opt for their Age Gyoza or crispy Tori Karaage that’s amazing for sharing too. Hinode also has a wide yakitori selection to share as well, and the must trys are their Bonjiri (chicken tail) and Buta Bara (pork belly) skewers coated with their house specialty sauce. With premium grilled meats, A4 Wagyu Steaks are seared to your desired doneness and served with an incredible house sauce to make the most of this premium cut. They also serve Lamb Racks that will melt in your mouth and leave you wanting more with each bite. For mains, go for their comforting Tonkatsu Ramen that is full of hearty and savoury goodness and great for chilly days. Or opt for their Hinode GyuDon for a beefy and satiating meal that’s saucy and delicious. Serving immaculate food, alcohol, and good vibes, don’t miss out on the perfect evening experience at Hinode Sake Bar and Grill. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tuna Tataki, Ehire, Hotate Tempura, Tonkatsu Ramen, Hinode Gyudon

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/hinode-sake-bar-grill

html:
• ABOUT

    Marbled slabs of pork belly or premium beef cuts are usually the meats of choice at most Japanese BBQ restaurants. But over at The Hitsuji Club, it's all about lamb in varying cuts. This intimate 20-seater specialises in jingisukan, a popular Hokkaido dish where mutton is grilled over a skillet. The chef’s insistence to use only grain-fed, chilled baby lamb from Australia or New Zealand means you don’t get the gamey smell so often associated with this meat. Instead, the grilled lamb chops are juicy and tender, with a clean, milky taste. Try the specialty Jingisukan With Lamb Chop set, which comes with different cuts such as the fillet, loin, and chops. Grilled together with plump mushrooms and fresh vegetables for an added crunch, the set can be considered a delicious and satisfying meal on its own. If you’re still feeling a tad peckish, add on some cheese miso and lotus root chips for nibbles. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Baby Lamb Chops, Lamb Fillet, Lamb Loin, Cheese Miso, Assorted Vegetables

    Whether you’re scouting out somewhere sweet to dine on the weekend, looking to book the best birthday party ever for a caddy kid, or locking down an adorable date spot for your par-crossed lover, Holey Moley is the destination for you. Pull up a seat and settle in at our fully-equipped cocktail bar. We will take care of you, with a wild range of crazy cocktails, beers on tap and fine wines. Worked up an appetite? With our American themed menu, our range of delicious burgers, hotdogs and more will take care of all your needs.  (Aug 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    There’s an exquisite simplicity to the menu here, but be warned: if you cannot eat crab, just go somewhere else. Basically, you order a crab done in one of their six styles, and have them with some carbs. The carbs are amazing though: think heavenly, lard-and-seafood kissed, wok-breath infused Hokkien Mee, a fine Bee Hoon steeped in a rich clam broth, or the HolyCrab Fried Rice stirred up with flecks of crab meat. But all this is only accessory to the real deal: massive crabs cooked in rich sauces. The signature item is the Holy Crab, an angelic vision featuring a Crab cooked in a rich crab broth, with lots of vermicelli to soak up the goodness. Then there’s the Orgasmic Crab, with a little sin injected by way of a salted egg & curry leaf gravy that is the perfect foil for sweet bouncy crabmeat. For something with more unusual twist, there’s the Balsamic Crab, with the meaty crustaceans bathed in a pungent, sweet, and acidic sauce made with balsamic vinegar, fresh herbs, and spices. Then there’s the house version of Singapore’s national dish: Singapore Chili Crab, and there are five levels of spiciness you can choose from, one for each decade of our independence. If you’re feeling a little crabbed out, throw in some decorative Seasonal Vegetables, or better yet, carb out some more with an order of fried Mantou buns to soak up all that sauce with. Don’t tell your cardiologist. (Jun 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hokkien Mee, Succumb Clam Bee Hoon Noodle, Succumb Crab, Balsamic Crab, Devil's Crab

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/holy-crab
name: HolyCrab

html:
• ABOUT

    From its humble beginnings at Yio Chu Kang in 2008 to its present day expansion to Joo Chiat, Home of Seafood has been winning numerous awards for their aromatic seafood. Recipients of "Singapore's Favourite Food" in 2013, and also voted the "Best Pepper Crab in Singapore", it's clear that diners love the restaurant's ability to serve that perfect pincer. One taste of their famous signature Black Pepper Crab and you'll be in love too! Their use of a milder pepper gives just enough heat to allow the sweetness of the ocean-fresh Sri Lankan crab to really come through, and often means you'll be down two claws before you've even realised how much you've eaten! These capable culinary captains of crustaceans are capable of more than just that though. At Home of Seafood, you have the option of having your crab steamed, buttered, chilled, cocktail-ed, claypot-ted, or spiced up with chilli. Our personal favourite of the lot? The Salted Egg Crab. Salty, sweet, savoury, and velvety smooth, their version of this increasingly popular dish has us wondering if the days of Chili Crab as the ambassador of Singaporean cuisine might indeed be limited. So whether you vote chili, pepper, or salted egg, rest assured that you've got a home away from home nestled in the increasingly hip neighbourhood of Joo Chiat. (Oct 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The restaurant's speciality is Black Pepper Crab, and it is well worth whatever the seasonal price may be at the time. The black pepper sauce is not the vague, gritty stuff you get in so many other versions of this dish. This one has sauce specially created by their chef to be viscous, hot and amazingly smooth." -SoShiok "Home of Seafood's (crab bee hoon) manages to strike a great balance: its soup's fragrance and milkiness help to accentuate the natural sweetness of their Sri Lankan crabs without overwhelming it. Weighing a minimum of 1 kg each, their succulent crustaceans are also the sweetest we've tried." -Epicure Magazine

  • ABOUT

    A lifestyle venue for locals to relax, unwind and connect, Honcho aspires to be a premier destination that brings in or collaborates with fellow talented Singaporeans in the fields of food, culture and music. Brightly lit by white LED lights in the day, Honcho’s welcoming entrance way transforms into a dimly lit space surrounded by neon coloured LEDs at night that invites diners in for a wine and dine experience they will not forget. With a fresh and bold take on authentic flavours, the ground floor of Honcho takes on a fun and funky style as reflected by their modern day monochrome chic decor. Expect fancy Japanese Western Fusion Cuisine that features modern Japanese vegan fare alongside light drinks and cocktails. Coffee and tea selections are also available on the menu. At night, diners can look forward to Modern Japanese Izakaya and Omakase being served in the same space. Vibe to modern hip hop, pop and future beats as you sip on whisky and crafted sake. For an elevated dining experience, we suggest going with the Omakase cocktail shot pairing for a true taste of Japan. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Honcho Wagyu Brioche Toast, Kaeru Shiso Pesto, Awabi Zosui Risotto, Ricepops Tofu, Toyosu Platter

    Inspired by the classical story of a virtuous scholar and his wife, Honguo hopes to translate the warmth and comforting moments of the story into piping hot bowls of soup for diners. Visit Honguo during weekdays and be rewarded with a weekday special set meal. Consisting of a main and a side dish, this deal will definitely afford you with more bang for your buck. Go for the XO Seafood Fried Noodles. Lightly fried, this deliciously sinful dish is an indulgence not to be missed. The Pork Ribs Yunnan Noodles Soup is a healthier dish that includes sweet corn, leafy vegetables and braised pieces of pork ribs. Also available with beef, these noodle options are delicious and nourishing. The star of the show is none other than the Cross Bridge Vermicelli. Double boiled for hours with selected duck, chicken and pork parts, the broth is extremely flavourful. Tuck in while it’s boiling hot to enjoy! (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    XO Seafood Fried Noodles, Pork Ribs Yunnan Noodles Soup, Cross Bridge Vermicelli, Pork Dumplings with Chilli Sauce

  • ABOUT

    The Capitol Arcade location is perhaps Hopscotch’s most iconic home so far. Located right outside the historic Capitol Theatre, Hopscotch once again finds itself close to the arts – a place with almost a century worth. After its revamp in 2015, the immediate area surrounding Capitol Theatre was transformed into the picturesque sunlit atrium where Hopscotch (Capitol) nests at today, “Arcade @ The Capitol Kempinski”.The fully air-conditioned atrium exudes old world charm reminiscent of Colonial era streets with modern expression, a fascinating amalgamation of the old and new. Being located at City hall also offers much accessibility, a convenience that our original 28 Maxwell location once had. To us, this is the perfect space for merry men, lively crowds, and vibrant atmosphere, the perfect place to host guests. (Mar 2021)

• ABOUT

    Gillman Barracks is already famed in the local art scene for its unique collection of restaurants, art galleries, and bars. Hopscotch adds to the mix by offering a selection of unique cocktails and libations for adventurous barflies. You can easily spot the bar due to its unique red brick exterior, decorative gears, and exposed piping on the outer walls. The highlight of the menu would has to be the bespoke cocktails. Crafted with a local palate in mind, many of the drinks combine familiar flavours with exquisite liqueurs to create unique concoctions. The White Sands cocktail, for example, will have you longing for warm beach days. Served in a seashell and made with a heady mix of Kwai Feh lychee liqueur, Nigori Sake, and a coconut sorbet for some extra sweetness, this is the perfect pick-me-up drink for those sweltering days you’d rather be by the sea. Pace yourself with the alcohol by indulging in some bar bites, like the Hyogo Oysters. Reasonably priced and specially flown in from the Hyogo Prefecture in Japan, these plump little gems provide a briny flavour tempered by dashi to cleanse the palate and prepare it for more flavours. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hyogo Oysters, White Sands, Skewers, Ice Man, Sinseh’s Mulled Wine

  • THE BUZZ

    "We’re pretty sure you can expect the same ol’ creative, locally-themed cocktails that will make you go: “Wow, how did they even think of that?!” - SG Magazine "Don’t just take my word for it, head on down before everyone else hops on the bandwagon." - Seth Lui

• ABOUT

    This chill joint is serving delicious comfort food for the soul. With indoor and alfresco dining available, Hot Kitchen by Gastrolicious is the perfect place for friends and family. For appetisers to share, go for their Salted Egg Deep Fried Button Mushrooms. Crispy light batter and coated in a thick, savoury salted egg sauce, these mushrooms are all the rage at Hot Kitchen and for good reason. Dangerously addictive, this appetiser will leave you wanting for more with each bite. For battered options, go for their Seafood Platter that consists of seafood calamari, prawns and fish. All coated in a light batter, this platter is great for sharing with a pint of beer or house cocktail for maximum indulgence. Hot favourites here are their pull-off-the-bone tender Baby Back Ribs that’s marinated in a finger lickin’ good house sauce and Braised Beef Cheeks that are painstakingly braised to tender perfection. For more carby options, go for their hand-stretched pizzas that are full of cheesy goodness. You will never go wrong with their Pepperoni Pizza. Or for a slurpalicious good time, go for their Tom Yum Seafood Pasta that brings a hint of spice mixed with fresh seafood. Pair your mains with a fun and colorful house cocktail to complete your meal and experience at Hot Kitchen. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Egg Deep Fried Button Mushrooms, Seafood Platter, Baby Back Ribs, Pepperoni Pizza, Tom Yum Seafood Pasta

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/the-hot-kitchen-by-gastrolicious

html:
• ABOUT

    Quiet Tanglin Mall is a treasure trove of undiscovered F&B gems, and the achingly pretty House of AnLi is probably the shiniest one. An extension of a chi-chi furniture store, the interiors here are, needless to say, well-considered. Handsome wooden touches offset a gorgeous black-and-white theme, with quirky decorations adding some humour to the space. Add some coffee and gorgeous Belgian-inspired plates, and it feels like you’ve walked into the pages of Kinfolk. Whether it’s the baked goods at the counter, a fragrant Mariage Frères tea, or punchy Allpress Coffee, this is the hottest spot for a premium afternoon. There’s also heartier bites like open-faced sandwiches topped with farm-fresh produce: beautiful eggs, vegetables, and meats elegantly arrayed on artisanal bread and drizzled with light dressing. Tuck into Maria’s Moussaka, a cheesy, eggplant-based Belgian “lasagna” filled with minced beef and a light bechamel sauce, or the house Carbonnades, a ragout of beef cheek, yellow spud potatoes, tender baby carrots, and a malty Trappiste beer sauce. Chase all of that with an intense chocolate tart, some coffee, and a spot of furniture shopping, some of life’s great pleasures all rolled into one, perfect location. (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    AnLi Eggs Benedict with Truffle & Mushrooms, Bouchot Muscles, AnLi's Caesars Salad, Sole Meuniére, Lavender Infused Flan Caramel, Mimi's Waffle

html:
• ABOUT

    Swing by the House of Kebab to grab a quick yet mouthwatering shawarma sandwich made from an assortment of freshly roasted meat. Located along Arab street, the restaurant serves up authentic Middle Eastern cuisine that’s delicious and affordable. Start off light with the Tabbouleh. A cold appetizer made of chopped parsley, freshly cut tomatoes and garnished with onions, mint and bulgur, this traditional salad is a nutritious way to kickstart your meal. For those who prefer a salad with fewer greens, the Tzatziki is a refreshing salad made with diced cucumbers and strained yoghurt. Tossed in a blend of garlic, salt, olive oil and lemon juice for extra zest, order one before diving into the steamy main courses. Served fresh from the grill, the Mix Grill is a combination platter that features different cuts of meat — perfect for large gatherings. Other signature meat menu options include the Signature Lamb Chop, Shish Kebab and Chicken Kabsa. Sandwiches and wraps are also available here at the House of Kebab. Pair with the Signature Drink Lemonade with Mint for a great meal. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tabbouleh, Tzatziki, Mix Grill, Signature Lamb Chop

  • ABOUT

    Offering a wide array of exquisite and mouth watering dishes, House of Seafood is a family oriented restaurant serving an extensive range of fresh and savoury seafood dishes. Best known for their award-winning Chilli Crab, dig into a wonderful myriad of savoury and sweet flavours accompanied with a lovely side of crispy and fluffy mantou buns. Another one of the restaurant’s signature dishes, the Wok-Fried Cereal Prawn is a plateful of huge prawns deep fried with oats for a crunchy and savoury taste. Fried over high heat, fresh and juicy clams are coated in a fiery layer of sambal sauce, resulting in the well-loved Stir Fried Lala with Sliced Chilli dish. Other side dishes that taste equally delicious include the Steamed Scotland Bamboo Clams with Minced Garlic. Sprinkled atop the steamed clams, the chopped garlic enhances the flavour and fragrance of this dish, making it a huge hit among both the young and old. The star of the show at House of Seafood is definitely the stunning Seafood Tower. Consisting seven layers of seafood, indulge in your favourite seafood with a steaming pot of highly addictive broth. (Nov 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Mention 180 Yio Chu Kang and your thoughts might jump to House of Seafood. Started in 2008, this restaurant has garnered plenty of fans willing to queue for their fresh seafood and mouth-watering crab dishes, and has now found a spot at The Punggol Settlement.It’d be best to go in a group because you won’t want to order just two dishes off the menu. Pan Fried Chicken Cutlet with Special Sauce, Steamed Marble Goby with Soya Sauce, and Sautéed Fresh Hokkaido Scallops with Broccoli are some of the a la carte options you can have, but save some stomach space for their signature crabs. There’re the ever popular options of chilli and black pepper, but for something a little richer, House of Seafood’s salted egg and creamy butter versions are deliciously sinful. What was once at Yio Chu Kang is now at Punggol and the lines are still as long as ever. Who says there aren’t any restaurants in the North worth traveling for? (Dec 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Pepper Crab, Salted Egg Crab, Pan Fried Chicken Cutlet with Special Sauce, Fried White Bee Hoon with XO Sauce

• PRESS RELEASE

    Introducing HOUSE OF WÈI, a brand new modern Chinese restaurant that has arrived at Fairmont Singapore, heralding a new chapter for the former Szechuan Court. Inspired by Master Chinese Chef Mok Wan Lok’s 42-year culinary journey spanning across some of the greatest culinary capitals in the world including his home country in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Kuala Lumpur, Dubai and Singapore; the new concept presents impressively executed Chinese culinary creations that are reinterpreted through contemporary and time-honoured Chinese cooking techniques to indulge modern palates of today. Diners will have their palates delighted in refreshed ways that marry different cultures, flavours and tastes; and with unique creations that showcase the best seasonal and homegrown produce, from locally sourced live seafood to vegetables lovingly cultivated at the Hotel’s onsite aquaponics farm. The best way to House of Wei will be via the lifts and escalators from Raffles City Shopping centre and not via the Fairmont Singapore Lifts as it is not operational. (Dec 2021)

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Remember the last time you had a hard time deciding whether to have a sweet dessert after a full meal course? Or the common concept that desserts are usually cold, sweet-tasting and “jelak” (sick of eating due to overwhelming sweetness)? At House on the Moon, we want to show that dessert is not necessarily the last course of a meal. We aspire to demonstrate that a multi-courses meal can be curated using ingredients and techniques often associated only with desserts. Our creations are not confined to notions of “sweet” or “savoury”, “warm” or “cold” dishes; but rather to engage the full palate of tastes and a sensorial dining experience. In the recent years, the blending and blurring of boundaries between sweet and savoury flavours has been increasing in popularity especially in the fine dining arena. The snack industry, in fact, has been leading this trend for some time now, introducing unique flavours of snacks like dessert-inspired potato chips and salted egg yolk ice-creams. Locally, the concept Is not foreign at all. Our beloved rojak, for example, blends fruits and sugar with spices and salted prawn paste. House On The Moon is helmed by owner-chef Hüseyin Turan. A German of Turkish descent, chef Hüseyin worked under culinary greats such as multi-Michelin starred chef Juan Amador, chef Paco Torreblanca (one of the world’s most innovative pastry master) and the traditionist chef Musa Dagdeviren. Over the years, chef Hüseyin learned and sharpened his culinary vision in Restaurant Bal D’onsera (Zaragosa, Spain), Café de Paris (Malaga, Spain), Restaurant Amador (Frankurt and Mannheim, Germany), Ciya Sofrasy (Instanbul, Turkey), Zuma (Istanbul, Turkey) and Zuma’s ROKA Oblix (London, UK). With chef Hüseyin’s culinary creativity, one cannot simply put a definitive label to his dishes; his desserts are not plainly desserts in the traditional sense, but neither are his mains considered savoury. The flavour profiles of his dishes just do not conform to the norm. Ingenuity or strange, one cannot deny the brilliance of his vision and immense talent. House On The Moon was initially launched as a dessert bar, but due to the pandemic which hit immediately after it opened in February 2020, chef Hüseyin introduced a collection of pastas and savoury dishes to respond to the exigence of the market. From the 7th January 2021, House On The Moon returns to the eponymous dessert dinning & bar vision to push the envelope of gastronomy and give diners a new perspective on desserts. The savoury a la carte menu will no longer be available; in its place are two “Haute.Dessert.Dining” sets – The Eclipse, comprising of 5 courses, and the Full Moon, comprising of 7 courses – featuring House On The Moon’s conceptual creations that promise to delight and surprise. Highlights of both the Eclipse and Full Moon menus include the Cauliflower Couscous, and the Spiced Semolina Dumpling, and the featured dessert by chef Hüseyin. The ingenuous Cauliflower Couscous dish elevates and venerates the humble cauliflower, first having the vegetable cleverly presented as a couscous, followed by a brilliant, jellified cream of cauliflower, with a dash of parsley oil and topped with tangerine sorbet and a sourdough cracker. Diners who want some protein with a more savoury touch may add S$9.00 for a scallop, which replaces the tangerine sorbet, and comes with a generous sprinkling of parsley sauce and tangerine gel for a hint of acidity and sweetness. Another culinary triumph is the hearty and flavourful Spiced Semolina Dumpling. Made with semolina and flavoured with ras-el hanout, a warm, earthy middle eastern mix of cinnamon, cumin, coriander, allspice, black pepper, and ginger. It is served with mango and passionfruit, with touches of coconut cream. Diners also has the option of adding beef cheeks to the dish, by topping up S$10.00, for a more savoury version of the dish. The meal is excellently finished with a Blue Moon dessert, exceptionally conceived by chef Hüseyin. The dish, comprising of carrots, sour cream, and coriander, forms a mildly sweet, slightly acidic dessert that is completely unexpected and redefines what a dessert should be. Regulars who have an impartiality towards House On The Moon’s signature desserts may opt to replace the Blue Moon dessert with a selection of iconic dishes from the dessert a la carte menu. “As diners become savvier to complex flavours and more receptive to the mixing of sweet and savoury, they are more adventurous towards crossover dishes like these,” says chef Hüseyin. “It will absolutely create a coup d’etat in the culinary scene but changes to dining perceptions are inevitable and inadvertent as consumers' taste buds evolve and cultures mix.” (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Scallop Chilli Crab Sauce, Truffle Takoyaki, Moon Walk, Kalea65, Black Forest

    HQ Italia Bistro & Bar is a modern contemporary bistro, restaurant and bar situated on the rooftop of Oxley Bizhub 2 in the East Side of Singapore. Offering patrons both dimly lit, romantic indoor vibes as well as charming poolside alfresco seating, HQ Italia Bistro & Bar is known for its stellar Italian cuisine options and has become a fancied Friday evening hangout for couples and friends looking for good, memorable times. Beyond the main restaurant and bar space, patrons seeking a more intimate dining affair can explore our cosy private room setting. (Sep 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Nestled in Orchard Hotel since 1992, the award-winning Hua Ting Restaurant boasts an amazing repertoire of Cantonese plates. Embark on your Hua Ting journey with the Baked Mango Chicken Tartlet. The tartlet’s crust crumbles in your mouth, revealing a filling of soft, buttery chicken and mango chunks. Complement this starter with a basket of Steamed Seafood Dumpling Abalone. The thin, doughy skin breaks apart with a bite before the succulent, briny abalone greets your tastebuds. Brace your stomach for Hua Ting’s signature Crispy Roasted Duck. Here, the duck fat’s been skillfully rendered off, resulting in a crispy layer of caramelised skin that’s accompanied by tender duck meat. If you prefer something lighter, refresh your palate with the Dong Xing Garoupa Rice. A simmering broth is poured over slices of premium fish, cooking the meat instantly. This comforting dish seals the deal with its crispy rice that adds a crunchy texture to the broth. Round off your experience at this family-friendly restaurant with the Mango Purée, Pomelo, Sago, and Herbal Jelly, a twist on the familiar Cantonese dessert. (Nov 2019)

  • ABOUT

    Get ready for Hue, a modern Thai dining concept that brings authentic Thai food to another level. For starters, go for Oychestra for fat, juicy oysters topped with three different Thai dressings that will leave you hungry for more. Or go for the What The Fish Salad for a raw fish dish that’s equally tasty. Topped with fish roe, pork crackling, and a dressing of your choice, this dish is saucy, refreshing, and appetising. Offering a modest selection of mains, a must-try would be Hue’s original Not A Tom Yum Soup. A hot and spicy soup inspired from Southern Thailand, it’s filled with charred seafood and paired with an omelette. It’s perfect for a chilly day. This dish serves one to two people, so bring a friend down for extra stomach space to sample more dishes. Or go for their Pad Thai Remix, a delicious deconstructed pad thai that lets you mix all the best flavours to your liking. For the adventurous, try out Moocano, a sticky glutinous rice dish covered with chargrilled pork and lava sauce. The sticky glutinous rice pairs perfectly with the smoky flavours of the chargrilled sauce and savoury goodness of the salted egg sauce. For dessert, finish off with their Tea-ramisu which is this silky smooth, Thai-tea flavoured goodness. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oychestra, What The Fish, Not A Tom Yum, Moocano, Pad Thai Remix

• ABOUT

    Housed under the oldest heritage mansion in Singapore, Hush is the latest experiential dining concept at The Riverhouse. A hidden secret den behind the golden door, Hush features multiple VIP booths that allow an intimate dining experience amongst friends and a main dining hall that can accommodate up to 200 pax. The venue oozes an oriental charm on the outside and modern glamour on the inside, with lush cushion seats, sleek marble floor and an intricate golden and bronze theme that help create a sophisticated lounge for the best vibe dining experience. Putting together the most creative culinary and bar team, patrons are guaranteed to find the most delicious Modern-Asian tapas and innovative cocktails that are often crafted or infused with Chinese tea, herbs and florals. Curated playlists will also be a staple feature with a different theme each night. From classics to the latest hits, explore the best of Electro House, Future Bass, Hip-Hop, R&B, Moombahton and commercial beats. If you expect great service, quality food, premium drinks and music, hush is the perfect lifestyle destination for you to seek specialty cocktails, premium spirits, wine, delicious Modern-Asian tapas and the best music in town. At Hush, everyday is a celebration. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Unsubtle Truffle Mein, Saucy Crab and Egg Affair, Roasted Duck with Foie Gras Sauce, Clear Soup Angus Beef Lionhead

html:
• ABOUT

    Known for its abundance of flavours, Hutong aims to preserve and recreate the different types of traditional Chinese delicacies. Boasting a wide variety of Chinese delights, Hutong’s extensive menu features a host of nutritious and mouthwatering Chinese cuisine. A beautiful appetiser to start with is the Sweet Scented Osmanthus Root with Glutinous Rice. Stuffed with sticky glutinous rice and slow-cooked in a sweet broth, children love it for its sweet flavour, while you’ll appreciate its nutritious value. Alternatively, kickstart your meal with the Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg. Crispy and tasty, it’s the ultimate pre-main course choice. Sweet and salty, the Deep Fried Softshell Crab is accompanied with a side of Mango Salad. The two differing flavour profiles perfectly complement one another, rewarding you with savoury mouthfuls of crunchy crab meat and cucumber. Spice lovers will also be glad to know that Hutong serves up a fiery pot of Mala. Treat yourself to the Grilled Premium Beef when you drop by Hutong. Juicy and fragrant, the slices of glistening red meat are speckled with thinly sliced garlic and sesame seeds for extra crunch and flavour. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sweet Scented Osmanthus Root with Glutinous Rice, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg, Crispy Fish Skin with Salted Egg, Grilled Premium Beef

html:
• ABOUT

    While traversing through the streets of Amsterdam, Muhamad Jamuri bin Busori fell deeply in love with the city. From its vibrant atmosphere and the beautiful bridges, to the Dutch’s bicycle-oriented lifestyle, he knew that there wouldn’t be anything quite like Amsterdam. Upon returning to sunny Singapore, his love affair led him to start a cafe in 2013 that would be all things Dutch. Now, the I am… Cafe is serves up amazing cafe grub to a bustling crowd everyday. And in case you were wondering, yes, the name is inspired by Amsterdam’s iconic ‘I amsterdam’ sign. Must-trys include the Dutch-inspired Fries & Mayo, featuring crispy thick-cut fries with a generous helping of rich mayonnaise. If you’re here with a group of friends, go for the I am... Platter, an elaborate showcase of all their starters such as the half-shell mussels, soft-shell crabs, buffalo wings, and many more. The perfectly battered Fish ‘N’ Chips has also garnered considerable fame, so be sure to try it while you’re here. You probably would have seen photos of their homemade cakes on your instagram feed, such as the cafe’s popular Rainbow Cake that’s as delicious as it is insta-worthy. The cake has seven layers, representing the rainbow’s seven colours of course. Top it all off with alcohol-free concoctions like the Virgin Lychee Mojito and the Bushramint, and your day’s made! (Oct 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    I am...Platter, Fries & Mayo, Charcoal-grilled Sloppy Beef Burger, Fish ‘N’ Chips, Soft-Shell Crab Burger, Crayfish Arrabiata & Italian Basil

• ABOUT

    Pizza, Pasta, Gelato – those are the three words prominently displayed underneath Ice Edge Cafe’s marquee. But if you ask us, this cushy little bistro located along Kovan Road offers much more than that. Spinning up incredible, family-friendly nosh in a plush environment, Ice Edge Cafe is the go-to hangout for lazy weekend afternoons spent gabbing over the latest gossip and making new memories with friends, all while sipping on cups of coffee or digging into excellent Western-styled nosh. With an extensive menu, you won’t find it hard to pick out your new favorite dishes. For heartier fare, be sure to check out the Tom Yam Seafood Linguine. This Asian-inspired dish is made from generous amounts of prawns, squid, clams, and garlic, and is served over a bed of noodles. And of course it wouldn’t be a kid-friendly place without a kid-centric menu with options such as Chicken Cream Spaghetti or the finger-licking Nuggets N’ Chips. Ice Edge Cafe is known for producing its own small batches of artisan Gelato In-House. We have now created over 60 different flavors. Our Gelato are produced fresh daily using premium grade ingredients. Gelato are typically healthier choice as compared to ice cream. They are denser in flavour & offers fewer calories, lesser sugar & lower fat content per serving than ice cream. So pack your day with good food and great company, all in the serene setting of Ice Edge Cafe. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Gelato, Freshly Made Waffle, Nachos, Fatty Fries, Tom Yum Seafood Linguine, Giant Chicken Schnitzel

    2019 marks IDLE’s decade-long presence in the F&B industry. Having grown from our humble first shop set up back in 2008 at Dempsey Hill, IDLE now boasts 3 outlets spanning Singapore’s Central, West and East zones. IDLE was not conceptualized out of idle but created from the idea to provide people with an affordable drinking spot to relax and unwind without burning a hole in their pockets. Pioneering Singapore’s liquid buffet concept, IDLE is proud to be the industry innovator offering a fixed-price drink-all-you-can selection of gin, vodka, rum, bourbon, whiskey, beer, and even cocktails/party drinks/shooters. • ABOUT

    Iggy's is an institution in Singapore’s dining scene. With its innovative creations that use only the freshest seasonal produce from Japan and around the world, it’s been consistently earning a Michelin star since 2017. The space is elegant and intimate, with only 38 seats so diners can have the best dining experience. Behind Iggy’s is Ignatius Chan, a restaurateur and sommelier with over three decades of experience. Working closely with the culinary team, he has designed a menu of modern European dishes that exude Asian flavours to suit the Singaporean palate. He also handpicks labels for Iggy's wine cellar, with a big focus on Burgundy wines. Both lunch and dinner offer set menus that showcase the chef's picks of the season. Naturally, menu items change regularly according to the ingredients that are available, but for a feel of what to expect, think Hokkaido Scallops with Oscietra Caviar, Vichyssoise and Apple Snow, Miyazaki Wagyu with Green Dragon Vegetable Shishito, and Foie Gras with Chinese Liver Sausage. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hokkaido Scallops, Miyazaki Wagyu, Tale of Two Livers, Walnut

  • ABOUT

    With a concept of marrying lifestyle, good food and good company as one, Ikigai Izakaya embodies the meaning of Ikigai - a reason for existing. In the heart of Singapore, Ikigai Izakaya offers a relaxing dining experience with views of the Singapore River. With a sizable menu that serves the best of Izakaya, Ikigai is here to impress. Among the unique appetizers to try here are their Umi Suisho - delicious shark cartilage flavored with crunchy plum, and their Tamagoyaki Mentai. This humble egg dish may look simple, but it’s done right. The eggs are cooked to the perfect fluffy consistency and the mentaiko is seared to give it a delicious umami flavor. If you're looking for affordable sashimi, go for their Sake Platter that features Salmon, Salmon Belly, and Salmon Roe all in one dish. With maximum freshness guaranteed, indulge your salmon cravings without having to break the bank. Bring color to your table with Ikigai’s Rainbow Maki. Featuring an assortment of sashimi atop premium Japanese rice, this roll is perfect for diners wanting a little taste of everything and a surprise with each bite. If you’re looking for indulgence, Ikigai Izakaya’s Wagyu Steak is a must-try. Miyazaki Wagyu Beef is delicately seared over a smoky grill and delicately basted in their special house sauce. The result is tender, melt-in-your-mouth morsels that will leave you wanting for more with each bite. Priding itself as a concept that revolves around finding your ‘centre’, be enchanted and wowed by Ikigai’s amazing attention to detail, good food and picturesque views. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Umi Suisho, Tamagoyaki Mentai, Sake Platter, Rainbow Maki, Wagyu Steak

    While our city does not lack for contemporary Italian restaurants, few come close to matching the exquisite dining experience one gets at il Cielo. Perched on the top floor of voco Orchard Singapore, the restaurant offers guests a bird's eye view of the teeming crowds on Orchard Road, a fitting tribute to its name that translates to 'the sky'. With its small 48-seater capacity and hyper-personalised service, this intimate restaurant is a perfect venue for a romantic evening or small dinner celebrations. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Wholesome, unpretentious and surprisingly excellent Italian food, il Cielo is definitely amongst one of our favourite Italian restaurants we've tried this year. We would keep it a secret to ourselves, but that'd just be selfish." -Lifestyle Asia

html:
• ABOUT

    This funky Italian restaurant presents traditional Italian fare in relaxed but hip digs overlooking a lovely green patch of the Stevens Road area. Priding itself on authentic fare, a smoky oven churns out pizzas to order, and these pies have attracted quite a following among in-the-know foodies in the neighbourhood. Choose from a comprehensive menu of practically every pizza flavour known to Man, from a piquant Puglia pie topped with anchovies, kalamata olives, artichokes, and mushrooms to the ubiquitous and controversial Hawaiian. If you’re a purist, stick to classic flavours like Cipolla e Pancetta, a red-sauce pie scattered with crispy pancetta, onions, and melty cheese. There’s also pasta dishes that will help fix any Italian craving. Think well-made authentic pasta plates here, none of that watered-down business you tend to find in Italian joints around the city. The Bucatini All’Amatriciana is a heavenly plate of tubular spaghetti tossed in a spicy, porky sauce of tomatoes, cured Guanciale (pork cheek), and tangy pecorino cheese. The Carbonara is a close cousin, made with a cheese and egg sauce instead of tomato, and prepared exactly as it is in Rome, with lashings of spicy rendered lard, black pepper, and no cream whatsoever. Grilled steaks and fish round out the menu, though honestly we think the hefty pizza and pasta plates will keep even the greediest of diners happy. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spaghetti alle Vongole, Pasta alla Norma, Costata di Manzo, Pizza Contadina, Pizza in Piazza, Margherita Pizza, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, Bucatini alla Amatriciana

html:
• ABOUT

    A quick-service Indian eatery located along Keong Saik Road, Indline is a sleek and modern eatery that serves up contemporary Indian fare in a comfortable environment. It’s easy to get overwhelmed when flipping through the numerous pages of this eatery’s menu. But rest assured that you’re guaranteed a great menu no matter which dish you decide to go with. Staples, such as Paneer Tikka made from cottage cheese cubes marinated in spices and roasted in the tandoor, are not to be missed. Fans of seafood would appreciate the evergreen Mahcli Tikka, featuring grilled dory fish brightened with a dash of lemon juice. The gold standard for any good Indian restaurant is in the vegetarian dishes, which are thankfully outstanding here. Dig into the creamy chickpea-based Chana Masala, cooked in a Punjabi-style sauce, or the Dal Makhani, where lentils are painstakingly simmered overnight in a mix of fragrant spices and herbs. Then wash your meal down with one of the four flavoured lassi drinks, the Rose Lassi being our go-to pick. Whether you’re in a hurry or want to slow down and savour a gut-busting meal, Indline consistently is our pick for a great meal that won’t cost too much money. (Jun 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Diners can shoot for the four set meals, one of which is the Indbox, which includes a main and four sides. Wash it all down with the restaurant’s selection of craft beers.” –Time Out SG

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Head Curry, Zafrani Chicken Tikka, Lamb Chops, Mam Mia Mutton, Garlic Naan, Peshwari Naan, Non-Veg Kebab Platter

name: Indline Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Indocafe's grand black-and-white compound is a historic remnant of Singapore's past, so it's only fitting the cuisine boasts equal cultural significance. In an interior done up to look like a warm dining room - parquet floors, Peranakan antiques, and cosy lighting - orders are brought to your table with little fanfare, confident in their authentic flavours and contemporary touches. Fundamental Nyonya techniques, classic recipes, and fresh spices, pounded together using the tried-and-true pestle and mortar method, result in fragrant traditional offerings like Kueh Pie Tee (crisp pastry cups filled with shredded turnip, served with prawns, crabmeat, and homemade chili dip), Ngoh Hiang (homemade five-spiced pork meat roll wrapped in soy bean curd skin and deep fried), and Organic Ayam Buah Keluak (braised organic chicken with black nut and exotic spices). That's not to say that Indocafe is stuck in the past though; little tweaks to suit modern tastes are a constant feature in their menu. Feast on dishes such as the Otah Klasik (steamed 'Chawanmushi' egg custard with fish fillet, seasoned with coconut milk, and a special blend of herb and spices) and Chendol Panna Cotta, both great examples of when past and present collide. Once you're done tasting a slice of Singapore's heritage, don’t forget to trot over to their Arts & Cultural Central where a little coffee appreciation and afternoon performance might go a long way! (Apr 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For an introduction to Peranakan cuisine, the stately 68-seater restaurant does the classics well, albeit with a modern twist." -Time Out Singapore "Once you're finished with savouring the culinary delights of Peranakan cuisine, it's time to sample some of the cultural kind as you can also pop across to the Arts & Cultural Centre for perhaps a spot of coffee appreciation, live performance or dance appreciation." -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kueh Pie Tee, Otah Klasik, Organic Ayam Buah Keluak, Wagyu Beef Rendang, Sayur Lodeh, Chendol Panna Cotta, Bubur Cha Cha

html:
• ABOUT

    Well-known for serving traditional Western food in a fusion style, Indulge Teppanyaki and Grill House menu boasts a variety of classic Japanese favourites with a delicious twist. Health-conscious diners are also in for a treat with the restaurant’s soba and salad options that offer Steak, Salmon and Grilled Chicken Chop as toppings. For those who love to mix things up, you can create your own pasta with your choice of protein and sauce. The Indulge Bowl is the star of the show. A custom bowl filled with fluffy short grain rice, customise your dining experience with your own pick of tasty toppings such as Chicken Cutlet with Nacho cheese, Clams with Hae Bee Hiam or the Truffle Mushroom. Other affordable one-dish meal options include the Grilled Salmon Fillet, Grilled Cajun Chicken Breast, Pan Seared Scallop Soba, and more! Enjoy a little bit of everything on the menu with the restaurant's Mixed Grill. Featuring a generous serving of chicken chop, striploin steak, tiger prawn and fresh scallops, this mouthwatering mix of meat options is every meat lover’s dream come true. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Indulge Bowl, Grilled Cajun Chicken Breast, Pan Seared Scallop Soba, Mixed Grill
