html:
• ABOUT

    The sleepy neighbourhood of Hillview has found a gem in iO Italian Osteria, the sister outfit to popular Italian restaurant Etna in Duxton. The warm, cosy space is lively and buzzing, constantly filled with the chatter of the many diners — it’s hard to just walk into iO expecting a seat — and staff bustling about with steaming plates of pasta. It’s hard to resist starting the meal with bread, because the ones here are baked fresh in-house and speckled with delicious tomatoes or mushrooms. The Roman schiacciata, for instance, is a golden-brown flat bread with crispy edges, which you either enjoy plain or stuffed with earthy truffle. A must-order is the porchetta, rolled pork belly roasted until the skin is crackling with savoury juices and the meat is super tender. Pastas are the star for main courses — the baked lasagne, grandma style, is absolute comfort food. But the home-made tagliolini is a dish you’ll come back for, with the springy strands of pasta tossed with generous amounts of garlic, olive oil and chilli, and fresh, chopped prawns. Our tip: Order to share, so you can dig into more dishes. (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Assorted Homemade Bread, Baked Risotto, Grilled US Ribeye, Dark Chocolate Lava Cake

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways/delivery instead.Click here to view the menu

html:
• ABOUT

    The wait is over. Hailing from Osaka, the highly-exalted tempura restaurant, Ippoh, has finally set up shop on our sunny shores. Loved by gourmands for turning what is assumed to be a simple deep-fried dish into an art form, Ippoh will now introduce Singaporeans to its perfectly-cooked tempura with Ippoh Tempura Bar by Ginza Ippoh. Based in the sleek and stylish COMO Dempsey compound, Ippoh Tempura Bar serves a handful of small appetisers and tempura dishes guaranteed to astound and dazzle. The secret to these exquisite nibbles is in the restaurant’s use of fresh and premium ingredients, such as top-quality safflower oil. Furthermore, the chefs painstakingly fry each piece of tempura individually to ensure that the oil at the optimal temperature so that the tempura attains its crispy golden layer. With a small seating capacity of 18, including a 12-seat tempura bar, dining at Ippoh Tempura Bar by Ginza Ippoh promises to be an intimate affair with its warm, personalised service. While an a la carte menu is available, we prefer the lunch and dinner set menus, which feature varying amounts of tempura, pickles, and rice. A selection of sakes, wines, and beers are also on-hand to complement a dining experience you won’t forget. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Chef Seki's batter is an ethereal combination of flour, egg yolks and Japanese water, which turns lightly crisp in the safflower oil that he prefers. There's hardly a hint of grease when biting into each course, testimony to the age-old techniques that the master chef employs." -Epicure Asia "Ippoh's open concept also allows diners seated at the tempura bar to witness the chef individually frying each piece of tempura - shrimps, fish, vegetables, and other munch-worthy goodies that you can mix altogether in a ten-don rice bowl." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tsuki Set, Sesame Tofu with Sea Urchin, Shrimp Toast, Anago Fish, Seasonal Fruit from Japan

• ABOUT

    If you find yourself craving Japanese food while shopping, make a beeline for issho izakaya. This modern Japanese outfit has something for everyone. For starters, try the Truffle Carpaccio or a comforting pot of Crab Zosui Nabeyaki, a Japanese porridge prepared with crab broth made by painstakingly simmering premium live crabs for hours. The result is a silky porridge that is sweet, boasting a delicious smoky flavour. Do check with our friendly staff for our seasonal fishes for the best cuts of sushi and sashimi which changes regularly. Being an izakaya, we are proud to have over 100 unique labels of sakes, shochu, wines and beer. Which are perfect for pairing with our live station – Kushiyaki skewers. Our crowd favourites skewers – Tebasaki (chicken wings), Buta Tomato (bacon-wrapped cherry tomato), Wagyu beef and much more perfectly grilled kushiyaki selection! For a sweet treat, snack on some Warabi Mochi. The all-time favourite Japanese dessert is coated in slightly bitter matcha powder, served with Japanese black honey on the side. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Carpaccio, Crab Zosui Nabeyaki, Crab Dou Special, Kushiyaki Tebasaki, Buta Tomato and Foie Gras, Warabi Mochi, Sake, Shochu, Wine

html:
• ABOUT

    With all dishes made from scratch, it doesn’t get any more authentic than this. This quaint spot on Baghdad Street is dedicated to bringing you the best of Middle Eastern cuisine. There are options for vegans, vegetarians, and meat-lovers, so no matter how diverse your group is, there’s bound to be something here for everyone. Start with some classic Baba Ganoush - smoky roast eggplants mixed with yogurt, garlic, and lemon juice. Mop up the decadent dish with some Turkish pita bread for a moreish dish. Be sure to save some space for the Lamb Shank though. Oven-roasted lamb cooked till tender enough to be cut with a fork, served on a bed of fluffy rice. This dish is decadent and will leave you licking your lips and wanting more afterwards, so be sure to savour every bite. Vegetarians, fret not, as the Moussaka is another popular dish that is plant-based. Made with soft eggplants, zucchini, onions, pepper, and zucchini, this main is best served with rice or pita bread which is able to absorb its earthy flavours. For a sweet end to the meal, opt for some classic Baklava - flaky crunchy, and sweetened with syrup. Adventurous diners can opt for the Sutlac - Turkish rice pudding topped with cinnamon and baked. Served hot, this dish is a treat for both the eyes and the tongue. With a spicy-sweet flavour from the cinnamon and richness from the rice, this dish makes for a good winter dessert. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mixed Meze Dips, Lamb Shank, Beyti Kebab Chicken, Izgara Kofte, Ali Nazik

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/istanblue-meze-grill-turkish-restaurant
name: Istanblue Meze & Grill Turkish Restaurant

  • ABOUT

    Izgara is a Mediterranean-Turkish Grill & Bar that serves up the best kebabs in town. Known for their flair in perfecting smoky barbecued meat, you can choose from the many options that will wow your tastebuds with every bite. Enjoy the best of red meats with the Adana Kebap that’s made with minced beef and lamb grilled on a skewer. You can also bring a friend or two to enjoy their Mixed Kebap Platter that has little of everything for the ultimate indulgence. Balance all the meaty flavours with a deliciously cheesy Cheese Pide filled with creamy goodness and satisfying carbs. Appetisers are not to be missed either, and we highly recommend ordering a side of Hummus served with bread for a delicious mix of textures. Alternatively, get the Meze Platter, which comes with an assortment of Beyaz Pinir, Yaprak Sarma, Acili Ezme and more. Enjoy these light yet filling sides that are great to pair with any mains or grilled meat to enhance the flavours of the grill.To end off your meal on a sweet note, we recommend their Kunefe with Ice Cream, an indulgent, sweet pastry layered with cheese and clotted cream. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Adana Kebap, Cheese Pide, Hummus, Meze Platter, Kunefe with Ice Cream

• ABOUT

    Step away from the usual Shenton Way watering holes and give this hidden gem a shot. Whether you want to enjoy sunset skyline views or lounge on sleek upholstery, this bar in M Hotel Singapore is the place to go. Boasting a live band, visitors can expect soothing tunes all night long as they relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of daily life. With pocket-friendly promotions such as free-flow champagne during ladies’ night among others, J Bar is one place for post-work drinks that won’t burn a hole in your pocket. (March 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled in the hip and trendy Lavender district, J Bistro offers a wide range of international dishes to suit every palate. For appetizers, we recommend trying their Creamy Spiced Black Mussels and French Onion Soup. The mussels are basted and cooked in an organic coconut cream sauce and mixed with a special blend of spices, giving it an added layer of flavour. Perfect for sharing, this dish is ready to whet your appetite for more to come. For soups, they honor their french roots with the French Onion Soup, a portion of comfort food that is done right. Deliciously rich, soft caramelised onions with a layer of gooey cheese make this savoury soup the best dish for a chilly day, or for when you’re in the mood for something satiating. Serving your usual mains from burgers to pasta, make sure to try their Triple Infused Lamb Shank that combines soju, merlot, and spiced rum in a delicious concoction that perfectly tenderizes the seven-hour braised meat. For a lighter option, try the J Bistro Tofu Burger, which combines the distinct flavors of wasabi and caramelised onions in a burger that you won't soon forget. J Bistro also serves an extensive range of sides and tapas that goes amazing with their extensive wine pairings. Go for sides like their Tempura Calamari Rings for a crispy and light snack or their Skewered Yakitori Chicken that pairs perfectly with a glass of red wine. Serving air-flown oysters from different regions of France, enjoy the taste of the ocean with each morsel, freshly shucked upon order. They also have a Toscano Wine Pairing menu for diners wanting something different from their regular offerings. To end off your meal, go for their Traditional Baklava for a sweet and nutty finish. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Creamy Spiced Black Mussels, French Onion Soup, Triple Infused Lamb Shank, J Bistro Tofu Burger, Traditional Baklava

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Jade restaurant offers authentic Chinese cuisine of exceptional quality and warm hospitality, earning for itself the reputation of its precious gemstone namesake. Helmed by Executive Chinese Chef Leong Chee Yeng, connoisseurs can enjoy exquisite, handcrafted dim sum and traditional Chinese creations that reflect Chef Leong's artistic creativity and culinary mastery. The 120-seat establishment features two private rooms and two partitioned areas. It is beautifully appointed in a colour palette reflecting the lustre of jade and evocative overhead lantern lighting, among other elegant design elements. Housed within the historic building of The Fullerton Hotel Singapore, itself a National Monument, Jade represents a fusion of heritage, design, culture, and epicurean delight that is unique to the Singapore culinary scene. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crystal Shrimp Dumplings, Abalone Siew Mai, Xiao Long Bao with Foie Gras, Braised Bird’s Nest with Truffle Egg White in Superior Broth, Braised Sweet Corn Soup with Minced Chicken, Braised Egg Noodle with Boston Lobster, Peking Duck, Pan-fried Lamb Ribs, Beef Ball with Sun-dried Orange Peel, Taro Paste wrapped with Truffle and Mushroom

html:
• ABOUT

    Sit back and relax at Jag Wine, where good food and drink come hand in hand to make for a winning combination. With its wood-finished walls and candlelit tables, this classy establishment is a good place to go for a corporate event, a romantic night out, or, well, a great meal. Have a go at one of the tapas dishes – the Crispy Soft Shell Crab will prove highly addictive as you crunch on each tasty mouthful. The Steak Bites with Blue Cheese Sauce is another (rather decadent) option, where sirloin cubes are accompanied by fragrant helpings of blue cheese sauce for a mouthwatering, unforgettable dish. If you’re hankering for a hearty plate of pasta, you can’t go wrong with the Crab Meat Pasta, where angel hair is topped with chunks of flavourful crab meat, mixed bell peppers, and red onion – it might sound like a fairly basic combination, but it works. Few meals are complete without a dessert to top everything off, so why not take a stab at the Molten Lava Cake with Ice Cream? Its nuanced, bittersweet taste will serve as the perfect denouement to your meal, and it’s a take on the popular dessert that’ll be as good as you’ve ever tasted. So head down to Jag Wine sometime soon for a good meal, a nice wine, and a great dining experience that’s hard to beat. (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jag’s Chicken Wings, Crispy Soft Shell Crab, Crab Meat Pasta, Filet Mignon, Baked Mussels, Sausage Platter, Molten Lava Cake with Ice Cream, Creamy Avocado with Ice Cream, Steak Bites with Blue Cheese Sauce

  • ABOUT

    Marrying modernity and tradition, Jarrell’s offers gourmet comfort food and pocket-friendly beers in an unconventional ambiance. The steampunk touches and pop culture elements give the place character, and you will immediately feel at home with their hand-crafted tables and cosy dining atmosphere. For starters, go for their Curdled Milk Board with Asian Charcoal Grilled Pork Slices - Jarrell’s take on your regular charcuterie board. Mixed with pork bak kwa and kaya, this board is fun and delicious with unique flavours in one platter. Or go for their Et Tu Brute?, a modern caesar salad topped with savoury bak kwa and garlic croutons. For mains, their Prime Minotaur Cut is a must-try, featuring a New Zealand ribeye with Asian mushroom ragout. Pasta lovers are in for a treat with their eclectic selection of pastas - we recommend the District 9 Pasta, a Tom-Yum style dish that’s spicy and tasty. For lunch, be sure to try their Chicken Little Burger that consists of prawn paste battered chicken thigh on top of soft and buttery brioche buns. It’s the perfect dish for a quick and easy meal that’s still guaranteed to leave you full and satiated. For dessert, finish off with their Legacy of Eemin, a brown sugar sea salt panna cotta that’s so addictive, it’ll be your go-to dessert from now on. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Curdled Milk Board with Asian Charcoal Grilled Pork Slices, Et Tu Brute?, Prime Minotaur Cut, Chicken Little Burger

html:
• ABOUT

    Located along the ever busy Duxton road, Jeffo’s is American food done right. Starting off with crispy fried wings, their signature Jeffo’s Wings have been perfected since 2002. With a crackling golden crust and housemade chilli for an added kick, pair this dish with an ice cold pint of beer for a delicious start to your meal. Enjoy other bar bites like their cheesy Chicken Quesadilla or their savoury Top Shells too for an easy evening meet up, or to munch away as you unwind after work. Pizzas at Jeffo’s are a fan favourite, and with unusual offerings like their Maggi May Pizza, it’s no wonder. Order this pizza for a delicious new take on how maggi is best eaten and you’re guaranteed to be hooked on the unique flavour. Alternatively, opt for a gratifyingly cheesy Margherita Pizza for a safer option. It’s equally delicious and addictive. For pastas, Jeffo’s must-try pasta is also another fusion dish - a deliciously spicy and creamy Chicken Mee Goreng Pasta that packs a surprising punch. With a savoury sauce that heats you up on the inside paired with tender chicken chunks, this dish is a crowd favourite and great for diners looking for an unexpected twist. For something classic, go for their Cheese Burger that comes with 150g of beefy goodness squished between two fluffy brioche buns for the true blue american flavour. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jeffo's Wings, Chicken Quesadilla, Margherita Pizza, Maggi May Pizza, Chicken Mee Goreng Pasta, Cheese Burger

• ABOUT

    Established in August 2013, Jekyll & Hyde is a whimsical cocktail bar located in the heart of Singapore. Started as a nail parlour by day and speakeasy by night, we've come a long way since, and we are proud to be known as one of Singapore's pioneer cocktail bars today. Graduating from a curation of cocktails inspired by unique Singapore flavours, our current edition by Head Bartender, Michael Foong, focuses on twists of classic cocktails, while incorporating funky food ingredients found in everyday life. Discover flavours like bacon, peanut butter, bananas and exotic spices, as your tastebuds take flight through our collection of signature cocktails. Chef Alvin Tan, formerly head chef at Shanghai Dolly and Straits Clan now heads up our kitchen. At Jekyll & Hyde, we are pairing our cocktails with Modern Singapore cuisine, taking your experience at Jekyll & Hyde to new heights - elevating local cuisine and creating a new dimension and perspective to our childhood favourites. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Char Kuay Teow, Peach Please!, Chili Crab Nachos, OG B&B, PB &J, Kurobuta Carrot Cake, Mr Hyde's Satay

• ABOUT

    Featuring both classic Chinese delicacies and contemporary creations for everyone to enjoy, Jia He Chinese Restaurant sets the table for a life well lived by encouraging strong familial bonds over a delicious meal. Begin your feast with an impressive selection of masterfully crafted Dim Sum offerings. Made with premium herbs and spices, the Steamed Xiao Long Bao with Bak Kut Teh is a comfortingly tasty dish where the peppery and garlicky Bak Kut Teh is the star. A truly innovative fusion dish, beetroot juice is used to turn the dumplings into a lovely shade of pink, making this dish extra classy. Other dishes that come highly recommended include the Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, Steamed Phoenix Prawn Siew Mai and Deep-fried Yam Dumplings with Minced Meat. Don’t leave without ordering the restaurant’s famous Peking Duck. The highlight of many Chinese dinners, Jia He Chinese Restaurant brings you an exquisite Peking Duck experience with the traditional accompaniments of cucumber, spring onion and a dash of plum sauce for a decadent mouthful. End your meal on a sweet note with the Deep-fried Sesame Ball with Durian. Another interesting combination, this sweet treat is sure to leave you coming back for more! (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Steamed Xiao Long Bao with Bak Kut Teh, Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, Peking Duck, Deep-fried Sesame Ball with Durian, Deep-fried Yam Dumplings with Minced Meat

    Known for their made-to-order boiled dumplings and signature noodles, Jia He Xing is an authentic dumpling restaurant established in 1998. Offering a wide choice of main courses, appetizers and beverages, the restaurant prides themselves on serving freshly prepared dishes. Made to order, delicious dumpling choices include the Boiled Joyful Three Delicacies Dumplings, Boiled Pork and Chive Dumplings, as well as Vegetarian Dumplings. Order the Chicken and Fragrant Mushrooms with Rice with a basket of dumplings for a satisfying meal. Fried together with tender pieces of chicken, the mushrooms add an earthy flavour to the dish. Sweet and glutinous, the Chilled Glutinous Rice Roll consists of yummy red bean paste topped with grated nuts. A traditional Beijing snack, the rice roll is a sweet end to your meal. (Mar 2020)

    It is not just food but the rich history and innovation connected to it that comes to life with each tantalising bite. That is the Jia Wei promise. To present Chinese cuisine that honours the rich traditions of taste and authentic family recipes, hints to the contemporary and sparks personal conversations with your palette. We are pleased to see this promise come alive in our new menu, a gastronomic delight with a selection of true-blue Chinese classics and modern creations built upon traditional recipes. New dishes to try : Crispy local farm soft shell crab with Yuzu Dressing, Poached corn-fed chicken with creamy spicy sauce, baked local farm barramundi fillet with chef’s honey pineapple sauce, crispy deep ocean prawn with creamy butternut sauce, crispy sea cucumber stuffed with minced prawn in abalone sauce.   • ABOUT

    It’s hard enough to find an authentic Chinese restaurant that is also halal, much less one that serves up traditional and tasty Tzechar dishes. This lovely spot serves up Muslim-friendly dishes that are so delicious, you wouldn’t even know they are pork-free! Treat yourself to some crispy Prawn Paste Chicken - delicious, non-greasy and the perfect dish to start off with. The vegetable dishes are nothing to turn your nose up at either. We love the Sambal Kangkong for its homemade taste and spice, and the Broccoli with Scallop for its rich, briny flavour and generous helping of seafood. While these dishes are definitely delicious, Jiak’s claim to fame is their Fish Head Curry. The curry is aromatic and spicy, but it is the fish that is the true highlight of the dish. The fish absorbs the spices from the curry and is cooked till tender - the meat is so soft, you can cut it with a fork! Pair this dish with some steamed rice for the perfect midday meal. (Nov 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Head Curry, Prawn Paste Chicken, Sambal Kangkong, Broccoli With Scallop, Oats Sotong

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/jiak-modern-tzechar-esplanade
name: Jiak Modern Tzechar (Esplanade)

Cuisine: Chinese, Malaysian, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Halal Certified, Zi Char
html:
• ABOUT

    It’s hard enough to find an authentic Chinese restaurant that is also halal, much less one that serves up traditional and tasty Tzechar dishes. This lovely spot serves up Muslim-friendly dishes that are so delicious, you wouldn’t even know they are pork-free! Treat yourself to some crispy Prawn Paste Chicken - delicious, non-greasy and the perfect dish to start off with. The vegetable dishes are nothing to turn your nose up at either. We love the Sambal Kangkong for its homemade taste and spice, and the Broccoli with Scallop for its rich, briny flavour and generous helping of seafood. While these dishes are definitely delicious, Jiak’s claim to fame is their Fish Head Curry. The curry is aromatic and spicy, but it is the fish that is the true highlight of the dish. The fish absorbs the spices from the curry and is cooked till tender - the meat is so soft, you can cut it with a fork! Pair this dish with some steamed rice for the perfect midday meal. With a cosy interior, delicious dishes and a family-friendly atmosphere, this spot is perfect for a weekend out with the family, or for a work lunch with your closest colleagues. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish Head Curry, Prawn Paste Chicken, Sambal Kangkong, Broccoli With Scallop, Oats Sotong

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/jiak-modern-tzechar
name: Jiak Modern Tzechar (Hillview)

html:
• ABOUT

    Making the luxurious Four Seasons its home, the equally majestic Jiang-Nan Chun consistently wows diners with their exquisite, award-winning gastronomy. Head up a flight of marble stairs and you will find yourself at a regal labyrinth with opulent furnishings - think intricately carved wood, plush leather couches, and handsome carpets - fit for an emperor's palace. Enjoy some top-notch Cantonese fare here, including chef-crafted dim sums, double-boiled soups, and Jiang-Nan Chun's signature Peking Duck roasted in a mesquite wood-fired oven and served with caviar. This traditional technique roasts the skin to a satisfying crisp while keeping the duck meat juicy and succulent; take a little dollop of caviar with the red meat to elevate the dish with a subtle sweet-salty aftertaste. Gorgeous double-boiled soups such as the Hot & Sour Soup with Lobster or the signature Sea Whelk, Maka, Dried Scallops & Pork Ribs Soup are not to be missed either: wholesome ingredients are boiled for more than 15 hours to make soups that are rich, sweet, and highly nutritious. Other highlights include exquisite dim sum favourites such as the Steamed Scallop Dumpling with Crab Meat & Shrimp and the Baked Flaky Pastry with Smoked Ham, along with live seafood dishes such as the impeccably fresh Live Prawns and Dragon Tiger Garoupa. With a bevy of lavish eats to choose from, one visit to Jiang-Nan Chun is definitely not enough! (Sep 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Jiang-Nan Chun's signature Peking Duck is a meticulously prepared masterpiece. After being marinated and painstakingly air-pumped (for more than 14 hours) to separate the skin from the fat, the duck goes into a specially constructed wood-fired oven where it is smoked for another six hours over mesquite wood instead of the more typically used lychee or apple wood." -Today Online

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Peking Duck, Dragon Tiger Garoupa, Sea Whelk, Maka, Dried Scallops & Pork Ribs Soup, Steamed Scallop Dumpling with Crab Meat & Shrimp, Baked Flaky Pastry with Smoked Ham

    The latest venture by Chef Darwin Wong who helms modern European restaurant Buerre, Jidai is an innovative interpretation of the tastes of Japan together with his arsenal of French techniques. Get whisked away to an enchanting French-Japanese wonderland, through Chef Wong's magical creations. (Mar 2022)

html:
• ABOUT

    A legendary oasis for those yearning for a bit of an escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life, Jim Thompson offers exciting Thai cuisine in a stunning British colonial barrack in Dempsey Hill. Bringing together rave-worthy dishes in a heritage venue with such a rich history - this is one of our favourite places for a Thai escape. We can’t stop raving about the spacious restaurant venue, itself. The clever layout and wide pillars looming throughout the room make the dining experience more intimate, while the modern furniture evokes a sense of grandeur. However, what’s most impressive about Jim Thompson is their menu. With over 80 classic Thai dishes on the menu, it’s safe to say diners are spoilt for choice. From the crispy Poh Pia Gai to the fiery Khao Phad Graprow Gai (it’s got two chilli peppers next to the dish name on the menu so expect to be sweating) and the refreshing Som-Chun with orange, lychees, and shredded mango - this spot guarantees a delightful foodie-approved journey from beginning to end! (Nov 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Dig into freshly-made papaya salad from the salad station, a selection of premium roast meats, traditional Thai appetizers, and authentic curries and soups. Be sure to save some space for dessert, you’ll definitely be circling the dessert table and devouring multiple servings of mango sticky rice!” -Honeycombers “With more than 80 classic Thai dishes on the menu, including appetisers, spicy salads and barbeque, you’ll be spoiled for choice when dining there. What’s more, the menu features some vegetarian options, making it convenient when dining with vegan friends.” -Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Poh Pia Gai, Thod Man Pla, Yam Ma-Moung, Larb Gai, Tom Yam Talay, Gayeng Mussaman Neau, Khao Phad Graprow Gai, Phad Thai Goong Sod Rue Gai, Goong Oob Mor Din, Rad Prik, Phad Bak Boong Fai Dang, Som-Chun

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Jimoto Dining presents an authentic Japanese omakase experience. Touted as the best omakase restaurant in the Joo Chiat neighbourhood, the restaurant serves their omakase over the counter, presenting you with a wonderful opportunity to see the expert chefs at work. A nice wake-me-up after a day at work, the ice-cold Saito Karakuchi is a smooth, crisp house pour sake that is moderately sweet. Pair it with the Pitan Tofu, a go-to appetiser at Jimoto Dining. Sitting in a housemade sauce of sake, mirin and shoyu, the silken tofu is served cold. To go with the rest of the meal, order a bottle of Saito Junmai Ginjo Genshu. Boasting robust and tangy flavours, it complements the meal perfectly. Start off with Sashimi Platter, which consists of lightly torched kurodai, yellowtail and tachiuo. Move on to the Tuna Katsu Tataki With Ponzu Sauce, which is a harmonious bite of meat and fatty tuna. End the meal on a sweet note with the restaurant’s refreshing Yuzu Sorbet. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pitan Tofu, Tuna Katsu Tataki With Ponzu Sauce, Yuzu Sorbet, Saito Junmai Ginjo Genshu

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/jimoto-dining
name: Jimoto Dining

  • ABOUT

    Situated along Telok Ayer Street, Jin Fine Dining is dedicated to serving up delicious and authentic Japanese cuisine that’s great for your next omakase lunch or dinner. Marrying Japanese culinary techniques with fresh air-flown ingredients, get ready to be transported to Japan by their extensive menu of multiple omakase, lunch and premium set meals on offer. Helmed by chef Ray Phun, the restaurant’s Classic Omakase is a great meal option that introduces you to a variety of sushi. Start with an exquisite plate of five kinds of Sashimi before moving on to interesting combinations such as the Maitake Truffles with Foie Gras Tofu. Finish off your delightful omakase experience with a soothing bowl of Asari Somen. Desserts are delightful too. An interesting take on the traditional cheesecake, the restaurant serves up Tofu Cheese Cake and Sasa Custard which ends the meal on a refreshingly sweet note. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Classic Omakase, Maitake Truffles with Foie Gras Tofu, Kuruma Ebi Tempura, Tofu Cheese Cake

• PRESS RELEASE

    Opened in April 2018, Jinjo is a modern Japanese sumiyaki restaurant by the Les Amis Group that focuses on the Japanese art of grilling.Japanese charcoal-grilling mastery is celebrated through a prefecture focused menu where prime seasonal ingredients are sourced from all over Japan, just so that guests get the best flavours of the season. Cooked over charcoal, these ingredients are imbued with a delicious smokiness and transformed into delectable dishes.Complementing the dining experience sits a carefully curated sake menu, which is also prefecture focused and selected to match the taste profile of Jinjo's sumiyaki items. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yaki Goma Tofu, Ankimo, Nodoguro, Truffle Donabe, Jinjo Warabimochi

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Located on the rooftop garden of Orchard Central, Joie (pronounced ‘joy’) Restaurant, presents a refreshing concept that specializes in modern meatless cuisine. Influenced by the new wave dining trend in Europe and Taiwan that focuses on uplifting and innovative natural fare prepared with the freshest vegetables, fruits, and herbs. Experience the very special vegetarian-friendly fine-dining Restaurant at Joie. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lime Tofu emulsion, Silk Lasagna with Broccoli Riso and Cashew Nut Sand, Grill Summer Mushroom Steak on “Pu-Ye” Hot Stone, Truffle Risotto

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/joie-restaurant
name: Joie Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Touted as Singapore’s first Makgeolli bar and restaurant, Joo Bar is conveniently located along Tan Quee Lan Street within a three-storey heritage shophouse. Offering top notch Korean bites and creative drinks in a cosy, laid-back environment, Joo Bar is the place to recharge, rejuvenate and re-energise after a long day at work. Featuring an array of quintessential Korean dishes with a twist, a huge crowd favourite is the Joo Calamari. Served with lime, the accompanying kimchi tartar sauce is made from Joo Bar’s signature in-house recipe, adding a delightful kick when eaten with the crispy squid rings. For those who love chicken, the Dak Kang Jung is a fiery dish that is sure to blow you away! A tantalising mix of chicken tenders, spring onion, tteokbokki, and honey butter glaze, this flaming dish is a unique spin on a usually sweet and savoury dish set to delight your taste buds. Another highly recommended dish is the Joo Bossam. Braised pork belly is the star of the dish, with its flavours further enhanced by a side of spicy radish salad and white yucha kimchi. (Jul 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Joo Calamari, Dak Kang Jung, Joo Bossam, Tiramisu

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/joo-bar
name: Joo Bar

html:
• ABOUT

    The perfect place for a tasty breather from the hustle and bustle of city life, enter Josephine French Cuisine & Wine Bar to enjoy trendy modern French bistro-style dishes in the heart of Singapore’s Central Boulevard District at Amoy Street. A vibrant restaurant and bar that whips up innovative French dishes and boasts a heady concoction of spirits and cocktails, drop by this duo concept dining outlet today for after-work socials or weekend gatherings with friends and colleagues. If you’re visiting earlier in the day, lunch specials at Josephine French Cuisine & Wine Bar include gastronomic delights such as the Pan Seared Foie Gras, Honey Baked Half Camembert and Smoked Salmon Rillettes. Seafood lovers looking forward to indulging in the fresh catch from the ocean can order the Sea Bass or Grilled Salmon. Served with asparagus and lemon cream emulsion, the latter features a tender piece of salmon grilled to perfection for the ultimate indulgence. Fancy a dish that showcases the epitome of French cuisine? Opt for the French Gourmet Burger and sink your claws into 180g of juicy steak, comte cheese and caramelised onion sandwiched between two fluffy brioche buns. End your meal with a sweet and savoury Apple Tarte Fine topped with vanilla ice cream for a happy ending. Customise your dining experience when you pick a charcoal-grilled item off the menu and choose one sauce and a side to pair your meat with. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pan-Seared Foie Gras, Grilled Salmon, French Gourmet Burger, Apple Tarte Fine

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/josphine--french-cuisine-wine-bar
name: Joséphine - French Cuisine & Wine Bar

html:
• ABOUT

    Conveniently located in the heart of Singapore’s Central Boulevard District, Ju Hua Tai is a Chinese-inspired concept bespoke cocktail bar hidden along the row of shophouses that line the streets of Duxton Hill. A place where friends gather and strangers meet, this cocktail bar is a great place to form everlasting connections over good food and great drinks. Those who enjoy tasty Chinese cuisine should kickstart their evening at Ju Hua Tai with the bar’s best-selling Power Crispy Pork “Xiao Su Rou”. Accompanied with a saucer of homemade green chilli chutney, this mouthwatering bar snack combines traditional delicacies with modern cooking techniques for a delicious burst of flavours. Other equally innovative bar snacks that are maddeningly addictive include the Golden Prawn Cake and Puffed Pork Skin. For those on the hunt for a heartier meal, we recommend diving straight into the wide selection of baos on offer. Sandwiched between steamed sesame buns, the tender fried chicken drenched in lao gan ma mayo is the star of the bar’s signature Crispy Chicken Bao. Vegetarians would be delighted to know that the Mushroom Bao menu option is a sumptuous mix of fried maitake mushroom and king goma sauce wrapped in soft, fluffy buns that are steamed to perfection. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Power Crispy Pork “Xiao Su Rou”, Golden Prawn Cake, Crispy Chicken Bao, Mushroom Bao

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/ju-hua-tai
name: Ju Hua Tai

Menus: A La Carte Menu  Brunch Menu  Lunch Menu  Vegetarian Menu  Takeaway Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Ju95 is a modern take on an age-old recipe. Helmed by Head Chef Louis Lee, Ju95 focuses on the east meets west communal Izakaya dining experience done socially. Set along Boat Quay, the restaurant is nestled between the quaint shophouses of Singapore, right by the riverfront. Upon entering, patrons are greeted with dim lighting, eclectic artwork, soft subtle colours, and unique standout decor pieces such as our signature lanterns. The space focuses on giving guests a venue of comfort where they can truly be themselves. From the casual uniforms to the provocative artwork on the wall and the cheeky audiobook in the restroom, the key aspect of the venue is to give every guest an escape from the mundane normality of day-to-day life. With exciting dishes such as the signature Parfait Ju (Chicken Liver, Fermented Mushrooms, Koji Sable Cookies) and the Grilled Baby Squid Donabe (Seaweed Schmaltz, Ikura, Grilled Baby Squid), this space is guaranteed to tantalise your palate. On the beverage front, Ju95 has a focus on quality sakes, signature cocktails, and bespoke cocktails. Cocktails are cheeky and playful to bring out youth and vitality in our new friends. With drinks such as The Dirty Threeway (Bourbon, Japanese Whisky, Cognac, Triad of Bitters) and The Wailing Yoda (Midori, Edible Glitter, Cream Liqueur, Japanese Vodka), there’s definitely something for everyone. Come through our doors a stranger and leave as a friend. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Angel Hair, Grilled Ika, Grilled Kurobuta Pork Rack, Coconut Panna Cotta

  • IZAKAYA BRUNCH, A CONTEMPORARY TWIST

    Hankering for a new take on a Sunday Brunch? Ju95 has got you covered! With signature sets like the Binchotan Grilled Beef Short Rib (for 1) or the Koji Marinated Roasted Heritage Chicken (for 2), there’s bound to be something that meets your fancy! All sets come with a wide serve of trimmings that include Takikomi Mixed Rice, Aka Miso Brussel Sprouts, Nori Roasted Japanese Sweet Potatoes, Fried Seafood Okonomiyaki & a delectable Seaweed Miso Soup! Along with that, be prepared to booze it up with the classics like a cheeky Aperol Spritz or go big with Ju95’s Home Brewed Espresso Martini! Whether you’re in for a cheeky or a day out with the family, the space has something for everyone! When: SundayTime: 11:30am- 2:30pm

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/ju95
name: JU95

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    JUMBO Seafood, one of Singapore's most recognizable home-grown brands, has over the years built its name on quality seafood at reasonable prices. This has earned it a name as one of the must-go places for its famous Chili Crab amongst locals and tourists alike. However, it should be noted that JUMBO is famous for so much more than just its award-winning Chili Crab. Some of its other signature dishes include Fried Prawns with Cereal, Crispy Baby Squid and Golden Egg Salted Prawns. Having built a name and an excellent reputation, JUMBO has since expanded with numerous outlets dotted across the island. Moreover, each outlet has its own distinctive menu in addition to the brand's signature dishes. It is little wonder that customers are encouraged to make reservations, or as Singaporeans would say, "CHOPE" seats before heading down, especially on Fridays and the weekends. If there is anything that should be remembered about JUMBO Seafood, it should be its consistent quality, excellent service and undeniably fresh seafood. (Apr 2013)

  • JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill)

    One of the things that set JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill) apart from all its other outlets is its location. Unlike its outlets at East Coast and The Riverwalk, JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill) is located at Dempsey Hill, situated at the edge of Orchard Road, of what was once an army barrack that was used by the British. The restaurant is surrounded amongst serene, lush greenery and a plethora of restaurants and bars, and offers all who dine there a resort-like ambience – the perfect antidote for all who are looking for a dining setting that enables them sit back, relax and enjoy their food al fresco style. Furthermore, JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill) has recently introduced their Executive Lunch Set - a fancy, fuss-free, non-messy way lunch option - which is only available at their outlet. This lunch set features a few of its signature dishes in single portions. One of the main highlights of this lunch set is the de-shelled crab claw drenched in a bowl of their iconic chili crab gravy served with fried buns. Guests who dine at JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill) will also be able to enjoy the seasonal Chef's specials such as Cheese Baked "Mentaiko" King Prawns and Chilled Crystals of Ocean Sunfish with ginger Flower Dressing. It is without a doubt that the JUMBO brand has evolved into a lifestyle dining brand that seeks to cater to the different taste palates and continues to deliver the authentic Singapore seafood experience in a slightly more luxurious setting. (Apr 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A generous helping of jumbo chilli crab stir-fried in rich chilli gravy and served with deep-fried buns is all the rage here; it’s second to none. With alfresco dining by the riverside or the beach, you can enjoy the crisp, fresh air along with a beautiful view." -Time Out Singapore

  • BEST SEAFOOD

    Jumbo Seafood has been named the winner for the category 'Best Seafood' in Chope Diners' Choice Awards 2017.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/jumbo-seafood-dempsey-hill
name: JUMBO Seafood (Dempsey Hill)

  • ABOUT

    JUMBO Signatures, the flagship premium dining concept of JUMBO Group, is taking your dining experience to greater heights. Set in a distinctive restaurant redolent of Singapore’s heritage as a British colony, the familiar black-and-white features and intricate geometric patterns offer an alluring opportunity to immerse yourself in Singapore’s tradition, culture and history through food fit for royalty. The flagship premium dining restaurant features Singapore’s iconic flavours from the multiple dining concepts of JUMBO Group. From the ubiquitous Bak Kut Teh stewed to perfection by NG AH SIO Bak Kut Teh to the tantalising Award Winning Chilli Crab mastered by JUMBO Seafood, JUMBO Signatures combines these quintessential tastes and elevates the Singapore dining experience through tasting menus and sommelier wine pairing. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    King Crab in Chilli Crab Sauce, King Crab in Golden Salted Egg, Signature Fragrant Rice in Rich Seafood Broth, Sliced Luffa Melon in Golden Stew

html:
• ABOUT

    Jun BBQ and Beer has a homely and relaxed atmosphere and is committed to serving dinners affordable and high-quality Korean food. Lovers of Korean barbeque are in for a treat. Beef-lovers, try the Galbisal Seoksoe Hanpan, a charcoal-grilled beef rib, cooked to perfection and deliciously tender. Alternatively, the Beef Bulgogi Seoksoe Hanpan is marinated in a mix of soy sauce, brown sugar and a variety of spices. The meat’s flavours are then enhanced by the smoking over the grill. Beyond barbeque, try the entrees, including the Budae Jjigae Hot Pot. A hearty dish with flavourful umami broth with thick sausages, juicy dumplings, luncheon meat, vegetables and ramyeon. It is sure to satisfy even the biggest eaters. And be sure not to miss the fantastic variety of drinks which includes K-favourites Makgeolli, Soju and Hite Beer. Non-alcoholic beverages include Sikhye, made of malt and rice and Sujeonggwa, a punch made with ginger and cinnamon sticks. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Bulgogi Seoksoe Hanpan, Makgeolli, Sujeonggwa

    Perched atop Justin Quek’s upscale outfit Chinoiserie, with a view of the Singapore River, JustIN Flavours of Asia is a casual eatery that shows off local fare made with gourmet ingredients. Fan of popcorn chicken? The Wok Fried Angus Short Ribs here easily reminds you of everyone’s favourite snack, with its coating of sea salt, garlic, and chilli. Tossed in a wok that’s warmed to high heat, the cubes of fried beef ribs are juicy with a crisp exterior and are dangerously addictive. Another popular dish is chef Justin Quek’s take on the humble satay. Here, generous cubes of New Zealand lamb leg are grilled over burning hot charcoal for that smoky aroma. Dip the Charcoal-Grilled New Zealand Lamb Leg Satay in an accompanying crunchy peanut sauce. Zichar classics are must-haves for dinner and the kitchen fires up the wok to churn out elevated renditions of Kampot Black Pepper Beef, Sweet & Sour Iberico Pork ‘Goo Lou Yok’, as well as a hearty plate of smoke-kissed Hokkien Mee with Live Maine lobster. Come with friends, and come with an appetite. (Feb 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Using premium ingredients, the dishes executed at his inimitable level will open diners’ eyes to different facets of food that they thought they were familiar with.” -The Peak Singapore, June 2018

    Wok-Fried Angus Short Ribs, Charcoal-Grilled New Zealand Lamb Leg Satay. Kampot Black Pepper Beef, Sweet & Sour Iberico Pork ‘Goo Lou Yok’, Hokkien Mee with Live Maine Lobster

    JÙN, weaving the essence of a charming dining scene, aims to deliver the authentic Singapore experience through its charismatic culinary expertise. Our chefs draw inspiration from Singapore’s rich migrant Nanyang heritage, fused with generations of local recipes to represent the melting pot of culture that is Singapore today. Highlighting the union of traditional cooking techniques paired with the freshest ingredients, JÙN puts a new spin on familiar Chinese and local cuisine, promising diners a hearty feast and a visual treat. At JÙN, patrons can indulge in conventional favourites such as Singaporean Chilli Crab, Teochew-style Steamed Fish, and Salted Egg Chicken. Diners can also look forward to experience innovative dishes like Chilli Crab Rillette Kueh Pie Tee, Beef Short Rib Rendang and Baked Chempedak Crumble. Situated at the heart of Chinatown, JÙN fills itself with a chinoiserie-chic interior brought out by oriental elements, multicoloured walls and furniture with a tinge of gold contrast to accentuate the overall design aesthetic. Ideal for an intimate family gathering, corporate events or even a romantic wedding, each visit warrants a tantalising meal that awakens one’s palates. (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Singaporean Chilli Crab, Teochew-style Steamed Fish, Salted Egg Chicken, Chilli Crab Rillette Kueh Pie Tee, Beef Short Rib Rendang, Baked Chempedak Crumble

    A great space for after work socials or casual catch ups, Jo is a specially curated venue for friends, family and colleagues to talk about dreams and aspirations. More than just a destination to unwind, explore the bar’s expansive selection of craft and imported beers, signature cocktails, and bar bites. Serving up modern day Japanese Western fusion cuisine, kickstart your night with the bar’s wide array of appetising bar bites before diving into heady house specials concocted for a night you won’t remember. Order the classic Smoke Salt Edamame to enjoy the classic Japanese soybeans drizzled with smoked sea salt to munch on while you sit by and watch the experienced bartenders shake up your drinks. For those looking for a light bite while sipping on cocktails, the Tofu Rice Pops or Cotija Corn Cobs are perfect menu options made for sharing as you jam to fast paced, eclectic beats that will fuel the generation of ideas and inspiration. Hearty meat options that are more filling include the Wagyu Slider, Holy Cow and the Yakitori Platter. (Oct 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Mention Ka-Soh to any self-respecting Singaporean and the reaction is always one of joy and enthusiasm. Ka-Soh, an institution beloved for its comforting, flavourful fish noodle soup, is a firm favourite across all generations.Available in a few variations based on the choice of the various parts of the Snakehead Fish, Ka-Soh’s Signature Fish Noodle Soup is milky, tangy, and robust. The juicy white rice noodles, together with the fragrant fish broth and crunchy vegetables, make it an unforgettable combination. Other zi char favourites, such as Prawn Paste Chicken, are also available on the menu. Each piece of the chicken is marinated with a generous coating of prawn paste before being deep-fried to a rich, golden-brown colour. Eaten piping hot, this dish is highly addictive. Another crowd-pleaser is the Fish Slices with Tossed Hor Fun and Bean Sprouts. Deceptively simple, the potent flavour of the dish comes from achieving the perfect balance between the saltiness of the fish against the crunchiness of the vegetables, as well as the softness of the hor fun noodles. Having been around for more than 40 years, and with an extensive array of traditional zi char dishes, plus its Signature Fish Noodle Soup, it is easy to see why Ka-Soh occupies a special place in every Singaporean foodie’s heart. (Feb 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Their signature fish head noodle is famous for the creamy texture of its soup.” -SG Now “Bestsellers include deep-fried chicken marinated in prawn paste, deep-fried cubes of salted tofu and a milky, fish-head beehoon noodle soup.” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rice with Shelled Large Prawns with Gravy, Fish Fillet with Ginger and Spring Onions, Frogs with Dried Chillies, Braised Sea Cucumber with Mushroom, Fish Fillet with Sliced Fish Noodles

  • MICHELIN GUIDE SINGAPORE 2017

    Ka-Soh has been awarded Bib Gourmand! Don't miss the chance to experience a Michelin-awarded restaurant.

    Found in the heart of the busy downtown core, Kaarla is a farm-to-plate restaurant that offers ‘Coastal Australian’ cuisine and makes use of the ocean’s finest alongside fresh ingredients to create a distinct palette. With the World's Highest Food Forest as its backyard and a scenic view of the cityscape, Kaarla offers a feast for both your eyes and taste buds. Helmed by Executive Chef John-Paul Fiechtner, each dish is a carefully curated work of art, Kaarla combines vibrant colours and unpretentious flavours to bring out the best of Australian cuisine. For appetisers, go for their Zucchini and Mussels that are topped with fresh tomatoes and trout roe. A burst of umami from the trout roe that perfectly combines with the natural sweetness of the mussels, this dish is the perfect starter to whet your appetites for more to come. Enjoy the flavours of the ocean with their beautifully seared Murray Cod with fennel juice, a dish featuring a delightful blend of spices along with juicy fresh cod. Or for a meatier option, go for their Lamb Saddle. This delicious loin of lamb is roasted to perfection and basted in a saltbush butter, giving it a unique roast flavour that leaves you wanting more with each bite. Masters of fire and the grill, Kaarla uses their expertise to create dishes that are full of flavour and that unique smokey goodness to enhance your dining experience here. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Zucchini and Mussels, Murray Cod, Lamb Saddle

html:
• ABOUT

    As the saying goes, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it" and Kai Garden at Marina Square Mall wisely heeds this advice. While the menu does serve a range of more modern items, the majority of the dishes feature traditional Cantonese flavours without introducing too many fancy tweaks. In fact, any change that executive chef and owner, Fung Chi Keung, makes is carefully chosen to enhance your dining experience. Dishes manage to achieve full flavours without compromising the delicate tastes of ingredients, and presentations don't lack for fun or interest. The Garoupa in Lobster Soup will have your server bringing forth a whole garoupa - freshly sliced - to be cooked in an intensely orange lobster soup right at your table. The resulting broth is deep and chock full of tender fish. Their Peking Duck is a signature, understandably so given the deliciously crispy skin, and will be sliced and prepared at the table to be served with a selection of innovative wraps and sauces. Not to worry, their less exorbitant items are equally as amazing. Try their surprisingly succulent Sweet & Sour Pork on the Rocks which are served like colourful lollipops on a bed of ice. With over 15 years and a previous position with Paradise Group, Chef Fung's expertise reaches from dim sum to excellent roasts, and Kai Garden is the perfect place to sample his creations. (Dec 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "But while the restaurant doesn't look remarkable, the food is. And if you are a foodie, you would agree that is so much more important." -The Straits Times "With these new recipes and presentations, you can truly sense (and taste) the excitement from Chef Fung's latest bout of inspiration. Kai Garden is a concept that marries tradition with the taking of risks, which, in our opinion, has paid off extremely well." -Honeycombers "If you're craving for elevated Chinese cuisine with a modern spin, then chef Fung Chi Keung is your man. Bring your family here for extra brownie points, as most of the dishes are meant for sharing." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Garoupa in Lobster Soup, Peking Duck, Sweet & Sour Pork on the Rocks, Double-Boiled Japanese Matsutake in Hot Pot

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    A casual Japanese bar dedicated to the twin pleasures of Yakitori and Premium sake, Kakurega oozes charm with an expansive menu that features items made from superior Japanese ingredients. Enter the lair and kickstart your Japanese dining experience with Oysters from Hyogo and Mie prefecture in Japan. Freshly shucked and delivered, these juicy oysters go best with a steaming hot bowl of Asari Miso Soup. Infusing a Japanese spin on the well-loved pork belly, the Chashu Ringo Sauce at Kakurega is a unique mix of pork belly and apple sauce. If you are a lamb lover, never leave the restaurant without ordering their Kohitsuji Yaki, a rack of lamb with garlic chips. For a grilled-meat lover, you can try the Gyu Tataki dish. The Meltique beef melts in the mouth with garlic chips as the side dish. Seafood dishes here include the Hotate Mentai and Shime Saba Aburi. The Hotate Mentai offers a mix of fresh scallops with Mentaiko sauce, and the must-try Shime Saba Aburi serves up a flamed-seared cured mackerel. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chashu Ringo Sauce, Kohitsuji Yaki, Hotate Mentai, Shime Saba Aburi, Kaki Ponzu, Gyu Tataki

    Kam's Roast has become a household name for succulent Hong Kong-style roasts ever since it arrived on our sunny shores in 2017. The outlets here are led by the same folks behind the original restaurant in Hong Kong, which have consistently garnered one Michelin star status since its opening. Signature dishes include the Roast Duck, a perfectly-roasted duck that's juicy on the inside yet crispy and golden on the outside, and the Suckling Pig, with paper-thin slices of crackling pork skin — a hallmark of culinary finesse. Other favourites are the Toro Char Siu, made from prime pork belly for the perfect balance of fat and meat, and the Wonton Noodles that come with plump prawn-and-pork dumplings. For a refreshing end to the meal, go for the Red Bean Soup with Aged Orange Peel, a subtly sweet dessert delicately brewed with premium red beans and orange peel that has been aged for at least a decade for the best flavour. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roast Duck, Suckling Pig, Toro Char Siu, Wonton Noodles, Red Bean Soup with Aged Orange Peel

    An authentic Japanese restaurant with a cosy ambience, Kan Sushi's beautiful interior is reminiscent of the hole-in-the-wall dining places commonly found in Japan. Using only the best seasonal fish imported from Asahi Fisheries to prepare the dishes, diners can expect nothing but the best from Kan Sushi. Keeping things fresh with the use of unique seasonal fish like hamo and shima-aji, diners can also look forward to different menu options each time they pop by. If you’re in the area for lunch, pay a visit to Kan Sushi to try out the Chirashi. A popular menu item, this fuss-free meal features ebi, uni, ikura, hotate and toro alongside other seasonal fishes and is a great quick meal fix. If you’re in the mood for a fancier meal, try the Omakase Lunch Course. Starting with three kinds of appetizers, this comprehensive eight course meal consists of the well-loved and innovative sushi and sashimi. Fried Japanese delights are also available at the restaurant. The Ebi Tempura and Yasai Tempura are signature favourites not to be missed out on. (Oct 2020)

Made for sharing, the Assorted Sashimi is a great platter of a variety of sushi. Take your pick of Makimono (Roll Sushi), Sashimi and traditional sushi favourites such as Sea Urchin, Salmon Roe and Unagi to fill up. Part of the lunch menu, this delicious set consists of a variety of Japanese favourites from half udon noodle and chawan mushi to four different kinds of tempura. Treat yourself to the Special Omakase Course and enjoy the best of Kan Sushi with six kinds of appetisers, five kinds of sashimi, dessert and more! (Oct 2020)

With a wealth of experience gained from training under world renowned chefs and working in multiple Michelin starred establishments, chef Kaji seeks to wow diners with his skills and knowledge in plating up his finest and personalised interpretation of Kappo specialities. Garnished with greens and crunchy peas, the Anago Rice is a tasty bowl filled with salmon sitting atop a bed of soft fluffy Japanese fried rice loved by many. Order this simple yet yummy main and elevate your dining experience when you pair with delectable side dishes such as the Shellfish and Steamed Bamboo Shoots. (Oct 2021)

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    This new venture promotes thoughtful living by challenging food norms that bring about unnecessary food wastage. Derived from the word "cosmos" - a system of thought, Kausmo is the brainchild of co-founders Lisa Tang and Kuah Chew Shian. The design of the 16-seater restaurant revolves around the concept of a "blank canvas", setting the stage for the transformation of aesthetically imperfect ingredients into delicious dishes. Every dish created at Kausmo incorporates thoughtfully sourced ingredients; seafood from small farming communities in the region, secondary cuts of meat which are often overlooked in favour of prime cuts, as well as forgotten native greens and florals. Combining European techniques with Asian influences, Lisa, who has worked at Pollen, Jaan, and Les Amis, demonstrates how lesser-loved ingredients are no less delicious than their popular counterparts. Expect to be greeted with a sense of comfort too as parts of the menu draws inspiration from the team's cultural roots, such as Lisa's Teochew heritage. Each meal at Kausmo presents a thoughtful approach for guests to think about how they can all make more conscientious choices in their everyday lives and contribute to a more sustainable ecosystem, in Singapore and beyond. The restaurant even has a dedicated retail and feature space that showcases works by local businesses, artists and craftsmen with thoughtfulness as their focus. Ultimately, Kausmo offers good food with a good cause, creating an authentic and warm space for conversations about thoughtful choices and conscientious living to happen around the dining table. (Jun 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wild Fish Congee, Chipotle-Berry Glazed Wagyu Beef D-Rump, Upside-Down Fruit Cake

    Kazbar is just the place to head to when you're yearning for life-changing Babaghanoush, craving tender grilled meats, or hankering for a little dose of Lebanon in Singapore. Widely known for having some of the best kebabs in town, this Far East Square hotspot is quintessential for everything from a laid-back lunch to a post-work hangout. Offering a menu with a wide range of Lebanese dishes - the Mixed Cold Mezzeh, Mixed Hot Mezzeh, and Mixed Grill Platter are perfect for trying a little taste of it all. Loaded with Hummus, Moutabel, Mohammarah, Babaganoush, and Tabbouleh, the Mixed Cold Mezzeh is one of our favourite appetisers on the menu. And for those hungry meat-eaters? There's plenty for you to feast on as well. The Mixed Grill Platter follows suit with juicy Lamb Chops, flavourful Shish Taouk, Chicken Kofta Kebab, and more! (Mar 2021)

    Having been in operation since 1993, Kazu Sumiyaki is an izakaya dining concept like no other. Featuring a seasonal menu that changes every other week, diners can expect a host of fresh and exciting dishes to wow their tastebuds away. Priding themselves on creating powerful meals to strengthen your health, Kazu’s menu is intricately prepared by Chef Kazu. Kazu’s grilled Foie Gras is highly raved with its melt-in-your-mouth texture and smoky flavour — the perfect dish to start off your dining experience. Try their Sawara Kizushi, which consists of marinated Spanish mackerel topped with Ikura for an explosion of umami and sweet ocean flavour. For meat options, their marinated beef tongue and steak is a crowd favourite, with the meat cut into bite-sized chunks — so you really get the most of its juicy flavour.To end off your meal on a sweet note, their Japanese Sweet Potato is a perfect delight that leaves a light aftertaste. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Foie Gras, Sawara Kizushi, Sin Ikura, Japanese Sweet Potato

  • ABOUT

    Kebaya Asian Indonesian by Rubato is a contemporary Indonesian restaurant located along the Turf Club Road. Styled with modern furnishing accompanied with a charming and cosy ambience, the restaurant brings fusion and classic flavours in perfect harmony. Serving deliciously crafted fusion dishes, feast on savoury dishes like Buntut Sapi Consummé Soup, a beef boneless oxtail soup that’s comfort in a bowl. The Maluku Ikan Gohu Ternate comprises tuna ceviche coated with crusted kemiri and kemangi that makes for a refreshing appetiser. For mains, we recommend Kebaya’s ULTIMATE ‘Tumpeng’, a traditional Indonesian dish that comprises a cone of rice in the middle and a mix of vegetables and meats on the side. Beautifully crafted, this dish is perfect for sharing with friends and family, or for diners wanting to sample a little of everything. Only available when you order a day in advance, be sure to call ahead before you enjoy this tasty platter. Fusion delights like their Foie Gras Bakmi bring an added flair to a homely dish — we’re in love with the umami and buttery flavours. For a dish closer to home, their Nasi Lemak Ayam Taliwang brings you back to the good old flavour of authentic Indonesian cuisine for the ultimate indulgence. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Buntut Sapi Consummé Soup, Maluku Ikan Gohu Ternate, “Balangan” Gurita Bakar, Kebaya’s ULTIMATE “TUMPENG”, Foie Gras Bakmi

    Keef The Beef is a steakhouse in Singapore that uses the highest grading USA steak, expect a divine steak experience with an emphasis on tenderness and meat structure. Apart from carefully selecting premium quality beef, each steak is also sous vide before the grilling process to ensure precise doneness. Afterwhich, the steak is grilled into a crust at perfectly high temperatures to lock in all the flavour to ensure deliciousness in every bite. Sink your teeth into a beautifully charred and juicy hunk of meat with their range to steaks, from the New Zealand Grassfed Ribeye to the top of the line Australian F1 Wagyu Op Rib. Broiled in a deluge of melted butter, the USDA Prime Beef is an indulging dish not to be missed out on. The restaurant also offers starters and sides for sharing before you dive into the mains. Made in-house, the Handcut Fries are crunchy and tasty — a great way to whet your appetite while you await your steak! (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Handcut Fries, New Zealand Grass Fed Ribeye, Australian F1 Wagyu Op Rib, USDA Prime Beef

    This omakase restaurant at Keong Saik Road serves high quality Japanese delights made with ingredients imported fresh from various fish markets across Japan. Kei Hachi invites diners to take a seat along the restaurant’s 15-seater bar specially designed to showcase the thoughtfully presented dishes crafted by experienced chefs. With three different omakase courses to choose from, experience a fully authentic dining experience when you order from Kei Hachi’s range of exclusive Hachi boxes and pair your meal with an exquisite bottle of sake from the extensive sake list. We recommend going for the Hachi set meal which includes two kinds of seasonal appetiser, a mouthwatering platter of seasonal premium sashimi, a cooked dish and as many as seven pieces of Nigiri sushi. Served alongside traditional classic bites such as the Japanese steamed egg, soup and sweet dessert, this set meal is the perfect hearty feast of sashimi and sushi to reward yourselves with after a long day at work. If you’re dining in groups of two or more, the Kei Hachi omakase set features two cooked dishes and nine different pieces of nigiri sushi. Still hungry after dessert? Simply top up a yummy bowl of Sakura Ebi Inaniwa Udon or the Kaisen Hachi Box for a filling meal. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kei, Hachi, Sakura Ebi Inaniwa Udon, Kaisen Hachi Box

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/kei-hachi

html:
• ABOUT

    Googled Mellben Seafood Toa Payoh but your efforts were in vain? Fear not, Mellben’s Toa Payoh offshoot has merely undergone rebranding and is now known as Kelly Jie Seafood. Wondering who Kelly Jie is? She’s the superwoman behind the scenes, having been the bustling restaurant’s manager since its opening in 2006. She has even become somewhat of an icon as regulars greet her by the affectionate term “jie”, or “sister” in English. Queues at this humble restaurant known for its out-of-this-earth seafood delights are still as long as ever, so remember to book your place before heading down to secure your place at the coveted dining table. In fact, there’s word around town that you haven’t experienced Mellben if you haven’t slurped up their signature Claypot Crab Thick Bee Hoon Soup, where sweet crab meat and generous portions of comfy bee hoon is served in a thick, milky broth. Kelly Jie’s Chilli Crab, the famous local delight, also reaches heavenly status in our books with its thick and luscious sweet and spicy egg sauce. Don’t forget to order some fried mantou buns to help you soak up all that divine goodness! Other perennial crowd favourites include Cereal Prawns, Wasabi Mayo Prawn, and Coffee Pork Ribs, so it’s about time you gather your crew for a big night out! (Jul 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Crab Thick Bee Hoon Soup, Cereal Prawns, Wasabi Mayo Prawn, Salted Egg Yolk Crab, Coffee Pork Ribs

  • THE BUZZ

    “It is in Singapore that some of the best food is found at inconspicuous/innocuous places, and Mellben Seafood is one of these. The gravy used in their version of chilli crab is a little spicier with sweet and sour tones, and their crabs are reliably meaty and fresh.” -City Nomads “Known for serving Chinese cuisine with a local twist, the restaurant’s signature dish – the claypot crab vermicelli soup – is legendary for the thick, milky broth and sweet crab essence. Or, if you want some good ol’ fashioned crab, order up the buttery Golden Sands Crab and a plate of fried mantou to soak up the gravy.” -Honeycombers

    Feast your eyes and stomach on the finest sushi made with the freshest imports direct from Japan. The perfect space to hold business meetings and special events, delight your guests with mouth-watering sushi, exquisite sake and seasonal omakase specials when you choose to dine at Ken Japanese Restaurant.Helmed by prize winning head chef Ryo Endo who has honed his skills for as many as 10 years in Miyajima and Hiroshima, diners can expect nothing but the best of Japanese cuisine from the restaurant’s kitchen. Drop by during lunch break to dig into tasty and affordable lunch set items such as the Grilled Saba Set, Salmon & Ikura Don, Tempura Don and more! A premium lunch set menu item is the Wagyu, Sashimi and Sushi set. Indulge in tender slices of quality wagyu beef served alongside fresh sashimi and traditional sushi pieces. For a fancier dining option, diners can go for the Omakase course menu to enjoy a 5 course meal. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Saba Set, Salmon & Ikura Don, Wagyu, Sashimi and Sushi, Omakase

• ABOUT

    Sitting pretty on the 4th level of Pan Pacific Singapore, Keyaki is an elegant Japanese restaurant that has a whole lot to offer. Boasting a menu with freshly sourced sashimi, authentically prepared teppanyaki, immaculately presented sukiyaki, and more - this Japanese wonderland is ideal for just about any occasion. Renowned for the masterful skills of their chefs, Keyaki serves up a culinary experience that is as fresh as the quality seasonal ingredients they use. Our favourites? The Yaki Nasu, Japanese Grilled Eggplant, is simple yet delicious while the Sukiyaki Prix Fixe is a sophisticated presentation of a few of their finest dishes. The impeccable eats, along with their serene koi pond and beautifully sculpted Japanese garden provide an authentic setting for an exquisite epicurean journey. (Mar 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Where do you go when you want excellent Japanese food in a nice restaurant but don't want to break the bank? Here. This stalwart in the Japanese dining scene has been around for years and has cultivated a strong, loyal following." -SG Now "Like a well orchestrated culinary symphony, Keyaki's Kaiseki Omakase set brings you on a ride of emotions expressed through the chef's selections. You can expect your taste buds to be brought on a roller coaster adventure of wide-ranging taste, from the simply seasoned appetizers to the heart-attack inducing mains." -Seth Lui

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seasonal Omakase Kaiseki, Sukiyaki Prix Fixe, Yaki Nasu, Nikudoufu Kushiyaki, Moriawase Gyuniku, Hotatemaki, Mitarashi Dango

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    The flavours of India comes alive at Khansama Tandoori Restaurant, a casual and wallet-friendly eatery located on Serangoon Road that stands out with its straightforward, no-nonsense Indian cuisine that is so authentic you’ll feel as though you’ve been whisked back to the Punjab region. Like any good Indian restaurant, there are numerous options for vegetarians such as the delicious appetiser Tandoori Gobhi where cauliflower pieces marinated in yogurt and spices are beautifully baked in a charcoal oven. Meanwhile, the house specialty Bharwan Masala Baingani is not to be missed. Here, sliced eggplants are stuffed with a spicy dry masala mix and sautéed to perfection. Meat lovers, on the other hand, need not despair, as the dining joint serves up an equally mind-boggling array of meat dishes. The Chicken Manchurian is a unique dish that fuses fuses the best of Indian and Chinese cuisine. Featuring boneless chicken, this meat is then chopped into cubes and fried before being slathered in a sauce made of sweet and sour gravy and soy sauce. Finally, might we recommend ordering up several freshly cooked Naan to mop up the remaining bits from the stews and curries. Sate your Indian cuisine cravings with some of downright excellent fare at Khansama Tandoori Restaurant. (Feb 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tandoori Gobhi, Bharwan Masala Baingani, Chicken Manchurian, Mutton Korma, Strawberry Lassi

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/khansama-tandoori-restaurant
name: Khansama Tandoori Restaurant

    Meaning “aristocratic craftsmanship”, Ki-sho reflects a value deeply ingrained in every aspect of the dining journey we intend for our guests. From the architecture of the building and the vessels that contain the food, right down to the seasonally inspired ingredients you savour and the sake you sip, Ki-sho is a culinary showcase for Japanese artisanship delivered with omotenashi. Set in a heritage black-and-white bungalow along Scotts Road that once served as a residence for colonial era civil servants, Ki-sho offers a kappo-style dining room with an L-shaped hinoki wood counter that sits 11 guests. Additionally, two dining rooms –for eight and 12 guests respectively -on the upper deck offer guests an exclusive space to dine in complete privacy.(Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Precise execution, combined with an overwhelming generosity in the use of premium ingredients, makes a meal at Ki-Sho one that impresses." -The Peak Magazine

    If you’re a fan of board games, and looking to disconnect from your computer screen for awhile, King and The Pawn is where you can do just that. This cafe and bar along Purvis Street is decorated in a cosy and chic fashion, taking inspiration from old-school games like Snakes & Ladders and Tetris. Spot the hanging ladder against the brick wall, or the drinks’ coasters made with Scrabble tiles! Choose your favourite from a selection of over 300 board games, and order up some tasty nibbles to share. The camembert brulee is perfect for two to three, where you get slices of crostini to dip into the wheel of gooey cheese, along with some roasted grapes and pears. Grilled cheese sandwich gets a quirky twist with the addition of date bacon jam, and if you’re here for brunch, don’t miss the spiced apple French toast with nutty maple bacon and swirls of salted caramel. Recharge your brain with a selection of locally-roasted coffees, or craft beers and cocktails if you’re playing on into the night! (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffled Honey Croque Madame, Spiced Apple French Toast, Camembert Brulee, Date Bacon Jam & Cheese

    Delivering amazing flavours at great value, King Army Stew is dedicated to bringing you an authentic taste of Korea in a fun, intimate and casual setting. Located in Fortune Centre, the eatery is conveniently located within walking distance from Bugis MRT station. With four types of stew available at King Army Stew, diners will find themselves spoilt for choice. The Classic Army Stew is a brimming pot of onions, lettuce, luncheon meat, bacon, kimchi, mushrooms and more stewed in the eatery’s homemade spicy paste, topped with a yummy layer of cheddar cheese. Add-ons such as chicken franks, tteokbokki and other seafood delights are also available. Crafted by their very own Korean chef, this steaming hot stew was specially modified to suit local taste buds! Complete your meal with King Army Stew’s signature Kimchi and Bacon Pancake. Seafood lovers can opt for the Seafood Pancake instead. Stuffed with squid, prawn, scallop and cheese, this delicious rendition of the classic Korean delight is not to be missed out on! Those with a lighter palette will enjoy the Beef Bulgogi Stew. Peppered with fresh mushrooms, glass noodles and marinated beef bulgogi in a clean taste broth, this menu option is great for sharing. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Classic Army Stew, Beef Bulgogi Stew, Kimchi and Bacon Pancake, Seafood Pancake

  • href

• ABOUT

    If you’re looking for steamboat with some extra ‘kick’, then boy do we have the place for you. With a name like King’s Laksa Steamboat, we can’t help but think that it’s rare to see so many good things crammed into a restaurant name – it just calls to mind the image of steaming spoonfuls of spicy laksa soup being ladled into your bowl, complete with the richness of flavour that only truly quality steamboat can have. To sweeten the deal, you won’t have to break the bank to feast like a king here (apologies for the pun); for extremely affordable prices, you’ll get a yummy, all-you-can-eat experience that’ll leave you full to bursting and satisfied beyond measure. As mentioned earlier, the eponymous Laksa Soup Base is an undisputed hit and a definite must-try. You won’t regret sipping on this intensely flavoursome concoction that’ll leave you with a warm, tingling sensation down to your fingertips! Take your pick from other soup bases as well, with flavours such as Seafood and Mala among them. And of course, no steamboat is complete without ingredients to throw into the soup; choose from old favourites such as Pork Belly and Fresh Prawns, and after you’ve made your selections, just settle down and dig into a nourishing spread that promises to make your dining experience one to remember! (Nov 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Laksa Soup Base, Seafood Soup Base, Mala Soup Base, Pork Belly, Sliced Beef, Flower Crab, Cockles, Kelp Strips
