  • ABOUT

    A heavyweight in the sushi counter-culture, Kinki Restaurant has been wowing the hip and tasteful crowds along Marina Bay for years, and the throngs of merrymakers show no signs of slowing down. Situated atop the Customs House building with knockout views of MBS, it's no surprise to learn that Kinki has some celebrity backing. However, given the edgy, underground vibe of the place, it makes sense that the celebrity in question is a fictional sumo wrestler, who defies all odds to allow his culinary alter ego to shine. His story is etched all over the restaurant and bar, from the wild floor mural by an artist of "Miami Ink" TV fame, to the graffiti clad walls and comic book styled menu. Despite the laidback persona of the place - with sneaker-wearing waitstaff and up-to-the-moment beats always pumping - the cuisine at Kinki Restaurant is nonetheless inventive, high-end and would make the restaurant's namesake proud. A palatable selection of mains includes the High Roller Wagyu Don - features ohmi A4 wagyu, Hokkaido uni, ikura, summer black truffle, onsen egg, Premium Unagi Claypot with homemade umami sauce and more. There's also traditional sushi and sashimi handled by masterful chefs behind the ice bar. "Rock & Roll" offers an interesting mix of creative maki rolls that lesser sushi restaurants are too risk-averse to try. If there ever were a sushi bar bold enough to go for it, while still paying respects to the artistry of the cuisine, Kinki would be it. The Foie Gras and Scallop Nigiri features delicate, pan seared foie with a plump, juicy Hokkaido-bred scallop, while the Golden Age offers an expert balance of meaty fish and bright fruit. There are more filling mains and cleverly crafted cold dishes as well, a selection that is well suited for any range of hunger. On the alfresco front, level three rooftop bar is a frequent hangout for the after-work crowd, with a plentiful selection of sake as well as the envelope-pushing cocktails you would expect from such a thrilling spot as Kinki. Long-standing favourites are the Kinki Mango Mint and Gin Berry. Their food menu also features an array of small bites such as Karaage Chicken Bao and Squid and chips. Now a well-established mainstay along the Marina Bay waterfront, rest assured there are no kinks to be worked out in Kinki Restaurant's daring and delicious concept. (Aug 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Strategically located on the second floor of the iconic Customs House, this modern Japanese bar and restaurant has been blazing the nightlife and dining scene here with its beautiful crowds, delish food and cool drinks." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Golden Age, Cowabunga, High Roller Wagyu Don, Unagi Claypot, Crusty Lamb Rack, Crispy Ume Kurobuta, Kickass Chrashi Don, Ohmi Wagyu Houba Yaki, Wagyu Garlic Teppanyaki, Pomegranate Miso Black Cod

  • KINKI’S BOTTOMLESS BRUNCH (SAT, SUN & SELECTED PH)

    Every Saurday, Sunday and on selected holidays, Kinki Restaurant presents their Bottomless Brunch with an exclusive menu, available between 12pm to 3pm. So filliing, it’ll be hard to keep your pants from popping! Bottomless BrunchDay: Every Saturday, Sunday and selected public holidays*Time: 12-3pm (Last Order: 2:15pm)Menu: Click here to view the menuPrice: $68++ per person for free-flow food only (the “Mains” section is a one-time order only, while every other food section is free-flow). Top up an additional $38++ to enjoy a choice of free-flow Sake, Shochu, Beer, or Prosecco!Kindly contact the outlet directly for less than 4 pax reservations.*Selected public holidays are as follows: 10 April, 1 May, 7 May, 24 May, 31 July, 8 & 9 August, 14 November, 16 November, 25 & 31 December

    Ongi Etorri (Welcome) to the Basque Country. Kinou is all about what Basque Country has to offer. Featuring rustic, traditional dishes with a local touch, chef-owner Benjamin helms this concept with fine wine to complement the flavors.  Hailing from Bayonne, Chef Benjamin brings the Spirit of South Western France: lots of good food and wines at a great price point. The perfect place to celebrate whilst having an opulent dinner and creating memories, Kinou is all about sharing, eating and drinking with friends and family.  Bringing a part of Basque, all products sourced at Kinou are curated close to home and heart. Its delectable offerings include Foie Gras au Torchon & Armagnac, a recipe passed down from his grandmother, as well as meaty items such as the Txuleta (OP Rib). Confit in duck fat is combined with make agria deep fried potatoes and rendered French Duck Fat for the perfect flavour match. Alternatively, go for the Beef Tartare with Bellota Chorizo cream and Caviar, a dish loaded with premium ingredients to indulge your taste buds. In essence, Kinou is known in French as “Bon Vivant”, for that luxurious lifestyle which you and your guests can enjoy.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Tartare, Kokotxe, Coq au Vin, Rossini

• ABOUT

    Indonesian cuisine has much to offer - we've had those cravings for addictive sambal heat, tender rendang, not to mention the depth and savouriness that come from a masterful combination of spices - and Furama RiverFront's halal-certified Kintamani Restaurant is a fantastic place to savour it all. A delectable buffet spread boasts authentic bites like Gado Gado Jakarta (a traditional mix of vegetables and peanut sauce) and Mee Soto Ayam (egg noodles in clear chicken broth topped with shredded chicken), as well as mains such as Rendang Daging Sumatra (richly spiced beef braised in thick coconut gravy) and Tahu Telur Surabaya (deep-fried beancurd and egg tossed with grated vegetables and spicy sauce). Second guessing your choice to go a la carte? Don't worry, that menu is equally packed with enticing delights like Udang Goreng Mentega (deep-fried buttered prawns tossed with egg yolk and curry leaves), Sate Lilit Bali (minced seafood skewered with lemongrass Balinese style), and Rojak Mangga Muda (Indonesian young mango salad) - all paired with fragrant rice, of course. These traditional beauties and fusion fare are the work of talented Chef I Gusti Nyoman Kaler and his team, so if you've got a sudden desire for lovely Indonesian plates, trot down to Kintamani where their expertise will leave you with a leisurely meal or delicious takeaway. (Mar 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Kintamani Indonesian Restaurant blends a medley of heady spice and flavor in its menu, bringing its 'A' game to the table of this homey yet comfortable space that is over two decades old." -Best of Halal "The staff here were attentive and always had a genuine smile on their face, which we found delightful." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gado Gado Jakarta, Rendang Daging Sapi, Tahu Telur Surabaya, Udang Goreng Mentega, Rojak Mangga Muda, Iga Daging Sapi Bakar, Ikan Bakar Jimbaran, Es Chendol

  • INDONESIA BUFFET PRICING

    Established since 1985, relish the best in Halal Indonesian cuisine over a delectable buffet spread as well as a savoury a la carte menu at Kintamani Indonesian Restaurant. Chef Sukimin leads the team to present diverse offerings with traditional Balinese cuisine as well as modern update with fusion Indonesian fare. • ABOUT

    Healthy food and great taste go hand in hand at Kitchen by Food Rebel. We'd say half the battle is won when the meals are made from scratch, omitting any refined sugars, MSG or artificial preservatives. Coupled with an innovative menu that combines both Western and Eastern flavours, the health nuts at Chope are sold. Kickstart your day with the cafe's energy-boosting selection of breakfast items such as the Cinnamon-Spiced Overnight Oats or the hearty breakfast platter with the works. Come lunchtime, keep your health game going strong with one of their well-loved Rebel Buddha Bowls. These nutritious, well-balanced bowls taste as good as they look. When the midday sugar craving hits, the snacks and cakes provide a guilt-free indulgence. Whether you're a meat-lover, vegan, or just looking to lead a healthier lifestyle, Kitchen by Food Rebel is one stop you shouldn't miss. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ultimate Breakfast, Cinnamon Spiced Overnight Oats, Chicken Protein Buddha Bowl, The Rebel Chicken Burger

    the kitchen table brings to life a culmination of culinary finesse and the electrifying vibes of W Singapore – Sentosa Cove’s tropical locale. Step through our doors and satiate your appetite anytime of the day. Centered on sustainability and pursuing prime freshness through sourcing local produce, witness palatial displays of seafood, fiery grills and glowing embers in the signature pizza oven as the restaurant innovates at the forefront of the latest food trends, interweaving global influences with a uniquely local insider touch. As the day gives way to stunning sunset hues, wind down on the terrace as you immerse yourself in W Hotels’ iconic cocktail culture. (Dec 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "And we've got to admit, our expectations were more than met. In fact, we were blown away, reminiscent of young children attending their first ever buffet!" -City Nomads

html:
• ABOUT

    KITEN is a kaiseki restaurant in Singapore that brings a unique fine dining experience to impress diners. Fresh ingredients come together in a perfect harmony of flavor with Kiten’s specially curated courses, courtesy of their talented culinary team. With a deliciously unique kaiseki menu, we recommend the special Chef Tasting Menu that guarantees a minimum of nine courses in almost every style of cooking. This menu keeps you on your toes as you guess what’s to come for each course, similar to an omakase. KITEN also boasts an alfresco dining area where they serve affordable teppanyaki lunch sets. If you’re going for a more premium option, their Miyazaki Wagyu Teppanyaki Set is the best way to indulge yourself. Gloriously marbled beef grilled to perfection in front of you, it’s the ultimate show stopper. After a sumptuous meal, wash it all down with a delicious cup of sake, paired with their homemade jelly to end off your meal on a high. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chef Tasting Menu, Kaiseki 9 Course Menu, Teppanyaki Lunch Set, Miyazaki Wagyu Teppanyaki Set, Sashimi Zen

html:
• ABOUT

    Built around the concept of bringing the community together over good coffee, food and company, Kith is the quintessential all day hangout. The heavenly aroma of roasted coffee beans is just the start of the mouth-watering experience at Kith. Using a rotating custom blend of specialty beans from various regions such as Brazil and India, coffee drinkers can look forward to a consistent cup of joe that is smooth, thick-bodied, with underlying tones of dark fruits and cocoa. Known for its tasty breakfast bites like Housemade Pancakes with poached pears, mixed berries and honey mascarpone, and the all-too photogenic Better than Benny with a mouthwatering combination of poached eggs, crispy bacon and creamy hollandaise, Kith also serves up a delectable Wagyu Beef Burger that comes laden with sharp cheddar, caramelised onions, and avocado mayo. For those on the lookout for something healthy yet hearty, Kith's Super Salad, power-packed with quinoa, greens, kale, walnuts and more, is sure to garner high praise from the healthy set. On the other side of the spectrum, the Carbonara pasta with morsels of smoky bacon in an indomitable creamy egg and parmesan sauce is always a smart way to go! (Jan 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Calamari, Kith Super Salad, Roasted Pumpkin Salad, Carbonara, Gnocchi, Wagyu Beef Burger, Kith Super Juice, Ice Blended Watermelon Lychee

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/kith-cafe-ascott-orchard

  • ABOUT

    Looking for the ultimate bowl of ramen crafted with Hokkaido wheat? Simmered over 10 hours using 100% Japanese pork bones, the broth from this ramen restaurant perfectly complements the noodles. Experience the exquisite flavours of Japan through the restaurant’s carefully selected menu that features top notch ingredients imported directly from Okinawa. Dig into a bowl of the signature Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen. Made with the restaurant’s original recipe pork bone broth, savour this flavoursome bowl of springy noodles with your loved ones for an intimate dining session. For the spice lovers, there’s no greater challenge than the Red Tonkotsu Ramen. Heating things up with Japanese red chilli oil and a dash of hot miso paste, this fiery broth is a dish made for those who simply can’t live without spice. Add-on options such as corn, beansprouts, Toroniku Cha Shu and more are also available on the menu. Swimming in a rich Tonkotsu broth, the huge prawns in the Hokkaido Ebi Tonkotsu enhances the delicious flavour of the thick broth. A dry version of this popular dish can also be found on Kiwami’s expansive menu. (Feb 2021)

    Kiwami Tonkotsu Ramen, Red Tonkotsu Ramen, Hokkaido Ebi Tonkotsu, Tantan Mazesoba

    A culinary celebration of Japan's seasons, Kiyose features Kaiseki cuisine by Head Chef, Shimpei Taniguchi. Born in Hiroshima, Japan, Shimpei-san grew up surrounded by the Seto Naikai, or Seto Inland Sea, and its neighboring mountains where he nurtured his craft amidst a wide variety of locally harvested seafood and vegetables. With this incredible access to produce at his doorstep and a natural sense of curiosity, Shimpei-san’s cuisine features bold, unique flavors and textures within the traditional sphere of Kaiseki-ryori. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sakura Ebi sushi, Maguro Maki, Shiizakana, Hassun, Tsukuri and Seasonal Donabe

html:
• ABOUT

    Kiyoshi Japanese Restaurant specialises in Inaniwa udon, a type of udon made in the Inaniwa area of Inakawa Machi, Akita prefecture. Slightly thinner than your regular udon but thicker than somen or hiyamugi noodles, this cream coloured udon is hand-stretched for that great bite. With a main focus in providing light and wholesome dishes, try a hefty selection of chilled and warm udon, as well as Nabe Mono, with udon in a hotpot — there’s also a kimchi edition! Besides seafood and meat, there are also options for vegetarians. For a light teaser of its many udon varieties, try the canape-like Kiyoshi Combination Udon, with three kinds of Japanese cold noodles: Ikura Salmon Udon, Tempura Udon, and Nebaneba Udon. Love Japanese curry rice? Try it with udon — the Pork Katsu Curry Udon is our top pick. While this Japanese restaurant attracts udon lovers, lovers of the cuisine can also enjoy other dishes in the menu that include sushi and sashimi platters, rice bowls, ramen, and more. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aburi Salmon Salad Udon, Kiyoshi Combination Udon, Kimchi Nabeyaki Udon, Prawn Udon

html:
• ABOUT

    As caffeine addicts, we like to think of coffee as the elixir of life that helps us power through the day. And after sampling many of the specialty coffee places around town, we can honestly say Knockhouse Cafe stands out above the crowd for its well-crafted cups of joe. Nestled on Upper Thomson Road, Knockhouse Cafe is the brainchild of the good people behind Oz Specialty Coffee and their Thai counterparts. The result is a sleek and starkly minimalistic cafe that’s the perfect venue for a mid-day hangout session where you can sip on a cup of coffee while soaking in the sunlight pouring in from their ceiling-to-floor windows. Aside from the coffees, this bistro also pumps out a fair number of cafe bites that are equal parts hearty and equal parts pleasing. Kick off the morning with large plates such as Breakfast Platter, featuring oodles of toast, grilled corn, pork sausage, hash, thick bacon, amongst others. Not a fan of breakfast? Then you won’t go wrong with unforgettable picks such as the Cajun Chicken Burger or the Wild Mushroom Aglio Olio. Whether you’re here for a casual business lunch or a lazy Sunday brunch, Knockhouse Cafe is a spot that’s worth checking out the next time you’re in the neighbourhood. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Yet another coffee roasters pops up, this time by the folks behind Oz Specialty Coffee.” –SG Magazine

    Inspired by its seafront setting, guests can enjoy a refreshing Mediterranean dining experience in an intimate and inviting atmosphere at The Knolls at Capella Singapore. The Knolls is one of Singapore's finest Mediterranean restaurants with a showcase of authentic specialties from the Mediterranean Sea. (Feb 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For intimate discussions in an alfresco, laid-back atmosphere, The Knolls, Capella Singapore’s all-day fine dining restaurant is the place to head to. Mornings are the best time to indulge in the tantalizing buffet spread alongside breathtaking views of the South China Sea." -Travel & Leisure Southeast Asia "The highlight of the meal is their version of churros, the Spanish style doughnut. This one came paired with three ramekins of chocolate, lemon and whipped cream. While chocolate seems to be the most natural pairing, it was the lemon cream that added the perfect tang to the sweetness of the doughnut. It's just the right way to end the meal." -Asia Tatler Dining "The Knolls has always been more well-known for its popular teatime sets, and the launch of its latest menu that sees dashes of Mediterranean influences, is set to ride on the popularity of its teatime offering. And in true Mediterranean style, the menu places much importance on healthier choices, and is even thoughtfully segmented into "Hearty Selections for Gentlemen" (healthy dishes that are still rich and flavoursome) as well as "On the Lighter Side for Ladies" (light, low-carbohydrate salads, soups and menu items)." -Lifestyle Asia "The service is warm and friendly, the decor slick and the menu offerings solid." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Croquettes, Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, Seared Barramundi Fillet

  • REFRESHED MENU OF THE KNOLLS

    Experience the essence of classic Mediterranean cuisine with The Knolls’ refreshed menu. Tucked away in a scenic tropical setting overlooking the resort’s cascading pools, The Knolls promises an exciting culinary journey, offering a sumptuous array of fresh seafood, salads and succulent meats seasoned with the finest herbs and spices. Available daily, 12pm to 10pm

  • ABOUT

    KOAL Grill is an authentic charcoal grill concept located in Shaw Centre. Utilising Western and Eastern grill techniques to bring out the most in their grilled meats, enjoy this unique combination of flavours in their lunch and dinner menu. For lunch, KOAL offers a modest spread of rice bowl sets to choose from. You’re guaranteed a generous portion of delicious grilled specialties to satisfy yourself in their one-dish meals. For a heartier option, go for their Grass Fed Ribeye or Iberico Pork Collar Rice Bowls, with the meats nicely charred with a hint of smoky flavour. For dinner, we recommend ordering their dinner Bread Rolls to start off your meal. Topped with bacon, sour cream and chive butter, this savoury bread roll is the perfect appetiser to share around the table. If you love salmon, their Salmon with Kimchi Butter Sauce is a lovely rich main that comes with a hint of spice and umami. Meatier options like their Iberico Pork Chop and Hanging Tender are great for sharing, allowing you to get a taste of everything. Don’t miss out on their sauces either. A crowd favourite to pair with their delicious grilled delights is the Yakiniku no Tare, a creamy sauce with confit garlic that melts into any meat. Last but not least, their Hojicha and Whiskey Tiramisu is a great all-day dessert that lets you end on a light and boozy note. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prawns with Beurre Blanc Sauce, KOAL’s Bread Roll, Makgeolli & Strawberries, Iberico Pork Collar Rice Bowl, Iberico Pork Chop

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/koal
name: KOAL

html:
• ABOUT

    Immerse yourself in Koh Nangkam’s long list of authentic Thai dishes that aims to bring the southern flavours of the country to the table. Located a stone’s throw away from Bugis MRT, this two-storey restaurant features a cosy interior with numerous seating options. Quench your thirst with a refreshing cup of Coconut Nectar. Colourful and flavourful, this makes for an invigorating start. The restaurant’s signature Koh Nangkam Steamed Sea Bass is great for sharing. A wonderfully aromatic dish, the fish is steamed with ginger and plum. Tinged with a hint of herbs, the succulent flesh is light on the palate. For those who prefer a spicier kick to their fish, the Steamed Lemon Sea Bass is a great option to consider. Sweet, sour and fiery, this classic Thai dish is peppered with chilli padi for an extra dash of heat. Indulge in Phad Thai with a twist here at Koh Nangkam. Stir fried and cut into smaller pieces, the mouthwatering noodles feature generous toppings of squid, prawn and fresh cabbage, giving the dish a commendable crunch. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Koh Nangkam Steamed Sea Bass, Steamed Lemon Sea Bass, Phad Thai, Coconut Nectar

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/koh-nangkam
name: Koh Nangkam

html:
• ABOUT

    Named after the culture that is used in the brewing of various fermented ingredients in Japanese cuisine, this spot has a simple menu focused only on quality sashimi and sushi. This restaurants provides bang for diners’ bucks, with undersized servings of rice topped with oversized pieces of seafood at bargain prices. The sushi is made from Japanese rice that is imported, and cooked in charcoal-filtered water to get the most authentic taste possible. The Kome platter is the perfect item to try all the best that Koji has to offer. A 10-piece dish made with swordfish, tuna, salmon, and various other premium seafoods, this plate is a collection of some of Koji’s most popular menu items, and is priced affordably. Not a fan of sushi? There are also some innovative Donburi dishes that you’ll want to get your hands on. The Salmon Avocado Tartare Don bring together the buttery flavour of avocado and the tenderness of salmon to make a delicious dish that is perfect with a glass of Sake. This spot even has an affordable Omakase set available for diners who wish to leave their dining experience entirely in the hands of the chef - and with the attention to detail here, you know you’re in good hands. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon and Roe Rice Bowl, Wagyu Sukiyaki + Gohan, Koji Sashimi Moriwase, Sushi Set C

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/koji-sushi-bar-pickering-street

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Koji Sushi Bar is a trendy and casual Japanese sushi and sashimi-only joint with a simple menu focusing on quality fresh sea produce and with speed and affordability in the day to cater to office crowd. In the evening, Omakase (chef decide) menu is served along with a good selection of sake and shochu for a relaxed dining experience. This restaurant is committed to using the Japan-produced rice and charcoal-filtered water to achieve the best tasting sushi rice. Diners have a choice of white rice or the healthier mixed grain rice for their donburi. There is a small but carefully selected range of artisan sake, shochu and craft beer for the diners. (Jun 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chirashi Don, Salmon Avocado Tartare Rice Bowl, Nigiri Sushi

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Featuring sushi, robata and izakaya style dining, KOMA is a Japanese restaurant and sushi bar offering a modern interpretation of Japanese cuisine through innovative, original creations. The restaurant also boasts a bar and lounge that serves an extensive selection of over 30 types of sake sourced from across Japan. Designed by renowned American design firm Rockwell Group, the 230-seat restaurant, bar and lounge is truly a one-of-a-kind work of art that is breathtaking in every way. Guests arrive through a striking 20 metre-long passageway that is inspired by the torii gates of the Fushimi Inari Shrine in Kyoto. Once inside the bar and lounge, guests are greeted by glass owls which line both the bar and a large wood "grid" suspended from the ceiling. The owls represent wisdom, luck, and good fortune. The "WOW" moment however, is the 2.5 metre-high Japanese bell with 20 different faces that overlooks a traditional Japanese foot bridge and reflecting pool. The soaring 7-metre high ceiling features decorative acoustic panels in the shape of lily pads and is designed to mimic the surface of a pond. Anchoring the dining room is the 15-seat sushi bar with a dazzling display of the day's offerings. On the mezzanine floor, a semi-private dining room caters to intimate group gatherings, while offering an expansive view of the action below.

  • DINERS' CHOICE 2020 - MOST ROMANTIC RESTAURANT

    Our diners have voted KOMA Singapore as 'Most Romantic Restaurant' in Chope Diners' Choice 2020.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Pillow, D.I.Y. Spicy Tuna (Do It Yourself), KOMA Roll, Wild Mushroom Fried Rice, Hobayaki Snow Aged Niigata Wagyu Ribeye

    Located in the heart of Orchard Road yet tucked away from the bustle is KOMYUNITI. Opened on 1st November 2018, KOMYUNITI, located on the 10th floor of YOTEL, is a place where people connect over food and drinks. KOMYUNITI presents a completely curated food and cocktail menu and is currently helmed by Head Chef Mark Tai and F&B Manager, As’ad Isnin – both of whom will bring guests on a journey with their various experiences, inspirations and memories. The menus feature dishes and drinks that are all about fun and creativity, ensuring that a visit will always be memorable. (Nov 2018)

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Chef Willin Low, a pioneer of Mod-Sin cuisine and industry veteran, is currently the Chef partner at The Kongsee. He’s changing the game by reinvigorating Singapore’s food culture through ‘imaginative’ cooking methods with a modern twist. Bringing Mod-Sin cuisine to a chic, sultry underground lounge in the heart of the city, The Kongsee exudes elegance through good food and good ambience.  Curating a delicate menu that highlights the best of Singapore cuisine, this fine dining industrial-style establishment creates dishes that pay homage to Singapore’s rich culture in elegance. Among the dishes to try here is their Otah. It's created in-house with a special blend and paste that brings out the freshness of the fish without any fishiness. For meatier options, go for their yakitori-style satay that makes the most of the iconic ’rempah’ smoke flavour to permeate the meat. Paired with a special house sauce that’s topped with chilli flakes, this juicy stick is highly addictive and tasty.  A great main dish to share, The Kongsee's Sambal Fish combines tender meat with a spicy, pungent kick - best eaten with a fragrant bowl of steamed rice. Other local flavours include their Singapore Laksa that's coconut-y and topped with fresh seafood. Served in a decent portion, you’re able to try out other different dishes without feeling bloated.  The bar also serves Singapore-centric cocktails, such as the creamy pandan cocktail that has an earthy fragrance combined with the boozy pleasure of alcohol to complement your meal.

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    There’s nothing better than good food, good vibes and the company of good friends and family, and Kontiki at Passion Wave @ Marina Bay is just that! Located next to the Benjamin Sheares Bridge, and with an awe-inspiring view of the Singapore city skyline as well as the meandering Kallang river, Kontiki provides a great location to catch up with family and friends over good food. The menu features an extensive selection of casual American food. To start with, the Roasted Portobello Mushroom Soup comes highly recommended. Button and Portobello mushrooms are combined to give the soup a rich and creamy texture. Dip the accompanying toasted cheese bread into the soup, and you would just have had a slice of heaven! The Mussels in Outlaw Gumbo is a refreshing twist on the usual mussel dishes available on the market. A generous portion of black mussels is cooked in a Cajun gumbo broth, adding an extra tangy kick to the sweet freshness of the mussels. Of course, the bestseller at Kontiki is the Double Cheese Burger. As the name suggests, it’s a cheeseburger but double of everything - double patties, double slices of cheese, and a huge portion of fries on the side! At Kontiki, you’re definitely in good hands. (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “At this waterfront location, chow down American diner food against lush views of our city's skyline and tranquil Marina Bay waters.” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mussels in Outlaw Gumbo, Double Cheese Burger, Love-Eat Beef Short Ribs, Roasted Portobello Mushroom Soup, Arugula Salad

• ABOUT

    The perfect place for locals and tourists alike, Kopi Tiam aptly displays Singapore’s vibrant cosmopolitan culture with comforting home-style dishes. Satisfy your local cravings and delight in rich flavours when you dig into Singaporean favourites such as Crispy Shrimp Paste Chicken, Fish Head Curry, Fried Carrot Cake and more! A uniquely Singaporean dish, Rojak is their local take on the classic Chinese salad. Tossed in prawn paste and fiery chilli sauce, pineapples, cucumbers, sweet turnips and dough fritters make up the dish. Seafood lovers can choose either the Crispy Salted Egg Yolk Calamari or Stir Fried Cereal Prawns to kickstart their meal. Vegetarians also have their fair share of options here at Kopi Tiam. Topped with mushrooms, mixed vegetables and mock goose, the Wok Fried Vegetarian Bee Hoon is a fragrant plate of tangy rice vermicelli fit for a delectable one meal dish. Wash down your meal with your favourite Kopi Tiam specialities such as the well-loved Milo Dinosaur or a pot of hot tea. For those on the hunt for something fancier, the restaurant offers bottles of bubbly or exquisite bottles of red and white wine. (Mar 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "After all these years, this place still manages to pack them in, especially at the weekend. All this without any fancy decor, though we’re rather fond of the tree-lined views of the bay through the windows that curve along the restaurant." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Egg Yolk Crispy Calamari, Fish Head Curry, Wok-fried Beef Tenderloin, Honey Sauce, Teochew-Style Steamed Whole Seabass, Marmite Prawns

  • ABOUT

    Dig into the smorgasbord of yummy treats offered at Korean Fusion BBQ (Dunlop Street). With its buffet-style spread, you can chow down on a night of unlimited supply of your favourites till your stomach’s fit to burst. And it’s definitely the place for meat-lovers – featuring an extensive list of marinated and unmarinated pork belly and chicken options (just to name a couple), release your inner carnivore and eat to your heart’s content. Chomp on a mouthful of Black Pepper Pork Belly, and savour the tasty nature of the meat – it’s testament to the type of marinade and duration for which the meat was marinated. The Korean Spicy Pork Belly is another one you won’t regret trying; quality always tells, and it shows in the addictive tenderness of the meat. This is a buffet, however, so do be sure to check out the restaurant’s numerous takes on pork (including the non-marinated options) – each one is sure to be a delicious treat for the taste-buds. There’s even a Bak Kwa option (yum)! Of course there are other meats too; as mentioned earlier, there’s chicken in several different marinades, beef (which includes the ever-beloved Bulgogi Beef option), and seafood. Do be sure to try the Prawns and the Black Pepper Fish, especially if you’re looking for a non-red meat selection. So head down to Korean Fusion BBQ (Dunlop Street) sometime soon, and have a whale of a time busting your belly with its plethora of tasty barbequed eats! (Aug 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Pepper Pork Belly, Korean Spicy Pork Belly, Bak Kwa, Curry Chicken, Bulgogi Beef, Black Pepper Fish, Spicy Fish

• ABOUT

    Kotuwa is Chef Rishi Naleendra's highly anticipated third and brand new venture. With an emphasis on a lively, modern and casual vibe that focuses on traditional Sri Lankan cuisine, Kotuwa pays homage to the 35-year-old's Sri Lankan heritage.Kotuwa, named after the Sri Lankan capital's central business district, aims to bring the sights, sounds and tastes from Sri Lankan's streets and markets to the Singapore diner. It also means "fort" in Sinhalese, a reminder of the ancient landmarks built by Sinhalese kings and the Portuguese, Dutch and British settlers that have influenced the country's rich history, culture and cuisine.Embodying Sri Lanka's vibrant and generous way of life, diners can expect bright, creative dishes made from quality ingredients that are as robust and flavourful as the culture and history that inspire them. From famous Sri Lankan short eats, to a myriad of curries and housemade sambols and preserves, Kotuwa looks forward to spicing-up and invigorating diners' palates, one meal at a time! (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Kottu, Crab Cutlet, Mutton Rolls, Wattakka Kalu Pol, Seeni Sambol, Dallo Baduma, Watalappam Tart

• ABOUT

    A place where good food and great drinks unite, KPO Cafe Bar is a bar staple on Orchard Road that impresses with several al fresco dining decks and elegant indoor seating. Make merry with family and friends as dusk settles with the bar’s rotating variety of live bands. From mando and cantopop to rockin 'oldies, groove to party tunes into the night here at KPO Cafe Bar.. Prepared in-house daily using the freshest ingredients, KPO’s Legendary Hokkien Mee is undoubtedly one of the best in town. Topped with fresh prawns and squids, two different noodles are mixed together and simmered in a creamy prawn broth for a delicious burst of flavours. Another uniquely localicious dish is the Salted Egg Fish Skin. Smothered in the bar’s homemade salted egg sauce, the crispy fish skins are fried together with curry leaves, chilli padi and served up in true local fashion. Dangerously addictive, this mouthwatering rendition of fried fish skins will have you coming back for seconds. Still feeling peckish? Wrap up your meal with KPO’s signature dessert. A combination of the crispiest chips and the most decadent vanilla ice cream, the Chips N Cream is an ingenious mix sweet and salty you simply can’t resist. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    KPO’s Legendary Hokkien Mee, Salted Egg Fish Skin, Chips N Cream, Kronenbourg Blanc

• ABOUT

    As a pioneer of premium Japanese ala carte buffets, Kushi Japanese Dining caters to everyone with two dining alternatives - Classic Buffet and Premium Buffet. The buffet features a range of tantalising dishes like Shiro Maguro Aburi Sushi, Ton Toro Kushiyaki, Surume Ika, Amaebi, Pork Belly Shogayaki, Rib Eye Steak and Hamachi Kama. Bringing authentic top-notch quality food to you at affordable prices, Kushi Japanese Dining offers set lunches such as the popular Premium MazeChirashi. Kushi Japanese Dining’s ala carte menu also aims to provide each and every diner with an opportunity to taste a wide variety of flavours. To enjoy a unique and tantalising experience and kickstart your weekend, the weekend brunch brings out the best of both worlds. From a wide array of Japanese culinary favourites, including Lobster Porridge, Teppanyaki, Deep Fried Oyster & Salmon Fin to a specially curated variety of Japanese fusion fare such as Spaghetti, Smoked Salmon and Shrimp Popcorn, as well as Japanese desserts - Crepe cake and Mochi to all-time favourite brunch items such as Scrambled Eggs, Bacon and Sausages, you will be asking for more! Not forgetting, drink and be merry by topping up for free flow alcoholic drinks or enjoy alcoholic drinks at discounted price during their happy hour! Kushi Japanese Dining is definitely the place to go for your quality Japanese food fix. (Nov 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shiro Maguro Aburi Sushi, Ton Toro Kushiyaki, Surume Ika, Kaki Fry, Pork Belly Shogayaki, Rib Eye Steak, Hamachi Kama, Premium MazeChirashi, Deep Fried Salmon Fin, Lobster Porridge, Mentaiko Salmon Spaghetti, Asari Butter Yaki

html:
• ABOUT

    Kwee Zeen invites you to its spacious establishment with high ceilings, gilded frames, dark mahogany wooden fixtures in a tasteful maroon and cream palette. Head on to the alfresco area where live stations and dedicated chefs meet you. Serving an extensive selection of Pan-Asian, Western and French cuisine, Kwee Zeen tempts and delights with sumptuous ala carte and buffet offerings - made fresh to order. With French hospitality at the heart, Kwee Zeen offers premium and attentive service with a smile. An all-encompassing experience of living the French way, Kwee Zeen’s Sunday Brunch offers over 80 food selections, with premium ingredients, free-flowing champagne, and fun activities for the whole family. (Mar 2020)

  • EASTER MEGA BRUNCH (17 APR)

    Reminiscent of the iconic children’s tale, go down the Rabbit Hole with an Alice in Wonderland themed Easter Mega Brunch, with over 90 selections of free-flowing epicurean delights. Thereafter, dive into freshest seafood on ice with four types of oysters, juicy tiger prawns, succulent Boston lobsters, snow crab and dungeness crab. Treat your tummy like royalty, akin to the Queen of Hearts, with the luxurious yet delicate foie gras, or the intense burst of umami with our caviar station. Not forgetting the little ones, let them indulge in their very own buffet section with over 10 healthy and indulgent treat to choose from. Finally, a whimsical and egg-travagant dessert spread to end the meal with fresh buttermilk waffles and chocolate fondue station, Easter-themed desserts from the classic carrot cake to rock road brownies. Get lost in a wonderland of the best and biggest brunch buffet on Sentosa Island! When: 17 April 2022Time: 12-3pmPrice: • $188++ per Adult | $288++ per Adult with free-Flow alcohol with brunch • $98++ per ChildExclusive: Early Bird Special - 20% off food only for bookings made before 04 April 2022T&Cs: • Offer is not valid in conjunction with other promotions or discounts. • Prior reservations and pre-payment are required. • Kids price is applicable for children aged 5 to 11 years only. Children aged 4 and below eat for free. Children aged 12 years and above are applicable for adult pricing.Click here to view the menu.

  • SOFITEL SENTOSA SUNDAY BRUNCH AT KWEE ZEEN (TILL 31 DEC)

    Sentosa Island’s best and biggest buffet awaits in a relaxed tropical ambience, with free-flow shucked oysters, foie gras, champagne and more. With over 90 selections of decadence to choose from, indulge in the freshest seafood catch featuring Boston lobsters, succulent prawns and more. The dedicated chefs delight and surprise with over 15 live stations including the luxurious foie gras station, tender meat carvings and indulgent waffles served to your plate. Children can head on over to the exclusive Le Petit Prince & Princess Corner with over 15 yummy treats to choose from. Enveloped in greenery with a relaxed tropical ambience, complemented with the call of the resident peacocks; top up for free-flow Taittinger champagne to kick it up a notch. When: Sundays (till 31 December 2022)Time: 12-3pmPrice:• $128++ per diner• Free-flow Top Up Options: $50++ with wine and beer and $70++ with champagneT&C: Offer is not valid in conjunction with other promotions or discounts.Click here to view the menu

  • INTERNATIONAL BUFFET NIGHTS (TILL 31 DEC)

    Entice and delight the family to sumptuous buffet spreads in an idyllic destination, with seafood on ice, carvings stations and lavish desserts. Kwee Zeen’s International Buffet Nights welcomes you to a selection of seafood on ice including succulent prawns and half shell scallops. Carving stations featuring tenderly charred and roasted meats are meticulously cut and served by our passionate chefs. The tempting aroma wafting from the clay tandoor invites you to piping hot naan and creamy butter chicken. A slew of desserts from cakes to lavish pastries end off the luxurious feast. When: Sun-Thu (till 31 December 2022)Time: 6:30pm onwardsPrice:• $68++ per diner• $34++ per childT&Cs:• Offer is not valid in conjunction with other promotions or discounts. • Menu is subject to change due to seasonal availability.

  • MAGNIFIQUE HAWKER NIGHTS (TILL 31 DEC)

    Helmed by Chef Nelson Lim, Kwee Zeen brings the best of Singapore hawker culture to an elevated buffet spread away from the monotony of city life. Headlining this extensive spread are Chef Nelson’s signatures, featuring his rendition of the tender beef cheek rendang and freshly made sambal seabass complemented with his cincalok sauce filled with umami. Flavourful and filled with exciting textures, the Indian spread awaits with fluffy and lightly charred prata served alongside tandoori chicken tikka. Dedicated chefs serve you with a bright smile at the popular seafood on ice counter with juicy prawns and half shell scallops. The free-flowing charcoal steamboat buffet specials are back – with enticing soup bases and extensive selection of fresh vegetables, premium meat cuts and seafood. Polish off the taste of Singapore with quintessential desserts including kek lapis, bandung panna cotta and more.     Presenting the best of sushi and sake, Kyo-ya Dining is conveniently located at Raffles Boulevard, bringing an authentic Japanese dining experience to diners in the CBD. Savour delicious moments with the restaurant’s contemporary Japanese menu alongside a wide selection of sake. Boasting yummy promotions that rotate every season, get more bang for your buck when you order one of Kyo-ya Dining’s Premium Bento sets for lunch. Complete with maki, sashimi, soba and your choice of dessert, this comprehensive bento set will not only fill you up but will surely satisfy all your Japanese food cravings! Alternatively, indulge in a fancier meal when you order a glass of sake to go with the restaurant’s popular Shiro Maguro Maki. Featuring sushi rolls wrapped with a layer of seared white tuna, this platter showcases the different cuts of tuna for a sumptuous sashimi feast. Can’t decide on which sushi to eat? Opt for the signature assorted sushi platter and treat yourself to a variety of flavours offered by the best of Japan’s seasonal produce. (Sep 2021)

Pair with chef recommendations from the extensive drinks menu to elevate your omakase experience. Headed by executive chef John Phua, be prepared to dig into innovative dishes made with the freshest of fishes and best quality seasonal seafood for a yummy Japanese feast.Affordable and delectable set meals and fuss-free bento options are also aplenty for those on a quick lunch break. Try the Shake Teriyaki Bento for a filling combination of teriyaki glazed salmon atop fluffy short grained rice served with salad and naturally sweet tamago. Fancier set meals such as the Sushi Gozen and Tori Sashimi Gozen come with bigger and more generous portions of sides as well as a hot soup and sweet treat. (Oct 2021)

• ABOUT

    Kyoten Japanese Cuisine is the newest kid on hip gastro-street, Yong Siak. Serving traditional Japanese fare, their Chefs are at the forefront of Sushi ageing which can be enjoyed in through their Omakase experience, lunch sets or an ala carte selection. Kyoten Japanese Cuisine serves top-quality Japanese fare by sourcing the freshest ingredients. The Sea Urchin that goes into their Uni Bafan Roll, for example, is air-flown right after the auctions at the Toyosu fish markets are concluded four times a week. A generous portion of the precious Sea Urchin is then laid on a special mix of young and old Sasanishiki rice from Miyagi prefecture and served with premium seaweed. No meal here is complete without the restaurant’s signature dish - Wagyu Sando: a thick slice of pan-fried A5 Wagyu sandwiched between lightly toasted crustless white bread. We hear the considerate Chefs at Kyoten Japanese Cuisine also do a Hokkaido Buta Sando for patrons who do not eat Beef. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Sando, Aburi Don, Ikura Gunkan Maki, Uni Bafan Roll

    Opened in October 2017, KYUU by Shunsui is a sister restaurant of Kappo Shunsui, the restaurant achieved Michelin Tokyo Guide’s Bib Gourmand fame from 2015 to 2017, and Michelin Plate Singapore from 2018 to 2021. We use the freshest and best quality ingredients sourced from Japan to serve Sashimi and Robatayaki (Charcoal Grill). Kyuu offers a ten-course sashimi and robatayaki course menu. Robatayaki is served with signature homemade sauces, adding a unique twist to the classic grill experience. While the course menu is available from 5pm to 9pm, an ala carte menu is available from 9pm onwards for late night diners. An extensive list of beverages, including umeshu, shochu, highballs, wines (red, white and sparkling), champagne and over 100 different labels of sake are also available. (Nov 2021)

• SAVE UP TO 20% WITH CHOPE VOUCHERS

    Pre-purchase Chope Vouchers for L'Angelus and get up to 20% off. This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions.Click here to purchase.

  • ABOUT

    L’Angelus, Singapore was established in 1998 and is the oldest single-location French restaurant in the city. Its dedication to exceptional food as well as its exclusive French wine list has earned it its spot in history – and a number of awards to go alongside. Reminiscent of the charming restaurants tucked away in quiet corners of Paris, the setting and décor of L’Angelus evoke a very warm and familiar feeling, emitting an incandescent love of everything French. Casier à serviettes, wooden pigeonholes for patrons' napkins line the walls, vintage posters lend a dramatic feel and colourful cut-glass ceiling lets in warm tones of daylight and fill the room with colour! The chefs follow traditional French cooking techniques, showcasing classic and interpreted dishes made from recipes honed to perfection through the centuries. The menu is expressed by dishes spectacularly simple and yet exquisite, devoted to using the highest quality ingredients, mostly air-flown directly from Rungis France. The food is complemented by a unique and highly curated wine list, full of gems and vintages for wine aficionados. The bar is perhaps the best-kept secret of L’Angelus. Apart from an exhaustive wine selection from France, the bar offers a great selection of spirits, liqueurs, cocktails, and Armagnacs. To experience the ‘true joie de vivre’ that comes with eating classic French cuisine, L’Angelus is the place to dine at. A reservation at L’Angelus is always a good idea! (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Traditional French Onion Soup, Burgundy Snails, Mini Raviolis, Pan-Fried Duck Liver 'Angelus' Style, Rib Eye Steak, Pan-Fried Dover Sole, Roasted Welsh Lamb, Hot Chocolate Cake

    Almost ten years after first bringing the authentic L’Entreco^te experience from the streets of Paris to the quaint Duxton Hill, Singapore, Deliciae Hospitality Management (DHM) now brings the Parisian flair of L’Entreco^te The Steak & Fries Bistro to another new neighbourhood – at Customs House in the heart of Singapore’s bustling CBD, overlooking the stunning vistas of Marina Bay. Staying true to the original L’Entreco^te experience at Duxton Hill, the authentic Parisian bistro will serve its signature French fare, and will also boast the addition of the distinctively French Ricard Bar. The Ricard Bar, set to open in mid-April, features airy al fresco seating, a bright yellow tone, and is set to offer respite and a much needed ‘pick-me-up’ to guests, both during the busy work week and on weekends. (Mar 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    The tree-lined, cobblestoned nook of Duxton Hill makes quite the pretty picture and L’Entrecote’s classy white doors and red awning blend right into the quaint scene. The decor beyond its entrance is redolent of Paris – more specifically the relaxed bistro culture that’s so common to the French city – as diners sit shoulder to shoulder in a long, cosy stretch whilst wine and conversation flow freely. The Plat du Jour is always their classic Steak Frites, slivers of succulent prime meat generously doused with a secret sauce that pairs perfectly with each melt-in-your-mouth bite. Accompanying those piping hot babies are a fresh green salad and a heaping pile of crispy, golden fries. Finished your first round and hungry for more? That’s when the servers offer you the second helping that’s been kept warm on burners. Of course, other bistro options such as Leek and Vinaigrette and Oven-baked Beef Marrow with Rock Salt are on the menu, along with decadent desserts like the Vacherin du Bistrot (meringue, vanilla ice cream, and hot chocolate sauce) but really, there’s nothing like sitting in that buzzing atmosphere, especially in the dim lights at night, and enjoying slices of beef or delightfully savoury cheeses. Bon appétit! (Apr 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Our beef was well-executed and succulent, although the mountainous heap of thin-cut, golden brown fries (undoubtedly twice-fried) threatened to dwarf it. Despite the exceedingly hearty meal, we succumbed to temptation with their waffle, accompanied by salted butter caramel and vanilla bean ice cream. Heavenly. We're already planning our next trip back." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Escargots de Bourgogne, Oven Baked Beef Marrow, Trimmed Entrecôte Steak, Pâté de Campagne, Profiteroles de "L’Entrecôte", Homemade Lemon Tartlet

html:
• ABOUT

    Singapore’s first eclair speciality shop, L'éclair Pâtisserie (Singapore Shopping Centre), offers up to ten unique flavours of eclairs daily. Best enjoyed with a fragrant pot of loose tea or a cup of speciality coffee, come down to Singapore Shopping Centre at Clemenceau Avenue and treat yourself to a box of sweet delights. Inspired by a stint in Paris and enriched with training at the famous Le Cordon Bleu, founders Sarah Tan and Michelle Looi toyed with multiple flavours before coming up with a multitude of exquisite desserts. Featuring innovative combinations, look forward to pairings such as salted caramel with caramelised popcorn, rose with lychees and strawberries, and more. Made in-house daily, the cafe offers eclairs in two sizes: Regular and mini. Beautifully packaged, select your favourite flavours and seal the deal with a coloured ribbon of your choice. The Lychee White Peach is a classic mix of sweet and savoury, with a refreshing fresh fruit cream on the inside. Coated in pink and decorated with petals, this eclair tastes just as heavenly as it looks. Other equally enticing flavours include the Banana Walnut as well as Pistachio and Strawberries. Apart from eclairs, L'éclair Pâtisserie (Singapore Shopping Centre) also serves Chouquettes, Scones and Pies. Perfect for a high tea session, these stunning desserts are impossible to resist. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lychee White Peach, Banana Walnut, Pistachio and Strawberries, Chouquettes

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Brand NEW European Restaurant & Bar, La Belle Epoque (which means ‘the good times’ in French) opens its doors in the heart of Singapore’s vibrant dining belt, Boat Quay on 3 February 2022. Helmed by dynamic, creative and passionate Chef Firdauz Nasir, La Belle Epoque specialises in contemporary European cuisine using fresh ingredients seasoned with natural herbs. Chef Firdauz, who has garnered a wealth of experience over the past 15 years under the tutelage of Master Chefs such as Chef Kentaro Torii, Chef Jeffrie Siew, Chef Christopher Millar and the late Chef Eng Su (Owner of the Coconut Club Singapore & Belimbeng Superstar), believes in ‘simple and tasty’ cooking. He enjoys creating culinary masterpieces using old-school techniques and herbs that he grows in his very own herb garden. To enhance your dining experience, pair the innovative creations with unique concoctions by our very own mixologist, Andy. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    28-Days Dry Aged Black Angus Beef, Canard Du Cial, Marrow & Squid Fusilli, Jamon Boulevardier, Espresso Martini

html:
• ABOUT

    Sitting in the heart of Kampong Glam, La Boca is a Cuban fusion bistro bar set to bring diners on a gastronomic adventure to the tropic and briny breezes of the Caribbean islands and seas in a burst of rich flavours. Kickstart your meal with a small plate of Pulpo Gallego. Made with Galician-style octopus and finished with chorizo and Spanish paprika, this yummy plate is great for sharing. Tailored for two pax, the Daily Catch menu option is perfect for an intimate dining session with your significant other. Add on a side of Salsa and Corn Chips or Mixed Greens if you’re still feeling peckish! Healthier meat options here include the Pulled Goat Curry on Flatbread and the Caribbean Jerk Chicken. Oven-baked to achieve a wonderful golden hue, the chicken thigh is served with black beans, rice and salsa for a filling meal. Throw some Cuban Grill Skewers into the mix for extra flavour. Finish with the bistro’s signature Rum and Raisin Gelato for a refreshingly savoury end. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pulpo Gallego, Caribbean Jerk Chicken, Daily Catch, Rum and Raisin Gelato

html:
• ABOUT

    Decked out in fairy lights with an airy alfresco dining patio, La Bonne Table is all about bringing a touch of homely comfort to restaurant dining. Run by a husband-and-wife team, the kitchen here dishes out rustic French cuisine. Indulge in the Pan-Seared Castaing Foie Gras, a slab of creamy duck liver with a buttery crust served on a slice of toasted French bread and honey to cut through the richness. A fan of fork-tender meat? La Bonne Table’s duck confit comes apart at the lightest touch. The bird is massaged with salt, garlic, and herbs, and then poached in its own fat for that melting tenderness. Chill out after dinner with a glass of wine (or two) while you contemplate dessert. The Chocolate Tarte and the Creme Brulee are both to-die-for. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pan-Seared Castaing Foie Gras, Duck Confit, Tuna Tartare, Tartiflette, Chocolate Tarte, Creme Brulee

  • WINE PROMOTION

    Buy any bottle of wine and get 30% OFF on the second one of your choice.

html:
• ABOUT

    Even those ambitious enough to search the streets of Singapore for hidden gems may not come across La Braceria. Located among a row of unassuming stores on a quiet street in the residential neighbourhood of Bukit Timah, La Braceria is an Italian eatery with food so authentic, it will transport you to the Mediterranean Coast. Although not nearly as understated as its storefront, La Braceria's interior is still modestly decorated, with just a few pieces of artwork on the walls to spruce up the decor. The real focus at La Braceria is the food. The traditional menu includes a variety of antipasti, pastas, meats and pizzas from Naples. Although dishes like Insalata di Rucola, Spaghetti alle Vongole, and Ossobuco alla Milanese may seem standard, La Braceria's food is anything but ordinary, thanks to their fresh ingredients and superior preparation. Be sure to look in the back for the walk-in wine cellar, where guests can peruse a large selection of wines. After a satisfying meal of high quality, authentic Italian food accompanied by a glass of fine wine, the trip out to La Braceria may seem more than worthwhile. (Oct 2011)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For an authentic Italian experience at a reasonable price, we heartily recommend La Braceria. And judging by the crowd, this place is definitely one hot gastronomical property." -SG Now "Hearty, rustic Italian cooking is the draw at La Braceria. Wonderful, thin-crust pizzas with dense, flavourful toppings emerge from the blackened dome of the oven, but best of all are the home-made sausages – fat tubes stuffed with fresh meat, marinated for days in a secret blend of seasonings and spices." -Time Out Singapore "Despite its contemporary interior, the cuisine at La Braceria is the most rustic and sumptuous we’ve had in recent memory. A word of caution: once you’ve tasted the Puglia-imported parcels of creamy burrata served with savory slivers of Parma ham, you’ll be begging for your next reservation." -CNNGo.com

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Antipasto Braceria, Insalata di Rucola, Spaghetti alle Vongole, Ossobuco alla Milanese, Spaghetti with Mixed Seafood, Tiramisu, Mama Cake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/la-braceria

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the heart of the historic Fullerton Heritage precinct, La Brasserie serves local and international specials including classic French bistro favourites in a sleek modern setting, alongside panoramic views of the Marina Bay waterfront. With two spacious salons and a private room, all with 10-metre-high windows, and an al fresco terrace, it is ideal for business lunches, intimate dinners, and weekend brunch. La Brasserie's Cake Boutique, located at its entrance, promises delicious moments for sharing or a well-deserved treat for oneself. Choose from a selection of cakes and pastries, freshly crafted by our Pastry Chefs using only the finest ingredients. Enjoy the enticing creations with coffee or tea in La Brasserie or have them packed to go as a spontaneous indulgence. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Steak Frites, Signature Duck Confit with Truffle Potato Mousseline

  • LE BRUNCH BY THE BAY

    Enjoy La Brasserie signatures and brunch favourites, freshly cooked upon order and delivered to the table. Weekends are made for leisurely brunching and La Brasserie at The Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore has long indulged in this tradition. The splendid repast features a carefully curated menu of signature La Brasserie highlights alongside brunch essentials. To ensure maximum flavour and food safety, all dishes are cooked to order and delivered to the table. For those who desire celebratory weekend tipples, there are also free-flowing champagne and delicious signature cocktails on offer. A Fine RepastExpect a premium selection that showcases signature La Brasserie favourites, such as Traditional Onion Soup, Grilled Angus Côte De Boeuf, Beef Cheeks slow-braised in Red Wine, Duck Confit and slow-roasted, herb-crusted Lamb Chops. Other highlights include Wild Mushroom Risotto, Blackened Ahi Tuna Niçoise, Escargots, Spicy Chorizo with Prawns, and Crispy Roasted Crackling Pork Belly. Presented with popular sides such as rich potato mousseline studded with French Butter Sea Salt and Truffle Fries topped with Parmesan shavings, they are served in suitably sized-down portions so that guests can enjoy the variety of the spread. The selection also features fresh poached seafood on ice — Scallops, Tiger Prawns, Maine Lobster, Snow Crab, and Bouchot Mussels, served with house-made dips. From the charcuterie, feast on a platter of the finest Saucisson, Parma Ham, House-made Duck Rillettes, and Bresaola. Those who hanker after Asian flavours are not forgotten. Le Brunch by the Bay presents a selection of popular local dishes such as Prawn Laksa with Quail Eggs in a rich, aromatic spicy coconut broth, Traditional Beef and Chicken Satay, and our signature pandan-scented Fullerton Chicken Rice. Complete the indulgence with sweet showstoppers such as Assorted Macarons, Fullerton Fudge Cake, Rose Lychee Raspberry, Coconut Kaya Mango-passion Trifle, and Vanilla Strawberry Chiffon Shortcake, served on a platter for sharing. A Toast to Eat, drink, be merry and toast to the good life with signature cocktails and wines. Choose your choice of tipple, be it an Earl Grey and Orange-infused Gin & Tonice, a fruity and refreshing spin to the classic G&T, a Golden Mary, or opt for champagne: Ruinart Blanc de Blanc or Veuve Clicquot Brut Champagne. Teetotallers can enjoy our alcohol-free beverage package, comprising a guilt-free line-up of alcohol-free wines, cocktails, spirits, and beer. html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    One of the world's top female chefs with a total of 7 Michelin stars under her belt, Anne-Sophie Pic makes her much-anticipated debut into Asia with La Dame de Pic, Raffles Singapore. Anne-Sophie Pic hails from a long lineage of chefs with the Pic family's culinary heritage beginning since their first restaurant started in 1889. As a third-generation Michelin-starred chef, Anne-Sophie Pic follows in the footsteps of her father and grandfather, perfectly reflecting Raffles Singapore's rich heritage that has inspired generations since the iconic property was established in 1887. Indulge in exquisite signature creations such as the Berlingots – iconic pasta parcels found in all of Anne-Sophie Pic's restaurants around the world with unique and slight adaptations to reflect the character of each establishment's locale. At La Dame de Pic, Raffles Singapore the incarnation of the signature Berlingots incorporates an Asian touch with a new flavour association using Red Kampot pepper, which enhances the Berlingots' French cheese fondue filling. Other specialties include Saga Wagyu Beef, roasted Japanese wagyu accompanied with smoked beetroot and a osmanthus-infused mushroom broth; and Blue Lobster slow-roasted with shellfish butter and served with a coriander-and-barley-infused broth. The culinary magic continues with desserts such as Anne-Sophie Pic's signature White Mille-feuille, featuring ginger flower light cream, confit grapefruit and Litsea cubeba emulsion; and Araguani Chocolate, which contrasts light Araguani chocolate mousse, Nikka whisky caramel and smoked Tahitian vanilla ice cream for a decadent finish to the dining experience. Guests can look forward to beverage pairing options available on request, with an in-house sommelier on the floor to offer recommendations catered to guests' personal preferences. Guests are welcome to bring one bottle of wine of their own and enjoy complimentary corkage when they purchase a bottle of wine. Our sommeliers will also be on hand to enhance your dining experience with a curated wine list that reflects Anne-Sophie's culinary vision. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Berlingots, Saga Wagyu Beef, White Mille-feuille, Araguani Chocolate

  • 3-COURSE SET LUNCH

    Be introduced to Chef Anne-Sophie Pic's culinary world and savour delectable creations over lunch at S$128++ per guest, excluding Public Holidays. Indulge in exquisite signature creations, including the Berlingots – iconic pasta parcels found in all of Anne-Sophie Pic's restaurants around the world with unique and slight adaptations to reflect the character of each establishment's locale. At La Dame de Pic, Raffles Singapore the incarnation of the signature Berlingots incorporates an Asian touch with a new flavour association using herb of grace, which enhances the Berlingots' French cheese fondue filling.The culinary magic continues with desserts such as Anne-Sophie Pic's signature White Mille-feuille, featuring ginger flower light cream, confit grapefruit and Litsea cubeba emulsion.

html:
• ABOUT

    La Maison du Whisky is a bit of a dream. A boutique bottle-shop that brings in some of the hardest-to-score spirits, liqueurs, and mixers into town, it’s also a whisky and cocktail bar that turns its on-shelf selections into some of the best drinks on the island. It’s a one-stop cocktail nerd destination, oh, and of course, one of the city’s best-stocked whisky bars. With knowledgeable bartenders, cocktail gurus, and suppliers constantly on hand to answer your questions or turn you on to their new favourite tipple, this is a veritable temple of booze where you always come away feeling a little more knowledgeable about your tasty poisons. If you’re looking to be schooled on classic cocktails, look no further. You can order a bracing Sazerac, a classic Old Fashioned, a refined Manhattan, or a frosty Mint Julep, and those are just the whisky cocktails. And if you like what you taste, your bartender can point you to the right spirit so you can take on home to rinse and repeat as much as you like. If you prefer your whisky by the dram (or bottle), simply ask for a recommendation and the bar team will help you out with their cavernous whisky selection, and possibly even arrange for a tasting flight. They’re here to help you have a good time, so just ask away. It’s a small bar, so book your space today! (Feb 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The bespoke service from the friendly, knowledgeable pair who run the joint and the deliciously extensive collection of fine spirits. The bar also holds regular tasting sessions that teach you how to appreciate whisky and other spirits.” -SG Magazine

html:
• ABOUT

    There are those restaurants you go to for a cutting-edge, hyper-fusion-y, once-in-a-lifetime experience, and then there are those you keep going back to for good solid food. La Nonna confidently sits in the latter category, with country style Italian fare that not only draws diners, but creates loyalists. Meaning "grandmother" in Italian, La Nonna indeed channels soulful and rustic fare with an understated decor, and a vast menu that does most of the talking. Go for the classics at La Nonna, where the pasta is lovingly prepared daily, and pizzas are kneaded and wood-fired to cracker-thin perfection. As if straight from a family's recipe book, the simply prepared dishes place great value on the integrity of a just a handful of wholesome ingredients. At the Holland Village outlet, opt for a table outdoors, ideal for spectating, and nuanced by sparkly, atmospheric lighting. Order a house specialty, the Macaroni and Cheese Della Holland Village for a more authentic version of the pasta dish, with a bright tomato sauce and gratinated Italian cheeses blanketing al dente noodles. The results will tempt you to kiss your collected fingers in the satisfaction that you can only get from a good Italian meal. (May 2014)

    "If you like truffles (or in our case, loooove truffles) and haven't tried the La Nonna Signature Pizza (Tomato, Mozzarella, Parmesan, Asparagus, Egg and Black Truffle), it is sheer truffle blasphemy. The quality of the crust at La Nonna also deserves special mention: light and crispy all around." -Honeycombers "The service is extremely friendly, warm and accommodating to requests. Great care is taken in the preparation of the dishes, the food quality is excellent and the prices are easy on the wallet." -Expat Living "The rigatoni with tender chunks of braised oxtail was delicious right down to the last drop of sauce, and the beef ravioli in a cream sauce is lifted by liberal amounts of fresh parsley and a truffle compote." -Time Out Singapore

html:
• ABOUT

    La Pizzeria at the Bridge & Beacon Bar is an authentic Italian Restaurant with the guidance of Italian Chef Francesco Romano. Chef Francesco bring the Romano Family culture to Singapore through his Grandmother recipes to the kitchen set up of the restaurant. With the warm breeze rolling in from the Gulf of Naples into their rustic kitchen in Lettere, Gennaro Romano and his wife Anna worked diligently with partial skim milk to create the “Caseificio Romano” - a cheese house. This was in the heart of the 1925. The Mozzarella was traditionally made of buffalo milk, Gennaro introduced in his factory a combination of whole cow milk producing a “Fior di Latte”. This mozzarella was sold and distributed from its humble origins in Lettere throughout the Naples, spanning from the Salerno to the rocky cliffs of Roma. In 1961, Caseificio Factory changed hands, passing to Gennaro’s son, Vittorio. He kept the original name of the factory and increased production. The family-run cheese factory became well known within Italy for its handmade authentic buffalo Mozzarella and Fior di Latte and up today Vittorio’s son Francesco, continues the tradition from the creation, to the production, to the sales of Caseificio hand-crafted cheeses and as corporate Chef of Italian restaurant chain in Italy and Dubai. Chef Francesco’s passion and expertise are in each single dish of La Pizzeria at the Bridge & Beacon Bar, all made respecting the traditional recipe of his Grandmother and with the same passion, he trained all our resident Chef. So come taste a piece of Italy right here in Singapore. These family recipes have been handed down for generations. Be our guest - you will feel right at home. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Primavera, Ravioli Spinach and Ricotta, Sautéed Mussels, Vegetable Pizza

    Taking its name from the La Scala Opera House in Milan, the world-renowned theatre inaugurated in 1778 and is today considered one of the most important and beautiful opera theatres, La Scala Ristorante sets to bring the flavours of Italy in its modernized space that still retains touches of Italian tradition like exposed red-brick walls, wooden floorboards and white Roman pillars, tied together with by a striking green oven, in which pizzas are baked fresh. La Scala Ristorante seeks to bring the tastes, sights and sounds of a buzzing Italian summer’s day to Arcade @ The Capitol Kempinski with a menu that shines with antipasti, soups, pastas, pizzas and desserts, complete with the most wholesome Italian touch. (Sep 2019)

• ABOUT

    From handcrafted pizzas (nothing beats a classic Margherita) to rich Ossobuco, selections of pasta and Chicken Milanese or beef carpaccio, La Stella By Tamaya has got it all! A celebration of comfort food, the Italian restaurant is tucked away on the second floor of a shophouse right in the heart of Singapore. Ready your stomach for the feast ahead with a Cold Meat Platter. A delicious mix of sherry figs, cornichon and roasted capsicums, the platter can be shared amongst all at the table. Follow up with a warm bowl of Cappuccino Style Mushroom Soup. Dig into the highly recommended Gnocchi Roma. These homemade potato dumplings are made up of bacon, cherry tomatoes and topped with chilli and fresh basil. For the pasta lovers, the Cartoccio is a bowl of tangy spaghetti accompanied by prawns and scallops cooked in a mouthwatering tomato sauce, before being baked in parchment paper. Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying their carnivorous cravings at the restaurant with the Manzo. A plate of braised USDA beef short ribs, this meaty dish is absolutely delightful. Wrap up your meal with the Panna Cotta for a deliciously sweet ending. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cappuccino Style Mushroom Soup, Gnocchi Roma, Cartoccio, Manzo

• ABOUT

    La Strada, which means 'The Street' in Italian, is a modern Italian restaurant bringing reimagined Italian cuisine in an intimate, comfortable, and modern setting. Located along the corner street of Shaw Centre, the journey of our guests begins right from the time we open the doors and right to the point when they take their leave. Executed with a sense of clarity and warmth, every dish uses quality ingredients sourced from all around the world. Savour the perfect harmony of flavours in each bite, and elevate your Italian escapade experience with our wine menu specially curated to pair beautifully with the food. Get ready to be swept away by this charming ristorante. (Nov 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The flavours are not lacking in any way, even if it isn't made by an Italian. It's no less satisfying and hearty, and I'd head back to try other dishes." -Robb Report "Pasta is the chef's strongest suit, as both the squid ink tagliolini and pasta carbonara are the highlights of our lunch. The dark-as-night thin pasta is coated in an intense, slightly spicy tomato-based sauce with generous nuggets of octopus, spanner crab and salty bacon that add to the diversity of seasoning. The carbonara is as it should be - rich with egg yolk, cream and bacon, but stops just short of weighing you down." -The Business Times

  • ABOUT

    A pioneer of the beloved Mille Crepe, Lady M has attracted a loyal following of dessert fans since its debut in Singapore in 2012. Known for its combination of French baking techniques and Japanese precision, drop by the minimalist cake shop to experience exquisite cakes and fine champagnes at ION Orchard. The star of the show at Lady M is definitely the best selling Mille Crepe Cake. A bestseller loved by all, the light and airy cake is simply decorated with a beautiful caramelised finish on the top, featuring a generous slather of cream sandwiched between 20 layers of crepes. Wafer thin, the slices of crepe layers simply melt in your mouth with every bite of this signature Japanese cake. Available in multiple flavours, the Green Tea Mille Crepe Cake is also a great option to satisfy your sweet tooth. Tinged with sweetness and dusted with matcha, the cake’s earthly and mildly bitter aftertaste is a refreshing alternative to the usual Japanese-style pastry cream favourite. Fruit cakes, tarts and eclairs are also on Lady M’s extensive menu - mix and match for a sinfully sweet high tea session in town! (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mille Crepe Cake, Green Tea Mille Crepe Cake, Chocolate Eclair, Tarte aux Fruits

Brenda handles the front of house, while Cataldo cooks every dish in the kitchen. Wiith an extensive selection of antipasti, homemade pasta, risotto and main courses, the 80-seater restaurant offers a wide section of authentic Italian fare.     Lagnaa, a one-of-a-kind bistro on Upper Dickson Road in Little India, is a welcome refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city. You are invited to take off your shoes, sit on the floor, and enjoy the restaurant's Indian cuisine. For those who are not really into sitting on the floor, the restaurant's ground floor offers an alfresco seating arrangement. The graffiti wall is something to behold. The "vandals" have expressed themselves. Owner and Chef Kaesavan (K7) who oversees every aspect of the restaurant from music to menu says: "At Lagnaa we invite you to bare your feet and feed your soul." The cuisine at LAGNAA, is the expression of the surrounding... and the best of Indian food. Come sit with me on the floor. The Drinks Cold The Foods Warm The Friendship’s Free. (Sep 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Lai Bao Fish Head Steamboat located in Toa Payoh aims to bring the best of local Singaporean Zi Char to your dinner table. Elevating local Zi Char fare, it provides an innovative reimagination of local favourites that remain rooted in its origins. Try Lai Bao’s Sixties Fish Head Charcoal Steamboat. The broth, comprised of collagen soup, is creamy and deliciously thick. Simmering for hours on end, the flavours of the soup are rich and warms you right to the core. The use of charcoal creates an aromatic smokiness to the soup, creating a robust flavour. Diners can choose between grouper and snapper, as well as a spicy or original soup. Further add-ons include pork meat pies, forest mushrooms, yam, and an assortment of fresh vegetables. Don’t miss Lai Bao’s other dishes, including the gorgeously plated Pomelo Salad Yam Ring, adorned with poached chicken slices, cherry tomatoes, peanuts and prawn. The aromatic Curry Assam Prawn in Claypot is also great. The intense earthy flavours from cooking in the clay pot complement the sweet taste of the prawn, with a sweetness that’s further accentuated by the medley of spices in the curry. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sixties Fish Head Charcoal Steamboat, Curry Assam Prawn in Claypot, Grandma’s Recipe Pork Belly, Pomelo Salad Yam Ring

html:
• ABOUT

    Traditional Chinese Tze char with amazing taste and unique concept, Lai Huat Signatures guarantees that you’ll never leave with an empty stomach. With your fragrant steamed rice, try their signature Lai Huat Sambal Fish, drizzled with a delicious blend of spices created by their founder from a special recipe. Each beautifully fried and tender fish is perfectly complemented by the sweet chili. Curry lovers rejoice - another signature to try here is their Claypot Fish Head Curry, using premium fish that enhances the taste of the creamy curry. With a wide selection of Chinese dishes to choose from, you're spoiled for choice. For appetizers, go for their Cereal Sotong with Egg Floss for a flaky, yet chewy and tender dish for sharing. Dangerously addictive, this octopus dish is salty, sweet, and savoury - the ultimate binge dish before any mains. One of the other unique dishes you should try at this restaurant is their Boss Mee Sua, which consists of fresh seafood and tiger prawns served in a deep-fried mee sua bowl of thick gravy. A visually intricate yet hearty dish, enjoy this fun dish with family and friends. Alongside their signature sambal fish dish, go for their filling yet highly addictive Sambal Seafood Fried Rice, which combines perfectly cooked fried rice and their signature sambal. Packed with subtle heat and a whole lot of oomph, their fried rice can be eaten on its own or paired with other dishes on their menu for an indulgent meal. Lai Huat also offers an all-you-can-eat buffet menu that includes the regular menu, so you don't have to miss out on all the delicious goodness they have to offer. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lai Huat Sambal Fish, Claypot Fish Head Curry, Cereal Sotong with Egg Floss, Boss Mee Sua, Sambal Seafood Fried Rice

    Go with the flow at Lalang and have a great night out with friends and family. Conveniently located in the heart of Singapore’s bustling central boulevard district, this vibrant restaurant is a modern gastropub serving delectable contemporary Chinese fare, paired with an extensive menu of unique white wine cocktails. Kickstart your meal with a plate of Spicy Vermicelli Seafood Salad. A must-order for seafood lovers, this fiery plateful of thin, springy noodles is just the dish to fire up an appetite for the tasty Chinese fusion menu dishes to come. A medley of prawns, flower squid, minced pork, onions, celery and chilli padi doused in the restaurant’s signature in house special sauce, this appetiser packs a punch of flavours in every mouthful. For diners who prefer lighter bar bites, order the Skinny Cut Fries to pair with a glass of Singapore Sling or a shot of Roku Gin to get the night started. Sharing options at Lalang include the Signature Pork, Pork Belly Enoki and Chicken skewers. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Vermicelli Seafood Salad, Pork Belly Enoki, Singapore Sling, Roku Gin

    The Landing Point stretches along an elegant indoor promenade paved with bespoke marble mosaics and gold hues. Its majestic 13-metre long bar lined with top shelf spirits from around the world take centrestage here. Sit back and enjoy your afternoon tea while taking in the panoramic sweep of Marina Bay’s waterfront, or toast bespoke cocktails as you catch the sunset by the bay. In line with government regulations, please note that the sale and consumption of alcohol in all food and beverage establishments are prohibited after 10.30 p.m. daily. The safety and well-being of our guests and team members are our top priority at The Fullerton Hotels and Resorts. We have set up rigorous cleanliness practices and safe distancing measures at our restaurants to ensure that you can experience an enhanced level of protection. (Jul 2020)
