html:
• ABOUT

    The Landmark is the in-house restaurant at Village Hotel Bugis, and it serves up a mean, halal buffet of local and international favourites, all bursting with rich, piquant flavours from Southeast Asia and the Mediterranean. Kick off your buffet spread with some hot Soup Kambing, a spicy broth of mutton bones, or a piquant Harissa Soup from the Middle East. Then move along to hearty regional mains like Beef Stew, savoury Malaysian Fried Fish with Kerabu Mangga (shredded mango), or Indian Mutton. That’s just the tip of the iceberg at this spread, which also includes Indian classics like Chicken Masala and Thai dishes like Minced Chicken with Thai Basil. For a more conventional continental buffet experience, there are live carving stations for beef and lamb, as well as a chilled seafood selection where you can grab fresh prawns and Spanish mussels. The dessert selection is as expansive as the mains, running the gamut from sugary sweet Gulab Jamun to rich Malay Kuih. This is a buffet with its eye and palate firmly set on the rich cuisine of our region, teasing out the best in our shared heritage and love of spice and bold flavours. (Mar 2017)

The lunch and dinner buffets serve an impressive spread of international cuisine with Western, Asian, Indian and Mediterranean influences.” -Her World Singapore “Look out for the live-action station where pasta, chicken shawarma, and vegetarian pizza are made fresh upon ordering.” -The Asian Parent

    Recognised as one of the best hotel bars in the world by CNNGO.com, Lantern is a stylish addition to the bar scene at the sophisticated Marina Bay waterfront area. With an unbeatable view of the resplendent Singapore skyline, it’s no surprise that Lantern attracts only the most stylish and trendiest people in Singapore. Paying homage to its locale and setting, the custom–designed circular bar counter is shaped like a lantern with bronze metal fins and is where the magic happens. Skilled bartenders sling out a wide variety of cocktails, including the Peach Berry Sling, a modern take on the classic Singapore Sling. The smoky and intense 45–day aged Bourbon whisky adds a certain depth and complexity to the classic Manhattan cocktail. (Mar 2021)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Since Lao Beijing opened in 1996, it has served classic Chinese delicacies that many have come to reminisce. Keeping up with the times, we continue to push the boundaries of change to engage palates of the present. Still Hooked On Classics, our cuisine philosophy aims to unite the old and the new. Our chefs’ creativity is always on the go, giving new interpretation to classics that have popularised Chinese cuisine from all over the world. You will experience the new and improved flavours which draw inspiration from the essence of traditional classics. Dishes like Chow Mein, General Tso’s Chicken, Sweet & Sour Pork, Chop Suey, and more. And to offer you a truly complete dining experience, just take a look around the restaurant to feel the vibes! Specially-designed wall art visuals lend a touch of fun and vibrancy to the dining space. Together with our team of friendly staff, you know you’ve come to just the right place for your meal. Welcome to Lao Beijing, where classical tales are told in modern times. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Skin Roast Duck, Beijing-style Sweet and Sour Fish, Xiao Long Bao, Shrimp, Pork and Chive Guo Tie, Dan Dan Noodles

html:
• ABOUT

    Experience Italian-American cuisine, 57 stories above ground with LAVO. Bringing to diners the ultimate dining experience with spectacular views in the heart of the city, LAVO flaunts a luxurious lounge with a fully equipped DJ booth situated within the restaurant, making it the perfect pre-party spot before a wild night. Indulging diners in hearty Italian-American cuisine accompanied by electrifying music, all-time favourites here include the classic Chicken Parmigiano and the famous LAVO meatball. Made of fresh imperial wagyu beef and premium Italian sausage, the meatballs are spiced to perfection and topped with layers of whipped ricotta cheese. An alternative way to enjoy these signature meatballs is to order the Meatball Brick Oven Pizza. Topped with wagyu meatball, tomato agrodolce, ricotta and capsicum, this tasty mix is perfect for sharing among family and friends. Served with braised pork belly and charred eggplant, the Pistachio Iberico Pork Chop is coated in pistachio crust and best enjoyed medium rare. Hearty and satisfying, this huge piece of meat is sure to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Wrap up your meal with LAVO’s famous 20-Layer Chocolate Cake. A highlight not to be missed out on, this decadent chocolate cake is layered with peanut butter mascarpone for a wickedly rich and luscious treat. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Parmigiano, Meatball Brick Oven Pizza, Pistachio Iberico Pork Chop, 20-Layer Chocolate Cake

  • ABOUT

    Located in the heart of Orchard Road, Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore is distinguished for its exceptional American cuisine, serving only the best. Overlooking the vibrant streets of Orchard Road through the 4-metre high floor-to-ceiling windows, Lawry’s boasts a seating capacity of up to 170. It exudes an air of opulence with its sleek interpretations of luxury. Be prepared to indulge in their authentic Signature Prime Rib of Beef! Each standing roast is aged for up to 28 days to heighten tenderness and slowly roasted on beds of rock salt, a method that forces the juices inward and ensures uniformly juicy and flavourful meat. It is then carved from the famous Silver Carts and served with table-side showmanship of the Original Spinning Bowl Salad. End your meal on a sweet note with Lawry’s Signature dessert the Strawberry English Trifle. (Mar 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Lawry’s is one of those long-standing dining establishments that never goes out of style. Red and gold is the primary colour scheme, and everything’s just really fancy and posh. You can’t go wrong with the signature USDA prime ribs of beef – this baby’s aged 21 days so expect a perfectly roasted, tender treat!” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Roasted Prime Rib of Beef (Lawry's Cut), Broiled Atlantic Lobster Tails, Truffle Rosemary Crusted Lamb, Traditional Lump Crab Cake, Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail, Atlantic Lobster Dinner, Lawry’s Idaho Baked Potato, Silver Side Trio

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2019 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • SPRINGTIME HAS ARRIVED AT LAWRY'S THIS EASTER (17 APR)

    With Easter just around the corner, Lawry's The Prime Rib Singapore is all set to join in on the celebrations in true American style — with a mouthwatering feast and their customary Best Dressed Children contest on Sunday, 17 April 2022. Ever the vibrant occasion, Lawry's gets a fabulous makeover for the coming Easter. The 5-course Easter set menu will tempt with the Famous Original Spinning Bowl Salad, boasting a selection of fresh and tasty greens, tossed with their exclusive Vintage Dressing. Next up, the appetizer features a classic Roasted Baby Carrot Soup. A visit to Lawry’s is never complete without tasting the restaurant’s famous Roasted USDA Prime Rib of Beef, so don’t forget to get your hearty fill when the Silver Cart is on the way to you. The other entrée options are equally spectacular, and include the grilled Yakiniku Chicken with Mushroom Escalope and pan seared Peach Seabass Fillet with Southern Fried Fish Bites. Be sure to leave space on the plate for desserts! Teeming with lovely toppings, the made-to-order Happy Baby Chick & Nest Cupcakes are perfect for an egg-cellent Easter celebration. You're in for a treat with the Hoppy Bunny’s Carrot Cake if you're one to enjoy the quintessential Easter dessert. It is deliciously moist, with a perfectly tangy cream cheese buttercream between spiced layers. The perfect occasion for the entire family, Lawry's Easter festivities have a little something for everyone. Keep your eyes peeled for the restaurant’s Best Dressed Children Contest and stand the chance to win some fantastic prizes including dining vouchers worth up to $200 and a Bruno Wireless Speaker Rib Pot worth $68. Other fun activities include complimentary candy bags, kid’s colouring and activity sheet, temporary body tattoos, and balloons giveaway. Children will receive a limited-edition kid’s mask with every kid’s menu ordered, while adults get a $50 dining voucher for use on the next visit with every bill. The 5-course Easter Day menu will be served for lunch and dinner at Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore on Sunday, 17 April 2022 for $119 per guest. The kid’s set menu will be available at $49 per child. To join in the Easter festivities, tables are available for booking at (65) 6836 3333 or reservations@lawrys.com.sg. Early reservations are strongly recommended to avoid disappointment. When:  Sunday, 17 April 2022Time: Lunch and DinnerPrice: • Easter Day 5-Course Set Menu at $119 per guest• Kids Menu at $49 per childMenu: Easter Day 5-Course Set Menu | Kids MenuEaster Day Highlights:• Best-dressed children contest with attractive Prizes to be won• Easter chocolates for Children • Kid’s colouring and activity sheet• Temporary body tattoos• Balloons giveaway• Limited-edition kid’s mask with every kid’s menu ordered • $50 return dining voucher with every bill

    Enjoy delicious, flavorful, and nutritious meals at this cosy neighbourhood restaurant nestled at Flora Vista when you drop by the Lazy Lizard. Featuring yummy western delights, be rewarded with hearty, fuss-free dishes that are mouthwatering and affordable. Choose from a variety of light bites and tasty mains for a scrumptious meal. Signature favourites not to be missed out on include Pork Ribs, Rack of Pork, and Crabby Pesto. Meat lovers will surely find themselves spoilt for choices with the restaurant’s multiple steak dishes set to satisfy all your carnivorous cravings! Swing by during happy hour to take a swig of Lazy Lizard’s ice cold Beck’s Beer. Sold by the pint and available on tap, this all-natural German beer is made with the finest natural ingredients such as hops, barley malt and water for a refreshing taste. Looking for the best food to create unforgettable memories with family and friends? Lazy Lizard offers irresistible selections of pizzas and pastas catered to suit everyone’s palates. (Aug 2021)

    Pork Ribs, Rack of Pork, Crabby Pesto (Pasta)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Le Bon Funk is a natural wine bar by The Lo & Behold Group. Located on 29 Club Street, it is the brainchild of Chef-Owner and Burnt Ends alumnus, Keirin Buck. Le Bon Funk brings "fine casual" to Singapore's food and beverage realm with its refreshing blend of exceptional boutique wines and elevated plates, all set in a convivial atmosphere. The name, Le Bon Funk, is a tongue-in-cheek jibe at the misconception that all natural wines taste funky (we think they are much more). It is an open invitation to not take oneself too seriously and to always be a 'glass half full' kind of person. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Naturally Leavened Sourdough Bread, House-Cured Charcuterie, Vegetable Crudités with Whipped Roe, Cedar Jelly with Foie Gras on Toast, Grilled Iwashi Sardines, Whole Heritage Chicken, Celery Custard and Buckwheat

  • PARKING INFORMATION

    Parking is available along Gemmill Lane and also at China Square Central which is a short walk away.

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the hip Mohamed Sultan area, Le Fusion specialises in modern Chinese fusion cuisine that intersects East and West. Offering a one-of-a-kind dining experience, Le Fusion is a melting pot of well-loved recipes and modern cooking techniques. The interior of Le Fusion is apt, a true amalgamation of Eastern and Western traditions in all forms. Gently lit by red lanterns, its walls are decorated with graffiti-esque pop art, with neon signs providing an extra je ne sais quoi. Be sure to try their Imperial Double Boiled Soup, accompanied with premium nu er hong. Alternatively, the Pan-seared Salmon that is infused with Japanese mirin, and further seasoned with bearnaise sauce and baby romaine is also a standout. No meal is complete without some dessert! Be sure to try Le Fusion's excellent Chendol, topped with coconut milk and Bailey's cream, for an additional pick-me-up! (Dec 2019)

    Le Noir offers a full food, drinks & live entertainment experience while enjoying spectacular views of the Singapore River. Located along the promenade of the iconic Marina Bay Sands, the venue features a unique blend of wood, marble and touches of gold; emanating in a sophisticated yet cozy atmosphere that is perfect for any occasion. Wine, dine and dance the night away, with a delectable variety of western fare including our must-try lava cheese wagyu burger and savory crab cakes; delicious signature cocktails, and a line-up of live performances from talented local and international artists. (Aug 2019)

    Crab Cakes, Lava Burger, Trio Cheese Pizza, Classic Breakfast

  • ABOUT

    Meat is the name of the game at Le Rida in Bukit Timah, a cosy little eatery that specializes in mezze-style grilled meats and steaks. Riding on its mezze theme, communal dining is encouraged, and a big part of the menu is shared platters of pitas and hearty Middle-Eastern dips like hummus, Iabneh, and motabal, which whet your appetite for the main part of your meal: the grilled meats. A mix of Middle-Eastern skewering and French-style grills, the menu here features classics like spicy tender lamb-mince kofta kebabs served on saffron rice and crunchy greens, minced chicken kebabs flavoured with Iranian spices, and flame-grilled seafood kebabs. These rub shoulders with French classics like French onion soup, grilled foie gras in a savoury-sweet orange sauce, and other carnivorous plates like crisp-skinned duck confit, a rich fricassee of chicken with cepes mushrooms, and a selection of premium flame-grilled Angus and Wagyu beef steaks, each steak served with a classic Bordelaise sauce, pomme frites, and buttered haricot beans. At Le Rida, there’s a little bit of something for different carnivorous appetites. Plus you get to jump across continents and cuisines, all at the same dinner table! (Nov 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    French Onion Soup, Foie Gras, Black Angus Sirloin Steak, Lebanese Kofta Kebab, Shish Taouk, Beef Shikaf Kebab

  • ABOUT

    More than just about serving up comfort food and drinks, Le Social strives to bring the highest standard of service to all diners looking for a relaxing time over good food and great drinks. Located in the heart of Joo Chiat, the restaurant’s cosy kitchen space boasts a huge variety of cocktails, whiskies, sakes, draft beers and an extensive collection of wines to pair with the plethora of localicious dishes available on the menu. Nothing lifts the spirits than the taste of home and renowned Peranakan chef Joel delivers just that with his creative spins on local favourites. Treat yourself to a glass of sparkling, red or white when you pop open your bottle from the restaurant’s carefully curated list of fine wines from all over the region. A legendary recipe from chef Joel’s grandmother, Taste of Home Braised Oxtail Stew is sure to evoke waves of nostalgia when you bite into the generous pieces of oxtail. Other equally noteworthy classics include Clear Seafood Tom Yum and Basil Chicken Rice. Wrap up your meal with a hearty serving of the Popiah Garden for a deliciously sweet ending here at Le Social. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Taste of Home Braised Oxtail Stew, Clear Seafood Tom Yum, Basil Chicken Rice, Popiah Garden

• ABOUT

    Creating conversations with cocktails and dainty morsels of canapes. LeBar is an outdoor pavilion-styled breezy bar lounge, with a panorama encompassing the lobby with its radiant blown-glass chandelier, extensive fountains, not to mention the inviting Sofitel Pool. Regardless of where you sit, the view enchants and delights. Inspired by the 19th century colonial-era pavilions, LeBar’s airy décor and plush furnishings invite you to linger over coffee and shared plates in the sun-drenched lounge. A quintessential spot to enjoy a tete-a-tete with friends and family as your nibble on artisan sandwiches, French pastries, intriguing libations and more. Watch the bar transform as the sun sets into a glamourous gathering place with eclectic furnishings and mahogany floors, along with the glistening waters after dark, creating a stunning stage to whisk the night away with tempting tipples. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tropical Classic High Tea

  • TROPICAL HIGH TEA (TILL 31 DEC)

    Savour a refreshing tropical high tea and bubbly in the heart of the resort with tranquil views of the lush outdoor palatial spaces and wafting sea breeze. The longstanding grand tradition of high tea awaits at LeBar. Whilst the gentle breeze wafts in, sink yourself into the plush cushions ready for an afternoon of tête-à-tête amidst a delectable selection of patisserie and savouries, reminiscent of a tropical Balinese escape. Keep an eye out for the resident peacocks as they grace the outdoor palatial spaces at the Sofitel Fountain. Enjoy free-flowing Nespresso or TWG Tea with the Tropical High Tea or enhance your private conversations with cool glasses of champagne. • ABOUT

    Draped in quirky crab regalia is a quaint little seafood cove doling out the best of crab, fish, prawns, and more! Legacy Seafood is simple seafood done exceptionally well. The menu has it all, from traditional favourites to unique renditions, so ordering one of everything is a must! The family-style concept is perfect for those groups looking to try a little bit of everything, with items like their Shimmering Sand Crab - also their claim to fame - being a true delight. The mesmerizing Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup is a personal favourite, and we've come to learn the hard way that one order is never enough. The broth is simmered for hours which makes for an extremely flavourful stock, and a dish we really begrudgingly share with friends and family - it's just that good! (Jan 2016)

    "Legacy Seafood (Previously known as Uncle Leong Seafood at Jurong East) is famous for their crab dishes and local cuisine. A now, full-fledged restaurant, continues to drawn customers with its signature dishes that could really attract everyone the way it was made and prepared." -Singapore Expats

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Five-star luxury urban resort Dusit Thani Laguna Singapore unveils Legends Bar, an alluring new establishment with a line-up of cocktails inspired by golfing greats. Sharing the grounds of Laguna National Golf Resort Club, home to two championship golf courses, Legends Bar offers the perfect space to chill out and cool down while taking in picturesque views of the lush surroundings. “Legends Bar is inspired by Dusit Thani Laguna Singapore’s unique location, with a history of hosting major champions such as Ernie Els and Sir Nick Faldo. We want to provide our guests with a comfortable and classy spot to enjoy drinks wittily concocted to honour golf luminaries from all around the world,” says Eric Piatti, General Manager of Dusit Thani Laguna Singapore. Guests can look forward to warm Thai hospitality and the infusion of exotic tropical ingredients, influenced by Dusit Thani’s roots in the Land of Smiles. A comprehensive list of wines, spirits, sake, and mocktails will also be available at the venue. Every corner of the warmly lit space is filled with rich green foliage, complementing undulating cushioned wooden booths and tables that offer cosy nooks for intimate conversations. The result is an intriguing and welcoming environment that evokes a sense of wonder and desire for exploration. Once restrictions lift, Nu-funk, house, and soft jazz music will play throughout, putting imbibers in a relaxed mood as they indulge in their drinks of choice. For a light-hearted touch to further enliven the atmosphere, Legends Bar also provides fun table games – think a micro-sized, compact miniature golf set, or Play Nine – a card game golfers and non-golfers alike are sure to appreciate. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Your Daly Smash, Mango Madre, Long Banana, Arnold Palmer, Legends Beef Sliders

    With a sleek modern décor and cosy ambiance, Leopold, a 40 seater restaurant in the heart of Tanjong Pagar serves the first of its kind in Singapore, the AGS menu. AGS stands for Austrian, German, and Swiss. Austrian owner Klaus Leopold is giving guests the opportunity to savour common cuisines of German-speaking countries cooked with grandmothers recipes. Choose from Leopold’s 5 hours slow braised beef Goulash, traditional food like Swiss Rösti, German Flammkuchen, Cheese Spatzle, Leberkase, Apfelstrudel, Kaiserschmarren, viel Schnitzel and many more. Pair your dinner with a selection of own imported Austrian and German wines and curated cocktails with its own Leopold Sloe Gin and Dry Gin brand called Leopold Spirits. (Feb 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    “A tapas bistro, cocktail and wine bar rolled into one, this Tanjong Pagar restaurant serves a modern and comforting menu, which features dishes like cured meat and cheese charcuterie boards.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Traditional Beef Goulash, Curry Sausage, Slow Roasted Marinated Pork Collar, Leopold Chicken Drumlets, Austrian Apple Strudel, Cajun Shoestring Fries, Calamari Rings, Austrian Apricot Dumpling

    It’s modern French cooking that’s served at Lerouy. True to the modern ethos that permeates the entire establishment, the setting features an elegant, winding counter which curves around an open kitchen. The restaurant offers a tasting menu which evolves and changes from time to time, but which constantly features exciting creations with the chef’s strong individual stamp. The only thing predictable about Lerouy is the consistently excellent cooking which never fails to impress, so do head down sometime soon and give it a go! (Nov 2021)

  • MENU & PRICING

    In Lerouy, a Carte Blanche menu is served across lunch and dinner.This Carte Blanche experience is about the “element of surprise”; giving Chef Lerouy the opportunity to create an entirely bespoke tasting menu drawing from inspiration, creativity, and seasonality, whilst working with the best artisan providores and purveyors from around the world.Lunch (5-course) $98++Dinner (7-course) $198++15 April 2022 onwardsLunch (5-course) $118++Dinner (7-course) $210++

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Since its inception in 1994, Les Amis, the sophisticated first-born of the Les Amis Group, has always strived to maintain the restaurant's philosophy - to deliver the ultimate fine-dining experience realized through attention to detail and dedication to sourcing and serving the finest ingredients. After picking up the reins at Les Amis in 2014, Chef Sebastien has made it his mission to further the restaurant's philosophy by emphasizing the focus on the quality of ingredients used, rather than targeting the latest cooking trends. Today, 90% of the ingredients used at Les Amis are imported from France, carefully crafted and skilfully presented in an elegant setting of luxurious comfort. (Nov 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "This is one of the few meals I've had this year where every thing on the table was a win, and we're pretty sure your experience will be amazing and totally worth the damage." -City Nomads "This is traditional French food at its best in Singapore - you won't find any fancy fusion stuff here. For this privilege you fork out of course, but this one is worth saving your pennies for." -SG Now "The highlight of our meal is still the chef's signature pasta, which condenses an ocean's worth of rich sweetness and brine into a sauce for angel hair pasta, served with Kombu, caviar and black truffle." -Time Out Singapore

html:
• ABOUT

    A classic destination for the tradition of bistro style steaks and the ever important French fry, Les Bouchons is certain to become your next go-to steakhouse. The look of Les Bouchons defies any whim of trendiness and sticks to the standards of bistro design: curvy backed chairs and white tablecloths simply dressed with the essential fork, steak knife, burgundy napkin, and wine glass, sit upon tiled floors both inside and out on the charming patio. The shophouse locale fits the look, transporting the restaurant to a simpler time and slowed down pace in small town France. And with the upcoming selection of to-die-for steaks and free flow fries, you'll be glad to feel the minutes slipping by at their leisure. Start with the Os A Moelle, or beef bone marrow served with crisp toasts. The meaty butter-like spread is indulgently delicious, and an ideal primer to the protein heavy meal. The mains are simply stated, and all come with sides of salad and endless frites. The Grilled Sirloin Steak with Herbs is a particular star as is "The Real Entrecote" from Normandy, which is best to be shared among pairs. The steaks are clearly of premium quality and cooked to rosy pink perfection with a caramelised char on the outside. The accompanying fries are of medium thickness with fluffed centers and crisped coatings, ideal for dipping into the classic sauces of mustards, bernaise, mayonnaise and horseradish. However, the steak haven is no one-trick pony. On the weekends, the talented kitchen pulls out all the stops with the Couscous Royal, a tempting platter of marinated and grilled lamb, chicken and Merguez sausage upon a flavored bed of couscous. Or else try the Jumbo Prawn, kissed by the grill and drizzled with olive oil to bring out the natural sweetness of the crustacean. The dish is another reminder from Les Bouchons that French cooking needs only the very basics to be done well. (Dec 2018)

  • SAVE UP TO 20% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    20 years young and radiating joie de vivre (enjoyment of life) is Les Bouchons, a culinary stalwart known for value-for-money Steak Frites and authentic French cuisine. This time, the brand sets up shop amidst the serene and lush Rochester Park, offering an effortlessly relaxed and casual chic ambience that harks back to old-school French bistros and steakhouses. Working closely in tandem with Executive Chef Mickaël Cornac and helming the kitchen at Les Bouchons Rochester is Chef Nelson Chua, the former executive chef of Atout, as well as a Les Amis alumnus who founded Poulét.Guests will be immediately drawn to a range of quality meats on the affordably priced Plats and À Partager sections that include a Mixed Salad and free-flow homemade French fries. (Mar 2022)

• ABOUT

    Perched on the rooftop of a conservation shophouse in Tanjong Pagar, Levant is a stylish, cosmopolitan open-air bar that crafts out sleek cocktails and Mediterranean-inspired mezze plates perfect for sharing. The menu plays with the flavours of the region, mingling citrus with exotic spices and florals. Smooth grooves, sassy beats and the cool city breeze set the tone for nights of reunions and rendezvous. Stylish and bold, the expansive menu experiments with the different flavours of the region, mingling citrus with exotic spices and florals. Gear up for a lovely feast featuring the restaurant’s sleek cocktails and Mediterranean-inspired mezze plates here. Embark on a journey of sensual florals, intriguing herbs and spices with a hot mezze starter. Truffle lovers should opt for the Smoked Duck & Truffle Samosas. A hearty serving of meat and samosas, this delicious plate is drizzled with Mango Amba sauce for a refreshing finish. Served with pita bread, the cold mezze options are also aplenty. The Avocado Hummus is a nutritious and tasty dish perfect for the health-conscious. Other vegetarian menu options include Stuffed Olives, Sundried Tomatoes, Roasted Artichokes and more. Wash your meal down with a glass of Citrus Tree. A heady mix of Gin, Citron and Citrus Smoke, enjoy your cocktail spiced, dry, or spirituous here at Levant. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smoked Duck & Truffle Samosas, Avocado Hummus, Sundried Tomatoes, Citrus Tree

    Standing at 156 meters above ground level, LeVeL33 literally rises above all breweries as the world's first microbrewery installed at the penthouse of a skyscraper. Located on the 33rd floor of Marina Bay Financial Centre, the restaurant houses 8,000 kg of state-of-the-art microbrewery equipment in a spacious restaurant featuring breath-taking panoramic views of Singapore skyline, as well as an open-air Terrace. LeVeL33 offers guests a multi-zone dining experience and ambiance, from refined privacy to social revelry. The refined LeVeL33 Dining Room exudes a mellow ambiance suited to business lunches, dinners and/or special occasions and is specially designed to ensure more comfort and privacy. LeVeL33 Social was designed for social interaction and encourages a buoyant atmosphere for guests to relax. With sharing menu and the new Raw Bar that offers an array of seafood such as oysters, guests are able to enjoy a truly heightened dining experience. (Jul 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Named after the famous Tang-dynasty poet, the ambience at this Sheraton Towers stalwart is a feat in and of itself. Think Jade table settings, bone chopsticks, and discreet waitstaff. The dining concept here harkens back to the days of grand Emperors in China, so you can expect fresh ingredients and premium nosh in an equally opulent setting. Located centrally, the menus here cater to a variety of diners, so whether you’re after a exquisite business lunch or a cosy dinner, veteran chef Chung Yiu Ming’s delicious creations have got you covered. The executive lunch set is a big hit with office workers, as is the dim sum menu, which features an array of delicate nibbles crafted with premium ingredients. We especially love the Crystal Skin Dumpling, a tender creation bursting with colourful vegetables. Meals here begin with the classic Chinese delicacy, Shark’s Cartilage Soup. Rich, tender fish maw and Goji Berries are the crowning glory of this light soup, that makes for the perfect precursor to the carefully curated cuisine that follows. Whether you’re a seasoned diner or completely new to Cantonese cuisine, if you’re after a taste of Hong Kong, this is the place for you. (Apr 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Many things about Li Bai tell of its unique positioning as one of the few classic establishments that is stoically unchanged, and its loyal patrons clearly appreciate it." -The Peak

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shark’s Cartilage Soup, Crystal Skin Dumpling, Bird’s Nest Soup, Barbecued Peking Duck, Steamed “Live” Red Garoupa

html:
• ABOUT

    Inspired by their illustrious maritime history, Lighthouse Bistro shines brightly in a little corner off Jellicoe Road. Since 2003, it has provided both members and non-members of the Singapore Maritime Officers’ Union with a place to socialise and unwind. If you want to enjoy fresh and tasty seafood in a good ambience, you won’t go wrong with Lighthouse Bistro. If you’re in a big group, pay homage to the bistro’s past by having the Fishermen’s Board - a platter of tiger prawns, fresh blue mussels, crispy Atlantic dory, and garlicky, spicy batavia squid. Enjoy the Milk-Battered Calamari that is topped with copious amount of chicken floss and tangy lemon tartar sauce. For mains, the Fishermen’s Angel Hair is a great fusion noodle dish with a spicy sambal kick. If seafood is not your thing, fear not! Soaked in a special marinate for 24 hours, the Honey Charred Chicken emerges completely tender and succulent, definitely a crowd favourite for a reason. For a sweet finish, try Mary’s Butter Cake, which is a buttery vanilla cake topped with either chocolate or vanilla ice cream, cookie crumbles, and berries. The team at Lighthouse Bistro is extremely dedicated and driven to create good memories for you. Since its founding, it has undergone three major revamps to provide a refreshing experience. By providing quality at affordable prices, it is of little wonder that many of the diners are repeat customers. For those looking to experience the trinity of great food, great price, and great ambience, look no further than Lighthouse Bistro! (Nov 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Lighthouse has been revamped with a sophisticated new look and a new stripped down but focused menu - a change that makes it the latest must-try.” -Weekender Singapore

  • ABOUT

    Here at Chope, we are willing to do a lot for great eats. But if satisfying our Caribbean cravings means taking a long haul flight to the western hemisphere, that's where we draw the line. Thankfully, all we need is a trip to Chinatown, where buzz-worthy Lime House Caribbean Restaurant & Bar is just the place to get our Caribbean eat, drink, and party on! Set in a beautifully restored shop house, the ambiance prepares you for "liming", which is Caribbean lingo for chilling with friends. Given rave reviews for its authentic island cuisine - a rare find in Singapore - Lime House Caribbean is a mecca for those looking to indulge in good vibes, friendly gatherings and a Caribbean menu devised by their head chef from Barbados, Kirk Brathwaite. Having had extensive experience working at some of the most luxurious resorts in the Caribbean, he means serious business when it comes to churning out delicious fare. Kirk puts his spin on classics but isn't afraid to introduce new and exciting dishes that evoke the Caribbean. Pepper Shrimp, Seafood Cakes, Calypso Fish, Blue Mountain Steak, Fire Roasted Stuffed Sweet Potato, and Tropics Cheesecake, it's an endless list of punchy flavours. With a “welcome home” philosophy at the core of the Lime House Caribbean Experience, diners are also free to make themselves comfortable by sharing hearty platters of Wings, Sliders, and an assortment of other trademark Caribbean bites that are sure to become favourites. Renowned philosopher Captain Jack Sparrow once posed the existential question, "But why is the rum gone"? Well, we're happy to confirm that it isn't, and that Lime House Caribbean has a plentiful stash that would make any pirate jealous! That being said, you are encouraged to continue your liming on the second floor, with a classic punch in hand! (Dec 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Well-spiced and filling Caribbean classics served up in generous portions." -SG Now "We perused the different options and agreed that, if we came back, we would try pretty much anything on the menu." -Expat Living

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oxtail Eggplant, Dhal Mushrooms, Seafood Tostones, Caribbean Rice Bowls, Curry Goat, Signature Jerk Chicken

    The pleasures of a multi-sensory feast come alive at The Line! Be wowed by the sights, sounds, aromas, and flavours as the multi-national team of chefs prepare a smorgasbord of international flavours and curated speciality dishes from their heritage. Discover a world of flavours through Middle Eastern, Indian, Western, Peranakan and Asian delights, and indulge in the fresh selections of chilled seafood and succulent roasts that The Line is well-loved for. The destination of choice for family gatherings and birthday celebrations, The Line continues to bring a sense of occasion and ignite the joy of dining with a vibrant and enthralling gourmet experience. Expect nothing short of a clawsome time with Seafood Splash, as you choose your serving of fresh Boston lobster, Sri Lankan crab, prawns and more to be prepared with one of five unique sauces created by The Line’s culinary team.     Chinese Vegetarian Gourmet Cuisine is served at LingZhi. Its innovative and quality dishes have kept many, vegetarians and meat-lovers alike, coming back for more since 1991. Gone are the primitive, conservative style of preparing vegetarian dishes with mock meats, artificial colouring, and additives. In its place, is a range of dishes filled with wholesome goodness, and tonifying fare prepared from the finest, freshest, natural as well as organic ingredients. Each dish is meticulously prepared to ensure that it is well-represented and the cooking methods used allow maximum retention of the original tastes and nutritional values. This, of course, is no small feat, achievable only by chefs who have honed their culinary skills over several years of hard work. So whether you follow a strict vegetarian lifestyle or are someone who's looking for healthier, tastier options, we welcome you to the exciting culinary world of LingZhi Vegetarian. (Jul 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mixed Fresh Fruits and Kale Salad with Vietnam Rice Skin, Mushroom Truffle Bisque, Homemade Carrot Cake Topped with Ice Cream, Poached Mixed Rice with Vegetables, Vegetarian Satay Served in Fresh Pineapple

html:
• ABOUT

    Located at Binjai Park, Lino brings classic Italian cooking techniques to the table with their homemade pizzas, pastas and other italian favourites. With a wide menu to choose from, you’re spoilt for choice when dining at Lino. For starters, go for their Octopus, with delicate and tender chargrilled tentacles drizzled in a light balsamic sauce. Deliciously fresh and tantalising, it’s the perfect appetiser to start off your meal. For mains, Binjai’s Braised Lamb Shank is fall off the bone and fork-tender. If you’re looking at a lighter option, go for their creamy, cheesy Spinach Ricotta Ravioli, a buttery blend that leaves you satisfied with every bite. Pizzas are also a must-have at Lino, and their Meatless Meat Pizza is a great meatless option if you’re looking for a change of taste. To end off your meal, we recommend their crumbly and dense Apple Tart. Served with whipped cream, this pastry will make any Nonna proud. Lino also serves a whole host of cocktails. If you’re looking for a great way to end your evening, sip on their delicious blend of alcohol while feasting on classic Italian cuisine. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Octopus, Clams, Lamb Ragu Garganelli, Scallop Risotto, Char-Grilled Iberian Pork Secreto, Braised Lamb Shank, Burrata Pizza, Mixed Mushroom Pizza

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    LINO is a contemporary, Italian-inspired restaurant specializing in fresh, handmade pizza, pasta, and small plates, and offers a unique beverage program focused on wine, spritzes, beer, digestives, cocktails, and coffee. The first LINO Restaurant opened in 2018 at Binjai Park, and in September 2021, the brand welcomed its second outlet at Forum The Shopping Mall. The spacious restaurant is a lush sanctuary of vibrant colours, natural elements and greenery. Distinct from the Binjai Park outlet, LINO at Forum The Shopping Mall is bright and airy during the day with plenty of natural light, and elegant yet cozy at night. The open kitchen and bar offer a view of the action, while the gorgeous alfresco dining area provides the perfect respite especially in the cool evenings. LINO’s philosophy is to utilise classic cooking techniques that allow flavours to develop naturally and honestly, and to make it a happy place for honest Italian food. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Vitello Tonnato, Arancini, Carbonara Chitarra, Trofie Al Pesto, Pollo Al Mattone, Pan-fried Veal Escalope, Burrata Pizza, Pancetta Pizza

    Located in Shaw Centre, LINO Pizza & Pasta Bar prides itself on its simple and comforting dishes. Boasting a minimalist and sleek interior with delicate touches of olive green and soft pink, LINO Pizza & Pasta Bar provides a cosy and tranquil establishment that is perfect for an intimate meal. While pasta and pizzas are a focus here, the menu also offers a variety of appetizer and dessert options for a more wholesome dining experience. An affordable 3 course set lunch of $22++ is available from Mondays to Fridays. There are also monthly specials specially curated by the team. Lino Pizza & Pasta bar is open for Walk-ins. Reservations are open from 11:30am-12pm (Lunch) and 6-6:30pm (Dinner) only. (Jul 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Perched on the water’s edge is LIT Bar and Lounge. Charmingly located in a lovingly restored conservation shophouse, LIT serves a wide selection of dishes. Enjoy the tranquil views of the Singapore River as you dine on mouthwatering dishes. For starters, we recommend their Sautéed Garlic Prawns, a fragrant, rich dish with generous portions of sweet prawns accompanied with a bed of greens. In line with the seafood theme, we recommend their Treasures of the Sea, a rich seafood stock that’s mixed and cooked with a wide selection of seafood. Enjoy a deliciously sweet and satisfying start to your meal with this savoury soup. Splurge a little and go for their Exotic Hand-Picked Jumbo Crab Linguini with Scallops. Worth every penny, this pasta dish is a delightful mix of Hokkaido scallops with fresh organic basil bathed in a stock-infused pink sauce. Full of umami goodness, this dish is incredibly appetizing without overpowering your tastebuds, and you get to taste the freshness of their ingredients. For groups that are looking to share a bite, LIT’s Signature Famous Burrata Pizza brings you Michelin-grade burrata with premium-aged parma ham and juicy tomatoes. Don’t skimp on the alcohol. With LIT’s wide selection of alcohols and spirits, find the perfect drink to pair with your food for a perfect boozy evening out by the river. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Michelin Quality Burrata, Exotic Hand-Picked Jumbo Crab Linguini with Scallops, The Sicilian Fisherman’s Bounty Prawns, Seafood Risotto in Roma Tomato Sauce, Tiramisu

• ABOUT

    Little Elephant SG Thai Bistro will whisk you to the land of smiles with its array of authentic Thai dishes and decor that evoke the vibes of an old-school Thai eating house. As with most Thai restaurants, dishes are served communal style, so grab a few buddies. Start with several hot and cold appetisers such as the Papaya Salad, Homemade Prawn Cake, and Grilled Pork Neck. Get the feast going with a selection of Thai soups, curries, mains, and rice and noodle dishes. All-time favourites such as Tom Yum Kung, Pineapple Rice, and Pad Thai star alongside lesser-known gems like Stir-Fried Morning Glory and Prawns in Lemongrass and Honey Sauce. After working up a sweat with all that spicy goodness, cool down with a refreshing Thai Milk Tea or Chang Beer. Be sure to leave room for dessert too. You won't want to miss their rendition of the sweet and tangy Mango Sticky Rice. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Kung, Grilled Pork Neck, Stir-Fried Morning Glory, Prawns in Lemongrass and Honey Sauce, Mango Sticky Rice

  • PROMOTIONS

    Craft Beer Tuesday1-for-1 craft beer. Dine-in only. Price of the lower-priced beer will be waived.

    Little Farms at Valley Point has recently renovated its Café & Bistro and is now accepting reservations for dinner and afternoons. With a new Execute Chef, our revamped menu with light and fresh options made with seasonal produce and ingredients from Little Farms Grocer is open 7 days for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Try light options like the Homemade Falafel, Smoked Cauliflower, or delicious Baked Camembert or Burrata – the perfect accompaniment with wine.Keen for more substantial options? The Roasted Free-range Half Chicken, Linley Valley Pork Cutlley, and the Barramundi Fish and Chips are both made with meat and fish farmed in Singapore. There's also a range of keto-friendly and vegan treats like Banana Bread, Orange and Almond Muffins, and more, all baked fresh daily. Wine down with us in the evening – on Sunday Happy Hour is extended all night. On Wednesday, enjoy free wine corkage when the table spends more than $40 on food, and on Thursday – Haton Champagne is $15 a glass from 3pm. Tables available for walk-ins for breakfast, lunch, and brunch. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Falafel, Linley Valley Pork Cutlet, Smokey Turmeric Charred Cauliflower, Comte Burnt Cheese Cake. Ask about our seasonal daily specials!

  • ABOUT

    Specialising in dishing up healthy bites that feel good and taste delicious, Little Farms Bistro uses the highest quality fresh ingredients that are all-natural for a mindful approach to healthy living. Fresh for the neighborhood, look no further than Little Farms Bistro to feast without guilt on savoury dishes and sweet pastry treats along with coffee, juices and smoothies. The bar also serves up a specially curated wine list alongside craft beer on tap and a wide range of signature cocktails that are as delicious as they are eco-friendly. Start off your morning strong with a shot of Macchiato. Sure to leave you refreshed and rejuvenated, this shot of caffeine is all you need to fuel you up for a busy day ahead. Try on the crowd favourite Avocado Smash on House Sourdough to complete your morning. Featuring freshest avocados (that can be found at Little Farms supermarket), poached eggs, Meredith feta, confit tomatoes, furikake and enjoy this hearty serving of breakfast delights. Quick grab and go option are available with freshly baked pastries. Wrap up your meal with a tantalising slice of Muscovado Carrot or Comte Burnt Cheese for a decadent end! (Feb 2022)

    Avocado Smash on House Sourdough, Muscovado Carrot, Comte Burnt Cheese

  • ABOUT

    Little Italy Salumeria along Changi Road recreates a cosy Italian family environment serving authentic Italian food from traditional recipes made with quality ingredients. Offering simplicity at its best, this humble Italian restaurant provides diners with an extensive list of antipasti, pasta, risotto and pizza options for a complete Italian dining experience. Featuring Italian pork sausage porcini mushroom drizzled with a light truffle sauce, the Paccheri Salsiccia E Porcini is a delicious pasta recommendation that will satisfy all your carnivorous cravings. The Risotto Frutti Di Mare is another tantalising menu option made of prawns, calamari, clams, and mussels with squid ink sauce. Try pairing it with a healthy bowl of Mixed Salad or Grilled Vegetables for a hearty meal. For those visiting in larger groups, order the Diavola or Bufalina Pizza to go around the table. (Sep 2021)

    Paccheri Salsiccia E Porcini, Risotto Frutti Di Mare, Diavola, Bufalina

  • ABOUT

    Nothing spells communal dining quite as much as a hotpot dinner. Adding to the fray of hotpot joints in Singapore is Little Lamb (Xiao Wei Yang), located in Suntec City mall. The star of the show here is the Mala Xiang (spicy Sichuan) soup, made from plenty of dried chilli peppers, ginger and ginseng for a vibrant red soup base that packs a fiery punch. Order from a wide selection of fresh meats to swish and swirl in your choice of broth. The US beef slices and Kurobuta pork slices are generously marbled, and you’ll want to save room for the Lamb set as well. Try the signature Lamb Ribs, or the Braised Lamb that is good for sharing between three to four persons. Wash it all down with a pot of hot Chinese tea, that will help to balance out the rich dinner. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lamb Ribs, Braised Lamb, Mala Xiang Soup, US Beef Slices, Kurobuta Pork Slices

• ABOUT

    Just a stone’s throw away from Sixth Avenue MRT, Lazy Lizard is a quaint restaurant that dishes out Western cuisine at pocket-friendly prices. A must-try on the menu is the Crispy Poached Salmon, a wholesome dish showcasing a fork-tender fillet of slow-cooked fish, scented with a citrusy lemon oil, and paired with roasted garden vegetables. The Roasted Game Hen is another delicious dish to tuck into. Here, half a spring chicken is generously seasoned with garlic and herbs, then roasted to yield a crispy, golden-brown skin and succulent, juicy meat. The dish is served with red mashed potatoes and a drizzle of red wine sauce. If you are looking to sink your teeth into a juicy burger, the Triple Cheese Beef Burger is the thing to order. US choice beef patty is stacked with grilled bacon, mushrooms, and triple gruyere cheese. A sunny-side up egg completes the tasty picture. Best savoured with your bare hands, and plenty of napkins on the side to wipe away those delicious juices. (Sept 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Poached Salmon, Roasted Game Hen, Triple Cheese Beef Burger, Lazy Lizard’s Sirloin, Green Tea Lava Cake

  • ABOUT

    If hotpot’s your thing, Little Sheep Hotpot spot is sure to be right up your alley! Founded in the early 2000s in Inner Mongolia, this greenhorn shook up the hotpot scene in China with their innovative hotpot -- minus the dipping sauce. Their rich broth all but made up for the lack of condiments, and the recipe has stayed consistent for over eighteen years. What’s so special about the broth? The savoury soup base, made with seven special spices and mutton from Inner Mongolia, retains its signature flavour even after long hours of boiling. The Four Mushroom Soup is one of their most popular broths. Earthy and not too spicy, this base choice adds richness to all the items added. Meat-lovers are sure to enjoy the array of dishes on offer for the hotpot. The Australia Sirloin Beef Cubes are rich and buttery, and absorb the spices of the soup, enhancing the meat’s flavour with a spicy kick. One of their most raved options for hotpot is the Lamb Roll, which consists of paper-thin slices of lamb rolled into small tubes. The meat cooks quickly and is thin enough to soak up all the broth’s flavours. The lamb cuts are available on their own or as a combination with beef slices. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Australia Sirloin Beef Cubes, Lamb Roll, Double Flavour Hot Pot, Four Mushroom Soup, Tomato Soup

    The perfect venue for daily Happy Hours and all the latest sporting action, Lobby Lounge & Bar is the place to unwind after a day of sightseeing, shopping or work. Guests can pamper one’s self with a dainty high tea set or simply enjoy a collection of tasty cocktails complemented with savoury snacks from the kitchen. (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Beef Sliders, Fish Fingers, Grilled Mini Sausages, Homemade Potato Wedges

  • UNIQUELY LOCAL COCKTAILS

    Satisfy your Asian tastes at Lobby Lounge & Bar with Uniquely Local Cocktails. A delightful flight of flavours showcasing local elements taking on unforgettable twists on familiar Singaporean tastes that you can indulge in. Venturing deep into the craft of cocktails, Head Craftsman Vignesh Iyer creates exciting flavours using modern techniques paired with a range of quirky infusions and tinctures, presenting our very own rendition of locally inspired iconic drinks. Choose from 9 artisan crafted cocktails, each one bespoke in its own way that will tickle your palate and suit your preference, style and taste. Tiger Sling$18++ One of Lobby Lounge & Bar’s signature drinks made from refreshing herbs and tiger beer, a twist to the original recipe. Singapore Sling$18++ A cooling mix of cherry brandy, gin, lime and pineapple originating from the Long Bar at the Raffles Hotel since 1915 Durian King$16++ An exotic cocktail using Singapore’s favourite fruit carefully infused into this local concoction. Teh Tarik$16++ Locally inspired tea infusion with bourbon and flamed with cinnamon Coco Power La$16++ Enticing flavour of coconut with 23 year old aged rum perked up with pandan, one of Asia’s top flavour enhancers combined with the fragrance and sweetness of pineapple and orange juice. August National$16++ Commemorating the month of August that is celebrated as our nation’s birthday and whiskey sour day, this is a spin-off to the classic whisky sour which still combines the original big three of spirit, citrus and sugar resulting in a satisfying finish. Wah So Hot!$16++ The cocktail that brings tears of joy to all lovers of spicy food. Lemon Lime$16++ Miss the simple drinks of the good ole days? Here’s a concoction which will help you relive those memories with an infusion of gin, lime, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaf, simple syrup and topped with soda. Bo-Jio$16++ A sweet refreshing cocktail of vodka, ginger syrup, fresh lime and soda, perfect for the tropical weather. Don’t say bo-jio!

  • PROMOTIONS

    Super Happy Hour Don’t miss out on everyday Super Happy Hour at Lobby Lounge & Bar and on weekends, be part of all the live sporting action.When: Available from 5pm to 9pm daily (On live-match days, Super Happy Hour is available from 5pm till closing.)Price: All house pours start from S$12++Afternoon High Tea Set with Local Infusions at Lobby Lounge & Bar Listed as having one of the best high tea promotions in Singapore for 2019 by Asia One (https://www.asiaone.com/lifestyle/high-tea-promotions-singapore-2019), Lobby Lounge & Bar presents an afternoon high tea with a twist. Combining the best features of a traditional tea with local infusions and inspirations, the three-tiered serving platter is packed with 16 dainty bites, each one picture perfect and a real treat to eat. At only S$42++ for 2 persons on weekdays and S$45++ for 2 persons on weekends, its great value with an artisanal quality that is hard to find. Lovingly crafted by Executive Chef Bobby Saravanan and the culinary team, high tea lovers can start the true English way with scones, a must have in every high tea, where there is nothing better than having the joy of spreading clotted cream and strawberry jam on a freshly baked scones. The afternoon high tea set comes with three generous tiers of bite-sized tea cakes, pastries, sandwiches and tantalising savouries like smoked asparagus quiche. End of with a sweet finish of waffle croissant with vanilla ice cream to culminate your afternoon experience. There’s no better feeling than sipping a piping hot cup of tea with friends while nibbling on creative treats and exquisite savouries. Lobby Lounge & Bar also provides a relaxing ambience to lounge your afternoon away with the perfect afternoon tea for any occasion. Stay on after 5pm to enjoy our daily Super Happy Hour with 1-for-1 on all alcoholic beverages.Time: 12-4:30pm dailyPrice:• S$42++ for 2 persons (Monday to Friday)•S$45++ for 2 persons (Saturday & Sunday)• S$28++ for 1 person (daily)• S$15++ per child (6 to 12 years old)

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Dine as the locals do, albeit with a refined twist, with every visit to The Lobby Lounge. Redesigned and revitalised, the lounge now offers an enticing array of local heritage hawker dishes, made with finest quality ingredients, and prepared to perfection. Eight signatures anchor the menu, each inspired by the flavours and culinary techniques of those who know this best in the nation: Hainanese Beef Noodles, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Fish Soup, Roti Prata, Katong Laksa, Prawn Noodle Soup, Bak Kut Teh, Bak Chor Mee, Ayam Buah Keluak, Ikan Assam Pedas and Beef Rendang.What's more, come mid-afternoon, The Lobby Lounge transits to afternoon tea, offering a Three-Tier Local Signature Set featuring succulent local delicacies. To enhance the experience, food is served on Peranakan crockery - think colourful motifs of nature that lend an authentic touch to the dining experience. Touch and taste aside, in between courses, pause for a moment to enjoy the elegant and relaxing atmosphere, complemented by impressive soaring columns that heighten the double volume space, floor-to-ceiling glass windows that let in natural light. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    3-Tier Local Signature Afternoon Tea Set, Kong Bak Pau Kong Bak Pau, Bak Chor Mee, Prawn Rolls

  • DAILY HERITAGE BREAKFAST SPREAD

    Experience perennial local favourites all under one roof with Lobby Lounge's Heritage Breakfast. In collaboration with popular local food brands, the menu sees six authentic signature dishes such as Nasi Lemak, Prata, Soft-Boiled Eggs with Kaya Toast, Wanton Mee, Carrot Cake and Hainanese Porridge.     Offering an elegant and comfortable setting, drop by The Lobby Lounge at Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel anytime time of the day to enjoy a casual, open layout with natural lighting, textured stone floors, and wooden panels. A great place with beautiful sunlight for a cup of traditional afternoon tea or a hearty lunch with Western and Asian delights. Indulge in the old-school charms of traditional English afternoon tea and satiate your taste buds with a selection of delicious afternoon snacks and assorted savourites. Pair with your choice of TWG tea or coffee for a relaxing afternoon catch-up with family or friends. Inclusive of a complimentary glass of welcome cold brew white tea, the English Afternoon High Tea set comes with a variety of sweet and savoury treats. Let Lobby Lounge take your happiness up a notch with our unique and refreshing Citrus Fruits English Afternoon Tea. Freshly made in-house with carefully-selected fresh citrus fruits and fine ingredients, standout treats include Champagne Panna Cotta with Mango and Pomelo; Osmanthus Scented Pineapple Éclair; Yuzu Green Tea Cheese Tart; Bergamot & Blueberry Pound Cake; Hot Smoked Salmon Rillettes Vol-Au-Vent with Kaffir Lime Ricotta & Passionfruit Pearls, and more.     With the Marina Bay area getting prettier by the day, you’ll want to get a seat at this lobby cafe which offers some of the most gorgeous views of the waterfront on the island. It helps that the view is framed by the chic interior decor and heaving tiers of tea-time treats, all of this several floors above the ground at one of the “highest” hotel lobbies in the city. html:
• ABOUT

    Calling all lobster and travel lovers! Lobster Air provides diners with an enjoyable First and Business class dining experience. With a menu inspired by actual airline food served in those categories, the restaurant whips up classic delights such as Lobster Pasta, Premium Oyster Plate and more. Follow the dedicated cabin crew staff to your seat and prepare for a feast in the skies. Start with a light plate of Tofu Lobster Salad or the Lobster Salad topped with Salted Egg Fish Skin. While it’s a less healthy option, the latter is worth every calorie, rewarding diners with a satisfying crunch in every bite. Baked with garlic butter sauce and served with a house salad, choose to either satisfy your seafood cravings with half a lobster or a whole lobster. Piled with a hearty portion of organic spinach pasta, the Lobster Spinach Pasta is also a healthy main option filled with juicy lobster, greens and a generous serving of noodles to fill you up. For passengers who are looking for a lighter selection, the restaurant’s short haul menu is made for you. Featuring steamed lobster meat, opt for the Lobster Salad topped with sunflower seeds and drizzled with Japanese roasted sesame dressing for an extra crunch. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Premium Oyster Plate, Lobster Salad topped with Salted Egg Fish Skin, Lobster Spinach Pasta, Lobster Bisque

html:
• ABOUT

    In 2014, Aussie Chef Darren Farr started The Lokal, an Australian Restaurant-Bar, providing customers with homemade comfort food — including butter, sauces, pickles and meats all made on site. Our name is German for local, an influence that be explained by its proximity to Goethe-Institut Singapore and is also reflective of our diverse and worldly approach towards food that can be enjoyed by the people in Singapore. In the day, he serves up healthy and hearty brunches but slowly transits into a cozy and versatile space for intimate dinners & casual cocktails sessions with comfort food by German Head Chef Max Strauch. Aside from the normal menus, both Chef Darren & Max also prepare Daily Specials with fresh seasonal produces for Brunch & Dinner, like Victorian Truffles & White Asparagus. Chef Darren Farr, more prominently known by his Instagram followers as ‘fuzzychef’, used to work at Tetsuya’s in Sydney, before working at various restaurants across London and Hong Kong. Chef Max Strauch spent most of his childhood growing up in Jakarta (which explains how he can speak fluent Bahasa) before heading back to Germany to further his culinary journey, spending years in Cookies Cream, a popular vegetarian fine dining restaurant in Berlin. The well-travelled Chef Max also worked in Hamburg & Australia before settling into The Lokal in Singapore, showcasing his style of comfort food with great produce. So the next time you swing by, pull out a seat at the kitchen counter and have a chat with the chefs to find out more about the food you’re eating at The Lokal! (Apr 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Even though most of its featured ingredients are humble, The Lokal manages to elevate its offerings with technique and care, all while maintaining a casual, laid-back vibe." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kaya Toast, Homemade Ricotta Cheese, Cauliflower 3 Ways, Lamb 3 Ways, Sticky Date Pudding, "Pimp Your Own Breakfast", Steak & Eggs

html:
• ABOUT

    Drawing from its underground supper club roots, Lolla fits right in on Ann Siang Hill with a petite but confident concept featuring uncompromising ingredients transformed into renowned small plates.If you think modern design, communal dining, artisan ingredients and small plates could be the description of any number of popular nouveau restaurants in Singapore, you'd be right. However, Lolla has proven itself to be the cream of the crop, as evidenced by the standard wait list for a reservation to sample their fare. Here's some insider intel: book for lunch, where you can request a seat at the coveted bar (which is saved for those few well-timed walk-ins come dusk) and avoid the feeding frenzy of dinner time service. Why is the zinc-plated bar the place to be? From here, you can watch the compact kitchen create the wondrous small plates that have earned Lolla international acclaim.Such plates include the Sea Urchin Pudding, a deceivingly miniature vessel of deadly-rich egg yolk custard, blackened by squid ink and topped with tangerine-coloured morsels of urchin plucked straight from the ocean. The dish is at once thick and light, the depths of umami refreshed by a spritz of the sea. The Beef Tongue and Cheek are similarly brilliant, tenderized to banish any minerally gristle and which presents a unique meaty flavour spiked by pickled sides. All dishes benefit from a glass of bubbly, which is intentionally the bar's specialty. It's a fitting choice since the extraordinary dining experience at Lolla isn't exactly a steal, making it ideal for special occasions.In the basement, a large, democratic table-for-all accommodates the majority of diners, a design choice that loosens up the mood. The concrete and bare bulb ascetic is softened by vintage touches like antique crystal vases posted alongside family-sized cans of artisan ingredients atop the bar. The menus are simply stated and printed with Victorian comics on paper placemats. The décor, along with the exceptional culinary musings served, ensure that Lolla really lives up to the hype. (Mar 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A raft of restaurants and clubs is riding the upswing, and one of the hardest tables to book is Lolla, a new kid on the block that made Zagat's 2013 "10 hottest restaurants in the world" list." -The New York Times"Referred to by The New York Times as Lolla's signature dish, the sea urchin pudding is satiny squid ink custard topped with raw sea urchin - a plate that will surely feature in the top ten when Expat Living produces its "50 Dishes in Singapore to Try Before you Die". It's absolutely astounding." -Expat Living"Inspired by a trend in New York, Lolla's defining experience is a 13-seater bar surrounding the open kitchen area where dishes are cooked and prepared before you. This upscale post-work watering hole features small plate options with an international influence (just don't call them 'tapas')." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cinco Jotas Jamon Iberico de Bellota, Hand Torn Pasta with Brown Crab, Tongue 'n Cheek, Tuna Belly "Chutoro" Carpaccio, Sea Urchin Pudding, Doughnuts with Lemon Curd, Chocolate and Pistachio Tart

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

  • ABOUT

    Known for their Signature Hong-Kong style roast duck, London Fat Duck’s menu doesn’t stop there. They also serve an array of Chinese dishes that are as tasty as they are impressive. Atop their roast selection are these delicious and tender Braised London Duck Wings, making them the perfect starter dish for any meal. For a chewier option that’s just as flavourful, go for their Braised London Duck Tongue. Perfectly complemented with a steaming bowl of rice or alone, this dish combines their signature spices that tenderize the meat. Veggie lovers are in for a treat here with delicious options that will have you going back for more. The Spinach with Fish Curd in Superior Stock is a favourite here. It's perfect for sharing. The fish curd melts in your mouth, while the spinach provides a nice crunch. For a less soupy option, go for their Triple Dou Miao with savoury pork bits and crunchy leaves. It’s a great dish to pair with their London Peking Duck. You should also check out their Poached Chicken with Garlic and Spring Onion Sauce. This dish is delicate and tender, with plump meat that mixes perfectly with the garlicky and savoury sauce. Best paired with a fragrant bowl of steamed rice, try their Poached Rice in Prawn Broth to go with for a change, and enjoy the natural sweetness of the prawns with the delicious taste of their Poached Chicken. London Fat Duck also serves a modest dim sum menu with unique offerings. Enjoy their Crispy London Duck Snow Buns, which are light and filled with sweet and savoury glazed meat. Other favourites to try are their Collagen Shrimp Dumpling “Har Kao” that has a succulent shrimp encased in their Collagen wrapper that creates a jewel-like effect, making this dish a feast for the eyes and taste buds. Another delicious dish to try is their Collagen Shrimp Dumpling "Har Kao", which has a succulent shrimp encased in their collagen wrapper, giving the dish a jewel-like effect. This dish is a feast for the eyes and taste buds. For desserts, finish off the heavy meal with a light and refreshing Chilled Aloe Vera Jelly with Chrysanthemum to end on a sweet note. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised London Duck Wings, Braised London Duck Tongue, Spinach with Fish Curd in Superior Stock, Poached Chicken with Garlic and Spring Onion Sauce, Chilled Aloe Vera Jelly with Chrysanthemum

Address: 6 Scotts Road #B1-16/17 Scotts Square Singapore (228209)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    The London Fat Duck has been serving Hong-Kong style roast duck that’s prepared using their chef’s special roasting technique and classic heritage recipe for years. It has become a household brand in Singapore that's loved and of course, a must try. Their must-try dish is of course the Signature London Roast Duck, made with a delicious blend of spices that coats the duck perfectly. Each slice of duck is tender, juicy and savoury, making this dish an amazing addition to your meal. For diners looking for a different kind of protein, London Fat Duck also offers their Barbeque Pork with Honey Sauce “Char Siew” and Hong Kong Crackling Pork Belly “Siew Bak”. Their Char Siew is melt-in-your-mouth tender and basted in a sweet honey sauce that makes the meat addictive and savoury sweet. Their Crackling Pork Belly is oh so satisfyingly juicy and the meat is tender yet firm. For the full experience, we recommend diners to try all three meats to fully appreciate and enjoy their expertise in the meat roasting department. Looking to impress your guests? Their London Peking Duck is a definite showstopper with glazed crispy skin and deliciously juicy meat. A perfect ‘DIY’ wrap, this dish is fun and loved by young and old for its presentation and taste, making this a must-have dish at the table. If you’re more for a noodle-based option, London Fat Duck also offers delicious noodles that are equally satiating. Go for their Ramen in Superior Stock with Prawn Pasta for an umami meal that’s heavy on the flavour profile yet comes in a light broth that will have you slurping every last drop up. For something more carb heavy, London Fat Duck’s XO Duck Bakkwa Fried Rice is a must-try. So unique and tasty, you won’t be able to stop at a bite with this dish. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature London Roast Duck, Barbeque Pork with Honey Sauce “Char Siew”, Hong Kong Crackling Pork Belly “Siew Bak”, London Peking Duck, XO Duck Bakkwa Fried Rice

• ABOUT

    Singapore’s leading seafood restaurant and creator of the original and best black pepper crab since 1982, Long Beach Seafood invites you to enjoy a vast array of exclusive live seafood delicacies. Coated with piquant black pepper sauce and stir-fried, the Original Black Pepper Crab is a signature seafood dish that is not to be missed out on. Another all time bestseller, the Scottish Razor Clam is steamed in a light and aromatic sauce with minced garlic and vermicelli, topped off with luscious royal razor clams and a crunchy smattering of fried garlic. Other mouthwatering seafood dishes include the Air Flown Live Alaskan King Crab, Southern Australian Lobster and Dungeness Crab. For a different dining experience, smaller groups can opt to try out the sampling menu. Specially curated to serve and satisfy diners in small portions, the food selection consists of a variety of local favourites. Sweet and spicy, the Grilled Chicken Satay skewer features a savoury peanut sauce glazed with pineapple puree and paired with cucumber and onion slices. Cooked in a delectable chilli gravy with generous bits of fresh crab meat, the famous Chilli Crab is best enjoyed with sake or beer. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Original Black Pepper Crab, Scottish Razor Clam, Southern Australian Lobster, Grilled Chicken Satay.

html:
• ABOUT

    A pioneer seafood restaurant in Singapore, Long Beach impresses as the creator of the original and best Black Pepper Crab of Singapore. Today, the restaurant’s menu has expanded to include exciting new seafood dishes cooked with the freshest Singapore produce. Prized for its remarkably sweet, sea fresh flavour and crunchy texture, the Live Geoduck Sashimi with Superior Stock Steamboat is a pot of perfectly sliced sashimi best enjoyed in superior stock hot pot. Another great dish to get the party started, the Steamed Live Scottish Razor Clam that comes served with minced garlic and vermicelli is ideal for sharing! The star of the show here at Long Beach is undoubtedly the different variations of crab on offer. Spice lovers should opt for the Famous Chilli Crab for a taste of the sweet and savoury. Served with your choice of fried or steamed buns, this fiery rendition of a local classic is a must-order. Other signature favourites include The Original Black Best Black Pepper Crab and Classic White Pepper Live Alaskan King Crab. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Live Geoduck Sashimi with Superior Stock Steamboat, Steamed Live Scottish Razor Clam, The Original Black Best Black Pepper Crab, Famous Chilli Crab

• ABOUT

    Hands down one of the coolest hotpot places we’ve seen, LongQing’s concrete walls feature street-style murals – done in monochromatic colours, naturally – that complement the edgy metal and wood furnishings. You can get pre-selected sets for two to go with unusual appetisers like Marinated Beef and Omasum Tripe or Chilled Seaweed with Homemade Sauce, but for finickier folk, a la carte gives you a range of options that can’t be beat. Choose Spicy Ma La, Tomato, or their Signature Clear Broth to begin and then plop in savoury bites such as Crispy Fish Head, Fresh Prawns, handmade pork and beef balls, and a generous handful of vegetables ranging from Garland Chrysanthemum to classics like Chinese Cabbage and Spinach. If you’re like us, however, the stars of the show will be the meat offerings. Lamb Shoulder, Prime Beef, Signature Chilli Beef Tenderloin, chicken; the array can almost seem endless. Steamboat never struck us as particularly trendy but LongQing’s proving to be hotpot for the hip! (Jul 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

• ABOUT

    Owned by the renowned JAG restaurants group and helmed by veteran restaurateur Anant Tyagi alongside Michelin-star chef Jeremy Gillon, diners can expect an experience unlike any other at this cosy watering hole. Tucked away on Duxton Road on the second floor of a restored shophouse, The Lounge Bar serves up delicious drinks inspired by central European tipples. Decorated with plush armchairs and wood accents, the bar gives off prohibition-era vibes, and is the perfect place for a post-work drink. The artisanal cocktails here are a must-try. The Angelique is notable for its light flavour accented by the addition of Chita Suntory Whisky. For something a little stronger, try the Aperol-infused Agastache flavoured with Peruvian Pisco. This is a strong drink with a robust flavour that will leave you sipping on the dregs. Feeling peckish? The kitchen serves up some traditional French bites that pair perfectly with the drinks. Try the delectable Croque Monsieur. Made with gooey melted cheese and rich ham sandwiched between two slices of soft bread, this is the perfect option for diners looking for something substantial. The Croque Salmon offers a similar option made with salmon instead of ham. The flavour of the fish pairs well with the other ingredients for a unique taste. (March 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Agastache, Angelique, Croque Monsieur, Croque Salmon

• ABOUT

    Born of a love for the vino, this wine bar was named famously “Best Wine Shop of the Year” by La Revue des Vins de France in 2013, and has grown from strength to strength since. This nook on Boon Tat Street aims to provide an engaging environment for wine enthusiasts to congregate and enjoy some of the best bottles the wineries around the world have to offer. There are over a thousand labels for the picking here, which means that no matter your taste, there is bound to be a wine that will catch your fancy. Can’t make up your mind? An expert French sommelier is on hand to provide tailored advice to suit every palate, event, and budget. The menu here consists of light nibbles that pair perfectly with wine, such as artisanal cheeses, Croque Monsieur, and Charcuterie. Large groups will find that the Sharing Platter - with cheese, cold cuts, gherkins, and olives - presents a diverse range of pairings for diners to enjoy. For something a little moreish, try the Squid Ink Risotto, a hearty dish flavoured with squid ink for a unique, briny flavour best enjoyed with a glass of red. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Croque Monsieur, Charcuterie, Squid Ink Risotto, Sharing Platter

With a selection of the finest tequilas and innovative cocktails, Lucha Loco provides an authentic and festive Mexican experience for all. A perfect setting for romantic dates, catch ups, parties, birthday celebrations and weddings. (Apr 2021)

• ABOUT

    Known for affordable food, great wine and delightful service, LUKA @ Cross Street Exchange is the perfect place to spend a relaxed evening with friends. Headed by chef Takashi Okuno, the Italian restaurant offers over 10 handmade pasta options to choose from, it’s impossible to pick the best! Opt for the Ikasumi for a unique combination of squid ink cream and tomato sauce. Sourced from Japan, the wagyu is reared by specialists using traditional Japanese methods, resulting in high quality premium beef roasted in the restaurant's wood fire oven. Similarly, the Neapolitan-style pizzas at LUKA @ Cross Street Exchange are made with specially selected quality ingredients and baked fresh in a handmade oven. Signature dishes include the Wagyu Corned Beef Hash Tacos and the Grilled Sardine Tacos. Check out the beverage menu and choose from a wide selection of wines, beers and pots of tea to complete your meal. (Feb 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    Classy interiors, a wallet-friendly menu, and a central location, are just some of the things that make this gorgeous restaurant one of the most popular watering holes around. Head here with friends after work for some tipples to welcome the weekend at the bar, or romance a date in the elegant ambience of the restaurant - whatever the occasion, this spot has got you covered. With esteemed chef Takashi Okuno helming the kitchen, diners can expect a riot of flavours from the dishes here. Fresh ingredients, innovative cooking techniques, and an unorthodox take on classic Italian cuisine make for a menu bursting with dishes you wouldn’t find at a typical Trattoria. When in doubt, you can’t go wrong with something that is housemade.Start with the Housemade Wagyu Bresaola- an air-dried cured beef bursting with flavour. The meat has more intense flavours due to the dry ageing process, and as a result, this dish is perfect paired with a glass of red wine from the bar. For something a little moreish, opt for the Gnocchi Formaggi - a four-cheese pasta dish topped with creamy sauce. End off a meal here with the Luka Tiramisu - a coffee flavoured dessert that will leave your taste buds tingling. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Bresaolav, Gnocchi Formaggi, Acqua Pazza, Risotto Di Mare, Margherita, Luka Tiramisu

    M&S Café (Wheelock Place) Singapore is the world’s first table service café by Marks & Spencer. The 60-seater M&S Café offers a full menu of items such as all-time favourite British Fish & Chips, Wood Fired Pizza and lighter meals such as sandwiches and salads. Recently, over 20 new dishes were introduced such as traditional Bircher Muesli, Fish Finger Sandwich, Sweet Potato Falafel, Chicken Korma Curry and more. (Jul 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    From the English-style lighting to the lush gold interior, everything about this restaurant radiates elegance. Opened by acclaimed restaurateur Alan Yau, Madame Fan represents a shift from the in-your-face luxury of traditional Chinese dining to a more subtle opulence. This is reflected in the menu, which focuses on premium ingredients cooked to bring out their best flavours. The Wok-Fried Crispy Duck is a must-try. Made with tender duck meat fried to perfection, this dish is crisp on the outside, tender on the inside, and goes perfectly with a bowl of steamed rice. Another signature plate at this restaurant would be The White Pepper Crab, a less searing version of one of Singapore’s most iconic fare. This seafood delight preserves the airy egg white sauce but uses white pepper for a more delicate flavour. Diners who love their carbs can indulge in the Claypot Japanese Rice With Japanese Sweet Potato. The claypot cooking enhances the taste of the dish and its accompanying items, giving the rice a heartier taste, while the Japanese sweet potato provides some delicate sweetness, balancing out the flavours. The Lobster Cantonese with Wanton Noodle is another great option as the lobster meat is lightly sweet and juicy, and pairs perfectly with the tender noodles. (June 2019)

  • NOTE TO DINERS

    The hotel is committed to providing our valued customers with a safe environment that aligns with new protocols for the current circumstances. Certified SG Clean by the Singapore government, the hotel’s measures and actions include temperature checks of all guests and associates, enhanced cleaning and disinfection, queue management and safe distancing of tables and seats.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wok-Fried Crispy Duck, White Pepper Crab, Lobster Cantonese with Wanton Noodle, Drunken Chicken Soup, Scallop Shumai, Jasmine Pork Ribs, Australian Rib-eye with Sarawak Black Pepper

  • DIM SUM, DRINK SUM

    Dim Sum, Drink Sum with an over the top cocktail dim sum brunch When: Saturday & Sunday Time: 11am-3:30pm (2-hour seating) Price: $136++ per person incl. free flow cocktails, wines, beers
