  • ABOUT

    Standing as a bastion of heartfelt Italian cuisine since 1995, Michelangelo's has recently launched a new a la carte menu that goes right back to their roots: traditional, home-cooked Italian cuisine at an exceptional price point. Service here is warm, friendly, and personal. Helmed by the affable Jacylyn, service is as much part of the nostalgic charm of the restaurant as the timeless dishes they have on offer. Their outdoor tables have a casual elegance that look (and feel) incredibly comfortable, and during the drier months of Singapore's skies, are an excellent place to have a long, wine-enriched dinner with friends. On the new menu, the Appetizers section is headlined with Michelangelo's famed Calamari Fritti. The light crunchy morsels come with two dipping sauces, and it's no wonder they come highly recommended by regulars and staff alike. The menu now offers two pasta sections: Pasta Classico which offers a range of Singapore’s favourite pasta selections, and Pasta Speciali where all your Michelangelo's signatures return to delight you once more. There are, of course, non-pasta options like the Seafood Cartoccio, which is a sublime medley of seafood cooked in a white wine and tomato broth wrapped in a paper package. It's a varied and delicious sounding menu, and since we’re sure that Michelangelo's will still be winning fans for many years to come, you’ve got all the time you need to try every single option that tickles your fancy. (Sep 2012)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Taking over the space that was formerly occupied by Michelangelo's is this new Italian concept with more homey dishes on the menu. The vibe and decor is kept pretty similar with a dark color scheme and plush booth seats accented with red. On the menu are dishes like caprese salads ($19) and their forte of risotto dishes like truffle and mushroom ($36), as well as seafood squid ink ($34)." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tandoori Linguine, Truffle & Mushroom Risotto, Gluten Free Pizza, Misto Di Mare Cacciatore, Tortelli Crab And Lobster, Fettucine Boscaiola

html:
• ABOUT

    Long a favourite among CBD folk looking for a good lunch, Mag’s Wine Kitchen offers contemporary French bistro fare with sophisticated service and ambiance that manages to be homey, and not in the least bit stuffy. A massive wine room calls invitingly as you sit down to order, so you may as well crack open a bottle and make an event of the visit. The superb plates certainly demand some vino as accompaniment: think starters of bouncy Hokkaido Scallops, or Australian beef carpaccio done up with lashings of black truffle and sesame dressing. For an extra classic touch, spread some croutes with a smearing of Foie Gras Terrine, perfect with a semi-dry white wine as you wait for your mains. The more classic fare on the plats principaux, from Argentinian Beef Tenderloin given the simple salt and jus treatment, to an elegant risotto of asparagus and seared Boston lobster, sweet, buttery, and indulgent. Dessert is a refined affair of peaches poached in fragrant amaretto, followed by a platter of French cheeses to elongate the meal alongside the good conversation and more wine. The French do it right, and this is an invitation to indulge and turn a simple meal into a luxurious event. (Mar 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Clearly Mag is doing something right as this restaurant is still good, even after more than a decade on the scene.” -SG Magazine “A telling mark of success in the cut-throat arena that is the F&B industry: a restaurant that lasts more than a decade.” -The Peak

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Foie Gras Terrine, Hokkaido Scallops, Argentinian Beef Tenderloin, Brine and Seared Pork Ribeye, Asparagus Risotto with Seared Boston Lobster

  • TRIPADVISOR TRAVELLERS' CHOICE AWARD WINNER 2021

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled along the quaint streets of Telok Ayer, the unassuming Magal Korean BBQ has built up quite a reputation for its authentic Korean fare and irresistible marinated meats perfect for the barbecue. But this should not come at a surprise - this cosy establishment is but one of more than 400 outlets worldwide. Tuck into some traditional Korean favourites such as the Bibimbap, Wang Galbitang, a delicious back rib beef stew, or the signature Galmaegi, where tender pork, surrounded by an egg crust, is cooked on a special grill. Here with company? The Teugsu Budae Jjigae, a hearty kimchi stew topped with generous portions of sausage, ramen, beef bulgogi, tofu, and many other toppings, is a satisfying crowd pleaser that’s perfect for sharing, especially on a rainy day. But of course, the spotlight’s on the barbecue and nothing beats the Signature Combo featuring boneless short ribs, marinated short ribs, pork belly, sliced brisket coated with mouthwatering spices and sauces that will have you coming back for more. Don’t forget to order some sides to complement your meal; our favourites include the Chicken Feet Roast and the Grilled Prawns with Salt. Work around the area? Magal also has some irresistible lunch specials and cold noodles sure sounds like an excellent idea when it’s 30 degrees outside! (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Galmaegi, Kkotsal Jumulleok, Beef Platter, Mapo Galmaegi, Mapo Kaisamgyupsal

• ABOUT

    Book your seats at Magosaburo if you like your beef of an excellent grade. For starters, this elegant Japanese restaurant brings in some of the best Ohmi and Kobe beef, featuring exclusive cuts like the zabuton, a prime yakiniku cut taken from just behind the neck. Tender and flavourful, it’s a must-have at authentic yakiniku restaurants. For melt-in-your-mouth beef, the Ohmi Wagyu Ribeye is streaked with a mesmerising web of snow, served tableside, cubed and grilled. Got a beef with wagyu? The menu here also includes other meats like Hungarian pork belly slices. Marinated in Korean sauces, the grilled meat is wrapped in a leafy lettuce, and savoured with a dash of spicy paste. Don’t worry about the smell of smoke getting in your hair; the exhaust system in Magosaburo is one of the most efficient ones we’ve experienced so far. You’ll leave smelling just as good as when you entered. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Ribeye, Kobe Chateaubriand, Exclusive Karubi, Zabuton, Superior Cut Tongue

html:
• ABOUT

    From all the flavours of savoury crab you love, to some you've probably never tried before, the creative kitchen at Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant is bound to please with the culinary flair that's come to be synonymous with the Majestic name. Both the Chilli Crab and Black Pepper Crab deservedly get their fair share of fandom from both locals and tourists alike. But while Majestic Bay Seafood does a wonderful rendition of both, what you should really be there for is Chef Yong Bing Ngen's award-winning, signature creation: the Kopi Crab. This dish is a reflection of Chef Yong's culinary philosophy that Chinese cooking is a great canvas for bold, artistic flourishes. Tossed with a sauce made from fruit jams and juices, and three varieties of coffee beans, the crab's flavours blend harmoniously, leaving you savouring every last morsel! Flambéed tableside, it's one of those dishes that you never knew was missing from your foodie bucket list until you've tried it. If you're fishing around Gardens by the Bay for a light bite, Majestic Bay Seafood also fits the bill. Its tantalising dim sum, only available for lunch, is worth a visit on its own. Pick from local favourites like Steamed Custard Buns with Salted Egg Yolk, oozing with creamy goodness, or signatures like their Seared Chilli Crab Meat Buns. Dining at Majestic Bay Seafood is as much a feast for the eyes as it is for our bellies. Indeed, if it weren't for the restaurant's impressive waterfront view of Marina Bay, and magnificent display of 3D textured artworks by Singapore-based artist Hong Zhu An, we'd be sorely tempted to pack a basket of that dim sum for a picnic among the lush greenery! (Aug 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "If you're in the mood for delicious Chinese-style seafood, this is a tasteful, versatile location that works for family get-togethers, visiting out-of-towners and even business associates (there's a private room for up to 14)." -SG Now "For dim sum with a view, head to Majestic Bay Restaurant at Gardens by the Bay and eat your meal while gazing at the waterfront. This massive seafood restaurant serves a wide range of dim sum (only for lunch we're afraid) and is a lovely spot for letting the kids run around in the gardens afterwards." -Sassy Mama Singapore "With a menu so genuinely full of surprises, I suggest you pop in for the authentic tastes before copycats emerge." -Expat Living

• PRESS RELEASE

    Formerly housed within the New Majestic Hotel, the award-winning Majestic Restaurant has found a new home at Marina One located within the prestigious Marina Bay financial district. True to Chef Yong's style of contemporary Cantonese food rooted in traditional Chinese culinary techniques, the refreshed menu features new dishes such as the succulent Roasted Ireland Silver Duck in Peking Style served with handmade rose pancakes, scallion and cucumber, the wonderfully aromatic Black Truffle with Crabmeat and Egg White Fried Rice, and the tantalizing Smoked Kampong Chicken with Salt and Hickory served in a glass dome. Chef Yong has also introduced a full selection of dim sum for lunch, with new creations such as the Chee Cheong Fun made with organic brown rice and served with Hakka-styled lei cha (thunder tea) sauce, pan-fried Radish Rolls with Chicken, Button Mushrooms and Cheese, and Xiao Long Bao Bak Kut Teh-style. Popular Majestic Restaurant signature dishes such as the Majestic Trio Combination of Crispy Wasabi Prawn, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Peking Duck and Organic Greens, and Stewed "Mee Sua" Baby Abalone, Vegetable and Crab Roe Gravy remain on the menu. Set Menus, starting from $48++ per person for lunch and $68++ per person for dinner, are also available. (Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "When a restaurant is helmed by someone with as long-standing a reputation as Majestic Restaurant's chef-cum-owner Yong Bing Ngen, you can almost bet that the eatery will always be buzzing with activity. And it is, thanks to the crowds who can't get enough of Yong's 'well-executed' Chinese fare with a modern twist." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Xiao Long Bao in Bak Kut Teh-style, Majestic Trio Combination, Roasted Ireland Silver Hill Duck in Peking Style, Stewed "Mee Sua" Baby Abalone, Smoked Kampung Kitchen

  • ABOUT

    Celebrate life’s simple pleasures with beautifully prepared food and fine whiskey at malts. A premium whiskey bar nestled in cosy spots within the central business district, malts is the perfect place to let loose and enjoy life to the fullest with family and friends. Open on Mondays to Saturdays, head on down to malts to explore the aisles of carefully curated alcoholic beverages from all over the region. Great for any occasion, the 12 year old Bunnahabhian is tinged with a light sherry sweetness overpowered by a smoky and smooth aftertaste. Best paired with Spanish tapas, opt for the bar’s take on tasty Spanish dishes to complete the experience. Apart from whiskeys and Spanish delights, malts also provides draft beers for beer lovers. Swing by for after work drinks with colleagues or intimate gatherings with friends, and celebrate the end of a hectic day with a round of drinks! malts’ cosy interior also makes for an ideal date spot should you find a kindred spirit. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    12 year old Bunnahabhian, Three Course Lunch Set

  • ABOUT

    A speakeasy cocktail bar that infuses the elements of iconic Singaporean local delights with modern new flavours, Mama Diam boasts an old school-inspired outdoor area that features HDB stools, vintage knick knacks and traditional snacks set to bring diners on a nostalgic journey. Enjoy a mix of Singapore-inspired menu bites that are freshly prepared daily with the restaurant’s 9 Bites of Wonders. A signature menu item that consists of an exclusive set of small savoury bites for sharing, spread the joy with this sharing platter among family and friends. Other equally tantalising menu options worth ordering are the Truffle Mushroom Wonton in Chilli, Curry Beef Pithivier and Crab Kueh Pie Tee. Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying their cravings with the Pork Belly Char Siew. A delicious spin on a local favourite, this dish is made up of tender roasted pork belly with a generous side of cabbage rice and archar drenched in honey mustard sauce. Toasted with sesame chimichurri, the Beef Striploin comes in a hearty portion and is plated with butter sauteed vegetables for a filling meal. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    9 Bites of Wonders, Truffle Mushroom Wonton in Chilli, Curry Beef Pithivier, Pork Belly Char Siew

  • ABOUT

    Lauded by Singapore Tatler as one of Singapore's best Chinese restaurants and recipient of the Michelin Plate, Man Fu Yuan is a stalwart in the Chinese fine dining scene in Singapore, serving culinary presentations that showcase an artful balance of spices and flavours, uplifted by modern interpretations and quality ingredients. Look forward to a refined dining experience underpinned by traditional culinary techniques and elevate your experience with a handpicked selection of quality wines or premium tea pairings. Set within an elegant venue which accommodates up to 172 guests, including a suite of private dining rooms, Man Fu Yuan is well-suited for all occasions, from private business lunches to joyous celebratory events. For reservation of private dining rooms, get in touch with us at +65 6825 1008. (Dec 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The Man Fu Yuan weekend dim sum buffet gets rave reviews with their unlimited selection of over 40 dishes. Service here tends to be spot on from topping up your Chinese tea to making dim sum recommendations to suit your taste.” - SassyMama. “I like the poached marble goby fish with mala green peppercorns and chilli in salted vegetable broth (market price), a Sichuan dish that is very appetising with spicy and sour flavours. The braised beef short ribs with wild mushrooms in lotus leaf ($68) is not only delicious, but also presented in a rather showy fashion. Tender pieces of beef are wrapped in a lotus leaf with assorted mushrooms and covered in salt before being baked. The salt crust is topped with peppercorn and set afire at the table-side to release an enticing spicy aroma, then cracked open and the leaf unwrapped to reveal the goodies inside.” – Wong Ah Yoke, Straits Times.

    Savour the ultimate South Indian experience of days gone by at MANAM with the restaurant’s menu that is inspired by the country’s nostalgic past. Plated with passion and dedication, each dish at MANAM is made to order and customisable to suit your palate. Made of only the freshest cuts of sustainably sourced fresh meat and zero artificial colouring, experience sheer joy with every bite into the aromatic plates of authentic South Indian cuisine that envelops the mind and soul here at MANAM. Whet your appetite with a hearty bowl of Kozhi Milagu Saaru. Lightly seasoned with black pepper and spices, this bowl of spicy chicken soup tastes best when consumed hot. For sharing platters, the Teriyaki Chicken Wings is a classic serving of crispy chicken wings coated in a homemade teriyaki sauce and cooked to perfection. Other equally tantalising meat options include the Chicken Tikka and Tandoori Chicken Half. Drop by with family and friends to indulge in platters of great Indian food that evoke wonder, joy, nostalgia and bliss with every bite. (Jul 2021)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Inspired by the Golden Age of cocktails and fine drinking, Manhattan is reminiscent of a grand hotel bar, modern yet with a touch of old New York glamour and sophistication. Choose your tipple from artisanal spirits, and classic and forgotten cocktails, meticulously crafted from the world’s first in-hotel rickhouse and a remarkable collection of house-made ingredients, accompanied by gourmet bar bites. Manhattan was recently placed 15th in World’s 50 Best Bars and 6th in Asia’s 50 Best Bars. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Every little detail has been meticulously examined, from the incorporation of rare ingredients, sourcing artisanal spirits, ensuring only the highest quality water is used for their ice, customization of their cocktail glasses, and careful crafting of their New York-inspired menu." -Honeycombers "Inspired by 19th century New York, this Regent Hotel bar serves up delicious bespoke cocktails and gourmet bar bites in a romantic and vintage-inspired ambiance." -Sassy Mama Singapore

  • ASIA'S 50 BEST BARS 2019

    Manhattan has been named #2 in Asia's 50 Best Bars 2019, voted by the most knowledgeable and travelled members of the bar industry, drinks media and mixology experts from across the world.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rebellion Burger, Central Park Crudités, Crispy Golden Cauliflower, Big Apple Cheesecake

  • MENUS & OFFERINGS

    NEW MENU! NEW YORK PERSONIFIED Bringing the same creativity and thoughtful research to its third menu concept, Manhattan takes inspiration from six big-league personalities; iconic Manhattanites that have made their mark in the circuits of music, film, fashion, culinary and politics. With stories richly intertwined in drinks crafted from astute bartending and artisanal spirits, these 18 new cocktails and six zero proof beverages truly leap from the pages of history.Explore the New MenuCocktails at ManhattanWhen: Wed-Sat Time: 5pm-12amViolet HourAs the sun sets casting a beautiful glow across the late afternoon sky, Manhattan will serve a complimentary warm cheese sandwich with every drink ordered.When: Wed-Fri Time: 5-7pmMenu: Food, Spirits and Wine MenuAmerican Whiskey Embassy Putting a spotlight on the great whiskies from the United States of America, the bar team has scoured across the world to present a specially curated list of the American spirit, for the imbibing pleasure of serious whiskey drinkers and curious explorers. The collection now features just over 200 bottles of whiskies, including a range of rare and collectible ones. All of which is housed in a Whiskey Glasshouse, an elegant space within the Ingredients Room that displays bottles of the exquisite golden-caramel liquid; an arresting showstopper wall of only the finest, that are as visually enticing as they taste. Terms & Conditions:• Prices are in SGD, subject to 10% service charge and applicable government tax and are accurate as of 1 October 2018.• Please note that buffet prices are subject to change at the restaurant's discretion

  • PRIVATE EVENTS & GROUP FUNCTIONS

    The Rockefeller Room (seats up to 10 persons - minimum spending of $1,500++)Hidden behind a “secret” door and lined with ornate marquetry wallpaper tinted in silver blue tones, this uber-luxe space is reminiscent of private New York clubs in the 1920s. Settle into the plush tufted faux steel-blue suede banquette and enjoy this uniquely private experience. A dedicated service station ensures champagne glasses are never empty while our backlit Aged Negroni bottles guarantee you will never be short for inspiration. The Rockefeller Room + Library (temporarily unavailable for private bookings)An intimate room for guests looking to escape the energy of the Main Salon, the Library is available in conjunction with the Rockefeller Room for parties exceeding 16 guests. Simply open the “secret” door. Timber paneling and lush green Italian velvet accents evoke quiet sophistication and a relaxed elegance that befits its name. The Private Salon (seats up to 10 persons - minimum spending of $1,500++)Tucked away from the Main Salon, this welcoming space oozes comfort with opulent Italian plum velvets and tan American leather seats amidst custom hand-tufted wool rugs. Be transported to 19th century New York while you sip on Singapore’s finest Bourbon. Perfect for intimate gatherings.Prices are in SGD, subject to 10% service charge and applicable government taxes.

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • NEW ORLEANS SUNDAY COCKTAIL BRUNCH

    Welcome to Singapore’s first adults-only cocktail brunch. Join us as we take you on a gastronomical trip to the “Big Easy” New Orleans, home to some of America’s greatest food traditions and cocktail culture. Enjoy our take on this mid-afternoon affair with traditional favourites and roving drink trolleys. $188++ per person with free flow cocktails or $228++ with free flow Champagne.Click here to view the menu

html:
• ABOUT

    This cosy spot has found a new home in Clarke Quay Central. Opened in Kampong Bahru by Hokkaido-born Urayama Satoru, this restaurant serves up a range of fresh fish grilled to perfection, as well as a variety of seafood dishes. Due to their late opening hours, this restaurant is a favourite of late-night stragglers and Japanese chefs alike. The Mixed Sashimi Rice Bowl is a must-try here. Featuring a decadent slices of fresh tuna and salmon layered over a bed of rice and topped with greens, this dish is the perfect pick-me-up for a midday meal. The buttery velvet fresh fish slices contrast well with the crunch of the vegetables, and the soft rice soaks up the umami flavour of the fish. Diners chasing a spicy kick can opt for the Spicy Garlic Ramen - a dish consisting of springy noodles and egg bathed in a red hot broth - with three levels of spice to choose from, you can customise your dish to suit your specific needs. The Stir Fry with Squid Ink is the perfect dish for seafood lovers. Made with saline squid ink, this dish is made with firm squid tentacles and flavoured with chilli. The dish is topped with crunchy greens that add to the bite of the meat. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Garlic Ramen, Mixed Sashimi Rice Bowl, Stir Fry with Squid Ink, Japanese Omelette, Clam Soup

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Marcy's is a restaurant set amidst the backdrop of Duxton, a seafood bistro at heart that takes familiar ideas and presents them in new, satisfying ways. Inspired by the rarified worlds of Latin America and Coastal Italy, while showcasing the best local and regional produce, our attention to detail in all things from the sea flows through our food that is decidedly unbound by a single cuisine. Our intimate bar is open late and you can come in for just a glass of wine or a classic nightcap and a small bite should you feel like it. The adventurous will feel at home with a selection of craft spirits, cocktails, and atypical small plates. Marcy’s strives to chart the tide for restaurant culture in Singapore, with inventive yet hearty food, disarmingly relaxed service and an eclectic and atmospheric setting that all set the stage for an experience like no other. Here at Marcy’s, we are anchored in being all real, all the time, attracting those who don't chase luxury, but who live it by elevating moments, indulging their senses and celebrating the everyday. (Oct 2021)

  • MENU

    Click here to view the Dinner Menu.

html:
• ABOUT

    In this fickle city, it’s no easy feat managing a successful long-running restaurant, let alone an eating spot that still dazzles diners with its consistently solid fare. Margarita’s Dempsey Hill is one such culinary gem, sporting a rich history that dates all the way back to 1988, with a longevity can be credited to its authentic and succulent Mexican bites that don’t cost a pretty penny. Explore a trove of Mexican grub with bright and fiery appetisers such as the Cheese Fondue that gets its kick from a dash of chiles and chorizos. Meanwhile, the Nachos La Especial is another evergreen favourite, made with a seasoned blend of black beans, chipotle cheese sauce, jalapenos, guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. And we can’t talk about the mains without salivating. There’s the drool-worthy Carnitas de Puerco, which features a fork-tender piece of pork slowly roasted in the oven and served with a zesty dollop of salsa verde on warm corn tortillas. And be sure to save room for the tantalising desserts which include the popular Mexican Fried Ice Cream or warm Churros. Good Mexican cuisine made from fresh ingredients. That’s the concept behind Margarita's Dempsey Hill and we can’t ask for anything more. (Apr 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Taco Salad, Swiss Flat Enchiladas, Poblano Rellenos, Chorizo Sonorense Al Ajillo, Fajitas, Chimichanga, Tacos Al Pastor, Three Milk Cake, Churros

  • ABOUT

    The Market Grill and Wine 90 harkens back to the days of traditional diners where it is all about a fun-filled dining experience. Located in the historically rich district of Telok Ayer, the decor is inspired by traditional old-style butcheries and diners with the perfect complementary menu of hearty and robust dishes. Step through the glass doors for a haven of gourmet burgers, decadent lobster rolls and quality steak cuts. One of the first concepts to introduce lobster rolls to Singapore in 2013, expect market fresh produce chargrilled to perfection in the specially imported "Woodstone" Charbroiler. Savour the taste of the ocean in the heart of Singapore. (Mar 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The burgers here are mighty good, so much so that they even made the cut in our feature of Singapore's best burgers." -City Nomads

• ABOUT

    Everything about the Marmalade Pantry, from the rich sticky goodness of the name to its reputation as one of the city's favourite bistros, speaks of delicious, indulgent afternoons spent gossiping over impeccable treats and beverages. But beyond afternoon tea, this Downtown location is also perfect for a solid meal, serving up beautiful plates of modern comfort food with a distinct modern-European meets Asian sensibility in swish, modern digs. For a start, nothing says indulgence quite like a luxury burger, and both the Truffle Beef Burger and Spicy Sriracha Burger has that in spades. Filled with juicy goodness and using 200g (USDA) meat, the Truffle Beef Burger is both tender and flavourful while the Spicy Sriracha Burger is filled with spiced chicken patty, sriracha mayo, blue cheese and parmesan fries. For a lighter meal, the Caesar and Kale Salad and the Grilled Pear and Arugula Salad are the go-to dishes for something refreshing and healthy. (Oct 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "High points go to the absolutely charming ambience and the inventive tweaks and additions to the menu." -Her World Singapore "A great place to simply chill out over desserts with friendly service." -SG Now

html:
• ABOUT

    Get cosy with a delicious afternoon tea at The Marmalade Pantry Petite (BHG Bugis)! Located along Victoria Street, this casual dining spin off and retail concept offers delectable brunch fare, exquisite desserts, and quick bites for those on the go. As Marmalade Pantry’s ‘baby’, it adopts a black and white collar palette infused with modern contemporary elements. Diners can expect an Instagram-worthy experience perfect for a date. Treat yourself to a delicious Truffle Egg Mayo Croissant or share a Quinoa Chicken Salad with friends. Looking for something more substantial? We recommend their Zucchini and Cheddar Waffle, a savoury and cheesy delight that is not too greasy or heavy. Dress fancy and live your best life with their fragrant Buttermilk Scones, and envision a luxurious and carefree tea party worthy of royalty. For something slightly more substantial, their Petite Tea Party Set gives you a taster of their best offerings. To finish off on a sweet note, we recommend their Sea Salt Caramel Cheesecake. A smooth and creamy slice of happiness with a slight crunch of sea salt to cut the sweetness, it’ll be sure to elevate your experience. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Egg Mayo Croissant, Chilli Lime Prawn with Fusili, Petite Afternoon Tea Set, Lemon Meringue Sponge Cake, Zucchini and Cheddar Waffle

• ABOUT

    An authentic Japanese restaurant serving healthy dishes in the heart of Singapore with its origin in Japan since 1962 as the whole seller of Japanese broth ingredients. Dashi Master Marusaya takes great pride is offering a large selection of healthy, Dashi-based dishes. For the non-epicureans among us, natural Dashi (as opposed to chemically-composed additives) is a key seasoning developed from Katsuboshi (dried bonito) and ingredient in Japanese cooking. As a result, the stars of the menu are those dishes which make full use of the umami taste of the natural Dashi. For example, the Dashi Katsu Toji (Pork Cutlet with Dashi Sauce) are deep-fried pork cutlets from Hokkaido which go perfectly with the thick, flavourful egg Dashi gravy, whilst the Japanese Wagyu Beef Dashi Shabu features melt-in-your-mouth slices of beef cooked in a delicately-flavoured Dashi pot. (Dec 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Owner Eiji Futagami, a katsuobushi (dried bonito flakes) supplier, was inspired to open this restaurant to showcase the versatility of dashi – a Japanese stock enriched with dried fish and seaweed.” –Time Out Singapore “The MSG-free soup stock features in a range of dishes: udon (from $13), oden ($15), ohitashi ($9)—cold vegetable appetizer—and, most notable, their shabu shabu (from $40). At lunch, there are also value for money sets such as salmon ikura chirashi ($22).” –SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Japanese Wagyu Beef Dashi Shabu, Dashi Katsu Toji, Shimahokke, Tori Karaage Amazu Ankake, Dashimaki Tamago, Oden

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 and 2019 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Belly-dancing, friendly Clarke Quay vibes, hearty no-fuss food, and frosty pints, The Mask hides very little about its intentions: here, they want you to have a fun time chilling with friends and family. Inside its dim, sexy interiors, tuck into British style pub-grub like a hearty braised Lamb Shank served on a pillowy mound of mash, a classic Bangers & Mash doused in homemade black pepper sauce, or a flaky Fish & Chips served with tangy tartar sauce and fat-cut chips. Beyond pub grub, there’s also slightly fancier fare like a crisp Duck Confit on pomme puree and garden salad, or a simple Grilled Salmon Fillet on a bed of sauteed greens, as well as pastas like a rich Pesto Pasta and a homey Parmesan-rich Beef Bolognese. They’re open for lunch, too, perfect for a quick bite in the CBD, though it’s at night that the place comes alive. With its nightly beer and wine promotions, constant party vibe, and chill river-side breeziness, you’ll want to stay here all night after that hearty dinner! (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bangers & Mash, Fish & Chips, Duck Confit, Lamb Shank, Grilled Salmon Fillet, Beef Bolognese, Pesto Pasta

name: Mask, The

html:
• ABOUT

    Well known for their range of freshly made thin crust pizzas and pasta dishes, discover a delectable mix of Asian and Western favourites at Masons restaurant and bar. A versatile space set in the tranquil colonial setting of Gillman Barracks, the restaurant is the perfect place to indulge in a round of drinks alongside good food with great friends. For starters, the Crispy Duck Pancakes is a hot favourite at Masons. Wrapped in wafer thin oriental style pancakes, bite into slow cooked crispy duck garnished with spring onion, cucumber strips and hoisin sauce when you order this dish. Meat lovers can also order the Thai Style Stuffed Wings to satisfy their carnivorous cravings. A plateful of succulent chicken wings stuffed with spicy pork and prawns, dip into the accompanying Thai chilli sauce for an extra spicy and sweet kick. Another tantalising dish fully loaded with ham, beef and pepperoni is the Carnivora pizza. Fresh from the oven, this pizza is topped with a variety of meat, making it the ideal dish for sharing! There’s something for the seafood lovers too in Masons’s expansive menu. Decorated with a selection of seafood fresh off the boat, the Seafood Pasta is a bowl of tangy linguine pasta in a yummy tomato sauce garnished with basil and cherry tomatoes. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Duck Pancakes, Thai Style Stuffed Wings, Carnivora, Seafood Pasta

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/masons
name: MASONS

html:
• ABOUT

    Aptly situated in the Freemasons Hall of Singapore built in 1879, The Masons Table is a casual dining concept that’s great for fuss-free and delicious dining. Incorporating classic and modern European flavours, The Masons Table brings your favourite french and italian to impress. Starters to try at The Masons Table are their Vongole-Style Clams: Freshly stewed with a dash of cream and served with toasted bread, and their Crispy Whitebait. The battered Whitebait is fried to an airy crisp and served with a tangy tartar sauce, making this the perfect appetiser to share. Relax in and soothe the soul as you soak in the timelessly elegant interior and enjoy a hearty Rustic Coq au Vin. A signature at The Masons Table, this dish will transport you to the peaceful French countryside. Rich, savoury and comforting, this chicken dish is great for romantic dinners paired with a house wine of choice. If you’re looking for a sharing dish instead, go for their handmade thin crust pizzas. Popular choices at The Masons Table include their Crudo Pizza and Chilli Crab Pizza. With parmesan, prosciutto, and rocket, this pizza is a classic favourite that brings familiar flavours to the next level. Their Chilli Crab Pizza is a local spin on everyone’s favourite sauce, combining Italian and local cuisine perfectly in this fusion dish. Thick, spicy sauce is combined with spring onions and red chilli on crispy bread to create an almost dip that’s highly addictive and a must-try. For desserts, finish off with a classic Bread and Butter Pudding for a perfect sweet carby end to your meal. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Vongole-Style Clams, Crispy Whitebait, Rustic Coq au Vin, Crudo Pizza, Bread and Butter Pudding

• ABOUT

    An exciting concept tucked away in Paragon, Matsukiya dishes out traditional kushiyaki that is grilled over bincho-tan. An exclusive Japanese charcoal grill restaurant that promises a personalized and private dining experience, get ready to indulge in the luxurious selection of fresh Japanese ingredients, complete with a curated selection of spirits. Start with small bites such as the traditional Chawanmushi. A unique take on the all-time favorite, the steamed egg is infused with bits of truffle. Another great starter is the Satsuma Imo. A filling dish, the Japanese sweet potato is extremely tasty. Move on to the Donburi bowls. A staple dish in any Japanese restaurant menu, the rice bowls at Matsukiya are made with high-quality ingredients. Try the Foie Gras Tontoro Don, which features duck liver and pork cheek on rice. For truffle lovers, the Truffle Tori Omu Rice is a must-try! Wrapped in a rolled omelet, pieces of chicken are strewn atop the omelet, accompanied by truffle shavings. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chawanmushi, Foie Gras Tontoro Don, Truffle Tori Omu Rice

  • ABOUT

    Nestled within Orchid Hotel, Matsumoto is a friendly Japanese restaurant serving up a wide variety of traditional Japanese delights. Fresh from the ocean, Matsumoto delights diners with assorted platters of exotic seafood and mouthwatering hot pot options. Choose from either the Oyster Kanban Yaki or Grilled Oyster to satisfy your seafood cravings. Indulge in the best of both worlds with the mix Seafood and Oyster hotpot for a sweet taste of miso or soy sauce. Fried delights are also available with the different kinds of tempura on offer. For sharing, go for the classic fried potato. Meat lovers will definitely appreciate the Minced Beef Cutlet. Taking the shape of a patty, the minced beef is lightly fried with batter. Sink your teeth into one for a wonderful burst of flavour. For those with a lighter palate, order the warm Seafood Porridge for a taste of rich and nourishing miso soup. Rice bowls are also available at Matsumoto for a filling one-dish meal. End your meal with a refreshing fruit platter of exotic fruits. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oyster Kanban Yaki, Minced Beef Cutlet, Grilled Oyster, Seafood Porridge

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/matsumoto
name: Matsumoto

html:
• ABOUT

    Omakase has been a food trend locally for a while now, and while it takes some courage to leave your meal solely in the hands of the chef, at Matsuya, you can rest assured that you’re in good hands. This intimate restaurant is helmed by Chef Benson, a homegrown chef who works his magic at a station in front of diners. The menu here focuses on fresh seafood, and plays up the best of Japanese cuisine. The Chirashi Don comes with a warm, authentic Miso Soup and a generous serving of fish of your choice. The Otoro Don here is tender, and pairs perfectly with the sushi rice. With tuna bought and chilled individually, diners can rest assured that they are getting the best that the ocean has to offer when they dine here. The Katsu Don is a staple of every Japanese menu. Heaps of crispy pork cutlet and egg, served on a bed of sushi rice is as attractive as it is appetizing. The Gyu Don is equally generous with the tender beef, and pairs perfectly with crispness of the accompanying vegetables. Whether you choose to head over for a delectable lunch or an authentic Japanese dinner experience, this spot is sure to deliver.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Otoro Don, Sushi Platter, Salmon Aburi Maki, Bara Chirashi Don, Unagi Don, Negitoro Don

html:
• ABOUT

    The Jalan Sultan stretch may be known for its sprawling heritage district, quirky cafes, and Malay hawkers, but this little gem is set to establish itself as a prominent eatery in Singapore. Tucked away in the back alleys bordering Little India and Kampong Glam is Maya’s Kitchen, this spot serves up Indian comfort food made with fresh handpicked ingredients. The menu here includes a range of North and South Indian classics. Even the pickiest of diners are sure to love the range of vegetarian and non-vegetarian starters available here. Tuck into one of their Samosa - a delicious fried treat of fried potato wrapped in crispy dough. For something a little richer, the Lamb Pepper Fry is an excellent option. Chunks of buttery lamb is seasoned with spicy pepper and cooked to perfection, this dish is an excellent way to whet the appetite for the dishes to come. The Mutton Biryani is an excellent dish of pilaf rice cooked with flavourful mutton. The combination of fragrant rice and spicy meat is a good option for diners looking for a filling meal. For something a little less rich, opt for the Garlic Naan, a herby flatbread that is perfect on its own, or dipped in a curry. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mutton Biryani, Garlic Naan, Lamb Pepper Fry, Samosa, Tandoori Chicken, Butter Chicken, Chicken 65, Paneer Chilli, Mutton Jogan Rosh

html:
• ABOUT

    Pleasure meating you. This is the Meating Place promise. Located in DUO Galleria, the made-in-Singapore restaurant is unfettered by cuisine type or rules. Owning and running it are brothers Jerome and Johann Lim, who set it up in 2018, bound by their passion for gastronomy. From the kitchen come dishes that are the amalgamation of Jerome’s decade-long journey in the F&B industry and life-long love affair with food. These are made with modern European techniques fused with methods inherited from his East Asian heritage, applied onto meat, seafood and greens. Well-travelled epicureans will appreciate how every plate creatively balances culinary science and art to excite the palate and seduce the senses. Experience this in a place that is cosy and welcoming – like reuniting with a bosom buddy. Authenticity, enjoyment and intimacy reign here; Johann makes sure of this. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Cauliflower, Kale & Pine Nut Salad, Dry-Aged Wagyu Burger and Boneless Wagyu Shortrib

    MeatSmith Little India is Singapore’s first restaurant serving Modern Indian Barbecue. With its colorful façade and street artwork, this outlet fits perfectly at its home, at Campbell Lane in the heart of Little India. Expect a masterful menu combining the technique of slow cooking and barbecue, with Indian spice, rubs, and sauces. By adding a tandoor oven and spit roaster alongside the southern pride smoker, guests can expect dishes like a Ikura Papadum, Coconut Pork Ribs and suckling pig biryani. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bhaji Onion Rings, Madras Pork Cheeks, Butter Chicken Hot Pocket, Biryani Stuffed Suckling Pig, Okra Fries, Gunpowder Potatoes, Indian Lemonade

  • ABOUT

    Churning out American Southern style BBQ, MeatSmith (Telok Ayer) takes a bold approach by offering up only the most premium cuts of meat, Southern sides, and tasty tipples from all around the world. Seriously, the menu here is exceptional from beginning to end. And the meats? One word: flawless. The Beef Brisket is tender, juicy and smoked to perfection, and when combined with a side of either the Mustard Potato Salad or gooey Mac & Cheese, makes for the perfect meal. If you're still yearning for more, check out the Nashville Fried Chicken, it's mouth-watering. The fried chicken here does have a spicy kick to it, so make sure to have a glass of Southern Iced Tea or one of their signature drinks like the Valentino Twist within arm's reach. So head on down with your carnivorous clan to enjoy a true taste of the South, and discover for yourself why MeatSmith (Telok Ayer) has often been touted as being 'a cut above the rest'. (Nov 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "One of the first restaurants in Singapore to focus on smoked briskets and all things meat, this American smokehouse is casual, convivial and packed to the brim on most nights, but has plenty of classy touches, like chicken liver parfait and the taramasalata on the snacks menu at dinner." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smoked Suckling Pig Platter, Meat Platter, Dirty Fried Rice, Brisket Spring Rolls, Mac & Pimento Cheese, Nashville Fried Chicken, Chongqing 1/2 Pork Spare Ribs, Southern Ice Tea, Valentino Twist

    A Turkish restaurant in Far East Plaza, The Mediterranean Deli Turk is a must-try for all diners on the hunt for deliciously healthy food when dining out.Start with the Green Salad for a healthy combination of freshly chopped green vegetables lightly dressed with olive oil. For those looking for a more substantial start to your meal, choose the Fusilli Salad. A wonderful mix of cold pasta de fusilli and greens, this colourful bowl is as tasty as it is healthy.Side dishes at The Mediterranean Deli Turk are also not to be missed out on. Chef’s recommendations include Kul Basti, Falafel Plate, and Butter Rice. An interesting combination of vegetables and chickpeas dipped in tomato sauce, the Spicy Chickpeas Stew is a pure vegetarian dish made for all.Another sumptuous selection within the menu are the Turkish pizzas. With seven different flavours to choose from, mouthwatering favourites include the Cheese Pide and the Deli Turk Pride. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kul Basti, Falafel Plate, Deli Turk Pride, Spicy Chickpeas Stew

  • ABOUT

    Welcome to Tampines’ choice steakhouse. Fresh from the grills of Saveur, comes MediumRare, a steakhouse focused on the true way to cook a steak, no shortcuts, premium grades and the same affordable value that we are known for. But not detracting from what Saveur is known for, we are still focused on providing value, with carefully sourced meats from reputable suppliers, we offer cuts such as the increasingly popular Flat Iron Steak (250g) at $18++, to an Angus 150 Days Grain Fed Ribeye (250g) at $38++ only, even the Tomahawk is going for only $150++ as a sharing dish for 5 Pax. Aside from such, we offer a distinctive taste, crafting something new just for the local palates to pair with everyone's love for meat. Other than the usual Mushroom, Black Pepper sauce and Cafe de Paris, we serve a special Mala steak sauce, that everyone can enjoy, drawing the taste of szechuan sauce with mala peppers, the taste that has taken the nation by storm now comes with you juicy, roasted steaks. We also offer a Black Bean sauce, typical of a familiar dish one would find in a dimsum restaurant. These tastes are paired well with meats, and we have ventured to bringing it to the table with cuts of Steak, properly cooked, and affordably served, For those who need your carbs, we also serve a small range of Rice Bowls, such as a Grilled Chicken bowl ($12++), and a Flat Iron Steak Bowl ($18++) and even a Steak & Foie Gras bowl ($23). (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    1.5kg Tomahawk Steak, Flat Iron Steak, Angus 150 Days Grain Fed Ribeye, Grilled Chicken bowl, Steak & Foie Gras bowl

    Carnivores rejoice! There’s a new kid on the block: Meet & Meat – Street Food, the latest addition to the bustling food haven on East Coast Road. Meat lovers, you’ll feel right at home at this casual, no frills joint that dishes up affordable cuts of tender, juicy steaks. We’ve heard raving reviews on the Meet & Meat Beef Burger; boasting thick, moist 100 days grain-fed beef patties, dripping in melted cheese. Don’t forget to try their charcoal grilled skewers – with a plethora of flavours to choose from: Chinese traditional spicy, BBQ, teriyaki, or good old sea salt & black pepper. What better way to round it all off, than with a selection of ice-cold Paulaner beers on tap. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Meet & Meat Beef Burger, Ramly Beef Burger, Beef Batter Onion Rings, Hot Wings

    Melben Seafood has officially opened a new outlet @ Downtown East Market Square, catering to crab-craving diners staying in the east of Singapore. Singaporeans rave over Melben Seafood's heavenly crab dishes, and Melben Seafood never fails to serve up the freshest crabs, which are delivered daily to the restaurant. Do head down for their signature dishes such as the Claypot Crab Bee Hoon, Chili Crab, Shimmering Sand Crab, Black Pepper Crabs, and numerous other styles of crab dishes. They have launched a new dish "The Laksa Crab Bee Hoon”, combining a local delight with juicy crabs, and it is only available at the Downtown East outlet! (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Crab Bee Hoon, Chili Crab, Shimmering Sand Crab, Laksa Crab Bee Hoon

    Dressed to impress, Mellben Signature features a wide array of seafood delights with an innovative twist garnished with unique ingredients that guarantee a delicious dining experience. Committed to selecting only the highest quality Sri Lankan crabs, the restaurant performs an additional round of selection when bringing in a fresh batch of crabs to ensure that only the biggest and freshest crabs end up in your dishes. Helmed by Chef Gabriel, Mellben Signature tantalising menu includes the Claypot Crab Vermicelli Soup, Creamy Butter Crab, Imperial Chicken Soup and more! The place to visit for a hearty feast, drop by today to have a taste of these fresh ocean delights. A crowd favourite, the Pi Feng Tang Crab is fried with chillies, garlic and scallions, making for a fragrant pot of steaming hot crabs. Blanketed with a layer of melted savoury cheese, the lobsters and oyster menu options available here at Mellben Signature are a must order for all seafood lovers. Other equally mouthwatering dishes include the Braised Pork Belly. A wonderful meat option doused in an exceptional sauce, dig into a plateful of tender meat for melt in your mouth layers of fat. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Crab Vermicelli Soup, Creamy Butter Crab, Pi Feng Tang Crab, Braised Pork Belly

    Melt Café is a sophisticated all-day-dining experience, where cultures and cuisines mingle. The restaurant presents guests with contemporary and stylish interiors, where a delightful patisserie counter takes centre stage.Known for its extensive buffet presentations, the restaurant has a variety of stations to tempt diners. The main dining space is filled with light, which comes from floor to ceiling windows and provides a welcoming ambience. Here diners will find a roast and carving corner, as well as the ever popular live gourmet stations, together with European and Asian spreads. Guests can also dine alfresco during dinner, amidst lush greenery, while enjoying a delicious barbecue. Indoors, the award-winning pastry theatre provides for the perfect finale. (Jan 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Leave room to sample the vanilla panna cotta topped with raspberry coulis, and the white chocolate mousse and green apple sauce, which both required second helpings." -Time Out Singapore"The restaurant's own live stations feature a wide assortment of dishes freshly prepared by the chef a la minute. Selections include homemade pasta with a choice of sauces, meat carvings such as whole-roasted lamb saddle with spinach and mushroom, slow-roasted herb-crusted beef strip loin and miso-flavoured kurobuta pork, Chinese roasted meats such as roasted crackling five-spiced pork belly, herbal roasted duck, and more." -The Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oysters & Premium Seafood, Royal Tandoori Selection, Herbal Drunken Prawns, Japanese Sushi & Sashimi, Outdoor Barbecue Grill Station, Roasted Wagyu Cuts, Melt Signature Cake, Sabayon in Liquid Nitrogen

    An unforgettable outdoor dining experience awaits at MEMO! Set amidst the laid-back ambience of Robertson Quay, this modern bistro and cafe offers a perfect place to unwind while soaking in the Instagram-worthy spots the iconic Singapore River has to offer. Grab a bottle of beer and a plate of hearty Mediterranean cuisine off MEMO’s menu to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. For early birds, brunch options here are aplenty with classic delights such as Egg & Toast and Eggs Benedict available on the menu till 3pm daily. A premium mix of smoked salmon, ikura, tater tots and muffin, the Eggs Royale set will surely provide you with the energy boost you need to kickstart your day. Served with salad and fries, the Roasted Beef Sandwich is packed full of nutrients and stuffed with tomatoes, chimichurri, emmental and mozzarella. Complete your breakfast with a cup of freshly squeezed fruit smoothie or juice. Aside from brunch dishes, the cafe invites diners to savour decadent hot dishes such as the Mixed Grill Skewers, Potato Rosti, Prawn Penne and more. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggs Royale, Roasted Beef Sandwich, Mixed Grill Skewers, Potato Rosti

  • ABOUT

    Satiate your ramen cravings at Menbaka Kyoto Fire Ramen. Known for its abundance of green onions and signature negi onion oil, these bowls of tangy noodles are both a feast for the eyes and stomach! Watch in awe as the expert chefs pour the negi onion oil over the steaming hot bowls of ramen to create a tall, dramatic fire. Featuring huge flames and a rich, flavourful broth, don’t leave without trying the restaurant’s signature Shoyu Fire Ramen. Created by simmering chicken bones for hours on end, this delicious bowl of flavours is topped with bonito and mackerel flakes for that umami flavour. For spice lovers, we highly recommend the Kara Miso Fire Ramen. Born out of the locals' love for spicy delights, the spicy fermented bean paste packs a punch. The perfect balance of fiery and savoury, this Singapore-exclusive dish is a must-try. Besides ramen, there’s also a range of delectable sides that make great accompaniments. We recommend the Charcoal Karaage. Dip these crispy morsels in the citrusy wasabi sauce for extra zing. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shoyu Fire Ramen, Kara Miso Fire Ramen, Charcoal Karaage, Kyoto Matcha Beer

At the restaurant, dishes and flavour combinations are reinterpreted to reflect Chef Sun Kim's experiences. Combining his Korean heritage, Japanese culinary techniques, and Western culinary training, Meta presents innovative and well-balanced dishes that utilise the best seasonal produce and ingredients from around the globe. (Mar 2020)

• ABOUT

    Many would have heard of Metropolitan YMCA Singapore (MYMCA), an organisation which strives to inculcate a heart for the wider community in today's youth. What you wouldn't expect to find, however, is a restaurant nestled within MYMCA's building, where all net surpluses made are channelled to MYMCA's community outreach programmes. They support low-income families and underprivileged individuals affected by physical disabilities or chronic illnesses. What can be more gratifying than enjoying a sumptuous meal and giving back at the same time? (Mar 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    Offering an expansive selection of lip-smacking delights, there's something for everyone at the MYMCA Restaurant. Make it your next family hangout, where grandma and grandpa can feast on local delights while the young can choose from the several Western options available. The Claypot Fish Head Curry is a favourite among diners, with a tender half snapper fish head and generous portions of beancurd, yam, and vegetables drenched in a fragrant curry. The Fish & Chips, featuring a perfectly battered fillet, is another instant hit, along with the Cheese Burger. Finally, for those with a sweet tooth, the Sago Gula Melaka is an absolute must-try.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Fish Head Curry, Fish & Chips, Claypot Chicken Rice, Indonesian Nasi Goreng, Sago Gula Melaka

    mezza9 derives its name from nine thrilling and authentic experiences - the grill and rotisserie, a sushi and sashimi counter, a Thai grill and kitchen, sustainable seafood, traditional Chinese, patisserie and a gourmet boutique. There is also the martini bar and the party room, both versatile venues suitable for drinks and private events. With authentic dishes prepared in exciting open kitchens, guests get to interact with the restaurant's chefs as they showcase their love for the most delicious, sustainable produce on the planet. Thirsty? Hop on over to the martini bar for bold and exciting martinis, handcrafted gin and tonics, as well as a great, value-for-money selection of certified sustainable champagne and wines. (Dec 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Many restaurants have come and gone, but mezza9 stands strong in our fickle dining scene. It's one of the first hotel restaurants to feature several show kitchens under one roof. At these vibrant live stations, guests can interact with chefs as they dish out meals." -The Peak "When you know you want to eat but aren't sure what you want to eat, there's always mezza9 at the Grand Hyatt. This large, attractive restaurant offers nine different 'dining experiences' from Thai to Japanese, grills to seafood - you can sit anywhere you like and order from any of the show kitchens. It also boasts an impressive selection of martinis and over 350 labels on the wine list. Sunday brunch is a veritable institution." -MICHELIN Guide 2017

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crab Cakes, Tom Yum Goong, Sushi Kiwami, Porterhouse, Mezza9 Dessert Extravaganza

html:
• ABOUT

    Named after the Japanese word for “respect”, this casual izakaya pays homage to the cuisine of Southwest Japan, which is heavily influenced by fresh seafood and premium cuts of meat. The intimate setting, affordable prices, and friendly service has made this restaurant one of the most popular haunts in the city. The Chicken Nannban is a great option for diners looking to treat themselves. Made with breaded chicken fillet deep fried to crisp perfection and flavoured with a dollop of pink radish sauce, this dish is an exciting mix of flavours. The chicken skin is light, crisp and non-greasy, while the meat is tender and juicy. Paired with the earthy richness of the sauce, it’s sure to leave you wanting for more. Noodle enthusiasts are sure to love the unique Champon ramen. A traditional version of the Singaporean Hokkien Mee, this recipe is made with a broth of chicken and pork bones, stringy noodles, and topped with chunks of lard, seafood, and vegetables. The result is a flavourful meal that is best enjoyed on a cold day with some beer. Speaking of beer, barflies will be glad to know that there are various happy hour promotions at Mikoto, cementing its place as one of the CBD’s favourite watering holes. (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Champon Ramen, Chicken Nannban, Sashimi, Mentaiko Pasta, Tempura

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/mikoto-singapore

• ABOUT

    Embark on a culinary tour of stunning creations fresh from Mikuni’s teppanyaki and sushi live stations at Fairmont Singapore. Helmed by various master chefs, each station highlghts different premium Japanese produce. Complemented with signature dishes and innovative modern kaiseki dishes that never disappoint, visit the restaurant to feast your senses on mouthwatering Japanese delights. Drop by during lunch to indulge in Mikuni’s teppanyaki lunch menu. Consisting of an appetiser, sashimi platters, A5 Wagyu, rice, and dessert, this menu is specially curated to bring diners an authentic teppanyaki experience. For those who prefer to customise their dining experience, mix and match the various menu options for a true taste of Japan. Highly recommended, the Dragon Roll is a mouthful of BBQ eel, shrimp tempura, tobiko, cucumber, avocado topped with tempura flakes and unagi sauce for an extra crunch. Other signatures include the Crunchy Spicy Tuna and Mikuni Lobster Maki. The finest selection of assorted seasonal tempura, the Tempura Moriawase is a tasty platter of fried Japanese favourites that will leave you coming back for seconds. Wrap up your meal with a refreshing scoop of Yuzu Sorbet for the perfect finish! (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Nihon Namayasai Salad, Jou Sashimi, Miyazaki Wagyu Sirloin, Live Boston Lobster Uni Yaki

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Hidden in plain sight, Mimi , aptly named ‘secret’ in Mandarin is nestled on the upper floor of the 150-year-old mansion, The Riverhouse, one of only two of Singapore’s remaining historic Chinese Mansions. A classy and chic concept, Mimi epitomises the sultry and elegant personality of the mansion, elevated by Chef Jesse’s injection of contemporary twists to long-standing traditional Chinese cuisine. Helmed by Chef Jesse Lim with 14 years of experience, brings to life its enchanting blend of tradition and modernity, through its unique Modern Chinese menu. Every dish mirrors the venue’s former status as the enigmatic backdrop to clandestine meetings, which seeks to convey the secrets, origins, and stories that passed through its doors. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Unsubtle Truffle Mein, Saucy Crab & Egg Affair, Typhoon Shelter Duck Leg Confit, Chicken on Fire

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in the cosy alley that is Nankin Row, this intimate 15-seater restaurant is your go-to for a night of delicious Japanese food. Head over for a satisfying and affordable meal at $88 for 13-course Omakase during lunch or a gastronomic dinner Omakase course at $188. The lunch course is an absolute steal for a quality sushi and a decent omakase experience which includes 1 appetiser, 9 pieces of nigiri sushi (including toro), Wagyu Uni Rice Roll, Mini Maze Don, soup and dessert. Pair your meal with a carafe of chilled sake or opt for a good bottle of Shochu. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    15 Course Lunch, Chef’s Omakase Special

html:
• ABOUT

    Located at Marina Bay Financial Centre, this Japanese restaurant is well-loved by the office crowd and weekenders looking for sushi and sashimi. With “Misaki” representing the air, trees, and sea, these balancing of nature’s elements are evident in the extensive lunch and dinner menu. With attention to detail, beautiful plating, and a curation of the best Japanese ingredients, Misaki Japanese Restaurant is great for an indulgent solo lunch at the counter, or an intimate catch-up with work mates. Go for their Chirashi Dons, which are beautifully plated with quality ingredients such as Botan Ebi, Uni, Caviar, Ikura, Otoro, Kani Tsume, and more. For something comforting, the smooth Chawanmushi is given a luxe edge with the addition of uni, balancing the light tofu pudding with the saltiness of the sea. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bara Chirashi Teishoku, Santoku Teishoku, Sashimi & Sushi Set

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/misaki-japanese-restaurant
name: Misaki Japanese Restaurant

Cuisine: Bar, Italian, All-Day Breakfast, Greek, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
html:
• ABOUT

    Epitomising Mediterranean tranquillity, Miska Café is the perfect escape for people to ease up on their hectic pace of life as the soothing colours, open concept, and patterned tiles create a relaxed ambience. Awash with the constant murmurs of lapping waters, this soothing quayside gem boasts lengthy pages of breakfast options to keep both adults and children satisfied. Plates like Mediterranean, a dish packed with delights like Halloumi cheese, freshly baked pita, and grilled sausage, Mushroom Frittata, and the classic Shakshouka, sit alongside sweeter options like Vanilla French Toast and Pancakes, and it’s a picky person that won’t find something to suit their fancy at Miska. The rest of the immense offerings are both staggering and delicious. You’ll be tempted to fill up on appetising starters and a Greek salad, at first, but as your eyes travel on (and on), the lure of mouthwatering mains like Döner Kebab & Rice and a Kalymali Pizza topped with minced beef in spicy tomato sauce, coriander, and cheese, becomes more difficult to resist. Health buffs will also appreciate the lighter bites and preservative-free pita and wrap breads that showcase fresh products and homemade sauces to their best advantage. It can be a tad tough to find a spot that offers great food, family friendly atmosphere, and a chance to regroup from the chaos of everyday life but Miska Café has hit three for three in our books! (May 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Döner Kebab & Rice, Pancakes, Mushroom Frittata, Shakshouka, Mediterranean, Halloumi Salad, Kalymali Pizza, Falafels, Chicken Kebab, Cypriot Halloumi Wrap, Hummus

  • href

name: Miska Cafe (Sentosa)

Menus: Takeaway & Delivery Menu  A La Carte Menu  Omakase Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Located along the hip Duxton Road, the winsome Mitsu Sushi Bar charms diners with the best and freshest sushi in the city, thanks to its premium seafood that gets flown in from Japan five times a week. Under the deft hands of Fukuoka-native Chef Mitsuyasu Tatsuro, simple sushi ingredients are made to shine. The chef employs a “one fish, three ways” approach to his food, so diners can choose one fish from the daily menu and have it cooked three different ways. One notable standout is the Alaskan King Crab, cooked in styles that run the gamut from kaminabe, tempura, and sashimi to grilled & served with vinegar, simmered, or in chawanmushi. Other must-try menu items include the Soft-shell Crab Roll paired with a mildly spicy mayo. The Asari Clam Soup is another divine dish that doubles up as a refreshing palate cleanser. Then complement the fresh seafood offerings with any of the eatery’s numerous sake and shochu options, such as the Nama Sake, an unfiltered and unpasteurised sake that goes down smoothly with sushi. There’s nothing quite like an omakase meal, a chef-curated meal where all you have to do is sit back and enjoy the journey. And if there’s any restaurant that ranks among the best, it’s Mitsu Sushi Bar. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Alaskan King Crab, Grilled Anago (Sea Eel), Aburi Maguro Spicy Roll, Asari Clam Soup, Nama Saké

    Dining with a view has to be one of our favorite things and you get that and much, much more when you dine at Mitsuba Japanese Restaurant. Sprinkled with keyaki booths for a more traditional experience, dining here is perfect for date night, birthday dinners, and family gatherings! Settled right in the heart of Clarke Quay in Central, Mitsuba Japanese Restaurant is a vibrant eatery serving authentic Japanese cuisine. Signature dishes like Temaki, Maki Mono, and Ipin Mono make it quite hard to pick a favorite so do what we do and order them all! (Apr 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sashimi, Temaki, Makimono, Jyo Chirashi, Dobin Mushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Miyu is a Japanese omakase restaurant tucked away in a shophouse on Duxton Road. Helmed by executive chef Ng Kam Kwan, who’s trained in the kitchen of some of Singapore’s most highly-acclaimed restaurants, it’s a great place to get a taste of Japan. During lunch, the menu is casual, offering a variety of sets that come with appetisers, soup, a main dish, and dessert. The Bara Chirashi set is a favourite among sashimi fans. For something more indulgent and tuna lovers, go for the Otoro Chirashi Don set which is the fattiest portion of the Japanese Bluefin Tuna and can literally melt in your mouth. During dinner, full-course omakase sets are the stars of the show, with each set having no less than seven courses. Dishes change regularly according to the season and the chef's preference, but you can look forward to fresh air-flown sashimi, sushi, donburis, cooked dishes, dessert, and more. Dinner sets are also available upon request during lunch, so die-hard omakase fans can get their fix at any time of the day. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bara Chirashi Set, Otoro Chirashi Don set, Miyu Omakase Set

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/miyu
name: Miyu

Address: 391 Orchard Road #05-32Ngee Ann City Podium BlockSingapore (238872)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked in Ngee Ann City along Orchard Road, Mizuki is a Japanese restaurant to enjoy cuisine of the highest order. Well-known for their Omakase Tempura Meal, the restaurant specialises in whipping up tasty tempura dishes. Perfect for intimate meals, the restaurant is segregated into private rooms with the option of dining at the sushi counter or the tempura counter. For the tempura experience, start with a simple plate of spinach and beancurd skin in dashi sauce before moving onto the scallop. Cooked medium rare, the wonderful texture of the scallop elevates the dish, giving it a fantastic flavour. Deep fried to perfection, the anago is a delicious mouthful of sweet and tangy flavour, enhanced by the acidity brought about by a drop of lemon juice. Wrap up your meal with a small bowl of fluffy Japanese short grain rice topped with diced tempura prawns. The sushi set features the usual fanfare of traditional Japanese favourites such as eight different pieces of sashimi sushi, as well as a variety of handrolls. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Omakase Tempura Meal, Sushi Set Meal

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/mizuki
name: Mizuki

html:
• ABOUT

    Located along Hong Kong Street, Mizume is an omakase restaurant in Singapore. Bringing with him over 30 years of experience in Japanese fine dining, chef and owner Lawrence Chia aims to wow diners with meticulously prepared dishes featuring seasonal ingredients. Step into the cosy and elegant 25-seater restaurant for an intimate dining experience. Featuring a wood-lined exterior and a semi-dark interior, the restaurant is great for private events or small get-togethers. Showcasing the freshest exports from Toyosu fish market three times a week, the dishes are creatively handcrafted by the chefs and made for the discerning palates. Choose from four excellent choices of lunch and three dinner sets to begin your luxurious dining experience. Promising diners a creative omakase dining experience, diners can look forward to fresh and innovative combinations of traditional Japanese favourites. Open daily from Monday to Saturday, drop by during lunch or dinner time to enjoy Japanese fine dining at its best. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lunch Set, Dinner Set

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/mizume
name: Mizume

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled along Cavan Road, Mizuya (Cavan) is a gem waiting to be discovered by lovers of Japanese food. Omakase (chef’s choice) is the menu on offer here, though you’ll find affordable sets available during the busy lunch hour. By day, tuck into a selection of donburi, from a premium Wagyu Don set complete with a sous-vide egg, to affordably-priced Chirashi or Sashimi & Unagi Don sets. Come dinner time, the restaurant transforms into an intimate space where diners indulge in an extensive tasting menu. Tuck into three kinds of appetisers, and a refreshing salmon carpaccio. Dinner then progresses to an assortment of seasonal sashimi, served on a bed of ice and beautifully garnished with edible flowers. A bowl of piping hot clear soup is a good palate-cleanser, before the chef serves up the main courses — nigiri sushi, a mini don bowl, and miso soup, ending with some sweet Japanese fruit and hot tea for dessert. Sushi fans can opt for a full Nigiri Sushi Omakase, which comes with 15 pieces of nigiri sushi and a handroll. Head chef Kenny is also an expert in pairing whisky with Japanese food, so be sure to ask him for recommendations on a delicious dram for an accompanying nightcap. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fugu Mirin Boshi, Wagyu Tataki, Aburi Sushi, Special Chirashi Don, Shiromi Usuzukuri

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/mizuya-cavan
name: Mizuya (Cavan)

html:
• Good For

    Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner

  • ABOUT

    In the heart of the Tanjong Pagar District is Mizuya, a casual omakase dining concept that’s great for quick bites, after-work chill drinks and delicious air-flown sashimi. For their omakase courses, they offer a Nigiri Omakase for all the nigiri lovers out there, on top of their regular 8-course Omakase options. Eat to your heart’s delight with these fuss-free courses so you enjoy more and think less. Mizuya also serves an a la carte menu. For appetisers, try out their Fugu Mirin Boshi, dried pufferfish that’s savoury and great for sampling. For mains, their Special Chirashi Don with assorted thick-cut sashimi topped off with uni is a must-try — fresh and delectable with flavours of the ocean. For a more premium experience, we recommend trying their Shiromi Usuzukuri, consisting of white fish with caviar and bonito flakes. A sweet and light option, pair this with a cup of sake for maximum indulgence. Squid lovers rejoice! Mizuya’s Surume Ika is perfect for a delicious quick bite and is full of savoury and umami goodness that’s paired with their specialty chef sauce. A meat lover? Their Wagyu Tataki brings a savoury melt-in-your-mouth experience with each bite. Full of aromatic fragrance, this tantalising dish is great paired with a cocktail and good conversation. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fugu Mirin Boshi, Special Chirashi Don, Shiromi Usuzukuri, Wagyu Tataki, Nigiri Omakase

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Recognised as one of Asia's 50 Best Bars 2020 and inspired by the Pacific Ocean and rich culture of Asia's ports, MO BAR is a vibrant experience that celebrates the flavors and aromas of the region. Blending the finest ingredients with progressive techniques, bespoke cocktails and beverages range from refreshing to spirituous, with each artfully presented by Mandarin Oriental's talented team.The innovative cocktail menu can be paired with eclectic light bites, while the hotel's popular afternoon tea is also served daily, featuring artisan pastries and a myriad of accompanying delights. With breathtaking views of Marina Bay, by day or night, and a chic design, MO BAR is the hottest destination in Singapore. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sarimanok, Chamoe, Thunder, Milkyway, Panacea, Gyu-Katsu Sando (Breaded Wagyu Beef and Bulldog Sauce), Tiger Prawns (Masala Mayo and Curry Leaves) and Lobster Roll.

    MoboMoga is a quaint little sake bar, tucked away in a little corner in UE Square Shopping Mall. Stepping inside this place allows one to feel at home instantly with its cosy atmosphere and friendly bartenders. MoboMoga also boasts a wide selection of Sakes and food options to pair with, making this the perfect place for Sake lovers as well for people looking for a chill night out. (Aug 2019)

    Tsukune, Yakisoba, Karaage, Shizuoka Oden

html:
• ABOUT

    Moghul Mahal is an institution for North Indian food lovers in Singapore. Established almost 30 years ago, when there were only a small handful of restaurants serving authentic North Indian food, Moghul Mahal has stood the test of time and needs no introduction to those in the know of the local dining scene. It has steadily built up a pool of loyal patrons that have followed the restaurant and its exquisite range of fine North Indian dishes through its multiple incarnations in various locations over the past 3 decades. Using only the finest ingredients and freshly blended spices, the award winning chefs bring to life the wonderful universe of flavours that Indian food has to offer, delivering a feast for all the senses that will undoubtedly delight and satisfy you. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rogan Josh, Garlic Naan, Paneer Tikka, Seekh Kabab

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/moghul-mahal-restaurant
name: Moghul Mahal Restaurant

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Molly Malone's was the first Irish pub to open in Singapore, way back in 1995. More than twenty years on, she still maintains that unrivaled jovial atmosphere intrinsic to any classic Irish Pub. Molly Malone's Irish Pub was actually born in Ireland and transported piece by piece to Singapore, where she was reconstructed in 1995 on the corner of Circular Road and Canton Street. There she remained for just over 9 years, before packing up house and moving across the street to the helm of Circular Road on Christmas Eve of 2004. When you come for a pint of beer or our famous Fish n' Chips, you'll feel that you're in a home away from home. With all the live sport you could want, Molly's is always lively, full of interesting people, and (of course!) the craic! There's a true blue (or perhaps green?) sense of community at Molly's that you'll be hard-pressed to find anywhere else! (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Molly's Famous Fish & Chips, Bangers & Mash, Molly's Burger, Ribeye Steak

name: Molly Malone’s Irish Pub

html:
• ABOUT

    Robertson Quay has long had a stellar reputation as a trendy dining and nightlife destination, probably partly due to its choice location along the Singapore River. As you walk along this iconic river, you can't help but sense an instant lightness in your step, a bounce in your walk, and a rumble in your belly. And if you think there's something reminiscent of the canals of Venice, why not answer that rumble with a trip to Mondo Mio? Mondo Mio is an authentic Southern Italian restaurant which is as Italian as it gets. Freshly-made pizza and pasta make up the bulk of the menu and cheese is used generously. Still not enough cheese? The Four Cheese Pizza comes highly recommended. Fans of the thin thin-crust variety of the famous Italian pie will also enjoy the satisfying biscuit-like crunch with each bite. If you're not a huge fan of either pizza or pasta, or just happen to be craving for a good chunk of meat, the premium veal shank is your answer. Braised on low fire with rosemary and thyme, the shank comes served on a bed of rich and flavourful saffron risotto made with simmered Italian Arborio rice. Just the sight of it is guaranteed to make you want to belt out a melody like a Gondola singer. (Aug 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Four Cheese Pizza, Mondo Mio Pizza, Ossobuco, Pappardelle Casalinghe Mondo Mio, Pappardelle di Spinaci ai Gamberoni in Crema di Zafferano, Tiramisu

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    The only restaurant in Singapore that serves Japanese demi glace curry made with as many as 14 varying vegetables and spices, Monster Curry keeps diners coming back for more. Big on size and huge on taste, the restaurant’s monstrous bowls of curry rice and noodles bring joy and spice to all! Perfect for sharing, opt for the 41cm plate and spread the love of Monster Curry’s smooth and fragrant curry with family and friends. All dishes at Monster Curry are served at five different levels of spiciness. Daredevils can opt for the monster spicy or super spicy option while others can enjoy the hot sauce concoction at a normal spicy level. A popular favourite, the Flame Monster Curry consists of pork shabu shabu, tori karaage, shrimp tempura, onsens egg and cheese for a satisfying one dish meal. Other signature menu options include the Chashu Curry Ramen and Combo Curry Ramen Set. For those who fancy pasta, a plethora of creamy and tangy pasta options are available on the menu. Opt for Seafood Fantasy and indulge in a taste of the flavours from the ocean in a single plate. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Flame Monster Curry, Chashu Curry Ramen, Combo Curry Ramen Set, Seafood Fantasy

html:
• ABOUT

    The only restaurant in Singapore that serves Japanese demi glace curry made with as many as 14 varying vegetables and spices, Monster Curry keeps diners coming back for more. Big on size and huge on taste, the restaurant’s monstrous bowls of curry rice and noodles bring joy and spice to all! Perfect for sharing, opt for the 41cm plate and spread the love of Monster Curry’s smooth and fragrant curry with family and friends. All dishes at Monster Curry are served at five different levels of spiciness. Daredevils can opt for the monster spicy or super spicy option while others can enjoy the hot sauce concoction at a normal spicy level. A popular favourite, the Flame Monster Curry consists of pork shabu shabu, tori karaage, shrimp tempura, onsens egg and cheese for a satisfying one dish meal. Other signature menu options include the Chashu Curry Ramen and Combo Curry Ramen Set. For those who fancy pasta, a plethora of creamy and tangy pasta options are available on the menu. Opt for Seafood Fantasy and indulge in a taste of the flavours from the ocean in a single plate. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Flame Monster Curry, Chashu Curry Ramen, Combo Curry Ramen Set, Seafood Fantasy
