  • ABOUT

    Landing in Causeway Point, Monster Planet is Monster Curry Groups’ debut of a halal-certified brand. Known for their monster-sized curries dished up at pocket-friendly prices, the iconic Japanese restaurant chain is offering its fiery dishes alongside other exclusive menu options at Monster Planet. Made with 14 varying vegetables and spices, the addictive sauce is cooked over low fire for two days, resulting in an intensely flavourful sauce. Popular signatures drenched in this fiery sauce include the Monster Curry Combo, Signature Chicken Katsu Curry, Monster Combo Curry Ramen and more. For those looking for a taste of something different, the burger options at Monster Planet will surely satisfy your cravings. Seasoned with teriyaki sauce, the juicy patty in the Supreme Beef Burger is handmade using premium beef for a delicious one meal dish. The Lemongrass Chicken Burger is another mouthwatering option that comes highly recommended. End your meal on a sweet note with the restaurant’s Mixed Berries Honey Toast. Drizzled with strawberry syrup, the Shibuya style toast features a tasty mix of Ben & Jerry’s vanilla ice cream with strawberries and blueberries. (Feb 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Monte Risaia spotlights Japanese flavours executed with Italian flair. Dining omakase-style, with a three-course menu starting from $68 and a six-course menu from $128. The meal starts with an amuse bouche and assorted appetizers, before moving on to pasta and the main course. Pastas here are cooked to perfection. The Pescatora Rosa Shiso & Omaru Lobster Dashi Pasta is an umami-rich dish of plump juicy lobster sitting in a light and tangy tomato-based broth made from dashi stock. For mains, the Omi Wagyu Tagliatelle promises to win over your heart — and stomach — with its beautifully-marbled meat, seared to medium-rare doneness. The beef is buttery and meltingly tender, best paired with a glass of classic Italian red wine or some fine Japanese sake. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pescatora Rosa Shiso & Omaru Lobster Dashi Pasta, Omi Wagyu Tagliatelle

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/monte-risaia
name: Monte Risaia

Menus: Breakfast Menu  Weekday Colapranzo Menu  A La Carte & Degustation Menu  Weekend Colapranzo Menu  Bar Menu  Wine List  No Strings Attached Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Known for its award-winning architectural marvel and elegant multi-concept space, Monti @ 1-Pavilion continues to be the bay’s jewel for culinary excellence, new-age cocktail creations and reliable breath-taking views of the entire Marina Bay. Located at the iconic spherical Fullerton Pavilion, Monti was designed with versatility in mind – from rich, jewel-toned furnishings to floor-to-ceiling windows that provide copious natural light by day and the city's twinkle lights by night, she is a wonderful collision of both elegance and old-school charm. Co-curated by both culinary maestros, Monti menus bring the soul of authentic Tuscan-Italian cuisine to elevated heights, using only premium ingredients sourced with as much care as her décor – including olive oils created specifically for the restaurant. Just as Chef Felix still hand-crafts his pasta, Chef Emanuele displays a level of devotion to quality that produces knockout hero dishes. Straight-forward and easy to love, Monti’s menu consists of composed appetizers and entrees that echo Italy’s charm. Main-stays like “The Fiorentina Experience’’ and ‘’The Omakase Menu’’ showcases a crescendo of flavor, moving guests along on an unforgettable gastronomical journey. As the night progresses, Monti offers the glamour of a city rooftop for after-work aperitifs, along with the charm of a sunset elopement dinner. Combining personalized service and chef-driven menus, Monti is one of the most-beloved fine-dining destinations for cosmopolites at the Marina Bay. (Aug 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Pastas take pride of place here (of course), like fresh ravioli stuffed with braised veal and bone marrow cream, for instance. Wash it all down with refreshing cocktails like Mr. Monti, a rum-based tonic highball with grapefruit essence." -The Peak "Once you step into the glass dome, be swept away by their sleek interiors, decked out in bronze and copper hues, fresh flowers as table pieces, low-hanging lights and their marble bar top which rounds up the elegant atmosphere." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    House-made Spaghetti Aglio Olio e Gamberi, House-made Ravioli, Mayura Wagyu Beef Tartare, House-exclusive Mayura Full Blood-Wagyu T-bone, Butternut Squash Tortelloni

name: Monti

html:
• ABOUT

    Serving a delectable menu made up of Modern European cuisine infused with a delightful Asian influence, MOONBOW dishes up an array of eclectic dishes presented on exquisite ceramic tableware. Pamper your senses in the heart of Dempsey Hill with a sumptuous feast today! Perfect for intimate meals, it’s love at first bite here at MOONBOW with soul booster soups, wholesome vegetables and a delicious spread of desserts for a sweet ending. Kickstart your meal with a plate of Wagyu Carpaccio. A match made in heaven, slices of seared wagyu beef are paired with purple mustard and truffle shoyu for a savoury dish that will surely whet your appetites. Seafood lovers can opt for the Prawn “Gambas”. Peppered with coconut crumbs and coconut emulsion, this serving of succulent ocean Tiger Prawns is a great start to a hearty meal. Those who prefer something lighter can order The Heirloom Tomatoes or Heart of Palm for a nutritious starter. Move on to the mains with the restaurant’s tantalising European plates such as the Hokkaido Scallops Orzo, The Salmon Fish & Chips, as well as the Angus Beef Short Rib. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Carpaccio, Prawn “Gambas”, Hokkaido Scallops Orzo, The Salmon Fish & Chips

html:
• ABOUT

    Get your hands on good old-fashioned slow-cooked delicious American BBQ prime pork ribs today at Morganfield! Conveniently located right outside Promenade MRT, the restaurant is best known for its mouthwatering Sticky Bones spare ribs that are smoked over hickory wood, then basted with a sweet, tangy hickory flavoured BBQ Sauce. Imagine juicy, tender, perfect ribs paired with jaunty blue beats and laid back vibes, and let Morganfield bring you on a gastronomic journey, back to a time when life was enjoyed with hearty food and good music.To cater to a range of preferences, when you order a slab of ribs you can choose your accompanying sauce from a choice of five - Hickory BBQ, Smoked Peppercorn, Garlic BBQ, Kansas Sweet BBQ and Spicy Asian BBQ. You can even get their delicious ribs in an easier to eat option where hot chucks of ribs have been pulled off the bone and sandwiched in a warm buttered sesame bun when you order Morgan’s Rib Burger.Morganfield’s also offers Combo Platters and Sharing Platters where you can choose from a selection of meats, seafood and sides, perfect groups of 2-4 people. Morganfield’s Home of the Best Ribs in Town! (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sticky Bones Spare Ribs, Pork Belly Burnt Ends, Loaded Chili Nachos, Granny’s Apple Lychee Tea

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the lush greenery of Dempsey Hill, this restaurant has all the makings of a chilled out hangout spot away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The interior of this restaurant is almost as green as its exterior, with hanging plants, repurposed wooden furniture, and wood panelling reminiscent of a weatherboard cottage. This restaurant has won many accolades throughout the years and has gained an experience for their excellent food, and it’s not difficult to see why. Chef-Owner Petrina Loh draws on her childhood for inspiration for her dishes, and has created sharing platters of fusion cuisine that feature the perfect balance of flavours. Diners looking for a unique dish can try the Pork Jowl Char Siew Wonton Mee. Made with tender, locally sourced pork jowl, herbal soy sauce, pork and kimchi wontons, and a fiery jalapeño chilli sauce, this dish seamlessly incorporates the spice of Korean and Latin American cuisine into a dish that is uniquely Singaporean. Looking for a unique treat to end your meal? Look no further than the Jackfruit Banana Cake. Made with chunks of fragrant jackfruit and sweet banana, and topped with Mugi miso meringue and drizzled with chocolate sauce, this dish is deliciously sweet without being cloying, and the perfect dessert to end an excellent meal. Ultimately, while Chef Petrina's culinary pedigree is nothing to sniff at, with Le Cordon Bleu and a stint at HUSK in Nashville under her belt, it's really the intimate hospitality and innovative courses that will keep you coming back, time and time again, for more. (Oct 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The winner here is the squid ink risotto. A pale yellow salted egg yolk sauce (similar to those in Chinese seafood restaurants) is drizzled over plump, briny grains of risotto rice and the flavours marry well. Slices of octopus and tobiko give the composition a nice variation in texture." -The Business Times "Morsels is big on flavour combinations, so expect intriguing sharing plates like the Hokkaido scallop ceviche with plums, cilantro, red onions and homemade tortilla chips." -Time Out Singapore "Offerings include Firecracker pork pasta ($12) and grilled octopus with squid ink risotto and salted egg sauce ($25). Chef-owner Petrina Loh supports local farmers and the menu features produce from sustainable sources." -SG Now Singapore's Top Restaurants Guide 2017/2018 - One Star World Gourmet Summit Huber's Restaurant of the Year 2017 World Gourmet Summit Chef's Choice (Western) 2017 – Chef Petrina Loh

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Jowl Char Siew Wonton Mee, House-Poached Octopus, Wild Sri Lankan Prawns Laksa, Jackfruit Banana Cake

• ABOUT

    Situated smack dab in the middle of the Commercial and Central Business District, Morton's The Steakhouse in Mandarin Oriental is the truest and bluest steakhouse Singapore has to offer. Not skimping on any detail, everything from the succulent steaks and fresh seafood to the vast wine collection and seamless service reiterate the classic and exceptional dining experience Morton's is widely known for. As mentioned, no detail is overlooked and this is clearest when glancing at the menu. Serving the best available aged grain-fed beef, such as the must-try 48-ounce (1300g) Porterhouse and 20-ounce (550g) New York Sirloin, as well as fresh fish, Maine Lobster, and lamb chops - the menu offers generous portions of it all. Equally renowned for their extensive wine list, the bar at Morton's is one of our favourite post-work spots to grab a drink, indulge in bar bites like their Blue Cheese Steak Fries, and loosen up after a long day at work! (Apr 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "With impeccable service, mouthwatering food and an extensive range of wines available, Morton's has definitely won our hearts. Now with new additions to the menu, even non-steak eaters can experience the classic dining experience." -Lifestyle Asia "Get a slice of the good stuff here at Morton's. Choices like the boneless USDA prime rib, the porterhouse steak, and the five peppercorn rubbed prime strip steak don't come cheap, but they sure are worth the hefty price tag." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oysters Rockefeller, Tuna Tacos, Chilled Ocean Platter, Baked Five Onion Soup, Lobster Bisque, Cajun Ribeye Steak, Porterhouse Steak, Chicken Bianco, Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes, Morton's Legendary Hot Chocolate Cake

    Established in 1989, we began in a teahouse that serves fresh handmade dim sum and Cantonese fare to Singapore’s Hong Kong expatriate community. 30 years on, the teahouse has transformed into a family-friendly restaurant that has remained resolute in its interpretations of Cantonese cooking. Now an all-inclusive Chinese restaurant, we offer affordably priced innovative dim sum in a family-friendly environment. To sample Mouth Restaurant’s signature flavors, diners should go with the Roasted Suckling Pig, Peking Duck, Black Char Siew, Phoenix Soon Hock Fish, Chilli & Black Pepper Crab. Mouth’s Liu Sha Bao has also made waves among the local foodie community - its custard buns have been recognized by Epicure Food Magazine and Lifestyle Asia, as one of Singapore’s Best. In 2014, the restaurant was rated as one of the top 23 dim sum restaurants in Singapore. In 2018, it was voted one of the top Chinese Restaurants in Singapore. (Aug 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roasted Suckling Pig, Peking Duck, Black Char Siew, Phoenix Soon Hock Fish, Chilli & Black Pepper Crab

    Mrs Pho brings the best of both Northern and Southern Vietnamese cuisine under one roof. Step into the home of Mrs Pho, where she will feed you like family. Savour her heirloom recipes, featuring traditional Vietnamese charcoal hotpot and barbeque. With French flavours and techniques from its colonisation days, and influences from neighbouring countries like China, Thailand and Cambodia, there is a world of flavours to experience in Vietnamese cuisine, beyond just Pho. (Oct 2021)

    Mugen does not have a fixed menu - what we serve changes daily, depending on the availability of ingredients, which varies with each season. This stays true to the idea of the omakase menu where the diner trusts the chef to present his best dishes of the day. Ingredients are shipped fresh from Japan four times a week.Both MU and GEN mean Dream, with GEN taking on the additional meaning of Dream (Shadow). This is reflected in how our Chef provides a dream space and time to customers with his high quality fare. (Mar 2022)

html:
• ABOUT

    MY Cafe & Bar is what modern bistronomy looks like, where casual multi-cuisine dining meets an eclectic bar. Available round the clock, the Stuffed Chicken Breast is a crowd favourite. Garnished with ricotta cheese and sun dried tomatoes, the chicken breast is stuffed with hazelnut, crab meat, mashed potato and seasonal vegetables. Another hot favourite at the cafe is their thin crust pizza. Fresh from the oven, there are six different kinds of pizzas to choose from, including the cafe’s NJ Special Pizza Base. A tasty combination of mozzarella, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, asparagus and zucchini, this signature pizza is delicious and filling! Flavours across Asia can also be found here in dishes such as the Mutton Biryani and Chicken Tikka Gravy. The drinks menu also offers a wide variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Sporting a fun and casual ambience, MY Cafe & Bar promises to bring all diners a good time. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Stuffed Chicken Breast, MY Special Pizza Base, Mutton Biryani, Lava Cake

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    My Little Spanish Place, one of Singapore's first Spanish restaurants, has setup its second home-style space in town. Housed at the ground level of a conservation shophouse along the Boat Quay riverside, guests can now have a taste of Spanish 'meson' dining right in the heart of the CBD. With its new location by the waters, the My Little Spanish Place chef duo, Chefs Maria Sevillano and Edward Esmero, naturally looked to the Balearic Islands - anarchipelago made up of 4 islands, the well-known clubbing destination Ibiza, Majorca, Minorca and Formentera. The brand new menu offers dishes inspired by new regions previously not explored. (Aug 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Migas, Sepia, Handmade Sausage Platter, Secreto Iberico, Leche Merengada

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/my-little-spanish-place-boat-quay
name: My Little Spanish Place (Boat Quay)

html:
• ABOUT

    Newly renovated and with a new chef sharing the helm, My Little Spanish Place is once again right at the forefront of the Spanish culinary wave that has left Singaporeans in a tizzy. Chef Edward Esmero joins Chef Maria Sevillano in the kitchen and promises to bring a completely new perspective to the cuisine that has so quickly settled as one of our island's favourites. There is still a strong focus on authentic, home-cooked style dishes, and the new revamped menu combines old favourites with new ones. Simple, classic favourites like the Pulpo de la Casa (grilled fresh octopus seasoned with pimenton, sea salt, and olive oil) or the Chuletillas de Cordero ($32), pan-fried cutlets of milk-fed lamb with a garlic white wine reduction, are exactly reminiscent of the local fare in the countryside regions of Spain. The team is also introducing a brunch menu that's only available on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays (till 3pm) that include a Spanish version of the classic ham and eggs! Considering the general quality of Spanish ham, that sounds amazing to us! Chef Edward shares that My Little Spanish Place aims to be somewhere friends and family can bond over a good meal, so round up those friends and family members! Any excuse for a good meal works for us! (Aug 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Moist and perfectly oiled, the rice [of the squid-ink paella] creates a fluffy bed for the well-sized chunks of squid, along with a balanced combination of garlic, paprika and chilli. “ –Time Out Singapore “My Little Spanish Place is a cosy 50-seater serving hearty, flavourful signatures from Salamanca.” –Appetite Asia “At this quaint 50-seater eatery, tapas served are a collection of chef-partner Maria Sevillano’s favourite recipes from her hometown of Castilla y Len.” –Epicure Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pulpo de la Casa, Chuletillas de Cordero, Cochinillo Asado, Churros

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked in along lively Ann Siang Road, My Little Tapas Bar is a cheeky newcomer in Singapore's love affair with Spanish tapas. With simple, classic fare done as the Spanish do - as an accompaniment to long, lovely evenings filled with wine and laughter - My Little Tapas bar is sure to steal your heart. Taking a more authentic approach to tapas than usual, per its sister restaurant My Little Spanish Place, this tapas bar is all about the bona fide, Iberian originals - an all-Spanish wine list, five types of jamones carved-to-order, Spanish cheeses and only the most fundamental of Spanish snacks. The interior features rough-hewn woody tones and modern touches like bare bulbs. Spanish flare is evident in vintage posters, bullfighter-red napkins and rope accents that recall a traditional torero. The wine list is concise and convincing, each entry boasting its high Robert Parker and (Spanish equivalent) GUIA Penin scores, so you know that your choice will be a great one. The cuisine is so classic and restrained that you can taste each ingredient that went into the dish. Andalusian flatbread features caramelized onions, piquillo peppers and a rioja reduction over grilled bread. The gambas are seasoned with smoky paprika and garlic, creating slurry so tasty that we recommend digging down into the dish long after the prawns are gone. For dessert, try the Chocolate Tart served with a traditional meringue sorbet with flavours of cinnamon. In all, My Little Tapas Bar's disarmingly chic combination of modern decor, warm vibe and delicious food has it poised to become your little tapas bar. (Mar 2014)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Charcuterie Platter, Andalusian Flatbread, Gambas Picante, Tortilla Espanola, Tapas Steak, Mini Chocolate Tarts

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    Naeum proudly presents the best of Western techniques and Korean heritage flavours to diners, through episodic menus. Located along Telok Ayer Street, this humble restaurant was founded by chef Louis Han, who delivers show-stopping dishes of contemporary Seoul cuisine. Well-lit by soft lighting, the cosy space at Naeum is furnished with sleek wood panels for a cosy yet sophisticated vibe. Snag a seat near the bar for quick refills or slide into the booth seats to enjoy an intimate dining session with friends. Start off with the Fish and Spanner Crab, which comes beautifully garnished with fish roe, and features the freshest catch of the ocean. Stuffed with succulent crab meat, the tightly rolled wrap is evenly sliced, rewarding diners with mouthfuls of juicy crab meat dipped in a light yuzu sauce. Next up, the visually spectacular Mulhwae, with its explosion of flavour and colour, is a fantastic dish that sashimi lovers should not miss out on. Our favourite? The Uni Somyeon which is an exquisite dish of cold soba and uni topped with caviar. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fish & Spanner Crab, Mulhwae, Uni Somyeon

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/naeum-restaurant
name: NAE:UM Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    It’s all about food from the heart at Nalan Restaurant (City Hall). Set up in 2009 by two old friends who were dissatisfied with the then-available options for Indian cuisine, Nalan Restaurant (City Hall) has blossomed into a gem that spins out authentic Indian vegetarian fare meticulously prepared with traditional cooking methods-- no doubt the reason for their impressive pool of loyal patrons who return for a heartwarming taste of home-cooked food.Nalan’s dedication to their customers is clearly evident in their ability to cater to traditional Jain diets. Dishes without onion and garlic, such as Palak Paneer and Sbji Diwani-hundi, are commonplace and should you have any dietary restrictions or food allergies, Nalan’s skilled chefs are more than happy to whip something up for you without sacrificing taste or quality.The menu also features an impressive range of options from all across India. We are major fans of the Paneer Butter Masala, featuring satisfying cottage cheese cubes drenched in a creamy sauce of tomato and butter. Tip: soak up every last drop of goodness with some naan. If you’re looking for some Western fare, Nalan’s got you covered too, with exciting options like the Asparagus and Baby Bella salad and the Rigatoni with Broccoli, Walnuts and Ricotta. What’s there not to like? (Aug 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hara Bara Kebab, Paneer Tikka Masala, Mixed Vegetable Curry, Aloo Shimlamirch, Paneer Butter Masala, Dal Tadka, Rava Onion Masala Thosai, Paper Thosai, Assorted Bread Basket

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled within the illustrious Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore, NAMI Restaurant & Bar showcases perfectly balanced culinary creations that stay true to authentic Japanese cuisine, harmonised with international influences. The restaurant is temporarily operating out of Origin Grill, and guests are invited to immerse in a splendid, diversified dining experience with Japanese chef, Yutaro San, and omotenashi (Japanese hospitality) from the heart. Under the leadership of Chef Yutaro Tsuchiya who has decades of experience and exposure to distinct influences from overseas working experiences and travels, the repertoire of gastronomic delights at NAMI showcases a mindful balance of the art of Japanese cuisine with international influences as techniques and flavours that Chef Yutaro has discovered from his exploration of different cultures are incorporated into the culinary creations. From slicing techniques to unique marinades, the culinary team’s craft of treating each ingredient differently with skill brings out the best of each produce. Hailing from Yokosuka, Yokohama, Chef Yutaro was raised near the sea, laying the foundation for his expertise in handling seafood and his deep-rooted appreciation for fresh seasonal produce, which forms the heart of the restaurant’s identity today. NAMI, which means wave in Japanese, transports the pulse of the sea from Japan to diners in Singapore with an unrelenting dedication to seasonality, flying in seasonal fresh catches from Japan frequently as the delicacies are available. Guests can look forward to savouring quality produce at their peak in a la carte selections as well as curated set menus that are updated frequently to present only the best that are in season. (Jul 2021)

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/nami
name: NAMI

html:
• ABOUT

    Nan Jing Restaurant offers an array of flavourful menu dishes that focuses on Huaiyang and Cantonese cuisine, aiming to bring authentic Chinese cuisine to Singapore. Appetisers are simple yet delicious. For example, the Cucumber with Sesame Oil is lightly seasoned and garnished with diced chilli padi, giving it a sweet and tangy flavour. The Preserved Egg is another crowd favourite. Cubes of salted eggs are served up on a platter decorated with carrots, beans and flowers. However, the star of the show at Nan Jing Restaurant is undeniably the Chilli Crab. Freshly cooked, the crab meat is juicy and succulent and tastes best when dipped in the thick and spicy Chilli Crab sauce. The Pork Trotter is another worthy contender. Fried with peanuts and coriander, the Pork Trotters are a wonderful burst of flavours. Order a warm bowl of Mushroom Soup to cleanse your palate. Filled with handmade meatballs and mushrooms, the soup is nutritious and refreshing. For those who are craving something more sinful, try the Deep Fried Pumpkin Pancake. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, this dish presents the perfect balance of flavour. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cucumber with Sesame Oil, Chilli Crab, Pork Trotters, Deep Fried Pumpkin Pancake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/nan-jing-restaurant
name: Nan Jing Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Nanami Modern Izakaya is a casual eatery that serves authentic Japanese fare and drinks. Conveniently located in Tanjong Pagar, it's the perfect place to grab lunch with colleagues or for some after-work drinks and nibbles. During lunch, it whips up a variety of donburis for a quick and satisfying meal. The Bara Chirashi Don is a sashimi lover's paradise, with fresh chunks of salmon and tuna sashimi over a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. All donburis come with miso soup, salad, and dessert. In the evening, the menu expands to include a wider selection of ala carte dishes such as sashimi, maki rolls, tempura, yakitori, grilled dishes, and more. You'll be spoilt for choice with the dishes available. Favourites include the Saikoro Steak Teppanyaki (grilled beef cubes with wafu oroshi sauce), the Surume Ika (grilled squid), and the Ama Ebi Karaage (deep fried sweet shrimp). The drinks menu completes the izakaya experience, with a tempting range of premium Japanese cocktails, liqueurs, and sake. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bara Chirashi Don, Saikoro Steak Teppanyaki, Surume Ika, Ama Ebi Karaage, Green Tea Ice Cream

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    Established over three decades ago, Nanbantei was Singapore's first and only Yakitori restaurant. 30 years on, and they're still standing strong, serving up stick after stick of their signature skewers. Lightly seasoned with sea salt to let the flavours of the meat shine through, each skewer is grilled to perfection over high heat using a special type of charcoal, which imbues the meat with a distinctive smoky aroma. This meticulous grilling method results in skewers that are slightly charred on the edges, while retaining all its juicy goodness. Whether you're looking to tuck into succulent meat on sticks, or seafood and vegetables fresh off the grill, Nanbantei's extensive menu has got you covered. So, for an authentic taste of Japan, Nanbantei is your best bet. (Jul 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yakitori Bento, Pork Don Set, Unadon & Tempura Set, Sashimi & Yakitori Course

html:
• ABOUT

    Diners looking for pure Nanjing cuisine, look no further. This swish spot in Plaza Singapura is this beloved Chinese restaurant chain’s first foray into Singapore, and serves up a variety of dishes made in classic Chinese style. The interior here will transport you back in time to the heyday of China’s first capital - think fine upholstery, traditional calligraphy on the walls, and delicious dishes cooked using time tested methods - there’s a reason why this is one of the must-visit restaurants of China. Dig into beloved dishes like Poached ‘Lion’s Head’ Meatball, large generous chunks of pork meatballs served with cabbage and vermicelli noodles in a rich broth. Spice fanatics will enjoy the Mala Red Crayfish, a dish flavoured with traditional Sichuan spice, with the crayfish cooked to perfection inside. The Nanjing Impressions Potstickers dumplings are this restaurant’s claim to fame, and for good reason. The dumplings are tender and chewy, and stuffed with a generous amount of pork filling. The Honey-glazed Stuffed Lotus root is a simple dish bursting with subtle flavour. The lotus root is rich and cooked to tender perfection and the honey glaze adds a touch of sweetness that contrasts perfectly with the earthiness of the lotus. (June 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Drunken Virgin Red Crayfish, Honey-glazed Lotus Roots, Poached Lion's Head Meatball, Salted Duck

html:
• ABOUT

    With its inky wood interior, rustic stone walls, location on bustling Telok Ayer Street, and namesake emblazoned on the back vaulting, Napoleon Food & Wine Bar certainly lives up to the impression of the cool French wine bar you'd think it is. Then you catch flashes of the very unique. The visit is streamlined with smart touches of tech - like the long row of enomatic machines that, like adult soda fountains, welcome guests to taste a selection of their 28 wines before committing to a half-glass, glass, or bottle. The wines and food follow through with Napoleon's concept of an exceptional and easy wine experience. With a varied selection of hand-picked, reasonably-priced French labels categorized by taste, we were able to pick our top choices - and were happy to taste a few along the way - before settling on that perfect glass. The small plates menu is intelligently created to pair well with all of their wines and are also meant for sharing, making the ordering process lively and involved. The menu offers a range of salads, platters and European and Asian-influenced mains, along with scrumptious desserts that most certainly call for adding a sweet wine to your iPad order! Napoleon explores the rich culinary history and fabulous offerings of France. The Chef boasts an exquisite menu of traditional French brasserie dishes with a modern twist, focused on low temperature cooking. (Jan 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The southern European leanings carry through its food offerings: creations such as homemade foie gras, pastas and Spanish ham croquettes span a range of flavours from sweet, sour, salty and spicy so diners can sample different results when pairing them with different wines." -The Business Times "But the range of beverages also extends beyond wines to include beers, cocktails, whiskies and the like. Meals are also available and well-presented mains at around $20 represent good value, complemented by salads and a good variety of ham/cheese platters." -Asia Tatler Dining

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Homemade Grand Marnier Foie Gras Terrine, Hand Cut Angus Beef Tartare, Seared Tuna Steak, Duo of Chocolate Ganache & Mi-Cuit Canelé

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/napoleon
name: Napoleon Food & Wine Bar

  • PRESS RELEASE

    An authentic Italian restaurant at Anson, Napolizz Pizza is a family-friendly spot that serves freshly made pizzas. Enjoy these delicious pies alongside an extensive wine list and a variety of alcoholic beverages. Signature pizzas here include the Pizza Napolizz, Pizza Gorgonzola and Pizza Pollo. Apart from just pizza, the restaurant offers multiple dishes such as appetisers, salads, pastas and main courses. Kickstart your meal with a classic slice of Garlic Bread with Mozzarella Cheese. Toasted with garlic, butter, and parsley before being topped with a generous spread of cheesy goodness, these delicious slices of fluffy bread are the perfect appetisers before your pizza feast. For celebratory gatherings, order the Combo Plate to sample the huge variety of tasty appetisers that Napolizz Pizza has to offer. From chicken wings to king prawns and potato wedges, this platter has all your favourites on one plate! Those looking for healthier alternatives can opt for lighter meals such as the Rucola Salad or Parma e Melone. Drizzled with olive oil, the latter features thinly sliced Parma Ham and rockmelon. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pizza Napolizz, Pizza Gorgonzola, Pizza Pollo, Combo Plate, Rucola Salad

• ABOUT

    Consistently dishing up delicious Turkish cuisine, Nasrin Restaurant is a great foodie find in the heart of Kampong Glam.If you're into classic Turkish staples, start with a serving of Hummus for a platter of tasty dip made with chickpeas blended with olive oil, fresh garlic, lemon juice, and tahini. Looking for a heartier option? Dig into the American Salata. Drenched in tasty American salad dressing, this light and sour potato salad is an extremely popular choice.The Roasted Lamb Leg is another mouthwatering favourite - this rendition consisting of slow roasted lamb leg that rewards with mouthfuls of tender, juicy meat, along with a side of grilled potatoes. For seafood lovers, the Salmon Steak or Balik Sis are both great options for an affordable one meal dish. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hummus, Roasted Lamb Leg, Adana Kebab, Salmon Steak

html:
• ABOUT

    With its multipurpose function as a bakery, a bistro, and a bar, Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar has comfortably earned a reputation as a triple threat, must-visit establishment. With its warm, friendly atmosphere and a menu that's easy to love, it's the perfect place for families and for those looking to unwind with friends at the bar after work. Sink your teeth into an utterly decadent forkful of Rosemary Lamb with Truffle Potato Mash, and savour the balance of delicate rosemary fragrance and tender, grilled lamb chop. The truffle potato mash is an unforgettable component of the dish as well, and will linger (in all its truffle-scented glory) on your mind for days to come. You also can't miss out on the Chilli Crab Pasta, where large chunks of fresh crab meat are sautéed in the restaurant's irresistible homemade chilli crab sauce and served on top of a bed of spaghetti. If you're looking for a refreshing drink to wash all that down, then a Summer Sangria (which serves four) wouldn't be amiss - it's always summer in Singapore after all. The place also offers up a bevy of classic and other innovative cocktails, spirits, and other drinks to tickle your fancy if you feel so inclined. You're bound to have an enjoyable, relaxing time at Nassim Hill, and that's a promise. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Tucked away in Tanglin Post Office Building, Nassim Hill Bakery is a cosy restaurant that caters to your hunger pangs at any time of the day." -The Weekender

• ABOUT

    Celebrate Singapore’s fine flavours at the National Kitchen by Violet Oon Singapore in the iconic historical City Hall building now home to the National Gallery. Treat yourself to a luxurious meal in our grand hall or breezy bite on our scenic veranda. We promise a dining experience to remember. (Aug 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Don't miss the butter prawn and the rich, balanced and slow cooked fish head curry which she takes to new heights." -SG Now "In addition to serving their famed Peranakan dishes, this true-blue Singaporean restaurant will also whip up a mouth-watering list of Indian, Hainanese, and Eurasian cuisine." -City Nomads "Is there anyone better than renowned food connoisseur Violet Oon to helm the Singapore's national kitchen, if there was actually an official one? We think not - and the family couldn't have chosen a better name for their second restaurant at the Gallery." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kuay Pie Tee, Ngoh Hiang, Beef Rendang, Butter Prawn, Ayam Buah Keluak, Dry Laksa, Tau Hu Goreng, Nasi Goreng Nyonya

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Located within the cosy Sentosa Island, Native Kitchen takes diners on a culinary adventure with an island-inspired menu featuring the best of land and sea, prepared with a tropical twist. Celebrate the lifestyle of Asian and Polynesian islands with Native Kitchen's take on a number of culinary favourites, while embracing the culture of togetherness with communal dining options. Special attention is paid to the use of fresh ingredients and culinary techniques that bring out the best of natural flavours, ensuring that the Native Kitchen experience is always enjoyable, welcoming and memorable. Signatures include Steamed Barramundi, Kalbi Short Rib Loco Moco, Bebek Goreng and the classic Big Kahuna Burger. For those who prefer Asian Island classics, our curated selection of Native Kitchen's Nasi Lemak, Singapura Laksa and Jumbo Satay Skewers are sure to delight the palate. Top the tropical feast with refreshing Native's rejuvenators, smoothies and desserts such as the Ginger Zinger Juice Rejuvenator, Mango Lassi Smoothie, Pineapple Upside Down Cake and Hula Pie. Native Kitchen appeals to guests and diners from all around the world - travellers, families, locals, business executives and leisure-seekers - looking to soak in the easy tropical vibe and savour a truly delectable experience. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jumbo Satay Skewers, Big Kahuna Burger, Misoyaki Butterfish, Bebek Goreng, Kalbi Short Rib Loco Moco, Native Kitchen's Nasi Lemak, Pineapple Upside Down Cake, Hula Pie

  • ABOUT

    Bringing subtle elements of Ginza’s starched collar cocktail culture to Singapore, Nee Yakitori and Bar proudly presents an authentic Japanese dining experience within the Katong neighbourhood. Offering a broad collection of Japanese alcohol and affordable bar bites, wine and dine with friends and colleagues at this yakitori restaurant and bar. It employs the famed charcoal Binchotan cooking technique, rewarding diners with tasty skewers that feature a delicious smoky flavour profile. Whet your appetite with the huge variety of tapas options available. Chef recommendations include the Gyoza Karaage and Chicken Skin Karaage. For a simple yet scrumptious one dish meal, meat lovers can opt for the Ribeye Soba. Served with a generous heap of carrots, purple cabbage and mixed salad, the tender piece of perfectly seared meat is drizzled with honey mustard sauce for extra flavour. Looking for a heartier meal that’s easy on the wallet? Nee Yakitori and Bar has got your back with the wide selection of set lunch options. The Tori Teriyaki Set is a popular crowd favourite that will have you coming back for more. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gyoza Karaage, Quinoa Bowl, Tori Teriyaki Set, Tori Teriyaki Set

  • ABOUT

    Bringing cocktails and pizzas to Duxton Hill, Nemesis is where you’ll enjoy an unforgettable wine and dine experience in the lively Tanjong Pagar neighbourhood. Enjoy refreshing cocktails from the signature “NoLo Aperitivo” section which offers an array of low-ABV cocktails like the Sunset Drip. These drinks are also available in a no-ABV edition for those of us who are practicing a dry month. You’ll also find alternative classics like the Raisin’ Perfection which is a Manhattan-style cocktail. If you’re looking for something a little stronger, the signature martinis won’t disappoint. Nemesis prides itself in being unconventional, and the pizzas are no exception. The 10-inch pies are built on hand-kneaded sourdough crust. For carb lovers, order the Potato Pizza – potato salad and bechamel on a chewy sourdough crust. For something lighter, opt for the Zucchini Pizza featuring yuzu ricotta and zucchini ribbons. The Fried Lasagna is a Cheat Day must – as if lasagna wasn’t already the ultimate comfort food, this one is breaded and fried. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sunset Drip, A Raw Dill, Potato Pizza, Fried Lasagna

html:
• LEADING THE FLOCK

    Neon Pigeon brings energy and life, and that’s what you need to know. It’s a Japanese Izakaya like you’ve never seen before, equal parts Tokyo soul and East Village rebel, mixed with a block party vibe. Escape into the graffiti-clad space welded together by a punched-up menu, an all-new Raw Bar and the long-awaited upgrade for a bar worthy of their larger-than-life attitude. So is it a restaurant? Is it a bar? Forget it, who cares. Let’s just do this and we’ll deal with that later. Eat. Drink. Neon Pigeon.

  • IT’S YOUR TIME, WE’RE HERE TO MAKE IT AWESOME

    “Indeed, one thing clear from my time in Neon Pigeon is the courage behind each plate. Bold, unabashed flavours come through in every dish, and that reflects the vision behind its concept.” - Seth Lui"Swing past the massive door out front and you’ll be transported to the underbelly of Tokyo’s underground; pulsating with a gritty interpretation of urban New York coupled with the same casual conviviality you’d expect from a back-alley izakaya.” - Undercover Asia

  • EAT.

    Tokyo Hummus, Kumamoto Oysters, Charcoal Grilled Asparagus, Sweet Corn Rice, Smoked Baby Back Ribs, Togarashi Monkfish

  • DRINK.

    Ichi-go-Lightly, Boshi Maker, O.F RX-78-2, Hanami Punch (Big Smash), Akebono Saizu (Big Smash), Salted Cucumber Soda (Zero Proof), Nori Lemon Soda (Zero Proof)

  • BOOZY BENTO BRUNCH

    Weekend Brunches at Neon Pigeon are anything but tame. Think swanky tunes, “not your usual brunch” brunch food, and booze – pretty much a party during the day. The 4-course Boozy Bento Brunch features signatures like Birdfeed Benedict, Matcha Chia Seed Pudding, Katsu Sando, Wagyu Steak and Eggs. A two-hour free flow (additional $75) provides an endless supply of cocktails, including shochu-based Bloody Mariko and Shinjuku, a gin, sake, lime, mint, and cucumber mix, house wines, and lager. Price: $49++ | Food only $75++ | 2 hours free flow

  • href

  • ABOUT

    If you’re looking for private dining in Singapore, check out Nest at One Farrer. Situated in One Farrer Hotel, this private dining restaurant features 13 exclusive venues ranging from villas to dining studios that offer views of Singapore. Choose from different packages such as an executive set menu, and various multiple course-lunch and dinner menus. A bespoke menu is also available upon request. Nest at One Farrer’s award-winning culinary team and guest chefs are there to make your dining event a success. The menu is modern European, with influences from France, Europe, and even Singapore. Start with Foie Gras Royale, served with a green apple compote and a brioche. Fusion food lovers will enjoy the Creamy Lobster Laksa Spaghetti, with generous helpings of seafood such as squid and mussels. Sink your teeth into the Black Angus Tenderloin for a heftier meal. Perfumed with truffle, the potato puree on the side is a winner, flanked with asparagus, almonds, crispy garlic, and a beef jus. Desserts are interesting — try the Creme Brulee Lemon Tart, which marries both creme brulee and a tart into one satisfying dessert, coupled with a fresh berry compote. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Foie Gras Royale, Creamy Lobster Laksa Spaghetti, Black Angus Beef Tenderloin, Creme Brûlée Lemon Tart, Ricotta Cheesecake

    Spanning more than 10 years of delivering sought-after vegetarian delights, New Fut Kai Vegetarian serves up superb Charcoal Hotpots and Chef Signature dishes for families and corporate diners alike. Vegans can now rejoice as we provide full-vegan options at request. Make friendships and good conversations over delicious vegetarian food. Our Signature Dishes - Charcoal Hotpots (Mushroom, Fish Head Laska & Soy Miso) A soupy mix of fresh and hearty ingredients slowly simmered over a traditional charcoal flame. Be surprised by flavourful and healthful hot pot ingredients, chock-full of body-restoring vitamins and beauty-enhancing minerals. Fusion Wok Dishes - We combine traditional favourites and contemporary dining ideas to bring fresh new flavour combinations. (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Honey Roast Pork, Curry Nonya Fish, Chef-made Roast Duck, Pumpkin Butter Sauce Mushrooms, Crispy Lotus Root with Honey Red Dates, Sanyao Tofu, Pesto Wantons

  • ABOUT

    With the opening of their second outpost in CHIJMES, fans of New Ubin can now indulge in a truly Singaporean dining experience in the heart of the city, thanks to a menu chock-full of mouth-watering tze char dishes and innovative takes on local and Western staples. Expect signature favourites like USDA Black Angus "Choice" Rib Eye with Heart Attack Fried Rice, Crispy Pork Jowl, and Grilled Lime Leaf Chicken, amidst other new creations, like Milk Fed Veal Chops and Ubin Fried Mee Sua, the latter of which is exclusive to the CHIJMES outlet. With multiple accolades under their belt, including the coveted Michelin Bib Gourmand, as well as their illustrious history of serving up flavourful kampong-style seafood since 1986, it's no wonder that New Ubin continues to churn out stellar dishes with such ease, pleasing flocks of hungry diners while they're at it. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "It also offers unique signature dishes, including sliced US Angus Ribeye steak, kong bak pao and prawns with wasabi mayonnaise. It's always packed with locals and tourists alike, so be sure to make reservations before heading down." -SG Now "The meat is served with caramelised onions and fluffy yet crispy potato wedges, but it does not end there: it also comes with a complimentary portion of fried rice, cooked with beef fat and French butter, and has crispy rice bits. The rice is so popular that diners even ask for it to be served on its own, but Mr Pang is adamant that it comes only with the steak." -The Business Times

  • ABOUT

    Serving authentic Japanese Omakase with creative flair and thoughtful flavour profiles, Nijuuichi offers an intimate dining experience like no other. Helming this concept is Head Chef Marcus, disciple of renowned Chef Yoshio Nogawa. Having served luminaries such as the late Prime Minister Lee Kwan Yew and the Sultan of Johor, you will be sure to enjoy high quality dishes that have been refined and honed to perfection. Nijuuichi serves sushi in the Edomae style with modern influences that elevates each dish presented. Serving either lunch or dinner slots, look out for their Kampachi Carpaccio with Caviar and Uni when dining here. Fresh slices of Kampachi are topped with premium ingredients like caviar and uni for that extra burst of ocean flavour. Perfectly complementing each other to create an umami bomb, this dish is one to remember when dining at Nijuuichi. Other dishes that may catch your attention is their Hirame Sashimi. The thin slices of flounder are delicately prepared and retain its chewy and firm textures. With a sweet and mildly nutty flavour, this dish is unforgettable with every bite. Other dishes to look out for is their Premium Sashimi Bowl. Topped with Ikura and Uni, this premium bowl brings the flavours of the ocean together in a symphony of flavours that melts in your tongue and brings out the natural sweetness of their fragrant rice, making for an addictive bowl you just can’t get enough of. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kampachi Carpaccio with Caviar and Uni, Hirame Sashimi, Premium Sashimi Bowl

html:
• ABOUT

    Welcome to the wonderful world of Japanese beef: meat that’s succulent, sweet, well-marbled, and unbelievably tender. Niku Katsumata prides itself on serving some of the finest beef produced in Japan, plated in the simplest ways to highlight the natural flavours of the meat, and paired with various complementary dishes to create a full, beef-centric meal. At its barest level, the beef here is of such high quality that it’s served up as as sashimi. For cooked beef, one of the specialities here is Tataki Wagyu, a premium A4 Grade Wagyu that’s lightly seared before being placed atop a bowl of rice and given the ‘chasuke’ treatment: a light, savoury bonito stock is poured over the dish, which gently coaxes even more flavour from the beef. You have the option to top this up with premium, umami-rich ingredients like caviar, foie gras, or ikura. You can also have the beef in the form of a magnificent set meal, the A4 Wagyu Beef Set, which features Japanese Pork Prosciutto, a selection of home-made pickles, a premium selection of A4 Wagyu Beef, and a Japanese A4 Beef Curry Rice. The beef here, beautifully marbled, tender, and served very rare, is prepared by chef Tsuyoshi Katsumata in the most unusual of ways: it’s cooked over a crystal plate, a method that apparently evenly distributes the heat and cooks the meat gently, ensuring it remains perfectly juicy. The incredible flavour of the beef at Niku Katsumata has to be tasted to be believed. A word of warning: you may never go back to your supermarket varieties after this! (Apr 2017)

    Housed at the 7th floor of Funan’s rooftop, NOKA by Tippling Club is a modern-Japanese restaurant serving spirited small plates bursting with flavour and omakase with a sexy arsenal of Japanese whisky highballs and artisanal sake. Helmed by award-winning Chef Ryan Clift of Tippling Club, known for its ultra-progressive cuisine and cocktails. Stamping the menu with Tippling Club’s brand of playful gastronomy, NOKA by Tippling Club turns Japanese cuisine on its head into an innovative ingredient-focused dining experience. One that still undertakes a profound love and appreciation for Japanese produce and provenance. (Jun 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Inspired by the rich history of the Silk Road, a vast melting pot of great cultures which helped develop an array of cuisines, The Nomads seeks to expand Singapore’s culinary horizons with the exotic intrigue surrounding a Central Asian dining experience. Promising a multi-sensory culinary journey, their eclectic dishes draw inspiration from China, India, Southern Europe, and Central and Southeast Asia. The custom-built grill is where the magic happens, dishing out specials like The Nomads ‘Plov’, a take on the Central Asian rice dish. Here, their ‘rice’ is replaced with a carnaroli risotto, while the meat is a mouth-watering combination of A4 Wagyu striplion and bone marrow. Every trimming of a great plov has been upgraded: Pickled heirloom carrots, tea quail eggs and branded raisins are found in each mouthful. You can try this dish in both their omakase-style Long Menu and Short Menu, aptly named The Nomad’s Journey and The Nomad’s Introductory respectively. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Nomads ‘Plov’, Beef Tongue, Caviar & Kaya

Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill showcases specially crafted contemporary fusion menu that goes beyond regular dining, challenging boundaries with food concoction and exciting senses, all while maintaining unique traditions. At Noosh Noodle Bar and Grill we bring sophistication and excitement to everyday comfort food, by introducing and immersing different ingredients, specialty cooking techniques and robust culinary skills. html:
• ABOUT

    NOX brings you a unique dining experience in the heart of club street, where you can dine in the dark. Engage your other senses in this unique pitch-black dining concept as you’re served ‘mystery’ food while being guided by visually-impaired hosts. Serving up to 12-course tasting menus, NOX combines booze and food in this experiential concept with flair. With dishes centred around its alcoholic beverages, the highlight here is their wide menu of alcohol and cocktails offered. Signature cocktails include Breakfast for Champions. Combining whiskey, cream, and maple syrup, this delicious drink is filling, sweet and potent - best for someone with high alcohol tolerance. Smooth, velvety whiskey with a light taste, this drink is one to savour for a good burn. For a visually appealing cocktail that creates an almost soft glow, go for their Not A Frozen Margarita cocktail. A frozen alcoholic slushie, this drink is reminiscent of old-school ice kacang with a boozy twist that’s fun and deliciously sweet. Another signature cocktail to try here is their Coco-NOT. Made with green tea, gin, pandan syrup and roasted rice, this unique cocktail is robust with a hint of pandan, creating a unique flavour profile that is sweet and fragrant. Slightly on the drier side, this drink is great with an appetiser like their Seared Ahi Tuna and Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes with Bacon. This pairing is great for diners looking for a mix of flavours and textures. Serving non-alcoholic drink pairings on their menu as well, non-alcohol lovers can go for their set of three mocktails to go with their meal too. Dubbed as mystery cocktails, surprise your tastebuds with flavours that are specially curated to your food menu that will enhance your dining experience with NOX. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Breakfast for Champions, Not A Frozen Margarita, Coco-NOT, Seared Ahi Tuna, Duck Fat Roasted Potatoes with Bacon

name: NOX - Dine In The Dark

Address: 583 Orchard Road#01-41Forum The Shopping MallSingapore (238884)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    A Japanese restaurant serving classic and modern interpretations of traditional Kyoto kaiseki cuisine, Nozomi @ Forum The Shopping Mall aims to curate and execute a menu that provides quality meals to customers at affordable prices. Flown straight from Japan’s Toyosu Market twice a week, the restaurant’s seasonal sashimi is fresh from the ocean. Prepared in true “kaiseki ryori” fashion, the dishes are cooked using a myriad of different cooking methodologies. Available in Salmon and Ikura or Sakura Ebi, the Japanese Claypot Rice features fluffy white rice steamed in dashi stock with a hint of savoury sakura ebi and light soy seasoning blended together for a refined flavour. Pair with a side of Pork Kakuni, where braised pork belly is drizzled with the restaurant’s in-house concocted sauce. Other ala carte options include the Unagi Kabayaki, Oden, Nankotsu Karaage and Mentaiko Cheese Balls. Pocket-friendly bento sets are also available in a range of options. Served with salad and miso soup, Yoshi’s Signatures are also a must-try at this authentic Japanese restaurant. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Japanese Claypot Rice, Pork Kakuni, Bento Set, Nankotsu Karaage

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/nozomi-forum-the-shopping-mall
name: Nozomi @ Forum The Shopping Mall

• ASIA’S & WORLD’S 50 BEST BARS

    Nutmeg & Clove has consistently been named among the World’s & Asia’s Best by the most knowledgeable and traveled members of the bar industry, drinks media, and mixology experts from across Asia and the world. Asia’s 50 Best Bars • 2017 Ranked #30 • 2018 Ranked #33 • 2020 Ranked #32 (Highest Re-Entry) World’s 50 Best Bars • 2016: 51 to 100 – Ranked #72 • 2019: 51 to 100 – Ranked #90

  • PRESS RELEASE

    After not being able to open for almost 300 days due to Covid Restrictions in 2020 and holding of a bar license, Multi Award Winning Cocktail Bar Nutmeg & Clove has moved to a brand new location with a new Modern Singaporean (Mod-Sin) Cocktail & Cocktail Program with a Restaurant and Bar License. The design of the new venue is a totally different look & feel from before. Adapting a modern and brighter ambience, Nutmeg & Clove strives to give consumers a different drinking experience. Nutmeg & Clove’s new home will be in Purvis Street, a historical area in Singapore that used to house the early Chinese settlers back in the late 1800s and 1900s. Nutmeg & Clove will continue to conceptualize a cocktail program with the heavy influence of Singaporean and Asian flavours like they did since they opened in 2014. The new cocktail menu; Mythical Animal Stories is inspired by the 12 Chinese Zodiac which is celebrated especially in the Lunar New Year.With a full kitchen set up, Nutmeg & Clove has collaborated with Celebrity Chef Willin Low, founder of Asia’s 50 Best Restaurant Wild Rocket, Relish, Roketto Izakaya & Roketto Niseko with him coming on board as Culinary Consultant. Expect Mod-Sin dishes like Curry Chicken Kueh Pie Tee & Braised Pork Belly Chee Cheong Fun which will be a perfect complement to the cocktails. (Mar 2021)

  • DRINKS WE LOVE

    You’re One in a Melon, Oh My Jasmine!, Call Me Old Fashion, Lion in a Sling, The King and Queen, The Galangal Beer, Bay Side

  • PROMOTIONS

    SOCIAL HOUR Besides getting to enjoy selected cocktails during SOCIAL HOUR, guests will also be served complimentary Crispy Chicken Sandos (unlimited servings) till 6:30pm.Our famous Crispy Chicken Sandos which took more than a month to perfect is a fillet of juicy marinated chicken thigh deep fried to perfection with a secret batter recipe sandwich between traditional Hainanese toasted buns with Achar and Sambal Mayonnaise.Wash it down with a glass of Bubbles or with a Smokey Old Fashioned which is a marriage of Monkey Shoulder Blended Malt Whisky, Islay Whisky, Okinawa Sugar, and Bitters. When: Mon-Sun Time: 4pm-7pm Click here to view the menu Tingkats & Tipples Weekend Brunch Served every weekend, the brunch sets are served in a combination of traditional Tingkats and Banana Leaf trays comprising of Modern Singaporean / Asian dishes. Named after our team members, there are 2 different sets Shelley’s Tingkat & Pan’s Tingkat with each brunch set good for 2 pax.Alongside brunch, Nutmeg & Clove has also launched a Tripples Buffet where you can enjoy unlimited servings of Selected Cocktails, Wines, Bubbles, Spirits, Beers & Non-Alcoholic Beverages. When: Sat-Sun Time: 12-4:30pm (Last Order: 3pm) Price: • $68 Shelley's Tingkat • $98 Pan's Tingkat • $58 Tripples Buffet. Includes selected cocktails, wines, bubbles, spirits, beer & non-alcoholic beverages for 100mins Click here to view the menu

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Conceptualised with the belief of representing elements of fire on every plate, NY Verden takes a modern spin to the classical means of cooking with wood-fire. The restaurant respects the cuisine inherited from early modern Europe combined with innovations persisting in the modern era. At the heart of this modern grill restaurant is an open-concept kitchen featuring two gastronomic Josper grill. Coupled with elements of smoking, grilling and house-cured charcuterie, we seek to showcase the beauty and functionality of our dishes featuring seafood, meat and vegetables over hearth. Culinary curiosity inspires us to achieve balance between the hearty piquancy through precise techniques of wood-fire cooking and the pairing of intrinsic natural flavours from an ensemble of simple ingredients. We are committed to craft every dish with fresh air-flown ingredients from unique origins, with our menu changing in tandem with the season’s best produce. The bar features an ever-evolving wine list that celebrates diverse winemaking styles, unique vinification methods and terrior. Our wines are especially curated to marry the pairings of our food for a perfectly executed, harmonious adventure that excites your palates. Whether you are looking to unwind with a tipple or embark on a culinary thrill, every plate and every bottle encompasses familiar yet innovative provenance, kissed by smoke and amplified by fire. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Iberico Pork Jowl, Wagyu Tomahawk, Tuscan Cabbage, Gambas

html:
• RESTAURANT NOTICE

    As part of Grand Hyatt Singapore’s upgrading efforts, the Oasis Restaurant is currently closed for renovation until further notice.

  • ABOUT

    Nestled in the Grand Hyatt Singapore, amongst the lush greenery of the terrace wing on the 5th floor, Oasis is an alfresco poolside dining restaurant presenting an a la carte selection of impeccably hearty options and refreshing sundowners. Living up to its name, it offers a relaxed atmosphere and a true escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The sumptuous BBQ buffet dinner at Oasis is a grand event in itself. On Friday and Saturday, you can savour the dining experience of selecting food from a full bed of tantalizing BBQ. From Sunday to Thursday, you can sit back, relax and enjoy a tantalising BBQ platter made up of your picks, which are plated and served directly from grill to table. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Living up to its name, the open-air restaurant Oasis, located just next to the swimming pool, boasts a warm and relaxed atmosphere. And it was certainly warm when we popped by for lunch one sunny afternoon. The waiters, all garbed in bermudas and Hawaiian-influenced shirts, were fast, friendly and eager to please." -SG Now "All-you-can-eat barbecue with free-flowing booze? Get. Us. There. And by "there", we mean Oasis restaurant at Grand Hyatt Singapore, which is getting us all riled up for their new buffet dinner featuring a scrumptious selection of juicy, grilled meats. The poolside setting and being surrounded by lush greenery sure don't hurt, either." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Grass-Fed Flat Iron Steak, Slow Roasted Beef Short Rib, Crispy Fish & Chips, Char-Grilled Portobello Mushroom Chicken Burger, Mango Melba

  • BUFFET PRICING

    BBQ PlatterWhen: Sun-Thu Time: 5:30-8:30pmFrom Sunday to Thursday, Oasis will serve the BBQ platter, with all food served to diners' tables. All items can also be replenished at no additional charge.BBQ Buffet DinnerWhen: Mon-Sun Time: 5:30-8:30pmPrice: • $98++ per adult (Alcohol) • $68++ per adult (Non-Alcohol) • $38++ per child (aged 4 to 12)

  • PRIVATE POOLSIDE DINING

    Throw the ultimate poolside party for $88++ per person and leave all the grilling and roasting to a private chef from Oasis. Take a dip in the hotel's pool and dig into BBQ favourites such as the Australian grass-fed Sirloin Steak and Norwegian Atlantic Salmon, and free-flowing drinks with loved ones in a private gazebo. Applicable to groups starting from 10 guests and for a duration of three hours. Diners will have to contact the restaurant directly if they wish to book a private poolside party.

html:
• ABOUT

    "Oberstrasse" is a common street name in German-speaking towns, and is also the street in Switzerland on which the cafe's owner met his first and only girlfriend. It's no surprise that he aims to recreate that nostalgic feeling through this quaint, warmly-lit cafe. But it isn't all just sentiment though — the food served here packs a punch too. A good selection of Western appetisers, mains, and pastas are available, with a section of the menu dedicated to Rosti. We recommend the hearty Crispy Duck Confit with Lingonberry Sauce on days you're feeling ravenous, or the Crabmeat Arrabiatta for when you need a bowl of comfort food. The Farmer's Rosti, that comes with a veal bratwurst and sunny-side up, is also not to be missed. With brunch as Oberstrasse’s speciality, you’ll be pleased to know that you can enjoy these staples at dinner, too. The Instagram-worthy Brioche French Toast tastes as good as it looks, with homemade jam, Mascarpone cheese and maple granola atop buttery slices of toast. For something more substantial, go for the German Breakfast that comes with a pretzel, eggs, ham, sausages, and more. Pair your food with some equally good coffee, brewed from beans roasted locally by OBX Coffee Roasters. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oberworks, Crabcake Benedicts, Original Rosti, Oven Baked Cajun Chicken Thigh

Aquarium, but that’s not the only thing that sets them apart from the rest. This elegant spot serves up modern seafood using locally-sourced and sustainable produce, and aims to promote marine conservation with their menu of healthy dishes. Designed perfectly to ensure all diners get a front-row seat to watch the marine animals in their habitat, a dining experience here is like no other. (Feb 2020)

    Hop on over to the Offshore Bar & Grill to embark on a friendly kelong dining experience surrounded by great company, good barbeque and kickass drinks. Tucked away at Tanah Merah Ferry Terminal, this unpretentious bar and grill place provides a safe haven for you to lift your spirits and escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life.Enjoy beautiful seaside views as you munch on smoky barbecue delights that the restaurant’s expansive menu has to offer. Seafood lovers will surely be spoilt for choice with the variety of fresh finds from the sea. A yummy go-to option are the Grilled Prawns. Succulent, tender and juicy, the freshly caught prawns are grilled to perfection over a well-controlled flame for maximum flavour. (Sep 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    A great place to dine with family and friends, Ohana is dedicated to serving authentic Indian staples, alongside meat, vegetarian and western options. Located at Serangoon, be sure to visit Ohana to enjoy a selection of international food options. The Cheese Naan is a simple dish to start your meal with. Freshly kneaded, the naan is soft and chewy, with cheese in the middle that melts in your mouth. Move on to more filling options such as Chicken or Tandoori. For those who prefer a good ol’ burger, fret not as Ohana Restaurant also serves sandwiches and sides, pastas as well as meat and burgers. The Mushroom Swiss Beef is simply delectable. Sandwiched between two brioche buns, the beef patty is topped with mushrooms and caramelised onions, and slapped with slices of cheese. Seafood lovers will also be happy to know that Ohana serves ‘Thai-rrific’ seafood. As the name suggests, the seafood here takes on Thai influences. For example, the Crayfish is prepared with fragrant sambal sauce that gives the meat a sweet and spicy taste. Other Thai delights include the well-loved Thai Green Curry and Tom Yam soup. (Mar 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tandoori, Mushroom Swiss Beef, Thai Green Curry, Tom Yam Soup

  • ABOUT

    Ohayo Mamasan serves healthy Japanese all-day brunch and drinks in a casual atmosphere. With premium liquor and fun cocktails, the restaurant aims to impress its guests. With an emphasis on feasting with all your senses, Ohayo Mamasan's menu is aesthetically pleasing, appetising and full of vibrant colours. Try their chicken kebab served with fries for a delicious appetizer to enjoy while drinking Forbidden Passion Saketini. Served on skewers and standing tall, their kebabs are marinated in a house sauce with a perfect smokey flavor. Other fun dishes to try at Ohayo are their Kyuden Sets, with delightful pieces of sushi elegantly placed on wooden towers. Go for their Temari Ball Kyuden Set and indulge in premium sashimi atop rounded sushi balls that are sure to liven up your dining experience. Or add an element of surprise to your meal with their Ohayo Set, which features akami tuna, salmon belly, hotate and surprise sushi made from their catch of the day. Hearty meals to try from Ohayo is their Hail-the-King Prawn Truffle Onsen Dry Ramen - an explosion of colour and flavour, this dish is fit for a king and is full of umami sweetness from the King prawns. For carbier options, go for their Dreamy Wagyu Truffle Onsen Don that’s deliciously indulgent with tender slabs of Wagyu and a creamy onsen egg to coat the rice and meat. Nutritious and satiating, this dish is a must-try at Ohayo. Finish off your meal with a Is It Cheesecake? Is it Tempura? to end on a sweet note that’s also delightfully playful and colourful. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Temari Ball Kyuden Set, Hail-the-King Prawn Truffle Onsen Dry Ramen, Dreamy Wagyu Truffle Onsen Don, Is It Cheesecake? Is it Tempura?

    Oishii Ristorante is a modern unique Japanese-Italian restaurant that serves up the Italian pizza and pasta with a touch of Japanese ingenuity, alongside Japanese donburi and a good array of classic Japanese dishes. Helmed by a veteran chef of more than 10 years, with experience in Michelin-starred restaurants, and a Certified Sake Sommelier with an impressive 14 years of rich F&B experience, Oishii Ristorante offers a variety of irresistible culinary delights, a full bar with a splendid selection of Japanese sake, whiskey, fine wines, champagne and beer that will marry perfectly with the dishes. Centrally located in the CBD at Frasers Tower (opposite Amoy Street Market), be seated comfortably indoors or if you absolutely love how alfresco seating gives you that carefree romantic feel, you can definitely take your pick. There are also bar seats and some directly facing Oishii Ristorante's open kitchen so you can watch the chefs in action. (Nov 2021)

• ABOUT

    Say Aloha to Ola Beach Club, Singapore’s ONLY all-encompassing Hawaiian themed lifestyle venue! Situated on the sun-kissed stretch of Siloso Beach in Sentosa. Ola is a sprawling 20,000-ft lifestyle destination where you can spend a relaxing day indulging in an array of Hawaiian beach grub, Tiki cocktails concocted by in-house mixologists as well as some fun in the sun with many exciting watersports activities! Get ready to go on a culinary adventure with Ola’s Executive Chef Liinson Heng. Begin your escapade with exotic Kalua Pork Tacos, featuring Kalua Pork cured for 24 hours before being lovingly steamed and baked. The result is tender and succulent pork topped with sautéed white cabbage, fresh relish, and a spicy sour cream, all in a crispy taco shell. Another must try on the menu is Ola’s rendition of the beloved Huli-Huli Chicken ($20), Hawaii’s version of teriyaki chicken – consisting of juicy chicken thigh and breast steeped in a teriyaki marinade and sous vide till flavours fully permeate the meat. The dish is served with grilled leek and seasonal vegetable puree. Don’t miss out on the signature Loco Moco ($25), featuring a delicious Wagyu beef patty cooked to medium-rare goodness and sitting atop steamed Japanese koshihikari white rice, glittered with sesame seeds and finely chopped konbu (kelp) and adorned with a panko crusted egg with a smooth golden yolk. Quench your thirst with one of Ola’s lip-smacking cocktails in hand! Sip on the refreshing Ola Huli Pau ($18), a delicious tipple featuring rum, pavan liqueur, fresh mint and watermelon. Fancy something more bespoke? Speak to the talented bar mixologists for your very own handcrafted cocktail or mocktail, and get a truly unforgettable drinking experience by the beach! For water sports enthusiasts, Ola Beach Club is Singapore's only holistic water sports activity centre to offer the exclusive water-propelled Jet Pack and Jet Blade. For a more leisurely ride, try the stand-up paddleboard or kayaks. Serving up delicious bites, craft cocktails, and a splendid lagoon view, an afternoon at Ola is a tropical paradise fantasy come true. The best part? You don’t even have to have to pack your bags! (Feb, 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Perfect for the tropical heat are Hala Lei, a cool concoction of gin, pineapple juice, chamomile tea, and homemade allspice liqueur, and Melemele Tiki which, spiked with a delectable homemade cinnamon banana purée, is Ng’s take on the classic piña colada. It’s like a breakfast smoothie, but with alcohol.” –SG Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cold Caviar Pasta, Kalua Pork Tacos, Loco Moco, Ahi Poke, Wagyu Plate Lunch

  • ABOUT

    The good folks who pioneered the Cold Brew Coffee wave in Singapore are happy to welcome you to their second nest along Owen Road, just a little distance from their first home. This time it’s nothing new or revolutionary but who could ever complain about finally finding cafe grub that marries both style and substance? Holding the fort with their artisanal beverages, they nonetheless wow the crowd with their tasteful menu that will have you coming back for more. As you sip on a refreshing Cold Brew or the absolutely delightful Cold Matcha Milk, dig into the Portobello Aglio Olio or the perfectly beer-battered Fish & Chips for maximum enjoyment. Raining Outside? The Buttered Corn Chowder will warm both your tummy and your soul instantly. If you’re looking for something with a cleaner palate, the Salmon & Soba ticks all the right boxes. The sous vide salmon and warm soba gets a flavourful kick from the heady combination of peanut, red chilli, and citrus teriyaki, making for a dish that will titillate your taste buds. Think it can’t get any better? We’ve saved the best for last, as dessert heaven comes in the form of Old Hen Kitchen’s Matcha Affogato. Drizzle the little pot of earthy, robust koicha over a scoop of creamy vanilla ice cream and speculoos crumb, then take a little of everything with your spoon for a taste of unadulterated pleasure. Take our word for it, there’s really nothing quite like it. (Jul 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

Using recipes passed down from generation to generation, Old School Delights takes pride in serving authentic local food that stays true to original methods of preparation that were handed down the family. Everything that we serve at our restaurant are classic local recipes that have been in our family for generations so what we eat, is what you eat. (Mar 2019)

    Located along the rejuvenated Keong Saik Road, this restaurant is dedicated to bringing the best of Barcelona’s cuisine to Singaporean plates. Designed by the famed Lázaro Rosa-Violán, Olivia has made a name for itself as the go-to place for Spanish fine dining. Named after the daughter of the chef, every dish here is a labour of love. The menu bursts with deliciously rich dishes that combines premium ingredients with traditional Spanish techniques. Seafood lovers will enjoy the the Envoltini de Bogavante y Aguacate, Olivia’s tribute to the famed avocado-lobster roll from the Catalunya Restaurant. The lobster meat is addictively juicy and slightly sweet, pairing well with the richness of the avocado. The Lomo de Buey Wagyu is a premium dish made with juicy Wagyu striploin beef served with truffle sauce and piquillo peppers. The Jamón Ibéricode Bellota is made with the finest ham in the world - free-range oak forest ham fed with acorn. The meat is cured for 36 months to ensure the best taste, so you can rest assured that the quality of the meat served is unparalleled. (March 2019)

    Serving authentic Indian cuisine to customers since 1996, Omar Shariff Authentic Indian Cuisine aims to bring the best curry to the Bukit Timah neighborhood. The restaurant's well-furnished interiors create a cozy and comfortable dining experience for all customers. A platter of all things nutritious and tasty, the Veg Platter is a special mix of tandoori vegetarian grilled served on a hotplate to share amongst family and friends. For cheese lovers, tandoori menu options that will excite your taste buds include the Tandoori Paneer Tikka and the Tandoori Aloo Bharwa. Omar Shariff Authentic Indian Cuisine offers an interesting array of kebab options. The Chicken Garlic Kebab is a plate full of boneless pieces of chicken marinated in curd with the chef’s secret spices before being grilled to perfection in the clay oven. From rolls to skewers and platters, the restaurant prides itself on providing an expansive selection of grilled meat dishes to cater to varied preferences. (Aug 2021)

  • PRESS RELEASE

    The name plays on the phrase ‘OM NOM NOM’ with a cheeky Japanese twist to it – sake bars need a quirky name after all. Between countless servings from the raw bar served chef-to-counter and dishes right of that smoky binchotan grill, there’s serious dedication in being a spot for guests to get introduced, explore and experience the ever-growing trend of Craft Sake. From ancient styles to modern, sour, fruity, aged experimental brews, their in-house Sake Sommelier and team taste every single sake that comes through the doors, of which their sake list rotates almost weekly.“Our tasting notes are ours. Sakes are tasted by us first, notes are written by us, for you”, they flexed. “When a set of sake is sold out, it gets replaced by something entirely new.”The bar also features a curation of whiskies, expanding on traditional highball culture. From a more basic Hi-Nikka, a sweeter smoky variant of your typical Suntory Kakubin, to an unimaginable Bruichladdich Port Charlotte Heavy Peated Highball, to a bougie (yet true-to-taste) Blue Label Highball, this place has it. In fact, ask the booze-head behind the bar for an Iceless Highball to experience the peak of highball drinking.Seafood flies in four times weekly, with some fish reserved for careful aging to enhance their flavours. Apart from serious sushi and sashimi, there’s the Overloaded Maki, a playful interpretation of loaded fries but with decadent fancies of chopped tuna belly and uni. The Carabinero Prawn Sushi is an upgrade from the traditional Botan Ebi sushi, with a sweet tail pressed into hand-beaten red vinegar rice and that prized Carabinero head packing an extra-luxe tomalley. Their handrolls too, are fun tasting yet simple, fuss free and really worth it.When you’ve had your fill of the Raw Bar, the grill offers wood, fire and passion. Choosing Japanese Binchotan for that important smoky-crisp flavour, a large portion of the menu relies on the potential of the grill, be it yakitori, or steak, or fish. The traditional Buta Kakuni is developed with over-the-coal charred Japanese leeks, burnt onions and roasted garlic for depth of flavour to the pork belly braising sauce. Their Foie Gras, brushed with a house-blend kushiyaki sauce is binchotan grilled rather than pan-seared, giving smoky depth and flavour to an otherwise familiar item. Even their Flamed Edamame gets bougie with the coals and is finished with a rich lemon butter. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    OMU NOMU's Signature Gyudon, Tuna Tartare, Tamagawa Steak, Ootoro, Highball, OMU NOMU's "Sake" Tea
