• ABOUT

    You wouldn’t usually expect a green oasis at the heart of the city, but Open Farm Community, nestled in the verdant surroundings of Dempsey Hill, will change that perception. A revolutionary collaboration between the Spa Espirit Group, Head Chef Oliver Truesdale Jutras, Souschef Phoebe Oviedo and award-winning food garden specialists, Edible Garden City, Open Farm Community is an urban farmland, horticultural hub, and restaurant all packed into one. At the heart of it all is one simple philosophy: to provide Singaporeans with a space to reconnect with nature whilst educating the young and old about local farming and the food we eat. The sprawling outdoor space features a garden brimming with herbs and vegetable produce, as well as educational breakout spaces alongside lawn bowling lanes and table tennis tables. True to their goal of educating city dwellers about the food we eat, tours of the vegetable and fruit orchards, talks, and gardening workshops are available too. The centrepiece is the gorgeous restaurant, a building with floor-to-ceiling glass windows and a high ceiling, the perfect place to unwind and tuck into some simple and honest fare. The kitchen here adopts a strict no-no policy towards processed ingredients, imported produced, and unsustainable farming practices. This means that ingredients used here are mostly locally-sourced and always fresh - even the pasta is made fresh in-house! The menu is also one striking example of Open Farm Community’s dedication to serving honest food, with lengthy names laying out the different ingredients used in each dish. The flavours here are simple yet robust, focused around local farms and heritage, as epitomized by the Laksa Pappardelle, featuring soft shell prawn tempura, a spicy coconut based sauce and fresh laksa leaves from the garden; or the light and fresh watermelon salad, replete with lime and mint to balance the housemade ricotta from local Hay Dairies goat milk. A highlight was the Barramundi, straight from the waters off Pulau Ubin, combined with a sumptuous seaweed butter and organic dou miao, with puffed black rice crumbled over for a textural contrast. Now, whether you’re looking for romantic date spot, or a place where the kids can have some fun, Open Farm Community definitely provides an unforgettable experience for all. (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Local flavours reinterpreted for global palates." - Weekender Singapore "What makes this project special, however, is what lies outside the building. There are rows of vegetable beds planted with herbs, vegetables and fruit such as tarragon, mint, basil, ladies' fingers, papaya and guava." -SoShiok "OFC is a breath of rustic air to the plush dining neighbourhood. It’s working hard to open minds with its lovely brunch rays, hearty and thoughtful cuisine, and a mission to push our local dining scene to the next level." -TimeOut Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cauliflower "Wings", Thai Asparagus Salad, Bolognese, Prawn Pappardelle, Warm Broccoli & Toasted Pili Nut Salad, Steamed Tiberias Barramundi, Spiced Braised Beef Cheek, Lime in the Coconut

  • EARTH DAY DINNER (22 APR)

    Join us for a mindful feasting this Earth Day as we present Kampong Global — a special dinner featuring 5 conscious courses, starring produces from our own farm! Be surrounded with calming dimmed lights at the dinner table where your surroundings are ignited by a soy-wax handcrafted candle (with bespoke scent by Candles of Light for Open Farm Community). As a reminder that this planet’s future is all in our hands, you’ll find several items best eaten with your own bare hands! The dinner also includes 1 mangrove tree from our Open Farm Forest planted in your name.When: 22 April 2022 , FridayTime: 6:30pm, 7:30pmPrice: $115.35Choice of menu:  Herbivore or OmnivoreCancellation Policy: We have a strict no refund policy for cancellations 48 hours prior to event date, and no-shows. Refunds will be made for any cancellations 48 hours before event.

    There are two things that matter when you are considering the humble steak - the meat and the grill. While seasonings and sauces have their place, these two essentials go the longest way in ensuring a perfectly juicy, endlessly flavourful cut from pasture to plate. This is the philosophy of Opus Grill, the stunning mahogany clad steakhouse at voco Orchard Singapore. Featuring an impressive dining room with handsome furnishings, it has the feel of a solid modern grill experience long before you get a peek at the well-curated menu of grill basics. The meat starts with 18 to 36 days of dry aging in a one-of-a-kind Himalayan salt tiled cabinet. The in-house curation makes a tasteful difference in the flavour and juiciness of the steak, and while there are a handful of choice cuts available, the dry-aged Rangers Valley Angus OP Rib with a Marble Score of 4 is a fast favourite. This sizeable beauty, meant for two diners, is carefully grilled upon an open-flame charcoal grill for an ideal flame-licked crust. Plus, you can choose from a selection of sauces and delectable side orders to go with the it.For less carnivorous diners, Opus is the first restaurant in the city to gain the MSC ecolabel for sustainable seafood, so you know the seafood come from the best possible place. Finish off with a charcoal grilled banana smoked with salted caramel and served with refreshing coconut and calamansi ice-cream - just the right kiss of sweetness to end your decadent evening. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "But we are really here for the steaks. Our perfectly seared 150-day grain-fed Australian Angus tenderloin didn't need much else but salt, which comes in a trio of flavours: rosemary, black lava and paprika. Sidekicks like the Mac & Cheese and mashed potatoes allow the main attractions to shine. However, a few, like the smoked risotto threaten to steal the show: al dente rice and crunchy bites of charred leek, laced with pecorino cheese and charcoal oil, make it far less cloying than it sounds." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Watermelon & Feta Salad, Lamb Skewer, Whiskey-Aged Wagyu Tomahawk, Wagyu & Lobster, Grilled Butterflied Spring Chicken, Opus Over-the-Top Fries

  • ABOUT

    Tucked in Rochester Mall is Orange & Teal, a cosy cafe that aims to bring people together through the shared love of food, books and music. “Where the conversation’s even better” is the cafe’s motto, and it has definitely stuck through with its words. Furnished with tasteful rustic wood furniture, enjoy an easy casual lunch with your favourite company. Looking for a nice afternoon snack to recharge? Orange & Teal’s savoury Beef Pie is a hot comfort dish that brings warmth to your soul. With a dense crust, it’s a delicious tea time delight or a great way to start your day. Grab a Sirloin Panini if you’re not a pastry fan to treat yourself right. With just the right portion of juicy, flavourful beef topped with gooey cheese on panini bread, this sandwich makes for a great meal paired with a delicious beverage of choice and a friendly conversation. For heavier meals, their most popular mains include their Poulet Roti, a perfectly seasoned juicy roast chicken leg. The Creamy Butter Tuscan Salmon is another winning option, with pasta that’s deliciously buttery. A cut above your regular Salmon dishes, Orange & Teal’s version feels more homemade with an almost personal touch. Polish off your meal with their Ondeh Ondeh Cake, where toasty coconut flakes pair with a deliciously sweet Gula Melaka sponge cake. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Texas Oven-Baked Beef Brisket, Creamy Butter Tuscan Salmon, Poulet Roti, Truffle Linguine, Tuna Panini Sandwich, Sirloin Cheesesteak Panini Sandwich, Four Cheeses Pizza

    Be spoilt for choice at Orchard Hotel Singapore’s iconic restaurant, The Orchard Cafe, with the wide array of fresh seafood, Asian, Japanese and hearty Western fare. Showcasing local dishes as well as international favourites, take a trip around the world with the restaurant’s enticing Signature class buffet. Drop by during dinner to indulge in The Orchard Cafe’s a la carte plated buffet dinner. Served with balsamic dressing and drizzled with extra virgin olive oil, this bowl of seasonal winter salad leaves is fresh from the farm and makes for a delicious starter. Meat lovers can choose to add House Cured Salmon, Gourmet Ham or Sous Vide Chicken Breast to the Imperfect Vegetable Salad for extra flavour. Dive into the Ocean of Seafood Platter to indulge in the assortment of chilled prawns, mussels, scallop, snow crab leg and more. For sushi lovers, the Assorted Japanese Appetiser Platter contains a host of classic favourites that will definitely satisfy all your cravings. Indian, Asian and Western delights are also readily available on the menu — there’s something for everyone here at The Orchard Cafe! (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Assorted Cold Cut Platter, Blue Ocean of Mix Seafood on Ice, Mixed Grilled Platter, Slow Roasted Australian Prime Ribs of Beef with Condiments, Hazelnut Chocolate Log Cake

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Origin Grill is inspired by the origin of flavours, travel adventures and Singapore's illustrious history of bountiful trade, colonial charm and tropical splendour. The restaurant showcases fresh, authentic flavours from curated, unique and quality-driven ingredients, while advocating responsible and sustainable sourcing. Begin the gastronomical journey with appetisers such as Spicy Beef Tartare and Hokkaido Scallops & Jerusalem Artichoke. Cruising along with a harvest of seafood is the gluten-free Smoked Canadian Cod Chowder served with crustaceans and vibrant vegetables. A worthy nod to the restaurant's notable bespoke beef repertoire is the distinctive Olive Craft Wagyu from Hata Farm in Kagawa, Japan. The olive-diet of the cattle results in beef with exceptionally high levels of oleic acid that brings a rich and buttery mouthfeel. (Mar 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Origin Grill offers selected exclusive wagyu options: the 500-day Japanese diet-fed Shiro Wagyu, Marble 9; and snow-aged full blood wagyu beef A4 from Niigata, Japan. For the latter wagyu, its ageing process requires a consistent internal temperature between zero and five deg C - in a state called seichi - which causes the meat to keep more than 90 per cent humidity, thus retaining its freshness." -The Straits Times "The restaurant takes diners on a journey through heritage - a concept taken quite literally with its train terminal-inspired interiors with industrial fittings, wood banquettes and arching pillars. Ingredients are sourced from around Southeast Asia, such as tuna from the Philippines served sashimi style in a salad and pate made from the liver of local free-range chicken fed on a diet of corn, garlic and sesame." -The Peak

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Beef Tartare, Seasoned Jackfruit Roll, Smoked Canadian Cod Chowder, Origin Octopus, Prawn Risotto, Olive Craft Wagyu A4 Hata Farm, Bergamot Avocado Parfait

  • EXECUTIVE SET LUNCH FROM $38++

    Make lunchtime the highlight of your day with an Executive Set Lunch at Origin Grill. The clarified milk punches such as Tequila-based Grass, Whiskey-based Minerals, Rum-based Nuts or Cognac-based Tannins are paired to complement each course of the meal and will add a pop of colour to your afternoon.     Located in Holland Village, this charming restaurant will tantalise your tastebuds with its eclectic selection of Mediterranean, Greek, Italian, and Middle Eastern dishes that are all cooked to perfection. At Original Sin, you can choose to sit indoors, where glass murals and delicate ornaments help to establish a romantic and cozy setting, or outdoors, at beautiful mosaic tables that add to the rustic Mediterranean feel of the restaurant. Original Sin has been around since 1997, and since then owner-chef Marisa Bertocchi has hand-crafted a flawless menu. Each item is carefully fashioned with the best of ingredients and when combined with Marisa's midas touch, culminates in a rich dining experience. It is no wonder that the restaurant has a dedicated clientele that keep coming back for more. (Dec 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "This cozy place is a perennial favorite with Singapore's expatriate population. Located in Holland Village, Singapore's expat enclave, this particular restaurant is a favorite, with generous portions of baba ghanouj, tzatziki, and hummus served with olives, feta, and pita bread." -New York Times "The starter of pan-fried haloumi salad with roasted capsicum and lentils ($18) provided just the right balance of fresh, savory and sweet, and hearty standards such as the creamy porcini pasta ($26), chock full of mushrooms, really got our appetite going." -SG Now

Milk, and its global fare of hearty and comforting dishes that suit everyone’s lifestyle. Expect all-day breakfast classics, and hearty fares in particular Oriole Truffle Burger and Capellini Crabmeat; keto-friendly dishes like Ribeye Steak & Baked Eggs and Herb Roasted Barramundi; also meat-free alternatives such as ImpossibleTM Quarter Pounder and Crème Brulee Coconut French Toast. • ABOUT

    One of the stalwarts in the hotel buffet scene in Singapore, Oscar's has long been known for the quality of their food. Serving both international and local cuisine in a cheery, casual dining room, one is spoilt for choice amidst the variety of gastronomic delights on offer. The salad bar holds its own in the centre of the room. You know it's serious stuff when the Caesar salad is tossed in a huge block of parmesan, ensuring that you get fresh chunks of nutty goodness. And if that's not enough, there's also a staggering selection of ingredients you can add to your salad, along with an assortment of seafood, soup and other cold starters. The main courses are prepared fresh in small quantities each time (to ensure quality), right behind the counter in the library kitchen, where curious diners can observe all the action going on behind the scenes. The themes and menus change daily, so loyal patrons will always be kept on their toes. In fact, don't miss the noodle station that's located on the terrace. With a menu of local noodle dishes such as laksa and more, cooked-to-order, what's there not to love? During the weekends, Oscar's buffet ramps it up a notch with free-flow champagne, house wine, and beer to go along with their extensive selection of freshly shucked oysters, seafood on ice, and live carving stations. (Jul 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "An inviting atmosphere for any occasion, the well-groomed yet informal ambience at Oscar's restaurant strikes a fine balance." -Time Out Singapore

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

• ABOUT

    Meat connoisseurs will love the prime offerings at Osia Steak and Seafood Grill. Opened by Australian celebrity chef Scott Webster, Osia focuses on bringing in only a rare selection of meats sourced from boutique farms in the Down Under. Take the Bangalow Sweet Pork, which is generously marbled and incredibly tender when seared expertly on a hot pan. Be sure to also try the Mayura Station Full Blood Wagyu Beef Striploin. The rich, buttery beef boasts a melt-in-your-mouth texture, served with a simple house-made apple barbecue sauce to accentuate the flavours of the meat. Seafood lovers will find themselves reeled in to try the Glacier 51 Toothfish. Known as ‘the world’s deadliest catch’, this rare fish has a smooth, silky texture and is rich in Omega-3. Savour it simply with braised daikon (radish) and sweet potato puree. For desserts, Osia injects a playful touch to well-loved flavours of chocolate and hazelnut. The Hazelnut Souffle is served with a curry biscuit and freeze-dried yogurt, while a luscious Hot Chocolate Soup is laced with a hint of spice from the addition of black pepper ice cream. Pair your dinner with a selection of boutique Australian wines. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mayura Station Full Blood Wagyu Beef Striploin, Wagyu Beef Tenderloin & Oyster Beignet, Glacier 51 Toothfish, Hazelnut Souffle, Hot Chocolate Soup

• PRESS RELEASE

    For more than 25 years, Alain Ducasse has worked to express the myriad of flavours from Continental Europe, especially Italy, by combining the regional traditions of this land with gastronomic expertise that convey a tangible sense of terroir while supporting indigenous artisans. The seasonal produce, climate and warmth of the Italian people embody the imaginative 'art de vivre' so dear to Alain Ducasse. Through exploring the lively markets and partaking in local conversations, Alain Ducasse has experienced the quintessence of aromas, tastes and the beauty of the Italian culture encompassed in his recipes and his ways of doing things.Through OSTERIA BBR by Alain Ducasse, this sense of quintessential Italy is presented in an ambience that is fun and relaxed, using an authentic culinary approach, prepared with locally and regionally sourced produce and heightened with unsurpassed native ingredients of Italy. Offering a myriad of different dining and bar experiences every day, this concept reflects Alain Ducasse's experiences and stories. It is modern, energetic, vibrant and accessible - a gathering place to meet, exchange and discover.OSTERIA BBR by Alain Ducasse is Singapore's latest social space, thrilling the senses of local residents to celebrate and enjoy at while offering an inspirational spot for global travellers when they return to the city. (Jun 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    We're a little reluctant to share this well-kept secret, but hidden behind an unassuming door at the Marriott Hotel is one of the sexiest cocktail bars in the Orchard belt.The Other Room, helmed by zany bartender and cocktail wizard Dario Knox, serves up some pretty mean prohibition-inspired craft cocktails. We especially love Dario's twists on classics like the smoke-infused Old Cuban, made with rum and citrus, or the bizarre Reverse Gin and Tonic, a mix of gin and tonic syrup that's carbonated at freezing temperatures at the table, ensuring a crisp, if a little science-fiction like, drink. On top of this, ask for any classic you can name, which Dario and his team will fix for you with pleasure.The main appeal for us, though, is Dario's pet project: he takes bottled spirits and finishes them in specially-treated casks to infuse them with new flavour dimensions. Your favourite whisky or rum can be turned into a completely different drink given some extra time in a sherry cask, or a gin you thought you knew and loved is given a new depth of flavour through infusions with all manner of fruit peel, herbs, and spices. It's a real mad scientist's lab here, and one that's guaranteed to change the way you enjoy your favourite spirits. If you ask Dario for recommendations, he can turn one of these finished spirits into a cocktail for you.If you like your drinks with a little bit of mystery, some magic, and lots of flair, seek out The Other Room, if you can find it! (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "If you have the chance to chat with the loquacious Dario while you drink, do it. He can give you the history and inspiration behind each cocktail and infused-spirit creation, and every other detail you'd want to know." -Expat Living "Even if you're just there for one tipple, The Other Room’s exhaustive cocktail list covers all the standards. But trust us and carve out a few hours for the full experience." -Time Out Singapore

  • ASIA'S 50 BEST BARS 2018

    The Other Room has been named #50 in Asia's 50 Best Bars 2018, voted by the most knowledgeable and travelled members of the bar industry, drinks media and mixology experts from across Asia.

  • DRINKS WE LOVE

    Old Cuban, The Fidel Castro, The Reversed Gin & Tonic, Aged Spirits

    A resplendent dining spot, OTTO Ristorante is the brainchild of four men who have decades of experience in marketing and the luxury sector. As it happens, their background in creating a rich, luxurious experience is readily apparent through the restaurant’s sophisticated decor, with its polished chrome and oak-hue decor designed by the uber-talented Jasper Chia of Fuur Associates. Located at Maxwell Chambers Building in the Central Business District, OTTO Ristorante shines with its well-executed takes on rustic Italian dishes. For lunch, the establishment’s lunch menu shines with dishes that are well-worth their price. Standout dishes include the Tagliata di Merluzzo in Crosta di Olive Taggiasche e Salsa all’ Aglio Dolce, where a piece of Atlantic cod is enhanced with black taggia olives and drizzled with a sweet garlic sauce. Don’t miss out on the Tortino di Astice e Porri con Salsa agli Scampi e Polvere di Pancetta, featuring leeks and Boston lobster in a tart and paired with a savoury scampi sauce and topped with crispy bacon. The perfect venue to impress business clients or for a romantic celebration, OTTO Ristorante stands above the fray for its authentic yet refined Italian dishes. (Feb 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Authentic and recognisable dishes from across Italy draw plenty of customers to this well-regarded, well-established and comfortable Italian restaurant that’s proven a good fit with the CBD” –MICHELIN Guide Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tagliata di Merluzzo in Crosta di Olive Taggiasche e Salsa all’ Aglio Dolce, Tortino di Astice e Porri con Salsa agli Scampi e Polvere di Pancetta, Zuppa del Giorno, Spaghetti ai Ricci di Mare e Bottarga di Cabras, Scampi alla Piastra con Asparagi Verdi e Olio Extra Vergine “Cavallino”

    Bringing authentic Japanese ‘Kappo’ cuisine with scenic views of the bay, Oumi is the go-to dining restaurant to impress your guests. Experience a lively atmosphere as you enjoy delicious courses cooked before your very eyes and served with flair by talented chefs here at Oumi. True to the Kappo style of making use of the freshest ingredients, each dish is prepared with care and with cooking methods that truly bring out the full potential of each ingredient. Enjoy delicately prepared premium seafood all with different flavour profiles that will bring an unforgettable taste. Dishes to look out for here include their Foie Gras Monaka that is light and crispy, yet includes melt-in-your-mouth foie gras that adds a whole new dimension to a classic pastry. For another light dish that brings out the best of the ocean’s catches, go for their Kabocha Uni Tofu. Generous chunks of uni are laid atop chilled tofu and dressed in an umami sauce that truly brings out the unique taste of the uni. The tofu is light and slightly nutty, creating a mix of flavours and textures that add dimension to this dish. To top off your meal, go for their Kyoho Sorbet, an intricate dessert that’s almost too pretty to eat - sorbet is topped with shards of caramel and sat atop a bed of cake crumble, a bowl of sweet perfection to end your experience here at Oumi. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Foie Gras Monaka, Kabocha Uni Tofu, Kyoho Sorbet

    Devour a thick and juicy burger and wash it down with an ice-cold root beer float at this hip American diner on the waterfront. From midday until it's nearly dawn, OverEasy satisfies diners with a menu brimming with American favourites, like burgers, wings, and milkshakes. And while the food is hearty, the drinks menu makes OverEasy a boisterous late-night spot, where guests can indulge in drinks like a spiked milkshake (strawberry, coffee, or cookies & cream with an infusion of alcohol) or a Hote Date w. Yours Truly (a mix of fig & date infused bourbon, lemon and egg white).Whether it's 2pm or 2am, OverEasy is an ideal spot for a casual gathering of friends. With a stunning waterfront view, the restaurant's front wall is completely open to the patio, where a generous number of bar-height tables and stools allow guests to dine in an unusually spacious bar-like setting. Inside OverEasy, the diner-themed décor feels understated beneath the dim lighting of a modern bar, creating a cool and easygoing vibe that keeps a steady stream of hungry partygoers returning to OverEasy for a final bite before the sunrise. (Sep 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "From the crew that brought us The White Rabbit and Loof, OverEasy serves up the most delish cocktails and burgers this side of Marina Bay." -SG Magazine"Pop in for the outdoor seating, evening views of the bay and a reasonably fresh sea breeze." -Time Out Singapore"Sitting on the boardwalk overlooking the river, listening to good music being played at a volume that doesn't make your ears bleed. There is a real buzz about this place and the bar snacks are bloomin' delicious." -Expat Living

html:
• ABOUT

    The first thing that hits you when you walk through the doors of Pagi Sore is the fragrant waft of coconut, garlic and spices. That and the delighted sounds of your fellow diners feasting on large plates of traditional Indonesian fare. It almost feels like you have left the hustle and bustle of the CBD and entered into a lively Indonesian village, with boisterous laughter filling the large oaken dining room, peppered with various traditional Indonesian curios. The simple, family-style seating adds to the feel of the place. Pagi Sore is your lunch or dinnertime escape from the urban jungle. At the Far East Square outlet, subtle touches such as the display of Angklungs (a traditional Indonesian musical instrument) at the cashier counter, and little hand-carved wooden animals perched atop shelves add to the traditional feel of the place. Continuing in the vein of celebrating Indonesian culture, a rich tapestry woven with gold threads is also displayed at the front counter. With its humble beginnings as a Nasi Padang stall, Pagi Sore has come a long way, but one thing still remains the same in all its 24 years - their sensational recipes that have drawn crowds for generations. Although Indonesian fare has a reputation of being too hot for most to handle, the tastes here have been slightly adjusted for the local palate, with a special focus on each of the five major flavours. In fact, as we journeyed through the menu, we appreciated the progression of sweet, savoury, sour, spicy and umami. The bustling atmosphere when we visited is a testament to Pagi Sore's popularity, so be sure to make a reservation to guarantee yourself a seat. Otherwise, be ready to torturously watch as hungry patrons lap up plates of Indonesian goodness as you wait in line. (Oct 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Pagi Sore has maintained its traditional Indonesian taste while incorporating Chinese cooking styles into the preparation process, and caters to both new and returning customers." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Indonesian Keropok, Teruing Tau Chio, Beef Rendang, Kangkong Belachan, Ayam Bali, Ikan Otah Kukus, Tahu Telor

    Al Fresco, Business Meetings, City Views, Quiet Dinner

  • ABOUT

    As Singapore seafood outlets go, Palm Beach Seafood is not a restaurant, it's an institution. Established in 1956, and widely credited in the contested race of who was creator of the Singapore Chili Crab, Palm Beach has perfected its recipes and service over its long tenure. Whether you frequented the East Coast outlet back in the day with family, now visit for entertaining clients with local flair, or bring your out-of-town friends to One Fullerton for a meal and view to impress, it seems like we all know and love Palm Beach. To those skeptics who hail a heartland hawker as more quintessentially Singaporean, we hear you. But once to have enjoyed succulent Black Pepper Crab and fresh squeezed fruit blends under crystal candelabras and the watchful eye of the Merlion, with a cooled interior to beat the heat, and a shiny, modern décor, we bet you will be a convert. Situated at the coveted spot where the Singapore River meets Marina Bay, views are second-to-none. While news of Palm Beach's greatness has drawn crowds from all over, our secret to avoid tourists is to be seated indoors. Expansive windows allow views to be just as idyllic, and we find that the temperature is more conducive to digging in to their various delicacies. And what delicacies there are! Sparing no expense in sourcing the freshest of seafood, vegetables and ingredients for house-made sauces, it is a pleasant surprise to see that price tags for dishes have seemingly not changed that much from 1956! Recipes have been fine-tuned since then, but classics like Sri Lankan crab prepared 11 different ways, and Honey Tangy Fish remain largely the same and will always be held close to our hearts, and stomachs. (Sep 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "It is now in an equally, if not more, tourist-friendly spot at the mouth of the Singapore River and serves 11 varieties of crab. The brightly polished interiors of this glass-surrounded restaurant may not be as spirited as its predecessor, but there's no getting around eating with your fingers. If that still doesn't feel Singaporean enough, round off the meal with deep-fried durian served with coconut ice cream." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Seafood Deluxe, Coco Lobo, Chili Crab, Salted Egg Yolk Crab

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/palm-beach-seafood

  • ABOUT

    Simple, pure and unpretentious is the tagline of this cosy Greek restaurant located in Tanglin Mall. For starters, the Grilled Octopus served with fava puree and lemon is tender and juicy, with a smoky char from its time spent on the grill. The Spanakopita is another sweet treat to start your meal on a high note — made from a family recipe, this oven-baked savoury puff features flaky filo pastry wrapped around crumbly feta cheese with chopped spinach and egg. Sharing is the best way to enjoy a little of everything from the wide selection of mains here. From the Josper Grill, try the Bone-In Marinated Pork Ribs. Tender and juicy, the meat is extra flavourful and kissed with a smoky char. For seafood, try the Catch of the Day. A whole fish is cooked on the grill, and is a hearty feast. For desserts, end the meal on a sweet note with the range of artisanal gelato. The Greek Pistachio is nutty and sweet, while the Rocher Chocolate is a classic that won’t disappoint. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Octopus, Spanakopita, Bone-In Marinated Pork Ribs, Catch of the Day, Greek Pistachio Gelato

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pano-kato-grill-pizza-deli
name: Pano Kato Grill, Pizza & Deli

html:
• ABOUT

    Ernest Hemingway was affectionately known as "Papa" in Cuba. When one day he wandered into La Floridita Bar, Havana, Cuba to use the toilet, he chanced upon a daiquiri created by Constantino Ribalaigua. He is quoted as saying, "that's good but I prefer it without sugar and with double rum" - so the 'Papa Doble' was born. Papa Doble Singapore name takes after this great author and honours Hemingway by taking inspiration from his novels, history, love for bull and folklore.Literary giant Hemingway had quite a colourful life. Papa Doble Singapore's latest menu is inspired by his experiences, and the women he loved. The innovative food and drinks attempt to distil the memories associated with Hemingway's journey, invoking a sense of nostalgia for a distant past, for romantic and tragic relationships, as well as adventure and travel.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cured trout, Hummus, Grilled Chorizo, Bikini Sandwich and Creamy Cheesecake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/papa-doble
name: Papa Doble

html:
• ABOUT

    Singapore has no shortage of watering holes, but this swish spot at the Regent is paradise for diners who love their grapes. A tea lounge by day and wine bar by night, this is the perfect spot for post-work drinks or a weekend tete-a-tete. With over a thousand labels rated RP90 and above by Robert Parker Wine Advocate, this place has a selection of tipples unlike any other. Not a wine enthusiast? The complementary menu of sharing plates from the famed Basilico and one Michelin-star Summer Palace will keep you coming back for more. Dig into some Wild Mushroom Arancini With Saffron Mayonnaise. The fragrance of the exotic saffron gives this dish a uniquely sharp flavour. The earthiness of this dish is easily offset by a glass of sweet white wine. Diners who prefer some meat with their drinks can opt for Italian Cold Cuts. Perfect with a glass of red, this dish features fresh salami, crisp parma ham, cooked ham, and mortadella. Clueless about pairings? Ask one of the friendly staff for a recommendation. End the meal on a sweet note with the Praline Cake - a hazelnut and chocolate sponge cake made with Amedei dark chocolate. The cake is dense, spongy, and melts in the mouth - the perfect way conclude a satisfying meal. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Praline Cake, Wild Mushroom Arancini With Saffron Mayonnaise, Italian Cold Cuts, Tortelloni With Porcini And Truffle, Deep-Fried Buttered Chicken Thighs And Wings With BBQ Sauce

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/park90
name: Park90

html:
• Good For

    Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    Pasta & Co. is an Italian restaurant dedicated to rolling out freshly shaped artisanal handmade pastas with a twist on your classic Italian flavours. Enjoy handmade pastas infused with interesting flavours such as roasted capsicum with smoked paprika spaghetti and beetroot fusilli. Diners can expect an innovative variety of different flavours inspired by the local palate. Celebrate friendship and connect with your loved ones at Pasta & Co. over comforting bowls of freshly made pasta. Start with a portion of Burratina Salad. A mixed salad that features a nutritious blend of juicy tomato pulp, olive crumble and a dash of basil oil, this healthy bowl of greens tastes just as great as it looks! For those who prefer traditional appetisers, the Caesar Salad and Soup of The Day are equally tantalising options one can opt for. Choose from four different types of pasta to form your very own bowl. Signature favourites such as the Beetroot Fusilli, Pumpkin Rigatoni, and Squid Ink Tagliatelle are delicious crowd pleasers that wow with its unique flavours. Pair with a basket of crunchy Truffle Fries or crispy Calamari Rings to complete your meal! Beautifully garnished with lavender and fresh berries, indulge in the restaurant’s sinfully sweet serving of Creme Brulee to end your meal on a sweet note. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Burratina Salad, Squid Ink Tagliatelle, Calamari Rings, Creme Brulee

html:
• ABOUT

    There is something to be said about restaurants that outlast the competition by sticking to tradition. If you've lived in Singapore for a while, chances are you've heard about Pasta Brava which was established in 1991. And it wouldn't be surprising if the name conjures up word associations like "authentic Italian", and "delicious". East truly meets west as the Luceri family serves traditional Italian dishes at a conservation shophouse in Tanjong Pagar. With its central location, it's perfect for corporate lunches or romantic dinners, and if you don't believe us, perhaps the numerous accolades that take up an entire wall near the entrance can back up our claim. They deserve a standing ovation and a "Bravissima!" for their simple yet delicious renditions, many of whose ingredients can be counted on one hand like the Insalata Caprese and Calamari Fritti. The extensive menu has you covered from antipasti to dolci, but as their name suggests, the homemade pastas are their specialty. Consider their signature dish, the Mezzelune Ripiene di Zucca. Half moon shaped pumpkin ravioli comes in a divine red capsicum cream sauce. At first bite, you get the sweetness of the pumpkin, which is then finished off with the sweetness of the red capsicum. Between this and their chocolate lava cake, we're hard-pressed to choose which the sweeter escape is. (Jan 2014)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Calamari Fritti, Insalata Caprese, Branzino (CHOPE TIP: ask for the tomato based Livornese sauce), Mezzelune Ripiene di Zucca, Chocolate lava cake

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2015 and 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pasta-brava
name: Pasta Brava

Menus: Menu  Executive Set Lunch Menu  Wine Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Countless restaurants may be popping up around town claiming to offer authentic Italian fare, but Pasta Fresca Da Salvatore has stood the test of time, with 27 years of serving honest and hearty Italian fare under their belt. This is no surprise as their dishes are made with fresh imported ingredients from Italy and their dishes are also endorsed by the Health Promotion Board. Pasta Fresca translates to “Fresh Pasta” and, staying true to its name, this heartwarming establishment offers the widest range of homemade fresh pasta, completely without preservatives and additives, in Singapore. From familiar favourites like Spaghetti and Linguine, to eclectic picks like Panzerotti, Conchiglie, and Pappardelle, there’s something for everyone. Choose from four pasta bases: cream, tomato, seafood, and olive oil. Seafood lovers should not miss the Polpa Di Granchio, a luscious sauce of soft crabmeat sauteed with garlic, crushed black pepper, cherry tomatoes, and white wine in tomato sauce. If you’re looking for something more decadent, the bestseller, Al Funghi E Salsiccia, features homemade Italian pork sausage and mushrooms sauteed in light cream. An avid pizza fan? The selection here won’t disappoint you either. Our favourite was definitely the Rucola, Mozzarella Fresca E Pomodorini, the signature pizza topped with generous portions of cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, and fresh rucola. The Parma Ham was a smashing delight as well - who can resist the king of Italian Ham smothered all over a crusty pizza dough? For a sweet ending, indulge in mouthwatering desserts like the Panna Cotta, because don’t kid yourself already, there’s always room for dessert! (Nov 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Who still remembers the TV jingle from this Italian restaurant’s old commercials? Though that may seem like an eon ago, this Italian chain continues to thrive with its dedication towards freshly-made pasta and heartfelt service. 27 years on, and Pasta Fresca stays fresh by constantly revamping its menu, with current mainstays including Vongole Alla Pescatora, Crespelle Al Funghi, and Risotto Al Frutti Di Mare.” -Honeycombers “Pasta Fresca Da Salvatore may have recently given its Boat Quay outlet a fresh coat of paint, but its rustic, trattoria style remains the same. With 16 hand-made pastas and 21 accompanying sauces, you’ll never go bored with your pasta-mixing and matching.” -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Zuppa Di Mare All’ Amalfitana, Melanzane Alla Parmigiana, Crespelle Al Funghi, Vongole Alla Pescatora, Risotto Al Frutti Di Mare, Rucola, Mozzarella Fresca E Pomodorini Pizza, Parma Ham Pizza

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2019 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pasta-fresca-da-salvatore-boat-quay

    It’s amazing how adding egg and salt to flour can conjure up homemade pasta that elevates a dish from good to great. Lucky for us, getting such delectable pasta requires nothing more than a car (or train) ride into town. Located along Craig Road in Tanjong Pagar, Pastaria Abate is a casual eatery that has seemingly cracked the culinary code, serving up amazingly delicious pasta in an inviting environment at prices that won’t break the bank. Embark on your meal with several Italian appetisers such as the warm Garlic Bread made in-house, or the Antipasta Full Board showcasing cuts of prosciutto, salami and more. Then move on to the pasta because, my oh my, is it divine. Select your favourite pasta from egg-based fettucine to rigatoni and pair it with any of the 18 rich and flavourful sauces available. Stellar options include the Al Ragu, where the traditional chunky beef sauce is slowly cooked overnight. The Mixed Seafood sauce is another crowd-pleaser, with its generous heaping of prawns, mussels, and squid all lightly cooked in a seafood broth. And what better way to round off the meal than with a glass of Italian wine from the eatery’s wine cellar? Set in a warm and cosy environment, the humble Pastaria Abate charms with delightful renditions of classic Italian pasta meals at wallet-friendly prices. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Calabrese Stewed Squid Pasta, Create Your Own Pasta

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pastaria-abate-tanjong-pagar
name: Pastaria Abate (Tanjong Pagar)

html:
• ABOUT

    Simple Thai dishes done well. That has been the cornerstone of Patara Fine Thai Cuisine’s cooking for the last twenty years, and their longevity in this country of fickle diners is testament that it works. Nestled in the cosy compound of Tanglin, Patara Fine Thai Cuisine combines premium ingredients and traditional cooking techniques to conjure Thai dishes that will warm the body and soul. There’s no better way to kick things off than with a Patara Premium, designed to be shared by two. This showcase sampler features top-sellers such as the resplendent Chor Muang, or handcrafted blue flower dumplings stuffed with caramelised chicken, sweet turnip, and peanut filling. If you’re a fan of beef, then opt for Nua Yang. Here, a tender 300 days grain-fed Australian beef tenderloin is cooked to perfection and paired with a tangy spicy tamarind sauce. Patara Fine Thai Cuisine also does not lack for any seafood options, ranging from fresh lobsters, prawns, to several kinds of fish, so you won’t go wrong with any pick. For us, the Whole Seabass cannot be beat thanks to its complementary broth concocted from lime, garlic, and chilli. Bold, zesty Thai flavours are on full display here at Patara Fine Thai Cuisine, an eatery that stands out among the best Thai spots in the city. (Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Traditional touches, a lemongrass-scented ambiance and fine Thai cuisine are what you can expect here. There are lots of starters, and modern creations such as lemongrass-marinated New Zealand rack of lamb with a very spicy green papaya salad to choose from.” - SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Patara Premium, Nua Yang, Whole Seabass, Gang Kiew Wan Nua, Khana Moo Grob

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/patara-fine-thai-cuisine-sg

  • ABOUT

    PATH brings to the table unexpected interpretations of lesser-known regional ingredients through a seamless composition of French culinary techniques and presentation. Each dish draws upon the rich playground of a relatively unexplored East-Asia, informed by a rigorous research and refinement process.Helmed by chef Marvas Ng who navigates the culinary world with down-to-earth finesse and curiosity, PATH is crafting its own genre of cross-border cooking with progressive yet balanced flavours.Located at the Marina Bay Financial Centre, the ambience of the restaurant is bright and welcoming with earthy colours that serve as a canvas for bold expression. Free-flowing forms and curvature express the meandering culinary journey that is constantly evolving to tantalise the palate. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wakamatsu Strait Yellowtail

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/path-restaurant
name: Path Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    The grand dame of German hangouts here in Singapore, Paulaner Brauhaus is the only German microbrewery in Singapore, and has been delighting Singaporeans with its superb, full-bodied beers for years. The Brauhaus is also a stellar Bavarian restaurant, churning out plates of meaty German favourites to go with those beers, as well as heaps of friendly German “Geselligkeit,” or “sociability”. Channeling an authentic German tavern, the trappings here are gorgeous and rustic, and usher you into a truly German experience. The food does the rest. The great classics of the cuisine are all here, including a massive Roasted Whole Pork Knuckle on the bone, served with tart Sauerkraut and Bavarian bread dumplings. There’s also German meatloaf, called Leberkas, served grilled with a side of fresh cucumber salad, a sunny side up egg, and rich Bavarian mustard. Deep from the heart of Bavaria comes the Beef Beer Goulash, a rich beef stew given extra layers of flavour by some dark beer, served with mounds of Bavarian egg noodles to soak up all that delicious gravy. It’s not German food without an entire section of the menu dedicated to sausages, and here you can get your fix of Currywurst, Munich Weisswurst, and herby Sausage Snail. Pile on the meat with a serving of Schnitzel, a battered cutlet of pork or chicken, served with a variety of sauces that will forever change your mind about German food being bland and uninteresting. Needless to say, chug down some beers. They’re brewed on-site and are some of the tastiest on the island. (Feb 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cordon Bleu, Pork Knuckle, Beef Beer Goulash, Currywurst

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/paulaner-brauhaus-millenia-walk
name: Paulaner Bräuhaus

  • ABOUT

    With delicious nosh at budget-friendly prices, we can see why Pavilion Banana Leaf has become a success in its own right. Located at Jurong Point, this cheery establishment draws crowds of hungry diners who flock here for lunch and dinner service. Have a crack at winsome dishes such as the amazing Zaffron Fish Head Curry that's so delicious we just can't stop raving about it. Here, fish head is slowly cooked in a pot of rich tamarind gravy and topped off with brinjal, okra, and creamy coconut milk. Mop up your curry with some freshly baked Garlic Naan or Tandoori Roti. The Moong Dal Halwa is required eating for anyone who proclaims to love dessert. Made of lentils and cooked in milk, butter, and sugar, this buttery dessert will warm your heart while satiating any sweet cravings. For homely Indian food that's a cut above the rest, Pavilion Banana Leaf can't be beat for its combination of quick service, great prices, and bowls of aromatic curries. (Mar 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The food was just as good - tasty without being fiery or overpowering in the use of spices. Each dish had a distinct flavour and every one I tried came across just right. The Zaffron tandoori platter, which comprised chicken tikka, malai tikka, fish tikka and seekh mutton kebab, turned out very nicely with everything cooked just right." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Deep Fried Chettinad Mutton Meatballs, Garlic Anchovy Curry, Prawn Thokku Masala, Paal Kolukkattai, Chicken Dum Biryani, Chettinad Chicken Curry

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/zaffron-banana-leaf
name: Pavilion Banana Leaf

• PRESS RELEASE

    Founded in 2019, PAZZION Café is a multi-concept store that boasts a holistic retail and dining experience in the heart of lifestyle hub Jewel Changi Airport. Shoppers can browse the latest shoes and accessories at the retail section and look forward to a variety of artisan beverages and premium quality delights at the café thereafter. Adorned with French-inspired interiors that exudes a relaxed and intimate vibe, PAZZION Café is the ideal cosy hangout for families and friends alike. (Jul 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Peach Garden is a top-rated Chinese restaurant that seeks to delight diners with exciting set menus and a wonderful selection of signature dishes served in thoughtfully plated portions. Ideal for large gatherings or celebratory dinners, Peach Garden at Chinatown Point indulges diners with a huge selection of private dining rooms for more intimate functions. The Roasted Crispy Peking Duck has just the right balance of sweet and tender duck meat. The Steamed Soon Hock Fish in “Hong Kong” Sauce is also a great dish for sharing. Braised and steamed in a fragrant sauce unique to Peach Garden, the fish is garnished with ginger slices that add flavor to every mouth. Follow up with the Deep Fried Duck Meat seasoned with salt and pepper. Finish off with a plate of Stewed Vermicelli with Assorted Diced Seafood and Baby Cabbage in Black Bean Sauce. (Apr 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roasted Crispy Peking Duck, Steamed Soon Hock Fish in “Hong Kong” Sauce, Deep Fried Duck Meat with Salt and Pepper, Stewed Vermicelli with Assorted Diced Seafood and Baby Cabbage in Black Bean Sauce

name: Peach Garden (Chinatown Point)

Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Dim Sum
Address: 401 Havelock RoadLevel 3 Hotel Miramar Singapore (169631)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Relish the delicious Cantonese delicacies prepared by expert chefs at Peach Garden as you indulge in the spacious and elegant setting of the restaurant in Hotel Miramar. Opt for the set menus specially designed for four. Perfect for family dinners, the six-course meal takes diners on a culinary journey to experience authentic Cantonese delights. Delight in a hearty starter of Roasted Crispy Duck served with Chilled Marinated Jellyfish and Almond Flakes Fried Prawn before moving on to a comforting bowl of Traditional Braised Yoshikiri Shark’s Fin with Egg White. The restaurant saves the best for the last with its signature Fried Hor Fun with Pork Collar Meat in Egg Sauce. Coated in delicious egg sauce, the Hor Fun tastes as good as it looks and is accompanied by a generous amount of juicy pork collar meat. End with Sweet Temptation, a dessert that truly satisfies. Coupled with Peach Garden’s distinctive brand of personable service, the restaurant’s unique dining concept continues to be a choice destination for many diners. (Apr 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roasted Crispy Duck, Chilled Marinated Jellyfish, and Almond Flakes Fried Prawn, Traditional Braised Yoshikiri Shark’s Fin with Egg White, Fried Hor Fun with Pork Collar Meat in Egg Sauce, Sweet Temptation

html:
• ABOUT

    With an emphasis on premium ingredients, winning culinary skills and top-notch service, Peach Garden at OCBC Centre brings diners the best of Chinese cuisine with a refined touch. Located in the heart of the Central Business District, the restaurant offers unparalleled views through the iconic building’s glass doors. Look out to spectacular views of the Singapore River, Esplanade and Singapore Flyer as you tuck into dishes prepared using only the freshest and most premium ingredients. Start your meal with the signature Roasted Rack of Suckling Pig. Juicy and succulent, this dish is one of the main highlights here at Peach Garden. Move on to the Double Boiled Baby Superior Shark’s Fin with Essence of Chicken Soup. An aromatic blend of high-quality herbs, the soup delicately balances out the flavors of shark fin and chicken essence. Finish with a Chilled Jelly Royale with Mango, Sago, and Pomelo in Young Coconut for a refreshing end. (Apr 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roasted Rack of Suckling Pig, Steamed Fillet of Soon Hock with Beancurd in Special Sauce, Double Boiled Baby Superior Shark’s Fin with Essence of Chicken Soup, Chilled Jelly Royale with Mango, Sago and Pomelo in Young Coconut

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    Peach Garden is a top-rated Chinese restaurant that seeks to delight diners with exciting set menus and a wonderful selection of signature dishes served in thoughtfully plated individual portions. Boasting a dining concept that brings together award-winning cuisine and the relaxed vibe of the restaurant’s noodle house, Peach Garden at The Metropolis is an exquisite dining experience that is perfect for all special occasions. Offering a variety of set menu options that cater to different groups of diners, Peach Garden at The Metropolis is the ideal place for dinner dates and celebratory gatherings. Indulge in Asian fares such as Braised Homemade Beancurd with Local Spinach and Fresh Crab Meat, as well as the well-loved Stewed Ee-fu Noodle with Assorted Diced Seafood and Minced Meat Sauce. For seafood lovers, enjoy a plate of juicy Pan-fried King Prawn with Garlic and Superior Soya Sauce. End off the satisfying meal with a delectable dessert. Named the Sweet Temptation, this dessert tastes true to its name by being deliciously sweet and creamy. (Apr 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised Homemade Beancurd with Local Spinach and Fresh Crab Meat, Stewed Ee-fu Noodle with Assorted Diced Seafood and Minced Meat Sauce, Pan-fried King Prawn with Garlic and Superior Soya Sauce, Sweet Temptation

  • href

name: Peach Garden (The Metropolis)

html:
• ABOUT

    Established in 2002, Peach Garden at Thomson Plaza is well regarded for refined traditional Cantonese cuisine deftly prepared by a team of experienced and dedicated master chefs. The place to enjoy authentic Cantonese specialties, signature dishes on the restaurant’s a la carte menu include the Roasted Peking Duck, Roasted Crispy Chicken, Steamed Mian Xian and Baby Lobster with Egg White and Chinese Wine, and the quintessential Cantonese Steamed Sponge Cake. Catered for two, the set menus at Peach Garden will leave you feeling more than satisfied. First up, try the Smoked Duck with Fresh Mango, followed by the Deep Fried Scallop with Salted Egg Yolk. A delicious mish-mash of seafood, meat and fruits, the salted egg yolk elevates the dish, giving every bite into a delightful kick of flavor. Cleanse your palate with a Double-boiled Soup of the Day before diving into the Deep-fried Chicken Cutlet with Almond Flakes and Plum Sauce. (Apr 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Roasted Peking Duck, Roasted Crispy Chicken, Smoked Duck with Fresh Mango accompanied with Deep Fried Scallop with Salted Egg Yolk, Deep-fried Chicken Cutlet with Almond Flakes and Plum Sauce

html:
• ABOUT

    COVID-19 has presented a unique set of challenges for Singapore’s F&B landscape, especially with the new norm of safe management measures in place to develop a safer framework and maintain a hygienic environment for diners and party-goers alike. Established in Chijmes since 2006 (formerly known as Cosafe Maid Café), PNC has watched its space grow beyond what was first envisaged in its maiden rebranding exercise in 2014 to appeal to a variety of target audience. Today, we are taking this opportunity to re-evaluate, regroup, and rebrand our existing identity. And we must be prepared to innovate, and embrace the reality of rapid digitalisation.Going forward, our establishment has a newly adopted vision of transforming into a local promising label that distinguishes itself from competitors within the F&B industry, yet remains perfectly affiliated to PNC – Pemenco: the expression of ‘Peaty, meaty, and company’ is the inspiration behind this original brand name.This complete rebranding campaign takes time and only PNC’s loyal, and royal, patrons will eventually attest to its successful business transformation into Pemenco, which is already a work-in-progress. From a stylishly designed logo in new corporate colours of brown and orange hues, to its commitment towards enhancing service orientation, as well as freshly curated menu of the finest culinary by its contemporary resident-chef and other exceptional personalities, Pemenco will evolve from “grapes to peat” – wines to whisky in other words. And we must continue to remain resilient even as the going gets tough.While the nature of rebranding is painstaking, it is both necessary and inevitable from our business point of view. In essence, the understanding and renewed support of the esteemed Chijmes management towards our latest aspiration will certainly enable Pemenco to break newer ground and pursue remarkable growth under greater stewardship amid these trying times. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    USDA Prime Rib Eye, Chilean Codfish with Sea Scallops, P&C Signature Pork Belly, Homemade Tiramisu

html:
• ABOUT

    Peng Cheng Xiao Chu serves up a classic range of Chinese fare, emphasising on dishes from the ancient city of Peng Cheng, now known as Xuzhou. As you enter the eatery, you'll be greeted by lanterns, murals, and furnishings that pay homage to tradition. The menu boasts an extensive array of small plates, claypot and ground pot dishes, hot plates, noodles, and more. Favourites include the Ground Pot Chicken — tender, braised chicken surrounded by flour cakes to help soak up all the savoury sauce — and the Claypot Braised Pork with its succulent slices of pork belly. For those who love variety, go for the Claypot Stewed Delicacies, an assortment of homemade meatballs, fishballs, fried pork skin, beancurd skin, squid eggs, and veggies. If you have a sweet tooth, you should try the Candied Sweet Potatoes, a dish of stir-fried sweet potatoes in a sticky glaze. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised Pork Belly, Beef Tripe, Moo Shu Pork

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/peng-cheng-xiao-chu
name: Peng Cheng Xiao Chu <U+5F6D><U+57CE><U+5C0F><U+53A8>

Menus: Ala Carte Menu  Dim Sum Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    This restaurant is set to shake up the Chinese dining scene in Singapore. Helmed by Chef Ricky Liew, who is known for his creative presentation and dishes, the menu here features a number of dishes that are easy on the eyes and palate. With no MSG and minimal oil used in his creations, the dishes here are perfect for the health conscious. Try Chef Liew’s signature dish like “Bi Feng Tang” Style Crispy Cod. Crunchy pieces of fresh fish is served with caramelised onions and presented on a bed of greens, sprinkled liberally with chilli. Meat lovers will love the Honey Glazed Barbecue Pork - smoky, tender chunks of meat from Spain drenched in a rose-infused honey sauce that is rich, tangy, and sweet. The sauce goes perfectly with the meat and can be eaten on its own, though some diners may choose to mop up the decadent sauce with some steamed rice. Diners who can’t decide on what to eat can opt for a special omakase style meu. Simply inform the restaurant of a budget, and Chef Liew will create dishes that are not on the menu from fresh ingredients he finds at the market. (May 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Char Siew Soh, Chili Crab Sauce Dumpling, Peking Duck, Hot Sweetened Teochew ‘Oor-ni’ with Ginko Nuts,

• PRESS RELEASE

    The warmth and comfort of wood-fired pizzas and traditional pasta over drinks with friends and families have become an everyday affair that started with Peperoni Pizzeria's first outlet in Greenwood, Singapore. Charming, vivacious and full of life, Peperoni has since evolved into a much-loved multi-destination staple with its 'Appetite for Life' philosophy. This philosophy makes Peperoni more than just a restaurant, as it is a place with a mission - to bring people together, to bind relationships, and to savour life in all its delightful flavours. (Jul 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Overall, the trademark Peperoni humour and attention to the dining experience will ensure that it gets a steady stream of customers, especially for families in the area." -Singapore Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Arancini, Chicken Truffle Pizza, Grilled Vegetable Pizza, Seafood Misto, Nero Di Seppia (Squid Ink Pasta), Lasagna, Caribbean, Vanilla Panna Cotta

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the mini-metropolis that is Jewel Changi Airport, this bistro serves Asian-European fusion food with an emphasis on Southeast Asian flavours. Start your meal with appetisers such as the Otah-Otah Slider Bao, garnished with sambal mayo and Kyuri cucumber, or the Blue Swimmer Crab Cake, served with Gochujang cocktail sauce, celeriac, and an apple and raisin remoulade. Continue to the entrees, such as the Braised Lamb Shank in Pomegranate Molasses, served with celeriac puree, confit cherry tomato and haricot vert (green bean). For more pronounced Asian flavours, don’t miss the Steamed Baby Seabass with Lemongrass Broth, served with cantaloupe and Japanese pearl rice. Finish your meal with the Cempedak Profiteroles, consisting of a craquelin (a Scandinavian type of pretzel), served with creamy Cempedak ice cream and compote. For vegans, try the Vegan Chocolate Hazelnut Cake, served with sinful chocolate frosting and roasted hazelnut ice cream. All dishes are best enjoyed with a glass of wine from 1855 The Bottle Shop’s extensive collection. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Otah-Otah Slider Bao, Steamed Baby Seabass with Lemongrass Broth, Cempedak Profiteroles, Vegan Chocolate Hazelnut Cake

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Celebrity Chef Mel Dean is the Culinary Director at Permata Singapore with a passion to launch a progressive Nusantara cuisine showcasing the vibrant diversity, indigenous ethnic flavours, while highlighting classic Nusantara dishes presented in a modern way.Boasting over 10,000 square feet, Gedung Kuning was built in the late 1850s and its exterior was inspired by Palladian architecture which is a European architectural style that was trendy back in the day. The interior of Gedung Kuning, like the former Istana Kampong Glam next to it, follows the design of a traditional Malay house. Gedung Kuning is Singapore’s first Nusantara lifestyle destination with 4 different offerings - Permata Singapore for Nusantara Cuisine, Amazing Chambers Singapura, an escape room with games-based on Singapore’s history, a book cafe, and we will soon have weddings and community events. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Nasi Ulam Cakerawala (Ulam Rice Balls), Kerabu Daging Sri Mersing (Beef Salad), Permata Samudera (Nusantara Ceviche), Rawon Risotto, Botok Botok Halibut, Rusuk Percik (Percik Lamb Ribs), Cek Mek Molek

html:
• RESTAURANT NOTICE

    As part of Grand Hyatt Singapore’s upgrading efforts, Pete’s Place is currently closed for renovation until further notice.

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Journey through Italy at Pete's Place, one of Singapore's oldest and most nostalgic restaurants that serves authentic Italian fare in a rustic, charming brick abode since 1973. Helmed by two Italian culinary maestros, find arguably, the most authentic pastas and wood-fired oven pizzas in town. (Dec 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    Located in Grand Hyatt Singapore's basement, stepping into the restaurant feels just like walking into a trattoria in Italy, what with the brick walls, dark wood chairs and checkered table cloths." -Epicure "Sunday Brunch at Pete's Place comprises salads, stations of housemade Italian cuisine and a spread of antipasti such as beef carpaccio with aged parmesan cheese and buffalo mozzarella with vine-ripped cherry tomatoes. The seafood counter features freshly shucked oysters, cold poached prawns, crabs and more. Customise your favourite handmade pasta at live stations and enjoy the signature 48-hour dough pizzas plus daily risotto specials that are served to your table." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spaghetti Ciopinno, Bistecca alla Griglia, Frutti di Mare, Burrata e Caponata, Ravioli Astice, Quattro Formaggi Pizza, Tagliata di Manzo, Capricciosa Pizza, Bonnet Astigiana

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

name: Pete's Place

html:
• ABOUT

    Who says that you need to travel to the city for top-notch, drool-worthy Italian cuisine? Not us, that’s for sure, when we know there are culinary neighborhood gems such as the one tucked away in Serangoon – Pietro Ristorante Italiano. This comfy eating spot has always astounded us with its solidly creative and delicious Italian fare, conjuring up hearty portions meant to be shared among friends. At this mid-sized restaurant, which seats 56 people inside and 32 at its alfresco area, the crowd is raucous but never rowdy. Here, all your favorite classics are on the menu, from pizzas that are fired in a wood-burning oven, to creamy risotto and plates of pasta made with fresh pasta. Carb-eaters would undoubtedly appreciate the fragrant Risotto di Mare e Zafferano, where risotto is cooked with a blend of prawns, clams, squid, and scallops in a saffron-based sauce. Meanwhile, Pietro kicks it old-school with tried-and-true recipes such as the Spaghetti alla Carbonara, so good it’ll even put a smile on the face of an Italian grandmother. And you can’t go wrong with the kid-friendly Cheese Pizza, served on a crispy thin crust. Well-seasoned with well-loved dishes make a play here at Pietro Ristorante Italiano, ensuring that any meal here would be an excellent one.(Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Funghi Portebello, Pollo con Salsa al Vino Bianco e Roshari, Pizza al Quattro Formaggi, Linguine al Cartoccio, Tiramisu al Pistacchio

html:
• ABOUT

    With well-done, hearth-crisped pizzas, rare draught beers and even on tap wine, Pizza Fabbrica is a welcome addition to the Bugis dining beat. Upon entering the cool, minimalist space taken by Pizza Fabbrica on Bussorah Street, your eye is drawn straight through to the back by the glinted reflections of a gorgeous copper-clad oven, ebulliently glowing from its wood-fired embers within. It sits behind a glassed-in kitchen, bustling with chefs pressing dough and boiling pasta. The window is a theme at the restaurant, its storefront also featuring floor-to-ceiling versions that allows light and action to flow from inside to outside beautifully. The rest of the design is as if stepping into the mind of a graphic designer, complete with techy textures of chrome and wire, along with charming infographic posters displaying optimal wine and beer pairings. It’s a refreshingly minimal, but not understyled look that shows a new side to the tired hipster aesthetic, and a very unexpected one for a pizza restaurant. Let the posters guide you to your ideal beverage, picking from the small but efficient bar of beers and wines on tap. From the menu, the pizzas are the obvious choice, in which you can taste the handiwork of that impressive oven. The Funghi Scarmorza features a woodsy mix of mushrooms with a drizzle of truffle oil and rich melted cheese that’s an immediate palate pleaser. The Prosciutto Crudo con Rucola is another winner with more than the usual volume of toppings of Parma ham and peppery rocket suspended in a milky mozzarella. The Vegetariana has the same cheese, which is cut nicely by balsamic grilled eggplant, capsicum and zucchini. All the pizzas are grounded by a tasty crust, chewy in the center and bubbled and scorched at the edges. A variety of pastas is also available for the non-pizza straggler of your dining party. Cap off the meal with a heavenly scented, creamy Saffron Panna Cotta and you won’t be disappointed! (Dec 2014)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prosciutto Crudo con Rucola, Funghi Scarmorza, Vegetariana, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, Saffron Panna Cotta

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Greek food isn’t exactly a common sight in Singapore, so based on that alone the grub at Place to READ stands out. That would mean little, however, if the food wasn’t authentic and delicious, but fret not - the restaurant’s commitment to good food is obvious from the very first bite. That, together with a relaxed ambience and attentive service staff, makes for a meal to remember. If you’re looking to have a little taste of Greece, then dig into a large helping of Moussaka, an oven-baked casserole made of grilled eggplant, minced beef, decadently creamy cheese, and various spices. Hot, rich, and a real belly buster, it’d be a rare person who didn’t come away from it feeling satisfied. Do try the Grilled Stuffed Squid with Feta Cheese as well – every chewy mouthful is enhanced by the fragrance of sliced garlic. It’s not an overly complicated dish, but man if it isn’t good. Place to READ doesn’t just serve Greek food – there’s a great selection of pastas and pizzas too, among other Western fare. You won’t regret the Chilli Crab Sauce Pasta, with an authentic take on the sauce that won’t disappoint fans of the Singaporean classic. Served with helpings of scallop and shrimp, you’re sure to get every cent of your money’s worth. Hearty, good value, and a good place to unwind – that just about sums up Place to READ! (Aug 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Stuffed Squid with Feta Cheese, Lamb Shank, Beef Souvlaki, Vongole Pasta, Chilli Crab Sauce Pasta, Moussaka, Hummus Bi Tahini, Laksa Pasta with Prawns, Scallops and Mussels, Pan Seared Salmon with Special Mango Salsa

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Established in January 2013 by the lovely Johanna, PLONK is a contemporary food and wine bar in a prime neighbourhood location - at the heart of Singapore's charming Serangoon Gardens! Inspired by fresh produce, elegant executions of great cuisine and a laid-back Australian vibe, the restaurant is the go-to local spot for friends and families from within “The Gardens” and beyond. Check out our mouth-watering brunch selections, extensive a la carte offerings and regular rotations of chalkboard specials; we’re all about unpretentious, heartwarming dishes that you can share family-style with your loved ones. What’s a good meal without something equally delicious to guzzle down? The team at PLONK has selected an extensive range of handpicked eclectic organic & natural wines, international beers & spirits, velvety locally roasted Brazilian & Ethiopian coffee from Reezal of Paradise and high quality teas from Newby Tea. Our versatile upper floor dining area is transformed weekly into a battle ground for our Tuesday Trivia Nights, not forgetting exciting events like music nights, wine tastings, private birthday parties and intimate weddings. Coupled with a private bar, this 65-seat floor space can be converted to fit your needs for the perfect private function. What else are you waiting for? Come join us for a cheeky PLONK! (May 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The food at Plonk is what they "like to eat", nothing too fussy, with a focus on quality ingredients.” -SoShiok “Kick back with some wine and tapas at PLONK. Owned by two chefs from Down Under, it’s no wonder this cheery bistro and bar reminds us of a day on the beach. Featuring different live musicians every week on their upper deck, this new kid on the block is set to add some spice to your nights.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Plonk's Original Chicky Parmigiana, Seared Halloumi, Manchego Croquetas, BBQ Pork Ribs

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    A refined Singaporean concept, Po is the flagship restaurant of The Warehouse Hotel, a meticulously restored godown on the banks of the Singapore River. Combining culture, heritage and cuisine, Po pays tribute to the flavours of yesteryear using premium ingredients and meticulous cooking techniques that would make even the toughest popos proud. All are welcome; for popiah parties, celebrations or corporate dinners - popo does it all. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Popiah, Kurobuta Char Siew, Charcoal-Grilled Iberico Satay, Barramundi Salad, Paper Spring Chicken, Spicy Tamarind Barramundi, Carabinero Prawns & Konbu Mee, Ice Cream Popiah

  • CASHLESS PAYMENT

    Please note that Po Restaurant is a cashless establishment. Payment modes accepted include Visa, Mastercard, Amex, JCB, UnionPay, GrabPay, PayLah, PayNow.

    For reservations at The Warehouse Hotel Bar, please click here.

  • PRIVATE EVENTS & GROUP FUNCTIONS

    Heritage, design and culture converge under one roof, The Warehouse Hotel, creating an elegant and striking venue along the Singapore River. With three spaces to choose from, there are endless ways to celebrate – from blowout bashes to intimate gatherings with loved ones and even corporate events. This historic godown has seen it all. Spaces: The Den: up to 40 guests Furnished with artwork by local artist, Robert Zhao, and a library of curated collection of literature and art, this cosy, mood-lit space can be tailored to suit your event needs. From intimate gatherings to cocktail parties and product launches; this space is unlike any other. Po: up to 30 guests The more the merrier for the best popiah parties. Colleagues, family, or friends, all are welcome for private dinners at Popo's place. Lobby Bar: up to 120 guests An eclectic combination of design and comfort, The Lobby is where The Warehouse Hotel experience begins and ends. A beautiful and open space, kitted out with furniture crafted by the world's finest designers, it paints the perfect scene for any and all events - big or small. *Full buyouts available upon request. **Do note that due to safe distancing measures, capacities may vary during this time.

html:
• ABOUT

    Located on Serangoon road in Little India, this lovely gem serves up vegetarian Indian snacks and desserts. Its roots date back to the social enterprise Arpanam, which was started by the Nadathur family who was involved in the founding of technology giant Infosys. The menu boasts an array of light bites bursting with flavour at pocket-friendly prices. All proceeds from sales go directly into supporting local artists and cultural programs. Dig in to one of their Medhu Vadais, a crispy, deep-fried savoury donut. Made with urad dal and rice, as well as a special mix of spices, these little bites of heaven come with coconut chutney, giving them a spicy kick. For something a little moreish, opt for the Idli-Vadai combination. The Idli is made with ground rice batter that is steamed to fluffy perfection. There are even curries like Poondu Rasam and side dishes like Murungukkai Pachadi that can be ordered with your choice of rice - or millet for a healthier option. Prefer something a little more saccharine? Try the Paruppu Payasam with Jackfruit. Made with Moong Dal, milk, sugar, and fruit, this dish is delectably sweet and perfect for diners who want to indulge their sweet tooth. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Medhu Vadai, Idli, Paruppu Payasam, Murungukkai Pachadi, Poondu Rasam

  • ABOUT

    At Poisson, indulge in the freshest seafood delicately prepared with care for maximum flavour. You can choose from an array of oysters from different regions that’s served with a lemon and shallot dressing to fully bring out the taste of the oyster. If you are looking for an appetizer that is worthy of splurging, Poisson serves Kaluga Queen Hybrid Caviar with Blinis and Sour Cream. Enjoy a little bit of everything with their Seafood Platter, which includes fresh seafood from steamed crabs to smoked salmon. It’s perfect for sharing. Serving a menu that splits into hot and cold mains, Poisson’s dishes are all carefully crafted around the choice of seafood used. Shellfish lovers should try Poisson’s St Jacques, a Hokkaido scallop ceviche with apple and cucumber in a dill broth. It’s a refreshing combination that brings out the natural sweetness of the scallops. Or go for their Ama, featuring ama ebi and uni with marinated daikon and shiso. This luxurious dish combines the fresh ocean taste of uni with the nutty flavor of ama ebi tartar for a remarkable culinary experience. Two Monks and Omar are two of the most popular hot dishes here. Two slabs of monkfish are grilled to perfection and served with monkfish liver in a sake broth, making this the perfect dish for diners looking for a satisfying meal. The Omar features Grilled Blue Lobster Tail and Iberico Bellota Flakes, combining the best of both flavours from land and sea with smoky roasted capsicum and silk jerusalem artichoke. To end off your meal, go for their ‘Red’ - poached pear, raspberry coulis and berries fun fare for a sweet finish. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kaluga Queen Hybrid Caviar, Seafood Platter, St Jacques, Two Monks, Red

html:
• ABOUT

    Housed within the Flower Dome at Gardens by the Bay - the largest glass greenhouse in the world, Pollen is helmed by Michelin-starred Chef Michael Wilson, who creates modern interpretive cuisine inspired by nature’s bounty. Always evolving with the seasons, his cuisine seeks to inspire the imagination. More than just delicious creations served on the plate, Chef Michael’s cuisine is artful yet approachable, created to inspire diners to be curious about the flavours, textures and origins of food. Begin your epicurean journey to POLLEN with our personalised buggy service from Gardens by the Bay’s arrival plaza to the restaurant. Enjoy complimentary access to the Flower Dome and wander in the sub 20-degree Mediterranean garden filled with exotic flowers, herbs and foliage. A unique POLLEN experience made with you in mind. (Dec 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Pollen is flourishing. On the garden level, there's a wonderfully stocked wine cellar and bar, with fresh juices and garden-themed cocktails. There is a more formal dining room with excellent modern interpretations of Mediterranean-inspired cuisine." -The New York Daily News (Sep 2012)"Speaking of the food, Pollen's menu will feature modern European fare with a Mediterranean twist - and with herbs grown within the dome's micro-climate, no less." -The Business Times (Jul 2012) "Imagine Provence, recreated inside a domed glass consevatory: The restaurant is surrounded by olive and fig trees, and plenty of lavender and thyme, all in a temperature-controlled 20-degree Celsius climate." -The Wall Street Journal (Jun 2012)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lettuce Gazpacho, Carne Crudo, Duck Neck & Foie Gras Sausage, Pandan Rice Pudding, Watermelon Ravioli

    Coffee and tea enthusiasts have found their latest stomping grounds at The Populus Coffee and Food Co. on Neil Road. A collaboration between the folks behind Department of Caffeine (D.O.C) and local specialty coffee roasters 2Degrees North Coffee Co., The Populus is a contemporary gastro-cafe with a menu that delivers a range of edibles from all around the world and a selection of exquisitely flavoured teas by Tea Bone Zen Mind.Their weekday menu is all work appropriate, with healthier alternatives like the Roast Chicken Grain Bowl and Buckwheat Pancakes. The weekend menu then, is all about indulgence with their Baked Pistachio ‘French Toast’ with Red Wine Pears and Lobster Seafood Linguine. Populus has got wickedly good eats and drinks down to a T (or tea)! (Jan 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The rounded, dark chocolatey notes in the Caldera house blend is built on Brazilian and Columbian beans that 2Degrees North roasts just for the cafe, and the sleek steel Victoria Arduino machine is quite the looker." -Time Out Singapore
