html:
• ABOUT

    This snazzy restaurant at the Sail offers a delightful feast for the senses. With a sleek, sweeping wood-panelled interior and minimalist decor, this place is versatile enough for business lunches by day and dinner dates at night. Diners get to customise their own three-course meal here, and can even choose to pair their selections with a wine from the extensive list available. The Portobello Mushroom With Truffle Chantilly Cream is an excellent soup to start with. Light, earthy, and simple, this dish whets the appetite and prepares the palate for the dishes to come. Another popular starter here is the Porters Crab Meat Croquette. Served with homemade chilli sauce, this dish is crunchy, meaty, and not greasy in the slightest. The Pan Seared Foie Gras is an excellent main, and a crowd favourite. The duck liver is seared to tender perfection and served with brioche and mixed berry compote, making for a dish that is sweet, buttery, and melts in your mouth. The Papillote Sea Bass is a generous serving of fish with potato fondant and lemon on the side, making for a dish that is tangy with a hint of earthiness tempered by the umami flavour of the fish. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Portobello Mushroom With Truffle Chantilly Cream, Pan Seared Foie Gras, Porters Crab Meat Croquette, Papilotte Sea Bass, Char Grilled Kurobuta Pork Chop, Wagyu Cheese Burger, Grilled Prawn Aglio Olio

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/porters-restaurant-bar
name: Porters Restaurant & Bar

html:
• ABOUT

    Positano Risto offers a gastronomic adventure with authentic Italian flavours! Indulge in fan-favourites such as the juicy Short Ribs, Angus Ribeye, and their legendary Mac n Cheese. For starters, their Arancini Balls, crispy, golden Italian rice balls stuffed with just the right amount of mozzarella, as well as their mushroom and tomato bruschetta, will leave you craving more! Other wows include their Super Supreme Calzone, a thin-crusted Roma Style pizza, baked to absolute perfection, topped with Turkey Ham, Pepperoni Strips and Burrata. Feeling super hungry? Dive into their enormous serving of their Signature Boston Lobster Fettuccine. Whole Boston Lobster paired with al dente Fettuccine, cooked in a hearty lobster bisque sauce, this dish is perfect for a truly special occasion! As for the Chilli Fanatics, have a twirl of their Squid ink Spaghetti and Seafood Aglio Olio Linguini with Sun-dried Tomatoes, spiced to your liking! Are you game? This charming hidden gem, coupled with amazing service and a quirky dining ambience, will definitely leave you coming back for more! (Jul 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “100% Muslim-owned, delicious cuisines and a great place for you to lounge at – and the best part is you don’t need to book a flight to Italy for this!” -Have Halal Will Travel

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Positano Mac and Cheese with Crab Meat, Arancini Balls, Super Supreme Calzone, Signature Boston Lobster Fettuccine, Signature Short Ribs, Positano Wagyu Beef Burger, Signature Chocolate Fudge Brownie

  • PRESS RELEASE

    PTT Family, the hospitality and entertainment group renowned for the internationally acclaimed 'Potato Head Beach Club' in Bali and the 'Potato Head' restaurant in Jakarta, opened its first venture outside Indonesia in June 2014, located in the heart of Chinatown in Singapore. Housed in one of the most iconic buildings on Keong Saik Road, this dynamic destination offers four venues within one building. Guests can combine the distinctively different restaurants and bars to create their perfect mix, or visit individually depending on the occasion, mood and time of day. Designed as PTT Family's 'home' in Singapore, Potato Head Singapore has the intimate feel of a private house - the first floor is the kitchen - the dynamic burger restaurant Three Buns; the second its living room - a relaxed restaurant with table service; the third its private studio - a decadent drinking den; and the rooftop its garden - a tropical-paradise open-air bar. The different rooms of the house are a haven in the heart of the city, a retreat for Singapore's creative crowd from the arts, fashion, film, music and design worlds. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "There may be no cosier, more comfortable and more interesting drinking den in Singapore than this buzzy Indonesian export." -Time Out Singapore

    Naughty Fries, Pokemon, Baby Huey, Burning Man, This Lil Piggy, Cobblepot

    In light of the recent spate of events, we have extended our food and wines to accommodate deliveries to our friends and patrons of Praelum. We humbly and sincerely thank you for your continued patronage and support for us. Delivery Operating Hours: 12pm-12am

  • ABOUT

    Looking for a place to improve your knowledge of your libations? Look no further. Named after the device used to extract juice from crushed grapes, Praelum is one of the few places that has been continuously lauded by Wine & Dine Magazine for their excellent wine list. There is also a selection of cheeses and other dishes for diners’ pairings. With a walk-in cellar home to over a thousand bottles of carefully procured wines and a bottle list that changes weekly, this is one place that truly knows its grapes. Wines are sold by the glass using the Enomatic and Coravin wine preservation systems, which minimises spoilage of the wine. The knowledgeable sommeliers are also able to advise diners and make recommendations for different palates. Diners can pair their choice of wine with farmhouse cheese platters and truffle honey. The tarte flambee is another good option, and comes with a range of premium toppings, including roma tomatoes and gruyere cheese. For something a little moreish, opt for the Stockyard Wagyu Ribeye. The fresh cut of beef is cooked to your liking and slathered in a rich beef demi glace sauce which gives the dish a strong flavour without overpowering the taste of the meat. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Stockyard Wagyu Ribeye, Tiramisu Classic, Salmon En-Croute, Tarte Flambee, Braised Beef Cheeks, Pork Parcels, Crème Brûlée

html:
• ABOUT

    Looking for a place for curated food and craftsmen specialty coffee for a breezy afternoon pick me up? PRAIRIE by Craftsmen is the place to be for casual dining any time of the day! Boasting a wide array of Instagrammable dishes, drop by Bukit Timah today to try out the delicious menu options. Featuring an outdoor greenhouse dining area and a comfortable air conditioned indoor space, snag a seat wherever you prefer to dig into the cafe’s salads, pasta and meat dishes. The Rustic Mushrooms provide for a healthy breakfast. Served up with soft poached egg, sourdough, truffle porcini butter and a generous amount of avocado salsa, this nutritious and filling platter will definitely fuel you up for a busy day ahead. If you’re looking to grab a quick bite, simply order a Butter Croissant or Pain Au Chocolat from the cafe’s variety of freshly baked pastries to satisfy your sweet tooth. From truffle to prawns and Hokkaido scallops, PRAIRIE by Craftsmen has got it all with an innovative selection of pastas available on the menu. A tantalising combination of angel hair, tiger prawns, cherry tomatoes topped with shaved cheese and chilli flakes, the Blue Mussel Pasta is a highly recommended dish not to be missed out on. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Rustic Mushrooms, Butter Croissant, Parma Scallop, Blue Mussel Pasta

• ABOUT

    What do you get when you fry a bit of dough in ghee? None other than light and fluffy roti prata. This humble South Indian staple has long been a go-to dish for many people across all walks of life, who find themselves chowing down on this dish at all hours of the day. And as big fans of this simple dish, we know that some of the best prata can be found in Clementi at a little establishment called Prata Alley, located in the shopping mall 321 Clementi. Unlike your old-school neighbourhood joints, Prata Alley kicks this dish up a notch, serving up inventive fare. One such dish is the The Big One, which seamlessly blends a mozzarella cheese prata base with pizza toppings such as pesto chicken and shiitake mushrooms. You can expect other specialties too, such as the Turmeric Rush, which showcases a generous plate of nasi goreng cooked with a special blend of spices. Of course diners who prefer traditional dishes would enjoy Prata Alley’s rendition of Chicken Sambal Briyani, where you can bite into chunks of chicken that’s both tender and spicy at the same time. By putting a new spin onto the age-old prata dish, Prata Alley has created a bevy of delicious and innovative dishes for all to enjoy. (Jun 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Big One, Tumeric Rush, Chicken Sambal Briyani, Milo Ice, Mango Lassi

html:
• ABOUT

    Pratunam market place and bar brings Bangkok’s lively Thai tradition of sipping fresh beer on busy street corners to Bencoolen street in Singapore. Start with a selection of small but flavourful bites to whet your appetite for a wonderful evening inspired by Bangkok’s variety of street food. Affordable and delicious, the restaurant offers multiple lunch set menus that make for a hearty meal. Customise your lunch according to your preferences by choosing your starter, main and drink. A signature dish at Pratuman market place and bar is the Crab Meat Bread Roll Set. Featuring generous chunks of tender and juicy crab spread across a freshly toasted bread roll, the sandwich is filled with thick warm lemon butter. Served with an in-house chilli sauce, dip the juicy crab meat into the sweet and spicy chilli for a brillant burst of flavours. A unique twist on a local favourite, the Lychee Curry Steak is a hearty one dish meal that will surely fill you up! (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crab Meat Bread Roll Set, Lychee Curry Steak

    Featuring a vibrant, contemporary setting in Fairmont Singapore, this magnificent 235-seater Italian restaurant boasts handcrafted, authentic Italian food by Chef Mauro Sanna. Enjoy delicious Italian fare at Prego with their signature Charcuterie Board. Decorated with assorted cured meats, the combination of different cuts of meat is perfect for two to three diners. Those who love fish should definitely try the Ali di Razza in “Agliata”. Served with crispy salsa chips, this bowl of fish slices is beautifully garnished with carrots and spring onions. Seafood lovers would definitely favour the Capelli d’Angelo all’Astice. Abundant with generous chunks of Maine lobster entangled in angel hair pasta, this sweet mix of tomato and meaty lobster is deliciously sweet. Thinly stretched and laden with ham, sun dried tomatoes, wild mushrooms, parmesan and mozzarella, the restaurant's signature pizza, the Prego, is the perfect dish for sharing. Finish your meal on a tasty note with the Pancetta di Maiale. A plate of slow roasted pork belly drizzled with a savoury sauce, dig into this hearty dish for mouthfuls of juicy pork meat. (Mar 2021)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Preludio is a contemporary dining concept from Fernando Arévalo that moves with time in orchestrated chapters. The word preludio, which may be translated as "introduction" or "prelude", alludes to the constant beginning of something new. For its debut, Preludio will open with Monochrome, where the restaurant will be inspired in black and white. To remove colour from an object is to strip it down to its fundamental self - everything raw and everything pure. Opening with this rudimentary idea of black and white seemed only befitting for Preludio as it embarks on this unconventional journey. (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    La Cortina, Pata Negra, Burrata Parmigiana

• ABOUT

    Casual yet chic, Privé exudes an allure of laidback charm reminiscent of its sister at Keppel Bay and not just because of the relaxing waterfront river view. The ACM branch delivers and upholds the Privé brand of approachable and delicious fare. Comforting favourites are the perfectly poached Eggs Benedict, tender Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger and their famous Sticky Date Pudding. Other than the familiar favourites, the menu offers some exciting new dishes. The health-conscious city-goer will be delighted to find that Privé ACM takes care of their needs with their range of “healthier choice” salads and sandwiches, while tourists can enjoy local favourites like Thai Vegetable Curry and Nasi Goreng. Vegans and vegetarians will also be delighted with the wide range of plant-based options from award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice and Tracy’s Favourite Salad to indulgent tiramisus. Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. Drop by for happy hour from 4pm to 9pm daily.As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet friendly. If you’re looking for a place to bring your furry friends, you may visit our pet-friendly sister outlets, Privé Robertson Quay, Privé Tiong Bahru, or Bayswater Kitchen. (Nov 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Serving signatures like the eggs benedict, wagyu burger and the must-try sticky date pudding – one of the best in town, in our opinion.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggs Benedict, Plant Power Breakfast, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Pan-Roasted Chilli & Lime Salmon, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Spaghetti Aglio Olio With Roast Pork Belly, Impossible Meatballs In Tomato Sauce, 85% Dark Chocolate Cake, Sticky Date Pudding

• ABOUT

    Located in Singapore’s first UNESCO World Heritage Site, Privé is an all-day dining and drinks venue sitting amidst the lush greenery of the Singapore Botanic Gardens.Conveniently located near the Nassim Gate Visitor Centre with sheltered carpark and taxi stand access, Privé is ideal for pre or post exploration of the Garden’s lush greenery and many meandering paths. Come at sunrise and welcome the morning with other early birds with a hot cup of coffee and hearty breakfast. In the afternoon, you can seek reprieve from the sun with a healthy salad and refreshing iced tea. When night comes and the temperature drops, be sure to enjoy the alfresco seating with a cocktail and some small bites, before you tuck into a hearty dinner, dining ‘under the stars’. And we know that no walk is complete without your children and pet in tow, so we are completely child and pet-friendly. We also offer both indoor air-conditioned dining and outdoor alfresco seating so you can choose your dining preference according to the weather. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ultimate Big Breakfast, Happy Belly Buddha Bowl, Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger, Singaporean Seafood Laksa

html:
• ABOUT

    Prive is the only standalone pavilion in CHIJMES and commands an impressive plot of prime courtyard real estate, and dons a look that's fresher and more chic than anything else around. The sprawling portico is outfitted in bamboo, teak and concrete, channeling the organic feel of the characteristic CHIJMES greenery. The simple lines and casual furnishings offer a roomy backyard feel, but elevated with design-centric touches, so it's more of what we would imagine Gwyneth Paltrow's back lawn to be like rather than our next-door neigbour's. Vintage green brick and terracotta tiles are reflected from the rattan-clad mirrors, all cast with a romantic glow come nighttime. The set-up, along with the varied menu, allow Prive to be a great spot for both brunch with the family, or an after work hangout with friends. The menu has brought along the most-loved dishes from Keppel Bay including Eggs Benedict, crispy Fish & Chips we can't seem to get out of our heads, satisfying Impossible Meat burgers, and divine Sticky Date Pudding. Being added to the mix are stone-baked pizzas, hearty brunch as well as local favourites like the Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice and Traditional Chicken Curry. If you prefer snacking, then the selection of bar food, including Breaded Crab Cakes and Crispy Chicken Wings are ideally suited to enjoy with the extensive range of cocktails, affordable beers and wines. Drop by for happy hour from 4pm to 8pm (Last Order: 9:30pm) daily and relax in the garden with an ice-cold drink in hand. Think of it as your own backyard, just better. Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet friendly. If you’re looking for a place to bring your furry friends, you may visit our pet-friendly sister outlets, Privé Robertson Quay, Privé Tiong Bahru, or Bayswater Kitchen. (Nov 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "One of the best parts of this outlet is their huge alfresco space, a prime spot for people watching among the white walls of the heritage building. There's lots of bar snacks, beers and wines to go around - so drink up." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eggs Benedict, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Roast Pork Belly, Impossible Meatball Spaghetti, Sticky Date Pudding

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Privé Grill @ The University Club offers affordable French classics served in a cosy and casual setting away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The distinctive location in the National University of Singapore affords the unique opportunity to re-live some university nostalgia and dine like an academic would. During lunch, it is an ideal spot to grab a delectable weekly set lunch from only $28, while at night, affordable set dinners (with a la carte options) from $42, featuring Salmon Tartare, Escargots, Ribeye Steak, Lamb Shank, Tarte Tatin & more will tantalise the taste buds. Privé Grill @ The University Club, which is also open to the public, offers the choice of an intimate indoor dining area, breezy alfresco terrace and informal lounge seating. Those looking for something more private can also book the Private Dining Room (PDR) for intimate soirees or jubilant celebrations. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Tartare, Escargots, Ribeye Steak, Lamb Shank, Tarte Tatin

html:
• ABOUT

    Privé’s first venture into the east, this convenient location is found in Katong. Choose from their all-day menu and get a platter to share. Go with their Ultimate Big Breakfast and order a few mains over drinks to maximise your stomach space and coin. If meat options are not your thing, Privé’s inclusive menu also features plant-based options to satisfy your food cravings. Stay happy and healthy with their Happy Belly Buddha Bowl. Consisting of a delicious mix of brown rice, avocados, carrot, edamame, and more, all topped with a creamy roasted sesame dressing, you’re guaranteed to be satiated and full. Privé’s Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger is a must-try, and it’s a crowd favourite with tender, juicy pork knuckle over a bed of lettuce and fluffy bun. Enjoy this sinfully indulgent burger that satisfies any meat cravings and leaves you hungry for more of it’s smoky flavour. They also offer freshly made stone-baked pizzas that are great for sharing too, and you can choose either a half and half or whole pizza, depending on your preference. Our pick is the Spicy Meat Lover and Truffled Field Mushroom Madness. Perfect toppings that mix amazingly well together, this combination gives you the best of both mushroom-y meaty goodness topped with melted cheese. If you’re looking for more Asian flavours, Privé’s Singaporean Seafood Laksa brings it home with authentic coconut curry and sweet, fresh seafood. Privé also offers a competitive happy-hour menu, so be sure to make the most of your dollar and catch them during their promotional offer. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ultimate Big Breakfast, Happy Belly Buddha Bow, Pulled Pork Knuckle Burger, Spicy Meat Lover, Singaporean Seafood Laksa

html:
• ABOUT

    Privé Keppel Bay is a casual and children-friendly venue which the whole family can spend hours enjoying. Strategically located right by the water’s edge, diners can choose to relax indoors in air-conditioned comfort or savour the cool sea breeze amidst lush greenery in the expansive al fresco area.Privé Keppel Bay makes every effort to ensure the freshest food is prepared with exacting standards, making your visit to Keppel Bay completely worthwhile. Privé Keppel Bay’s simple and down-to-earth menu can satisfy a variety of appetites. Hungry diners might just appreciate hearty choices, like the all-day breakfast, stone-baked pizzas, pastas and even local delights, while the peckish can enjoy a simple pastry, freshly-baked cakes or one of the menu’s many beverage items (thick milkshakes, TWG teas, and gourmet coffees). With unbeatable views of the award-winning Marina and Sentosa, Privé Keppel Bay will definitely brighten your day with its cheerful décor and friendly servers. Drop by for happy hour from 4-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm) daily.Privé Keppel Bay is also very kid-friendly with a separate kid’s menu, indoor library and TV area, as well as an impressive outdoor playground that the kids can spend hours at. As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet friendly. If you’re looking for a place to bring your furry friends, you may visit our pet-friendly sister outlets, Privé Robertson Quay, Privé Tiong Bahru, or Bayswater Kitchen. (Nov 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Plain in looks but tasting so good, their New York cheesecake makes our list for one of the best versions made—smooth and creamy with just the right balance of sweet and tart." -Epicure Asia “We truly enjoy kicking back and relaxing here with a book, a mug of their Valrhona Caraïbe 66 percent hot chocolate and a slice of lemon meringue pie.” -SG Now “Don’t miss the caramelized banana and macadamia crumble, which comes with a dollop of vanilla ice cream served in a nut-flavored filigree nest.” -The Wall Street Journal "The baby of Michelin-starred chef Wayne Nish, the 50-seat alfresco eatery dishes out scrumptious café fare such as salads, pies and indulgent cakes, along with a number of signature items – deluxe milkshakes and chips done four ways – all guaranteed to make you salivate." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Plant Power Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, Tracy’s Favourite Salad, Ultimate Fish & Chips, Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Vegetable Curry, Sticky Date Pudding

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    During the day, the chic yet friendly environment makes it perfect for entertaining, social lunches, business meetings or just taking in the sights and sounds of Orchard Road. Start your morning off with a cup of good coffee paired with a light breakfast, or linger over a hearty lunch comprising brunch favourites, local delights and hearty mains. For something a little healthier, Privé Paragon also has lots of plant-based options from filling salads to award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice. Come evening, Privé’s alfresco deck transforms into casual place to gather for drinks and bar bites while the cosy indoors is ideal for those looking for a more intimate dining experience. Start your evening off with happy hour cocktails from 4-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm) and wines complemented with small bites at the vibey alfresco terrace, or come by at 7pm for live acoustic jazz daily. Craving something a little more substantial and cosy? Then the inviting indoor area can cater to anyone looking for either a romantic date night or a night out on the town with close friends or colleagues.Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet friendly. If you’re looking for a place to bring your furry friends, you may visit our pet-friendly sister outlets, Privé Robertson Quay, Privé Tiong Bahru, or Bayswater Kitchen. (Nov 2021)

• ABOUT

    Conveniently located in the centre of the bustling Robertson Quay neighbourhood, Prive at Robertson Quay exudes casual charm and treats diners to beautiful waterfront views as they wine and dine by the Singapore River. Prive’s all-day menu encompasses delicious brunch favourites, Asian delights, Western fare and more! As extensive as they are indulgent, the plethora of mouthwatering menu options include cakes and desserts as well as plant-based options specially crafted for vegetarians. The Plant-Based Truffled Mushroom Burger is one such option. Garnished with creamy field mushrooms, vegan Swiss cheese sauce and vegan truffle mayonnaise, this burger is packed full of flavours and greens, perfect for a quick bite. Other scrumptious delights include the Singapore Seafood Laksa, Eggs Royale and the Oreo Mudpie. As evening dawns, head out to the alfresco terrace to grab some happy hour wines, beers, spirits, and tasty bar snacks as you enjoy the evening breeze. An ideal space for social gatherings and family meals, Prive at Robertson Quay has something for everyone. Don’t forget to bring your furry friend along as they have treats and toys to keep them occupied too. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Plant-Based Truffled Mushroom Burger, Singapore Seafood Laksa, Eggs Royale, Oreo Mudpie

• PRESS RELEASE

    Conveniently located near Somerset MRT station in the busy al fresco promenade of 313@Somerset, Prive offers the same high-quality yet affordable food and drinks. Its affable and friendly service has positioned itself as one of the must-visit dining venues in the bustling Orchard Road area. Prive Somerset is a relaxed all-day dining and drinks venue where you can grab a quick bite, linger over a full meal or unwind with cold beers in a comfortable garden-esque al fresco setting. Offering juicy burgers, stone-baked pizzas, Asian fare, brunch favourites and other comforting dishes which are guaranteed to satisfy, Prive beckons you to take a break from the hectic pace of life and just chill.The daily Happy Hour from 4-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm) is even more reason to linger on for a refreshing cocktail and gourmet bar bites. Casual, friendly and familiar, feel free to drop by in your slippers and kick your heels up with family and friends. Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet-friendly. If you’re looking for a place to bring your furry friends, you may visit our pet-friendly sister outlets, Privé Robertson Quay, Privé Tiong Bahru, or Bayswater Kitchen. (Nov 2021)

• ABOUT

    Joining the enclave of hip cafes at Tiong Bahru is Privé, the cafe chain that's garnered a solid following for its hearty mains, decadent desserts, and laid-back atmosphere.This outlet marks Privé's first foray into a residential neighbourhood, and it couldn't have chosen a better spot than one teeming with old-school charm and nostalgia, creating the perfect vibes for a good book and a cuppa.It opens early at 8am to fuel residents and tourists exploring the area with a variety of both light and hearty breakfast options. As the crowd starts to trickle in during lunchtime, the menu expands to offer an extensive range of local delicacies, salads, burgers, pastas, and mains. In the evening, the alfresco dining area makes a great spot for nibbling on tapas and imbibing a drink or two from the bar. Drop by for happy hour from 4-10:30pm (Last Order: 10pm) daily.What makes Privé stand out from the crowd is its innovative selection of vegan and vegetarian options. Even meat-lovers can't say no to Papa’s Plant Protein Burger, Impossible™ Meatball Spaghetti, award-winning Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice or the Harrisa Spiced-Roasted Eggplant.End your meal on a decadent note with Privé's signature 85% Dark Chocolate Cake and Sticky Date Pudding. Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. (Mar 2020)

    Whether you’re looking for a place to rest your feet after a day of shopping, enjoying a fun night out, or having some late-night drinks with friends, Prive’s breezy alfresco terrace is your perfect refuge. Nestled prominently at the junction between the bustling Orchard Road and Scotts Road, this all-day dining establishment earns a place in our hearts with their amazing location, mouthwatering dishes, and refreshing drinks.Begin your day with an Eggs Benedict or Plant Power Breakfast, or tuck into mains such Tracy’s Favourite Salad or a hearty Pulled Poek Knuckle Burger. Craving for local flavours? Satisfy them with Heura Hainanese Chicken Rice or Traditional Chicken Curry. For the perfect partner-in-crime, look no further than their drinks menu where a good selection of classic and specialty cocktails, beers, spirits, and many more await you. Be sure to take advantage of the daily happy hour promotion on selected house pours between 4-11pm (Last Order: 10:30pm), and get your fix of sassy cocktails, like the Gummy Bear Margarita, which is a heady mix of tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, watermelon syrup, and irresistibly adorable gummy bears. Who can say no to that? Families with children will also be pleased with a healthy and affordable Kids Set Menu. As much as we love our furry friends, we are currently not pet-friendly. html:
• ABOUT

    A cafe with a difference, Professor Brawn Cafe was set up with a mission to provide affordable good food by an inclusive workforce comprising people of different abilities, ages and socio-economic backgrounds. Serving great food with a great cause, Professor Brawn Bistro is the perfect place to indulge in sweet treats and healthy staples. Classified under urban farming research, starters at the bistro are healthy options that include Mushroom Soup, Garden Salad with Mushroom, Caesar Salad and more. For those looking to indulge in fried food, try out their sides. The House Drumlets are a classic favorite, with mouthwatering pieces of fiery drumlets doused in the bistro’s signature sauce. Strewn with tasty shavings of truffle, the Truffle Fries are absolutely delightful, with a hint of truffle in every bite. Move on to the mains and be wowed by seafood, meat or pasta options that will leave you spoilt for choice. Classified under the study of anthropology, desserts include Waffles with Ice Cream or baked treats such as Assorted Muffins and Brownies. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mushroom Soup, House Drumlets, Pan Grilled Striploin Steak, Waffles with Ice Cream

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/professor-brawn-bistro-enabling-village
name: Professor Brawn Bistro (Enabling Village)

html:
• ABOUT

    Serving the best of Japanese-Italian fusion, Pronto is located right in the heart of Singapore’s Central Business District. A cafe by day and bar by night, Pronto changes its menu and service style according to the time of the day. Have a taste of something different when you stop by at different times of the day. Indulge yourself in Italian cuisine with the wide range of appetisers, mains and sharing platters on the menu. Start with a tantalising portion of Mini Fish & Chips before diving right into the hearty Grass Fed Striploin Steak to satisfy your meat cravings. Pasta lovers can go for the Truffle Cream Sauce Pasta. Topped with fresh cherry tomatoes for a subtle sweetness, this dish is made for truffle fans. Sharing options here include the variety of pizza flavours available. The Garlic Chicken is a hot favourite here at Pronto. Served piping hot, these slices of cheesy chicken are here to delight! End your meal on a sweet note with the Hokkaido Cream Cheese Cake or Mascarpone Cheese Cake. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mini Fish & Chips, Truffle Cream Sauce Pasta, Garlic Chicken, Hokkaido Cream Cheese Cake

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pronto
name: Pronto

Cuisine: Bar, Australian, Fusion, Seafood, Vegetarian Friendly, Cafe
html:
• ABOUT

    Knock yourself out on a spread of wholesome café nosh at The Providore, which hosts a café, deli, bakery, and grocery space within itself. The establishment's dedication to serving up good food is apparent from the start - one bite and you're sure to be hooked. Its creations are lovingly made with fresh seasonal ingredients, and it shows. When at the café, be sure to try the Crab Linguini Pasta, an absolutely divine option made with sundried tomato, bird's eye chili, and fresh basil - cooked to al dente perfection, this is one pasta dish you won't be soon forgetting. The Pan Seared Barramundi is another must-have, with its accompanying Mexican rice, home-made corn tortillas and guacamole. If you're there for breakfast, however, then you can't go wrong with their signature Ricotta Pancakes, which comes with caramelised banana, candied walnuts, and sugar syrup. The Providore does a particularly fragrant latte too, if you're looking for a coffee on the side. There's much to love about the place, with its versatility and commitment to quality - you won't regret a visit! (Oct 2017)

  • ABOUT

    The Providore at Raffles City is a well-loved cafe offering an all-day dining menu that includes signature dishes, familiar favourites, and a plethora of healthy dining options. Drop by during the day for a quick caffeine fix or during the night for after-work socials to relax and unwind. There’s no better place than The Providore to grab a fuss-free and delicious breakfast to fuel you up for the day. Crowd favourites here include the Smashed Avocado on Toast, Ricotta Pancakes and Sourdough Toast. Fresh from the cafe’s bakery in Downtown Gallery, the artisanal breads and pastries are made fresh daily by a team of skilled bakers using traditional methods and high quality, all-natural ingredients. From healthy breads to classic bakes such as sourdough and baguettes, The Providore has a wide variety of freshly baked treats for a quick and simple meal anytime of the day. Made up of sugar, spice and cocoa beans, order a cup of chocolate drink and enjoy it your way — iced or hot! Alternatively, diners can get refreshed with a flavour bomb of Sparkling Organic Juice. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smashed Avocado on Toast, Ricotta Pancakes, Fettucce Pasta, Sparkling Organic Juice

  • ABOUT

    Conveniently located at Level 2 of Wisma Atria along Singapore’s bustling shopping district, The Providore is a versatile space fit for holding a variety of occasions including business meetings, casual dining, intimate dinners and after work socials. Explore the European cafe’s plethora of all day dining favourites in the airy open concept space with family and friends any time of the day. The Lobster Mac & Cheese is a yummy combination of pastificio dei campi pasta and poached lobster that is layered and baked in a light cheese sauce. Another huge crowd favourite here is the Risotto. Served with shredded duck confit, mushrooms, green peas and drizzled with just the right amount of truffle oil, fans of this classic Italian dish should not miss out on ordering this scrumptious menu option! Pair with your choice of coffee, tea or drinking chocolate and chai to make it a meal. Hearty eaters who still have space left for dessert can approach the servers to seek out the selection of freshly baked breads, cakes, pastries and desserts such as the Strawberry Shortcake and Mont Blanc, as well as seasonal delights created to inspire and delight taste buds. Cheese lovers will also be delighted to know that apart from an extensive wine range, the cafe also features a cheese counter filled with an assortment of gourmet cheese. Make your own platter or take your pick from the menu of exclusive dishes - either way, we promise you a meal filled with good food and great wine! (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Mac & Cheese, Risotto, Strawberry Shortcake, Mont Blanc, Cheese Platters, Crab Linguini Pasta, Club Sandwich, Nicoise Salad

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in a quiet corner of Ann Siang Hill, this PS. Cafe outlet is the perfect spot if you’re looking to hang out in the city without all the hustle and bustle. The colonial-inspired interiors — think black leather banquettes, white marble tops, and chic dark woods — are paired with casual European classics with a hint of Asian flavour. The Fish & Chips, for instance, are a British classic. But here, the batter is infused with local Tiger beer, a crispy shell encasing a delicious fork-tender fish. Crab Tart is something you can have for both lunch or dinner. Handpicked slivers of blue swimmer crab are spiced up with chilli and kaffir lime, sitting pretty in a rich buttery shortcrust with prawn bisque. Feel like something a little more clean? Tuck into the Green Goddess Pesto Penne, whole-wheat pasta with plenty of fresh garden vegetables and a tasty house-made herb and pinenut pistou. In a dining landscape where restaurants are constantly evolving, PS. Cafe manages to stay a place where friends and families come back to again and again for refreshed classics and the beautiful chic interiors. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Green Goddess Pesto Penne, Laksa Leaf Pesto Pasta, Crab Tart, Miso Cod

  • href

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Pioneers of Singapore’s cafe culture, PS.Cafe opens its eighth outlet, PS.Cafe by the Sea at East Coast Park, making this their first foray out East, away from the hustle and bustle of the city-centre. Inspired by its waterfront location while staying true to the homegrown brand, the menu showcases and celebrates seafood with exclusive dishes, while introducing a special Junior section for the first time. Starting from humble beginnings in 1999, PS.Cafe began as a cosy cafe hidden within Projectshop clothing store. The charming and understated spot quickly gained a following for its hearty takes on savoury cafe classics, famous truffle shoestring fries and indulgent cakes, puddings and tarts. Since then - over the course of 20 years, PS.Cafe has steadily expanded in Singapore and recently opened up in Shanghai and Seoul this year. Spanning over 3,000 sq ft, this 120-seater offers a multitude of crowd-pleasers, impeccably suited for friend gatherings, date nights and weekend brunches with loved ones. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lemongrass Mussel & Clam Spaghettini, Poached Ocean Trout Nicoise, Singapore Chilli Crab & Prawns, Chargrilled Octopus, Chorizo & Calamari Stew

html:
• ABOUT

    An iconic cafe in Singapore, P.S. Cafe is where heart-to-hearts and girly pow-wows happen. Also a favourite for families, here’s where you can tuck into local delights as well as international staples. Variety is the spice of life here. Highlights include Middle Eastern-inspired dishes such as the Impossible Bombay Koftas, a vegetarian-friendly feast which consists of cauliflower, potato hash, cucumber and a mint salad. For a meaty option, try the Kashmiri Lamb Chops, with a tender char-grilled lamb rack accompanied by masala chat potatoes, baby green beans, spiced mint jus and tomato chutney. Other highlights include the Spiced Biryani Salad and Masala Roast Chicken. In addition to the wide selection of international fare, the cafe prides itself in serving delectable fresh bakes and sweet treats. French-inspired desserts such as the Normandy Pie of the Day, Burnt Rum & Raisin Cheesecakes as well as Cinnamon Dipping Fingers are perfect grab-and-go bites for breaks in between retail therapy. P.S. Don’t say no to their PS. Fluffy Pancakes! (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spiced Biryani Salad, Kashmiri Lamb Chops, Impossible Bombay Koftas, PS. Fluffy Pancakes

html:
• ABOUT

    This iconic brunch spot and homegrown culinary gem has become a staple destination for lazy brunches, classy afternoon teas, and luxurious dinners. PS.Cafe opened its second outlet at Harding Road in 2005 and the flagship outlet immediately stood out among its Dempsey Hill neighbours for its gorgeous space and stellar food. The cafe is set amidst lush greenery, a tropical oasis untouched by the concrete jungle that is Singapore. There’s an understated finesse about the space: sunlight floods the sprawling space through gorgeous glass-to-ceiling windows while minimalist furniture warms up the industrial-chic interior. Totally understandable if you’re tempted by the irresistible aroma of freshly baked pastries wafting through the air, but don’t forget about PS.Cafe’s brunch classics and signature cakes. With a Bellini or a Mimosa in hand, tuck into the PS. Fluffy Pancakes, the PS. Big Breakfast, or the irresistible PS. Brunch Burger, alongside the famed Truffle Shoestring Fries. Health junkies will especially enjoy the Superseed Granola and the protein-packed Kale Florentine. All-day treats include specialty sandwiches such as the Croque Monsieur and the PS. Steak as well as the Crab Tart, where handpicked blue swimmers are pan-fried with chili and kaffir before being drizzled with luscious prawn bisque sauce and homemade harissa. You haven’t been to PS.Cafe if you didn’t enjoy a slice of their delish cakes, though we reckon that one slice’s not gonna be enough. The famed Double Chocolate Blackout Cake served with dark chocolate sauce is a definite must-try, though unique sweets such as the Flourless Orange Cake, PS. Ginger Brulee, and the Sticky Date Steamed Pudding are treats straight from dessert heaven that should earn well-deserved top spots on your go-to list as well. We could go on, really, but we prefer to let the flawless dishes speak for themselves, so don’t forget to make your booking at this always-packed space. (Sep 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “There’s no denying: we are big fans of the PS.Cafe brand. There’s great food, the decor in each outlet is unique and on-point, and the dining experience is fantastic.” -Honeycombers “Highly recommended is the hearty Portobello Brunch Souffle. Laid atop two double-baked cheese soufflés are tasty strips of smoked bacon, a juicy baked Portobello mushroom, wilted spinach and a runny poached egg… Come early and snag one of their coveted outdoor seats to soak up the sun and enjoy the tranquil, green setting.” -Epicure Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Shoestring Fries, PS. Brunch Burger, Kale Florentine, Fluffy Pancakes, Superseed Granola, Crab Tart, Double Chocolate Blackout Cake, Sticky Date Steamed Pudding

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/ps-cafe-harding
name: PS.Cafe Harding

Menus: Brunch Menu  All Day Menu  Dessert Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    This PS.Cafe outlet comes with the perfect side of view — you get an uninterrupted, all-around view of the Marina Bay, as well as the nightly laser show from Marina Bay Sands. Also good for watching fireworks when it hits National Day or New Years’ Eve. The interiors follow the same design as all P.S outlets, with black leather banquettes and white marble tops. Food-wise, tuck into European classics with a hint of Asian flavour. The Fish & Chips, for instance, are a British classic. But here, the batter is infused with local Tiger beer, a crispy shell encasing a delicious fork-tender fish. The Crab Mee Goreng is a fusion of local and western, with slivers of hand-picked crab swimming in a bed of fried noodles. Feel like something a little more clean? Tuck into the Green Goddess Pesto Penne, whole-wheat pasta with plenty of fresh garden vegetables and a tasty house-made herb and pinenut pistou. There are also dishes exclusive to this One Fullerton outlet, like the Chargrilled Skate fish with green harissa sauce, and the Chargrilled Chunky Prawn Sandwich. The prawns are packed into a meaty patty, lightly grilled for a wonderful aroma, and served with lashings of pickled mango and coriander on crusty sourdough bread. In a dining landscape where restaurants are constantly evolving, PS.Cafe manages to stay a place where friends and families come back to again and again for refreshed classics and the beautiful chic interiors. (Sep 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “It’s not Michelin star (nor are their prices) but you’ll have a good meal – much better than a gamut of other copycat eateries that shall go unnamed – and service is better than expected.” -AugustMan

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Green Goddess Pesto Penne, Chargrilled Chunky Prawn Sandwich, Crab Mee Goreng, Crab & Prawn Laksa

  • href

name: PS.Cafe One Fullerton

html:
• ABOUT

    A brave pioneer of Singapore’s now sprawling café scene, PS.Café has stood the test of time with its effortless brunch classics. The Palais Renaissance outlet takes the same effortless chic vibe and houses it in a uber-cool standalone conservatory. The downright gorgeous interior features glass-to-ceiling windows that allow plenty of light in, Peranakan-esque tiles that add a delicate local touch, and a beautiful spiral staircase that leads you to the upper floor. Want to get away from the crowd? This tranquil haven is just minutes away. With a Bellini or a White Bouquet Sangria in hand, tuck into the PS. Fluffy Pancakes, the Portobello Brunch Souffle, or the irresistible PS. Brunch Burger, alongside the famed Truffle Shoestring Fries. Health junkies will especially enjoy the Superseed Granola and the protein-packed Kale Florentine. All-day treats include specialty sandwiches such as the Croque Monsieur and the PS. Steak as well as the iconic Crab Tart, where handpicked blue swimmers are pan-fried with chili and kaffir before being drizzled with luscious prawn bisque sauce and homemade harissa. You haven’t been to PS.Cafe if you didn’t enjoy a slice of their delish cakes, though we reckon that one slice’s not gonna be enough. The famed Double Chocolate Blackout Cake served with dark chocolate sauce is a definite must-try, though unique sweets such as the PS. Giant Salted Caramel Profiterole, M’s Carrot Cake, and the Sticky Date Steamed Pudding are treats straight from dessert heaven that should earn well-deserved top spots on your go-to list as well. We could go on, really, but we prefer to let the flawless dishes speak for themselves! (Sep 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “There’s no denying: we are big fans of the PS.Cafe brand. There’s great food, the decor in each outlet is unique and on-point, and the dining experience is fantastic. If you’re in town, opt for brunch at PS.Cafe Palais Renaissance, an iconic dining destination complete with high ceilings, classic decor, an outdoor eating area, and plenty of natural light for your perfect Instagram shot.” -Honeycombers “We just love the light and airy high ceiling-ed conservatory in which it is housed. If you’re looking to escape the maddening crowds of Orchard, step right in.” -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Rossa Penne, Truffle Shoestring Fries, PS. Brunch Burger, Portobello Brunch Souffle, Kale Florentine, Fluffy Pancakes, Crab Tart, Double Chocolate Blackout Cake

html:
• ABOUT

    PS.Cafe had its humble beginnings in 1999 within the Projectshop (hence PS) clothing store tucked away on Paragon’s upper floors. The charming spot quickly gained a cult following for its hearty takes on savoury café classics alongside its famed shoestring fries and indulgent desserts. Fast forward 19 years later and PS. Cafe has expanded to include nine more outlets under its fold. Loyal fans, however, still return to where it all began for servings of hearty nosh and a dollop of nostalgia. The cosy, laidback space immediately transports you away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road. Wood furniture dominate the decor while a charming bar takes its place in a cosy corner complete with an alluring bar top and eclectic shelves of liquor. With a Bellini or a White Bouquet Sangria in hand, tuck into timeless PS. classics such as the PS. Fluffy Pancakes, the Portobello Brunch Souffle, or the irresistible PS. Brunch Burger, alongside the famed Truffle Shoestring Fries. Health junkies will especially enjoy the Superseed Granola, and the protein-packed Kale Florentine while those craving some local flavours should look forward to the mouthwatering Laksa Pesto Spaghetti and Chicken Tau Kwa. All-day treats include specialty sandwiches such as the Mushroom Croque Monsieur and the Club Sandwich, as well as the iconic Crab Tart, where handpicked blue swimmers are pan-fried with chili and kaffir before being drizzled with luscious prawn bisque sauce and homemade harissa. You haven’t been to PS.Cafe if you didn’t enjoy a slice of their delish cakes, though we reckon that one slice’s not gonna be enough. The famed Double Chocolate Blackout Cake served with dark chocolate sauce is a definite must-try, though unique sweets such as the PS. Giant Salted Caramel Profiterole, Flourless Orange Cake, and the Sticky Date Steamed Pudding are treats straight from dessert heaven that should earn well-deserved top spots on your go-to list as well. We could go on, really, but we prefer to let the flawless dishes speak for themselves! (Sep 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “There’s no denying: we are big fans of the PS.Cafe brand. There’s great food, the decor in each outlet is unique and on-point, and the dining experience is fantastic.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Original Laksa Pesto Spaghetti, Spicy King Prawn Aglio Olio, Chicken Tau Kwa, Club Sandwich, Double Chocolate Blackout Cake, Sticky Date Steamed Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    PS.Cafe had its humble beginnings in 1999 within the Projectshop (hence PS) clothing store tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road, on Paragon’s upper floors. Fast-forward to the present, and the daring pioneer of Singapore’s now sprawling cafe scene has opened its tenth outlet on the third floor of Raffles City. The branch features the same, mouthwatering local-Western fusion cafe fare and intricate, laidback space. In fact, the cafe inhabits its own world within the iconic mall: the exterior resembles a greenhouse, with floor-to-ceiling glass windows, lush greenery, and PS.Cafe’s classic monochrome interior, creating a vibrant oasis in the heart of the central business district. Enjoy breakfast before starting the work day here with wholesome favourites such as the Breakfast Grand Slam Bunwich, the Almond & Chia Seed Granola, or PS.Cafe’s own twist of the local classic, the Kaya Toast, served with homemade organic ash white sourdough. With a cuppa or a Bellini in hand, dive right into the post-work hustle after tucking into stellar classics such as the irresistible PS. Brunch Burger, the Roasted Pork Belly Bap, not forgetting a side the famed Truffle Shoestring Fries. Alternatively, enjoy inventive takes on comfy local dishes with the PS. Prawn Noodle Soup and the PS. Crab & Prawn Laksa. Reward yourself after a tiring day with delish mains including the PS. Burger, the Tiger Beer-Battered Fish & Chips, and the iconic Crab Tart, where handpicked blue swimmers are pan-fried with chili and kaffir and drizzled with homemade harissa as well as a luscious prawn bisque sauce. On weekends, enjoy the same grub alongside the the PS. Fluffy Pancakes and the PS. Classic Benedict. You haven’t been to PS.Cafe if you didn’t enjoy a slice of their delish cakes, though we reckon that one slice’s not gonna be enough. The famed Double Chocolate Blackout Cake served with dark chocolate sauce is a definite must-try, though unique sweets such as the Flourless Orange Cake, PS. Ginger Brulee, and the Sticky Date Steamed Pudding are treats straight from dessert heaven that should earn well-deserved top spots on your go-to list as well. We could go on, really, but we prefer to let the flawless dishes speak for themselves! (Sep 2018)

    “There’s no denying: we are big fans of the PS.Cafe brand. There’s great food, the decor in each outlet is unique and on-point, and the dining experience is fantastic.” -Honeycombers

  • ABOUT

    Publico Ristorante brings a little slice of Italy to Singapore, with an emphasis on authentic and evocative Italian flavours. With interiors designed by New York firm AvroKO, the award-winning restaurant & bar boasts a multi-sensory culinary experience where you can enjoy contemporary Italian fare highlighting provenance and seasonality. Situated along the Singapore River, this lively Italian restaurant is a social hotspot that offers a haven of tropical paradise away from the bustle of city life. (Mar 2020)

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/publico-ristorante
name: Publico Ristorante

html:
• ABOUT

    Korean BBQ has long been a favourite of Singaporean diners, with various franchises popping up all over the island. However, at PUJIM, expect to be blown away by the variety and quality of the meat available. Popular with well-heeled Singaporean diners and Koreans alike, this restaurant offers a range of premium meats on communal platters, as well as a variety of dishes to go with your meal. There’s no need to worry about leaving smelling like a meat market either, since the premium exhaust nozzles ensure the air is clean and fresh. Beef Ribeye Cap steak, Wagyu Striploin, and Pork Neck are just some of the premium cuts of meat you can order and cook to desired doneness at this spot. The highlight of the menu may be the delicious cuts of meat, but there is also a host of side dishes or baechu on offer here. Choose from deliciously spicy Kimchi or the milder Selleoli Jorim - tart pickled celery. There is also the Eomuk Guk - a hearty Busan-style dish made with fish cakes, fishballs, vegetables, and rice cakes simmered in a rich broth. Diners looking to wash down their rich meal with a tipple or two are in luck - an extensive menu of Korean beers and soju is available. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pujim Combo Set, Pujim Marinated Signature Sauce Brisket, Iberico Pork Jowl, Soybean Stew

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/pujim-bbq
name: PUJIM BBQ

html:
• ABOUT

    A well-known Spanish restaurant chain, Pura Brasa opened its seventh restaurant in Tanjong Pagar Centre. Offering a unique dining experience based on their formula of quality products, expect a wide variety of dishes. Pura Brasa’s menu exudes originality with their unique spin on Spanish tapas, burgers, fish and meat, as well as grilled greats. From 12pm till 3pm daily, the set lunch menu is a satisfying three-course meal not to be missed. Start with an Avocado Salad with Ciptrio Dressing before working your way through the Tagliatelle Pasta with Homemade Marinara sauce and Meatballs. Last but not least, end your meal on a sweet note with the Dessert of the Day. Born from the idea of high quality food at affordable prices, Pura Brasa aims to deliver an unforgettable dining experience to all customers. (Jul 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    This Japanese izakaya-themed gastro-bar is a great spot for meat on sticks and cups of sake. Located in a leafy green area of Katong, Q-WA Bar and Yakitori offers a large selection of delicious Japanese grilled meats. Tuck into classic charcoal-grilled dishes like Pork Belly Shio, Tsukune and Gyu Yaki Shio. The Enoki Maki and Shiitake Maki are popular favourites — who doesn’t like the winning combination of bacon and cheese? If you need your carbs to keep you full, Q-WA Bar and Yakitori also offers rice and noodles on their menu. The Garlic Yaki Meishi is not the kind of rice you want to share with a date, but we love it for its fragrant, garlick-y aroma! Zaru Udon is a cold noodle dish that is a refreshing change from all the heavy meats you’ll be indulging in. For drinks, check out the bar that is well stocked with premium sake, as well as beers and Japanese single malt whiskies. Keep the mood light and fun with drinks like Shochu, Highballs and Umeshu! (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Katsu Cheese, Buta Bara, Gyu Yaki Shio, Garlic Yaki Meishi, Hatsu (Chicken Hearts), Shiitake Maki

  • TAKEAWAYS / DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways / delivery instead. Takeaway Operating Hours: Mon-Sun: 11-2pm, 6-10pm Promotion: Sake 1-for-1 Menu: Takeaway/Delivery Menu

• Good For

    Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks

  • ABOUT

    Hotpot has become one of the mainstays of Singaporean cuisine, but there are some things that our palates have yet to experience. Qi Lai Feng aims to enhance the hotpot dining experience with the unique “muscle fish”. A type of fish that is grown under strict conditions with a specific diet, its taste is similar to pork belly — firm, chewy, and delectable. Available exclusively at Qi Lai Feng, they’ve centred their menu and dishes around it with dry pots, soup pots, and side dishes. The Mala Fish Pot is a great option for diners looking for a kick. Made with fish, Sichuan peppercorns, and chilli, this fiery dish has the searing flavours Singaporeans have come to love, made richer by the addition of silky fish. Top it with noodles and meat to soak up the broth for the perfect meal. For something a little milder, try the Tomato Fish Pot. Sweeter and tangier than Mala, the tomato in this soup gives the dish a rich and subtle flavour that goes well with rice. Try the Collagen Q Fish Ribs soup. Clear and packed with nutrients, this mainstay of hotpot is also available here, made with fish instead. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Collagen Q Fish Ribs, Tomato Fish Pot, Mala Fish Pot, Baby Lobster

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/qi-lai-feng
name: Qi Lai Feng <U+9F50><U+6765><U+4E30>

• Good For

    Business Meetings, Fine Dining, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    Bringing out the ‘xiang’ (fragrance) in their name, Qi Li Xiang Hotpot is here to satisfy diners and whet appetites with aromatic broths and fresh ingredients. Experts of flavour, broths at Qi Li Xiang are specially curated. They’ve even experimented with their original Si Chuan Mala Broth and Hainan Coconut Chicken Broth to create their third signature broth, the Mala Chicken. Featuring a hint of coconut and spice, this spicy broth makes a delicious dip for pork belly or beef. For the non-spicy hotpot lovers, Qi Li Xiang has got you covered with their fragrant tomato hotpot base as well. While cooking the ingredients inside of the broth, it gets thicker and more flavorful over time. Make sure to leave some stomach at the end for a bowl of soup after your meal. If you're looking for the ultimate in indulgence, order a plate of scallops and abalone to enhance the flavour profile of your broth. They also serve house food specials and we recommend ordering a plate of Braised Mix and Match to share while you wait for your meats to cook. You can choose from a variety of dishes, including braised pork intestines, pork ears, beancurd and liver. Qi Li Xiang also has ala carte lunch specials like their Braised Pork Rice Bowl or Meat Sauce Noodle for those looking for a quick meal instead. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sichuan Mala Broth, Hainan Coconut Chicken Broth, Mala Chicken Broth, Braised Pork Rice Bowl, Meat Sauce Noodle

name: Qi Li Xiang Hot Pot

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    At Quaich Bar, we believe that the love for fine whisky always begins with an exquisite dream. Stocking more than 500 varieties of fine whisky, the bar is a warm embrace from the bustle of city life. Quaich Bar is one of the most exquisite whisky bars in Singapore. Since its opening in 2007, it has played host to countless social gatherings among friends and catered to the every need of business leaders looking to entertain colleagues or clients with a taste for the finer things in life. In the true spirit of this tradition, it is therefore apt that Quaich (pronounced ‘quake’) is named after the Gaelic cup, a symbol of welcome and friendship. We started in 2005 as a humble retail kiosk in Tanglin Mall called “The Whisky Store”. At that time, the market lacked a dedicated whisky bar so we pursued our passion, opening Singapore’s first whisky bar a year later at Waterfront Plaza. The venture soon reaped rewards in terms of notable accolades for our contribution to whisky culture in Singapore, being awarded the ‘Great Whisky Bar of the World’ title by the international whisky publication ‘Whisky Magazine’ in 2006. In 2007 the bar was renamed Quaich Bar, as it remains today. In 2010, Quaich Bar was voted ‘Top 10 Best Unique Bars’ by regional gastronomic publication, ‘Epicure’. It has since become a stop-over for master distillers from around the world who regularly conduct introductions or workshops to showcase their signature brands. After nine years of spreading the word of good whisky at the original outlet nestled at the corner of Waterfront Plaza next to Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, a second outlet was opened at South Beach Avenue, next to JW Marriott Hotel, in 2016. (Jan 2019)

  • DRINKS WE LOVE

    Quaich Bar's Hot Toddy, Quaich Bar’s Classic Whisky Sour, Reel Gin Tonic, Gin Fizz Ocean

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/quaich-bar-south-beach
name: Quaich Bar (South Beach)

• ABOUT

    Quentin’s Bar and Restaurant explores a contemporary dining concept that is traditionally communal and takes pride in preparing distinctive and piquant dishes with recipes passed down from generations. Savour great Eurasian favourites such as the Chicken Curry Debal while indulging in unique twists to classic desserts. Eurasian cuisine is a glorious and exotic mix of Asian and European flavours ranging from fiery hot chilli-mustard-vinegar flavoured curry to a mild cinnamon-garlic-onion flavoured stew.Located in the heart of Lion City’s most visited destinations and set in a thoughtfully restored colonial building, guests can expect a gastronomic Eurasian dining experience with a modern twist amidst Sentosa’s tranquil environment and opulent ambience. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Curry Debal, Buah Keluak Curry, Putugal & Kueh Salat

Cuisine: Bar, Chinese, Indian, Malaysian, Fusion, Local
html:
• ABOUT

    For most diners, Eurasian fare is uncharted territory. The fusion between Portuguese recipes and Malaysian and Indian spices is as unique as it is exciting, and this laid-back diner off Ceylon Road is happy to be your tour guide through the diverse landscape of these most savoury dishes. The Debal Galinhia or Chicken Devil Curry is a chicken dish named after the devil himself for its potent blend of spices, and for those that can handle some heat, it's a must try. The hearty Ros Befe presents a traditional pot roast with a boldly spiced gravy that's good to the last, fork-tender bite. The Turmeric Cabbage is a filling dish in vibrant marigold colours. Another pleasingly bright dish is the Patchri, a beautiful composition of deep purple eggplant with sweet and sour sauce. The Fretu Bendi, or fried okra, is contrastingly crisp and toothsome. (Feb 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For warm, homey fare that blends European and Asian flavours, look no further than Quentin's Eurasian Restaurant, which makes a wicked Devil's curry (a signature dish for Eurasians). While you're there, try sugee cake, a fluffy and buttery cake made with almonds." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Debal Galinhia (Chicken Devil Curry), Prawn Bostador, Ros Befe, Porka Semur, Turmeric Cabbage, Fretu Bendi, Patchri, Chap Chye, Sugee Cake

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • ABOUT

    Bringing the best of Irish pubs and delicious Irish food, Quinn's The Irish Tavern is sure to please you. Dedicated to serving tasty Irish bar food that goes perfectly with their liquor, it’s perfect for diners to unwind after a long day. Quinn's offers an extensive liquor menu filled with cocktails and hard liquors; the hardest decision is finding the best food and drink pairing. Warm up with The Irish Bacon, an eggs, beacon, mushrooms, and tomatoes dish that pairs perfectly with a cool craft beer. For more conventional bar food, go for Quinn’s Piglet Pizza that’s full of meaty, cheesy goodness and amazing for a night of boisterous drinks. Alcoholic drinks to try here include the Singapore Sling and the Nutty Irish Man. For diners looking for light bites, Quinn’s serves a tapas menu with dishes like Chilli Concarne Fries and Quinn’s Beef Cubes that are great to snack on over good conversation. Can't decide? Go for their Quinn’s Platter, which features the likes of Roasted Pork, Chilli Mussels, Fish Fingers and more. This plate is perfect for sharing and for people who want to try a little bit of everything without feeling too full. Quinn's tasty menu and welcoming ambiance ensure that you'll never go thirsty or hungry when you visit. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    The Irish Bacon, Quinn’s Piglet Pizza, Quinn’s Beef Cubes, Nutty Irish Man, Quinn’s Platter

html:
• ABOUT

    Experience a home away from home at QIN restaurant and bar, where a plethora of classic dishes are reimagined with a modern yet intimate touch. A place where culture meets and kinship ignites, taste QIN's contemporary and innovative take on well-loved delights that tug at the heartstrings of one’s home when you drop by The Clan Hotel. Featuring an open kitchen concept that offers diners a visual spectacle while they await their masterpieces, the restaurant boasts Chinese design elements coupled with granite and wood finishing that creates an elegant dining experience. Bask in nostalgia at QIN with their extensive menu that celebrates the diversity of Singapore. Start with a warm cup of Siphon Mushroom Tea to whet your appetite before diving into the various main dishes. A scrumptious favourite, the Hainan, No Rice Please is a plateful of free-range organic chicken served up with chicken chips, barley grain ball, garlic chilli aioli and shoyu jus. Meat lovers can opt for the Canton Crisp. Braised in pickled cream and paired with a hearty portion of crispy noodles, this tender beef brisket is just the dish to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Wash down your meal with a glass of signature cocktail that pairs exquisitely with the food and savour the taste of home. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Siphon Mushroom Tea, Hainan, No Rice Please, Canton Crisp, The Five Kings

html:
• ABOUT

    Racines, which means “roots” in French, is a restaurant that grows out of two very different but spiritually intertwined cuisines. The elaborate sauces and flavours of French cuisine meet the à la minute robustness of Chinese cooking, with each cuisine getting half of the menu, allowing diners to create a fascinating fusion meal unlike any other. Helmed by famed Executive Chef Jean-Charles Dubois, this restaurant spreads out over four live cooking stations that turn locally-sourced and organically-grown produce into elegant plates, a truly unique hotel buffet experience. There is also an à la carte menu that sprawls the full gamut of these two rich cuisines. In this fashion, you may see a classic pot-roasted French hen, a corn-fed beauty cooked in a pot with French potatoes and vegetables served up with a plate of stir-fried Frog Legs in a fiery Szechuan sauce. Or a beautifully slow-braised Wagyu Cheek served alongside crunchy Sweet & Sour Kurobuta Pork, or scallion-kissed wok-fried Angus Beef Cubes. Both cuisines unite in their love for seafood. On the French side, there’s a massive platter of premium Fruits de Mer (fruits of the sea), including Alaskan king crab, freshly shucked oysters, and scallop carpaccio on an iced platter. On the Chinese side, the ubiquitous Abalone, except here served sashimi-style with a sea urchin sauce and a sprinkling of lemony breadcrumbs. Dessert is a grab-bag of options: delicate French gateaux flavoured with strawberries, dark chocolate, or praline rub shoulders with Asian flavours like red bean, yuzu, and mango sticky rice. The quality of cooking is truly unmatched, and who knows, you may discover some delicious food pairings for yourself at this culinary wonderland. Come experience one of the island’s most exciting fusion experiences today! (Nov 2017)

  • SAVE UP TO 10% WITH CHOPEDEALS

html:
• ABOUT

    Exuding a welcoming vibe and surrounded by lush greenery, Raffles Courtyard is the city's social space in a lushly landscaped alfresco venue at the Raffles Arcade. This friendly bar and lounge offers guests a garden respite against a colonial architectural backdrop, complete with refreshing shared summer drinks and a selection of Southeast Asian small plates, including authentic Singaporean delights. Perfect for the all-year-round summery weather in Singapore, this bar is where the city comes to socialize, meet, and spend time at. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Laksa Spring Rolls, Salted Egg Squid, Singapore Chilli Crab Cake, Watermelon & Beetroot Salad, Original Singapore Sling

  • PROMOTIONS

    Happy Hour SpecialsToast to the end of a work day with $10++ selected house pours, wines and more.When: Mon-SunTime: 6-9pmClick here to view the menu"Love Thy Neighbour"Raffles Courtyard invites our surrounding neighbours with offices on one of the 4 historical roads (North Bridge Road, Seah Street, Bras Basah and Beach Road) surrounding Raffles Hotel Singapore for two complimentary sticks of satay with your first drink.

  • HAWKER STORIES AT RAFFLES COURTYARD - MR TERSMELL (30 MAR TO 17 APR)

    Celebrate Singapore’s beloved hawker culture and the home-grown culinary talents behind them as Raffles Courtyard presents, Hawker Stars at Raffles Courtyard. Relive delectable creations from popular hawker stalls that had shuttered during the pandemic right in the heart of the city. Discover our collaboration with Hady Jay, the friendly hawker behind the popular Malay food stall, Mr Tersmell, which was formerly located at Turf Club. Hady Jay specialises in Pulut Kuning, a well-loved specialty consisting of turmeric glutinuous rice accompanied by an assortment of delectable toppings. During this collaboration, enjoy Hady Jay's signature specialties comprising of the traditional Pulut Kuning with Beef Rendang and Curry Chicken, and the Indonesian dessert of Bubur Pulut Hitam with Vanilla Ice Cream. When: 30 Mar to 17 Apr 2022Time: 5-9pmMode of guarantee: Full TokenizationClick here to view the menu.

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in Duxton Hill, Raku Raku Japanese Dining serves simple but delicious authentic Japanese fare prepared with passion and sincerity. Drop by in the afternoon to enjoy affordable and delicious lunch sets to get more bang for your buck! Served with rice, miso soup, side dish and a generous serving of Japanese pickles, Raku Raku Japanese Dining offers a wide variety of filling lunch sets for a fuss free meal. Be it beef, chicken or pork, the restaurant’s got it all! Meat lovers can look forward to satisfying their carnivorous cravings with the Beef Steak Set, Chicken Karaage Set or the Pork Cutlet Set. For those who love their tempura, the Prawn Tempura Set and Tempura Mix Set are hearty servings of yummy fried food best enjoyed with soft, fluffy short grain Japanese rice. Other menu options that come highly recommended include the Chicken Udon, Zaru Soba, Minced Tuna Don and more. Add on extra dishes such as the Boiled Sausage or Grilled Squid to fill up your table with all sorts of Japanese delights. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Cube Steak, Original Gyoza, Karaage Deep Fried Chicken, Grilled Hokke Fish

html:
• ABOUT

    Calling all lovers of authentic Japanese cuisine! Raku Raku Japanese Dining located along Stanley Street is a hidden gem that offers all your classic Japanese favourites at great prices. Dive right into yummy sushi rolls and traditional Japanese fare with the various daily specials featured on the restaurant’s rotating menu. The Aburi Salmon Roll Sushi is a must order dish made up of fresh fatty salmon sashimi seared to perfection atop lumps of fluffy Japanese rice. Another salmon dish that is as healthy as it is tasty is the Smoked Salmon Salad. Drenched in a light olive drizzle, this bowl of greens and fresh salmon sashimi is perfect for those on the hunt for a light meal. Fried delights that are extremely popular among the crowd include the Karaage Deep Fried Chicken, Deep Fried Oyster as well as the Kawa Ebi Karaage. Try pairing these signature dishes with your choice of drinks from the wide selection of exquisite sakes available at the restaurant to savour the full Japanese dining experience. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Cube Steak, Original Gyoza, Karaage Deep Fried Chicken, Aburi Salmon Roll Sushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Set within a relaxing space along Dempsey Road, Rakuichi specialises in dishing out authentic and tasty Japanese fare at pocket-friendly prices. Sashimi is a must to start the meal, and the fresh slices of raw fish presented elegantly on a platter are definite crowd-pleasers. Grilled meats are a highlight at Rakuichi — your eyes feast first on the generous cubes of meat on skewers, presented on a small charcoal-grill and cooked before you. It’s enough to work up an appetite (not that you’ll need to) for the smoke-kissed, lightly charred meats bursting with flavour. There’s also comfort food to indulge in, such as soft-shell crab karaage, plump breaded oysters that are crispy and creamy at the same time, as well as enoki mushrooms wrapped in thick strips of fatty bacon. Put this on your go-to list if you’re a Japanese food lover. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sashimi, Sumiyaki Moriawase, Soft Shell Crab Karaage, Breaded Oysters, Enoki Mushrooms & Bacon

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/rakuichi-japanese-restaurant
name: Rakuichi Japanese Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Your answer to late-night cravings lies at The Ramen House, a Japanese eatery that opens till 6am. The folks here serve a wide array of ramen with their signature homemade broth, where chicken or pork meat and bones have simmered patiently for 30 hours to create a smooth, rich and milky texture. The Volcano Ramen is their best-seller, with succulent pieces of chicken cha shu accompanied by dollops of "red hot lava", a paste of red chillies and dried Indian chilli padi. Another indulgent option is the Abalone Seafood Ramen that comes with a plump abalone and tempura prawns and squid deep fried to perfection. Even if you're not in the mood for ramen, other dishes from their extensive menu are sure to catch your fancy. There’s even a good selection of Sake, Shochu and Hokkaido Wines to wash all the food down at the end of your meal. From innovative sushi creations to hearty Kushiyaki Bento sets and Donburis, you’ll have to make several trips to try them all (but we aren’t complaining!). (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Volcano Ramen, Cha Shu Ramen, Kushiyaki Set, Kaisen Don, Abalone Seafood Ramen

  • TAKEAWAY/DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    NA

html:
• ABOUT

    Here’s a halal Japanese eatery that opens till 5am, serving a wide array of ramen infused with a local twist. They’ve swapped the typical tonkotsu ramen broth with a chicken base, one that’s been patiently simmering for 30 hours, resulting in a rich and smooth texture. The Volcano Ramen is their best-seller, with succulent pieces of cha-shu accompanied by dollops of "red hot lava", a paste of red chillies and dried Indian chilli padi. Another indulgent option is the Abalone Seafood Ramen that comes with a plump abalone and tempura prawns and squid deep fried to perfection. Even if you're not in the mood for ramen, other dishes from their extensive menu are sure to catch your fancy. From innovative sushi creations to hearty Kushiyaki Bento sets and Donburis, we couldn’t ask for a better excuse to be pigging out with a bunch of friends after hours. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Volcano Ramen, Chicken Cha Shu Ramen, Kushiyaki Set, Kaisen Don, Matcha Yoghurt Soft Serve

    Centrally located in the heart of Singapore's city centre, Rang Mahal is a fine-dining destination that serves up the best of Indian cuisine with modern flair. Taking pride in quality, excellence and focused on cooking from the heart, a meal at the acclaimed restaurant entails more than the assembly of freshest ingredients and culinary finesse; Rang Mahal represents fine dining that is unpretentious and exemplary, bringing people together through familiar yet refreshing flavours that delight the palate and nourish the body and soul.Since its establishment in 1971, Rang Mahal has been recognised as one of Singapore's leading Indian fine-dining restaurants with accolades such as the Singapore Brand Prestige Award – Heritage Brands Award, Wine Spectator's Award of Excellence from 2016 to 2018 and the Michelin Plate in 2018 and 2019. (Jan 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "We'd recommend this restaurant anytime." -SG Now "Its menu is testimonial to the chefs' masterful handling of authenticity and contemporary influences. Perhaps one of the best meals we've had in recent memory." -Lifestyle Asia

  • ABOUT

    Curated by chefs Alastiar and Shaun, Rascals is an inventive gastrobar along the fringes of Tanjong Pagar, open for both lunch and dinner. Joining the ranks of bars and amazing food on this swanky avenue, Rascals is the brainchild of the chefs’ many travels and experiences. Made with the intent of concocting an international menu, they’ve done exactly that. Sandwiches are great options from Rascals’ lunch menu. Go for their Vietnamese-inspired Banh Mi-fletta, consisting of a fish sauce caramelised pork belly, shredded pork, luncheon pate, and assorted pickles on Vietnamese Baguette. It’s the ultimate indulgence and the perfect savoury lunch treat that leaves your tastebuds satisfied. For a Japanese Twist, try their Ajitsuke Tamago Egg Mayo Sandwich. With gooey soy-marinated eggs, egg mayo, and yuzu kosho between two pieces of buttery brioche toast, it is the ultimate indulgence for an umami lunch. For sides to share, we recommend their Boneless Fried Chicken Thighs. Juicy, tender, crispy — need we say more? Rascals has a local lineup for a satisfying diner. For starters, their Crispy Chicken Skin is a delicious dish that you can snack on while you wait for your mains. Paired with a refreshing pint, soak in the best feel-good vibes with great company. For mains, try their Belacan Tiger Prawns with Roasted Candlenuts, a savory and addictive prawn dish that has you going back for seconds. There’s always room for dessert. Polish off the meal with a sweet scoop of Coco Loco, a delicious roasted coconut sorbet mixed with different types of coconut textures to create a milky and satisfying end to your meal. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Banh Mi-fletta, Ajitsuke Tamago Egg May Sandwich, Crispy Chicken Skin, Local Pearl Grouper, Coco Loco
