  • ABOUT

    Enjoy good food, drinks and conversations with your loved ones at Raw Kitchen Bar (RKB). Located along Kallang Riverside, this intimate bar and restaurant features a secluded garden, perfect for intimate dinners.Representing a return to the basics, RKB is a celebration of the realness and rawness of being present, inviting you to sample their delicious menu of backyard comfort cuisine, inspired by punchy flavours from the Southern Hemisphere.Be sure to try out their signature Herbal Tuna Tartare. Served with a generous side of fresh perilla leaves, enjoy the tartare in this leafy goodness! The Black Ink Rice is a great option for those looking for a more filling meal. Flavoured with squid ink sofrito and topped with juicy charred tiger prawns, the in-house sambal chilli enhances the medley of flavours, turning it into an incredibly savoury and satisfying dish not to be missed out on. End your meal with the well-loved Limber. A crowd pleaser, this classic childhood Puerto Rican popsicle is served in seasonal flavours and makes for a refreshingly sweet end to a sumptuous meal. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cauliflower Tacos, Herbal Tuna Tartare, Warung Pork Ribs, Miso Jerk Chicken, Black Mamba, Rum Berry Tart

  • ABOUT

    Tucked along Kensington Park, The Rebel Company Cafe & Bar (Serangoon Gardens) is known for whipping up delectable Western classics from bacon waffles to fish and chips and roasted chicken. Choose from a variety of all-day breakfast favourites from the restaurant’s famous All Day Breakfast Menu. For something sweet and savoury, go for the Ultimate French Toast. Drizzled with coffee maple syrup and snow powder, the crispy toast is topped with blueberries and strawberries. The restaurant’s highly raved waffles are also a must-try. You can even customise your waffle with the cafe’s Build Your Own Waffle option. Don’t leave without tasting the Crispy ‘Pork’ Knuckle. A delightful twist on the classic local favourite, the pork knuckle is baked German style and served with mashed potato and mixed greens. Another dish worthy of mention is the Fried Steak. Featuring cubes of tender steak soaked in mixed herb crumbs, this fragrant dish is not to be missed! A great place for drinks and brunch, be sure to drop by The Rebel Company Cafe and Bar for an indulgent meal. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ultimate French Toast, Crispy ‘Pork’ Knuckle, Fried Steak, Rebel Feast

• ABOUT

    Red Crab Singapore, as its name suggests, serves up fresh crab and other ocean gems. Be sure to grab your buddies and order the assorted seafood package that comes with a crab, cockles, prawns, cheese hotdog, and corn. You can even choose the sauce you'd like the seafood to be cooked in: Chilli, black pepper, or salted egg, which is by far our favourite. For those who love crab but are too lazy to peel it, Red Crab even has a Crabmeat Steamed Egg, with fluffy egg chock full of tender crabmeat. There’s also a variety of finger food available, such as popcorn chicken, cheese fries, and even "maggi mee", the perfect accompaniments to a hearty seafood feast. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seafood Package, Popcorn Chicken, Cheese Fries

• ABOUT

    Here’s your new go-to for delicious smoked meats at an affordable price. Imported from an exclusive butcher in California, the grass-fed produce have been transformed into perfectly marbled steaks with an even ratio of fat to meat. Chicken, pork ribs, and pork belly are also available for diners looking for something other than beef. The Angus Short Ribs are one of their popular items, and it’s no surprise why — the ribs are tender and flavourful. Made from meat selected specifically for smoking, the thick ribs have been cooked for six hours that result in a tender, melt-in-your-mouth bite. The Iberico Duroc Short Ribs are another great option for diners who prefer a beefier alternative. Seasoned with dry rub and smoked for four hours, these ribs are sweet, spicy, and juicy. For something a little lighter, go for the Smoked Chicken Flatbread, topped with veggies and a helping of delightfully tender chicken. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Angus Short Ribs, Iberico Duroc Short Ribs, Smoked Chicken Flatbread

html:
• ABOUT

    A decades-old operation originally from the East Coast, Red House Seafood upholds the tradition of classic seafood dishes with a focus on freshness. Established in 1976 in a literal red house in East Coast, the restaurant has had its roots in the community for some time now, and its growth to various outlets across the island is a testament to its tasty fare. The original red house was a bastion for just-caught fish and crustaceans, delivered fresh from local fishing boats. The crimson-coloured facade was a symbol of prosperous and communal dining, further adorned with traditional red lanterns. Now, the Clarke Quay outlet has very few red-coloured accoutrements, as the decor takes on a more understated look. For a casual step up from the outdoor seafood restaurants, this incarnation of Red House fits the bill perfectly, favouring simple functionality over flair. The one red item that's not going anywhere though, is their famed Chilli Crab, and with good reason. While there's much debate over which recipe reigns supreme in Singapore, Red House is consistently named among the top contenders. Here, the spicy gravy tastes especially homemade and doesn't mask the freshness of the crab. With a bilingual menu written in both English and Chinese, Red House Seafood offers patrons a wealth of seafood options split into categories, all kept at more reasonable price points than you may expect. Prepared using a mix of Chinese and local Singaporean cooking methods, menu items include savoury dishes, like Fried Hor Fun, Lobster Pao Fan, and Creamy Custard Sauce Lobster that are all absolute must-tries. (Dec 2016)

  • SAVE 10% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    "The food's good, and the space is modern and comfortable for a seafood joint. Plus, it's rare to get local seafood specialties so close to the city center." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Pao Fan, Creamy Custard Sauce Lobster, White Pepper Crab, Fried Seafood Hor Fun, Chilli Crab, Takesumi Chilli Crab Buns, Crispy Cereal Prawns

    "Groups of businessmen, families, couples, locals and tourists all pile into the restaurant to enjoy high quality seafood dishes. Signature Dishes include the much-loved Singaporean favorite Chilli Crab, the delectably sweet and sticky Creamy Custard Prawns, the salty and savoury BBQ Cod Fish in Teriyaki Sauce and the sensational Thai-inspired Spicy Seafood Combination." -USA Today "Just when you think you've tasted all the good black pepper crab dishes in Singapore, another one creeps up. • ABOUT

    Serving the tech wizards and film gurus of Fusionopolis is this charming dive bar and restaurant that trots out a menu of hearty Asian-Fusion bar bites and dinners along with frosty beers and cocktails. Here you’ll find all kinds of interesting pairings, but comfort food is at the heart of it. You can order their signature Fusion Bak Kut Teh, featuring pork ribs in a rich tonkotsu-style soup laced with punchy spices, and served up with a ramen soy-sauce egg alongside the requisite braised peanuts and dark soy sauce. Ribs come in a completely different form when you order the BBQ Pork Ribs, a much more American affair glazed in sticky sweet and sour sauce, over a bed of crisp fries. Then there’s the Japanese Chashu Rice Set, think ramen turned into a rice dish, with sweet glazed chashu served with freshly steamed rice. For a little zi-char comfort, order the Frog Leg Hor Fun, smoky wok-fried rice noodles tossed up with tender frog legs, spring onions, and lots of fiery ginger in a rich soy-based sauce. All this comes paired with frosty craft beers, the incredible marriage of a dive bar, kopitiam, and Izakaya, perfect for all your post-work hangout needs. (Apr 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prawn & Pork Rib Ramen, Chasu Ramen, Prawn Laksa, Assorted Ngo Hiang Platter

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in the refurbished Tanglin Barracks, this quaint spot boasts is modelled after the beer gardens of Bavaria, and boasts old world charm. Wonderfully intimate, it is the perfect place for a romantic dinner or a catch up with close friends. This restaurant is also one of the few places that are dog-friendly, which means furry friends are more than welcome to enjoy the dining experience. There are even kid-friendly activities like cooking classes and face painting for the enjoyment of the little ones - truly a dining experience for the whole family! The Finger Foods here are perfect with a glass of beer, which is available on tap. The Crispy Pork Belly is reminiscent of Germany - home-cured and deep fried to crisp perfection without being too greasy. For something a little smokier opt for dishes from their charcoal grill - there’s the classic Satay available in chicken, beef, and pork, but there are also exquisite offerings like the Wagyu Rump and Rib-Eye Steak. For something a little lighter, opt for the RedDot Guava Salad, a unique mix of sweet and tangy guava, turnip, cucumber, and a variety of other greens topped with a lemon dressing. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    RedDot Guava Salad, Crispy Pork Belly, Wagyu Rump, Rib-Eye Steak, BBQ Squid Tubes

    Launched by Zouk Singapore, RedTail Bar is the group’s very first restaurant and bar concept that serves up an array of contemporary Asian sharing plates alongside craft cocktails, beers and great wines. Headed by chef Marco, the team at RedTail Bar seeks to present South East Asian and Western flavours in their menu. In the mood for some comfort food? Give the bar’s tasty Royal Broth Congee a try. Those looking for lighter bites can opt for modern crowd favourites such as the Mala Fries and Squid Pong. Topped with bonito flakes, seaweed and served with a yummy sriracha dip, seafood lovers must not leave without ordering the Squid Pong. An all time favourite at Zouk, the Signature Sausage & Mash is a mouthwatering combination of garlic and thyme pork sausage atop a bed of fluffy garlic mash available on the menu anytime of the day. Pair with your choice of alcoholic beverage from the bar’s colourful cocktail menu or join the Liquid Buffet for a fun night out! Planning to pop by during lunch? Beyond sharing plates, the bar’s expansive menu also boasts a selection of affordable daily lunch specials such as the Beef Burrito and Fish & Chips. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Squid Pong, Signature Sausage & Mash, Beef Burrito, Liquid Buffet

  • ABOUT

    Set within an old industrial building, Refinery & Co exudes old-school charm with its casual dining setting. Dishing up traditional Japanese cuisine with a modern and local twist, the restaurant is well known for its variety of popular grain bowls such as the iconic Truffle Gyudon and fresh salmon poke bowls. An ideal destination for lunch and brunch, chill with friends and family as you sip on the cafe’s signature Refinery Coffee Baller. Fit for those looking for an afternoon pick me up, this aromatic cup of coffee is concocted with multiple shots of espresso compressed into an ice ball and served with warm milk on the side. Simply pour the milk over and you have an iced coffee that never dilutes. As the sun sets, the outlet transforms into a laid-back watering hole offering affordable drinks, beer, and dinner grub. Choose to dine indoors for a cozy dining experience or opt to hang outdoors in the alfresco area to enjoy dinner under the stars. A plethora of innovative menu options await you here at Refinery and Co. Made for spice lovers, the Mala Beef Bowl is a house blend of fiery Sichuan spices and spicy marinated beef topped with a delicious onsen egg. Carefully break the egg to munch on soft fluffy grains of short rice coated with a yummy layer of egg yolk. Japanese cravings are also taken care of with the Mixed Chirashi Bowl, Salmon Don, and Mentaiko Scallop Pasta. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Gyudon, Mala Beef Bowl, Mentaiko Scallop Pasta, Refinery Coffee Baller

  • ABOUT

    Step into a dynamic space designed by famous contemporary designer, located next to the dazzling JW Marriott Hotel Singapore South Beach. The concept comprises several distinct spaces, starting from the lounge for bar snacks and extensive selection of drinks; island centrepiece kitchen of counter seats for omakase dining; and a private room for more space and privacy.At the sleek counter seats where the Omakase experience takes place, diners relax on comfortable bar chairs with a commanding view of the action as chefs prepare the sequence of Omakase dishes in front of them. Accommodating up to just 16 diners at a time for lunch and dinner, this central open kitchen is where the freshest wild-caught seafood is transformed into the Edo-style nigiri for your enjoyment.Experience the finest dishes at rén lounge Omakase, serving with freshest ingredients air-flown directly from Toyosu Market. (Dec 2021)

Nestled in the quaint and historic grounds of CHIJMES, Renga-Ya is a one-of-its-kind culinary gem that combines great food, warm hospitality, and a lovely atmosphere to boot. (Nov 2018)

html:
• ABOUT

    Offering the best of royal Thai cuisine, RennThai is located just a stone's throw away from the historic bank of Singapore River. Apart from a delectable Thai menu, the restaurant also offers a comprehensive wine selection. A well-loved Thai classic to kickstart your meal would be the Phad Woon Sen. Fried with generous chunks of chicken with an assortment of vegetables thrown into the mix, this plate of fragrant fried glass noodles is an authentic blend of Thai flavours. Seafood lovers should opt for the Khao Phad Pataya. Topped with scallops and prawns, this flavourful dish will leave you coming back for more. Complete the Thai dining experience with Tom Yum Talay. Both spicy and sour, the soup is brimming with a medley of prawns, squid and other fresh seafood. Add some greens into your meal with RennThai’s Phad Prik Khing Tua Khiy Kem. Fried with chilli, chicken and salted egg yolk, this savoury dish is a wonderful way to enjoy the traditional stir-fried french beans. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Phad Woon Sen, Khao Phad Pataya, Tom Yum Talay, Phad Prik Khing Tua Khiy Kem

html:
• ABOUT

    The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore presents an exciting new bar concept. Republic presents flavours, ingredients, and sensations inspired by the influential hallmarks of the 1960s - one of the most pivotal eras of the Twentieth Century. The bar celebrates four cultural epicenters of importance and meaningful change; represented by way of alluring cocktails. Enjoy the stories while you imbibe on liquid history. Open from 12 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily, Republic offers delicious cocktails, afternoon tea, lunch, and bar bites. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    British Prawn Cocktail, Tomato-Vanilla Chutney, Artisanal Chocolates, Handcrafted Pastries, Boneless Texas Buffalo Wings, Squid Ink Brioche, Cocktails

  • PUNCH BOWLS AND SUNDAY PUNCH BRUNCH

    In keeping with its 60s concept, Republic has introduced three distinct punch bowls and a Sunday punch brunch experience. Once synonymous with every great soiree, punch was a main feature of opulent house parties in the 1960s. A very social and communal drink, it is now back in vogue. Punch is the drink of crossroads; of ships and ports, commerce and adventure. It started in the ports of India and the East Indies using native ingredients such as arrack, lime juice, palm sugar and spices, before becoming the first mixed spirits drink to become globally popular. Over the years, other ingredients such as London dry gin, sherry wine, fancy liqueurs, American rye whiskey, cold soda water have been incorporated into punch bowl recipes, making it one of the most exciting styles of mixed beverages. Republic is delighted to have worked with David Wondrich to shape our new punch bowl menu. A key figure driving the punch revival, Wondrich is one of the world's foremost authorities on the history of the cocktail and one of the founders of the modern craft cocktail movement. “There is no quicker way to bind a group of people together in friendship than to gather them around a bowl of real punch,” shares David. On Sundays, our newly launched Punch Brunch is a curated experience that features appetisers, a main course and dessert, complemented with our signature punches and cocktails. Select from starters such as the British prawn cocktail with brandy-prawn dressing; or foie gras terrine with port wine gelée and brioche; mains like the braised beef short rib with potato mousseline; or Hainanese Kurobuta pork chop; and finish with a mini warm chocolate pistachio tart with vanilla ice cream, or the raspberry yoghurt ball. Your dining experience is complemented with unlimited pours from Republic’s three punch bowls. Other cocktail options guests can enjoy include the Timeless Beauty, English Milk Punch, Ruby Bellini and Irish Coffee. Republic’s Punch Brunch is available on Sundays from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m. at $168++ per person.When: Every SundaysTime: 12-3pmPrice: $168++ per personClick here to view the menu.

    JAG is Jeremy Anant Gastronomy. Founded in 2018 by friends, Chef Jeremy Gillon and Restaurateur Anant Tyagi, Restaurant JAG is an award-winning Contemporary French Fine Dining establishment located on the historic Duxton Road. Within a year of opening its doors, JAG was awarded the prestigious MICHELIN Star. In September 2021, the restaurant was again rewarded for its uncompromising vegetable and Savoie herb-centred culinary philosophy and retained the highly-coveted MICHELIN Star.Diners are taken on a vegetable-centred Seasonal Omakase journey, making JAG Singapore’s ONLY French contemporary restaurant offering an elegant Vegetable Découverte Menu curated entirely to embrace the rich palette of shifting seasonal vegetables and our guests dietary choices. Offering a holistic dining experience, JAG’s newly appointed FLOW Bar curates seasonal cocktail menu making it a perfect stop for pre-dinner cocktails. While over 230 expressions of wines and 25 sake selections are on the JAG menu to expand the diners' palates. An impressive Whiskey menu features American, Japanese, Irish and Scottish labels while hand-selected Tequila, Mescal, Gin, Vodka and Rums from boutique distillers are also meticulously sourced. (Sep 2021)

    The idea for Restaurant Labyrinth came about when Chef LG Han realised that whilst Singapore is a bastion of great street food, the quality of dishes vary widely from hawker centre to hawker centre. Thus, Restaurant Labyrinth was conceptualized to provide a consistent level of top-notch, elevated Singaporean street food under one roof, complete with an edgy ambience. Starting with a menu featuring some of Chef LG’s most-loved local dishes, diners will now be able to indulge in his signature “Ang Moh” Chicken Rice, the recipe of which was left to him by his beloved late grandmother, as well as Laksa featuring Local Green Lipped Mussels stuffed with homemade Fish Paste, Crab Meat Her Geow and Grilled Argentinian Red Prawns in a luscious broth. (Jun 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "At the new, black-hued space, set menus continue to be his main mode of surprising the 60 seats in house with his novel interpretations of Chili Crab in ice-cream form and Chendol tumbling out of Xiao Long Baos." -Time Out Singapore "It's Mod Sin, European and modern gastronomy touches all rolled into one at this set-menu, multi-course fine dining concept by local talent Han Li Guang." -SG Now "Service here is excellent and can rival top restaurants in the world. The staff are trained and well informed of the food and drinks menu, and are able to guide patrons in their choices for the evening." -Asia Tatler Dining

    Revolver is a bold, refined grill that laces Indian cooking sensibilities with international flair and ingredients.Fire is an essential element in the creation of Chef Saurabh's revolving menu. Custom built woodfire and bincho grills, tandoor and smokers create charred flavours, and form a central part of the dynamic, open kitchen. With its unadulterated, industrial-chic design and rocking atmosphere, Revolver brings upbeat energy to its shophouse setting on Tras Steet. Considered one of India's youngest and most promising culinary talents, Saurabh is the Executive Chef at Revolver, whose love for experimenting with the grills and home spices led to the creation of bold and refined charred flavours in his progressive menu. Using fresh, seasonal ingredients and spices from India and around the world, diners can look forward to a true avant-garde dining experience. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Courgette Flowers, Cumin Paneer, Wagyu Scotch Eggs, Pulled Pork & Gruyere Kulchette, Spiced Crusted Margra Lamb Chops

    Nestled at Duxton Hill, Rhubarb Le Restaurant is a contemporary French restaurant that opened its doors in 2014 by chef Paul Longworth, Jerome Desfonds, and Alice Low Ang. A Michelin-starred restaurant, Rhubarb Le Restaurant is touted as one of the best restaurants in Singapore. Dishing up delicious set lunches and dinners, the restaurant delivers quality food of the highest standards, sourcing the best ingredients and wines at a great value. Sit down for an unforgettable three-course dining experience here at Rhubarb Le Restaurant. Cured in rhubarb, pomelo, osmanthus and green apple, the trout is a mouthwatering dish not to be missed out on. Alternatively, go for the Full English Breakfast for a hearty first course. Featuring your favorite breakfast classics, enjoy toasted brioche with egg, sausage, beans, and crispy ham. Move on to the Confit Lamb Shoulder or a generous slice of Barramundi sauced in spiced red wine. End your meal on a sweet note with the classic Chocolate Fudge Brownie. The restaurant also offers a special chef menu for diners who prefer an elevated meal. Wine pairing options are also available for a unique wine and dine experience that brings diners on a gastronomic adventure like no other. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Full English Breakfast, Confit Lamb Shoulder, Chocolate Fudge Brownie, Wine Pairing

  • MICHELIN GUIDE SINGAPORE 2019

    Rhubarb Le Restaurant has been awarded 1 Michelin Star.

    This well-loved Italian restaurant is popular with an in-the-know lunch crowd hungry for its Italian deli grub and pastries, though in true Italian fashion, a luxurious sit-down affair that stretches out over a few hours would be the best way to enjoy this homey restaurant’s ample offerings. The menu features lots of Italian classics, with a good number of ingredients made from scratch in the kitchen to really get at that home-cooked flavour. There’s a wide range of hand-made pastas tossed in vibrant sauces, including house favourites plump ravioli and tortelloni, stuffed with creamy cheeses and rich meat sauces. The risotto here is made from organically grown rice that gives a superb texture and creaminess, perfect in the meaty, Milanese-style risotto that’s made with a beef marrow reduction, saffron, and for a top-up, mounds of luxurious foie gras. Grilled dishes round off the meal, and the seafood here is particularly good, featuring a range of oceany treats like grilled seabass. Delicious and hearty Italian plates from start to finish, find yourself some dining partners and have a nice, long meal at this fine trattoria. (Jul 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The service is great — intuitive but never intrusive.” -SG Magazine

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Linguine al Granchio, Ravioli del Plin, Tortelloni di Bufala, Trofie alla Genovese, Risotto alla Milanese

    Hidden somewhere behind the lush greenery in the heart of Bukit Timah is Riders Cafe, a charming and rustic restaurant that is one of Singapore’s most unique venue and popular dining spot. They have been one of Singapore’s most popular brunch spots since their establishment in 2007. Riders Café specializes in contemporary comfort food in a casual and relaxing space that exudes a lovely old-world charm in a black and white house. Guests are treated to a lovely view of riders on horses while dining at the cafe's verandah - a charming view where you might just forget you are in Singapore. In the evening, the calming view of the setting sun along with the gorgeous pink hued sky is perfectly framed from the verandah of Riders Cafe. Just minutes away from the bustling city, this idyllic getaway is perfect for a romantic dinner or an intimate family gathering. Contrary to the buzzing brunch service they are so well known for, their dinner service is turned down to a chill and relaxing ambience, with a carefully curated selection of wines and full main courses. The Dinner Menu is a sampling of modern European cuisine with classic signatures such as the Steak Frites - 250gm Australian Angus Striploin (150 day grain fed), Berkshire Bone-In Grilled Pork Chop and Roasted Snapper. (Sep 2019)

  • SAVE 10% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    "In a country where children are prone to thinking that chickens grow in supermarkets, a trip out to Rider's Cafe where you can see horses, and have brunch at the same time is an ideal family brunch spot." -CNNGo.com “The best seats in the house are by the balcony overlooking the horses’ paddock and training circle. The small menu is imaginative and executed with such panache you have to wonder how long it will be before the chef is poached.” -Time Out Singapore

    An Italian family, led by Chef Valentino, serves up the hearty fare of their home country, with ingredients specially imported from Italy and lovingly prepared in a way even Italian mothers would approve of. Ristorante Da Valentino prides itself on its seasonally-influenced menu, working with the best produce of each season, bringing the harvest highlights to the table. Open a meal with some antipasti, like a Mediterranean-style grilled octopus leg, spritzed with the barest trace of lemon juice to highlight its oceany flavours. There’s also an appetizer of thinly-sliced pork loin blanketed in a zingy sauce of capers, mayonnaise, and tuna, the perfect prelude to hearty, seafood-studded pasta mains like black fettuccine dressed in fruity olive oil with chunks of crabmeat. If you still have room for a course after that, order some dry aged tenderloin served up with earthy porcini mushrooms and mashed potato, or some pork chops given a sweet moscato marinade for an extra tender, deeply-flavoured dish. Hearty from start to finish, with a rustic sensibility that’s so quintessentially Italian, you know you’re in the good hands of a family steeped in tradition at Ristorante Chef Valentino. (May 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Zuppa Ai Frutti Di Mare, Valentino's Granchio, Antipasto Fantasia, Tentacolo di Piovra alla Griglia, Tonnato, Burrata e Datterini, Insalata con Carne alla Griglia, Assaggi di Paste Speciali, Spaghetto ad frutti di Mare con Bottarga, Spaghetti e Scampi, Risotto ai Funghi Porcini, Linguini alla Pescatora, Costata di Wagyu Tomahawk Gr 250 or Gr 500 with Bone, Pollo alla Diavola, Branzino Pope

    Ristorante Palermo is an elegant Italian trattoria on Keppel Island, an ideal escape from the grind of the city. Whether you choose to dine indoors or on the alfresco terrace, you'll be treated to sweeping views of the marina and beyond. The fare served here is undoubtedly authentic Italian, with a wide range of antipasti, pastas, pizzas, and sweet treats. Whet your appetite with the indulgent Burratina Verdure, a platter of creamy burratina cheese and vine tomatoes topped with crushed pistachios and truffle caviar. For mains, the Paccheri Braised Beef Ragu is comfort in a bowl, while the Quattro Formaggi pizza, with four types of Italian cheese, will definitely satisfy all the cheese fanatics out there. Whatever you choose, the range of cocktails and Italian wines available are perfect pairings to your meal. Save some space for dessert too. You wouldn't want to miss the Tiramisu or the Torta Della Nonna, a traditional Tuscan custard pie. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Burratina Verdure, Paccheri Braised Beef Ragu, Quattro Formaggi Pizza, Tiramisu, Torta Della Nonna

• ABOUT

    Standing out from the elegant row of shops along Alexandra Road is Ristorante Takada, which sets itself apart from other dining establishments in more ways than one. At its helm is Chef Masahiro Takada, who has established himself as a trailblazer and a creator of superb Japanese-Italian fare. With a strong emphasis on the freshness of ingredients used, Chef Takada ensures the extraordinary standard and quality of his food. The restaurant uses fresh seafood, such as Hokkaido scallops and sea urchin, which are imported directly from the famed Tsukiji market in Tokyo. The squid ink taglioni topped with sea urchin is sublime, with the combination of ingredients releasing a delightful blend of flavours on the taste buds. We also highly recommend the Wagyu tenderloin steak which is cooked to perfection, bringing out the full magnificent texture of the beef. These are all found on the July 2016 dinner menu, and are just a few examples of Chef Takada’s varied and exquisitely unique creations. Let your dining experience be elevated further by the simple, chic decor that speaks of subtle elegance. The soothing jazz music and minimalist aesthetic create a great ambience that complements the meal perfectly. Japanese-Italian cuisine might not be quite as well-known as Japanese-French fare, but we definitely recommend giving Ristorante Takada a go! (Jul 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    French White Asparagus & Hokkaido Scallop, Tagliolini Pepperoncino Hokkaido Sea Urchin, Risotto Foie-Gras with Rapsberry bubble, Kagoshima Wagyu Tenderloin Steak with Red Wine Sauce

html:
• ABOUT

    A household name in town for serving delicious North Indian Cuisine, Riverwalk Tandoor has now arrived at Rangoon Road. With an extensive menu of classic North Indian dishes, you’re able to feast like a king at affordable prices. Begin with their addictive Punjabi Samosas that will have you coming back for more. They also offer a series of meatier options including their Chicken Tikka or Mutton Sheekh Kebab, which are both heavily spiced and expertly cooked for a smoky flavour. Several rice options are available, including Jeera Rice. We recommend the Mutton Briyani Rice that's great for sharing. With tender chunks of mutton and a spicy, thick curry, this dish will satisfy any spice lover. If you want something less spicy, order any of their Naan to accompany their signature Palak Paneer, a vegetable curry with cottage cheese, or their fragrant Butter Chicken. Fair warning, their Butter Chicken is so delicious that one order of Naan won’t be enough. They also serve a high tea menu that comes with small bites and sweet treats to tide you over until dinner. Go for their Gobi Paratha, where cauliflower is stuffed inside flatbread for a light and fluffy bite. Get your crunch on with their Mixed Vegetable Pakora, a vegetable fritter that contains carrots, bell peppers, and cabbage. Wash down your meal with their refreshing Strawberry Lassi - a classic yoghurt drink, for a sweet and milky finish. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mutton Sheekh Kebab, Butter Chicken, Palak Paneer, Mixed Vegetable Pakora, Strawberry Lassi

• ONE STUNNING LOCATION - TWO UNIQUE CONCEPTS

    Sitting elegantly within One Fullerton with stunning vistas of the Marina Bay waterfront and overlooking Merlion Park, Riviera (Riviera The Restaurant | The Lounge at Riviera) is one of Singapore’s best-known destinations for modern Mediterranean lounge fine dining with a view. Each meticulously-crafted dish is a gourmand’s journey of the Mediterranean, celebrating the finest culinary influences from the coasts to the mountains of this diverse region, from France and Italy, with hints of North Africa. RIVIERA THE RESTAURANT MODERN MEDITERRANEAN FINE DINING An unforgettable fine-dining experience with some of Singapore’s most iconic views to match! Be seduced with each bite of our chefs’ culinary creations in our stunning dining space at Riviera The Restaurant, filled with gold pillars, vibrant table settings of striking flora combined with candlelight, hanging chandeliers and tactile chairs in caramel blush to heighten the expansive-yet-seductive ambience. Kindly note that Riviera The Restaurant exclusively serves specially-curated Set Menus of Riviera Signatures. THE LOUNGE AT RIVIERA CASUAL MEDITERRANEAN FARE FOR SHARING Guests may wind down, relax and enjoy a casual meal of Mediterranean signatures for sharing at The Lounge at Riviera, along with wine from across the Mediterranean (including Lebanon and Greece) or creative cocktails. The Lounge at Riviera is the perfect location for fruitful business lunches, relaxed gatherings and unforgettable romantic evenings.

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Sitting elegantly within One Fullerton with stunning vistas of the Marina Bay waterfront, Riviera is one of Singapore’s best-known destinations for Mediterranean fine dining with a view. Each meticulously crafted dish is a gourmand’s journey of the Mediterranean, celebrating the finest of culinary influences from the coasts to the mountains of this diverse region. (Nov 2020)

Once inside this 80-seater restaurant, though, it is the view of Marina Bay through the floor-to-ceiling windows that steals the limelight." -USA Today "The highlight though was the raspberry tarte with Moscato d'Asti wine zabaglione - it was divine. You'll be hardpressed to find better service (attentive without being intrusive, polite without being fawning) anywhere else." -SG Now

    This casual and edgy restaurant isn’t just your typical Yakiniku joint. A haven for meat-lovers, Rocku serves up tantalising cuts of meat flown in from Australia, Japan, and the USA. You can expect premium cuts such as Wagyu beef brisket, Australian sirloin, short ribs, and many other delightful options. The decor is equally intriguing. With unpolished brick walls and bold graffiti carelessly plastered all over them, the space oozes fun and cheekiness. What makes Rocku special however, is the multi-sensory dining experience diners will get to enjoy. Offering live music of the Korean, Japanese, and Mandarin pop-rock variety every Thursday to Saturday, Rocku is definitely your go-to place for an upbeat night out with friends. Don’t forget to complement your sizzling meats with some Asahi beer, whisky, or Japanese sake in hand. Whether it’s an Asahi Beer Tower, a classy glass of Nikka Black Special, or some Gekkeikan Josen, one thing’s for sure: there’s bound to be something to say cheers to here at Rocku. (Oct 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The joint in Bugis Plus is among a growing number of restaurants and cafes here offering diners live music, which was once exclusive to bars.” -SoShiok

    The Rose Veranda has been an institution for high tea since its inception in 1991, and an epitome of elegance with a serene and soothing ambience to while away an afternoon in good company.The culinary indulgences within the high tea experience are delivered with a strong commitment to freshness and seasonality, enhanced by the culinary team's creativity.The restaurant serves a 3-course high tea set menu, designed to continue afternoon traditions of luxurious tête-à-têtes over dainty sandwiches, and delectable pastries. First, a delightful selection of sandwiches is served to your table. Your choice of main course follows, inspired by haute cuisine and presented with finesse, to make a welcomed savoury intervention before dessert arrives on a three-tiered stand filled with French pastries and signature scones with homemade jam and clotted cream. For the traditionally inclined, select from two exclusive The Rose Veranda signature tea blends to complete your high tea experience, or choose your brew from a curated selection of more than 30 premium tea types from the best tea producing regions. Alongside the classic teas, there are champagnes and wines available for a sparkling afternoon. (Dec 2020)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Featuring the true taste of Italy, Rosso Vino has grown to be one of the finest in Singapore’s Italian restaurant scene. The restaurant offers a gastronomic journey that is centred on fulfilling their brand’s promise – quality and authentic Italian cuisine with genuine Italian warmth. As the owners, Salvatore Adaldo, a luxury hotel veteran with extensive knowledge of wines, and Carlo Mazzaglia head of the line-up of experienced service enthusiasts since opening took over the management of the Restaurant, the restaurant got its famed as “Top 3 Best Italian Restaurant in Singapore” and recently awarded as “Best of The Best by TripAdvisor” Favorably located at Robertson Quay, this classy restaurant and wine bar flaunts a welcoming, tranquil atmosphere with alfresco seating overlooking the picturesque view of the Singapore River and a cozy indoor air-conditioned seating. Idyllic for any occasion – Rosso Vino will surely hit the spot serving up classic Italian flavors with a contemporary feel. Your paw-friends are welcome to have comfortable seating with you at the alfresco area. Inspired by the homely creations of Nonna’s kitchen, our kitchen uses only the freshest, locally sourced ingredients. Our menu focuses on authentic traditional Italian classics, catered to warm the tummies of our guests. Some of our chefs’ signatures include our homemade cavatelli al ragu, fresh pizzas and signature angus beef. Most importantly we also cater to gluten-free and vegetarian diets and we are open till Midnight! (Jan 2022)

    Offering authentic Thai cuisine and irresistable drink packages, Route 6 is nestled within Sim Lim Square. Boasting a team of experienced chefs from Thailand, this Thai restaurant and bar attracts many diners with an array of classic Thai favourites. With a special menu dedicated to plating up seafood delights, Route 6 is a must-visit for all seafood lovers! Featuring juicy Grilled Tiger Prawns, Gong Gong, and freshly shucked oysters, these tantalising dishes perfectly complement sinful Thai classics such as the Thai Green Papaya Salad and Spicy Minced Pork Salad. A delicate balance of savoury and sweet, the Thai Spicy Salad with Salted Egg Yolk wows with each fiery strip of vegetable coated with a yummy layer of fried salted egg. Exquisitely wrapped in fragrant banana leaves, the Pandan Chicken is a hot favourite not to be missed out on. Other affordable one-dish meal options on the menu include Tom Yum Bouncy Pork Noodle, Thai Braised Pork Noodle and Boat Noodle variations. For those who simply can’t dine without soup, order the Thai Chicken Coconut Soup is a comforting accompaniment to rice plates. (Apr 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Serving inventive Indian cuisine for couples, families, travellers, and guests residing at Village Hotel Sentosa, Royal Taj is open all week for a la carte lunch and dinner buffets. Partake in a royal feast of timeless Indian classics and authentic flavours reconceived with a modern take, alongside local and international cuisine to suit all kinds of palates. Begin your meal with the Cocktail Samosa. A vegetarian-friendly option, the pastry shells are filled with a potato filling and served with a sweet tamarind sauce. A popular street food dish from India, Pani Poori Shots are crispy fried dough balls that are stuffed with potatoes, sprouts, and spicy tangy water, making this dish a great start to any meal. Tuck into a bowl of Royal Taj Butter Chicken, with tasty spiced chicken in a smoky cream tomato sauce mixed with dried fenugreek and cream sauce. For something lighter, go for the Zafrani Chicken Curry which features chicken simmered in fragrant zafrani gravy. End your meal with a classic Indian sweet. Known as Gulab Jamun, this dessert is a delicious concoction of milk solids, rose syrup and cardamom powder. (Jul 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    RUBATO Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar @ Greenwood takes its welcoming ambiance and understated decor a step further by keeping their kitchen open from 11am till 10:30pm. Located on Greenwood Avenue just off Bukit Timah Road, RUBATO keeps its décor simple and fresh, just like its menu. Ingredients are handpicked, pasta are homemade and cooked a la minute, and pizza are cooked to perfection in a wood-fired oven. In fact, the Chef Specialities vary each day depending on what owner, Marcus Edwin Wu, finds on his nightly journey to Jurong Port, where he selects the freshest seafood to serve. With the food taking centre stage, RUBATO Italian Restaurant & Wine Bar @ Greenwood is a place where serious foodies can focus on great food whenever the mood strikes them. (Jan 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Food-wise, Rubato may also get its diners singing praises of its off-menu Rubato Signature Pizza - thrice-cooked pork belly, strawberries and caramelized apples served on a crispy, wafer-thin crust, or the chicken "jump in the mouth" Saltimbocca." -The Business Times "Chef Wu wasn't kidding about his insistence on using the best ingredients. From the milky and wonderfully creamy burrata from Puglia and the intensely flavourful 36-month aged parma ham, to the juicy home-cured Roma tomatoes, the a la carte menu of antipasti is easily one of the most impressive selection we've ever sampled, a, pun unintended, symphony of delightfully fresh flavours and contrasting textures. " -Lifestyle Asia "And for all its unlikely setting, a residential estate up near MacRitchie; a good proving ground built surely not a permanent recipe for success, relative newbie Rubato does a solid job on all fronts." -SG Now "It seems out of place in a row of run down eateries and hawker stalls, but don't let the neighbours fool you - this place serves a menu that holds it's own against some our city's most exclusive dining areas. We are almost a little sad to let this cat out of the bag, as we wanted to keep this bellissimo gem all to ourselves." -The Honeycombers "Young head chef Wu whips up comfort Italian food that seeks to appeal to groups of families or couples. Tagliatelle with porcini mushroom sauce or burratina cheese salad complements a quiet evening, while the rib-eye risotto is a satisfying stomach filler. Small fairy-light lamps hang above white tablecloths in this intimate setting in which tables are grouped closely together, making for a warm atmosphere." -Time Out Singapore

  • ABOUT

    In addition to its minimalist furniture and floor-to-ceiling windows, this Italian restaurant combines good vibes and comfort food with a chill ambience. Serving a modest wine menu to pair with the authentic Italian food, Rubato makes for the perfect place to bring a date or guests to impress. Providing a full breakfast menu all day long, this restaurant offers options like their Big Breakfast For A King or their Australian-Style Extra Fluffy Pancakes for those looking for a hearty meal. Rubato's signature dish is the Mighty Tomahawk steak that delivers both weight and flavor. Tastefully seared, this massive steak is great for sharing and best for maximum indulgence. Their freshly shucked oysters and Rubato's Foie Gras are another must try, chargrilled to perfection and melt-in-your-mouth creamy, it’s the perfect way to start an evening at Rubato. They pair amazingly with a robust glass of red wine. For mains, go for their “A Gift From The Angels” Angel Hair Pasta that features sweet Hokkaido scallops, japanese seaweed and is drizzled with white truffle oil. This luxurious dish is full of smokey flavour and delightfully appetising. For smaller portions, get this as an appetiser instead for more stomach room for more dishes. The massive Rubato's World-Famous Burger is another main course worth devouring. It comes with juicy patties on fluffy buns and crisp bacon, or you can try one of their freshly made hand-stretched pizzas. Say “More Cheese Please” for Rubato’s cheesiest pizza or go for “In Search For Wild Mushrooms” for a shroomy pizza that’s full of umami earthy flavours. To end off your meal, go for Rubato’s Granny Smith Apple Pie and Sorbet for a sweet and comforting end. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Big Breakfast For A King, Rubato’s Foie Gras, A Gift From The Angels, More Cheese Please, Rubato’s Granny Smith Apple Pie and Sorbet

• ABOUT

    Merlot-coloured walls, plush gold and burgundy floors, a sense of timeless elegance, these are just a few gushing phrases that spring to mind upon stepping into Ruth’s Chris Steak House. It makes sense that the décor isn’t overblown because, as the familiar quip goes, all the better to focus on the amazing, New Orleans-inspired food, my dears! You might expect to come face-to-face with pages of meats once you crack open the menu, given its name, but, refreshingly enough, it starts off with plenty of seafood appetisers. Barbecued Shrimp, Sizzlin’ Jumbo Scallops, their signature Blue Crab Cakes; all good reminders that there’s more to this steak house than just beef. Go a little further, however, and you’ll strike gold: custom-aged Midwestern beef that come in all sorts of cuts, from Ribeye and Porterhouse to Petite Filet for those with a smaller appetite. Pair your juicy, perfectly grilled steaks – which come on a piping hot plate – with a Bleu Cheese Crust, get it Oscar Style with crab cakes, asparagus, and béarnaise sauce, or throw your diet plan out and add on other succulent mains such as Fresh Lobster or an Ahi-Tuna Stack. After all, when at Ruth’s Chris Steak House, following that wise rule of ‘go big or go home’ is what we call a solid plan. (Nov 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Even just as restaurant serving Cajun cuisine, Ruth’s Chris’ got an unique selling proposition to cajole even the most jaded of palates in Singapore. But throw in expertly-done steaks and a menu of unabashedly generously-portioned and flavoured dishes and you’ve got a keeper for the years to come." -Lifestyle Asia "The choices on this steakhouse’s menu are pretty classic and straight-forward. Petite filet, T-bone, New York strip, ribeye – take your pick! There’s also a porterhouse cut which is good for two." -Honeycombers

    The WINE RVLT is a wine bar founded by 2 veterans sommeliers of the F&B industry - Alvin Gho and Ian Lim - seeking to create a real revolution in the food and wine experience in Singapore. RVLT is an oasis in the middle of the concrete jungle that is Singapore, a home away from home for Singaporeans to unwind and just have fun. The founders get bored quite easily so they sought to create a wine and food program that radiates good energy in a spontaneous manner.For wines, Al Gho and Ian Lim likes to present whatever they like to drink! Some may say their taste is weird, or that their wines are too funky. However there are others like them from around the world who give them hope that they’re are not alone. From grower Champagnes to an amphora-aged Zibbibo, you will never know what to expect, because neither do they!Food is a key part of the new RVLT, with a focus on sustainable produce with a mind for "Lightness and Freshness". Great tasting dishes that nourish without making people feel jelak. (May 2019)

    Tucked away on the second floor of a shophouse along Neil Street lies Ryu Taro Yakitori Restaurant. A secret dining space featuring dark, swanky interiors decked out in carpeted floors and posh sofas, this modern Izakaya bar specialises in yakitori and Japanese cuisine alongside a wide variety of Japanese sakes. We recommend going with the mentaiko-flavoured Yaki Onigiri or Chikin Chahan to pair with the yakitori, starter and charcoal grill options. Hot appetiser options include Kani Karaage or Kawabi. Curated for seafood lovers, these fried seafood favourites are a great way to kickstart a hearty meal. The seafood feast continues with the restaurant’s yakimono offerings. Tuck into the Hamachi Kama to enjoy tender bites of lightly salted Grilled Yellowtail Collar. For the salmon fans, the Sake Kama Shioyaki and Sake Kabuto Yaki are not to be missed out on! Mix and match your favourite yakitori sticks with your pick of beer, chicken or lamb. Chef recommendations include the well loved Gyu Enoki Maki, Hatsu and Uzura Tamago. (May 2021)

    Nestled away from the busy streets of Chinatown, Rêve is your new destination to dine at with the intimacy of a clandestine affair that’s also elegant and intimate. The clatter of everyday life is gone, and all you should be anticipating is the reverie of French and Japanese flavours that is about to enchant your palate.Bask in the warmth and hospitality of the restaurant staff led by Executive Chef Kawano Masahiko, an award recipient of the highly acclaimed Taki Hisao prize by Japan’s RED-U-35, who believes a great meal starts the moment you sit down at your table and start your gastronomic journey of the night. Enjoy the menu that Chef Masahiko sets in front of you, made by a chef skilled in French cooking but whose identity is so Japanese it seeps into everything he makes. Savour and delight in the culinary creations which combines traditional Japanese ingredients with French cuisine. It also makes use of local ingredients and flavours, turning it into something wholly new and exciting.Relish in the wonders of flavours that are in sync with what you are looking for. Revel in the tranquillity of your surroundings and you are at once in peace. (Oct 2021)

• ABOUT

    Quayside Isle is home to many restaurants with a striking view, but none doling out zesty Spanish tapas like Sabio By The Sea. Inspired by the original Sabio on Duxton Hill, this Spanish tapas concept took to the sea to spoil us with a warm breeze and salty ocean air, yet keeping true to the delicious tapas we've all come to love. Adorned with antlered chandeliers, vividly curated paintings redolent of Joan Miró, and carefully etched tiles, Sabio By The Sea is an enchanting venue full of captivating Spanish culture and robust Spanish dishes. The menu, itself, is bold and intense. Conjuring up visions of matadors, evoking Iberian inspired flavours, and leaving a vibrant legacy - the plates here come to life as soon as they hit the table. The Paella Negra, a medley of seafood and squid ink, is the perfect example of what we mean. The savoury flavours come together to bring a dish you'll be craving for days to come. But it's not just about the savoury options, the dessert menu brings together so many of our favourite things, making for one tough decision when it comes time to make our pick. The Churros, glittered with sugar and cinnamon, are crisp heavenly delights! (Jul 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sabio’s Sangria (red/white), Gambas Al Pil Pil, Paella de Pescado, El Pulpo, Pan con Tomate, Gazpacho, Chorizo Iberico, Calamares a la Plancha, Croquetas, Josper-Grilled Beef Porterhouse Steak with Sides

  • JOSPER GRILL FIESTA MENU

    Using the world-famous charcoal flamed Josper Grill (a kitchen must-have well-loved by chefs around the world!), the unique combination of a grill and oven enhances unique umami flavours using smokey embers, and helps to retain the natural juiciness of the meat in every single bite. Featuring an all-new selection of steaks sourced from Australia, Argentina and New Zealand together with our signature Josper Grill signatures like our Paella, your tastebuds are in for a fiesta! Available Daily!

• ABOUT

    Savour the quiet refinement of Saint Pierre where subtlety is the name of the game, be it in its food, service or setting. With a warm palette of colours for the carpets and upholstery, the restaurant’s interior exudes an elegance that makes an impression from the very beginning. Coupled with a spectacular view, the impression will keep growing once you take in the selection of exquisite modern French dishes with Asian influences. The set menus offer myriad options for every course. The dishes tell the story of Chef-Owner Emmanuel Stroobant’s intriguing gastronomic journey as a European who has lived in Asia for half his life. They are fine examples of employing classic French techniques to prepare the freshest quality ingredients with an Asian touch. Sit back, take in the great views of the Marina Bay area, and dig in. (Feb 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "More than just a restaurant, Saint Pierre is Chef Emmanuel Stroobant’s homage to the gastronomic arts... Known for his Asian-inflected French fare, Liege-born Emmanuel Stroobant creates dishes reflecting his signature style, ie “essence- centric cuisine”. It is the culmination of his culinary career and personal journey of self-discovery. He is devoted to freshness and quality, and takes a spiritual view of cooking.’’ - Danielfooddiary "The unobstructed views of the marina, smart de´cor and discreet service don't outshine the modern French cuisine with pronounced Asian touches. Seafood is flown in from Hokkaido, Japan, four times a week to ensure freshness. The tasting menu is a great way to sample the culinary highlights. But seasonal items like Welsh lamb and pigeon should not be missed when they are available." - 2019 Michelin Guide

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Contemporary Australian restaurant, Salted & Hung presents an all-new Tasting Menu that revolves around the creative use of forgotten parts, from skins to bones, protein to innards, with not a single by-product put to waste. True to Chef Drew’s personal cooking philosophy of Minimal Wastage, the menu encapsulates the essence of Sustainable Cooking where every part of a single produce is pushed to its maximum potential.Diners are transported to a utopia of Sustainable Cuisine, starting from the table setting with a cutlery holder made from recycled abalone shells; to a pictorial guide detailing how each by-product are used, and lastly, the fine flavours from Chef Drew’s enthralling take on sustainable cooking. Drew grew up on his family farm near Brisbane, Australia where it first ignited his passion for cooking. He spent most of his childhood working the farm and attributes his cooking style and philosophy to his time at the farm. Coupled with hard work, passion, and dedication to his craft, Drew’s personal cooking philosophy of Minimal Wastage forms the cornerstone of Salted & Hung. The 7 & 10 course menu showcases Chef Drew’s clever manoeuvre of ingredients and his vision for a Sustainable kitchen. The signature dish on the menu is the Aged Turbot served on a wooden board with three elements, namely the ‘Turbot’, ‘Turbot Tea Broth’ and ‘Turbot Liver Vin Jaune’ sauce. The 5-days aged Turbot is stuffed with Mushroom Duxelles that has been slow-cooked for 8 hours. The skin and turbot trimmings will be fermented into a garam that is later used to season the fish. The dish is then finished off with a sauce made from the Turbot liver and Vin Jaune. Lastly, the turbot bones are hung and dried for 14 days in preparation for its role in making a dashi broth, along with local herbs and flowers lending an aromatic flavour to the dashi tea. These three elements will come together when presented tableside by our server. Next, the Kagoshima A4 Wagyu presents a sirloin steak grilled over Japanese Bincho-tan paired with carrots. The carrots presented on the dish are prepared in a process that spans over 24 hours. First, the carrots are confit in excess beef fat from the Wagyu, then slow-cooked, dried and rehydrated with beef sauce. The rest of the carrot trimmings goes into making a smoked carrot ketchup. Lastly, the sauces finishing touches consists of a charcoal powder derived from onion and leek trimmings, and pear and shiitake mushroom reduction made from vegetable trimmings. The final pièce de resistance El Toro Orchard is Chef Drew’s tribute to his family farm in Stanthorpe, Queensland. The farm is founded in 1945 and tended by generations of the Nocente family. The orchard mainly bears Granny Smith apples, Gala apples and Red Delicious apples. The dessert presents an Apple Tartin that resembles an apple dropped on the Orchard ground. The Apple Tartin is caramelised and compressed with cider, and filled with apple jam. The dessert is paired with chocolate twigs and mascarpone ice-cream. The Tasting Menu is available for dinner from Tuesdays to Sundays. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Abalone, Truffle, Aged Turbot, Japanese Wagyu, El Toro Orchard

• ABOUT

    Made for those constantly on the go, Salvo by Pasta Fresca serves quality Italian food in a fast casual setting. Choose to chill out at one of its two alfresco areas with bar bites and alcoholic beverages. Wherever you choose to dine, sit back and enjoy a plate of homemade fresh pasta in a welcoming and friendly setting. Crafted with love from Italy, the menu features a variety of antipasto, bar bites, pasta, pizza, and desserts alongside a huge selection of fine wines. Start by exciting your taste buds with a gigantic platter of Truffle Fries Parmigiano. Truffle fans are in for a treat with this plateful of truffle goodness. Tossed with truffle oil and topped with a smattering of shredded cheese, the deep fried shoestring potato fries are crispy and make for mouthfuls of truffle delight. Customise your delectable bowl of pasta with your choice of stuffed, long or short pasta and one of the many sumptuous sauces on offer. An irresistible choice for seafood lovers, the Marinara is a splendid mix of prawns, squids and mussels fresh from the ocean. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Fries Parmigiano, Marinara, Amatriciana, Lava Cake

html:
• ABOUT

    Located in Kitchener Road, this hidden gem of a restaurant serves up a hearty steamboat with a delectable laksa broth. The star of this restaurant is the laksa soup -- a rich and spicy concoction that comes with an extra bowl of laksa leaves for you to add as you wish. While it’s tempting to slurp up the gravy on its own, San Laksa Steamboat offers a wide variety of fresh seafood, vegetables, and meat for you to amp up your hot pot experience.Start with local vegetables such as kang kong, Chinese lettuce, and a mixed platter of mushrooms to infuse sweetness into the soup. Love cheese? The cheese tofu is a popular item here, where a square of fermented beancurd hides a lovely, cheesy middle. And no laksa soup can be complete without an order of tau pok — the spongy beancurd skin is the perfect way to sop up all the richness of the laksa broth.For meats, try the fresh prawns or wafer-thin slices of pork collar. Diners who prefer more seafood in their hot pot can opt for the fresh toman fillet. Round up a scrumptious dinner experience with an order of handmade minced meatballs, laced with tiny bits of water chestnut for that added crunch. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Handmade fish paste and meatball, Fresh Scallops, Seafood Steamboat

html:
• ABOUT

    Soak up the sea-side views and beach atmosphere at East Coast park from this casual family gastropub. While the interiors are handsome and look like a classic, no-frills sports bar, the outside is pure Singapore with sun, surf, and a 15 metres long plunge pool for kids that lends the joint a fun, beach resort feel. Perfect for families, or anyone on the beach looking to tuck into its selection of generous Western plates and cocktails. Think meaty sharing plates straight off the kitchen’s nifty charcoal grill, like a crisp-skinned charcoal-grilled chicken leg, or pleasantly charred US Black Angus Ribeye with roasted whole garlic, caramelized onions, and sweet pommery mustard. If in doubt, opt for a platter, like the Grilled Sausage Platter featuring chorizo, Italian sausages, and beef sausages with gherkins and zingy mustard. The signature SandBank Fish & Chips, made with battered seabass and served with fries and homemade Asian-inspired tartare sauce, makes the perfect beach-side lunch. If it’s a group situation, grab a few pizzas and spoil yourselves with flavours like the BBQ Pulled Pork, which sees chewy dough topped with a tangy and savoury shreds of pork, onions, and pineapples, and the elegant Verdura, a vegetarian number strewn with artichokes, mushroom, pimento, and spinach. On top of all this, look out for its sumptuous international breakfast and brunch buffet on weekends! The name SandBank has it right: swim ashore for a breather, chow down on some great bites, and then head back out to enjoy the rest of your day out at the coast. (May 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Family-friendly, fuss-free, and great value for money.” -Sassymama

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Charcoal Grilled Chicken Leg, Fish & Chips, Charcoal Grilled US Black Angus Ribeye, Charcoal Grilled Sausage Platter, Verdura Pizza, BBQ Pulled Pork Burger

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    An authentic taste of Lebanon. That's what Sanobar Restaurant promises diners who find themselves supping at their bustling restaurant on Bussorah Street, and boy, do they deliver. From familiar staples like falafel, hummus and baklava, to heartier mains like moussaka and lamb kofta, Sanobar Restaurant uses quality ingredients and traditional cooking methods to deliver one memorable meal. What's more, given that most dishes are grilled, baked, or sautéed in olive oil, you don't have to worry about overindulging. Their cosy home in one of Singapore's oldest, and most vibrant, cultural neighbourhoods, makes complete sense given their desire to impress with traditional flavours with a touch of modern flair. The al fresco area is perfect for people-spotting, and paves the way for a picturesque meal given the backdrop of one of Singapore's most ornate religious structures, the Sultan Mosque. Excellent use of traditional flavours and beautiful presentations in an even more spectacular surrounding, Sanobar Restaurant is the perfect place to take a bite out of both delicious nosh and history. (Oct 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    BBQ Butterfish, Chicken Moussaka, Lamb Kofta, Shish Kebab, Grilled Halloumi Cheese, 1001 Mezza, Baklava

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/sanobar-restaurant
name: Sanobar Restaurant

html:
• ABOUT

    Step into Sarnies and one of the first things you’ll notice is the cool, relaxed vibe characteristic of cafés in Melbourne. Opened by Aussie Ben Lee a while back, this trendy establishment has made a name for itself as the place to go for delicious, quality café nosh. Visitors are especially fond of its sandwiches on weekdays, which is no surprise considering the name ‘Sarnies’ is a slang term for sandwich! Little jokes aside though, Sarnies has proven to have as much substance as it has style, and that’s saying quite a bit; the café has received nominations by City Nomads for Best Coffee Roasters and Best Value Restaurant in Singapore, and has been featured in the Singapore Lonely Planet Guide. That’s gotta mean something! Looking past the accolades straight to the food and drink, coffee addicts will fall in love with the quality brews served here. With coffee beans that are meticulously roasted by a team of talented baristas, and with all coffees made with a double ristretto for more intense flavour, Sarnies firmly establishes itself as the place to go for your caffeine fix. And as for the food, you definitely wouldn’t go wrong with the brunch options, but the dinner menu offers a plethora of mouthwatering delights. So make a reservation at Sarnies – with such a yummy spread available at this café, you’d be hard-pressed to get a seat without one! (Mar 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Luscious, epic sarnies (Aussie slang for sandwiches) bust the jaws of suits and hipsters at this new-school Aussie cafe.” -Lonely Planet

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pulled Pork Tagliatelle, Aussie Burger, Chicken Parmigiana

  • href

  • ABOUT

    A cosy establishment along Upper Paya Lebar Road, Saturday House brings the concept of weekend getaways to life. A bistro, bar and cafe in one, it boasts a delectable selection of western and local fusions. Perfect for brunch, the Cheesy Baked Mushroom Toast is served with mushrooms and topped off with a melted blend of parmesan and mozzarella cheese. For non-cheese lovers, a great alternative would be the Grilled Pork Collar. Sinfully tasty, the pork collar is lightly char-grilled, yielding a tender bite that packs a punch of flavour. The Bacon Cheese Mushrooms is another noteworthy dish. Lightly battered, the crispy exterior of the fried mushroom gives a satisfying crunch to reveal generous amounts of stuffing of bacon bits and cheese hidden inside. Indeed, the classic combination of bacon and cheese never fails to disappoint! Don’t leave without trying the Marmite Mid-Joint Wings. Created with finesse, this dish is a huge hit among diners with the subtle taste of marmite flawlessly complementing the wings. Without a doubt, Saturday House is the place to be if you are on the hunt for good food and good times. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cheesy Baked Mushroom Toast, Grilled Pork Collar, Bacon Cheese Mushrooms, Marmite Mid-Joint Wings

    In case you don't remember a time before Saveur, French cuisine was almost synonymous with fine dining back in the day, so you can bet we sat up and took notice once this wallet-friendly restaurant burst onto the scene. Don't be too quick to dismiss the quality of the food before you tuck in though, the multitude of classical techniques used to create their particular brand of contemporary French fare are a testament to the professional training of the chefs.Begin with a starter of Saveur's Pasta before moving on to main plates like Beef Bourguignon, Chicken Roulade, and the signature Duck Confit. Rounding off the relatively compact menu are sweet treats like the Pistachio Panna Cotta which sound too good to pass up. It's difficult to believe this eatery had their first debut in a humble coffeeshop! Saveur's one-two punch of French flavours, tweaked to suit the local palate, and reasonable prices will leave you salivating for more. It's no wonder, then, that lines can sometimes extend out the doors. (Feb 2016)

  • ABOUT

    Have a taste of authentic halal Thai flavours at Saveur Thai with traditional Thai dishes that combine earthy herbs and fragrant spices imported from Thailand with fresh ingredients. Helmed by a team of chefs from Thailand with a passion for cooking up a storm in the kitchen, Saveur Thai opened its doors in 2014 to indulge diners in an extensive range of no pork, no lard classics and authentic all time favourites.Rekindle your best dining memories of Thailand with the chef recommendations. Featuring crisp yet tender pieces of fresh fish, the Deep Fried Seabass with Green Mango Salad is an innovative combination that rewards with a burst of sweet, salty and tangy flavours in every bite! Alternatively, diners can also look forward to discovering tasty new dishes such as the Isan Grilled Black Angus Beef with Spicy Thai BBQ Sauce, Thai Chicken Cashew Nuts and more! Fans of classic Thai dishes can opt for the Signature Tom Yum Tiger Prawn Red Soup to relish in Savuer Thai’s rendition of this well loved fiery dish. Filled with a variety of fresh seafood, this bowl of Tom Yum soup will surely satisfy your cravings for authentic Thai cuisine. Non-spice lovers can order the Saveur Thai Tender Beef Ribs Brisket Boat Noodles for an equally delectable dining experience! (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Tiger Prawn Red Soup, Deep Fried Seabass with Green Mango Salad, Isan Grilled Black Angus Beef with Spicy Thai BBQ Sauce, Tiger Prawn with Tamarind Sauce

    Revel in the music, good food and drinks together with family and friends at Savour Eat as you enjoy the restaurant’s chef signature dishes in a relaxing ambience. Pop by Savour Eat for a wide variety of freshly prepared healthy meal options that can be seamlessly incorporated into your busy lifestyle. Order the in-house special for a tangy and tasty pasta dish featuring meatballs made with hidden specials. Speckled with grated cheese, this dish is a wonderful medley of flavours. Ready your bibs for the restaurant’s Cordon Bleu. Guaranteed to fill you up, this chicken dish is layered with ham and cheese perfectly layered inside with a light batter outside, providing a satisfying crunch in every bite. For the seafood lovers, the Spicy Aglio with Tiger Prawn is a must have. Expertly cooked with olive oil and tossed to perfection, the chewy pasta is served up with a generous serving of juicy tiger prawns. Treat yourself to a glass of wine or chill with Savour Eat’s in-house beer bag for a delightful end to a satisfying meal. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cordon Bleu, Spicy Aglio with Tiger Prawn, Smoked Duck Pesto Pasta, Spring Prawns

    From the elegant decor, done up in swathes of gold with touches of wood and bamboo, to the jazzed-up Thai music in the background, and the spicy aroma wafting out from the kitchen, everything here evokes the charming Land of Smiles. Sawadee Thai Cuisine has been serving up traditionally-prepared Thai food since 2000, turning fresh ingredients cooked á la minute into comforting, flavourful Thai plates. All the familiar favourites are here. Whether your Thai fix is a plateful of crispy chicken wings stuffed with minced meat, or a fresh seabass lightly steamed and dressed in a piquant sauce, or a fiery Thai mango salad, this place will hit all your sweet spots. Save room for the mother of all sweet spots though. Living up to the famous Thai sweet tooth is a luxurious durian sticky rice dessert that’s made with super-fragrant Mao Shan Wang durians. Not to be missed! Relive all your favourite Bangkok memories here, where the food is hearty and the vibe is friendly and upbeat. (Sep 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For the past few decades, Sawadee Thai has been serving authentic Thai food in Singapore – saving you a two-hour trip to Bangkok when cravings strike. It gets a shipment of fresh Thai produce daily, ensuring that all its dishes deliver a genuine taste of Thailand." -Time Out Singapore "New dishes such as Grilled Kurobuta Pork Collar...boasts premium ingredients that you do not find in many Thai restaurants. The pork is succulent and the spicy sauce goes very well with the meat." -Straits Times

    Fun dining and fine drinking is the name of the game at this new Italian spot. With a menu bursting with authentic, affordable classics and plenty of tipples to go with your meal, this is the perfect spot for dinner and drinks with friends. While all the pastas here are done well, the Penne Alla Carbonara deserves special mention for seamlessly blending pecorino cheese and egg yolk into a creamy mixture that is flavourful without being too rich. The pizzas are large enough for sharing, and the Margherita is one of our favourites. Made with fresh mozzarella and basil, the dish is deliciously simple and goes perfectly with a glass of Premium Red from the drinks menu. Seafood lovers will appreciate the Zuppa Di Cozze, fresh black mussels in a white wine sauce. The sauce is light and luscious, and goes well with the succulent meat from the mussels. Mop up the remaining sauce with the oven toasted bread that the dish is served with. For a sweet end to the meal, dig into the Tiramisu. Soft savoiardi and creamy Italian mascarpone are the centerpieces of this treat. Whether you’re new to Italian cuisine or a seasoned expert, you’ll feel welcome in this friendly restaurant.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Burrata & Parma Ham, Special Italian Antipasto, Lasagna, Spaghetti Vongole, Tonnarelli Ink Squid with Seafood, Polpette Al Sugo, Calamari Friti, Arancini

    A mainstay of Singapore’s Korean food scene, this Korean Tofu House has once again opened its doors to patrons at a location closer to the Promenade. Clear floor-to-ceiling windows allow patrons to dine “al-fresco” while they beat the heat indoors. This new stalwart on Millenia Walk seats over 150 people comfortably, which means shorter wait times and a livelier dining experience. Helmed by celebrated Korean Chef Nam Kyoung Soo, diners will once again get to indulge in the beloved Soontofu soup with their choice of broth. The silken tofu used in the soup is made by hand at the restaurant daily, using organic soybeans imported directly from Paju, South Korea. Beloved classics like Spicy Baby Octopus and L.A. Galbi are also made with fresh ingredients and can be served with the rice dishes on the menu or as dishes on their own, depending on the diner’s preference. The rice dishes here are served in hot stone bowls as per Korean tradition, and the rice crust at the bottom is mixed with corn tea and served as a porridge at the end of the meal - if you’re looking for authentic Korean food that is healthy, hearty, and accessible, look no further. (Jul 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    L.A. Galbi, Spicy Grilled Chicken, Spicy Baby Octopus, Abalone Spoontofu, Assorted Spoontofu

html:
• ABOUT

    Helmed by celebrated Korean Chef Nam Kyoung Soo, the highlight of the menu here is the Soontofu Soup, which is made with silken tofu and the diner's choice of broth - from mild to crazy hot for the daredevils out there. The silken tofu used in the soup is made by hand at the restaurant daily, using organic soybeans imported directly from Paju, South Korea. The broth is made with a 10-ingredient secret recipe soup paste and is allowed to set for a couple of days after boiling. This brings out the best of the ingredients without any need for artificial flavouring, and results in a soup that is light but tasty and low in cholesterol for health-conscious patrons. Tiger prawns and flower crab are only some of the ingredients that can be added to the soup. If that's not your thing, authentic Korean side dishes like Spicy Baby Octopus and L.A. Galbi are also available. The rice dishes here are served in hot stone bowls as per Korean tradition, and the rice crust at the bottom is mixed with corn tea and served as a porridge at the end of the meal. If you're looking for authentic Korean food that is healthy, hearty, and accessible, look no further. (Apr 2018)

• ABOUT

    The phrase ‘seventh heaven’ is often used to describe a state of pure euphoria and joy. We don’t want to exaggerate but that’s what a meal at Se7enth Restaurant feels like. Under the masterful hands of acting Executive Chef, Gary Lim, SE7ENTH promises diners a relaxing evening with dishes centred around classic, contemporary Western and Asian fare. Situated within Oakwood Premier AMTD Singapore, SE7ENTH is a 74-seater restaurant perfect for social gatherings and business meetings. Tucked away on level 7 and hidden from the hustle and bustle of the central business district, SE7ENTH is a tranquil oasis offering modern international cuisine. For diners who relish cuisines inspired by the West, the Alaskan King Crab Seafood Platter with Truffle Risotto, a show-stopping galore of snow crab legs, mussels and prawns baked in garlic and herbs and served with a lush bowl of truffle risotto, will delight palates. The Salmon En Papillote with Wild Mushroom Velouté, baked salmon on a tender bed of zucchini and eggplants nestled in a paper pouch, is a delicious way to start a meal. Asian cuisine lovers can reminisce a trip to Japan with Wagyu Katsu sandwich featuring tender breaded Wagyu striploin steak medium done, sandwiched between grilled brioche. Alternatively, savor one of Chef Gary’s specialties, the Oakwood Premier Nasi Lemak, an elevated Asian delight of sambal king river prawns, mussels, crispy turmeric chicken, fried egg and fragrant coconut milk-infused rice. Making a bold and fiery entrance is rendition of a locals’ favorite, the Mala Xiang Guo, a spiced treasure trove of king river prawns, scallops, black mussels, squid, quail eggs and noodles. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oakwood SE7ENTH Beef Burger, Alaskan King Crab Seafood Platter with Truffle Risotto, Oakwood Premier Nasi Lemak, Curry Cod Fish and Chips, Angus Ribeye Black pepper Hor Fun, Crispy Chicken Wings with Truffle Maple Drizzle

    Founded by Adam, this seafood restaurant in Marina Square pays particular attention to the use of quality ingredients. Specially grown to suit the restaurant’s needs, the vegetables used in his dishes are urban farmed and exceptionally fresh. Their signature dishes include Red Snapper, Qing Tang, Special Cod, or Barramundi doused in Red Hot Chilli Flavour, a flavoursome soy sauce or the restaurant’s Signature Mala dressing. For those who are looking for a fiery good time, bolder flavours include the Fresh Chilli and Pepper Flavour, and handmade Kung Fu Tomato Flavour. Complete your meal with side dishes from stir-fry menu options that include classic Sichuan delights such as MSpicy Sichuan Chicken, Thirteen Incense and Garlic Baby Lobster, pick any for a mouthwatering addition to a yummy meal. Alternatively, choose to add on ingredients such as Potatoes, Enoki Mushroom or Kung Fu Vermicelli for a filling meal. Meat lovers will love the grilled BBQ menu here at Sea Chuan Kungfu Fish. Choose from a variety of beef, lamb, lamb ribs, and scallops for a steaming good time. (Feb 2021)

    A relaxing sanctuary for those looking for a laid-back and palatable dining experience, Sea Scent at Keppel club is located right at the border of Singapore’s Southern shoreline. Delight in a satisfying meal anytime of the day with the restaurant’s plethora of delectable menu options. The perfect dining venue for a romantic date by the sea or casual weekend family gatherings, Sea Scent’s menu is a carefully curated mix of Western and Asian cuisine suited for all. Tuck into a fragrant plate of Seafood White Bee Hoon and enjoy the tangy noodles elevated by the infusion of the flavour from the fresh ocean catch. For the little ones, indulge them in a hearty serving of Crunchy Fried Chicken Burger. Sandwiched between two fluffy brioche buns, the fried chicken is accompanied by coleslaw, lettuce, tomato and a sunny side up. Signature dishes include the Chilli Crab Linguine, Unami chilli Chai Poh Fries, Seafood Bisque and other innovative fusion creations. Visit Sea Scent today to feel the soft breeze from the sea and unwind while savouring dishes finely crafted by expert in-house chefs. (Mar 2021)

    Unami Chilli Chai Poh Fries, Seafood Bisque, Seafood White Bee Hoon, Crunchy Fried Chicken Burger
