html:
• ABOUT

    There aren’t a lot of places in Singapore where you can dine with a view of the endless horizon and the sound of the waves, but The Seagrill is one of them. Plane enthusiasts can get an unparalleled view of planes taking off and landing at Changi Airport, music lovers can enjoy the live band performances on Friday nights, and food lovers can nosh on the various delicious dishes on offer. Health-conscious diners can opt for the Detox Salad, made with greens and red quinoa, as well as a host of other colourful vegetables and nuts. This dish is a feast for the eyes and palate. For something a little moreish, opt for the Seafood Capellini, a delicious dish made with king prawns, Japanese sea scallops, clams, and a variety of other treasures of the sea. The pasta is coated in an earthy mix of garlic and olive oil, before being tossed in the seafood mix, making this dish an excellent main course. For a sweet end to the meal, try some local fusion desserts, like the Cempedak Creme Brulee. Made with the sweet and fragrant cempedak fruit, this dish combines the classic French dessert with a unique local flavour and makes for a memorable dessert. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Seafood Platter, Grilled Meat Platter, Grilled Rack of Lamb, Grilled Chicken Skewer with Pineapple, Grilled Barramundi Fillet, Boston Lobster Thermidor, with our handcrafted by our Chef's Cake; Seagrill's Burnt Cheese Cake and Dark Chocolate Lava Cake

    Sen of Japan is a modern Japanese restaurant and bar with a carefully curated menu using a dazzling medley of premium quality ingredients. The meaning of ‘Sen’ in Japanese is fresh, we believe that the quality of each dish lies in the source of ingredients – ‘to be fresh’. Sen of Japan aims to bring together key elements of traditional Japanese cuisine combined with modern flavours and techniques for a sophisticated flavour in every bite. The intimate settings and delectable dishes are accompanied by a spectacular view of the Singapore skyline for a memorable dining experience that is a feast for both the eyes and taste buds – perfect for both business and leisure meals. (Mar 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    An authentic Japanese experience awaits you at Singapore’s very first sen-ryo outlet at ION Orchard. Established in Japan in 1999, the restaurant places a huge emphasis on dishing up exceptional Japanese cuisine made of only the highest quality ingredients imported from Toyosu Fish Market and around the world. Prepare to be impressed by the variety of premium but pocket-friendly creations that promise affordable luxury at its best. Start your journey at the impressive sake bar and indulge in the various classic Japanese alcoholic beverages to relax and unwind. Highlights among the extensive sake selection available include the Ohime 2 Grain Hire Yamadanishiki and the Hyakujuro Junmai Daiginjo Black Face. Featuring a flora and subtly sweet rice wine with bittersweet undernotes, pair the former with a platter of cold starters to kickstart your meal. Topped with a dollop of minced fatty tuna, this inventive handcrafted creation known as the Maguro with Shio Koji Negitoro features a yummy slice of tuna lightly seasoned with fermented salt sitting atop perfectly rolled premium sushi rice. Available exclusively in Singapore, the Grilled US Beef Tenderloin and Foie Gras is made up of tender sliced meat expertly grilled to an aromatic char — perfect to satiate your carnivorous cravings. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Otoro Sashimi, sen-ryo Sushi, Japanese Wagyu Sushi Platter, DIY Uni Platter, Tamagoyaki Mentai, Grilled Chicken Thigh with Charcoal Style Sauce, Kaisen Nabe

    The brainchild of veteran chef Martin Woo, Steven Hong and team, Senshi Sushi & Grill is a contemporary Japanese a la carte buffet restaurant located in the Central Business District. Satisfy your Japanese food cravings in a homely interior decked out with cosy furnishings. Get ready to embark on a gastronomic adventure and feast like a warrior on the extensive range of Japanese dishes, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. Additionally, diners can also look forward to tasty menu dishes that change with the seasons to reflect the mood of the changing times. Backed by one of the largest seafood and meat distributors in Singapore, dig into the quality cuts of premium wagyu beef and gourmet seafood recognised for their superior quality and freshness. Chef recommendations here include the Seafood Hot Stone Rice, Spicy Salmon Roe Sushi Roe and Lobster Salad Sushi. For those who simply love digging into hotpots, the restaurant offers shabu shabu options if you drop by during dinner time. What’s more, you can discover a wide selection of beer, hard liquor and Japanese sake to pair with your meal for an authentic Japanese dining experience. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seafood Hot Stone Rice, Spicy Salmon Roe Sushi Roe, Lobster Salad Sushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Started in 1983, Seoul Garden has become a household name for many, owing to their affordable buffet-style Korean fare. For others, the restaurant brings back fond memories of joyful family dinners together whilst growing up. One thing’s for sure here at Seoul Garden, the diner is the centre of it all. Fun fact: Seoul Garden remains one of the few Korean barbeque restaurants that’s Halal-certified, and continues to prioritise a pro-family dining environment with a complimentary kids buffet on Sundays, and concessions for senior citizens. As you’re sizzling some of their signature Korean marinated meats, such as the bulgogi chicken, beef slices, or char siew chicken, don’t forget to check out Seoul Garden’s Seafood Feast as well. Tuck into contemporary Korean seafood dishes such as the Modern Korean Paella, where hearty amounts of flavourful mussels, prawns, squids, and clams are piled onto a bed of white rice, which seals in all the seafood’s goodness. Have a go at the wide assortment of Korean appetisers and sides while you’re here too, and if you’re worried about keeping a balanced diet, don’t worry, Seoul Garden’s got you covered with a large spread of fresh vegetables for you to choose from! Now, here’s an irresistible treat! (Oct 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “If its reputation and success is a gauge of the quality of its food, Seoul Garden should be at the apex of the Korean BBQ scene.” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bulgogi Beef, Tomyam Chicken, Garlic Chicken, Szechuan Chicken

    Seoul Kitchen is a charming and casual neighborhood restaurant that specialises Korean cuisine. Located along Sembawang Road, the eatery offers a specialty menu, traditional BBQ Buffet and crispy Korean fried chicken buffet. For the BBQ buffet, the free-flow meat variety comes with pork belly, pork collar, chicken, spicy pork and beef. As for the Korean fried chicken buffet, it also comes with a choice of stir-fried Korean glass noodle or rice balls, Kimchi Stew or Army Stew. There is a free-flow side dish buffet bar with 6 different kinds of side dishes and vegetables. Seoul Kitchen takes pride in serving authentic Korean food with the lowest price they can offer! So if you're craving comfort food in a homely and laid back setting, instead of traveling all the way to South Korea, look no further than Seoul Kitchen. (May 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Looking for a taste of home among the international crowd at Resorts World Sentosa? Look no further than Sessions, a casual dining establishment serving up classic Singaporean dishes like Chilli Crab and Cereal Crayfish. With Sweet Sessions, Crab Sessions, and Cooking Sessions, this 3-in-1 restaurant is sure to have you spoiled for choice. The Chilli Crab with Man Tou is a must-try. Based on the hawker classic, Sessions’ rendition is made with fresh crab and features a thick gravy flavoured with red chilli and plenty of tomato sauce for a well-rounded taste. Go in with your hands and mop up excess gravy with the delightfully fluffy Man Tou buns. Another usual hawker suspect is the Cereal Crayfish. An exquisite take on Cereal Prawn, this dish features the larger and juicier crayfish rolled in butter cereal and deep fried to golden perfection. There is also a range of delicious vegetable dishes on offer for diners who wish to enjoy a ‘zi-char’ style meal. The Stir-Fried Belachan Kang Kong gets our vote as it is cooked to tender perfection. The belachan gives the dish some heat and salty flavour, and it goes well with a bowl of steamed rice. (March 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab with Man Tou, Frozen Yoghurt Tower

    Our sunny island isn’t exactly a hotspot for beer connoisseurs but we have much to thank for the recent, much-appreciated influx of bars that specialise in craft beers. The newbie to the scene, SG Taps, has the same fervent mission of bringing the very best craft beers from around the world to Singapore, complete with a trendy address right in the heart of town, and we just can’t say no to that. Conveniently located at the historic Duxton Hill, SG Taps supplies the perfect spot for a cheeky midday pick-me-up or a casual after-work pint; and with 10 taps and a burgeoning collection of both familiar and eclectic beers, there’s no better place to be. Pair the lovely Crossroads Craft Lager or the Rye & Pint Trippin Wheat with some casual Japanese-inspired plates such as the Pakchi Gyoza, the Amami-style Chicken Rice for a well-rounded meal, or go local with their delicious Laksa Pizza, topped with generous portions of shrimp and clans - with so many options, there’s gotta be something for everyone. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Miso Nikomi Hanba-gu, Sake Kasu Miso Chicken, Teppan Neapolitan, Stuffed Chicken Ham, Piri Kara Chicken Wing

    Shabestan means a place of rest for weary travellers, and this oasis of deliciousness couldn't be any more aptly named. Nestled in a corner of Robertson Quay along a well-trodden path, Shabestan offers classic Persian cuisine but with a decisive nod to local palettes: less grease yet still perfumed with exotic, but never overwhelming, spices. Dine al-fresco and people-watch, or head indoors to enjoy the friendly ambience of this culinary gem. That Shabestan's Executive Chef Hamid Hosseini obsession with fine ingredients is apparent - there is nothing artificial in the flavours that combine to make each dish. Traditional grilled meats are marinated in fresh herbs; while seasonal vegetables meld with spices so perfectly that your taste buds will thank you for the experience. A little birdie tells us that Middle Eastern royalty have dined here on more than one occasion. We believe it - the food is wholesome perfection. Juxtaposed against the nightly belly dancing show, dining here embodies a delightful blend of naughty and nice. (Jan 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Freshly barbecued spring lamb, spiced chicken, succulent tender beef fillet and even fresh tiger prawns, all cooked in traditional middle eastern spices, are prepared to order in their show kitchen and form the centre piece for any Persian feast." -Great New Places "Also, important to note that while main dishes (kebabs and stews) tend to be meat orientated, many of the starters and sides are vegetable-based, and honestly, sound delicious enough to catch the eye of any fervent meat-eater, so this is a great spot to take any vegetarian friends." -City Nomads

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Muhamara, Kash-e-Bademjan, Kufte Parsi, Shah Pasand Chicken

  • PRIVATE DINING ROOM

    Shabestan makes a stylish event venue that is highly flexible with delectable Persian cuisine banquet service and catering. Both the indoor and alfresco areas have a different ambiance to meet the needs of your event. Well-suited for private parties, corporate, or simply fun, lively celebrations, the team at Shabestan will have something for every occasion. Kindly reach out to the Shabestan team directly for private dining room enquiries.

  • ABOUT

    At Shabu Sen, keep yourself warm and satisfied with their delicious hotpot filled with the freshest ingredients. Choose two or three soup bases to a pot to enhance your hot pot experience. We recommend their Healthy Collagen and Sichuan Mala soup bases to dip your ingredients in. With a wide selection of ingredients to choose from, you’re spoilt for choice with the likes of fresh Boston Lobster, Abalone, and even US Wagyu Beef Striploin. If you’re not up for hot pot, Shabu Sen also offers an ala carte chinese menu with delicious comfort dishes that reminds you of an authentic home cooked meal. Snack on the crispy Fried Fish Skin, or sink your teeth into their juicy, fragrant Prawn Paste Wings for a starter. One of their must-tries at Shabu Sen is their XO Fried Rice that has just the right amount of XO taste and a beautiful wok-hey char. For vegetables and seafood, Shabu Sen allows you to customise the cooking style to suit your taste. We recommend ordering their Sauteed Oyster Sauce Naibai and the Sambal Chilli Lala for a saucy, spicy and savoury meal. Indulge yourselves with their Half Shell Scallops that come steamed with garlic and springy vermicelli or go big with their Fiery Chili Lobster. With a menu that aims to please and cater to everyone’s palette, go empty-stomach and find a little something for everyone at Shabu Sen. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prawn Paste Wings, XO Fried Rice, Sauteed Oyster Sauce Naibai, Half Shell Scallops

    Since opening in 1997, Shahi Maharani has won countless awards and accolades for its fine cuisine, and judging from our own dining experience, each one is richly deserved. Shahi Maharani aims to provide a dining experience reminiscent of North Indian Royalty. Everything from its décor, to its food and service, will ensure that your trip to the restaurant is undoubtedly fit for a king. Upon entering its ornate doors, you will be enveloped by a deep burgundy and rich gold interior, with traditional glass lamps and classical Indian music. The traditional North Indian food is truly outstanding and will please even the seasoned gourmand. To those less initiated, the warm and helpful servers will be more than happy to recommend dishes, and even wine pairings to go with your meal. Topped off with its convenient location in Raffles City, a trip to Shahi Maharani is certainly not to be missed. (Dec 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "We left with satisfied stomachs: the portions are large and require a healthy appetite." -Expat Living

    Located in Shangri-La Hotel, Singapore, Shang Palace has held a reputation as one of the foremost Chinese restaurants in Singapore for 50 years.The flagship of 36 Shang Palace restaurants worldwide, it is the ultimate establishment for Cantonese fine dining. Using traditional techniques with a contemporary twist, Shang Palace delights diners with a delectable harmony of old and new; including ‘lost’ dishes, award-winning signatures, and a selection of innovation creations inspired by modern day influences. The restaurant's cooking has no added MSG and features more than 60 sauces made in-house. Combining stunning décor and the pinnacle of Asian service and hospitality, with impeccable Cantonese dining, Shang Palace remains the gastronomic icon in Shangri-La's international group of hotels. (Oct 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Definitely on the A-list of Singapore's Chinese restaurants, Shang's Cantonese seafood and classics such as Peking Duck are well known - and the interior more than matches the food. To sample the ambience without distressing your bank manager, order from the dim sum menu." -Lonely Planet "Seafood, the hallmark of any good Cantonese kitchen, is done particularly well: the yellow croaker, seasoned simply with pepper and salt and then flash fried, charmed with its tender flesh and light flavours." -Time Out Singapore

    Located in the spectacular JEWEL @ Changi Airport, Shang Social marks the esteemed Shangri-La Group’s first standalone restaurant venture. Diners can expect a luxe dining environment, top-notch service, and an exciting menu. The food here is inspired by three main cuisines, namely Cantonese, Huaiying, and Sichuan. Fittingly, there are three dining enclaves here, dedicated to formal and communal dining, as well as drinks. The Signature Honey Pork Belly is one of their most popular items, and for good reason. The meat is deliciously juicy, and is enhanced by the sweet smokiness of the marinade and grill. The skin of the pork belly is delightfully crisp, but the meat inside is melt-in-your-mouth tender. There is also a wide variety of seafood items. The Sichuan Kung Pao Prawn is made with a generous portion of spice for that mouth-numbing spice that Singaporeans have come to love. For something to share in a group of 4 and above, try the Deep-Fried Boneless Chicken filled with Fried Glutinous Rice, and Braised Black Marbled Pork. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Honey Pork Belly, Sichuan Kung Pao Prawn, Deep-Fried Boneless Chicken filled with Fried Glutinous Rice, Braised Black Marbled Pork and Eight Treasures Tofu Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    Hearts across the island broke as news of Shashlik's closure spread, but then the classic Hainanese-run Western restaurant announced it would re-open under a younger generation of owners, while retaining the old world charm and staff that had kept customers happy for decades. The endearingly twee vibe here harkens back to a day of refinement, when going out for a meal was a special occasion, and where personal, friendly service was a big part of the meal. But at Shashlik, it's also the comforting flavours that have kept customers returning over the years, starting with the pillowy dinner rolls and butter that greet you at the table, and following through to entrees like French Onion Soup, a meaty beef broth enriched with caramelized onions and a crusty cheese croute, or endearingly 60s appetizers like Egg Millionaire - chopped boiled egg, bacon bits, and parmesan gratin served in little egg cups. There's even Blinis & Caviar, served with sour cream, if you're feeling especially indulgent before your main. We'd hold back on the appetizers though, because the shashlik, or meat grilled on skewers served straight up at the table, is very hearty. There's the classic Shashlik of Beef, juicy tenderloin rich with the flavours of a 24-hour marinade, as well as pork, chicken, and lamb. If you like your meat cooked more conventionally, there's also grilled steaks. But one of our favourite ways of eating meat here is in one of Shashlik's classic old-world stews: hearty, rustic Oxtail Stew and creamy Beef Stroganoff, perfect with some crusty bread or rice, and a heart full of nostalgia. For dessert: Baked Alaska, no question. The food here may seem a little too quaint for the 21st century, but really that's part of the charm, and a rapidly disappearing one at that. So book a table while you can! (Apr 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "I like how the new owners of Shashlik have kept the character of the restaurant largely intact, but also made subtle changes to improve the food." -Her World "Shashlik is no fine-dining establishment, nor does it aim to be. What it has though, is heart and soul." -The Peak

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Blinis & Caviar, Borscht, French Onion Soup, Eggs Millionaire, Beef Shashlik, Oxtail Stew, Beef Stroganoff, Chicken à la Kiev, Baked Alaska

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2019, 2020, and 2021 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

    Tucked away in Broadway Plaza, Shen Ji Tong Guo Chuan Chuan Xiang is a hidden gem in Ang Mo Kio that serves authentic soups with unique flavours such as butter mala, as well as signature hotpots and skewers. The ideal place for gatherings and family dinners, Shen Ji Tong Guo Chuan Chuan Xiang often rolls out promotions and packages that give more bang for your buck. You won’t be able to resist their skewers that are sold for merely $0.20 each! Start your meal with the restaurant’s cold cucumber dish, a delicious traditional Chinese delicacy while waiting for your soup to boil. From pork belly to homemade prawn paste and cockles, the restaurant provides the freshest ingredients by ensuring that they are prepared daily. Dim Sum lovers will definitely be wowed by a wide variety of options such as pan-fried dumplings, spicy wanton and the restaurant's signature fried fish skin. Be it a reunion dinner or birthday lunch, the array of side dishes paired with the restaurant’s flavourful soup and tasty skewers makes it the perfect place for any meal. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fried Fish Skin, Shen Ji Pan Fried Dumpling, Prawn Egg Fried Rice

• ABOUT

    The grand-daddy of teppanyaki restaurants in Singapore, Shima has been firing up Japanese food à la minute at the stately Goodwood Hotel since 1980. The table-side acrobatics of its Japan-trained chefs has become a part of the meal as the delicious flash-cooked dishes made from fresh ingredients. The menu has since expanded to include sushi and sashimi dishes to go along with the hot plates, satisfying that Japanese cuisine craving of yours under one roof. The classic Teppanyaki menu features a range of premium meats cooked before your eyes to perfection. Fatty tenderloin of Wagyu, chicken thigh, buttery foie gras, live lobster, and tender salmon belly sizzle on the pan, releasing their delicious aromas as a teaser to the meal. Mounds of garlicky fried rice and fresh vegetables follow, mopping up the meaty juices for a taste of perfection. If you want to beef up your meal, order some hand rolls that are studded with everything from chopped tuna belly to braised unagi, or get a platter of sashimi to ramp up all those umami flavours swirling about in your mouth. If you hate choosing, meals here come in elegant Kaiseki-style sets, where you let the chefs prepare the meal at a luxurious pace that will leave you bursting at the seams. Everyone loves a good, smoky teppanyaki dinner, and here you get to pair that with sushi for a complete Japanese night out! (Jan 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “One thing is for sure though, whenever you choose to go to Shima, you’ll no doubt leave wanting more.” -Sassy Mama “Its showy, flamboyant chefs – equipped with culinary acrobatics and teppan tricks – have been personally honed by Japanese teppanyaki masters, and they won’t rest ’til you’re stuffed from Shima’s popular, all-you-can-eat teppanyaki buffet lunches.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sushi Moriawase, Beef Tenderloin, Ise Ebi, Salmon Belly, Oyster, Garlic Rice, Tochigi, Foie Gras, Lamb Tenderloin

  • ABOUT

    Simple and authentic, Shin Kushiya serves up affordable, quality Japanese cuisine in an elegant and contemporary setting. As one of the first Japanese restaurants to introduce the Kushiyaki dining concept in Singapore, their signature Kushiyaki skewers are prepared with culinary craftsmanship of the highest calibre, producing mouth-watering skewers that are both flavourful and appetising. It's also worth a mention that Shin Kushiya uses imported Bincho Charcoal from Japan that's known for the clean-charcoal smokiness it imparts to food during grilling. The minute you step into this quaint Japanese eatery, the minimalistic interior is a dead giveaway that it's no-frills and all-flavours here. Go for the signature Kushiyaki - with over 50 different types to choose from, there's no denying that these tantalising sticks made from fresh and quality seafood, meat, and vegetables are sure winners. Shin Kushiya doesn't stop at skewers either; enjoy all-time crowd-pleasers such as Sashimi, Sushi, Maki Donburi, and many more. (Mar 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Shin Kushiya takes pride in its speciality Kushiyaki - fresh ingredients that are grilled over bincho charcoal from Japan that burns at a high temperature to provide a crisp smokiness." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kushiyaki, Trio of Sashimi Favourites, Flamed Salmon Sashimi Maki, Yakitori Kushiyaki Set, Buta Kushiyaki Set, Unagi Don Set, Chicken Shogayaki Don Set, Asari Butteryaki, Ikura Chawanmushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Shin Minori is all about value in Japanese dining. Offering all sorts of cravings from sushi to tempura, this is your one stop shop for Japanese feasting without the splurge. Best known for its a la carte buffet option, Shin Minori is ideal for group gatherings or family dinners, where a variety of palates need to be pleased. Meaning "new harvest" in Japanese, the restaurant features a motif of golden grains blended with traditional Japanese design for a casual yet distinguished atmosphere. The menu indeed showcases the new and noteworthy, with novel selections crafted by the kitchen team to enhance the buffet experience with original tastes. The buffet menu is an impressive deal, offering tempting slices of raw seafood and rice filled sushi. A pretty parade of hand rolls, or temaki, is also on offer with the Spider Temaki filled crispy soft shell crab often gaining multiple orders. The maki rolls are a rainbow of creative combinations including the Harvest Maki Roll with tempura shrimp and avocado, almond and coconut flakes, and a sweet and tangy mango eel sauce. Supplement your picks with grilled yakimono, airy tempura and more for a complete Japanese smorgasbord that doesn't break the bank. (Oct 2019)

  • SAVE 20% OFF BUFFET WHEN YOU PRE-PURCHASE CHOPE VOUCHERS

    Save 20% off Buffet when you pre-purchase Chope vouchers to Shin Minori Japanese Restaurant (Katong Square) here.

    Maguro Sashimi, Kani Tempura, Zaru Soba, Spider Temaki, Ebi Tempura Maki, Harvest Maki Roll

html:
• ABOUT

    For a spot of comforting Japanese food in the Kampong Bahru area, head over to Shinnsato. Here, you’ll find favourites such as sashimi, tempura, and hearty donburi. For starters, order the Sashimi Platter that comes with a selection of salmon, horse mackerel, maguro (tuna), and swordfish. The slices of fish are fresh and generously cut, perfect with a dab of wasabi and soy sauce. For mains, the Gindara Cod Fish is not to be missed. The thick slab of fatty fish is tender and juicy, paired with crisp root vegetables. Fancy something heartier? Tuck into the Tempura and Soba set, which comes with two pieces of deep-fried prawns and vegetables, a Californian roll, and a refreshing plate of cold soba. Shinnsato also offers value-for-money lunch sets, with your choice of donburi or soba, along with a side of tempura or sashimi, and a bowl of miso soup. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sashimi Platter, Gindara Cod Fish, Tempura and Soba, Unagi Don, Salmon Don

  • ABOUT

    A Kyushu specialty, Shinsho Ramen Singapore serves piping hot bowls of fusion and special ramen inspired by the country to hungry diners in the town area looking to satisfy their Japanese food cravings. With a flaming passion for Japanese food and a burning desire to serve all customers only the best and freshest food, you simply cannot miss out on trying the restaurant’s creatively delicious combinations of tangy noodles and premium quality meat in a rich and unique broth. Prepared by boiling meat and bones for more than 12 hours, Shinsho Ramen’s signature homemade ramen soup features a milky white and smooth texture that is full of collagen. Take a pick of your favourite Japanese topping with the restaurant’s expansive menu of meat and seafood ramen dishes. From meltingly tender chashu to fresh wagyu and lobster, there’s something for everyone here! A simple yet delicious dish that will excite your taste buds, the Aged Soy Sauce Ramen is a dry bowl of freshly made noodles garnished with onions, radish and greens mixed in a fragrant soy sauce highly recommended for those on the hunt for a light meal. If you’re on the hunt for a unique bowl of ramen noodles, the Special Black Truffle Flavour is just the dish for you! Made for the truffle fans, this yummy bowl of noodles features a runny onsen egg paired with tender slices of chashu elevated by the exotic flavour of premium truffle sauce. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aged Soy Sauce Ramen, Special Black Truffle Flavour, Half Rock Lobster, Pork Ribs with Teriyaki

  • ABOUT

    Look no further than Shinsho Ramen for fusion and specialty ramen offerings. East siders can look forward to satisfying their Japanese food cravings with the restaurant’s creatively delicious menu options that delight with the best and freshest ingredients at the Paya Lebar outlet. Serving the best noodles with your choice of broth, the signature homemade ramen soup is prepared by boiling meat and bones for more than twelve hours resulting in a wonderfully milky white and smooth texture filled with collagen and other equally nutritious benefits. Combined with Shinsho Ramen’s in house fresh springy noodles, each and every bowl at the restaurant brings diners on a gastronomic journey for a taste of Japan. Simple ramen dishes fit for casual dinners and lunch dates such as the Aged Soy Sauce and Spicy Red Miso are popular crowd favourites while fancier dining options such as the Half Rock Lobster and Kuroge Wagyu A4 are often ordered for celebratory events and intimate dates. We highly recommend giving their fried buns a try. Our favourite is undoubtedly the Sliced Roasted Pork Belly. Sandwiched between a crispy fried bun, the generous slice of roasted pork belly is tender and melts in your mouth with each bite. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spicy Red Miso, Half Rock Lobster, Kuroge Wagyu A4, Sliced Roasted Pork Belly

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Shinzo Japanese Cuisine started in 2013 fueled by a passion to bring affordable high-quality omakase to Singapore. The word Shinzo means heart in Japanese. Having spent more than 39 years honing his skills as a sushi shokunin (sushi artisan), Chef Patrick Tan knows that the best sushi is made from the heart. Chef Tan takes great pride in making sure he maintains an intimate setting in his sushi bar. He wants every seat in the house to be the best so that guests have full view of their personal chefs in working on their creations. Chef Tan believes that this is one of the highlights of the Shinzo experience. He is a perfectionist who is known for shaping the culture at many renowned fine dining Japanese restaurants in Singapore, including the Sushi Jin by Les Amis Group, Nogawa and Sushi Chiharu. At Shinzo, one can expect nothing less than the freshest ingredients flown in directly from Japan. Just as the ingredients varies with the seasons in Japan, so does Shinzo’s menu. Chef Tan constantly pushes the envelope of culinary creativity, such as fusing non-Japanese ingredients like foie gras and century egg with traditional Japanese cuisine. (Jun 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chirashi Lunch Set, Take Lunch Omakase, Tokusen Dinner Omakase, Hokkaido Uni, Hotate Foie Gras, Kanpachi Carpaccio and Hokkaido King Crab with Uni Sauce

  • THE BUZZ

    "A Japanese sushi, omakase, and sake restaurant run by chef Lawrence Chia. It was a meal filled with "but wait, there's more" moments." -The Straits Times "Along the next street, stalwart Shinzo Japanese Cuisine constantly updates its offerings according to the seasons. Shinzo’s chefs Patrick Tan and Kevin Ho trained under acclaimed chef Yoshio Nogawa who introduced sushi to Singapore at his Sushi Kaiseki Nogawa when it opened in 1978." -cnaluxury

html:
• ABOUT

    A hotpot and BBQ buffet restaurant that serves up an interesting selection of fresh seafood, ingredients, cooked food and beverages, tuck into a hearty feast of Asian favourites with family and friends here at Shiok Garden. Decorated with elements traditionally found in the early kampung days of Singapore, feed your nostalgia as you savour the best of hotpot and BBQ delights in the restaurant’s cosy interior. You can’t go wrong with Shiok Garden’s BBQ Sambal Stingray. An all time favourite, this fiery dish is sure to spice up your meal with the in house special sambal that is prepared fresh daily. Taste the fragrance of the localicious sauce with each bite of the soft, succulent stingray that melts in your mouth! Topped with the freshest evaporated milk and sweetened with just the right amount of sugar, the Thai Ice Milk Tea is the perfect remedy for a hot day. Alternatively, the Avocado Milkshake is a deliciously healthy drink to quench your thirst. Made for rainy days, Shiok Garden also serves up steaming hot bowls of Fish Soup Noodle peppered with crispy flakes for an extra crunch. Wrap up your meal with the Classic Dessert Chendol for a sweet ending to a wonderful meal. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    BBQ Sambal Stingray, Fish Soup Noodle, Classic Dessert Chendol, Thai Ice Milk Tea

html:
• ABOUT

    Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro at Hilton Singapore Orchard, is the Singapore debut of Japan’s best loved chain of Szechwan restaurants, Shisen Hanten. It is the product of a proud culinary legacy that began with the founding of Japan’s first Szechwan restaurant in 1958 by Chen Kenmin, regarded as the “Father of Szechwan cuisine in Japan.” Carrying on the family tradition is his eldest son, Chen Kenichi, nicknamed the “Szechwan Sage” and acclaimed as one of Japan’s most celebrated iron chefs. It was Chen Kenichi that expanded the family business, branching out across Japan and imbuing his personal touch to the Shisen Hanten brand by incorporating fresh new ideas into the menu offerings. Now taking center stage is third-generation Chen Kentaro, Executive Chef of Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro, and himself a rising star in Japan’s culinary scene. From the time the restaurant was launched in 2014, Chef Kentaro continues to demonstrate his mastery of Szechwan cuisine with a menu that celebrates the signature flavors of Shisen Hanten, alongside traditional Cantonese fare. Shisen Hanten by Chen Kentaro was awarded two stars in the MICHELIN Guide Singapore 2016, 2017 and 2018, 2019, 2021, making it the highest Michelin-rated Chinese restaurant in Singapore for five consecutive years. (Mar 2022)

  • THE BUZZ

    "For those who can take the heat, Chen's mapo doufu and the stewed fish fillet in super-hot Sichuan pepper sauce are not to be missed. The former is one of the best versions of mapo doufu in town - silky beancurd with a beautifully spicy sauce of bean-paste (aged for three years), chilli peppers and fragrant Sichuan peppercorns that leaves a tingling, numbing sensation lingering in one's mouth." -Asia Tatler Dining "In addition to the cuisine perfected by the three celebrity chefs, indulge in a rich dining experience in its multi-million dollar interior. Be bowled over in its majestic dining hall, adorned in hues of black, gold and red, accentuated by charming furnishings of exquisite Chinese artwork, with a fusion of a modern contemporary touch in floor-to-ceiling glass panels." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised Abalone in Premium Soya Sauce, Mapo Tofu, Chen's Original Spicy Soup Noodle, Roasted Crispy Duck, Barbecued with Honey Glaze, Stir-Fried Wagyu Beef with Green Peppers, Pan Roasted Rack of Lamb, Cold Almond Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    Shish Mahal is a humble restaurant and bar tucked in Village hotel at Albert Court. Offering some of the best Indian and Nepalese Cuisine, the restaurant’s delicious food options are crafted with traditional organic herbs and spices. Great for families and large groups, this friendly restaurant’s extensive menu showcases the rich Indian and Nepalese culture. An ultimate place for authentic Indian cuisine, Shish Mahal’s extensive menu features a wide range of vegetarian food that will surely satiate your cravings for healthy, tasty and affordable Indian food. With many years of experience in whipping up special and exotic dishes, the team of chefs at the restaurant are highly skilled and adaptable. Be it a quick and wholesome meal or a tailored menu suitable for fine dining, Shish Mahal is able to provide what your stomach desires. Awarded a Michelin Award Winner Best Restaurant 2017 in Singapore, the restaurant’s signature dishes include Indian street food such as Aloo Papri Chaat, Fish in Banana Leaf, and Tandoori Prawns. Come down to Village hotel to taste the best of Indian and Nepalese cuisine for yourself! (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aloo Papri Chaat, Fish in Banana Leaf, Tandoori Prawns, Paneer Butter Masala

html:
• ABOUT

    The Emmanuel Stroobant Group's first venture into Japanese cuisine comes in the form of this intimate 14-seater sushi joint. Perhaps, 'joint' isn't the right word; after all, a restaurant which boasts an austere elegance and a pricey omakase menu deserves more formality. It's a venture with the founder of three Michelin star Sushi Shikon - folks who've been to this Mercer Hotel establishment in Hong Kong will likely remember its jaw-dropping price tag - so excellent Japanese food is to be expected. Like most Japanese places which take pride in authenticity, ingredients are flown in from Tsukiji Market daily and used to great effect in the Master Chef's impressive array of omakase dishes. Let's just say that wobbling out of Shoukouwa is a possibility once you've finished two appetisers, three assorted sashimi, four cooked dishes, 13 pieces of nigiri sushi, miso soup, Japanese omelette, and dessert. The cooked dishes are great but the stars of the show are, without a doubt, the premium seafood. Slices bear none of that heavy, fishy aroma, but remain slightly salty and very sweet - as all fresh catch should be. If you're looking to be hypnotised by a vast array of dishes made in front of your eyes and impeccably fresh seafood, look no further than this incredibly intimate and meditative sushi restaurant. (May 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Besides 13 pieces of sushi, you get two small appetisers, three kinds of sashimi and four cooked dishes - it isn't often that you roll out of a Japanese restaurant fully stuffed, but that's what happens here." -The Business Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Awabi, Nigiri Sushi, Uni

html:
• ABOUT

    This is one of the first overseas incarnations of the famed restaurant in Chengdu. Established in 2004, the flagship restaurant has been delighting diners with Sichuan classics for over a decade. The dishes here combine a variety of cuisines - from Huaiying to Cantonese, with dishes ranging from spicy Pepper Chicken to soothing soups. The popular Mala Hotpot has its roots in Sichuan cuisine, so it’s no surprise that dishes on the menu come with an extra kick. Spice fanatics will love the Mala Crab for its searing heat levels and generous portions of crab meat. Diners who prefer something less fiery can opt for the delicious Chicken Pudding - a delectable dish of meat and herbs that is perfect on a cold day. The Marinated Pig’s Trotter is another Sichuan dish that features tender pork meat soaked in a flavourful blend of herbs and spices and cooked to perfection. The premium ingredients and fancy interior may seem too plush for some, but don’t be fooled - this restaurant is as wallet-friendly as it gets, so patrons can indulge without fear of breaking the bank. If you’re ever in River Valley and craving a taste of Chengdu, this is the place to go! (Apr 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Marinated Pig’s Trotter, Mala Crab, Chicken Pudding, Gong Bao Cod Fish, La Zi Chicken

html:
• ABOUT

    You might be forgiven for thinking that you’ve been transported to an intimate restaurant in one of Tokyo’s back alleys. Nestled cosily in the trendy yet historic corner of Stanley Street is Shukuu Izakaya, a trendy hotspot featuring a bevy of eclectic small plates that will tickle taste buds. The intimate space features iconic red lanterns and a traditional Japanese mural to create a chic vibe that makes the experience so authentic. Whether you’re looking for an eatery with friends or just a quiet, solitary dinner after work, the superb yet reasonably-priced fare gives you the perfect reason to let your hair down. Staying true to their conviction of serving only high quality food, ingredients are sourced from leading Japanese suppliers and air-flown in fresh from Japan. The dishes here remains true to its Japanese roots while tinkling with Western influences. The Kani Gratin, or crab gratin with mentaiko, and the Rosti Mentai, where swiss-style potato shreds are drizzled with a decadent mentaiko sauce, serve as fine testaments. Shukuu Izakaya’s specialty, Kushiyaki, or charcoal-grilled skewered meat, is a must-try as well. The Omi Wagyu as well as the Kurobuta Tontoro are your best bets. For the more adventurous, the Yaki Gyu Tan, where premium beef tongue is grilled to tender perfection is sure to please as well. The dishes here taste best when paired with sake, so choose your partner in crime from their extensive range of sakes or ask for a recommendation, and voilà, the meal’s perfect! (Feb 2017)

    “Sake recommendations are dependent on the food ordered: Sakemire Jumai Ginjyo is paired with sashimi, Noguchi Honjozo Nama with char-grilled dishes and Tenzan Jizake Jumai with fried snacks.” -Time Out Singapore

html:
• ABOUT

    Since the early Edo period, izakayas (or ‘sit-down sake shops’) have been an indispensable fixture in the Japanese way of life and a few years ago, they found their place in Singapore’s flourishing culinary landscape. Shunjuu Izakaya, situated along the beautiful Robertson Quay, adds a refreshing spritz of excitement to the modern Izakaya with their specialty in Sumiyaki, charcoal-grilled dishes which may very well be the Japanese answer to tapas. We love the al-fresco dining space but if you’re looking for some air-conditioned comfort, the wood-filled interior and cosy booths provides a much-welcomed respite. When it comes to food, expect well-executed Japanese favourites with an emphasis on dishes that pair well with sake or shochu. As with tapas, the dishes are served as small plates made for sharing, so don’t go easy on the ordering! All 70 of their sumiyaki signatures such as the Tori Kawa Ninniku (garlic rolled with chicken skin), Tebasaki (chicken wings), Gyu Tan (ox tongue) are not to be missed of course. Cold dishes such as the Tako Wasabi (seasoned baby octopus) , the Sashimi Sarada (sashimi salad), and Tori Kawa Masago Ae (chicken skin mixed with cod roe) are also as delicious as hot plates such as the Buta Kimuchi Itame (stir-fry pork and kimchee) and the Ribuai Tataki (ribeye carparccio). For some carbs, opt for some Soba or the delicious Ninniku Cha-han (garlic fried rice). Wash it all down with sake or shochu - a wide selection awaits, along with a detailed table which specifies the serving temperature, the prefecture of origin, and the sake meter, allowing you to make the most informed choice. We suggest you try a few. It can’t hurt, can it? (Aug 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Shunjuu Izakaya grills the competition, pun intended, with their sumiyaki (charcoal grill) specialties. Often, you can find these delicacies served on skewers; don’t hesitate to try signature dishes like foie gras, kaki buta maki (oysters rolled with pork), and crispy tebasaki (chicken wing).” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yakitori, Tori Kawa Ninni, Ninniku Cha-han, Tori Zousui, Gyu Tan, Tebasaki, Sashimi Sarada, Ribuai Tataki

• ABOUT

    Having first opened its doors in 1996, Si Chuan Dou Hua is no stranger to anyone serious about Chinese food. A wide array of authentic Sichuan and Cantonese fare is offered here, with a menu that stretches more than 30 pages long. Yet, quality is not compromised, and every dish boasts nuanced flavours that will tinkle with your taste buds. Contrary to popular belief, Sichuan cuisine isn't defined by a fiery spiciness that requires a glass of water nearby at all times. We are major fans of their Sichuan Dan Dan Noodles, but that's just the tip of the iceberg. Expect dishes like the Marinated Black Chinese Fungus with Preserved Chilli, the Braised Sea Cucumber in Sichuan Bean Paste, and the delicate Boiled Sliced Fish in Sichuan Pepper Sauce to blow you away with their smorgasbord of robust flavours. Their Cantonese classics are similarly executed with finesse. The highlight is undoubtedly the dim sum here where diners are treated with an eclectic mix of old favourites and innovative creations, but double-boiled soups like the Chicken Soup with "Lingzhi" and dishes such as the Braised Seafood Treasures with Sliced Abalone warrant a return trip. (Jan 2017)

    "Are the dishes 'Sichuan spicy' or 'normal spicy'?" we asked. The restaurant's management staff replied, "Sichuan spicy!" Normally we would discount that reply as pure marketing trickery, but after trying the dishes for ourselves, we were instant believers. Welcome to Si Chuan Dou Hua, bringing you authentic Sichuan and Cantonese cuisine from its perch on the top floor of UOB Plaza 1. Complete with chefs imported in from Sichuan and Hong Kong in addition to martial arts-and-dance-trained traditional tea pourers from Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan province, this place is as real as it gets, folks! Although there are three outlets in Singapore, each boasting a different menu that caters to a specific clientele, the UOB location is best known for its 30% Sichuan and 70% Cantonese split menu. This makes it ideal for hosting clients since it's probably best to avoid the faux pas of entertaining guests while drenched in a fearsome chili-induced sweat. In addition to abalone-themed set meals and Sichuan-style high tea, the restaurant also features an expansive list of high end teas imported from various regions in China. (Oct 2012)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Spectacular views and refined Szechuan cuisine are what you can expect here. Popular with corporate types and families, Si Chuan Dou Hua offers a fantastic array of dishes." -SG Now

    It’s a no-brainer that our love for spicy foods knows no bounds. Whether it is a tucking into a bubbling pot of fish head curry, or scouring for the best sambal for our nasi lemak, we flock to spicy foods like moths to a flame. That’s why we’re head over heels for Si Wei Mao Cai, a humble Sichuan restaurant located in Chinatown that reigns supreme with its fiendishly spicy foods. Ready to set your tongue ablaze? Then we highly recommend diving into a pot of Si Wei Stewed Beef in Hot Szechuan Pepper Sauce. Adventurous eaters should not miss the restaurant’s rendition of Si Wei Chilli Frog where tender frog legs are stir-fried in a blend of fresh and dried chillies. Then wash down the spiciness with the mild vinegary Pickled Vegetables with Beef, or any number of Chinese wines and liquors available here. If you ask us, we personally can’t say no to a cold glass of Hai Zi Lan or a Mao Tai. Aside from its delectable dishes, Si Wei Mao Cai also prides itself on its top-notch service. And honestly, we’re bowled over not only by the incredibly polite and efficient wait staff, but the kitchen who tries to accommodate any requests for Sichuan dishes not on the menu. (Sep 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Be warned: dine at Si Wei Mao Cai only if you can take the heat. The dishes here are not kidding when it comes to spice – they’ll leave you dripping in sweat and with a numb tongue” – TimeOut Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Si Wei Stewed Beef in Hot Szechuan Pepper Sauce, Pickled Vegetables with Beef, Si Wei Chilli Frog, Si Wei Chilli Crab, Hai Zi Lan, Mao Tai

    Traditional steamboat is all about swishing your meat or vegetables in hot broth. At Si Wei Xiao Hot Pot, expect a slight twist on tradition, as you dip skewered meats into a variety of soup bases. This sister restaurant to the popular Si Wei Mao Cai just next door on Mosque Street offers matsutake mushroom or pork bone soup for those who prefer clear broths, to traditional spicy Sichuan soups for those who can take the heat. Come with an appetite and order an array of skewers to share, because the chuan chuan (food on sticks) menu here is extensive! Start the meal with sticks of pork belly, marinated chicken and beef tongue, then move on to ordering some vegetable skewers like kang kong, ladyfingers and beancurd skin. Dip these into your soup base of choice for a satisfying experience! (May 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sichuan Spicy Soup (Butter Oil), Matsutake Soup, Pork Knuckle Soup, Dan Dan Noodle, Wanton Mushroom Soup, Si Chuan Brown Sugar Ice Jelly

• ABOUT

    Rustic, old-world surroundings replete with soft lighting and wooden finishes, beautifully plated classic Thai food and friendly service, it’s hard to believe you’re in the middle of a bustling Singapore mall. Siam Kitchen gives you the Thai fix you’ve been longing for in air-conditioned comfort, offering platefuls of traditional Thai favourites, ranging from tasty Bangkok street food to refined fare originating from the royal court. Tuck into a Thailand-wide feast with fare from the country’s coastal cuisine - think a beautiful deep-fried garoupa dressed in a savoury-sweet mango sauce - to the rich curries and soups of the Northern regions, including fragrant red curry and a comforting beef soup. Grilled meats and skewers evoke sweaty Bangkok nights and a classic mango sticky rice rounds up the meal and sends you off with a satisfied smile. Let Siam Kitchen take care of your sweet and spicy food cravings, and come tuck into the robust offerings of our friends in the north! (Dec 2020)

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Sichuan Alley’s name is beautifully straightforward belying the respect, thought, and care that was put into it, much like its offerings. Sichuan Alley focuses wholeheartedly on one particular Sichuan ingredient known as Mian Yang rice noodles. At Sichuan Alley, these noodles are served the way they have always been for millennia: with a choice of different broths, and a variety of toppings such as braised beef and pig intestines. Sichuan Alley’s rice noodles are, admittedly, a little more distinctive: they are specially sourced from one particular artisan who lives in a village deep in Sichuan. Research for months into about 50 different Sichuan noodle shops led the Sichuan Alley team to understand that only one particular shop sold the exact type and style of Mian Yang noodles that they wanted to present to Singaporeans – but it took close to a year and dozens of personal trips to the shop insincere appeal before the owners finally softened and agreed to speak to them. It took even longer to research and try the different noodles the artisan-made: every detail was examined, down to the gauge of the noodles in millimeters.The noodles now served in Sichuan Alley are customised for the noodle house and found nowhere else in Singapore or South East Asia. The noodles may be ordered with the clear or red soups as well as the uniquely Sichuan mix of red and clear. In addition, Sichuan Alley also offers a third broth option: a deceptively clear soup that is piquantly infused with Sichuan vine pepper, and a dry-tossed version. Those with bigger appetites can feel free to order “add-ons” as extra toppings for the noodles, and a curated selection of small plates – archetypal Sichuan sides such as Fried Crispy Pig Intestines and Braised Eggplant – as accompaniment. The interiors of Sichuan Alley is deserving of attention from the diner as well. Located in a side alley just off the far busier main street in much the same way that noodle shops in China have been set up for years, Sichuan Alley is a little haven of gently coloured wood, bamboo furnishings and warm lighting. The small space of half a dozen tables – bustling when full, and tranquil when quiet – is inspired by the aforementioned noodle shops though elevated with thoughtful design details to ensure comfort for the guest even at the busiest of times. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mian Yang Noodles, Fried Crispy Pig Intestines, Braised Eggplant

    Signature Reserve is a collaboration between Quaich bar and Whisky Butler where diners get the opportunity to learn, experience and explore. Uncover as many as 500 different whiskies and discover the art of pairing whisky with food with the bar’s Signature Whisky Omakase. Taste and savour the epitome of whiskey enjoyment and appreciation with Signature Reserve’s professionally trained whisky butlers. Featuring the widest range of whisky tasting flights available locally, diners can enjoy an extensive collection of old and rare official bottlings as well as new limited edition collector’s whiskies by the glass. For those who prefer to pop open a bottle of bubbly for an unforgettable night out, the bar also boasts an equally elegant range of boutique wines, bubblies and signature cocktails inspired by Singapore’s gastronomical heritage. Looking for a quick fix? Signature Reserve’s signature single malt does exactly that! For the alcohol lovers that enjoy subtle hints of fruity flavour accompanied with a sweet aftertaste, the Arran The Sherry Cask Finish or Tomintoul 12YO Oloroso Sherry Finish is for you. (Jul 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Helmed by a team of culinary specialists from China who have dug deep into their respective repertoires of provincial cuisines to present an array of innovative and unique dishes, Silk Road Restaurant at Amara Hotel is a celebration of regional Chinese cuisine that is a joy to experience. The menu at Silk Road Restaurant is an enthralling medley of inventive and traditional creations, with each dish a perfect showcase of artistic flair and deft culinary skills. The must-have at Silk Road Restaurant is the Shanghai Xiao Long Bao. Each dainty parcel of pork is marinated with sauces and spices for over four hours to achieve maximum flavour, fragrance, and taste before being wrapped in a delicate dough skin together with a juicy burst of flavourful broth. The Fried Shaved Noodle with Sliced Beef features silky and chewy noodles paired with a succulent slices of beef which have been seasoned with fragrant herbs and spices before being expertly fried till all the flavours have been sealed in. Of course, the Traditional Beijing Roasted Duck is another popular dish on the menu. Roasted for an optimum amount of time so that the premium duck meat can retain moisture and succulence under its layers of shining, cracking, skin, diners are free to enjoy this in the usual way (rolled in a crepe), or with sugar granules that bring out its crunchiness and crispiness even more. A meal at Silk Road Restaurant is almost akin to a journey of discovery down the Silk Road - definitely not to be missed! (Apr 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shanghai Xiao Long Bao, Sliced Pork with Cucumber on Rack, Jelly Noodle with Spicy Sour Bean Sauce, Double-Boiled Chicken Soup with Ginseng, Deep-Fried Prawn with Wasabi and Crispy Potato, Sichuan Smoked Duck with Camphor and Tea Leaves, Fried Shaved Noodle with Sliced Beef, Traditional Beijing Roasted Duck

Relish all-you-can-eat indulgences or enticing a la carte selections that go perfectly well with curated wines, cocktails, and the fresh sea breeze. Western classics, Asian favourites, vegetarian options and more await, along with a dedicated kid’s menu that adds a splash of fun to the family-friendly all-day dining destination. Elevated on the third level of the resort offering air-conditioned indoor seating as well as an alfresco seating terrace, grab a table by the window to take in the sea views and immerse in a relaxed and casual atmosphere where service is attentive yet unobtrusive. Dine at ease with convenient contactless ordering and safety measures in place. (Dec 2020)

    Sinpopo Brand is an amalgamation of classics combined with Peranakan flavours to deliver a sensation-rich and delectable experience. Located in the heart of Katong, our restaurant pays homage to the community’s love for traditional comfort food by putting a delicious spin on familiar dishes in a charming retro setting located in a conserved shophouse in Katong, Singapore's first heritage town. We serve up gorgeous mains such as our Signature Nasi Lemak Collection with Blue Pea Flower coconut rice (freshly steamed the traditional way with a muslin cloth no less!), a Wok hei-rich Sinpopo Crab Bee Hoon, tender Chargrilled Pork Chop with Hainanese-style potatoes & curry and more. Come experience true-blue Katong at Sinpopo Brand. (Sep 2021)

  • SINPOPO BRAND'S BRUNCH PICKS

    Experience a uniquely local lunch that differs from your usual brunch fare. Sinpopo Brand runs a full-fledged kitchen that serves up delightful traditional dishes with a contemporary twist. You'll have to try their house special, the Deluxe Nasi Lemak, which comes with a juicy Har Jeong Kai chicken thigh, Hae Bi Hiam cashews, Sambal Ikan Bilis and an assortment of other truly umami accompaniments served with freshly steamed coconut rice. This is where you'll find a truly Singaporean brunch, paired perfectly with the most fragrant gourmet local roast coffee.

• PRESS RELEASE

    SIRI HOUSE draws inspiration from the modern Asian family table, introducing diverse flavours and influences to a delicious menu of shared plates. Quality produce is delivered with a signature SIRI HOUSE twist while service forgoes formality for genuine warmth and hospitality. A sophisticated bar programme of Aperitivo and Craft Cocktails comprises house-made distillates, spirits and garnishes. SIRI HOUSE elevates the home dining and drinking experience as part of lifestyle, social and dining space. Conceptualised by Thai Luxury Property Developer, Sansiri, the house prides itself in fostering community, bringing together people, art, design, food, and retail - all essential elements for a sought-after place of gathering. (Sep 2020)

html:
• ABOUT

    A refined and contemporary grill restaurant, SKAI Restaurant is located on the 70th floor of Singapore’s acclaimed Swissotel The Stamford. Indulge in the iconic views of the city’s beautiful skyline as you wine and dine with the restaurant’s extensive cocktail and brunch menu. Fresh from the Acipenser Schrenki variety of sturgeon, the Kaviari Kristal Caviar features a deep golden colour with a firm texture and rich nutty flavours — the perfect appetiser to a wonderful meal. Meat lovers can dive straight into the Miyazaki Wagyu. A 200-gram New York Strip from pure-bred Japanese wagyu, tuck into this plateful of meaty goodness to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Specially curated for two, the Stanbroke features a Black Angus cut, a wonderful cut of steak for an intimate dining session. Other chef recommendations include Crab Cake, Heirloom Beetroot and the Tenderloin Oscar. Pair with the restaurant’s exquisite bottles of red or white to complete your meal. Lastly, do not leave without ordering the Baked Cheesecake. A concoction of sweet strawberries, sour cream and vanilla, this mini cake is not to be missed out on! (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seared Foie Gras, Crab Cake, Tenderloin Oscar, Tomahawk, Baked Cheesecake

html:
• ABOUT

    SKIRT is a trailblazing grill house, where prime cuts of meat and fresh, sustainably sourced seafood are beautifully prepared on the centerpiece parilla grill, placing us amongst the most favourite Grill Restaurants in the city. The food concept of SKIRT simply offers the very modern and “now” approach that the essence of good cooking and thereby great eating is to source from the finest produce, treat it with simplicity to show it for the best that it can be – this remains as the cornerstone of the food philosophy of SKIRT. (May 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Prized for its flavour rather than its tenderness, the meat is rendered deliciously toothsome at SKIRT by dint of judicious ageing in two large glass cabinets that are part of the décor." -Expat Living

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pan-Seared Scallops, Housemade Hummus, Charred Sweetcorn Ravioli, Australian Wagyu, Cheese Platter

  • ABOUT

    A modern bar and restaurant nestled on the rooftop of Concorde Shopping Centre, Sky Lido is the place to be for a wonderful evening under the stars accompanied by good food and fine wines. Surrounded by lush greenery and the splendid views of the iconic River Valley and Robertson Quay area, the restaurant dishes up classic bistro fare that complements its bar menu. From adding bone marrow to mushroom cream pasta to smoking the highest quality Duroc bacon for the restaurant’s salads, pastas and pizzas, Sky Lido uses only the most delicious and sustainable produce sourced from local farms and kelongs. Classic dishes are reimagined to bring diners maximum flavour and satisfaction. Fit for two, the Grilled Vegetable Plate is a tasty mix of greens made up of grilled veggie favourites such as purple cabbage, zucchini and eggplant topped with toasted almonds for an extra crunch! Truffle Fries and Shiitake Kombu Corn are classic starters diners can look forward to starting their meal with. Served with a hearty side of french fries, the Sky Lido Cheeseburger is a well-loved staple that features a seared aged Argentinian beef patty sandwiched between layers of cheddar, bacon onion jam, balsamic ketchup and fresh lettuce. Other signature must-have favourites include the Brandy Cream Seafood, Burnt Butter Sea Bass and Pepperoni Pizza. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Vegetable Plate, Shiitake Kombu Corn, Sky Lido Cheeseburger, Brandy Cream Seafood

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/sky-lido

html:
• ABOUT

    When you’re feeling worn down from the grind of everyday life, take a breather and soak skyhigh with great food and a peaceful ambience at Sky Lounge. This laidback and tranquil eating joint, located on the 22nd floor of the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel, touts some of the best city views around with stunning 270-degree views of the city skyline and Marina Bay waterfront area. Simplicity and timelessness is the driving motto at this immaculately polished establishment. This is immediately apparent from the second you step through its doors as you set your eyes on the restaurant’s elegant and tailored decor. Then tuck into a worldly feast, with an international menu that will unmistakably satisfy curious diners. We love kicking the meal off with a zesty Scallop Salad made better with the addition of oranges, strawberries, cherry tomatoes on a bed of lettuce and baby spinach. Meat-lovers can partake in some quality meats, with well-crafted mains such as the Five Spice Lamb Rack where lamb marinated in Chinese spices is cleverly paired with a smoky barbecue sauce. Equally admirable is the Asian fare, with standouts such as the delectable and creamy Thai Red Curry Chicken. And be sure to save room for a sweet treat. We recommend the citrusy Cheese Cake drizzled with a sour cherry coulis. By elevating gourmet food to a new level, Sky Lounge shines with its amazing fare and breathtaking city views. (Jul 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Butternut Squash Soup, Braised Oxtail, Hainanese Chicken Rice, Singapore Laksa, Double Decker Club Sandwich, Local Satay

    Indulge in the award-winning taste of exquisite Chinese cuisine and an extensive spread of Cantonese cuisine at Sky View Pavilion. Our team of experienced and dedicated chefs utilise traditional cooking techniques to bring out the natural flavours of the finest ingredients with no added MSG, setting your palate alight and impressing even the most discerning gastronomes. Coupled with its posh, contemporary interior to create a refined ambience, Sky View Pavilion is your ideal venue for celebratory banquets and business dinners. (Nov 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    Skyfall Rooftop Restrobar is a classy rooftop bar at the newly renovated Travelodge Hotel located at Harbourfront just opposite Vivocity. Soak in the picturesque waterfront views and cool sea breeze on our terrace while our skilled Chefs whip up sumptuous meals and specially curated signature cocktails just for you. Whether you visit on bright sunny afternoons or romantic sunset evenings, we’ll give you an experience to remember. (Nov 2021)

  • ABOUT

    From a contemporary bar in the sleepy Opera Estate to its new loud, vibrant location The Riverwalk, Slake has come a long way. Helmed by self-proclaimed food enthusiast Jeremy Cheok, he challenges the culinary team to put a spin on old classics and turn them into contemporary creations. For a start, try out their Chilli Crab Rillettes, with delectable bites of Singapore’s favourite chilli crab sauce on slices of baguette bread. On the same line of chilli crab flavours, their Chilli Crab Noodles is full of umami notes. If you’re looking for a side to share, Slake’s Chye Poh Loaded Fries brings a new flavour to the table with its sweet and savoury topping that is dangerously addictive. For mains that many swear by, Slake’s Kicap Manis BBQ Pork Ribs brings it home with its mouthwatering sauce on the fall-off-the-bone tender meat. Take on an Italian spin with their Vietnamese Pesto, a wok-hey style fried noodle dish with fragrant homemade pesto and chunks of crispy fried chicken. To cut through the strong flavours, this dish is topped with pomegranate seeds for a nice sweet crunch. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab Rillettes, Chilli Crab Noodles, Kicap Manis BBQ Pork Ribs, Vietnamese Pesto, Chye Poh Loaded Fries

  • ABOUT

    Well known for their affordable beer towers and alcoholic options that will deliver a good time with friends, head down to Sleeping Giants in Sembawang for a “giant” hangover any day of the week. Drink more for less while indulging in tasty bar bites and a variety of fusion food here at Sleeping Giants. With giant deals that switch up the drinking game every week, bestsellers here include Budweiser Towers and Chivas bottles. Grab a bottle of ice cold beer to kickstart your night. Pair with a platter of Cult Fries for a night of fun and laughter with colleagues or friends. You can also drop by during dinner time and try out their mouthwatering sliders, pizzas, pastas or lok lok menu options for a filling meal. Looking to up the ante? Simply pair a glass of your favourite red or white wine with a serving of Tortilla Chips with Cheese, or a Mac and Cheese for an intimate dinner date. Add on a side of fiery BBQ Wings to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cult Fries, Tortilla Chips with Cheese, BBQ Wings, Budweiser Tower

The destination rooftop bar sets out to elevate guests’ cocktail experience by bringing the three senses of taste, sight and touch into every sip of each tipple. (Feb 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Unbeknownst to most Singaporeans, barbecue is a craft that requires passion, dedication, and practice. And at Smokey's BBQ, the down to earth, open air, go-to place for American-style ribs, that's exactly what you get. This isn't your simple poolside open brick pit with charcoal. In fact, Smokey's use a custom built smoker, imported wood from the States, and a homemade dry rub, all for that ultimate barbecue experience. Endorsed by our very own in-house token Texan, Smokey's BBQ is THE place to go for delicious ribs, beer, and an old-fashioned good time. The homemade sauces complement the dishes perfectly, and when coupled with the rich smoky flavour of the meat, it's impossible to resist picking the bones clean. For the perfect barbecue experience though, you'll need to wash all that meat down with some ice cold beer! There's beer on tap, imported craft beers by the bottle, and even a selection of wines from the walk-in wine cellar. Suffice to say, you won't be leaving hungry or thirsty. As one of the owners so eloquently said, the secret to Smokey's is simply that they love the food they serve, and serve the food they love. (June 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "If you've had authentic American barbecued fare in the US, you've probably been hunting for a place in Singapore that does it just as well. Well, we've got a winner here." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Venison Chilli Nachos, Buffalo Wings, Baby Back Ribs, St. Louis Ribs, Pulled Pork Sandwich, Texas Bacon Cheeseburger

• ABOUT

    So France Claymore is an immersive all-in-one space comprising a bistro, terrasse and epicurean grocer carrying over 500 gourmet products imported directly from France. The revamped concept brings bistros of today from the streets of Paris to Singapore, presenting the true French bistro experience unlike the caricatured recreations outside of the country.So France Claymore takes guests on a journey through the vibrant culinary landscape of France. Working closely with artisanal producers predominantly from Southwest France, as well as other regions of France, the restaurant presents an authentic selection of classic French bistro fare in a warm and inviting atmosphere. An extensive wine list completes the dining experience with accessible glasses and bottles of wines from beloved appellations including Bordeaux, Southwestern wines or Burgundy. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Souris d’Agneau, Duck Hash, Escargots En Persillade, Beef Tartare, Prime Rib

html:
• ABOUT

    Try halal-certified Vietnamese food in Singapore at So Pho, with their menu of healthy and delicious dishes. Using only the freshest ingredients to capture the authenticity of Vietnam food, So Pho promises the best pho, Banh Mi, Spring Rolls, bento sets, and more. Housed in a casual and contemporary setting, indulge in piping hot bowls of tasty pho. Topped with beef balls, beef and a dash of lime, So Pho’s Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup is a healthy bowl of vermicelli that is appetising and nourishing. Order a side of Imperial Spring Rolls to go with the bowl of noodles for a satisfying meal. Another great addition to your meal would be the Vietnamese Drip Coffee. Warm and robust, the specialty coffee is the ideal beverage for a quick pick-me-up. A plate of delights, the Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice is another dish that packs an explosion of Vietnamese flavours. Served with a generous amount of crisps and vegetables, the chicken is grilled and flavoured with a blend of chopped spices. An innovative offering not to be missed, savour the Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat. Similar to a crepe, this Vietnamese delight is made with a crispy layer of dough paired with savoury meat. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup, Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice, Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat, Vietnamese Drip Coffee

  • ABOUT

    Try halal-certified Vietnamese food in Singapore at So Pho, with their menu of healthy and delicious dishes. Using only the freshest ingredients to capture the authenticity of Vietnam food, So Pho promises the best pho, Banh Mi, Spring Rolls, bento sets, and more. Housed in a casual and contemporary setting, indulge in piping hot bowls of tasty pho. Topped with beef balls, beef and a dash of lime, So Pho’s Pho Sliced Beef with Tendon Brisket and Beef Balls Noodle Soup is a healthy bowl of vermicelli that is appetising and nourishing. Order a side of Imperial Spring Rolls to go with the bowl of noodles for a satisfying meal. Another great addition to your meal would be the Vietnamese Drip Coffee. Warm and robust, the specialty coffee is the ideal beverage for a quick pick-me-up. A plate of delights, the Grilled Lemongrass Chicken with Rice is another dish that packs an explosion of Vietnamese flavours. Served with a generous amount of crisps and vegetables, the chicken is grilled and flavoured with a blend of chopped spices. An innovative offering not to be missed, savour the Vietnamese Pancake with Minced Meat. Similar to a crepe, this Vietnamese delight is made with a crispy layer of dough paired with savoury meat. (Oct 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Travel the world with your taste buds when you drop by The Social Alley. Drawing inspiration from various countries all over the world, the restaurant's carefully curated menu is a delicious mish-mash of exotic fusion flavours set to bring diners on a gastronomic adventure. Offering a bold and unconventional menu of good food and exquisite drinks, The Social Alley welcomes people from all walks of life to come together for an unforgettable time with good food and great wine. A staple accompaniment to an after-work tipple, indulge in the classic dishes that make up the bar bites menu section at The Social Alley. Hot favourites include the Shoestring Fries and Crispy Chicken Skin. Dip these mouthwatering snacks into the restaurant’s Homemade Pink Tartare Sauce or Japanese Curry Sauce for extra flavour. Grown from scratch in the restaurant’s own farm, dive into their salads for a taste of the freshest, seasonal produce. The Calamari Salad is a great option to kickstart your meal. A jumble of calamari strips, sesame seeds and sliced chilli, this palatable bowl of greens is finished off with a generous amount of Thai sweet chilli dressing. Be sure to also give the strikingly sweet and umami tapas a try before leaving! (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Chicken Skin, Calamari Salad, Seafood Rolls, Vongole

    SOCIEATY is Les Amis Group's first ever multi-concept restaurant. Combining the words "society" and "eat", SOCIEATY aims to forge an identity of togetherness, enjoyment and friendship over food.Featuring the best of the group's favourite offerings, this spacious one-stop, multi-concept restaurant is located right above Farrer Park MRT Station at One Farrer Hotel. Offering a combined menu from Peperoni Pizzeria, Indigo Blue Kitchen, and Yujin Bowls, there is truly something for every craving. (Jan 2022)
