html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Sofi Cafe + Pizza + Keto by Pasta Brava is an all-day cafe serving pizza, coffee, healthy dessert, and drinks at an affordable price. The menu is crafted by Sofi, the owner, who got her recipes from her overseas trips, picking up local recipes and ingredients as she visits each country. Sofi Cafe + Pizza is located just next to Pasta Brava, the restaurant’s main branch which serves traditional dishes from various regions of Italy for 27 years. To put it simply, Sofi Café + Pizza provides diners with a warm and hospitable environment where they can enjoy their day over a good meal and coffee. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sous Vide Chicken Roulade with Strawberry Balsamic Reduction, Charcoal Fluffy Waffles with Carbonara Sauce & Crispy Bacon, Rosemary Chocolate Cake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/sofi-cafe-pizza-keto-by-pasta-brava
name: Sofi Cafe + Pizza + Keto by Pasta Brava

Cuisine: Middle Eastern, Vegetarian Friendly, Halal Certified
html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in the unassuming Shaw Towers, this household name has been operating for 16 years and for good reason. Quality and authentic Turkish food at amazing prices isn’t easy to find but Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant manages to tick off these boxes effortlessly. Sofra, which means “let’s dine” in Turkish, stays true to the humility, warmth and joy of sharing a meal. The fuss-free decor, riddled with interesting trinkets and folksy furniture puts all the attention on the good food while the extensive menu doesn’t dilute the quality of each Turkish classic. Try their pide, a Turkish pizza filled with gooey cheese and your choice of meat, or the indispensable Sofra Kebap, where your freshly baked bread is heaped with generous servings of meat, walnut, tomato and cheese. The Turkish answer to meatballs, Izgara Kofte, is also a timeless crowd favourite. Wash down the food with a cup of Turkish Hot Apple Tea or Turkish Coffee to complete the Turkish experience. If you’re around the area, do check out their set lunches, an absolute steal with prices ranging from $7.90 to $14.90 nett. Wait no longer! (Jul 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “This is one restaurant that doesn't need special introducing. Sofra probably serves every Turkish dish you can think of, but some of the crowd favourites you should definitely try are the Mussaka, Adana Kebab (served on a sword), and Izgara kofte!” -SoShiok “Relax and sip a cup of comforting Turkish tea at this laid-back niche while you wait for your lahmacun (Turkish ‘pizza’ with a minced meat and vegetable topping). Spicy and tangy at once, it is goodly-sized to satisfy a lunch appetite.” -Wine & Dine Magazine “Always a crowd favourite, Sofra has a food menu that’s pretty extensive. If you need help deciding what to order, the adana kebab, musakka, and pide are fab choices. Need a nice little pick-me-up? Order a cup of super potent Turkish coffee.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hummus, Sofra Kebap, Pide, Sofra Musakka, Izgara Kofte, Hunkar Begendi, Turkish Coffee, Turkish Hot Apple Tea, Baklava

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/sofra-turkish-cafe-restaurant
name: Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant

Menus: Beverage Menu  Dinner Menu  Weekday Lunch Menu  Breakfast & Weekend Brunch Menu  All-Day Menu  High Tea Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Known in Latin as Sun and Moon, this Latin European bistro serve authentic and fusion dishes amidst urban city views and lush greenery. Priding themselves on serving classic Latin European cuisine with a fun twist, Sol & Luna’s curated menu is here to sweep you off your feet and bring you on a culinary journey. For starters, indulge yourselves with Sol & Luna’s Smoked Duck and Foie Gras Rillette with Crostini, Pickles, and Olive Oil Caviar. A creamy, fun, and innovative appetiser that’s light on the palette yet full of delicious flavour. Pick up the rillette using the crostini and layer with pickles and olive oil caviar, have it all in one bite to fully experience the dish’s full flavour. Or go for flavours of the ocean with their Prawn & Octopus Niçoise Salad, a zesty and refreshing salad that’s sure to whet your appetite. In the mood for soup? Sol & Luna’s signature White Gazpacho Soup is a creamy and flavourful delight ready to leave your tastebuds satisfied. The main star of the show at Sol & Luna, Braised Lamb Shoulder Bone-in with Broccolini, is a must-try. Tender, juicy, fall off the bone lamb shoulder generously drizzled with a special sauce and served with a side of broccolini to balance the meat. Perfect for sharing, this dish is great for social gatherings or dates. For dessert, impress your guests with Sol & Luna’s Hazelnut Chocolate Cherry. Beautifully glazed to perfection and topped with gold foil for an air of sophistication, this sweet chocolatey dessert is sure to leave a lasting impression. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smoked Duck and Foie Gras Rillette with Crostini, Pickles and Olive Oil Caviar, Braised Lamb Shoulder Bone-in With Broccolini, Hazelnut Chocolate Cherry

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/sol-luna
name: Sol & Luna

html:
• Good For

    Al Fresco, Business Meetings, Private Functions, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    A restaurant and cocktail bar that specialises in Asian and Western fusion cuisine, indulge in the best of both worlds when you drop by Sol Singapore for a meal with family or friends. By combining the best of both Western and Asian culinary techniques. Sol Singapore dishes up specialties that do both sides justice. To start, we recommend ordering a plate full of freshly shucked oysters with yuzu and passionfruit dressing, laced with kaffir lime oil. The Ribeye Beef Cubes and Foie Gras are also mouthwatering menu options to kickstart your meal with. Move on to the main courses such as the Thai Pasta with Tiger Prawns to delight in yummy mouthfuls of spaghetti in ‘kee-mao’ sauce topped with sauteed, juicy tiger prawns and baby corn. For those who like their pasta simple yet sumptuous, the Aglio Olio is a vegetarian option featuring tangy noodles tossed in olive and garlic with sun dried tomatoes, chilli padi and mizuna. Wrap up your meal with a decadent slice of Molten Cake to revel in the harmonious mix of lava chocolate, vanilla ice cream, and biscoff. Alternatively, sip on glasses of the restaurant’s signature cocktails to savour the fragrant aftertaste of Korean ginseng. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ribeye Beef Cubes, Foie Gras, Thai Pasta with Tiger Prawns, Molten Cake

html:
• ABOUT

    The menu at Solo Ristorante rotates regularly, allowing you to experience their vibrant dishes which are crafted from seasonally abundant ingredients at the peak of their freshness.The degustation menu is modified daily and is prepared with the chef's daily sauces, fresh catches and butcher's cuts to keep a product-driven cuisine approach. No matter the time of the year, Solo's food can be customized to accomodate any dietary request - just ask the team. (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Carpaccio, Chef's Daily Pasta, Ravioli, Daily Catch of Fresh Fish or Seafood, Butcher's Choice of Cut

html:
• Good For

    Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions, Quiet Dinner, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    Inspired by India’s rich flavours and culture, Sona’s Grill serves contemporary Indian cuisine with traditional influences that combines bold ingredients with delicious aromatics. From smokey grilled delights to fragrant Indian breads, Sona’s Grill is the go-to place for an indulgent meal with friends and family. When it comes to sharing bites, go for their Malai Tandoor Broccoli - marinated broccoli florets with fresh cream and tandoor. Crunchy, sweet with just a hint of spice and smokey scent, this addictive dish is the perfect starter to whet your appetites for more to come. For meatier options, go for their Mutton Seekh Kebab. Spiced minced meat cooked in tandoor with Indian herbs spices, this delicious meat kebab is cooked with traditional methods that allows the spices to permeate the tender meat. For ocean catches, go for the Deep-Fried Pomfret Fish marinated in yoghurt, spices and cooked in a clay oven. Enjoy deliciously smoked fish that’s fresh and succulent with fragrant aromatics that bring out the natural sweetness of the catch. Best paired with fragrant basmati rice or biryani, this dish is best for sharing with a couple of other sides for variety. Vegetarian options here are also carefully curated and cooked to perfection. Cheese lovers rejoice - with a special section just for paneer, choose from different flavour profiles that enhance unique flavours of the cheese. Go for their Paneer Butter Masala for a tangy, sauce dish to go with rice. Perfect for diners straying away from the usual green curry. For dessert, finish off with an all-time favourite: Gulab Jamun. A milk-solid-based sweet that’s doused in sugary syrup, this indulgent dessert makes for the perfect sweet end to your meal. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Malai Tandoor Broccoli, Mutton Seekh Kebab, Deep-Fried Pomfret Fish, Paneer Butter Masala, Gulab Jamun

  • ABOUT

    At Soseoul, feast like royalty on perfectly prepared Korean dishes that bring the flavour of authentic Korean cuisine to Singapore. For starters, try out their Signature Soy-Marinated Crabs to whet your appetite. Slurp on deliciously umami crab meat and roe, or feast on their Signature Soy-Marinated Fresh Prawns for that extra crunch. As with all Korean BBQ, Soseoul’s grill menu features delicately marinated pork and beef to satisfy all your meat cravings. For the best of both, go for their Grill Courses, where you can choose from either Premium Pork or Premium Beef. Each features painstakingly-prepared cuts, Soy-Marinated Prawns, mini Bibimbap, Seasonal Soup, and Dessert. Bring a friend along and feast to your heart’s content with this amazing grill course set without feeling the pinch in your wallet. If their sets are too heavy, enjoy the best of both worlds with their ala-carte grill menu and have a little bit of everything. For a quick lunch meal, Soseoul also serves a dedicated lunch menu, all served with their signature sides to satisfy your midday cravings. Soseoul also serves an amazing bar menu to pair your perfectly grilled meats with their alcoholic slushies. Our favourites are the Passionfruit and Yakult Slush! (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Soy-Marinated Crabs, Soy-Marinated Prawns, Premium Pork Grill Set, Premium Beef Grill Set, Passionfruit Slush

html:
• ABOUT

    Striking black and white décor, hints of red, grandly tufted booths and an amber dome; the eye-catching décor is reflected in the walls of cleverly framed mirrors. Not that you'd be staring at your surroundings when there are counters laden with mouth-watering concoctions right before your eyes! Savour local specialties during lunch with popular favourites such as Oyster Omelette, Fruit Rojak, as well as Peranakan classics like the Ayam Buah Keluak, Kueh Pie Tee and Nonya Laksa. Desserts are equally stocked with Nonya confections, so fill up your belly with Apong Bok Kuah, Kueh Charah, and Durian Pengat to your heart's content! When evening falls, it's another decadent flow to look forward to, this time with jewels from the sea. Boasting three different crab creations, crustacean lovers will find it hard to tear themselves away from these but we urge you to try. It'd be a shame to miss out on the new Alaskan king crab claws (served chilled or stir fried in Thai curry), Cheese or Mentaiko Baked Lobster, a bevy of fresh sashimi, and the other grilled meats sizzling on the hot grill. Over the weekend, luxuriate in Spices Cafe's tea-time treats, specially put together to reflect a myriad of Singaporean flavours. It's not all Dim Sum, Laksa and Satay, however! End the meal on a sweet note with their Blueberry Cheesecake and Chocolate Fountain. Morning, noon, or night, Spices Cafe has an endless rotation of exciting fare to whet your appetite. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Laksa, Ayam Buah Keluak, Oyster Omelette, Dim Sum, Kway Chap, Apong Bok Kuah, Oysters, Alaskan king crab, Lobster, Salted Egg Crab

  • BUFFETS & PRICING

    Singapore Flavours Buffet Lunch Their Singapore Flavours Buffet Lunch offers popular local favourites such as Oyster Omelette, Fruit Rojak and classic Peranakan dishes including Ayam Buah Keluak, Kueh Pie Tee and Nonya Laksa. The buffet spread also features authentic Peranakan desserts like Apong Bok Kuah topped with durian or banana sauce, Kueh Charah, Kueh Dadar and Durian Pengat. When: Mon-Fri (except Public Holidays)Time: 12-2:30pmPrice: • $40++ per adult • $18++ per child aged 4-10 years old • $30++ per Senior Citizen aged 55 years and above Harvest of the Sea Buffet Dinner Feast like a king with the wallet of a common man while indulging in an extravagant buffet spread that would make any seafood enthusiast clap in approval. Binge on three different types of cooked-to-order crabs with individual portions served to you at your table; be it Salted Egg, Black Pepper or Singapore’s Signature Chilli Crab. The restaurant offers a new complimentary serving of either a 200gm Alaskan king crab served Chilled or Stir-fried with Thai Curry or Baked Half Lobster with Cheese or Mentaiko flavour or 2 Braised Baby Abalones with Broccoli and Mushroom. Besides fresh ocean catches, the restaurant have a live pasta/grill station that whips up pasta dishes of your choice ala minute and served with your choice of grilled meats such as Beef, Salmon, Pork Loin and Prawns. Do not forget to end the celebration meal in a sweet manner with the delightful dessert bar, packed with a plethora of English pastries, cakes and Nonya traditional desserts. When: Mon-Thu (except Public Holidays)Time: 6:30-10pmPrice: • $60++ per adult • $25++ per child aged 4-10 years old • $42++ per Senior Citizen aged 55 years and above When: Fri-Sun, Eve of Public Holiday and Public HolidayTime: 6:30-10pmPrice: • $65++ per adult • $25++ per child aged 4-10 years old • $45++ per Senior Citizen aged 55 years and above Weekend Afternoon Tea Buffet Weekends are for indulging with your family, so why not savour their Weekend Afternoon Tea with a delightful spread of local favourites including Kway Chap, Dim Sum and Laksa. Wrap up your afternoon with desserts such as Blueberry Cheesecake and enjoy a sweet treat at the Chocolate Fountain. html:
• ABOUT

    Buckle up and prepare for a rich, hearty, and – above all – spicy gastronomic adventure that has plenty of ‘kick’ and definitely won’t disappoint. Spicy House Restaurant certainly pulls no punches in serving quality, fiercely authentic, Chengdu-style hotpot. The chain has its origins in Shanghai and the outlet in Riverside Point is its first overseas branch; unique to the Singapore outlet is the mouthwatering addition of Japanese wagyu beef and Australian lobster (plus some others) to the menu. The restaurant’s signature soup base is the Mala Butter, which has a distinctively rich flavour courtesy of the butter stirred into the soup. You’d be hard-pressed to forget the taste of this particular base, which possesses a complexity that not many other places can produce. If you’re looking for something different, however, you can choose from a list of soup bases such as Tomato, Pig’s Trotters, and Chestnut Healthy Chicken, among others. Some ready-to-eat side dishes include flavourful Sichuan Dumplings as well as Mala Noodles, for those who feel like having something apart from hotpot. It quickly becomes apparent that there’s something in this restaurant for everyone, especially for those who like their food extra spicy, so make your way down to Spicy House Restaurant – you definitely won’t regret it! (Jan 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sichuan Dumplings, Mala Butter soup base, Indonesian Crab, Wagyu Beef, Australian Lobster, Mala Noodles

  • ABOUT

    Spizza is the go-to pizza parlour for loads of local foodies, known for its consistently outstanding wood-fired pies and reasonably priced Italian mains. Spizza might not look like your nonna's authentic pizzeria, relying on strict recipes in a white table clothed dining room. Instead, with a contemporary interior and endlessly personalized pizzas and pastas, this place is all about pleasing every type of diner that ambles in. The Balmoral Plaza outlet features a spacious outdoor terrace with garden lined views and plenty of clean-lined, modern seating. Despite its current look, you might be surprised to learn that several key components in their tasty dishes are sourced the good old-fashioned way. Ingredients hailing from the motherland include tomatoes, mushrooms, artichokes, and the insanely tasty ham from Parma. These goodies are used liberally in house made compositions, all named after Italian ladyloves, and wood fired by the custom built oven. The resulting crust is cracker thin with just enough char to hold up against the flavourful toppings and cheese. The Isabella is a longtime crush, with mozzarella, Parma ham, juicy tomatoes, rocket leaves and shards of peppery parmesan. If you prefer some curves over the skinny version, you can opt for your pizza gondola-style with a fluffy, boat shaped crust and toppings turned into innings filling it up. Every month, there's a specialty Star Pizza and Star Pasta created with gourmet, seasonal ingredients that are always a good bet. Or else you can create your own pizza and pasta with heaps of delicious tidbits to work with. For dessert, the Zara sweet pizza is a heartbreaker, with luscious Nutella, banana and crisp almond flakes topping that incredible crispy crust! (Feb 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Whether you pronounce it as "Spizz-a" or "S-Pizza", Spizza has become a bit of a pizza institution in Singapore. It's known for serving up reliably thin-crusted, tasty pizzas in relaxed and friendly surrounds, time and again." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Portobello Mushrooms, Parma e Melone, Aglio Olio e Pepperoncini, Kiara Pizza, Wilma Pizza, Vongole (clams) in White Wine or Tomato Sauce

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Located in Marina One, The Spot is a multi-concept venue comprising an all-day café, restaurant, bar and cigar lounge. The various spaces are functionally interwoven so that diners can enjoy each activity on its own or in combination with the others, creating a seamless wine-and-dine experience. Alongside The Spot are strategic partners, 1855 The Bottle Shop and South East Asia’s first and only The Macallan Boutique @ 1855, providing unique and complementary services for diners and guests. From breakfast to dinner and after, The Spot offers coffee and cocktails, superb contemporary food, extraordinary wines, and a sensational whisky collection for customers to enjoy in an elegant and welcoming ambience. About Executive Chef Lee Boon Seng As a boy of 17 in the kitchen of Equinox watching culinary virtuosity in action, executive chef Lee Boon Seng found his calling. He stayed for eight years at this - his first job, rising from trainee to Chef de Partie before notching an impressive resume at places like Curate and the one-starred Osia at Resorts World Sentosa. Chef Lee was honored with multiple accolades including Rising Chef of the Year at the World Gourmet Summit of 2013, and the Overall Champion during the semi-finals of Global Chefs Challenge organized by the Paris-based World Association of Chefs Societies (WACS). He also earned the opportunity of hosting and working with numerous Michelin-starred veterans such as Massimiliano Alajmo of the three-starred Le Calandre in Padua, Italy; Guy Martin of the three-starred Le Grand Véfour in Paris, France; and Esben Holmboe Bang of the three-starred Maaemo in Oslo, Norway. The food at The Spot is highly individualistic – with the starting point an ingredient that excites Chef Lee with the drive to introduce its beauty to the world by elevating its flavors. He found this route through sauces, employing the European techniques of his training in tandem with the Southeast Asian fruits, herbs, and spices of his cultural heritage. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Atlantic Salmon, Scallop Carpaccio, Duck Breast, Grilled Red Snapper, Liquorice Ice Cream

html:
• ABOUT

    As the oldest family-run restaurant still in business, it’s clear that Spring Court Restaurant has more than proven its mettle, and then some. Opened in 1929, the establishment has seen more than one venue (think the well-known Great World Amusement Park), and today one can find it located in a beautifully preserved heritage shophouse along Upper Cross Street. A restaurant that has remained open for this long surely has something good going for it, and you certainly won’t regret a visit! Lose yourself in the variety of sets offered on the menu. There’s a particular set for one person that we’re pretty fond of, with its plethora of seafood eats. Luxuriate in a serving of Stewed Boston Lobster in Fresh Fungus in Superior Stock, a tasty dish made with delightfully fresh helpings of lobster you’ll be remembering for days to come. The Crisp Fried Fillet of Cod Fish with BBQ Sauce is another dish that’s easy to love – perfectly crispy on the outside with firm, fresh cod on the inside, you’d be hard-pressed to stop yourself from guzzling it all down in a rush! There are other sets available that are pretty damn good too, and anyone who gets a taste of the restaurant’s comfort food offerings will immediately understand why it has remained open for business through the decades. (Sep 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “It hasn’t changed much – the chefs still use the recipes that have been passed down through generations. Signature dishes include the Spring Court popiah… a snack Ho’s mother Soon Puay Keow used to roll for employees to munch on between shifts. We’re told they had loved it so much they convinced her to include it in the menu – and it’s been a best-seller ever since.” -TimeOut Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Stewed Boston Lobster in Fresh Fungus in Superior Stock, Crisp Fried Fillet of Cod Fish with BBQ Sauce, Braised Fish in Claypot, Homemade Tofu with Scallop in Minced Pork Gravy, Stir-fried Chinese Cabbage with XO Sauce

  • ABOUT

    A culinary-cultural concept that merges food, retail and art into a single space, SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill offers an unparalleled multi-faceted experience. Boasting a modern European menu heavily influenced by South Asian produce, the multi-functional space offers all-day breakfast and lunch menus, attracting hordes of diners every week. Live and eat well with SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill’s wide range of all-day dining options. Redefining the local supermarket experience, SPRMRKT also aims to give back to communities around the region. Avocado on Toast at SPRMRKT at Dempsey Hill comes in the form of freshly deseeded avocado, pickled shallots, poached egg and cherry tomatoes piled atop toasted sourdough. A savoury breakfast staple, the Buttermilk Pancakes is topped with bacon, sunny-side up eggs, kurobuta pork sausage and sweetened with sliced banana, caramel sauce, fresh berries before being garnished with a drizzle of maple syrup. For those who prefer an iced cold treat that is as delicious as it is healthy, opt for the Honey Infused Yoghurt Bowl. Made of housemade granola, selected fresh fruits and honey-yoghurt, the yoghurt bowl is a refreshing dish to kick start your mornings. (Jul 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Avocado on Toast, Buttermilk Pancakes, Honey Infused Yoghurt Bowl, Golden Carbonara

  • ABOUT

    Spruce’s extensive menu of modern European dishes revolves around the concept of serving wholesome and unpretentious cuisine at affordable prices. Start your night with one of Spruce’s signature bar bites, the Spruce Hot Wings. Tender and juicy, the wings come with the hot sauce served as a dip, allowing diners to customise the spice level according to their preferences. Coated with a unique batter that retains the crisp and crunch of the buffalo wings, this dish is a must-try. A familiar starter combination of burrata cheese and prosciutto, the Pugliese is a tasty pizza version of the traditional Italian appetiser, topped with extra tomato sauce and cherry tomatoes as well as a cheesy layer of mozzarella. Dessert lovers rejoice! Spruce’s wide variety of cakes, pastries and desserts will spoil you. The Creme Brulee is glazed to perfection, with the sweet taste of caramelised apple in every bite. The Double Chocolate Crunch Cake Ala Mode, Baked Ginger Date Pudding or the Bomb Alaska are other mouthwatering treats that come highly recommended. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Spruce Hot Wings, Pugliese, Creme Brulee, Bomb Alaska

Menus: All Day Menu  Weekend Brunch Menu
html:
• Good For

    Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Private Functions

  • ABOUT

    Savour, relish and indulge in Spruce’s extensive menu of modern European dishes. Inspired by the concept of serving wholesome and delectable modern Italian-American cuisine at affordable prices, the restaurant has a huge array of Western dishes to choose from. Bite into the deep fried fish bites with spicy lime sauce first before moving onto the mains. This delightful starter is a crowd favourite, with spicy and tangy flavours perfectly complementing each other. For those looking for a challenge, the Devil’s Wings are the ultimate test of your spice tolerance. Be warned, for these succulent wings are fried and tossed in an extremely spicy blend of chilli sauces. Spruce has a variety of sharing platters great for groups. The European Cheese Wonderland consists of an assortment of European cheeses, presented with nuts and crisps. Ideal for after work socials or catch up sessions among friends, this wonderfully plated cheese platter is great for sharing. Homemade with love, the Messi Burger features a delicious beef patty, iceberg lettuce, sunny side egg and bacon sandwiched between two fluffy buns and drizzled in a cheese sauce. (Sep 2020)

  • SURVIVAL CHIC

    Enjoy 30% off your total bill (including alcohol) at this and 50+ other top restaurants with the Survival Chic (SC) Dining Card. Quote "Chope" when joining SC and enjoy a complimentary month of membership. Alternatively, Chope users can join via this exclusive link (the free month will be automatically added). Same-day pickup or delivery of the membership card can be arranged!

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Devil’s Wings, European Cheese Wonderland, Messi Burger, Spruce Sundae

Cuisine: Buffet, International, All-Day Breakfast, Vegetarian Friendly, Local
html:
• ABOUT

    Pamper yourself with a slew of international culinary gems at Furama RiverFront! Hankering after endless nosh? Their buffet spreads are there for you. Sup on ubiquitous seafood like Stone Crab Claw, Black Mussels, appetisers like the salmon sashimi, Live Noodle Station, Carving Station, and daily featured cuisine such as Thailand, Japanese, Local delights and Western. It’s too many to list so trust us when we say it’s a worldwide selection! Looking for something a little more restrained? A la carte it is. No matter the time of day, the chefs work to bring out the best of East and West with a bevy of gourmet dishes. Go for a Collection of, Asian bites like Satay or Furikake Pop Corn Chicken, local favourites which include the ever popular Hainanese Chicken Rice and Singapore Laksa, or Western classics ranging from Impossible Patty Bagel to Angus Ribeye Steak. The Square @ Furama is perfect for both adults and little ones – our little play area promises to keep the young ones entertained with activities, toys, and videos - so whatever the occasion, there’ll be food and fun for all! (Apr 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Burger, Beef Bolognaise Pasta, Cajun Ribeye Steak, Classic Fish & Chips, Pan Roasted Cod Fish, Fried Beef Kway Teow, Singapore Laksa, Fish Bee Hoon Soup, Satay, Royal Thai Seafood Tom Yum Broth

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/the-square-furama
name: Square @ Furama, The

html:
• ABOUT

    Look no further than SSak3 for your next Korean barbeque fix! Conveniently located in the heart of Singapore, SSak3 serves affordable grilled meat, army stew and more along with a variety of soju and beer, at the best deals. Helmed by a Korean chef with over 30 years of experience, the restaurant dishes out authentic Korean food. The restaurant has no lack of reasonably priced meat. The Planner Porkbelly is a massive plate of beautifully curled slices of meat, alongside a generous scoop of fried bean sprouts and fresh kimchi. To enjoy a scrumptious Korean barbeque, one cannot miss out on ordering the Grilled Cheese. A perfect combination of cheese, meat and kimchi, these two dishes complement each other for a deliciously unforgettable meal. If you’re still feeling peckish after savouring the huge pork platter, the SSAK3 Assorted Set is worth a try. Featuring pork belly, honeycomb pork belly, beef short ribs and short plate, this tasty plate of meaty goodness will surely fill you up. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Planner Porkbelly, SSAK3 Assorted Set, Army Stew, Ramen Noodles

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/ssak3-korean-bbq
name: Ssak3 Korean BBQ

html:
• Good For

    Casual Dining, Kid Friendly, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)

  • ABOUT

    With a buffet priced at just $25.80 (Weekday) & $27.80 (Weekend), Ssikkek Korean Grill draws in crowds with its pocket-friendly prices. The buffet spread here is sumptuous; think an array of top-quality meat such as ribeye, short ribs, pork belly, and pork collar. The ribeye and short ribs are popular cuts, sliced thinly so you can enjoy as much as you want. Pick from either marinated meats, or unseasoned ones if you prefer. Grill the meat on the hotplate individually, or turn dinner into a feast by putting all the meats and vegetables on the same plate and grilling them at once. The service staff are friendly, and always on hand (despite the crowds) to change the aluminium foil cover. To balance out the rich meal, add some kimchi to the mix - the sharp, sour fermented egetables are perfect for cutting through the fattiness of the meat. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ribeye, Beef Short Ribs, Pork Belly, Beef Bulgogi, Chicken Chop

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/ssikkek-korean-grill-bbq-tanjong-pagar
name: Ssikkek Korean Grill BBQ (Tanjong Pagar)

Menus: Super Spicy Wings Challenge Promotion  Drinks Promotion Menu  Ladies Night Promotion
html:
• ABOUT

    Good food and good music, the twin pleasures of life, are epitomised at STAGE, an unassuming hideout along Prinsep Street. The cosy space takes on industrial chic vibes reminiscent of an underground bar, setting the perfect atmosphere for live music performed by talented local bands. If you think you’ve got the vocal cords, then head down to Stage on Wednesdays when open mic sessions allow guests to belt out their favourite ballads before a crowd. While you’re serenaded by your favourite local acts, tuck into STAGE’s gourmet food. Their famed hand-crafted pizzas, for instance, are made from the freshest ingredients and served hot from the oven daily. Savour some local flavours with the Chilli Crab Pizza, where generous portions of succulent crab meat and a decadent chilli crab sauce are topped with a gooey poached egg and coriander leaves. Pasta is also always a good idea here - the Carbonara is creamy without being too overwhelming, while the Black Pepper Beef, a spaghetti tossed with tender beef cubes, bell peppers, and a tangy black pepper sauce is a definite must try. Looking for some small bites instead? Tantalising options such as the Crispy Pork Belly are always reliable choices here. Let’s toast to a great night out because it’s going to be tough to beat! (Aug 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab Pizza, Samb Chicken Pizza, Carbonara, Black Pepper Beef, Crispy Pork Belly

name: STAGE

html:
• ABOUT

    Bon vivants will be irresistibly drawn to this cosy lounge in the NCO Club, where you’ll find a private reserve of vintage New World wines from US and Australian wineries Stags’ Leap, Penfolds and Beaulieu Vineyard. Love a rich mouthfeel for your Chardonnay? Stag Leap’s wide variety of grapes harvested from their location at the base of the hill reflects the strength of their terroir, from creamy Chardonnays to powerful Petit Syrahs. Fans of dry reds will make a beeline for the extensive selection from Penfolds. You’ll also recognise the Australian winery’s iconic Penfolds Grange on the menu here. For wines steeped in history, the Beaulieu Vineyard is one of the few wineries to survive the Prohibition era, and wield a huge influence over the winemaking in the Napa Valley region today, For nibbles, there’s creamy Brillat Savarin with cranberries and truffle honey, as well as deeply savoury iberico bellota. (Dec 2018)

  • FABIEN DUBOUEIX, HEAD SOMMELIER

    Pursuing his career in the wine and hospitality industry across Europe, the UK, the US and now Singapore, Fabien brings with him a wealth of over 17 years of experience in the food and beverage industry. Truly passionate in his work, Fabien has built on his skills during the course of his career, the multi-hyphenate is a certified Sommelier (CMS), Specialist of Wine (CSW), Spirit Specialist and Sake Sommelier. In 2014, Fabien added another professional title to his belt, becoming an Advanced Sommelier from the Court of Master Sommelier, making him one of the very few sommeliers in this part of the world to have achieved such an advanced accreditation. Prior to The NCO Club, Fabien was Head Sommelier at Joel Robuchon le Restaurant at Resorts World Sentosa. He was also known for his service in restaurants including 1-Michelin-star Lucknam Park in Colerne, England and the 1-Michelin-star El Castell de Ciutat in Seo D'urgell, Spain. Fluent in English, Spanish and German apart from his native French, Fabien is keen on helping other wine professionals progress their career through consistent skills upgrading, like he has done. Fabien is currently the Head Sommelier of The NCO Club's culinary anchor Madame Fan. With his vast knowledge in wines, he works in consultation with the Stags Leap and Penfolds to curate the wine list and manage the team at Stags' Room, an intimate and lush wine room.

  • DRINKS WE LOVE

    Riesling Penfolds bin 51, Petit Syrah Stags' Leap, Viognier Penfolds Cellar Reserve

name: Stags' Room

Menus: Breakfast A La Carte Menu  Set, A La Carte & Beverage Menu  Menu  Bubbly Deals Promotion  Grab n Go Menu
html:
• ABOUT

    Set in a charming ambience, The Stamford Brasserie is a multi-concept restaurant and bar boasting affordable gourmet meals and unique craft beers. Start your day right with a slice of Golden Waffle. The perfect savoury treat to kickstart your day, indulge in a mix of berry compote, maple syrup and orange butter atop this classic favourite. A hearty platter of sausages, smoked ham, bacon potato and grilled tomato, the Traditional Two Egg Breakfast is a wholesome dish that both the young and old love. Want to have breakfast your way? Here at The Stamford Brasserie, Create Your Own Omelette features three different eggs and a variety of delicious fillings. Fuss-free grab and go options are also readily available on the menu. Choose from hand-crafted bakes and fruits, leafy salads, sandwiches and sweet treats to go with a steaming hot cup of Americano for your morning pick me up. There’s no such thing as too much alcohol! Pop open a bottle of bubbly to celebrate milestones with the restaurant’s multitude of promotions available. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fresh Fruit Danish, Pulled Kurobuta Pork, Beef Tartar, House Made Burger, BBQ Pork Ribs

Cuisine: Buffet, Chinese, Vegetarian Friendly, Local, Southeast Asian, Peranakan, Zi Char
html:
• ABOUT

    A name synonymous with Peranakan food, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant is Singapore’s oldest nyonya restaurant, serving food made with three generations of love since 1953. Building on the legacy, the restaurant uses secret recipes handed down generations to bring an authentic Peranakan cuisine made from the freshest ingredients and select choice of spices. For a complete Peranakan experience, the Ala Carte Nonya Buffet is an ideal choice. Start with an appetiser of your choice before moving on to the mains such as Ayam Buah Keluak, Udang Sambal, Beef Rendang and more. There’s something for everyone here as the buffet serves all kinds of meat and vegetables. Pair your meal with a traditional Chin Chow or Lime Cordial to cleanse your palate. Last but not least, choose from four different desserts to end your meal on a delicious note. For those looking for something refreshing, the Lemongrass Jelly is a great option that will surely perk you up. The Chendol is also a classic favourite that makes for a wonderful dessert in Singapore’s humid weather. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ayam Buah Keluak, Udang Sambal, Beef Rendang, Chendol

html:
• ABOUT

    Known as the oldest Nonya restaurant in Singapore, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant has been serving authentic Peranakan food since 1953. Apart from providing diners with an authentic Peranakan affair, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant provides nonya catering for corporates and other special occasions as well. A wonderfully authentic dining experience in the heart of the city, Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant is a must visit whenever you are in town. Nonya signatures here include Curry Fish Head, Ngoh Hiang, Crab Foo Young and more. Don’t leave without ordering the Nonya dish of the day. Suited for two pax, the Banwan Kerperting Soup is a mouthwatering blend of traditional Peranakan spices and herbal ingredients speckled with pieces of juicy crab meat. The Sotong Sambal is another aromatic seafood dish, with succulent squid in a blend of spicy paste. A fiery treat for the senses, this appetising dish will surely blow you away. Desserts at Straits Chinese Nonya Restaurant are impossible to resist. Their famous Durian Pengat is smooth, creamy and luxurious. A single bite of this decadent dessert will leave you coming back for more. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Curry Fish Head, Ngoh Hiang, Crab Foo Young, Durian Pengat

html:
• ABOUT

    Discover Singapore's reputation as a food haven through StraitsKitchen, a one-stop venue with a Halal-certified kitchen showcasing the best of Chinese, Indian, Malay and Peranakan cuisines. Hailing from around Asia, StraitsKitchen's team of chefs prepares authentic hawker fare for you a la minute and at the highest culinary standards.With the latest advisory by the Singapore Government, StraitsKitchen has now returned to serving all food items via a staff-served food line from 13th April 2021. Beverages will be ordered via the restaurant menu's QR code and will be delivered to the table. (Apr 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Best Halal Spot" - Chope Diners' Choice Awards 2015 "The traditional hawker food court concept is given a dramatic facelift at the spectacular StraitsKitchen. The menu runs the gamut from laksa, aromatic sticks of satay and char-grilled stingray to chicken rice, puffs of naan, tandooried meats and a bevy of Peranakan desserts." -Time Out Singapore "Can't get enough of the Red Dot's delicious local fare? Not keen (or no time) to hunt for the best dishes across the island? Look no further - StraitsKitchen has it all under one roof. It is big on promoting Singapore's cultural heritage and diversity and celebrates this by incorporating decorative elements such as Chinese teapots and a wall filled with bottles of chilli and pepper oils in the space." -The Finder

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Beef Rendang, Wok-Fried Crab, Tandoori Murgh, Assorted Nonya Kuehs, Durian Ice-Cream

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Paying homage to popular Hong Kong and Macau street food, Streats is a halal-certified restaurant chain offering a wide variety of dim sum, noodles, rice and pasta. With a focus on Hong Kong specialities, the restaurant’s casual and inviting layout provides a great dining experience for family and friends. Start with the restaurant’s signature Claypot Tom Yum Seafood. A popular favourite, this comforting bowl of spicy soup features a mix of juicy prawns, squid, mussels and more — perfect for seafood lovers. For those in search of a lighter meal, the Hong Kong Shrimp Noodle is a great option. Served either dry or in a piping hot bowl of flavoursome soup, the tangy noodles are accompanied by handmade shrimp dumplings and vegetables. Feeling overwhelmed by the sheer number of options? When in doubt, stick with the classics. Streats’ famous HK Beef Crispy Egg Noodles and HK Fried XO Seafood noodles are mouthwatering options you can never go wrong with. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Tom Yum Seafood, Hong Kong Shrimp Noodles, HK Beef Crispy Egg Noodles, HK Fried XO Seafood Noodles

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/streats-bukit-panjang-plaza

html:
• Good For

    Business Meetings, Casual Dining, Drinks, Large Parties (16+)

  • RESTAURANT NOTICE

    Dear valued customers, S-Cafe is turning the page and starting an exciting concept soon! Our last day of operation at 35A Scotts Road will be on 23 May 2021. Click here for more information.

  • ABOUT

    The lesser-known Swabian cuisine is recognised for its rich and down-to-earth dishes native to Wurttemberg and parts of Austria. The menu here is dedicated to authentic Swabian classics such as Pork Knuckle, Speciality Sausages, and Spatzle. Whether you’re a newbie to German cuisine or a seasoned connoisseur, there’s sure to be something for you. With fine upholstery, lively music, and welcoming staff, Bavaria is just but a meal away. You can’t go wrong with the Pork Knuckle. Crisp on the outside, yet tender and juicy on the inside, this dish is amazingly tasty. Pair it with one of the beers imported straight from Stuttgart and you’ll get a truly authentic Swabian feast. There is also a wide selection of wines for diners who prefer alternatives. The Speciality Sausages are another hot favourite, and for good reason. Choose between beef, chicken, or pork sausages, which are dressed up with a side of mashed potatoes and gravy. The gravy is lightly spicy and adds flavour to the generous portion of sausages. The Chicken Spatzle with White Wine Sauce is a boozy dish that is perfect for ravenous diners looking for a decadent dish. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Knuckle, Speciality Sausage, Prawn Linguine, Chicken Spatzle with White Wine Sauce, Maultaschen

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/stuttgart-blackforest-boutique-s-cafe
name: Stuttgart Blackforest Boutique S-Cafe

html:
• Good For

    Casual Dining, Drinks, Pet Friendly, Quiet Dinner

  • ABOUT

    Offering all kinds of authentic Japanese favourites including sushi, sashimi, yakitori and a great selection of premium sake and beers from the land of the rising sun, Suishin Izakaya & Sake Bar boasts an extensive menu highlighting shared dishes. Dished up with ponzu or tabasco, the freshly shucked Nama Oyster comes in servings of three pieces, half a dozen and one dozen. Ideal for enjoying alone or sharing with family and friends, these tasty seafood delights are a must order speciality menu item not to be missed out on! The Assorted Sashimi features as many as five different kinds of thinly sliced raw fish. Dining in big groups? Opt for the bigger platter featuring seven kinds of sashimi. Move on to fill your bellies up with the restaurant’s appetising maki sushi. A classic favourite, the California Maki is a staple when looking to satisfy your Japanese cravings. Pair with exquisitely rolled Salmon Avocado Maki to complete your meal. Health nuts can also opt for lighter meal options such as the Sashimi Salad or Caesar Salad. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot presents the multi-dimensional flavours of Thai cuisine through its halal-certified hot pot fare. Brought to you by the team behind Siam Kitchen and Bangkok Jam, the Eat-All-You-Can buffet menu features quality ingredients like thinly sliced Shabu-Shabu beef, fresh chicken, home-made fish glue, and access to the buffet bar with unlimited fresh vegetables, mushrooms, pot dishes and more! Experience an ensemble of sweet, salty and spicy through authentic Thai soup base well-loved all over the world, including the Thai Signature Tom Yum and a creamy curry broth Khao Soi. Go beyond the famed classics with Tom Yum Yen Ta Fo, a tom yum base with sweet yen ta fo sauce made from fermented beancurd, or the refreshing Sweet Basil Chicken Soup. Not forgetting the free-flow Thai drinks and desserts such as the Mango Sticky Rice, Khanom Tako (Thai pudding with coconut topping) and Cassava Cake, these are must-haves to round off the Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot experience. Set in a vibrant Thai-inspired interior, Suki-Suki Thai Hot Pot remains homely and welcoming, perfect for a hearty makan session with family and kakis. (Aug 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shabu-Shabu Beef, Thai Signature Tom Yum, Khao Soi, Tom Yum Yen Ta Fo, Sweet Basil Chicken Soup, Mango Sticky Rice, Khanom Tako, Cassava Cake

html:
• ABOUT

    If you’re looking for a place offering sukiyaki and shabu shabu at crazy affordable prices, then Suki-Ya’s your best bet. Priding themselves on offering diners a heartwarming dining experience that won’t break the bank, you’re sorely mistaken if you think quality is compromised here. Choose from five exciting types of soup bases to complement the quality meats, think an unlimited amount of thinly-sliced beef, chicken, or pork, which you’ll be tucking into in no time. Our personal favourites include the Tonyu Miso broth, a wildly popular Japanese winter dish that’s both nutritious and packed with flavour. The Kimchi broth, on the other hand, is perfect for those who want to spice up their meal. Simmered with authentic kimchi, spicy miso, and vegetables, this broth definitely packs a punch. Seeking a balanced meal? Suki-Ya’s got you covered too. Their expansive Healthy Bar features a wide variety of fresh vegetables to round up your meal with some greens. Now, get ready for a feast that will titillate your taste buds! (Oct 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shabuya Wagyu Beef, Pork, Tonyu Miso Soup, Sukiyaki Soup

• ABOUT

    If you enjoy swishing meats at popular outfit Suki-Ya, you’ll love its more upscale sister Suki-Ya Kin. With a panoramic view of the Sentosa waterfront, this premium shabu shabu outlet showcases all-you-can-eat quality ingredients. Pick from a choice of five different broths first, with popular favourites such as classic shabu-shabu made from simmered kelp and kombu, or a richer Butaniku — a creamy pork-based soup. On the menu are excellent meat selections, from fatty strips of wagyu to generously-marbled slices of premium kurobuta. Craving for seafood? A must-try are the fresh tiger prawns and the sliced sashimi. Balance your meal with trips to the vegetable bar to load up on crisp, leafy greens. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Shabuya Wagyu Beef, Pork, Tonyu Miso Soup, Sukiyaki Soup

• ABOUT

    An Asian-inspired dining space filled with innovative local delicacies and heady cocktails, ready yourselves for a treat on nights out with family and friends at Sum Ting Wong. Featuring monthly kitchen takeovers that ensures a rotating snack menu, this hole in the wall dining spot located in the heart of Chinatown is a great choice for good food and great drinks.Order a cocktail and indulge in the yummy combination of alcohol and a savoury pastry treat, courtesy of a well-known bakery. All cocktails at Sum Ting Wong come paired with a tasty traditional Chinese pastry such as egg tarts, siew paus, yam tarts and more for a complete wine and dine experience! A favourite among the sweet tooth crowd, we recommend starting your night with Wen Jing. Made with the restaurant’s very own butterfly pea infused Hendricks gin and married with aperol and lavender, this sinfully sweet beverage is topped with a generous layer of Prosecco for the ultimate indulgence. Those looking for cocktails infused with subtle notes of citrus and lime can opt for the Zhen Mei Li. Other delectable concoctions that will quench your thirst include Mi Lu and Jia Xing. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wen Jing, Zhen Mei Li, Mi Lu, Jia Xing

html:
• ABOUT

    Taking the pride of place in the cosy Japanese space that is Sumire Yakitori House at Bugis Junction is, of course, a grill. Large and shiny, it produces skewer after skewer of succulent meat grilled expertly right in front of you. Sumire hails from a long tradition of yakitori in Japan, and this is clear in its extensive menu, which showcases different parts of the humble chicken, from its shoulder to its thigh. Sumire’s meatballs are very popular for their savory balance of juicy flavours. They literally explode their goodness with each bite, making it necessary for you to reach out for a napkin or two to dab your mouth with after each bite. Non-yakitori items are also available at Sumire. The Japanese Daisen Chicken Hotpot is made from Daisen chicken, a breed of chicken that has been raised on the Daisen mountain in Tottori Prefecture (north of Kyoto) in Japan. The stock itself is chock-full of goodness, with chicken meat, minced chicken balls, prawn, fried tofu, enoki mushrooms, okra, zucchini, and fungus all contributing to its robust and hearty flavour. Love runny eggs? The D-I-Y Tamago Toji Hotplate is the perfect dish for you. Tossed in the hotplate are grilled chicken meat, grilled chicken meatballs, and mixed mushrooms, all mixed in a savoury-sweet dashi. Unlike the usual Tamago Toji dishes, Sumire serves the raw pasteurized egg separately so you can decide how cooked you want your egg to be. Do not ignore the accompanying rice bowl topped with Egg Tempura. The yolk itself is comfortingly runny, and together with the chicken pieces hidden in the rice, it is an eggy party in the mouth. For a yakitori night out that is far from yucky, Sumire is the place for you. (Aug 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bakudan Korekke, Aburi Salmon Menati Mayo Roll, Aburi Shime Saba, Sumire Mori

Inspired menus by the restaurants two Hong Kong chefs are complemented by a collection of fine Chinese art and antiques. Besides à la carte and set menu options, Chef's five-course lunch and six-course dinner menus are also available. For private business and social functions, two private dining rooms are available.   • ABOUT

    Enclosed by greenery and featuring a glass pavilion, the aptly named Summer Pavilion evokes the essence of summer and has diners feeling like they're feasting in a lush garden. References to the Chinese summer are beautifully represented in the floral motifs that appear in crockery and the musical arrangements featuring the Chinese flute, but most impressive of all, is the menu. Besides the usual Cantonese offerings such as soups, noodles, and a smorgasbord of seafood, meats and vegetables cooked in a variety of ways, keep an eye out for highlights such as the Double-boiled Sea Whelk Soup with Fish Maw & Chicken Served in Whole Coconut, and the Poached Rice with Lobster. Finally, choose a specialty tea from the Tea Salon to pair with your meal, to round out that perfect experience with Summer Pavilion. (Jan 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The spacious and serene restaurant overlooks a beautiful Chinese garden with lush greenery. With floor to ceiling glass and natural light flooding in during the day, the restaurant feels like a luxurious greenhouse." -Singapore Tatler

  • ABOUT

    It's not everyday you can say you're escaping to the countryside in manic Singapore, but take a car or bus ride into the quiet stretches near Seletar Airport and you'll find empty fields, lush tropical greenery, and The Summerhouse, a new restaurant, bar, and cafe that's housed within a colonial-era Royal Airforce Bungalow. Amidst the hilly greenery of the surrounding landscape, there's a high chance that you'll forget you're in Singapore, though the food and drinks here, created by a team led by Chef Chris Millar, will remind you that you're in one of the world's great dining cities. Crafted in partnership with farming communities in Singapore and farther afield, and topped off with produce from an on-site organic garden, this is a gourmet restaurant with a heart for nature. Leveraging on Singapore's constant sunshine to create the feeling of eternal summer, flowers and herbs from the garden are used to adorn the plate and each mouthful bursts with sun-ripened, sustainably-sourced flavours. Kelong-farmed grouper is served with an elegant pesto of farm-fresh carrot, orange-kissed hollandaise, and a garnish of garden nasturtiums. Seasonal farmed sea urchins from France are turned into a gelato-like ice cream, flavoured with soy sauce and topped with briny ikura and toasted nori, while beautiful Australian Mayura beef is rendered smoky and tender with an Inka grill before being served up with pickled pumpkin, local mushrooms, and an earl-grey infused jus. Come soak up the chill vibes and hard-to-find tranquility at The Summerhouse, a rare Singapore experience elevated by fine, sustainably-sourced food. (Apr 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "A mere 30-minute drive from the city will get you to the former Seletar Airbase, where your new idyllic escape from the daily grind awaits." -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Charcoal Grilled Slipper Lobster, Smoked Butter Poached Red Snapper Fillet, Pickled & Slow Cooked Lamb Shoulder

html:
• ABOUT

    Enjoy a little Sunday every day with a dose of delicious desserts and coffee. Not just any desserts, but handcrafted desserts prepared with pride and love. From the selection of raw ingredients to the making of crafted sweets, every detail pays homage to the freshness and tastefulness of our products. Kick things off by ordering a slice (or five, in our case) of one of their tempting cakes. Fans of lighter flavours might enjoy the Strawberry Charlotte or Lemon Lavender, whilst the other end of the spectrum sees richer combinations like Rich Cognac Chocolate or Oreo Cheesecake. Signature, however, is a plate of two thick waffles, crunchy on the outside and fluffy in the middle, stacked and loaded with a perfectly shaped spiral of freshly-churned ice cream. There are perfectly churned classics like Sea Salt Gula Melaka and Dark Chocolate Ferrero, but why not live a little and give less ubiquitous flavours like Earl Grey Lavender or their seasonal flavours a try. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sea Salt Gula Melaka Ice Cream, Affogatos, Iced White with Ferrero Ice Cream, Watermelon Lime Pop, Lemon Lavender Cake, Rich Cognac Chocolate Ganache Cake.

• Good For

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Bynd Artisan & Sunday Folks, two brands known for their passion and mastery for handcrafted experiences, have come together to offer the best of both worlds under one roof in the heart of Orchard Road.The Bynd Artisan + Sunday Folks ION Experience Store is a unique lifestyle destination ~ one that invites you to leave the noise of everyday life at the entrance, and treat yourself to a spot of retail therapy.Here, allow yourself the luxury of time to customize and personalise a well-appointed, handmade leather-and-paper gift; learn a new skill at a crafting workshop; and enjoy seasonal artisanal dessert creations, such as the Hazelnut Pretzel Mille Feuille, complete with a cup of specialty coffee crafted from locally roasted beans. In this dream sanctuary, both brands have combined their handcrafting ethos into an immersive brand experience with unique merchandise and thoughtful touches designed to bring meaning to our community.The interior exudes warmth and comfort through earthy hues, tactile surfaces and gentle lighting. The cool hand-grinded copper wall and a gallery-inspired product display convey a feeling of calm, composure and beauty that’s enhanced by a curated playlist. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Marrakesh, Ice Cream Petits Gâteaux, Freshly Churned Ice Cream

    Super Loco Customs House is a festive and contemporary Mexican restaurant and bar located on the Marina Bay waterfront. Relax with a margarita and delicious food as you enjoy the stunning backdrop of Marina Bay. Drop by during lunch to enjoy a quick salad, selection of tacos or a hearty burrito. Dinner at Super Loco Customs House is also equally delightful. Choose from and sink your teeth into signature tacos, quesadillas, salads, as well as sharing mains. (March 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cauliflower Aguachile, Tuna Tostadas, Wagyu Steak and Octopus Tacos, Beef Quesadilla, Lamb Barbacoa, Angus Rib Eye Steak and Churros

  • COCKTAILS

    One of the largest selections of high quality tequilas and mezcal in Singapore. Super Loco has an amazing range of margaritas and fresh fruit cocktails. There is a selection of handcrafted, unfiltered, preservative-free craft beers. Finish off with a post-dinner agave night caps.

html:
• ABOUT

    The fun and festivities never end at Super Loco Robertson Quay. A Mexican-inspired restaurant and bar founded by The Loco Group, the riverside restaurant is family and pet friendly and serves up a variety of hearty and healthy sharing plates with fresh ingredients and punchy flavours. Perfect for sharing, the restaurant’s dinner menu features plenty of healthy and gluten-free options. Must-try dishes are: Mexican street corn, Ceviche, Spicy chicken wings, Chicken and Beef quesadilla and their wide selection of tacos. For the health-conscious, at least half of the menu is vegetarian or vegan, or can be done so. Expect interesting and unique Cactus tacos, Roast Pumpkin & Corn Enchiladas and Huitlacoche Truffle Mushroom quesadillas. Pop by the restaurant on the weekends to have a taste of their popular brunch menu which consists of classics with a Mexican twist or come by for Happy Hour every Monday to Friday from 12-7pm. (March 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mexican Street Corn, Ceviche, Tuna and Crab Tostadas, Baja Taco, Chorizo Taco, Chicken Quesadilla, Mexican Pork Ribs, and Achiote Roast Chicken and their famous Super Churros. A wide range of vegan and vegetarian dishes.

  • COCKTAILS

    100% blue agave tequilas and mezcals, that are used in the number of amazing margaritas. The bar also features a refreshing selection of non-alcoholic drinks commonly found on the streets of Mexico - Agua Frescas (home made fresh fruit cocktails).

html:
• ABOUT

    Feeling very much like a modern trattoria, the trendy wood and black steel décor of Supply & Demand is instantly eye catching, in part because of the restaurant’s spot at the relatively artsy Esplanade. With huge glass windows, plenty of diners clamour to snag a spot that affords them a view of the outdoors bustle, but few succeed unless they’re very lucky or, you know, they book in advance. In terms of dishes, we’re happy to report this isn’t one of those places where the décor far outstrips the food. The menu is robust and boasts a wide variety of things you’d expect from an Italian joint; cichetti like Handmade Arancini, Beef Tagliata, Mixed Bruschetta, generous portions of Polpa Di Granchio, Carbonara Classico, and other pasta bigwigs – there’s even a whole section dedicated to risotto – plus pizza ranging from Hawaiian and Quatro Formaggio to unusual options such as Manzo Scottato (seared beef) and Gamberetti Piccante (spicy shrimp). The usual Italian offerings are more than enough, so we’re pleasantly surprised to see Supply & Demand go the extra mile by introducing something different in the form of Southeast Asian-inspired flavours. Sambal Marinara, Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Salted Egg Fries, it’s a collision of two cultures that form unique combinations sure to pique your interest. For a super casual Italian meal that’s inviting and delicious, this makes it into our top ten. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “You’d be hard pressed to find a better deal on happy hour beer - keep it in mind for a casual Friday night with friends.” -SG Now “Cool fusion is the name of the game at this Italian industrial-chic bistro, that comes with a rooftop bar. They serve pizzas, pastas and a formidable range of starters.” -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Garlic Truffle Fries (V), Homemade Breads (V), Chickpea Hummus & Guacamole (V), Truffle Mushroom Arancini (V), Bruschetta (V), Stracciatella (V), Squid Ink Risotto, Truffle Mushroom Risotto, Signature Homemade Pastas, Hand Opened Thin Crust Pizza, Tiramisu, Sticky Date Pudding, Chocolate Lava Cake

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/supply-demand-esplanade

html:
• ABOUT

    Feeling very much like a modern trattoria, the trendy old school chic décor of Supply & Demand is instantly eye catching, in part because of the restaurant’s isolated spot in the corner of Orchard Gateway. With huge glass windows and leafy trees, plenty of diners clamour to snag a spot that affords them a view of the bustle down below in Somerset, but few succeed unless they’re very lucky or, you know, they book in advance. In terms of dishes, we’re happy to report this isn’t one of those places where the décor far outstrips the food. The menu is robust and boasts a wide variety of things you’d expect from an Italian joint; cichetti like Handmade Arancini, Beef Tagliata, Mixed Bruschetta, generous portions of Polpa Di Granchio, Carbonara Classico, and other pasta bigwigs – there’s even a whole section dedicated to risotto – plus pizza ranging from Hawaiian and Quatro Formaggio to unusual options such as Manzo Scottato (seared beef) and Gamberetti Piccante (spicy shrimp). The usual Italian offerings are more than enough, so we’re pleasantly surprised to see Supply & Demand go the extra mile by introducing something different in the form of Southeast Asian-inspired flavours. Sambal Marinara, Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Salted Egg Fries, it’s a collision of two cultures that form unique combinations sure to pique your interest. For a super casual Italian meal that’s inviting and delicious, this makes it into our top ten. (Aug 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “While its first outlet at the Esplanade Mall caters to the drinking crowd and theatre-goers, Supply & Demand’s offshoot, opening at Orchard Gateway, is geared towards hungry shoppers. The restaurant’s menu features a range of Italian dishes with Southeast Asian influences.” -Her World Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Egg Fries, Mixed Bruschetta, Handmade Arancini, Asian Inspired Salmon Poke, Carte-Blanche Grill Menu, Signature Pastas Of All’ Arrabbiata, Polpa di Granchio, Al Funghi, Al Vino Bianco, Seafood Pasta. Squid Ink Risotto With Seafood & Signature Hand Opened Thin Crust Pizzas

  • ABOUT

    A Korean barbecue restaurant at Tanjong Pagar often dubbed as Singapore’s “Little Korea”, SURA is a dining institution fit for royalty. With an expansive menu that features lunch courses, a 12-course Korean Table, as well as other meals tailored for two, this Korean restaurant is the ultimate dining destination. Ingredients are flown directly from Korea, ensuring the restaurant’s authenticity and dedication to bringing the best of Korean cuisine to Singapore. Featuring four types of wagyu beef parts, choose from the sirloin, short loin, short rib, tenderloin, or all! Each features a distinct flavour profile and texture, best enjoyed over the grill. The premium black pork also enjoys a range of cuts, from the jowl and belly to the shoulder blade and spare ribs. You can enjoy all this in a signature grilled course that also comes with highlights such as the lotus root salad, sashimi, and ban-sang with six side dishes. There’s no shortage of drinks here at SURA. Opt for traditional soju, or choose from a wide range of alcoholic beverages such as premium makgeolli, champagne makgeolli, and yakju. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cod Fish Soup, Premium Black Pork Jowl, Wagyu Tenderloin, Lotus Root Salad

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    The name “Ayu-mu” () means walking towards a new beginning. 3 years ago, we started our journey stemming from a fervent respect and desire to share the rich heritage of “edomae” sushi. The name symbolised a fresh start with immense possibilities and was the inspiration of our longtime and dear friend, highly acclaimed Chef Masakazu Ishibashi, affectionately known as “Chef Masa” by his followers in Japan and Asia. Today, we are extremely privileged and humbled to announce a new chapter and the continuation of our dream with the official rebrand to Sushi Ayumu by Masa Ishibashi. This will be Chef Masa’s second outpost outside of Tokyo, following his successful “Sushi Nanami by Masa Ishibashi” in Taipei. Chef Masa comes from a family which ran a sushi restaurant in Tochigi prefecture and spent a lot of time behind the counter growing up. Many of his followers would have known him as the Executive Chef for Ginza Sushi Ichi Tokyo, Jakarta, Bangkok and Singapore. He led its Singapore branch to Michelin 1-star before starting Shoukouwa where he led them as the first “sushiya” in Singapore to earn Michelin 2-stars in their first 2 years of business. In Nov 2017, he returned to Tokyo with his wife Tomomi to establish Sushi Masa Ishibashi at Ginza, where he has become the latest culinary sensation at the heart of Tokyo’s high end dining scene. Known for his precision and finesse, Chef Masa will impart his eye for details and dynamism with us through this rebrand. Together, we will start walking towards a new dream to reflect his vision and interpretation of the perfect sushi “omakase” indulgence, along with our renowned “omotenashi” in a calm and luxurious intimate setting. We welcome you to embark on a memorable and decadent dining journey with us at “Sushi Ayumu by Masa Ishibashi”. Looking forward to the pleasure of your next visit very soon. Yoroshiku Onegaishimasu. (May 2021)

  • href

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Singapore’s leading nightlife establishment, Zouk Group, announces its latest venue, Sushi Ichizuke. The first of its kind in Singapore, the Japanese inspired, dual-concept offers a place for discerning guests to experience new level of hospitality and luxury. Located in Clarke Quay, Sushi Ichizuke will offer distinct experiences highlighting the very best of Japanese cuisine and culture with an Omakase Sushi-ya and a cocktail driven bar concept.  With travel off the cards for the foreseeable future, Zouk’s latest venture provides an element of escapism to the former glory days of Tokyo and the hospitality of the Oiran, a category of the high ranking courtesan in Japanese history. The sophisticated décor incorporates bold and creative elements, providing an immersive experience that boast an intimate and modern yet traditional feel. “During these uncertain times, we continually strive to provide our guests with refreshed and unique experiences, and look forward to providing an exceptional, one of a kind affair in Singapore with the launch of our latest concept,” said Andrew Li, CEO of Zouk Group. Helmed by Head Chef Ryoichi Nakatani, Sushi Ichizuke reflects the traditional tea houses of Tokyo, which were the centre of entertainment and where friends would gather to relax and unwind with quality food, drinks and service. It exemplifies the finest hospitality and meticulous treatment toward all guests that was provided by the Oirans, and the vibrant atmosphere of friends gathering to relax and unwind with exceptional food, drinks and service in the traditional tea houses of Tokyo. The space boasts a central kitchen with a unique omakase seating where it completely surrounds the Chef with a 360 degree view, allowing guests to have an open view of the chef in works. The layout of the omakase bar is actually modelled after the iconic Zouk eye offering an omakase Sushi-ya with a modern yet traditional feel. The menu comprises the freshest, high-quality ingredients flown in three times a week from Toyosu Fish Market in Tokyo. Paired with a curated music programme, the stylish and sophisticated Sushi Ichizuke takes a very Zouk approach to classic, offering a great, energetic environment and elevated vibe-dining experience. (Jun 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aoi and Tsubaki menus, Kiwami and Miyabi menus, Zuke Maguro, Ichizuke Don (Uni, Ikura, Caviar, Hairy Crab and Yellow Tobiko), House-special Handroll (Toro, Shiso Leaf, Takuan Pickles, Seaweed) and A5 Miyazaki Beef

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Japanese cuisine is still at the pinnacle of our palatal pilgrimage in sushi-obsessed Singapore, but a high-quality dining experience may not come with a plausible price tag – until now. The new concept by award-winning Les Amis Group is a "must-go" among Japanese food aficionados looking for a tranquil culinary escapade with a friend or two. At Sushi Jin, you get the supreme freshness of ingredients flown in 3 times a week from Tokyo's Tsukiji market, known to be the world's largest and busiest fish market. This means, you can now save on airfare to Japan's favourite destination among jet-lagged tourists with predawn hours to kill, on top of a price-savvy menu. Its menu boasts a plethora of appetizers, sashimi, sushi, maki, agemono, grilled items, noodles, rice, soup, and dessert. Chef's specials include Ootoro Aburi sushi, Wagyu Asupara maki, Gindara No Yuba Tempura and Gintara Tsuke Yaki. (Jul 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "One of our favourite items on the menu was the truffle seafood chawanmushi. Served with prawn, crab meat and scallop, the steamed egg was smooth and savoury, with varying levels of textures. In fact, it was so delicious, we think we'd have been satisfied to just pair this with plain rice." -Lifestyle Asia "His ingredients are flown in three times a week from the iconic Tsukiji Market, his menus are intricately hand-pressed, and the design of his restaurant is elegant and pristine. Yet, the high quality of Sushi Jin's ingredients and service somehow comes without a crazily hefty price tag." -City Nomads "In fact, balance of flavours is precisely what makes the food here remarkable, as Tan deftly creates sushi with ingredients like a sweet prawn dressed in crab yolk sauce and served with the prawn's head deep-fried to a shattering crisp, and foie gras with sea urchin that are both rich yet light and melt deliciously in the mouth." -TODAY Online

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tai Carpaccio, Mini Wagyu Don, Truffle Seafood Chawanmushi, Ootoro Aburi Sushi, Unagi Chahan, Yuzu Mochi

html:
• ABOUT

    Nakano Jiro-San founded Sushi Jiro over 2 decades ago with the sole aim of providing as authentic a Japanese dining experience to guests as possible. Armed with culinary skills gleaned from his experiences in Japan, Jiro-San has consistently offered his philosophy of respecting traditional methods of Japanese cuisine preparation and execution. Today he remains a pillar and mentor in Sushi Jiro's culinary team. Simplicity lies in the center of Chef Kenji Nakagawa’s culinary philosophy. A master in the art of Edomae Sushi, Chef Kenji offers his best in crafting his Omakase experiences that has gained him a loyal following. His creations are often simple in form but delights the palate sensationally, exposing the skill and mastery behind every creation. His expansive knowledge of Japanese produce, from origins to characteristics of each ingredient combined with his art produces a divine Japanese dining experience. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Omakase, Wagyu Don, Sushi Platter

• ABOUT

    If there's one thing the Chope team strives to avoid when it comes to describing a restaurant, it's hollow superlatives. With that said, a meal at Sushi Mieda is nothing short of breathtaking. Though what's served will change depending on what's in season in Japan at the current moment, you can be rest assured that everything will be prepared with craft and precision, earning Sushi Mieda a place among the upper crust of the best sushi restaurants in Singapore. For our meal, we were welcomed with a starter of sea urchin atop sesame tofu, covered in a bonito-broth jelly, and garnished with a touch of caviar and gold leaf. Describing the combination of flavours and textures as a symphony probably doesn't do it justice; the balance of saltiness from the bonito jelly and sweetness from the sea urchin and sesame tofu meant it was more a masterpiece than any 'mere' composition. Course after course convinced us that we were dining in the presence of a master craftsman. Head Chef Keisuke Ohno treated us to a dazzling array of fish both expected and uncommon. For the less sushi-seasoned, opportunities to sample fishes like golden-eyed snapper and black-throat perch will open your mind to an ocean far beyond salmon, tuna, and flounder. The setting for this culinary master class is equally authentic. Seats at the sushi counter of eight make for an intimate dining experience, its position at the centre of the floor just emphasizing the exclusivity, while sitting at the "outside" tables lining the interior of the tower provide for spectacular views of the surrounding area. Quite frankly, any meal at Sushi Mieda lets you leave the trappings of Collyer Quay far behind. An effortlessly bona fide Japanese experience, don't be surprised if you stumble back out, sated and blissful, and find yourself disorientated by the realization that you aren't standing on a street in Ginza. (Jul 2014)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seasonal Seafood Items, Edomae-style Nigiri Sushi, Omakase Menu, Jyunsai, Miyazaki Mango, Tosazu Jelly

  • HELMED BY CHEF KEISUKE OHNO

    Creating perfect sushi dishes comes under Chef Ohno’s forte.   His impeccable knowledge of fish and seafood reflects in his skilful preparation and wonderful presentation of his sushi.Originally from Miyagi, Japanese-born Chef Ohno was lured into the culinary world when his passion for this industry and for food was recognised at an early age.Chef Ohno prides himself on using the best and freshest ingredients and each sushi dish on the menu is conceptualized and executed with exacting standards.

    Enjoy creative sushi dishes in a cosy dining area as you watch the chefs in action at Sushi SEIZAN. This Japanese restaurant in Bugis serves delectable edo-mae style sushi expertly prepared by a team of chefs with more than 20 years of experience under their belt. Well-loved for their variety of omakase sets on offer, the Signature Sushi Kappo Full Omakase is a crowd favourite among uni lovers. Discover your favourite uni with this popular omakase set menu option and dig into different kinds of uni, tuna and seasonal ingredients alongside the restaurant’s signature Dashi Soup and Chawan Mushi. For sashimi lovers who love their fish fresh from the ocean, the Sashimi & Sushi Course is a delightful meal made up of as many as nine kinds of nigiri. Served with the Temaki of the Day, you simply can’t go wrong with this course filled with classic Japanese favourites. Fancy an affordable wine and dine experience at Sushi SEIZAN? The Bubbly Brunch Set during lunch time is the perfect combination of sushi and champagne. (Sep 2021)

  • ABOUT

    Dim Sum is food close to every Singaporean soul. Whether it’s fancy dim sum for Sunday brunch, humble dim sum for that post-party refuel, or the classic dim sum breakfast, dim sum always hits the spot. When you’re a dim sum establishment that has been around for more than 50 years (yes, that’s as old as Singapore) but only opens from 6pm to 6am, then you know you’ve got your niche market down pat. Night owls swear by their Mee Suah Kueh, Prawn and Banana Fritters, and the Salted Egg Yolk Custard Bun. First two items are fairly unique, items that draw in the diners from all over Singapore, and the last, simply a really good rendition of an increasingly common dim sum item that almost every Singaporean loves. The space is humble, the food is simple, but Swee Choon Tim Sum is timeless in its appeal. So the next time you want a taste of authenticity, you know where to go. (Aug 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Don’t be surprised to find a queue well into the early hours for a seat at Swee Choon Tim Sum. The 50-year-old establishment that's a hit with a younger, post-clubbing and night owl set occupies five ground-floor shophouses to keep up with the demand for their signature mee-suah kueh ($1/two), Portuguese egg tarts ($1.50/two) and custard-rich liu sha bao ($3.60/three).” -Time Out Singapore “Well-known dim sum specialist Swee Choon Tim Sum has a wide range of Hong Kong and Shanghai style bites, like the signature mee sua kueh, deep-fried vermicelli cake, and freshly made xiao long bao.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mee Suah Kueh, Liu Sha Bao (Salted Egg Custard Bun), Xiao Long Bao, Prawn and Banana Fritters, Pan-fried Carrot Cake, Drunken Chicken, Fried Golden Tofu

  • ABOUT

    Located on the fringe of the historic Kampong Glam district, Symmetry is an all-day dining restaurant and bar with the laid-back sensibility of Aussie culture. Having just revamped their restaurant to reflect a more timeless and chic space, they have changed up and refreshed the menus as well. Serving up quintessential Australian fare with a contemporary spin, Symmetry's food expresses of who they are and what they believe in. To bring true Aussie flavours to the table, expect vibrant and bold flavours meticulously prepared with the finest and freshest produce without losing the sense of familiarity and comfort. Crowd Brunch favourites such as the Symmetry Big Breakfast, Eggs Benedict, and Symmetry Waffles are still a mainstay on the menu. But be sure to try out the waffles' close cousin, the Pancake Stack, served up with fresh berries, lemon curd cream cheese, maple syrup, a dollop of home-made caramelised banana compote topped with honey ice cream. Dinner sees all types of meat for every belly. From Honey 5-Spiced Glazed Duck to Wagyu Rib-Eye A La Plancha, Red Snapper to Braised Lamb Shank, there is something for everyone to feast on. Vegetarians can look forward to an indulgent Black Truffle Risotto served up with enoki fritters, tarragon creme fraiche and pecorino. The starters take no back seat with contenders such as Roasted Quail, Tiger Prawn Soldiers, and Pork Jowl Confit. (Jul 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Of the mains, both the braised pork cheek with tagliatelle coated in mushroom cream and arugula and satisfying, full-flavored 18-hour braised beef short ribs are good options.” -SG Now
