html:
• ABOUT

    Singapore’s Japanese dining scene is vibrant, and has had plenty of new restaurants popping up every so often, but few offer the fresh take on seasonal dining that Syun does. Located in the luxe Crockfords Tower of Resorts World Sentosa, this spot pays homage to Japanese fine dining with their refreshing interpretations of classics. A sleek interior boasts natural accents like wood and marble and makes the perfect spot for a business lunch to impress, or even a date night to impress. For a dish that is as delicious as it is Instagram-worthy, try the Sea Urchin Rolled by Wagyu Beef. Served on little gold spoons, the delight is made with the beloved Japanese uni rolled up in a thin strip of raw beef. Elegant and simple, it is the perfect way to prime your palate for the flavours to come. The Wagyu Beef Sukiyaki is a premium plate that is a must-try for meat lovers. Made with thin strips of premium meat cooked at the table, the beef absorbs the flavours of the broth and is so tender, it falls off the fork. Kurobuta Pork and Wagyu Beef Shabu-Shabu are also available for diners to enjoy at their tables. (March 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sea Urchin Rolled by Wagyu Beef, Wagyu Beef Sukiyaki, Kurobuta Pork, Wagyu Beef Shabu-Shabu

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    One of the most influential chefs in modern Chinese culinary movement, Celebrity MasterChef Jereme Leung makes his return to Singapore with contemporary Chinese restaurant, yì by Jereme Leung at Raffles Hotel Singapore.Nestled on the third level of the restored Raffles Arcade, yì by Jereme Leung leverages on the art form of fine dining to awaken the appetite and the senses of guests. The restaurant delivers cuisine that takes guests on an exploration voyage to China's vastly diverse cultural regions.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Sichuan Spicy Chicken & Luncheon Meat, Sichuan Spiced Crispy Fish Skin, Brined Duck Breast, Beef Tripe & Ox Tongue with Sichuan Chilli Dressing, Golden Roasted Duck with Rose & Fermented Bean Sauce & Rainbow Pancakes, Braised Beef Cheeks, Fried Rice with Char Siew, Pork Belly & Pickled Long Beans

  • WEEKEND DIM SUM LUNCH SET

    Enjoy YÌ by Jereme Leung's new Weekend Dim Sum Lunch with your family and friends. Savour a curated line-up featuring both off-the-menu specials and well-loved favourites such as the Yunnan Rose Petal Pastry and Chilli Crab Xiao Long Bao.

  • SG-CLEAN CERTIFIED

    We are pleased to inform you that Raffles Hotel Singapore has been given the SG-Clean certification - an initiative by the Singapore government, led by the Singapore Tourism Bureau to award destinations that have met detailed and thorough precautionary measures.Please note that during your visit with us, all our dining venues will be practising these safe and enhanced precautionary measures, in accordance with guidelines from the government. We thank you in advance for your understanding and patience.

html:
• ABOUT

    Taking after the spirit of an izakaya in Japan and a joo-mak in Korea, TAAN IZA-BAR’s menu is specially crafted to incorporate interesting izakaya and joo-mak dishes which perfectly complement the bar’s comprehensive drinks menu. The place’s jazz music and scattered soft lighting gives the bar a relaxed and romantic aura. Taste the best of both worlds with the bar’s fusion menu of Japanese and Korean delights. Drenched in home-made sauce, the mix of Wagyu beef cubes and Shimeji mushrooms make up the Saikoro Steak, one of the most popular options on the menu. For seafood lovers, the Grilled Oyster is a yummy option that is spiced up with the addition of minced garlic sauce. The Oden and Nasu Miso are healthy yet delicious options, perfect for the health conscious. The former is a twist on a local favourite. Known as Japanese yong tau foo, the Oden is a light and nutritious one-meal dish that can be enjoyed any time of the day. Despite being smaller than the Japanese menu, the Korean options are also plenty. The Korean Fried Chicken is a classic favourite among diners. Featuring double fried boneless chicken tenders drizzled with Yangnyeom flavouring, these tasty treats are a highlight on the menu. (Jan 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Saikoro Steak, Grilled Oyster, Nasu Miso, Korean Fried Chicken

html:
• ABOUT

    Table at 7 serves Asian-Indonesian food at Bukit Timah. Helmed by executive chefs Karl Dobler and Eugenia Ong, their passion for diverse culinary experiences led them to Table At 7 - the perfect platform for them to share their culinary craft with the world.Serving food prepared with the most exceptional ingredients, your taste buds are in for a real treat. With fresh and exciting offerings, Table at 7's menu boasts a medley of dishes that pay tribute to both Asian and Indonesian cuisine. Carefully crafted and updated to include seasonal dishes to tantalise diners, the ever-changing set menus feature decadent dishes not to be missed out on. Start with a simple but delicious House-Smoked Ocean Trout Salad to whet your appetite before moving on to the filling mains, such as the Beef Rendang Burger or Black Angus Sirloin Steak. Served with a generous amount of fries or truffle mash potatoes, these delightful mains are sure to fill you up.End your meal on a sweet note with a Sticky Date Pudding. Paired with butterscotch and vanilla ice cream, this sweet treat is the perfect way to end an indulgent meal. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tahu Telor, Ayam Penyet, Udang Cumi Bakar, Nasi Kuning Platter, Wagyu Oxtail Rendang, Pisang Goreng, Sticky Date Pudding

html:
• ABOUT

    This restaurant is famed for their popular Apple Dessert, which is one of the most “Instagram-famous” desserts on the menu, but has much more to offer than just sweet treats. Located at the late Joel Robuchon’s former spot in Hotel Michael, this spot has made a name for itself as an unpretentious fine dining establishment. Helmed by veteran Dutch chefs Richard van Oostenbrugge and Thomas Groot - whose restaurant 212 in Amsterdam was recently awarded a Michelin Star - table65 serves up modern European fare and is their first venture outside of the Netherlands. Dig into the Veal Tartare, a rich dish of light beef marrow and meat topped with a generous helping of briny Beluga caviar. The richness of the meat is tempered by the salty taste of the caviar, and makes for a standout combination of flavours. The Ceviche Passionfruit is a sweet and rich dish that combines a staple of Latin cuisine with the vibrant sweetness of passionfruit. The highly-raved Apple lives up to the hype. Made with an isomalt apple shell with a core of apple sorbet and chocolate seeds, this dish is delightfully light and sweet, and makes for a unique dessert. (March 2019)

  • THE BUZZ

    A meal at Table65 is more than just food too. There are flourishes and spectacles, from projections that turn your plate into a lightshow, to the heaving bowls of caviar and truffles that they trot out to embellish your dish. -The Peak Magazine

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ceviche Passionfruit, Veal Tartare, Apple

  • MICHELIN GUIDE SINGAPORE 2019

    table65 has been awarded 1 Michelin Star.

• ABOUT

    Set to become City Hall’s newest dining destination, Tablescape is located on level three of the hotel, and guests can expect an upscale restaurant serving an innovative approach to Modern European classics complemented by a contemporary bar. Reflecting the hotel’s thoughtful approach to service a ritualistic table-side trolley service will complete your dining experience. Tablescape will reinterpret classic European flavour profiles with a menu delivering a refined selection of dishes, from starters, main courses of premium meats and fish grilled to perfection on a Josper Charcoal Oven to inspired desserts; while the bar celebrates the best of European classic cocktails infused with Asian nuances in the form of bespoke cocktails by the glass, communal cocktail punchbowls and barrel aged cocktails brewed at the bar, complemented by an extensive selection of craft beers and premium wines. (Jan 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    62°C Egg with Asparagus, Parmigiano and Black Truffle, Black Angus Beef Tataki, Black Angus Beef Cheek, Carnaroli Risotto with Cauliflower, Smoked Duck and Foie Gras, Iberico Pork Chop, Pan Roasted Barramundi with Eggplant, Tomato and Burrata, Soufflé served Crème Anglaise

  • COMPLIMENTARY PARKING FOR ALL RESTAURANT DINERS

    Enjoy complimentary parking at Grand Park City Hall for all diners at Tablescape. Remember to request for a complimentary parking ticket upon payment of your bill.

  • ABOUT

    Featuring the finest seasonal ingredients, Taiga Dining is a small intimate 11-seater sushi-ya run by Master Chef Taiga Kanekuni. Located amidst an abstract mountainscape design, Taiga's minimalist backdrop lends an air of sophistication to dining at the restaurant. For lunch, Taiga offers three tiers of Omakase at different price points each with 4 courses. Be sure to come in with a curious palate and a ready mind as you wait to see what Chef Taiga has to offer. The masterful art of Chef Taiga shines through with each exquisite dish, allowing you to feast not only with your eyes but also with your mouth as well. He is known for his signature dishes such as the trio of Uni Hand Roll with Murasaki and Bafun Uni that have an umami taste you can't find anywhere else. Ocean fresh uni is combined with premium Japanese pearl rice in this decadent dish. Another seasonal favourite here is the Spotlined Sardine Sushi, which is perfectly prepared and melts in your mouth. For dinner, Chef Taiga only serves two tiers of Omakase at different price points, and each 4-course meal is just as beautifully crafted for maximum indulgence. You can get up close and personal with the Master Chef himself to enjoy your night of elegant fine dining. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ka Cho Huu Getsu, Ino Shika Chu, Hi To To Se, Uni Hand Roll, Spotlined Sardine Sushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Experience the best of both worlds at Taikoo Lane Hotpot. Aimed to showcase the best of Sichuanese and Cantonese cuisine with diners, it is guaranteed to evoke the taste of home, as well as cultivate new memories. No matter your party size, Taikoo Lane Hotpot offers individual and larger sharing pots, alongside an extensive variety of soup bases. This includes the well-loved Sichuan Spicy Broth and local favourite Fish Soup Broth with Fresh Milk. Seafood lovers must sample the Shrimp Skewer, which comes in two varieties. The first is raw to accentuate its natural sweetness, while the second is marinated with Cajun spices, packing a flavourful punch! Their Lobster Noodles are also delicious. Simply cook the lobster and noodles in the flavourful broth, then drizzle on Taikoo Lane Hotpot’s special condiments! If you prefer red meat, must-tries include the Spicy Marinated Beef, seasoned with an intoxicating medley of spices that includes sugar, chilli powder and red pepper flakes. Beyond hotpot, Taikoo Lane Hotpot also serves a variety of cooked dishes such as their signature Braised Beef Short Ribs. End your meal on a sweet note and try the Pandan Ice Jelly with Coconut Milk. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Lobster Noodles, Spicy Marinated Beef, Pandan Ice Jelly with Coconut Milk

    Indulge in a signature Yakiniku experience with a premium selection of meats to pick from, and an exclusive Omakase experience at Great World. Showcasing the best Japanese charcoal grill experience, the Tajimaya Tasting Platter is an impressive assortment of nine distinct chef selected premium Japanese meat cuts, served with seven different appetisers and sides to complete the meal. Alternatively, hop on a gastronomical ride with an affordable omakase style dining experience. Featuring seasonal ingredients and refined flavours not to be missed out on, sit in on an authentic Japanese dining experience with your choice of a la carte menu options, an omakase affair or with the crowd favourite Tajimaya Wagyu Beef Buffet. Made for intimate dining sessions, the Japanese Miyazaki Beef comes in a set for two and features a fine selection of premium cuts such as the Miyazaki RIbeye, Miyazaki Tenderloin and more. Served up with delectable side dishes, take your pick of Tempura or Chawanmushi to go with the hearty feast that awaits. (May 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tajimaya Tasting Platter, Japanese Miyazaki Beef, Miyazaki Tenderloin, Chawanmushi

html:
• ABOUT

    Yakiniku is one of the great pillars of Japanese cuisine: the practice of grilling succulent cuts of meat over a charcoal fire. The basic elements are almost religious in their simplicity: beautifully marbled and fresh meat, a smoky fire, and some subtle dipping sauces to go along. Oh, and bowlfuls of steaming hot rice on which to baste those hot, meaty drippings. Here at Tajimaya, the menu is basically page after page of different grades of top-grade meat, though really they are most famous for their offerings of divine Miyazaki Beef offered in a range of cuts from ribeye to chuck short rib. Choose from an à la carte menu or simply get the set, which comes with a generous lineup of sides from crunchy Tempura to a daily selection of Sashimi, as well as a comforting bowl of Garlic Fried Rice. Apart from Miyazaki beef, there is US Wagyu and US Angus, as well as fatty Kurobuta Pork for lovers of that other great barbecue meat. The pork is available in a range of cuts as well, including the unctuous jowl cut, or meltingly tender cheek that will reduce to a fatty sliver of joy in your mouth. To undercut all of that meaty goodness, other dishes here include Korean-inspired soups like Kimchi Soup and hot-stone Ishiyaki Dons filled with meat and vegetables crackling from the heat of the bowl. To fill up, slurp up some piping hot Udon. With meat this good, you’ll want very little else but rice, but these other options make this restaurant perfect for hitting every corner of that Japanese craving you’ve been nursing. (Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Tajimaya’s menu is extensive and tasty, and its service pleasant enough to keep us coming back” -SG Magazine “We expected nothing but premium quality, and definitely weren’t disappointed with Tajimaya’s beautifully marbled Wagyu slices” -The Smart Local

  • ENJOY 20% OFF BUFFET WITH CHOPEDEALS

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Miyazaki Beef, Garlic Fried Rice, US Wagyu Beef, Kurobuta Pork, Kimchi Soup, Ishiyaki Don, Udon, Tempura

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Takayama Japanese Restaurant invites you to an intimate epicurean encounter steeped in the tradition of fine Japanese cuisine. Indulge in a multi-course menu that celebrates seasonal ingredients at the peak of their flavours, as Executive Chef Taro Takayama and his team curate every dish to exquisite perfection right before your eyes. At the heart of dining at Takayama Japanese Restaurant is the spirit of omotenashi, or wholehearted Japanese hospitality, graciously delivered in the elegant ambience of this exclusive kappo-style restaurant cocooned in the midst of Singapore's Central Business District. The menu at Takayama pays homage to the food culture in Osaka, which came to be known during the Edo period as "the kitchen of the world" and where people, to this day, take great pride in their local cuisine. Inspired by the four seasons of Japan, our menu and cooking styles are dictated by the freshest ingredients in season. Our signature dish, Abalone + Uni, is the ultimate celebration of this inspiration. Beverages, too, are curated with the seasons in mind to complement the cuisine at Takayama Japanese Restaurant. (Mar 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Formerly chef de cuisine at Mandarin Orchard Singapore, chef Takayama began his career at three-Michelin-starred restaurants Kashiwaya and Koryu in Osaka, before being appointed master chef at the residence of the Japanese ambassador to Singapore, where he served dignitaries such as Japan's Crown Prince Naruhito and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe." -The Straits Times

    Abalone + Uni, Saikyo Miso Black Cod, Grilled Kumamoto Wagyu Beef

  • ABOUT

    Takeshi-San is a sushi restaurant in Holland Village offering Japanese specialties that take on a classy and elegant approach. It’s all about the rolls here at Takeshi-San! A smashing hit, the Incredible Hulk is a tasty mix of avocado, salmon roe with soft fluffy grains of Japanese rice perfect for sharing with family and friends. Another equally delicious menu option is the Mexican Roll. Made up of a unique combination of shrimp, cream cheese, crispy tempura bits, these mouthfuls of delights are finished off with a fiery spicy sauce. For those with a bigger appetite, the restaurant’s Sushi Kaidan Sets will definitely satisfy all your sushi cravings. These sets are aesthetically presented with different pieces of sushi on a staircase-like wooden contraption. Truly indulgent, every piece of sushi is a passionate creation of pure enjoyment. For meat lovers, the A5 Wagyu Inaniwa Udon with Truffle and Onsen egg is a beautiful amalgamation of flavors that will have you putting your hands up for seconds. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Incredible Hulk, Sushi Kaidan Sets, Mexican Roll, A5 Wagyu Inaniwa Udon with Truffle and Onsen Egg

  • ABOUT

    A Japanese izakaya bar in Singapore’s CBD, Taki Izakaya Bar is the go-to spot for work lunches and after work drinks. With quality ingredients that would appeal to Japanese food lovers, expect a menu of classic favourites spread across sushi, sashimi, starters, kushiyaki, agemono, don, steak, and dessert categories. Lunch buddies can enjoy their value sets that come with rice, miso soup, salad, and pickles — with an option to upgrade when you add a chawanmushi, and more. Go for the Beef Yakiniku, Chicken Teriyaki, and Buta Shogayaki options for a hot meal, or choose their premium sets of nigiri and sashimi for a taste trip to Japan, sampling the freshest seafood. Sushi lovers should opt for the Spicy Maguro, with that hint of chilli kickstarting your dining journey. For drinks with colleagues, the best bar snacks take a Japanese turn with Tori Kawa, with crispy chicken skin. Or try the Tako Karaage, with crisp octopus tendrils. Their Kushiyaki Platter of eight skewers has it all: Buta bara, buta enoki, tomato bekon, shiitake, okura and uzura no tamago. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tori Kawa, Tako Karaage, Kushiyaki Platter, Hotate Mentai Aburi

  • ABOUT

    Delight in all things egg-related here at Tamago-EN. True to its name, the restaurant features a variety of dishes that feature your favourite Japanese egg as the star of the show. Using only the freshest eggs imported directly from Okinawa, delight in the orange yolk unique to Japanese eggs and revel in the fluffy texture of Tamago-EN’s delicious egg dishes. Order the 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer for an Instagrammable dish that’s a feast for the eyes and appetite! Each skewer comes with a different assortment of toppings, creating a bright, colourful and appetising dish. Soft and fresh on the inside, and springy on the outside, these tasty sticks of Tamago leaves a wonderfully sweet aftertaste. Topped with a runny egg and bonito flakes, the Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko is a must-try that tastes even better than it looks. The star of the menu, however, is The Ultimate TKG. Also known as Tamago Kake Gohan, whip the egg white into a fluffy cloud-like texture and add your favourite toppings for the ultimate indulgence. For dessert, be sure to order the Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake to end your meal on a sweet note. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer, Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko, The Ultimate TKG, Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake

  • ABOUT

    Delight in all things egg-related here at Tamago-EN. True to its name, the restaurant features a variety of dishes that feature your favourite Japanese egg as the star of the show. Using only the freshest eggs imported directly from Okinawa, delight in the orange yolk unique to Japanese eggs and revel in the fluffy texture of Tamago-EN’s delicious egg dishes. Order the 5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer for an Instagrammable dish that’s a feast for the eyes and appetite! Each skewer comes with a different assortment of toppings, creating a bright, colourful and appetising dish. Soft and fresh on the inside, and springy on the outside, these tasty sticks of tamago leaves a wonderfully sweet aftertaste. Topped with runny egg and bonito flakes, the Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko is a must try that tastes even better than it looks. The star of the menu however, is The Ultimate TKG. Also known as Tamago Kake Gohan, whip the egg white into a fluffy cloud like texture and add your favourite toppings for the ultimate indulgence. For dessert, be sure to order the Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake to end your meal on a sweet note. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    5-Kind Japanese Omelette Skewer, Hashimaki with Cheese and Mentaiko, The Ultimate TKG, Caramel Peach Souffle Pancake

html:
• ABOUT

    There is a certain purity to top-notch quality ingredients grilled with care and perfection, a implicit respect afforded to such delightful offerings from nature. At Tamashii along North Canal Road, that’s precisely what you get. An elegant blend of tradition and panache, food is served on wooden oars in homage to Japanese fishermen who did the same once upon a time. The freshest ingredients are flown in regularly from Japan, and Chef Patrick Tan continuously goes out of his way to prepare the amazing produce in tantalising, and occasionally fascinating ways! Previous seasonal stunners include grilled squid lips, ivory shell sashmi (called Shiro Baigai in Japanese), and Japanese clams served in a variety of ways. You can’t go to a Japanese robataya without having some grilled fish though, and the seasonal Barracuda was grilled to perfection. The skin of the fish was crispy, the flesh moist and tender. It tasted of the grill and the sea, and felt like a portal to being seated on the beach, charcoal in the sand, and fish straight from the ocean. We love the idea of walking into your favourite restaurant and eagerly asking “what’s in season right now?” Whether it’s the fruit of the land or the fruits of the ocean, there’s definitely only the freshest ‘fruit’ on offer at Tamashii, and we’re always eager to be introduced to something new, delicious, and satisfying whenever we visit. (Aug 2013)

  • THE BUZZ

    "...the best course turns out to be the luscious grilled seasonal vegetables - chewy gingko nuts, crisp-slippery mountain yam and squishy soft-yummy taro." -The Business Times Lifestyle "The Japanese style of barbeque is delivered here by owner chefs Max See and Patrick Tan (formerly at Yoyogi) and Tan’s wife Nicole, and the restaurant’s bar layout tempts diners with its bountiful display of fresh produce used to create signature dishes like the shiromi truffle ($58), which comprises of thinly-sliced white fish sprinkled with black summer truffle shavings, the yaki taraba gani ($45), or grilled King Hokkaido crab leg ($45)." -Time Out Singapore

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Tandoor re-opens on Thursday, 14 January 2021 and will operate from Wednesdays to Sundays.Established in 1985, Tandoor, Singapore’s most awarded Indian restaurant, takes diners on a journey with authentic North Indian dishes that pay homage to India's rich culinary heritage. Each dish in the gourmet menu is carefully handcrafted by a team of talented chefs using classic recipes and time honoured methods which date back in time across India’s rich history. Ever conscious of our diners’ palettes, some dishes use healthier preparation methods while retaining their original Indian heritage. Contemporary yet laced with tradition, Tandoor’s interior is dotted with subtle Indian motifs. Back-lit wall panels featuring Jaali (or Jali) - a latticed screen characteristic of Indian architecture – line two sides of the restaurant, while twin alabaster pillars house the traditional Indian craft of inlay mirrors. Full-length windows give diners an intimate view of the kitchen where two custom-made copper tandoors (or clay ovens) stand. From the dining hall, you will be able to see our chefs at work, from making Indian breads to preparing kebabs of tandoori meats and vegetables that are served fresh to your table, presents an inviting atmosphere where you can enjoy good food and great conversations with family, friends and clients alike. (Jan 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Mango Curry at Tandoor: This unique sweet-savoury curry inspires fanatical fervour among those who taste it. Many a diner has inveigled their way into the restaurant's kitchen, just to learn the recipe." -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mango Curry, Goan Fish Curry, Nimbu Murgh Ka Tikka, Bailey's Kulfi, Bollywood Bellini

html:
• ABOUT

    To find authentic Indian food, look no further than Tandoori Culture. With a branch located at Boon Tat Road in Telok Ayer, this cosy establishment offers a casual and relaxed atmosphere with excellent Indian food. Popular with Singaporean gourmets, Tandoori Culture specialises in food cooked in a traditional tandoor oven, or an oven made of clay. This method of cooking slowly extracts the rich flavours from the component ingredients, resulting in fragrant and impactful dishes sure to make your tastebuds sing. Start your meal with the Vegetable Soup, consisting of sweet corn, manchal and dal, and make your way to the entrees, which includes vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. For vegetarians, be sure to try the Punjabi Dal Tadka, consisting of yellow lentils cooked with butter and mixed with a medley of vegetables, including fried chopped onions, coriander and tomatoes. Beyond greens, try the Mutton Rogan Josh, consisting of bite-sized mutton cubes braised and blended with an eclectic mix of spices, and served in a creamy curry sauce. Finish your meal with Gulab Jamun, consisting of fried balls comprised of milk and flour, and soaked in saffron-flavoured sugar. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Vegetable Soup, Punjabi Dal Tadka, Mutton Rogan Josh, Gulab Jamun

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Dating back to the early 1950s, Singapore has long been a place for cultivating gastronomic inventions combining the dynamism of British cuisine with diverse local influences. The birth of the colonial cuisine was a melting pot of flavours led by the diverse culture in Singapore where each unique palate comes together. The ideation of the Cookhouse, or commonly known as a large eatery space, is where we present the most charismatic and original minds of culinary experts to gather, inspire and create the most delicious renditions of British foods. Enjoy this in a lush British colonial-style setting, giving a nod to the original heritage, coupled with an old-charm-meets new opulence furnishings, exuding a harmonious blend of modernity and heritage. Nestled in the corner of Tanglin Mall and tucked away from the buzzling streets of Orchard, Tanglin Cookhouse aims to bring you back in time with our contemporary rendition of colonial cuisines. We promise our guests will be delighted and awed through years of rich traditions. (Apr 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smashed Avocado Toast with Poached Eggs, Croque Madame Sandwich, Mulligatawny Soup, Crispy Hainanese Kurobuta Pork Chop, Strawberries and Rhubarb Crumble

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/tanglin-cookhouse
name: Tanglin Cookhouse

html:
• ABOUT

    A contemporary bistro and bar that brings to diners an inspiring and modern take on Indian cuisine amidst the lush greenery of Zhongshan Park, TANI serves great food at affordable prices. Start your meal with a Classic Caesar Salad. Always a well-loved classic bowl of greens, the salad is a tasty mix of lettuce, hard-boiled egg topped with croutons and parmesan cheese. An exciting trio of Bhel Puri, Sev Puri and Dahi Puri, the Bombay Chaat Platter is also another great dish to kickstart your meal. Move on to the mains with a hearty serving of Quesadillas. Sandwiched with your favourite fillings of grilled chicken or seasonal vegetables and melted cheese, these soft tortillas are just the thing to satisfy your Mexican cuisine cravings. Similar to the Quesadillas, the soft shell Taco comes in your choice of vegetable, chicken or fish and is served street style with beans, guacamole, sour cream and cheese. Pair your meal with a drink from our bar menu to enjoy TANI’s happy hour promotion - happening all day long! (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Classic Caesar Salad, Bombay Chaat Platter, Quesadillas, Taco

  • ABOUT

    Lauded by Condé Nast Traveller as one of the World's Best Beach Clubs, Tanjong Beach Club is a serene sanctuary located on the finest sun-soaked stretch of sand in Sentosa. Designed to straddle the line between indoors and outdoors, the beach club takes its cue from the seaside homes of yesteryear, mid-century modernism and nostalgic maritime influences. On weekdays, it is a peaceful hideaway from Singapore's concrete jungle, offering a slice of tropical paradise mere minutes away from the heart of the city. Over the weekends, the club transforms into a celebration of vibrancy and living a life more carefree. Take your pick from the lively string of parties running all year round, adorn yourselves with specially curated accessories from The Beach Shop and prepare to dance the night away. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "The convivial vibe here is a cross between beach diner and a classy bistro on the French Riviera." -SG Magazine "Named one of the world’s top 50 best beach bars, the plush daybeds, great grub, and sweet pool makes it a perfect spot to watch the sun sink and rise into tomorrow." -The Honeycombers "This beach club is an outdoor respite dotted with palm trees and nautical-themed amenities — and the best place in Singapore to soak in the sun with a margarita." -The MONOCLE Travel Guide Series Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Açai Bowl, Smashed Avo Toast, Smoked Salmon on Toasted Brioche, Burrata & Heirloom Tomatoes Salad, Crispy Skin Barramundi, Beef Ribs, Crunchy Brioche French Toast, Crab Linguine, Flourless Chocolate Cake, Pavlova, Apple Tart

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Say hola to the bright and festive flavours of Spanish cuisine with Tapas Club, a sleek and sophisticated eatery that promises food so authentic you’ll feel like you were whisked away to the Iberian Peninsula itself. Embark on your evening our lunch with some cold cut platters, such as the Tabla De Embutidos. This platter features a variety of mixed Ibérico cold cuts, such as chorizo and salchichón. Paired with some bread and a dab of tomato puree, you will be hankering for more of these delicious morsels. For more yummy bites, the heavenly Croquetas De Setas, otherwise known as mushroom croquettes, can’t be beaten. And what’s a Spanish eatery without some paella? Gorge yourself on one of the many paellas available. Our favorite has to be the Arroz Negro, highlighting fresh cuttlefish and clams in squid ink paella. Authentic and bold Spanish fare takes center stage at Tapas Club, so swing on by the next time you’re in the neighborhood. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jamon Iberico, Tortilla de Patatas, Croquetas de Jamon, Huevos Estrellados, Pluma Iberica, Paella Mixta, Churros

html:
• ABOUT

    Tapas 24 Singapore is the first Asian outpost of the iconic Barcelonian concept, helmed by Michelin-starred Chef Carles Abellán. A tribute to Spain’s laidback counter-culture, the elevated neighbourhood all-day tapas bar offers a buzzy atmosphere, unfussy service, and sublime tapas. The unpretentious menu highlights quality Spanish products and an intricate knowledge of and respect for authentic tapas dishes. This lively restaurant is conveniently located along Robertson Quay and is a great place to swing by for fuss-free meals. Dishing up sumptuous tapas classics such as the Patatas Bravas and Classic Bikini, the restaurant’s signature plates include both traditional and contemporary versions of Spanish snacks. Snag a seat near the bar and indulge in heady cocktails as you munch on Truffle Bikinis stuffed with a generous amount of ham and cheese. Don’t forget to order the Chicken Croquettes to enjoy crispy morsels filled with creamy chicken bits. Refreshing Sangria and a selection of Spanish Street Cocktails are also on offer, as is an extensive wine list, featuring curated offerings that showcase the best of Spain’s viticulture as well as much-loved New and Old World wines. (Aug 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Patatas Bravas, Classic Bikini, Truffle Bikini, Chicken Croquettes

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    Experience the taste of Nanyang right in the vicinity of Siglap. Owned and operated by multi-award-winning celebrity chef, chef Pung Lu Tin, the restaurant serves traditional Chinese dishes with a touch of modern creativity. A scrumptious creation by chef Pung Lu Tin is the Stewed Rice Vermicelli with Seafood and Supreme Stock in Opeh Leaf. Nicely diced into bite-sized pieces and braised in supreme chicken stock, the ingredients are tossed with prawns and scallops, enhancing the flavour of the dish. The Braised Charcoaled Tofu with Minced Pork and Dried Shrimps also pack a punch of flavours. Cooked over a hot stove to bring out the flavours of the silken tofu, the dish is topped with fried minced pork and dried shrimps. Another mouthwatering dish is the Poached Chinese Spinach with Sea Clam and Trio Eggs. End your meal on sweet and savoury notes with the Soya Bean Milk Pudding with Mango Puree. Delicious, innovative and fresh, the food at Tasty Court by Chef Pung transforms every visit into an unforgettable dining experience. (Mar 2020)

Try the Braised Dried Seafood in Golden Chicken Broth. html:
• ABOUT

    Wrapped around the corner of River Valley Road, this shophouse restaurant looks unassuming at a glance but a closer look yields the sort of quaint charm that draws diners in. Once inside, the Swiss chalet inspiration is clear – wood panels, vintage-looking lamps, and other decorative knick-knacks give the small space cosy warmth. The philosophy here is obviously less about fancy touches and more about letting the food speak for itself. None of that half-baked tourist fare though, the menu offers a rich selection of prime Continental items. Fresh Irish Oysters, Goose-Liver Terrine, Raclette Cheese with Air Dried Beef; you’d never guess these sumptuous appetisers were on offer just by looking at The Tavern Restaurant’s humble exterior. The mains are equally decadent, with Wagyu beef listed alongside dishes like Dingley Dell Pork Chop, Angel Hair Pasta with Half a Lobster, Sliced Veal Zurich, and Alaskan Crab-Mornay. Surprised by the incredible spread? We were too, at first. It’s a good lesson in not judging a book by its cover and, really, we’re only sad lessons can’t be this delicious all the time! (May 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Scottish Smoked Salmon Loin, Pan-fried Goose Liver, Chateaubriand, Beef Tenderloin 'Morel', Dingley Dell Pork Chop, Whole Dover Sole, Homemade Apple Pie A La Mode, Fresh Irish Oysters, Goose-Liver Terrine, Raclette Cheese with Air Dried Beef, Escargot ‘Madagasy’, Baked Portobello, Grilled Maine Lobster, Sliced Veal Zurich, Alaskan Crab-Mornay

• ABOUT

    Escape the hubbub of the city and chill out at this elegant spot in the Amara Hotel. With mood lighting and chilled out tunes, this is the perfect place to unwind with a cup of tea and some finger food. Whether you’re a high-tea newbie or a seasoned visitor, the spread at the Tea Room is sure to impress. Guests can choose their favourite type of TWG tea to be brewed, and enjoy it with a variety of light bites that will tide you through dinner. The Parma Ham and Cheese sandwich is definitely a must-try. For something a little lighter, the Classic and Raisin Scones are a great way to indulge your sweet tooth without going overboard. These airy treats come with a side of Devonshire cream jam, and butter. Feeling indulgent? Treat yourself and a friend to the English High Tea set, one that comes with a pot of premium brewed tea, and sweet and savoury treats on the side such as Mushroom Tarts and Coconut Macarons. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    English High Tea Set, Parma Ham and Cheese Sandwich, Raisin Scone, Coconut Macaron

html:
• ABOUT

    Warm and cherry, Tea Villa Cafe offers a wide range of premium teas, pizzas, pastas and a variety of Lebanese, Indian and Mexican food. Delivering mouthwatering Western classics and traditional delights, don’t miss out on trying their Mac and Cheese Pizza. A tantalising carb on carb option, the harmonious combination of mac and cheese atop a tangy tomato base is a definite must-try. For those looking for a flaming good time, the Schezwan Noodles is an addictively fiery dish loved by regulars. Other signature dishes include the Chilli Paneer Dry, Risotto with Pesto Sauce and more. An aesthetically pleasing dish that features an attractive selection of hummus dips served alongside a generous portion of pita bread and falafels, the Villa Special Hummus Platter is great for sharing among friends. Wash it all down with a refreshing cup of the cafe’s popular Peach Fairies. Unlike your conventional cafe, Tea Villa Cafe provides diners with a unique range of Indian-Chinese dishes on top of your favourite cafe picks. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mac and Cheese Pizza, Chilli Paneer Dry, Risotto with Pesto Sauce, Peach Fairies

html:
• ABOUT

    Don’t be fooled! Despite what its name suggests, Tekong Seafood Restaurant is rooted firmly on the mainland. Based in Changi Village, this storied culinary establishment that was formerly based on Pulau Tekong has been wowing diners with its consistently fresh seafood and Chinese cuisine for over thirty-five years and counting. Here, freshness is practically guaranteed as the restaurant tends to use live seafood that has been recently caught by local fishermen off the Singapore coast. And there’s something for everyone. For the health-conscious eaters, the Nyonya Steamed Fish is a great catch – bursting with flavour without the use of any oil. Meanwhile, the Ginger and Spring Onion Lobster is cleverly done, with the bright notes from ginger enhancing the tender lobster flesh. Vegetarians don’t have to despair, as the restaurant has plenty of stellar options to pick from, whether it is the soft Thai Style Tofu, or the crunchy Fried French Beans. And of course, one must not pass on the classic tze char go-to, the fluffy and fragrant Oyster Omelette. On weekends, you’ll see this eating joint packed to its gills with families large and small. And thanks to its coastal views, dining at Tekong Seafood Restaurant feels like a respite from the usual city life. Now don’t wait, chope a reservation for your next meal there! (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Oyster Omelette, Fried French Beans, Thai Style Tofu, Ginger and Spring Onion Lobster, Nyonya Steamed Fish

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Telok Ayer Arts Club is a multi-use venue that brings art, music, food and drink together in unexpected ways. Owned and operated by The Supermarket Company, the space is located in the heart of the busy Telok Ayer neighbourhood, at the crossroads of business, F&B, culture and more. Dubbed a creative factory for the community, Telok Ayer Arts Club will be a respite from the mundane – a jolt of creativity that is here to remind city dwellers to think about the driving forces behind our work, our city, and our lives. Artists are given a space to showcase their work and performances in a collaborative format, and in a non-gallery like setting. Each member of our homegrown team is continually inspired by our rotating schedule of artists and their work, ensuring that all are constantly creating and evolving the food, drink, and music offering. Telok Ayer Arts Club is here to challenge the notion that the arts isn’t for everyone, because we believe art is all around us, if we just looked a little closer. (Sep 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smashed Fingerling Potatoes, Fried Carrot Chips, Baked Chocolate Pudding, Salted Jaggery, French Vanilla Ice Cream, Bloody Maria, Bir Pletok

html:
• ABOUT

    Located along the Singapore River is Tempo Bar, a classy bar found at the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel. Serving up a smorgasbord of international fare, Tempo is the place to go for a casual dining experience at any time of the day. Feast on perfectly grilled Chicken Tikka, or sink your teeth into their delightful Beef Steak Sandwich to start off your meal - both off their all-day menu. For something with a little more heft, their Summer Season - an indulgent sharing platter that features chicken, pork, beef, and lamb - is the way to go. For a taste of the ocean, their Sea Sides platter which features Boston lobster, oysters, scallops, prawns, and snow crab legs, will do the trick. Smokey flavours from the grill shine through and enhance the sweetness of the fresh seafood.Wash it all down with a whimsical or classic cocktail with a twist, from their master mixologist, as you unwind at Tempo. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Tikka, Beef Steak Sandwich, Summer Season, Sea Sides, Lamb Kebab

html:
• ABOUT

    It’s easy to unassumingly walk past the beer vending machine that serves as the entrance to this bustling tempura bar. But keep your eyes peeled, and you’ll be rewarded with a night of good food, drinks, and plenty of fun. Owned by father-and-son duo Paul and Dragg Wong, Tempura Oji is a haven for midnight revellers looking for supper grub. And this is some fine supper nosh indeed. The pair invested in a top-grade flash-frying technology, which means the tempura that comes out from the kitchen here is wonderfully crumbed without being too greasy. Try the Supamu Tempura, which sees ‘Made in Japan’ Spam coated in a light batter and deep-fried. Enjoy this with the Pumpkin Tempura and a side of pureed radish and chopped ginger. Fancy a proper tempura meal? The Sea Bass Tempura is tender and sweet, and is a good complement to the Tempura Moriawase, a selection of deep-fried King Tiger Prawns and mixed vegetables such as onion and eggplant. Wash it down with some Japanese craft beers, or signature cocktails like The Blind Pig, featuring Japanese label Roku Gin stirred with homemade beetroot marmalade and pressed apples. (Oct 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Supamu Tempura, Sea Bass Tempura, Tempura Moriawase, Niku Udon, Shoyu Tonkotsu Ramen, The Blind Pig

html:
• ABOUT

    Pared down to the basics, it’s all about clean flavours and classic Japanese fare done right. TEN means “heaven” or “celebration” in Japanese and in the case of TEN Sushi, this can’t be more true: the cosy enclave is little more than a year old but has made its own splash with Sushi Master Marusaya at its helm. So whether you are looking for a mouthwatering array of fresh fish air-flown from Japan, impeccable hand-rolls, or just a comfy bowl of Don, TEN Sushi has got you more than covered. The Salmon Tartar provides an enticing sneak peek into the exhilarating epicurean journey ahead. A generous portion of salmon cubes is masterfully drizzled with a tangy spicy sauce that does not mask the salmon’s delightful creaminess, while the runny goodness of a perfectly poached onsen egg elevates the entire appetizer. Jumping right into mains, the sushi steals the show with its sheer freshness. Don’t believe us? Try the delicate 3 Kinds of Blue Fin Tuna Sushi for yourself. The rolls don’t disappoint either - the Fisherman Inside-Out-Roll, for instance, features 10 types of fresh fish, totally changing the game for your usual hand roll. Another highlight: the wide selection of sake, whiskey, and beers imported from Japan, so be sure to ask your friendly staff to recommend the perfect accomplice to a great meal! (Apr 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon Tartar, Hegi-Soba Salad, 3 Kinds of Blue Fin Tuna Sushi, Fisherman Inside-Out-Roll, Vegetarian Eel & Cucumber Inside-Out Roll, Teriyaki Eel Don

html:
• ABOUT

    The pet project of owner-operator, this restaurant specialises in Wagyu Beef Yakiniku, and is one of the hidden gems of Singapore’s thriving Japanese restaurant scene. From his humble beginnings in Japan as a dishwasher to a chef of a yakiniku chain, he has come a long way, and the expertise he gained reflects in his menu of beloved Japanese classics. There is a range of barbecue meats on offer at this restaurant, although the main draw is the wagyu meat. The wagyu here is Kagoshima and Hokkaido wagyu, which is one of the most exquisite cuts of beef available in Japan. The Salmon Belly, Sea Bream, and Tuna are also popular sashimi options. The crisp Ebi-Fry is a Japanese staple, and perfect for sharing. The Soft-Shell Crab is another popular dish. A whole crab battered and deep-fried, this dish is good to share but can also be enjoyed by one hungry diner. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kaiso Salad, Atsuyaki Tamago, Truffle Salami, Wagyu Saikoro Steak, Shishamo, Wagyu Beef Tataki, Wagyu Tokujo Rosu

html:
• ABOUT

    Clean, light flavours and precise cooking that highlights the very best of an ingredients natural flavours: that is the heart and soul of Teochew cooking. At Teochew Restaurant Huat Kee, this informs every dish, from its humblest items, like seasonal vegetables, to its more exquisite ones, like precious ocean bounty. An award-winning restaurant that has been passed down for three generations of Teochew chefs, Huat Kee is known and loved for its preservation of heritage Teochew flavours, but also its confidence in working with ingredients from far-flung places like Chile and South Africa. Enter the abalone, one of the signature ingredients at this restaurant, and some say done to perfection here. Served braised with sea cucumber, it may not taste like much, but it’s days in the making, and when eaten, is pillowy, soft, and bursting with briny goodness. There’s also Teochew-style duck, braised and served sliced on a platter with stewed pork belly, marinated eggs, tofu, and a lashing of sweet, herbal gravy. Steamed Pomfret, a Teochew hallmark, and one of the restaurant’s signatures, arrives shiny and pearlescent on the table, strewn with fine aromatic garnishes, and a light poaching liquor. The meat gives way in firm but perfectly tender chunks. For truly festive occasions, a whole, glistening, crisp-skinned suckling pig is available, too, and the meal is best rounded off with some signature Yam Paste, cooked with lard to perfection and topped with stewed pumpkin and gingko nuts. A mix of humble fare prepared to perfection, and premium ingredients prepared with masterful simplicity: Teochew Restaurant Huat Kee is a heritage restaurant, of the best in Asia, and available at your doorstep. (Jul 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Signature Braised Abalone, Duck Combination, Signature Suckling Pig, Signature Fried Kway Teow, Suckling Pig, Signature Cold Crab, Braised Boneless Duck, Homemade Prawn Balls, Yam Paste

• ABOUT

    With a kitchen helmed by lauded Chef Masayasu Yonemura, diners can rest assured that they are in good hands. His eponymous Kyoto restaurant was awarded One Michelin Star, and he is one of the most revered Japanese chefs in the world. This cosy spot in The Forum is his first foray outside of Japan, and was born out of his fascination with the traditional Japanese Teppan grill, and a desire to showcase the best of Eastern and Western cuisine. Start with the Mushroom Croquette with Beef Stew Sauce. The richness of the mushroom and the tenderness of the beef make for a hearty combination. Crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, these little bites are the perfect for whetting your appetite. There are a range of meaty mains here - the Wagyu Hamburg Steak is cooked on the teppan grill and has a signature smoky flavour that seeps into the meat and gives it a unique flavour. Seafood enthusiasts will love the Clam and Lobster Bouillabaisse. Made with Dashi stock instead of fish broth, this dish is a rich comfort food perfect for a cold day. (March 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mushroom Croquette with Beef Stew Sauce, Wagyu Hamburg Steak, Clam and Lobster Bouillabaisse, Crepe Suzette

  • PRESS RELEASE

    This private chef's table experience lets you get up-close-and-personal with the culinary action over a teppanyaki communal table. With a menu that changes according to seasonality, you're always guaranteed the freshest produce and diverse offerings. The restaurant's 'Weekday Donburi Lunches' are a steal, starting from just $22++ for a hearty Japanese donburi (rice bowl) that comes complete with a salad, miso soup and fresh fruits. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Black Angus Beef Tenderloin Donburi, Miso Atlantic Salmon Donburi

html:
• ABOUT

    Riding the wave of the Omakase craze in Singapore is this elegant restaurant in Tanjong Pagar. Established in a refurbished shophouse and seating less than 50, this intimate eatery serves up fresh sukiyaki, sashimi, and sushi made with fresh ingredients sourced directly from Japan. However, the true highlight of this spot is that it is the perfect place to indulge in some Omakase dishes that can be tailor-made according to your preferences. Diners can give celebrated Japanese chef Kenji Okumura guidance on their desired ingredients and flavours, and in a “reversed” Omakase experience, the chef will do his best to incorporate them in a bespoke menu. With ingredients sourced directly from Japan, and with all new ingredients chosen specifically by Chef Okumura, diners can rest assured that they will be in good hands at this restaurant. The Omakase menu makes use of ingredients from various regions of Japan, such as Iseshima oysters, Ise Ebi and Akamoku seaweed from the Mie Prefecture, Unagi from Shimanto and other fresh produce imported directly. Having satisfied personalities such as Gorbachev, Wen Jiabao, and the Japanese Emperor himself with his Omakase creations, diners are sure to enjoy the creations of Chef Okumura. (Nov 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wagyu Minced Katsu, Grilled Avocado with Herbs & Cheese, Soft Tofu Skin with Sea Urchin, Premium A5 Miyazaki Wagyu Sirloin, Shimanto River Unagi, Japanese Oyster from Mie Prefecture, Japanese Lobster from Mie Prefecture (Isejingu Hono)

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked away in Tras Street, Singapore’s Japanese enclave, Teppan Works is a cosy spot that offers diners a taste of Osaka. The Japanese city is well-known for its popular okonomiyaki dishes, and you’ll find this a mainstay on the menu at Teppan Works. Try the Signature Cheese Okonomiyaki, made from your choice of sharp gorgonzola, a light buffalo mozzarella, creamy camembert, or a rich raclette. The cheese is then cooked into the Japanese savoury pancake, with a crack of black pepper and a dash of fiery chilli oil. For something a little meatier, the Special Okonomiyaki is a must-try. The pancake here is stuffed with juicy slices of pork belly and beef tendon, mixed with potato and a fried egg for an indulgent treat. Otherwise, order a slab of the Wagyu Ribeye for sharing — the beef is cooked simply over the grill, then served with a dash of salt and pepper to bring out the rich, buttery flavours of the cut. For dessert, save space for the restaurant’s signature Warabi Mochi. Made with fine kinako (roasted soy bean) powder and black sugar syrup, these fluffy little pillows are the perfect sweet treat to end a delicious meal. (Apr 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hokkaido Uni with Aji-tama, Signature Cheese Okonomiyaki, Wagyu Ribeye, Special Okonomiyaki (Pork and Beef Tendon), Warabi Mochi

html:
• ABOUT

    Tess Bar & Kitchen is the always-bustling, perennially fun filled spot you might have seen on Seah Street near Raffles Hotel. And with drinks from an award-winning mixologist, matched with trendy fare from a culinary heavy-hitter, it's easy to obsess over Tess. Like any it-girl, or it-restaurant for that matter, Tess has a distinctive style, swagger and can back it all up with bona fide coolness. That confidence comes from tatted-up head chef Martin Wong, with L'Atelier de Joël Robuchon kitchen cred and whose expertise in fine dining and playful personality comes through in a variety of small, medium and large plates, which vary in fanciness, but all aim to satisfy. Behind the bar, you can find the shaken-up creations of Steve Leong, the well-known finalist of Diageo Reserve World Class' Singapore 2013. That means that the cocktails are as fine as the dining at Tess, whether you go with old world classics or newfangled tipples. He's not alone in dreaming up drinks, however, as Tess plays host to the city's up and comers in the bar scene, in what turns out to be an open mic night of sorts, that the regular patrons, and there are a lot of them, love. Settle into the hip, glowy space that's configured for optimal hanging out. From the menu, the Duet Scallop & Aburi Tartare shows off Tess' fancier side, with scorched meaty scallops played against a refreshing chopped tartare. Also from the small plates, the Crispy Pork Belly is simplistic in its flavour, served with a fusion dip, forming a savoury, finger-licking good dish. From the Medium Plates, the Tess Wagyu Cubes & Bone Marrow is a surefire winner, with pan seared cuts of beef glazed with veal jus and marrow, just in case you needed more of a meat hit. It's not all about the carnivores, though, as a selection of cheeses and even Vegan mains (a rare sight at Singapore fine dining restaurants, let alone a bar) can satisfy meatless diners. From that section, the Bohemian Vegetables Love is a colourful tangle of grilled zucchini, capsicum, aubergine and a piquant red pepper coulis. Finally, from the limited selection of dessert, the Chocolate Fondant with Blueberry Compote shows that the kitchen keeps careful measure of foodie trends, with savoury elements of spicy apple crumble accenting the luscious classic cake. In the end, it's not just the good looks and impressive resume at Tess that will have you coming back for more, but the rotating food and drinks menu of creative selections. In fact, you are sure to learn what other fans already know: when it comes to Tess, just say yes. (Dec 2014)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Located in a quaint shop house along Seah Street (opposite Raffles Hotel), here's where you can savour Steve's award-winning bak kut teh-inspired Tanqueray No. 10 cocktail along with other creative concoctions. The bar also aims to be a platform for its team of young Asian mixologists to experiment and hone their craft, so you can expect nothing short of a casual, welcoming, and highly interactive experience." -Honeycombers "Well for starters you may find it hard to find a seat, which is already the case at Tess Bar & Kitchen where Chef Martin Wong whips up gourmet bar bites and delectable dishes like the Tess Wagyu Cubes & Bone Marrow, and Steve Leong of Bitters & Love fame makes custom cocktails using premium spirits, juices, fruits and herbs." -Urban Journey But we're perfectly happy with what we have - from the crispy-but-slightly-hard pork belly ($10) slices that you dip into chilli-enhanced kicap manis; deep-fried popcorn chicken-like karaage dusted with a spicy powder; full-bodied briny clams ($9) sauteed with a heady shot of booze set back by the too-hard baguette slices to dip into the salty sauce." -The Business Times "The food is also no slouch. Besides well executed bar bites like crispy pork belly ($10), check out their beautifully plated fine dining-style dishes, including the duet scallop aburi carpaccio and tartare ($16) and even some vegan options (from $9)." -Time Out Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Duet Scallop & Aburi Tartare, Crispy Pork Belly, Triple Truffle Frites, Tess Wagyu Cubes & Bone Marrow, Baeckeoffe, Homemade Duck Rillette, Bohemian Vegetables Love, Chocolate Fondant with Blueberry Compote

    Located in Vivo City, overlooking Sentosa Island. Thai Accent will surely amaze you with Thai cuisine like never before. The moment you step into the restaurant, you will not only be greeted with warm Thai hospitality but also a stylish and funky giving it a retro and clean feeling to this iconic restaurant. The menu offers a simple yet tasteful selection of Thai cuisine. There are a number of omissible items, including the superb Tom Yam Seafood Soup with spices that will surely leave a tingling feeling on your taste buds. For a totally unique Thai cuisine experience, give Green Curry a try, carefully blended herbs with a light touch of coconut cream, served with a choice of chicken or beef. Another signature dish is our Steamed Seabass with lime, garlic and chili sauce. This is a sublime explosion of taste combining sweetness of the fish and sourness and spiciness of its accompaniment of chili, lime, garlic and other herbs. Conclude your meal with a traditional dessert of Mango with Sticky Rice will surely give an ‘accent’ to a satisfied meal. (Jan 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yam Seafood Soup, Green Curry, Steamed Seabass, Mango with Sticky Rice

• ABOUT

    Since 1988, Thanying has been serving gourmands with fine Thai cuisine. Their extensive menu also includes close to 30 vegetarian dishes. Thanying Singapore's chic interior carries a modern and refreshing design theme with brighter lighting, chrome-plated and matt black metallic fixtures juxtaposing against leather, velvet-clad chairs and wooden bone-herring flooring. Ceiling to floor glass windows cast sunlight onto a long gallery of photographs capturing the landscape, culture, arts and lifestyle of Thailand. Two cosy private rooms sitting 8 each are perfect for private dining. Start your culinary adventure with the Yam Som Oh, a salad made with sweet pomelo, a generous serving of chicken and prawn, chilli, and topped with tangy lemon juice for an extra edge. This refreshing salad will awaken your taste-buds and prep your tongue for the onslaught of flavours to come. While classics like Tom Yam Goong, Gaeng Keow, and Gaeng Ped are available, the main that truly stands out is Prow Pla Nam Daeng, a hearty soup made with generous chunks of fish maw. Looking for something a little moreish? Look no further than the Khao Ohb Sapparod - pineapple fried rice served with juicy chicken pieces and topped with sweet and salty pork floss. The tangy taste of the pineapple gives this dish a fresh tropical twist, while the flavoured pieces of chicken and vegetables add texture and complex flavours to what would otherwise be a regular plate of fried rice. (July 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Khao Ohb Sapparod, Yam Som Oh, Tom Yam Goong, Gaeng Keow, Phad Thai Goong Sod

  • ABOUT

    Joining the bar scene at Holland Village is That Wine Place, a wine bar, restaurant and wine academy all in one. With a rustic ambience and wood finish, That Wine Place brings a comforting and cozy experience that’s warm and inviting. Enjoy a deliciously curated menu that’s great with wines, or learn more on the art of wine tasting through their masterful staff. Simple, easy with a sophisticated flair, That Wine Place is the perfect place to relax with friends on a day out or after work. For their bar bites, go for their Heirloom Tomato, served with mozzarella and raspberry coulis. Paired with a wine of choice, this dish is an amazing starter that’s sweet and refreshing. If you’re looking for a fried option, go for their Crispy White Bait that’s seasoned with smoked paprika and saffron aioli for a tasty hint of spice. For starters, go for their Foie Gras that’s deliciously seared with a chlorophyll emulsion, making this dish creamy and savoury. Mains to try are their Halibut with roasted mussels and ikura, combing all the flavours of the ocean in one dish and dressed with a miso emulsion. There is one main dish you must try: Halibut paired with roasted mussels and ikura, which combines the flavors of the ocean in one dish. If you’re looking for a meatier option go for their Kurobuta Pork Collar that’s roasted and served with a cannelini bean stew for a comforting flavour. For desserts, go for their Texture of Lemon that’s light and refreshing for the palette. Serving a combination of sponge, curd, mousse and sorbet, enjoy the different layers of citrus in this artfully crafted dish. Pair this dish with wine for the perfect end to your meal at That Wine Place. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Heirloom Tomato, Crispy White Bait, Foie Gras, Halibut, Kurobuta Pork Collar, Texture of Lemon

    Tinged with a vintage charm, the 80-seater bar is decorated with mahogany-clad and nineteenth century furniture. A long, sleek and wooden-topped bar extends from the entrance and leads into a 10-metre long parquet-floored bar lounge, sporting wood and rattan cushioned bar stools, luxurious plush leather sofas and hanging pendant lamps emitting a warm glow. Guests have a choice of over 250 labels of wine, such as Chateau Pey La Tour Bordeaux and Astrolabe Sauvignon Blanc. The Bar at 15 Stamford showcases 160 labels of rum, painstakingly sourced from Old and New Worlds. Exclusive to The Bar at 15 Stamford, we have added new additions of rums to our collection. Bottled by The 1423 for its Single Barrel Selection range, we have the Dominican Republic 2008, Trinidad 2008, Cuba 2013 and Panama 2006. These single cask rums have been matured in a single cask for at least 5 to 12 years, and include their individual complex aromas and notes. (Sep 2019)

    Slow down and appreciate the beauty of tradition here at The Blue Ginger. Tucked away in a beautifully restored three-storey shophouse along Tanjong Pagar, the Peranakan restaurant provides a conducive and friendly space for conversation accompanied by hearty food that will satisfy more than your belly. Dive into conversation and the unique Pernakan culture with the restaurant’s extensive menu. Prompted by the fond memories of hearty feasts, the menu features a long list of starters, soups, meat, seafood and more. The Nonya Fish Head Curry is a staple. Simmered in a traditional home style curry, the red snapper dish is garnished with lady’s fingers and eggplant. A great centrepiece for any occasion, the fish head curry has a subtle taste of coconut milk that adds to the richness of the broth, bringing out the flavour of the fish. Order a Beef Rendang to go with the fish. Perfectly complementing the spiciness of the fish head curry, the tender beef cubes are prepared in rich coconut milk spiced with ginger, lemongrass, lime leaves and a dash of curry powder for a fiery kick. Other signature dishes here include the Curry Vegetables, Ayam Goreng Kunyit, Sambal Bendy and Durian Chendol. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Nonya Fish Head Curry, Beef Rendang, Sambal Bendy, Durian Chendol

    Raise your shot glasses and experience a night you won’t forget at Chupitos Bar. Bringing the game of shots to a whole new level, Singapore’s only specialised shooters bar is located right smack in the heart of the city.Have it your way with over 130 power-packed shots that may include candy, fire, tricks, and maybe even some naughty props. If you’re looking to rekindle your childhood memories, try the Paddle Pop shots. Want to forget the night? Breathe in the potent fumes from their Gas Chambers. Get ready to embark on a mind-blowing journey to a place filled with Green Fairies, Flaming Alien Brains, and Drunken Monkeys.Drop by for Happy Hour. Happening Tuesday to Sunday from 6:30pm til 9:00pm, enjoy a round of selected shooters, beers, house pours, and highballs at great prices. Don’t fret if you’re late to the party. Go hard or go home the whole night long with a multitude of sweet, savoury, and fruity flavours. For bar bites, try the Truffle Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Crispy Wings, and more, and pair up your shots with an array of snacks for a night to remember. (March 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Green Fairies, Flaming Alien Brains, Truffle Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Crispy Wings

    Nestled in the barracks of Dempsey hill where the nutmeg plantations once stood tall, The Dempsey Project refuses to be put in a rigid box. Simply because, no matter when you walk in and who with, you are stepping into a place that feels just right. Once you settle into the communal dining space and pick up a menu, you'll find yourself navigating a boundary-less world of cuisines - from the classic Avo on Sourdough to the flavourful Za'atar Baked Eggs, Ayurvedic Khichdi Wellness Bowl to 9 hour slow-cooked BBQ Pork Ribs, it doesn't get more diverse and wholesome than this. If you're gluten-free, vegan or on a paleo diet, you will not feel marginalized because a hearty offering awaits you too.Open all week long for breakfast, lunch, brunch, afternoon tea, light bites and dinner all week long, their indulgent cheese boards complement a wonderful suite of wines, while their in-house bakery offers guilty and guilt-free pleasure in equal measure. Hosting at home? The team has handpicked small-batch, artisanal produce from all over the world that you can buy off-the-shelf. Our values are our reason to be. We source ethically grown produce that nurtures the livelihoods of communities that cultivate it and the body, mind and soul of those who consume it. (Aug 2020)

    Centrally located in Asia Square, The Exchange is always humming with a convivial atmosphere and provides a fresh, holistic, and fully integrated day to night experience, with service a cut above the rest. Elaborately molded ceilings, Chesterfield sofas, and marble-clad surfaces provide elements of old-world character while the stainless-steel framed windows of the kitchen brigade echo the mid-century facades in Soho, New York. Complimented by a modern, Australasian-inspired menu, this Tadcaster Hospitality concept is the perfect venue for any occasion - from grabbing a takeaway coffee from our coffee hatch or catching your favorite sports, to after-work drinks, power lunches, and languorous dinner parties. (Jun 2021)

    Named after the commanding sound of the famed East Asian instrument, this restaurant has made a name for itself as one of the “It” places in Singapore’s drinking scene. Located in the swish Duo Galleria, this spot has made a name for itself as one of the few places in the city that offer a modern drinking experience with a nod to our roots. With an exposed brick interior, sleek lighting, and a posh feel, this spot wouldn’t look out of place on the streets of Melbourne. The seafood and poultry dishes are popular choices, and for good reason! Both dishes offer a hefty portion of meat without an exorbitant price tag. There are even gluten-free and plant-based options for diners who have dietary restrictions. The Mushroom Pizza is great for sharing. The crust is made in-house, and makes for a light base that doesn’t overpower the earthy mushroom toppings. Come here for a tipple or two, or dance the night away to some downtempo funk. Whether you’re in the mood for wine or whisky, a Singapore Sling or a Mojito, the staff will be happy to make recommendations.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mushroom Pizza, Singapore Sling, Mojito, Salt and Pepper Squid

    Tucked away in Great World, The Gong by Drinks&Co indulges diners in a casual yet sophisticated setting with dishes inspired by classic Italian fare. Keep it traditional by starting your meal with an Artisanal Cheese Platter. A selection of daily cheese served with grapes, quince and savoury biscuits, sample the different types of cheese on offer with this signature board. Move on to more exciting menu options such as the Grilled Chicken Wings to spice things up! Unlike your usual grilled wings, these tasty wings at The Gong by Drinks & Co comes with a coriander-chilli yoghurt dip. Other fusion dishes include The Gong Satay Pizza. Featuring perfectly diced pieces of chicken and beef satay glazed with a generous layer of satay peanut sauce, this local spin on a timeless Italian favourite brings the best of both worlds. End your meal on a sweet note with the Home-Baked Apple Crumble. Topped with walnut crumble and vanilla ice cream, the freshly baked apple crumble is the perfect finale for a sumptuous feast. (Jun 2021)

After all, better food is always betterer with the betterest people. Everyone wants to be happy right? For us, happiness is making others happy. It’s that simple.     Presenting an inventive menu of premium meats inspired by international cuisines, The Meathöuse is a halal steakhouse featuring a highly curated and original menu specially curated by renowned Eighteen Chefs cook, chef Benny Se Teo. Housing a comprehensive range of Western delights, indulge in a bowl of steaming hot Cream of Mushroom soup. Peppered with trio mushrooms and drizzled with truffle oil, the harmonious combination of truffle and mushrooms will definitely have you hooked. Topped with minced beef and a generous amount of sweet and spicy chilli, the All Chilli Beef Fries is a great sharing option to add to family dinners and celebratory gatherings. Alternatively, truffle fans can opt for the classic French Fries with Truffle. Ever heard of chocolate sauce as an optional topping for your burger? Here at The Meathöuse, you can choose to drench your Yin Yang Burger in a decadent glaze of delicious chocolate sauce. Slapped between fluffy brioche buns, the beef and lamb patty is sandwiched with layers of cheese and tomatoes before being topped off with a sunny side up. Sink your teeth into this hearty burger to indulge in a vibrant burst of flavours. Other equally tantalising dishes include the M Signature Aglio Olio, Ribeye Steak, Filet Mignon and more! (Jun 2021)

    All Chilli Beef Fries, Yin Yang Burger, M Signature Aglio Olio, Ribeye Steak

    Serving up well-loved Western dishes, The Rebel Bar is a quaint and cosy eatery located along Stanley Street. Casual dining is the order of the day here with the restaurant’s extensive menu of small bites and hearty brunch meals. Delight your taste buds with The Rebel Bar’s signature Hungry Rebel Beef Burger as you dig into a wonderful mix of homemade beef patty, chewy bacon and fried egg complemented by fresh romaine lettuce and tomatoes sandwiched between perfectly steamed buns. For the health conscious, you can opt for the Portobello Mushroom Burger. Made of lightly grilled portobello mushroom, the burger is garnished with caramelised onions and grilled capsicums to guarantee maximum satisfaction. The Beer Battered Fish and Chips is another long-standing favourite among customers. Served with fries, mixed greens and tartar sauce, the deep fried dory fish is covered in a rich coating of homemade beer batter. Ideal for gatherings with family or friends, The Rebel Bar offers enticing deals and platters that are great for sharing. End your meal on a sweet note with treats from the restaurant’s Dessert Platter. (Jul 2020)

    Peek behind the teal door. Nestled on Neil Road, just around the corner of Duxton is THE STORE - a resto bar inspired by speakeasys.Step inside and get transported away from the hustle and bustle of city life over an exquisite menu of dishes that are suitable for a wholesome lunch or tapas style concept that are perfect over drinks.Available daily, drop by for a quick and affordable set lunch with the multiple options provided by THE STORE's carefully crafted afternoon menu. Choose to kickstart your meal with either a Beetroot Salad or Prawn Couscous before indulging in the tasty Primavera Sandwich. Meat lovers can opt for the Street Style Hotdog which features a perfectly grilled hotdog sandwiched between a soft brioche bun. Wrap up your meal with either a Panna Cotta or Creme Brulee.Oh! Did we mention that behind the bar is Hirman, an OG in the bartending scene who has designed a unique selection of handcrafted cocktails that you won’t find anywhere else. He uses some interesting ingredients like coffee kombucha and tajin to really tingle your tastebuds.THE STORE is the perfect hideaway for that after-work escape or quaint date over tipples and tapas. We’ll see you behind the teal door. (Nov 2021)

    The Whiskey Library is one of the greatest whiskey bars in the world, housing over 1000 bottles of rare and refined award-winning whiskeys from across the globe. Set within the glamorous Vagabond Club and designed by world-renowned French designer Jacques Garcia, The Whiskey Library oozes sophistication adorned with red velvet banquettes, a unique collection of art and handcrafted furniture. Anyone and everyone are welcome to experience the art of whiskeys or explore the well-loved selection of expertly crafted cocktails. And for those looking for more, The Whiskey Library offers a membership programme that gives access to the captivating Vagabond Club experience. Lovers of creative libations will have to try The Whiskey Library's signature drink, Spice Road - a twist of an Old Fashioned that features scotch whiskey as a base, with hints of chocolate and spices like star anise, cinnamon, and cardamom for the ultimate sensorial experience. Another signature drink not to miss is the Cannery Row, a new take on a whiskey sour, featuring bourbon combined with vanilla and citrus flavours as well as a dash of red wine. Guests can look forward to the famed modern Chinese cuisine from the adjoining Singapore Icon, Yellow Pot Little India. Chef Sebastian Goh has created an ingenious offering of Chinese fare with an innovative twist made for both intimate gatherings and larger groups. Favourites include the signature BBQ Roast Duck, Fried Prawns with Bonito Aioli and the highly addictive Crispy Sichuan Chicken — all paired perfectly with The Whiskey Library's expertly crafted drinks. Bespoke elements such as artisanal ice and an international selection of the finest of cigars together with the extensive collection of whiskeys, bourbons and craft cocktails bring a truly complete and unique experience to guests of The Whiskey Library. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Cannery Row, Spice Road, Wok-seared Organic Grass-fed Beef Tenderloin, Fried Lion’s Mane Mushrooms with Avocado Puree, BBQ Roast Duck

    Here at The Winery Gourmet Bar, diners can look forward to an exclusive and intimate wine and dine experience complete with cozy private rooms and tasting rooms. Made for casual or private dates, indulge in exquisite Asian influenced cuisine alongside exotic European bites paired with an extensive selection of the finest European wines in Singapore. New to wine or perhaps already a seasoned wine drinker? Either way, The Winery Gourmet Bar has got you covered with an exciting list of wines from all over the region. Walk down the carefully curated aisles of the cozy wine cellar to unearth exquisite European wines from even the most remote locations and create shared wine memories with friends and colleagues over casual weekends or after work socials! Featuring age-old classics and refreshingly new creations, savour the variety of wine pairings available at The Winery Gourmet Bar and uncover hidden nuances in wine tasting with the restaurant’s specially crafted food pairings. Revel in the compelling variations of the differing notes of acidity and sweetness with every sip of your choice of red or white wine whilst digging into delicious fare here. Make a reservation at The Winery Gourmet Bar today to discover and unravel the secrets of Europe with every sip. (Sep 2021)

    By now, Potato Head has made a name for itself for its juicy, succulent burgers. Tuck into their decadent creations at their 80-seater standalone burger bar located in Quayside. Helmed by executive chef Adam Penney, the burgers here are made from scratch using only premium European cheeses and two cuts of grass-fed Australian beef for the patties. The sauces are also made in-house, so you can expect to find quirky combinations on the menu here! Sink your teeth into exclusive creations like the Bun DMC, with a unique homemade watermelon rind relish stacked on barang goweng (fried shallots) on well-toasted buns with melted cheese. Or, go all out with the Red Man Burger, a nod to Singapore’s iconic dish beef rendang. Here, the beef cheeks are sous vide for 24 hours until meltingly tender, slathered with a sweet and spicy blend of gula melaka and over 10 spices that has been lovingly stewed for two hours. Housemade virgin coconut mayo is added to this concoction,sandwiched between two coconut buns. There’s no denying the burgers at Three Buns Quayside are decadent — come hungry and relish every moment! (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Da Cheese Burger, Red Man Burger, Truffello, Seng Dog, Miso Dirty Fries

    Situated at Labrador Park, possibly one of the most beautiful downtown green spaces on the island, The Three Peacocks is a gorgeous open air barbecue restaurant spread out across a gorgeous lawn in the middle of the park, sheltered by chic architectural structures and lit at night by a scattering of lanterns. On offer is a menu that sprawls across Western, Korean, and Thai cuisines, the strong aromas of each intermingling in the air. You get to choose your meat of choice, and have it dressed with a sauce of your choice, from buttery French sauces to punchy Korean glazes. But before that, warm up the stomach with some appetizers, like fragrant Tom Yum Soup, crunchy Potato Skins, or flaky Kimchi Pancakes. Then choose a plate of carbohydrates to support the oncoming barbecue onslaught. There’s Korean and Thai stir-fried noodles and fried rice, ranging from oil-slicked Glass Noodles to aromatic Pineapple Rice, as well as simple pastas like Pesto and Mac & Cheese. Then it’s time for the main event. There’s a premium grilled seafood menu that features Boston Lobster, Squid, Grilled Oyster, and Tiger Prawns, with sauce options like Lemon Garlic Butter, Creamy Salted Egg, Tom Yum, and Korean Garlic sauce. There’s also grilled meats, like tender Ribeye Steak, unctuous Beef Cheek, perfect done the French way with a vigorous searing and a lick of jus. Then there’s marinated Korean-style beef and pork for that hit of Korean barbecue, a mix of spicy and caramelized flavours, and the occasional hit of black pepper. Options abound at this gorgeous barbecue restaurant, a true step up from low-fi East Coast Park barbecues. The premium meats and elegant sauces will give you a fantastic gourmet experience, while you enjoy the chill and laid-back open-air environment that’s the best way to enjoy Singapore’s weather. (Dec 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “The Three Peacocks is a hidden gem… Surrounded by lush greens , away from the hustle and bustle of the city, this is the go-to place to chill or for a simple dinner.” -Singapore Beauty.com

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tom Yum Soup, Potato Skins, Kimchi Pancakes, Pineapple Rice, Stir-Fried Glass Noodles, Mac & Cheese, Grilled Oyster, Boston Lobster, Beef Cheek
