• ABOUT

    If you’ve only ever been down Upper Thomson Road for the pratas, you’re missing out on the treasure trove of little indie bakeries, cafes, and restaurants tucked away in the small streets along the stretch. Thus Coffee is one of them, a specialty coffee joint in a charming residential area along Jalan Kuras, just a couple of minutes away from the Lower Peirce Reservoir Park. The space isn’t massive, but it’s very chic, done up with handsome wooden touches and a brushed concrete floor that announces its serious-coffee intentions. They’ve got an in-house roast and blend that they use for their coffees which promises a robust pick-me-up, but beyond a cuppa the food here is also to die for. Think subtle variations on the all-day breakfast menu, including treats like their in-house breakfast plate that features sous vide eggs on a fluffy muffin, paired with apple cider sausage, back bacon, mushrooms, and baked beans. Or the Salmon & Kale Toast, a fluffy brioche toastie topped with smoked salmon and avocado, creamy eggs, and a spinach and feta salad. Lunch plates here take a heartier turn, with numbers like the Korean-inspired Chicken Cutlet Jyolmeon, chewy Gochujang-drenched noodles topped with a crispy chicken cutlet and sunny side up egg. The pasta here isn’t your garden variety stuff either, with punchy plates like the Linguine Puttanesca, bursting with ripe olives, piquant capers, chunky tomatoes, and briny anchovies. No self-respecting millennial outfit is complete with a grain bowl, and here the Wagyu Beef Grain Bowl takes pride of place, featuring tender beef atop a mélange of pearl barley and quinoa for some good artery-clearing health benefits and lots of toothsome flavour. Come for the mid-day coffee but stay for the mid-day snack and maybe dinner at this charming, Instagram-worthy haunt in one of Singapore’s most idyllic little neighbourhoods. (Feb 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Thus Breakfast, Salmon & Kale Toast, Chicken Cutlet Jyolmeon, Wagyu Beef Grain Bowl

    This cosy little spot is the perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. From the beautiful art on the walls to the homely dishes on the menu, everything about this spot is comforting, making it the perfect place to unwind after a long day. The menu items here are healthy dishes meant to feed the stomach and soul. The Asian Prawn & Quinoa Salad is a light dish of spiced shrimp tossed with avocado, greens, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and sprinkled with quinoa pearls. The tender shrimp and crisp greens make for a great texture combination, and the cucumber and tomatoes give the dish a fresh flavour that is hard to pass up. Diners after something more than a salad will enjoy the Salmon & Kale Stir Fry. Made with a generous serving of salmon tossed in kale with chilli and garlic, this dish is simple, spicy, and delicious. For something a little heartier, opt for the Chorizo & Kale Broth. A rich stew of spiced Italian sausage, sprigs of kale, and juicy tomatoes, this is the perfect pick-me-up on a cold day, and is best enjoyed warm. The ever-popular burger is a crowd favourite, and for good reason. Made with a juicy meat patty and thick cut fries, this dish will satisfy all your cravings. (Nov 2018)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Part of the heritage of Raffles Hotel Singapore since 1892, the newly restored Tiffin Room returns and continues to celebrate the flavours of North India with an elevated dining experience featuring a resplendent interior, new delights and an extensive selection of vegetarian specialities. Newly refreshed, Tiffin Room showcases a reinstatement of wooden floorboards reminiscent of its décor in the early 1900s. It presents an extended menu featuring authentic specialties from every main region of North India like Kashmir, Lucknow, Punjab and Rajasthan. The century-old restaurant also delivers classic Indian brews and paired beverages as well as an interactive dining experience with tableside service by chefs, perfected with freshly ground spices.For lunch, guests can enjoy an exquisite array of delicacies with a tantalising buffet accompanied with pass around delights or opt for the Thali Experience, a flavourful curation of signature Tiffin Room highlights served on a classic silver plate known as a thali. Dinner at Tiffin Room is an a la carte affair and includes the heart-warming, customisable Mera Dabba (literally means "my box" in Hindi). Inspired by the home-cooked meals thoughtfully prepared by Indian families for their loved ones and packed into tiffin boxes, Mera Dabba offers a charmingly elevated North Indian meal experience presented in custom-made copper tiffin boxes and complemented with comforting curries, delicately-flavoured rice, tandoori breads, chutneys and pickles.

  • SG-CLEAN CERTIFIED

    We are pleased to inform you that Raffles Hotel Singapore has been given the SG-Clean certification - an initiative by the Singapore government, led by the Singapore Tourism Bureau to award destinations that have met detailed and thorough precautionary measures. Please note that during your visit with us, all our dining venues will be practising these safe and enhanced precautionary measures, in accordance with guidelines from the government. We thank you in advance for your understanding and patience.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Jhinga Kebab, Nalli Roganjosh, Makhana Paneer, Chocolate Gulab Jamun

  • STREET FOOD FESTIVAL (21 APRIL TO 5 MAY)

    Exclusively from 21 April to 5 May 2022, experience a sensational Street Food Festival showcasing well-loved delights inspired by the fascinatingly diverse street food found across distinct Indian cities. Specially curated by Chef Kuldeep Negi, the multi-course menu offers both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options complemented with choice beverages and attentive tableside service amidst the grand restored interior of one of Singapore's oldest Indian restaurants.When: 21st April to 5th May 2022Time: Lunch & DinnerPrice: $88++ / $78++ Vegetarian per person (Addition to A La Carte with limited selections)Click here to view the menuMode of guarantee: Full Tokenization

    Sitting by the Singapore River is the Timbre X S.E.A, housed in a beautifully restored historical building that used to play host to Singapore’s parliamentary meetings. Nestled in the heritage district and close to the landing site of our nation’s founder, Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, Timbre X S.E.A hopes to bring the region’s music, food and drinks together. For a perfect visit to this location; order Southeast Asian inspired dishes and drinks and take it all in. Must-try dishes include Poached Black Mussels in Coconut Tom Yum Broth, Rillette of Beef Rendang on Rosti, Thai Bas Duo Pork Capellini, and Chili Crab Kueh Pie Tee. Wash the food down with exclusive Thai Mojito, Chendol Cocktail, and a great selection of draught beers and wines. To curate a one-of-the-kind Southeast Asia experience, Timbre X S.E.A will also see renowned Southeast Asia F&B brands serving up their signatures on our menu for a limited time. And on the music front having regional acts on our stage when the borders reopen! Do follow our @TIMBREXSEA on Instagram to be updated on our latest collaboration. (Oct 2020)

    Poached Black Mussels in Coconut Tom Yum Broth, Rillette of Beef Rendang on Rosti, Thai Bas Duo Pork Capellini, Chili Crab Kueh Pie Tee

    Nestled in a charming shophouse along the trendy Tanjong Katong precinct, The Tipsy Cow stands out with its white neon signboard, chill atmosphere, and stellar Italian fare that keep diners coming back for more. Featuring both an indoor and outdoor area, the intimate space is perfect for hanging out with the mates or a cosy dinner for two, so get ready to tuck into good food and knock back some affordable drinks, all while watching the season’s latest games. Titillate your taste buds with the Grilled Lamb Ribs which features olive crusted grilled lamb ribs done medium rare and elevated with a red wine glaze, enjoy a fuss-free plate of pasta with the Linguine Marinara, or get comfy with a Soup Of The Day - there are no bad options here. For some bar grub, the Chicken Fajitas should be your go-to snack while the Granchio Prawns, featuring plump, succulent prawns drizzled with a decadent crab meat sauce and served with pizza bread, comes a close second. The pizzas here never disappoint as well, and our top picks include the classic Prosciutto or the adventurous The Raj, featuring majestic portions of mozzarella, lamb, chicken, capsicum, and porcini atop a tomato base. Vegetarian? Your options are equally appealing! Wash it all down with your favourite tipples, and the night will surely go down in the books as one to remember! (Sep 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Grilled Lamb Ribs, Chicken Fajita, Granchio Prawns, Lamb Burger, Vegetarian Pizza, The Raj, Linguine Marinara

    You can literally feast all day on brunch and stunning waffles at Tittle Tattle. A 24-hour vintage cafe cum bar decked with touches of retro furnishing, Tittle Tattle exudes a 1980s vibe that is inviting and cosy. If all day breakfast is your thing, you can drop by anytime of the day to enjoy the cafe’s hearty Tittle Tattle Breakfast. A hearty breakfast platter that features a delicious mix of Italian sausages, bacon, scrambled egg and sauteed mushrooms, this is the breakfast of champions. For those hunting down more nutritious chow, Tittle Tattle offers Mr Avocado that features slices of toasted bread and smeared with avocado, crowned with a beautifully poached egg and a generous heap of greens on the side. If you’re more inclined for something sweet, you can indulge in the Tittle Tattle Disaster - A waffle topped with macarons, marshmallows, iced gem biscuits, full kinder bueno sticks and a huge scoop of ice cream, this dish will surely take you on a sugar high. Their extensive menu also features other cafe style brunch options. Other signature dishes here include the Smoked Salmon Egg Affair and Beer Battered Fish & Chips. Grab a friend or two and head on down to Tittle Tattle for a casual brunch or study date today! Bonus points for accessible powerpoints that can also keep your devices juiced up throughout your stay. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mr Avocado, Tittle Tattle Disaster, Smoked Salmon Egg Affair, Beer Battered Fish & Chips, Dinosaur Waffle, Fried Broccoli.

html:
• ABOUT

    Chic, minimalist, and cosy, TOMO Izakaya captures the essence of a traditional izakaya while injecting youthful fun in both the restaurant's decor and food. Relax and unwind over sake, wines and spirits as you tuck into delicious Japanese cuisine at TOMO Izakaya. Air-flown twice weekly from Tokyo’s famed Tsukiji Market, all the ingredients showcase the best of the seasons. The izakaya offers small plate dishes such as yakitori, sushi and karaage. Crunchy and addictive, the deep fried Gobo Chips are great bar snacks. Another delightful small plate is the Aspara Maki. Wrapped in pork belly, the grilled asparagus is full of flavour. A welcome twist on the usual grilled salmon with cheese, the Salmon Wasabi Mayo uses the punch of wasabi to give the grilled salmon an extra kick. For something light and more refreshing, have a bowl of Ochazuke. With a choice of salmon, plum or spicy roe, the Japanese-style porridge is the perfect comfort dish on rainy days. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Gobo Chips, Aspara Maki, Salmon Wasabi Mayo, Ochazuke

Air-flown twice weekly from Tokyo’s famed Tsukiji Market, all the ingredients showcase the best of the seasons.The izakaya offers small plate dishes such as yakitori, sushi and karaage. Crunchy and addictive, the deep fried Gobo Chips are great bar snacks. Another delightful small plate is the Aspara Maki. Wrapped in pork belly, the grilled asparagus is full of flavour. A welcome twist on the usual grilled salmon with cheese, the Salmon Wasabi Mayo uses the punch of wasabi to give the grilled salmon an extra kick.For something light and more refreshing, have a bowl of Ochazuke. With a choice of salmon, plum or spicy roe, the Japanese-style porridge is the perfect comfort dish on rainy days. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aburi Wagyu Onsen Tamago, Salmon Mori, Salmon Oyako Volcano, Temaki, Sashimi Kaisou Salad

  • ABOUT

    Combining a hot pink interior with bright graffiti and a colourful menu that transports you back to Bangkok's streets, the only time you’ll be feeling Tongue Thai’d is when you’re figuring out what to order. Serving up an extensive drinks menu, choose from thirst-quenching refreshments like their Freezie Blue Lagoon or sip on sparkling wine to enjoy a boozy time at Tongue Thai’d. Pairing perfectly with delicious authentic Thai dishes, Tongue Thai’d ensures diners are fed and satiated with every order. For starters, go for their Glass Noodle Salad with Vermicelli. A classic Thai appetizer, this dish is spicy, with a hint of sour from the lime drizzled on top. Perfect for sharing with a sparkling drink, this dish is the perfect appetite whetter. For meat options, go for their signature Thai Basil Pork. A classic dish that’s great paired with a steaming bowl of fragrant rice. This spicy and savoury dish is comforting food for the soul. Diners looking for a more unconventional Thai dish can go for their Thai Style Vongole Spaghetti. Tongue Thai'd's vongole pasta is fusion food done right. It combines strong Thai flavors with a brothy, savoury sauce. Other fusion kinds of pasta to try are their Angel Hair with Basil Minced Pork and Lime, combining classic favourites in this hearty meat dish. The Signature Seafood Tom Yum Lava Omelette on Rice is a classic dish that's visually appealing and satiating to share among friends. Craving for Hot Pot? Tongue Thai'd's Hot Pot is packed with delicious ingredients, including fresh river prawns, sliced pork, and a rich spicy broth. At Tongue Thai'd, diners can enjoy a hip & funky ambiance along with delicious Thai dishes. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Glass Noodle Salad with Vermicelli, Thai Basil Pork, Thai Style Vongole Spaghetti, Angel Hair with Basil Minced Pork and Lime, Signature Seafood Tom Yum Lava Omelette

html:
• ABOUT

    If you’re looking for a bar to have a private tete-a-tete, head to Tonic. Nestled in a quiet corner of the hotel’s main lobby, the soothing soundtrack and leather banquette seats are perfect to unwind and sit back with a glass of craft gin and tonic. The drinks menu puts the spotlight on artisanal, small-batch gins from around the world. For instance, The Mom cocktail is a sweet and refreshing drink to start. Here, a berry-infused English gin is mixed with East Imperial Old World tonic for an easy tipple. The Ink Dry Gin is sure to impress with its pretty purple hue, paired with yuzu-flavoured tonic water for that splash of bright, citrus flavour. For savoury bites to go with your cocktail, Tonic serves up staple bar bites such as Buffalo Wings with scrumptious dips and Truffle Fries. If you fancy a little indulgence, try the Wagyu Satay — tender cubes of delectably marbled beef are grilled to yield a smoky char, perfect with the accompanying dish of peanut sauce. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mom, Ink Dry Gin, Wagyu Satay, Buffalo Wings, Burrata

    HOLA, Welcome to TONITO Latin American Kitchen, where every bite feels like a party! The only Latin American restaurant in the east serving family-friendly Latin American inspired dishes, TONITO introduces Latin American street food and staples the likes of Mexican quesadillas, Argentinian pastas as well as Peruvian stews. From tapas for sharing to classic desserts and cocktails, TONITO welcomes diners of all ages for a fuss-free spread against the beautiful panorama of the Rain Vortex, in its vibrant and cozy eatery. TONITO Latin American Kitchen is a part of Singapore-based hospitality group, 1855 F&B, which also houses brands like The Spot, WAKANUI Grill Dining Singapore, Perch and Kam’s Roast Malaysia. (Mar 2021)

    Tonkichi serves real Japanese tonkatsu, prepared the authentic, traditional way. We have 2 kinds of tonkatsu meat—pork fillet and pork loin, all carefully selected and trimmed with the utmost care and skill. Pork fillet has the finest texture and is thought to be among the healthiest pork cuts as they are lower in fat and calories, and richer in vitamins. Good pork fillet, cooked by our expert chefs, can be cut even with just chopsticks. Our pork loin has just enough fat in it to offer a rich aroma and a great texture, every bite offering you a great taste experience. Served with rice, miso soup with Japanese pickles, and completed with an appetiser, our tonkatsu makes the quintessential perfect Japanese set meal. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Premium Rosu Katsu Set, Cheese Kasane Katsu Set, Sashimi Mori, Tonkichi Special Roll

html:
• ABOUT

    If you’re looking for culinary perfection, search no further. For us hungry diners, utter gastronomic perfection can be savoured at Tonny Restaurant, a Cantonese eatery run by chef Tonny Chan who hails from Hong Kong and honed his chops at establishments such as Sha Tin Kitchen and Dempsey’s Grand Hong Kong. Now stationed at his eponymous eating joint, Tonny serves up old-school Cantonese fare alongside innovative dishes that are just as delectable. Not only do these plates of wonder attract epicureans from across the country, but local celebrities have been seen tucking into the nosh here, as evidenced by photographs of famous faces posing for photographs with Tonny plastered across the walls. When dining at Tonny Restaurant, one mustn’t skip out on the epic Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. Made from juicy scallops, egg whites, and tasty fish roe, this dish promises to be a knockout for the senses. Then there’s the Steamed Pantin Fish which showcases Tonny’s roots in Hong Kong and Singapore. Here, this butterflied fish is topped with copious amounts of ginger paste and chilli paste on either side, and enhanced with light touches of oil and soy sauce. If you want to round off a satisfying meal on a sweet note, we suggest going for options such as the Deep Fried Banana Yam Roll or healthful Double Boiled Bird’s Nest with Brown Sugar. Craving authentic Cantonese fare? Hit up Tonny Restaurant for the real deal. (Sep 2017)

  • BUZZ

    “This is a bright, pleasant air-conditioned mid-range eatery with a good, tight menu and all the favorites you’d expect from a Cantonese kitchen.” -SG Now

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, Steamed Pantin Fish, Double Boiled Black Chicken Soup, Pan-fried Slice Foie Gras, Double Boiled Bird’s Nest with Brown Sugar, Deep Fried Banana Yam Roll

  • ACCOLADES

    The Straits Times' Asian Masters Best Asian Restaurants 2019 - Bronze Tonny Restaurant has won this award 3 years in a row from 2017 to 2019 for one of the best Asian Cantonese Restaurants in Singapore.

    Torasho Ramen & Charcoal Bar prides itself on serving one of the best Tsukemen broths in Singapore, with the perfect ratio of tonkotsu and seafood broths in a bowl. An open kitchen lets you have a peek at the magic that goes behind the scenes. Chef Sho helms the kitchen, that dishes out appetisers, ramen, robata (charcoal and wood grill), and fresh sashimi. While they uphold Japanese traditions, expect some unexpected taste twists to your palate. Truffle lovers will enjoy the addition of this umami bomb of a flavour into the Truffle Wagyu Dry Ramen, the Truffle Tonkotsu, and even in snacks such as the Truffle Edamame. Whilst slurping on springy ramen noodles and piping hot soup, have a glass or two of their hand-crafted cocktails or their unique, transparent homemade cola. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Wagyu Dry Ramen, Spicy Uni Tsukemen, Lobster Dry Ramen, Truffle Tonkotsu

  • ABOUT

    The Japanese dining scene in Singapore is extremely varied, and has prices and dishes spanning from the very affordable to the exorbitant. However, there are rarely restaurants that succeed at marrying several aspects of the spectrum together, and TORIO is one of them. Their menu combines premium ingredients to dish out delicious recipes at affordable prices. Named after the Japanese word for trio, this restaurant is dedicated to showcasing the camaraderie, contribution, and commitment of its founding partners through their dishes. The Special Sashimi is a must-try. The plate features premium ingredients like Tuna, Salmon, and Sea Urchin, as well as two kinds of white fish -- well worth the price paid, being generous on portions and taste. The meat is plump and fresh, and the slices are paper-thin, which easily absorb the flavours of the condiments they are dipped into. Prefer a hearty grab-and-go lunch? Try the Unagi Don, a rich bowl of fluffy steamed rice served with a sizeable portion of grilled Japanese eel. The fish is spongy and the sweet and salty flavour of the meat gives flavour to the fragrant, pearly rice. (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Special Sashimi, Unagi Don, Kani Miso Don, Toro Kubi Shioyaki, Chirashi

  • TAKEAWAY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways and dine-in. Takeaway Operating HoursTue-Sun: 11:45am-2:30pm, 6-10pm Closed Monday

  • ABOUT

    Offering a comprehensive and affordable menu of local Chinese seafood and street food, TOTO Seafood is set within a cosy coffee shop setting with a pet-friendly outdoor seating area. Known to plate up the most “huat” seafood and zi char in town, this lively restaurant is a pleasant hang out spot to enjoy beers, skewers and seafood with family and friends. To start off, a generous serving of the Hotplate with Homemade Sambal Sauce or Mini Octopus is the best choice to fire up an appetite before diving into the expansive variety of seafood delights on offer. A deliciously traditional take on a Singaporean delicacy, the Take Crab in Singapore is a spicy dish that features the restaurant’s very own homemade chilli crab drenched in a fragrant sauce that’s great for dipping a side of freshly fried buns in. Try with a side of Salted Egg to Egg Plant for a yummy burst of flavour — we guarantee this killer combination will have you coming back for seconds! For those who crave a steaming hot bowl of soup to go with your selected menu options, the Curry Favour and Teochew Titanic are classic zi char options you can’t leave without trying. Other noteworthy dishes include the Homecoming Prawn, Xtra Ordinary and Lalala…China Wine. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hotplate with Homemade Sambal Sauce, Take Crab in Singapore, Curry Favour, Lalala…China Wine

    Trapizza is a casual Italian eatery located on Siloso Beach, just a five-minute walk away from Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa, Singapore. The dining establishment offers a family-friendly dining experience with a menu featuring mouth-watering pastas, perfectly baked pizzas, alongside salads, desserts and creative reinterpretations of classic cocktails. The menu showcases the best of Italian comfort food while preserving some of the restaurant’s best dishes. Pizza lovers, rejoice! The thin-crust pizza at Trapizza is their claim to fame and popular with adults and children alike. The handmade pizzas are topped with fresh ingredients and sprinkled generously with cheese, creating that Instagram-worthy cheese pull. Other classic favourites on the menu include the Trapizza Linguine and Siloso Prawn Salad. (Jul 2021)

    Trattoria La Vita prides itself on serving authentic, homely Italian cuisine in a friendly atmosphere where friends and family can gather over a good meal. Located along a row of shophouses between Clarke Quay and Boat Quay, it’s difficult to miss its signature orange logo. The menu boasts a wide array of Italian favourites, from appetisers to pastas, meats, and desserts. Whet your appetite with the Burrata Cheese or the Vitello Tonnato before digging into the mains. Pasta fans will love the Pappardelle Duck Ragout and Ricotta Ravioli, while those looking for something heartier pick from a selection of grilled steaks. For dessert, sink your teeth into a decadent Tiramisu or Crème Brulee. (Apr 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Named after Chef Simone’s beloved grandmother, Trattoria Nonna Lina is an utterly charming Italian bistro tucked away on Cantonment Road that spins up homestyle cooking that is sure to please everyone in the family. You won’t miss the brightly painted facade of this eatery as this conservation shophouse is painted in the bold colours of the Italian flag, ensuring this building stands out from the rest of the block. Inside, the decor draws inspiration from the sleepy seaside town of Porto Santo Stefano, where life is simple and the fishermen bring in the freshest Mediterranean catch every evening. Rustic and comforting, Trattoria Nonna Lina’s food showcases the best of traditional Tuscan cuisine. Start with the Bruschette di Nonna Lina, made with uber-fresh chopped tomatoes and a hint of basil sitting on slices of bread. Next, get a Pappardelle della Vigna, featuring Italian sausages and a creamy sauce made using blue cheese. It may be simple, but it packs quite a punch! For a taste of coastal Tuscany, try the Cacciucco, a thick stew of various seafood cooked in homemade tomato broth. Last but not least, the majestic Bistecca Fiorentina is perfect for hungry meat-lovers. Come for the top-notch Tuscan-styled nosh, but stay for an evening of long conversations with friends with a bottle of wine or two. (Jul 2018)

    True Blue Cuisine started in late 2003 in a pre-war shophouse in the Peranakan enclave of Katong. The restaurant’s aim is to serve the best authentic Peranakan cuisine to Singapore and the world. It was set up jointly with Baba Benjamin’s mother Bibik Daisy Seah, a well respected Peranakan chef. True Blue Cuisine is the place for a good Peranakan feat - drawing locals and food lovers from all over the world. Legendary dishes are their Ngoh Hiang (Minced Chicken and Prawn meat rolls wrapped in Beancurd skin), Jantong Pisang salad (Banana Blossoms with Cucumber), Ayam Buah Keluak (Chicken stewed with Indonesian black nuts), Beef Rendang (Beef simmered in a coconut sauce/dry curry) and Kari Kepala Ikan (Whole fish head curry). True Blue Cuisine is situated beside the Peranakan museum at 49 Armenian Street, and it compliments the museum and brings to life an all-round experience of the rich Peranakan culture. (Dec 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ngoh Hiang, Jantong Pisang Salad, Ayam Buah Keluak, Beef Rendang, Kari Kepala Ikan

    Bringing casual Thai dining and mookata with a seaview, Trunk 95 At Bay has you dining with an air of sophistication amid gentle seabreeze. For diners looking for more dish-centric meals, start off with a delightful fried Golden Triangle Platter. Consisting of spring rolls, prawn fritters and thai fish cake, this sinfully indulgent dish is the perfect way to start off your meal. Dishes you can’t miss are their creamy Green Curry that’s perfect paired with a steaming bowl of rice, or their Thai Garlic Pork. Signature specialities include their Thai Basil Pork and Sambal Kang Kong, both bringing a spicy punch to your meal. Last but not least, the ultimate must-try: Signature Trunk 95 Pork Knuckle. Crispy, crackling pork knuckle with fall-off-the-bone tender meat, this dish is amazing with a cool pint of beer, or with a pitcher of refreshing Thai Milk Tea. Trunk also serves a selection of wines and spirits for diners looking for drinks. (Feb 2022)

    Brought to you by the guys at Craft & Dough. TUCA is the evolution of all the things we love, crave, and adore. The amalgamation of things that make us happy. Lovingly named after one quirky "Italian" cat, TUCA is all about Great food & Good times. Collecting the most delicious European dishes and evolving it for the delight of ourselves and our customers. Much like that kooky cat, we hunt down only the finest high-quality ingredients and authentic techniques passed down by skilled artisans to share that love of craftsmanship with our friends. TUCA has his favorite ( garlic prawns) and we hope you'll find yours too. Next time you visit us, be sure to keep an eye open for a glimpse of TUCA. (Nov 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    Love live the leisurely lunch, the decadent dinner! This is the place you just want to settle in and indulge. TUCA is not just European in food, its European in spirit. Think the 3 hour European lunch, or the drinks with friends, that turn into dinner, that turn into.... a very special evening! Beautifully lit, dark and cozy.

• PRESS RELEASE

    Brace yourself, for TungLok Heen’s new menu has arrived on the shores of Sentosa today! Specially-curated by Celebrity Chef Susur Lee with the assistance of Senior Executive Chef Ken Ling, this menu features delicacies that aim to delight your taste-buds in every way. We have retained and upgraded all the crowd-pleasers such as Char-grilled Kurobuta Pork Jowl, Braised King Prawn with Superior Soya Sauce and Roast Irish Duck; and at the same time, included delectable dishes like Oven-baked Greenly Abalone with Salt and Japanese Kombu, Double-boiled Superior Fish Bone Soup with Fish Maw and Grilled Fish with Hot and Sour Consommé. Seafood aficionados out there will be happy to know that we have added in a variety of SEAFOOD such as Steamed Crab with Egg White and Chinese Wine, Live Australian Lobster with Singapore-style Chilli Sauce and Braised King Prawn with White Peppercorn. The Steamed Wild White Sultan with Crunchy Scale snagged the limelight with its delicate pearl white flesh that boasts an exceptional sweetness. Steaming the White Sultan Fish causes its scales to stand, providing a spectacle with its unique appearance. It is high in Omega-3 oil, which is known to prevent and manage heart disease. Now, don’t deprive your palate of these exquisite dishes! Make a plan to visit us today for an unforgettable dining experience. (Jul 2019)

The brand is proud to be the First in Singapore to serve the famed Irish Duck from Silver Hill Farm traditional Peking style. (Dec 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    A culinary powerhouse, TungLok has built its stellar reputation on creating Chinese meals that define perfection. With TungLok Seafood, the restaurant empire turns its focus to creating a seafood bonanza for diners, as it welcomes hungry eaters from all corners of Singapore with its consistently delicious locally-inspired seafood. Take a swim in the culinary ocean starting with the TungLok Seafood Platter. An ultimate crustacean dream, this impressive platter is practically overflowing with cuts of bluefin tuna, salmon, fresh oysters drizzled with chilli sauce, poached prawns, and braised baby abalone. The Fish Maw Broth with Four Treasures is a soup that’s sure to garner the approval of your health-conscious mother or grandmother, as it is packed with rich proteins and nutrients that will boost your immune system. Other perennial favourites include the super-shiok Black Pepper Crab. Sautéed with a homemade concoction of black pepper and fresh peppercorns, this highly-acclaimed crab dish is so fingerlicking good you’ll be coming back for more. With a seating capacity of 300, TungLok Seafood at The Arena Country Club is a fitting venue for large parties such as wedding anniversaries or birthday celebrations. So don’t waste your time and energy trawling through an ocean of mediocre seafood restaurants. TungLok Seafood will be your perfect culinary catch – that’s our promise! (Jul 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    “TungLok Seafood is also known for some of the finest Singapore-style seafood dishes – be sure to try them!” –Women’s Weekly

• ABOUT

    Tunglok Signatures has long been synonymous with excellent traditional Chinese cuisine, the go-to place for family celebrations and birthdays. Regardless of which outlet you visit in Singapore, you can be assured that each exquisite morsel on your plate has been carefully planned by a team of chefs who really understand the nuances of Chinese cooking and are willing to take risks as they push the boundaries for a better dining experience. Indeed, Tunglok has a way of taking the most basic of Chinese dishes and ramping up its flavour and style quotient. Take the Tung Lok Flaming Fortune Chicken for instance. The wedding banquet staple, roast chicken, has been updated in spectacular style. It arrives at your table wreathed in flame, and if that's not enough spectacle, its taste doesn’t disappoint with its plump and juicy flesh. Another poultry dish, the Roast Irish Duck, is made using only the best Irish Duck from Silver Hill Farm. If you ever thought the Irish were only known for four-leaf clovers and leprechauns, you might want to add duck to your list. The flesh of the bird is so juicy and flavourful that you wonder what magic happens in the farm and in the Tunglok Signatures kitchen. (Aug 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Flaming Fortune Chicken, Roast Irish Duck, Chilled Australian Lobster with Icy Salad served with Fresh Fruits, Pan-fried Norwegian Salmon with Mixed Salad

• ABOUT

    Tea drinking has been an important aspect of Chinese tradition for many occasions to connect families and friends. It encompasses many values such as respect and reciprocation. With that, TungLok Teahouse re-creates the convivial atmosphere where families can gather and relieve yesteryears while sipping and chatting over a cup of good tea. Complementing the variety of tea is a range of exquisitely handmade Dim Sum ‘Made on the spot, Steamed to order’ such as Nourishing Red Dates Cake and Baked Barbequed Pork Bun. Authentic Chinese favourites and Teochew cuisine are also available for those who prefer a fuller meal like Four Cups Soya Chicken, Braised Patin Fillet with Roast Pork, Bamboo Shoot, Mushroom and Garlic and Wok-fried Beef 'Hor Fun' with Pork Lard. TungLok Teahouse is also the rst Chinese restaurant to launch the automated tray delivery system. (Dec 2021)

    With its unobtrusive signboard and simple décor, it’s easy to dismiss this hole-in-the-wall eatery but, if nothing else, the mouthwatering smells wafting from the entrance and al fresco tables packed with people should hint at the delicious nosh you’re missing out on! Rather than pepper their menu with a variety of different offerings, Two Blur Guys beams their laser focus onto producing excellent gourmet burgers. So you can chow down on offerings like Duck Rillette, Prime Beef with Portobello, and Pulled Pork, safe in the knowledge that they’ve been finely tuned to perfection. As Two Blur Guys says – they’re “blur about everything. Except [their] burgers”. (Feb 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “This is honest, quick, flavourful food at its best, and did I mention, they only do burgers? but damn! they do them so well.” -City Nomads

  • ABOUT

    Offering yummy bites that are out of this world, blast off into space with Two Mars Bistro out of earth bar and kitchen that is packed with a vibrant menu and an all-rounded sky rocket vibe. Grab your drinks, sit back, and enjoy the trip to another planet when you swing by this unpretentious bistro. Launch into outer space with classic bar bites such as baskets of Hashbrowns, Chicken Nuggets, Cocktail Sausages and more! Known for their famous Mars briyani, meat lovers can order the Chicken Biryani or Mutton Biryani to satiate your carnivorous cravings. Vegetarians can also join in the feast with a hearty plate of Veg Biryani. Using only meat sourced from a halal supplier, Muslims can tuck into Chicken Burger and Cheese Hotdog Buns for deliciously halal plates that make for affordable one-dish meals. Known for their well-loved egg, sausage or cheese maggi, spice lovers would definitely get a fiery kick out of these bowls of tangy noodles tossed in a fragrant in house sauce. Other chef recommendations include the Commando and Chicken Wings. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Wings, Mutton Biryani, Cheese Hotdog Bun, Commando

    TXA Gastrobar relaunches at The Alkaff Mansion with a new menu, focusing on Spanish grills and flavours. Chill out in style on our al fresco terrace, watch our chefs work their magic at the grill pod, smell the aroma curling up from the grill and enjoy this vibrant symphony for the senses! Indulge in TXA ‘Char’ Grills or flavourful specialty dishes such as Ham Croquettes, Spanish Omelette, Coca de Serrano (Spanish Flatbread), Tarta de Queso “La Vina” (Burnt Cheesecake) and more. What’s more, treat yourself to our Sangria Punch Bowl, fully customisable to your tastebuds and one of its kind in Singapore. TXA Gastrobar is the perfect buzzy hangout spot for a delicious, casual Spanish dinner and evening drinks under the night sky. (Apr 2021)

• PRESS RELEASE

    Typhoon Cafe brings the “Taste of Taiwan” to the heart of Singapore. A concept that unifies Taiwan’s unparalleled flavours, obsession for artisan fruit teas and larger-than-life desserts set in cafe-style comfort. Located along Singapore’s hottest shopping district, one no longer have to endure “” crowds and compromise sleep to get a Taiwan food fix. Typhoon Cafe is located right in sunny Singapore’s Plaza Singapura. Name inspired by “” (which also means Typhoon) is an abbreviation of “” which means Taste of Taiwan. Expect to complete an entire meal with iconic dishes from the famed food capital like Classic Lu Rou Fan, Oyster Omelette to decadently adorned Coffin Toast and flavoursome fruit teas. Going beyond the streets, Typhoon Cafe births its very own signature dishes like Australian Beef Short Rib with Wuxi Maltose Glaze and Canadian Pork Belly Stew with Preserved Vegetables; their flavors will not disappoint. Check out Typhoon Cafe’s Board Set series featuring 17 traditional Chinese meal of a “”(small side), soup of the day with a main course. Typhoon Cafe is designed to simulate ahole-in-the-wall cafe along Taiwan’s quaint Fujin Cafe Street, the casual unpretentious restaurant is perfect for any time of the day from quick lunches for student/professionals to afternoon high teas and even after-work casual dinners with family and friends! (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Classic Lu Rou Fan, Oyster Omelette, Canadian Pork Belly Stew with Preserved Vegetables, Typhoon Pavlova, San Bei Chicken, Tropical Passion Fruit Tea, Souffle Stackers

  • ABOUT

    Feed your wanderlust with Typhoon Cafe. With its first along Orchard so successful, this Taiwanese concept is now making waves at the Kallang Wave Mall. Bringing Taiwanese favourites and the comforting taste of home-cooked meals, Typhoon Cafe is ready to catch the hearts of the easties of Singapore. Boasting an extensive menu, you will be spoilt for choice with every category. For starters, go for their signature savoury Typhoon Momofuku Buns with melt-in-your-mouth tender pork belly, or try out their crispy Oyster Omelette with generous helpings of fresh oysters. Warm yourselves up on cold days with a comforting bowl of Crab Meat Broth with Glass Noodles, or replenish your inner ‘qi’ with a nourishing bowl of Herbal Chicken Soup. A must-try at Typhoon is their Signature Tawainese Oyster Mee Sua with Braised Pork Intestine. Noodles, a rich broth, chewy pork intestines, and ocean-fresh oysters - all combined into a perfect steaming bowl of perfection. For heartier dishes, we would recommend their Steamed Barramundi with Shimeji Mushrooms in Hong Kong Sauce and Claypot Sauteed String Beans with Pork Intestines. The shimeji mushrooms bring a lovely crunch to firm and juicy Barramundi meat whilst the pork intestines add a delicious texture to the crunchy string beans. Our favourite way is to order them together along with a delicious steaming plate of Panko Canadian Pork Chop Egg Fried Rice to share. And last but not least, indulge yourselves with a beautiful plate of Souffle Stackers with Berry Ice Cream and Strawberry Cheese Sauce for a visually appealing yet delightfully sweet end to your meal. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Typhoon Momofuku Buns, Crab Meat Broth with Glass Noodles, Steamed Barramundi with Shimeji Mushrooms, Signature Tawainese Oyster Mee Sua with Braised Pork Intestine

html:
• ABOUT

    The TungLok group never ceases to impress, and with Tong Le Private Dining, they have set the bar high for world-class fine Chinese dining. Here’s a peerless experience for any occasion. Sprawled across two expansive levels of the OUE Tower, the space somehow effortlessly manages to be both luxurious yet intimate and cosy at the same time. Should you need that extra privacy, Tong Le offers 11 private rooms, seating from two to 22 diners. What’s more, this revolving restaurant promises stunning 360° views of the Marina Bay skyline. Using only the best ingredients from round the world, the stellar dishes boast of intricate flavours, yet evokes the familiar taste of home. The interesting twist, though, is that these timeless Chinese dishes are reinvented by award-winning chefs to blend contemporary flavours into the traditional fare. The pre-fixed menus also change every fortnight to keep things fresh. Should you have any dining requirements though, Tong Le is able to tailor your menu upon prior request. For an elevated dining experience, Tong Le Private Dining is undoubtedly your top choice. (Nov 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Each course is served individually at a pace to suit the diner. Poetic nuances in the four menus heighten anticipation of the meal to come, especially for diners who read Chinese characters. There might be, for example, exquisite braised cave bird’s nest with sweet king fish maw in an aromatic golden saffron broth.” -SG Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Bird’s Nest in Chicken Consomme, Fairy Duck of Confucian Mansion, Buddha Jumps over the Wall, Steamed Halibut with Kimchi

html:
• ABOUT

    “Un Yang Kor Dai” means anything goes, and pretty much summarises the story of this restaurant. Founded by four friends with varying expertise, this restaurant specialises in authentic Thai cuisine and is modelled after the communal dining restaurants of Thailand. The first overseas outpost of this popular Thai restaurant specialises in Thai classics, and also brings us a variety of new dishes that are equally as tempting. The Issan Spicy Grilled Pork Neck Fried Rice is one of the popular menu items, and features buttery rice stir-fried in a mix of spices and topped with tender pork neck meat. The richness of the pork meat combined with the fragrant rice makes for a filling meal. Another unique menu item is the Minced Pork Dip In Preserved Soy Bean And Coconut Milk Served With Rice Crackers. The tender pork and coconut together is a deliciously sweet combination, and is tempered by the briny flavour of preserved soybean. For something a little lighter, opt for the Steamed Whole Sea Bass In Spicy Lime Sauce. The tangy and spicy sauce combined with the tenderness of the steamed fish is irresistable. Enjoy this dish with a bowl of steamed rice, or dig into it on its own. (Oct 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pen Laos Signature Grilled Chicken, Khao Niew Dum, Stir-fried Lobster with Salted Egg Sauce, Phad Thai Tom Yum with Seafood

    UNA, previously at One Rochester, will be reopening its doors in May 2019. Now housed at Level 2 of The Alkaff Mansion, the modern and romantic restaurant has returned with its past signature items (i.e suckling pig, selection of Paellas, Spanish grills, etc) and is now moving towards a renewed emphasis on Basque Cuisine.  Through a strategic partnership with Basque Culinary Institute,  UNA will partner producers and culinary associations from the Basque region to bring the best of Basque Cuisine and culture to Singapore. (May 2019)

• ABOUT

    Having been in business for over a century, and having recently received a Bib Gourmand, you’d think the people at Miyagawa would know their stuff, and you’d be absolutely right. With 20 outlets in Japan, this is the first overseas outpost of the beloved unagi franchise. Famed for their expert grilling techniques and secret in-house sauces, this unagi restaurant is a must-visit for diners who love fine Japanese dining. The Unagi here is served in three different styles, namely: Hitsumabushi - where the eel is placed over a bed of rice and served with three condiments, Seiro Mushi, which is served with Hokkaido rice, egg, and a sweet sauce, and Mamushi Donburi, which is served with Japanese yam, mentaiko, kinshi eggs and onsen egg. The latter two dishes are unique to the Singaporean incarnation of the restaurant, while the former is a signature dish available at all outlets. The unagi for all three dishes is marinated in a spice mixture made with ingredients directly imported from Tokyo before being steamed, then subsequently grilled - just as they do at all outlets across Japan. Whether you’re an unagi connoisseur or just a fan of seafood, the wallet-friendly prices, intimate dining environment, and exquisite dishes here will surely entice you to visit more than once! (July 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hitsumabushi, Seiro Mushi, Mamushi Donburi

• ABOUT

    Uncle Leong Seafood is a popular and laidback destination for all those seafood comforts you crave. With a pleasant waterfront view and accommodating dining room, Uncle Leong's is aimed at making diners feel at home. After all, a hearty meal of Chinese seafood delicacies is a family tradition for most of us, and the next best thing to home cooked, is the variety of delectable treats at Uncle Leong's. Here, shellfish are sourced as fresh as possible, and a variety of sizes are available for diners to choose from. Along with the traditional Chilli Crab and Bee Hoon that's long been a signature of this seafood institution, Uncle Leong's features several other delightful concoctions that are worth a try. The Shimmering Sand Crab Delight offers a particularly savoury sauce and pleasing crunchy texture that's often missing in crab dishes. Speaking of crunch, the Gold Coast Prawn amps up the cereal recipe, with deliciously plump crustaceans in a spiced mix of golden, crispy topping. For the carnivores, the Guinness Pork Ribs is a favourite, with thick, mahogany sauce gaining tons of caramelised flavour from the distinctive beer, a perfect match for the meaty pork ribs. Made for sharing and family style enjoyment, Uncle Leong Seafood should be on every seafood fan's must-try list! (Mar 2015)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup, Shimmering Sand Crab Delight, Gold Coast Prawn, Guiness Pork Rib

    Draped in quirky crab regalia is a quaint little seafood cove doling out the best of crab, fish, prawns, and more! Uncle Leong Signatures in Punggol is simple seafood done exceptionally well. The menu has it all, from traditional favourites to unique renditions, so ordering one of everything is a must!The family-style concept is perfect for those groups looking to try a little bit of everything, with items like their Shimmering Sand Crab - also their claim to fame - being a true delight. The mesmerizing Claypot Crab Bee Hoon Soup is a personal favourite, and we've come to learn the hard way that one order is never enough. The broth is simmered for hours which makes for an extremely flavourful stock, and a dish we really begrudgingly share with friends and family - it's just that good! (Mar 2016)

    Bringing food alive with delicate care and masterful techniques, Unkai Sushi offers fine Japanese cuisine with elegance and flair. Offering premium sushi that's expertly prepared before your very eyes with an almost theatrical performance, Unkai Sushi offers an Omakase menu at three different price points based on the seasonal best. Serving a regular menu as well, Unkai’s donburi menu is one to fall in love with. Go for umami bombs like their Salmon and Salmon Roe Don that’s full of fresh salmon goodness, or try the Pork Cheek Rice Bowl, which has slices of pork cheek seared to perfection with a gooey onsen egg to top it off. Sashimi at Unkai is a luxurious experience, complete with a unique plating that frames each piece of seafood, creating a visual and sensory feast. Go for their Yama set which features premium seafood like Toro and Hotate to have a little bit of everything. For Sushi sets, try the Maguro Sushi Set to enjoy premium cuts of Tuna along with seared goodness. A homage to this delicious protein, this set is exquisite and perfect for any tuna lover. For variety, go for the Kaisen set that has fresh slices of sashimi elegantly shaped over premium Japanese rice. The perfect way to end your fine dining experience at Unkai is with a bowl of creamy Sea Salt Ice Cream. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salmon and Salmon Roe Don, Pork Cheek Rice Bowl, Yama, Maguro Sushi Set, Kaisen Sushi Set

    UOUO is the latest venture from the people behind Yakiniku-Oh. Located at Sunshine Plaza, deal-hunters will be delighted to find this hole in the wall dining establishment. UOUO offers the freshest fish from Japan to customers at affordable prices. Consisting of a bar counter on one side and dining tables on the other, this cosy joint in the heart of town is extremely accessible, and yet, also allows for some privacy, making it the perfect place for a quick lunch with friends. For those who love hearty meals, try the Chicken Katsu Curry Rice. Sure to fill you up, the curry is thick and filling, while the chicken katsu is crispy and satisfying. Other standouts include the Cheese Curry Salmon. This combination consists of a hearty and delicious dish, with melted cheese drizzled over a thick slice of salmon. UOUO also offers set lunches that allow diners to enjoy a main, a hot bowl of salmon miso soup, a refreshing salad, as well as green tea that’s refillable for all customers. (Jan 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chicken Katsu Curry Rice, Cheese Curry Salmon, UOUO Fresh Fish Assorted

• ABOUT

    Stepping into this intimate dining space, you’re immediately enveloped by ambient lighting and neutral tones in different textures. Exposed brick walls, sakura woods, and simple fabric chairs give the space a warm vibe but doesn’t overwhelm – an excellent way to let the wagyu-centric dishes shine.Ushidoki’s kaiseki dinners are prepared by Chef Hirohashi Nobuaki, and you can choose different types of omakase sets. You’ll probably skip the 12-course menu if you’re not famished, but a wagyu beef lover would well be tempted to give it a shot. There’s wagyu salad, a luxuriously prepared wagyu sukiyaki, and 3-kind wagyu sashimi moriawase where chef picks include wagyu wrapped around uni (sea urchin) and oyster topped with wagyu. The meat is Ozaki wagyu beef – a big deal since there’s only one farm in Japan that sells wagyu under this name – and finding a restaurant serving the same Ozaki beef is incredibly rare.If you’re looking for quality dishes that revolve around premium beef and done in Japanese style, book early for Ushidoki – especially since they claim to serve the whole cow in one course. (Dec 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    Before the meal, if anyone had posited that a sake-cup-sized “bowl” of wagyu beef chirashi, topped with shiso flowers, shoyu powder and a piece of kombu in the silhouette of a cow would have been enough, we would have said: “You’re mad.” We’ve now changed our tune to: “You’d be mad to not try this.” -The Peak Magazine

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Steamed Egg Custard with Minced Beef Thick Soup, Char-Grilled Ozaki Beef Sirloin served with Green Salad, “Rosanjin” Style Beef Sukiyaki with Soft Boiled Egg & Truffle

    Nestled within the grandeur structure of OUE Tower is USHIO. Its name is inspired by the pristine water that separates its location and Marina Bayfront translates to “tide”. In the same fashion, it sees the necessity to go on a relentless pursuit to ride the waves of opportunity and trends.Home to Japanese-style charcoal grilled delicacies alongside creative sharing plates - a la “Japanese tapas”, the creations boasts originality that is rejuvenated with a contemporary touch. Within the menu also includes an extensive range of artisanal sakes that are meticulously selected from major prefectures in Japan.Step inside and be transported into a world of sophistication. The interior features modern Ukiyo-e art paintings that breathe life into the sleek wood panels that accentuate the walls. Guests are welcome to rest in the arms of vibrance within the dining area or soak in the tranquility that the view brings at our islanders lined up outdoors.A hidden gem that brims liveliness coupled with elegance and precision, USHIO welcomes you on an escapade to an unforgettable Izakaya experience. (Dec 2021)

• ABOUT

    Uya may have opened its doors at Wheelock Place just recently, but it has served discerning diners for more than four generations back in Japan. What it does best is the exquisite, perfectly grilled traditional unagi and Uya aims to offer up its authentic rendition of the Japanese delicacy at affordable prices. The eels are carefully selected and this commitment to quality and freshness shows from the crispy, fluffy, and creamy unagi. In fact, the tare, or sauce, is made using Uya’s highly treasured secret recipe that has been passed down through the generations. The eel is delivered live from Japan and stored behind the kitchen before they are prepared and grilled daily. The main star here’s definitely the Hitsumabushi served with condiments, broth, soup, and pickles. The best way to savour the different flavours is simply to divide the unagi rice into four portions and enjoy it with some condiments, with the dashi broth and condiments provided, on its own, or any way you like! Different flavours come through with every quarter, making for a delightful culinary experience that’s truly exciting. No part of the eel goes to waste, so don’t forget to try the Kimoyaki (grilled liver) and the Hone Senbei (Bone Crackers) - they taste as delicious as they sound intimidating. Don’t pass up on this gem even if you don’t enjoy unagi. Dishes such as the Rare Wagyu Rice Bowl, the Sashimi Moriawase, and Oyster Tempura will also give you plenty reason to return! (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hitsumabushi, Grilled Eel with Salt, Sashimi Moriawase, Crispy Bone, Liver Ponzu

  • TRIPADVISOR TRAVELLERS' CHOICE AWARD WINNER 2020

    Doling out zesty and delicious Korean-Mexican fusion fare isn’t an easy feat but the guys over at Vatos Urban Tacos make it seem effortless. With all three owners having roots in either California or Texas, and growing up on true-blue Mexican eats, it’s safe to say they know a thing or two about the flavour explosion the cuisine brings with it. A quick glance at Vatos’ “Seoul-Mex” menu and you’ll know exactly what we mean. They dish out masterful fusion creations like the hefty Kimchi Galbi Grilled Cheese. Pieces of marinated Galbi short rib - bearing a moreish taste that comes from properly grilled meat - are sandwiched between slices of sourdough bread. Sounds simple? It's anything but. Each bite is a veritable bomb of umami, with Mexican cheese and savoury fried kimchi lending their own punchy kick. The sandwich itself is pretty filling so if you prefer a slower pace, we recommend going for a range of their popular tacos. From Baja Fish to Chimichurri Chicken, these are the perfect portable snacks. Finally, no visit is complete without Kimchi Carnitas Fries plus a basket of Honey Tequila Chicken Wings to go with one of Vatos' signature margaritas, so be sure to order one (or two) of each before you head out! (Aug 2018)

    Serving dishes that pay homage to Singapore’s unique flavours, Vibe Bistro brings good vibes and good food to the table. For mains, you should try their Pork Cutlet Rendang or Chinchalok Steak. The crispy pork cutlet is served with fragrant steamed rice and a special blend of rendang sauce that brings the heat and enhances the flavour of the juicy cutlet. Their Chinchalok Steak is grilled to perfection and served with a spicy, tangy sauce with a side of pickles and mashed potatoes, making this a hearty meal that’s deliciously satiating. For a dish that has a unique take on local flavours, try the Dry Bak Kut Teh. The pork ribs are seared in a homemade bak kut teh gravy and served on a bed of rice. It’s savoury, delicious and full of peppery goodness. For something meat-free, go for their Meatless Burger that’s served with cheese and guacamole on fluffy buns. For a boozy experience, go for a cool pint of Singapore Lager to pair. Looking for a taste of the ocean? Go for their Laksa Salmon - seared salmon with laksa gravy served with a side of mashed potatoes and greens. At Vibe Bistro, you can choose from a wide selection of alcohol to match your dish, and the Assam Delight is the perfect cocktail to pair with the Laksa Salmon with its citrussy flavours. The Pearsion and Gingertini are two other must-try cocktails. To end off your meal, go with Bola Bananas for their banana doughnuts with milo dinosaur and condensed milk hazelnuts for a sweet and indulgent finish. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Cutlet Rendang, Chinchalok Steak, Dry Bak Kut Teh, Meatless Burger, Laksa Salmon

    Nestled in Tanjong Pagar, Victorian Bistro is a cozy bistro with great brunch options and good coffee. Rise and shine for breakfast sets such as Toast with Scrambled Egg, Mini Benedict and Toast with Avocado. Healthy and filling, these dishes are also pocket-friendly. The all-day menu boasts pasta options such as Prawn Aglio Olio Pasta and the classic Carbonara. Our pick? The Chilli Crab Pasta, with mouthfuls of sweet and spicy crabmeat. Add-ons are also available at reasonable prices. Brunch lovers will be happy to know that Victorian Bistro's all-day menu also includes Baked Eggs and the Salted Eggs Benedict. The latter comes served with grilled prawns, poached eggs and drenched in salted egg sauce. The Baked Eggs are customisable with a choice of sausage, salmon or bacon mixed with homemade baked beans and mozzarella. (Mar 2020)

    At the downright lovely Vineyard at HortPark, spend the day dining among the lush greenery of HortPark and listening to birds as they serenade you while you graze over your meal. Be swept away the minute you step through the eatery’s doors, with its overhung foliage, beautifully aged-wood tables, and minimalist decor that will make you feel like being in the provincial countryside. Sporting a winsome French-Italian menu, this dining destination prides itself on its farm-to-table concept, scouting for produce and ingredients such as quail, frog legs, and fish right from our very own doorstep. For instance, one showstopper is its Whole Fried Local Quail that comes accompanied with a rich plum and berries compote and a side of crispy kale. The Walnut Crusted Bull Frog is another stellar option, highlighting frog legs from a Jurong farm paired perfectly with a teriyaki-sesame dressing. Then end the meal on a tangy citrusy note guaranteed to perk up the taste buds. For that, we love the Lemon Lava cake that goes down smooth with fresh vanilla chantilly cream. Romantic and dreamy, the Vineyard at HortPark has all the makings of a garden wonderland, complete with beautifully crafted plates that highlight the fresh produce our little red dot has to offer. (Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Nestled amidst the greenery of HortPark is Vineyard, a charming restaurant with a focus on French and Italian cuisine. Bonus point: they have a well-stocked wine cellar!” -Honeycombers

html:
• ABOUT

    Infused with local inspiration, Viva Loca serves up delectable Western, Mexican and Spanish cuisines prepared with local flair. Boasting both indoor and alfresco seating, drop by Viva Loca today to enjoy lip smacking tapas, oysters, ribs, pasta, pizza alongside the restaurant’s wide range of beer, liquor, wine, cocktails and mocktails. Feast on half a dozen of Freshly Shucked Oysters. Drizzled in mignonette sauce, the plateful of fresh catch from the ocean is juicy and succulent. Pair this refreshing appetiser with a plate of Calamari Salad. Made of mesclun, golden calamari strips and topped off with a homemade Thai sweet cilantro dressing, this delectable mix of vegetables and squid is great for those on the lookout for a nutritious yet yummy meal. For those looking to satisfy their carnivorous cravings, the Wurst Platter is the perfect combination of pork, veal and smoked cheese bratwurst, set to delight and satisfy. The Smoked Beef Burger is also a great option that is served with a generous portion of shoestring fries. Local delights menu options include the Shrimp Fried Rice, Crabmeat Fried Rice and Chicken Fried Rice. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Freshly Shucked Oysters, Wurst Platter, Smoked Beef Burger, Shrimp Fried Rice

  • href

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    VOLARE, formerly known as La Barca is now situated in the heart of Katong. A new facelift of the former, Volare is a marriage of old and new at the restaurant. Black and white contemporary design, laced with state-of-the-art diamond service top welcoming guests to a clean, sleek and comfortable place to dine in. With an open kitchen concept, guests are now able to interact with our resident Chef, Giuseppe. The proposed name “Volare”, which is also an Italian song, came from Chef Giuseppe as he shares the same hometown with the original singer – Domenico Modugno who he fondly remembers of. Volare also means “To Fly” hence the Italian National Bird, a swallow, is now part of the restaurant symbol. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fiorentina Steak, Cognilio, Antipasto, Bombette, I Lava You Chocofall

html:
• ABOUT

    VUE is a rooftop bar and grill that specialises in binchotan-grilled meats and seafood, and is home to Singapore's first outdoor spritz bar. Situated on the penthouse level of OUE Bayfront, it boasts unparalleled views of Marina Bay and the iconic Singapore skyline. With executive chef Sam Chin setting the pace on the culinary front, you can expect fusion dishes that showcase flavours of ingredients at the peak of their freshness. Start your dining experience with a few pre-dinner cocktails and canapés at the bar. The Aperol Spritz is sure to please cocktail purists, but if you're in the mood for something unique, there's a range of house creations to choose from. The Speyside Buck, with Monkey Shoulder scotch, mint, cucumber, and ginger ale, provides a refreshing kick while the Kaiser Goblet, made with Riesling, peach liqueur, whisky and soda, lends fruity notes. From the dinner menu, pick from the selection of premium charcuterie, cheese, seafood, grilled meat, and more. Be sure to try the restaurant's speciality: Binchotan-grilled A5 Emperor "Kokuou" Black Wagyu. Nothing pairs better with good food than fine wine, and VUE's wine cellar certainly doesn't disappoint, housing more than 1,000 bottles from around the world. (Nov 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    A5 Emperor "Kokuou" Black Wagyu, Crispy Scale-On Red Tilefish, Cheese Platter, Ceviche

html:
• ABOUT

    Stepping into W39 instantly lifts your spirits. From the cheery interior decorations to the delicious smells wafting from the kitchen, weekend brunch just got better. Family-and-dog-friendly, this cafe welcomes your furry pals to laze around as you enjoy your meal. Located just off West Coast Road, W39 may be a hidden gem that takes a while to get to, but it is well worth the effort. With tapas, lunch and dinner specials, as well as a mouthwatering spread of fresh cakes baked daily, there’s something for everyone here. Whet your appetite with their popular Housemade Crab Cakes. Made with juicy crab meat as well as capsicums and spring onions for an added kick, you’ll be wanting more after each bite. The addictive spicy mayo dipping sauce gives an extra flavour boost that brings out the mild sweetness of the crabmeat. One of the highlights of the menu is the BBQ Beef Brisket Sandwich -- a delicious dish made with a homemade charcoal bun encasing tender, pulled beef brisket flavoured with barbecue sauce. Smoky, decadent, and finger-licking good, this is a meal you’ll want to feature on your Instagram before you take a bite - it tastes just as good as it looks! (Mar 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Housemade Crab Cakes, BBQ Beef Brisket Sandwich, Prawn & Bacon Linguine, BBQ Chicken Leg, Poached Chicken Breast

    Casual Dining, Drinks, Romantic Dates

  • ABOUT

    Looking for the ultimate donburi experience? Touted as Singapore’s first flame-torched donburi restaurant, Waa Cow! is located in Change Alley Mall and is committed to serving good food stemming from their emphasis on quality ingredients and meticulous craft. Be spoilt for choice as you browse the restaurant’s offerings of a vast selection of signature wagyu and premium seafood bowls. For fans of truffle, the Truffle Wagyu Beef is a sumptuous feast of salmon roe and egg topped with the signature wagyu beef torched with their in-house special beef sauce. Paired with a house-made truffle sauce and drizzled with ground black truffle and champignons, this ‘trufflicious’ bowl of beef comes with a bed of fluffy Japanese rice. Complete your meal with a side of Truffle Fries for the full truffle experience. Accompanied with a truffle dip, the crispy shoestring fries taste as good as they look. A great addition to the menu, the Spicy Mentaiko Chirashi features neatly diced pieces of premium sashimi-grade seasonal seafood. Opt for the sashimi set or chicken karaage set for a filling meal. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Fries, Truffle Wagyu Beef, Spicy Mentaiko Chirashi, Kimchi Chirashi

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/waa-cow-change-alley-mall
name: Waa Cow! (Change Alley Mall)

html:
• ABOUT

    This humble eatery started out with just one outlet in the National University of Singapore, but quickly gained popularity for their delicious dishes made with the finest ingredients. This restaurant only serves premium cuts, such as the Australian Tajima Wagyu, which has a marbling score of 9, and beef from America’s Snake River Farms. You can’t go wrong with their Aburi Wagyu Beef - a bed of rice topped with 24 hour sous vide beef and a tender onsen egg drizzled with homemade beef bone sauce, this is the perfect option for a scrumptious lunch. There is even a Truffle Wagyu Beef option, which adds black truffle puree and white truffle oil to the decadent mix for an earthier flavour. Feeling fancy? Why not opt for the Ultimate Beef Sushi Experience? Available only during dinner, this exquisite option consists of six pieces of beef sushi with different flavour profiles. Whether you’re new to beef sushi or a seasoned connoisseur, you’re sure to find something you like in this dish. Seafood lovers are sure to enjoy the Mentaiko Salmon Don, a delicious plate made with sashimi-grade salmon fillet glazed with shoyu. There is also an option to add an onsen egg and tobiko to add to the flavourful dish. (Nov 2018)

  • href

  • ABOUT

    Providing a fuss-free yakiniku experience along the bustling stretch of shophouses in Tanjong Pagar, Wagyu Express by Aburiya offers a diverse selection of various cuts of beef and pork on the menu, along with a smattering of delightful side dishes. An assortment of kimchi with elements such as daikon, the Kimchi Mori is a delectable and mildly spicy dish to kickstart your meal with. Grilled over white charcoal for maximum flavour, the Wagyu Moriawase features a hearty mix of different cuts. The various cuts for the platter are the Jo Karubi, Tonbi, Jo Rosu, and Karubi. The restaurant also offers various choices of condiments such as ponzu, garlic butter, or the traditional dark soy sauce to complement the meats. A unique dish that is at the top of the must-try list here at Wagyu Express by Aburiya is the Wagyu Sukiyaki. Grilled to perfection, dip the exquisitely marbled slices of wagyu meat into egg sauce and enjoy the flavourful combination with each mouthful. Wrap up your meal with a fragrant bowl of Garlic Chahan. A simple bowl of fried rice with garlic and tender pieces of beef, this bowl is light on the palate and makes for the perfect end to a filling meal. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Kimchi Mori, Wagyu Moriawase, Wagyu Sukiyaki, Garlic Chahan

  • ABOUT

    Wagyu Jin is a prefecture-focused Wagyu omakase concept located right in the heart of Orchard Road. Led by Executive Chef Makoto Saito, this intimate restaurant features only A5 Wagyu from various Japanese prefectures such as Yonezawa, Gifu, Shiga, Miyazaki, Iwate and Tochigi on a rotational basis. Being the only concept in Singapore bringing Yonezawa beef to your table, don't miss the exclusive Yonezawa menu. Alternatively, treat yourself to the seasonal Wagyu omakase menus, featuring 6-8 courses of premium A5 Wagyu. Every dish is prepared using different techniques to bring out the best in each cut and paired with the finest seasonal ingredients to accentuate the flavours of each breed of beef, with every dish curated to be eaten with just a pair of chopsticks. Expect an exquisite meal and savour each tender morsel in a single bite. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    A5 Miyazaki Ribeye, Chateaubriand Sando, Somen, A5 Yonezawa Sumiyaki, A5 Mizayaki Teppanyaki, Udon

  • ABOUT

    An all-you-can-eat Japanese shabu-shabu restaurant in Bugis, Wagyu More was established in Hong Kong in 2014 and has since been serving a delicious assortment of the finest meats, vegetables, meatballs, sushi, drinks and desserts. Handpicked to ensure the best quality and taste, the restaurant is dedicated to serving up only premium food ingredients that are value for money. With as many as 10 varieties of soup base to choose from, diners can expect to be spoilt for choice. The soup bases offered are popular choices that add layers of flavour to the plethora of food options. To further tantalise Japanese Shabu-Shabu taste buds, Wagyu More serves premium buffet packages of Japanese A5 Wagyu Beef, Australian Wagyu Beef, Spanish Iberico Pork and Black Angus Beef for a tasty dining excursion. Apart from an all-you-can-eat menu, Wagyu More also features a soft drink bar for free flow non-alcoholic beverages. To elevate your dining experience, order from the All You Can Drink menu option for free top ups of Beer and Whisky. (Oct 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Japanese A5 Wagyu Beef, Australian Wagyu Beef

html:
• ABOUT

    Since 1988, Wah Lok at the Carlton Hotel has set the standard for fine Cantonese dining. For a restaurant of such pedigree, it exudes a tremendous amount of contemporary elegance while keeping the food fastidiously traditional. As you might expect of a Cantonese restaurant, seafood reigns high on their list of priorities, but that doesn’t mean they neglect the rest. Famous for being packed during Sunday ‘yum cha’ hours, you can also prepare your appetite for exquisite lunchtime dim sum as well as aromatic Cantonese grilled meats. The Dim Sum menu boasts all the favourites, executed with a perfectionist’s hand. Stack your table with flaky Baked Barbecued Pork Buns, delicate Steamed Glutinous Rice Dumplings, tender-centred Baked Egg Tarts, and pillowy Steamed Carrot Cake. Wah Lok does equally well in its banquet-style fare, turning out incomparable seafood with inimitable Cantonese flair. Whether it’s premium Australian King Crab, Live Abalone, Coral Trout, or Hokkaido Scallops, expect simple but effective culinary magic that will transform your chosen seafood into delicate mouthfuls of rich, oceany flavour. And if you’re looking to impress a boss or potential in-law, bring out the big guns: Chilled Foie Gras & Whole Abalone is one of the kitchen’s signatures, sure to seal any deal. Wah Lok’s reputation precedes it, and the restaurant more than lives up to its name. (Mar 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “A stalwart on the local dining scene, Wah Lok continues to maintain its reputation for its excellent Cantonese cuisine and stellar service. No surprise then that it has a loyal following, especially when it comes to its popular dim sum lunches.” -Singapore’s Top Restaurants “As the name suggests, Cantonese cuisine is the hallmark of this well-established 260-seat restaurant.” -Singapore Tatler

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Baked Barbecued Pork Buns, Steamed Glutinous Rice Dumplings, Baked Egg Tarts, Steamed Carrot Cake, Australian King Crab, Live Abalone, Coral Trout, Hokkaido Scallops, Chilled Foie Gras & Whole Abalone

  • PRESS RELEASE

    Having single-handedly changed the steak scene in Tokyo, WAKANUI Grill Dining has set their sights on replicating that success here in Singapore since their opening in 2017. From clinching one star in Wine & Dine's Top Restaurants 2018/2019 to hosting the most prestigious wine and whisky events – WAKANUI Grill Dining Singapore has upheld its rapport of quality cuts and refined dining experience in its stunning location at Marina One. Developed in Tokyo by ANZCO Foods, a New Zealand-based meat company specializing in premium-quality New Zealand beef and lamb in Tokyo, WAKANUI takes its name from the location of ANZCO’s Five Star Beef Feedlot on the coast of Wakanui, South Canterbury. The ‘stars’ of WAKANUI and the essence of the restaurant are New Zealand Ocean Beef and WAKANUI Spring Lamb, which are grilled over Japan-sourced Binchotan charcoal in the centrally-placed, open kitchen. The beef displays the perfect balance of marbling and leanness, while retaining natural juiciness and an intense beef flavour. The lamb possesses peak flavour and texture. These optimal levels of quality are achieved by the precise and careful control that ANZCO Foods exercises over every step of the production process, from start to finish. The restaurant also showcases the best of New Zealand produce, including seasonal seafood and hand-picked wines. (Jul 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wakanui Spring Lamb Chop, Hot Smoked Salmon, WAKANUI Selection Board, Pavlova

    An authentic Japanese BBQ restaurant that offers a wide selection of premium quality meats grilled to perfection, Waku-Shin Yakiniku prides itself on using traditional Japanese charcoal grill methods of preparation to bring out the best aroma and taste possible for a delectable dining experience.Start your meal with an assortment of seasoned vegetables with the Namuru Moriawase before diving into the various kinds of sashimi. Scallop sashimi lovers can opt for the Hotate Sashimi to enjoy a fresh platter of juicy Hokkaido scallops. For a taste of all the sashimi on offer, order the 3 Kind Sashimi or 5 Kind Sashimi to enjoy slices of the different raw fish available. Seafood lovers can look forward to trying the succulent Hokkaido Squid and Tiger Prawn with the 3 Kind Seafood Platter while meat lovers can satiate their cravings with the Waku Shin Platter that consists of beautifully marbled wagyu beef alongside tender pieces of chicken thigh and jumbo aburi sausages. Beyond classic Japanese favourites, Waku-Shin Yakiniku also boasts an impressive array of pork and vegetable skewers. We recommend choosing a mix of Asparagus Maki, Enoki Maki, Shiitake Mushroom for a delicious meal. (Sep 2021)

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Chinese restaurants can usually be classified as Asian kitsch or Asian splendour and there’s no doubt as to which category Wan Hao falls into. Elegantly outfitted in muted golds and blacks, the place abounds in tasteful chinois touches like gold leaf and calligraphic artwork. Similarly, the menu boasts the sort of stately fare you can imagine eating during leisurely dim sum days, relaxed lunch times, or at family gatherings. We might sound like we’ve watched one too many Wong Kar Wai films, but once you take a gander at their list of Hong Kong dim sum items and opulent mains, you’ll want to order one of everything as well. All the dim sum favourites are prepared with care – Steamed Shrimp Dumpling with Black Truffle and Cordyceps Flower, satisfying Steamed Scallop and Morel Mushroom Dumpling – and the main menu doesn’t fail to deliver either. South African Dried Abalone with Japanese Shiitake Mushroom and Chef’s Secret Sauce and Deep-Fried Prawn with Black Truffle Mayonnaise and Broccoli, signatures like Pork Ribs with Mandarin Orange Sauce, Irish Roast Duck with Chinese Crêpe, and Stewed Bird’s Nest with Egg White, Crab and Superior Soup. With a multitude of premium ingredients, award-winning Cantonese dishes, plenty of options for vegetarians, and an exceedingly stylish environment, we’re betting this Orchard Road restaurant will prove to be a delightful time! (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Irish Roast Duck with Chinese Crêpe; Pork Ribs with Mandarin Orange Sauce; Stewed Bird’s Nest with Egg White, Crab and Superior Soup; Australian Premium Dried Abalone with Superior Abalone Sauce; Deep-Fried Prawn with Black Truffle Mayonnaise and Broccoli

    “Most well known for its Peking duck, this Chinese restaurant is one of those places you know will be around forever. Seldom quiet at meal times, you can expect to find business people, tai tais and well-heeled families eating enthusiastically here. Gold leaf calligraphy and antique displays complete your dining experience.” -SG Now “Wan Hao is the flagship Chinese restaurant of the world-renowned Marriott chain and it is for this reason that diners have high expectations. Fortunately, it lives up to its reputation.” -SG Tatler

  • ABOUT

    We're suckers for unexpected bursts of inspiration and Wan He Lou's award-winning Lobster Porridge certainly qualifies. Catching a lobster during one of his typical leisurely diving trips off an isolated island, the lack of other ingredients forced Chef Lau Siaw Dee to throw together a quick meal using only rice, seawater, and the aforementioned crustacean. Surprise, surprise! The salty combination worked so well, it became an instant hit once Chef Lau brought it back home – after much refinement of course. Today's iteration is a Teochew-style porridge, whose loose grains float in a yellow broth that's been richly flavoured with lobster roe, accompanied by a bevy of fresh lobsters sitting under a blanket of fresh spring onions. It's both comforting and decadent without being too much on the palate. There's also plenty more on the menu that can round out your meal, from poultry dishes like Seven Spice Pork Choplets to local staples like Braised Yee Fu Noodles and Sambal Fried Rice. For mouth-watering Chinese food that's packed with plenty of local flavour and an exceptional bowl of lobster porridge, only one place comes to mind, and this is it. (May 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Lotus with Salted Egg, Ice Plant with Pickled Cherry Tomatoes, Pan Fried Kurobuta Pork, Yellow Gravy Crab Meat Tofu, Crisp Salt & Pepper Soft Shell Crab, Lobster Porridge

    Offering local Chinese zi char, Wan He Lou Kitchen is best known for their award-winning Lobster Porridge. Stewed Teochew-style in a rich golden broth for hours, the porridge is sprinkled with a blanket of fresh spring onions that perfectly complements the lobster roe and enhances the taste of the fresh, juicy lobster. Besides this signature dish, Wan He Lou Kitchen also features a wide variety of side dishes that make for a comforting and nourishing meal. Start with the Crisp Salt & Pepper Soft Shell Crab before diving into a steaming plate of Sweet and Sour Patin Fish. Drenched in the restaurant's signature house sauce, the fish is tender, each mouthful packing a flavour punch. Then cleanse your palate with a hearty concoction of Crocodile Soup with Cordyceps Flower before ending off your meal with the restaurant's delicious 'Dessert of the Week'. Wan He Lou is the place to be whenever you seek rich, comfort Chinese cuisine at affordable prices. (Jul 2020)
