• Good For

    City Views, Casual Dining, Drinks

  • ABOUT

    Looking for wanton noodles in Chinatown? Come to Wanton Seng’s Eating House @ Ann Siang, where you’ll tuck into bowls of comfort and tradition, fashioned with a contemporary attitude. From a humble recipe dating back to 1968, these bowls of wanton noodles come with springy noodles, broth, wantons, sauce, and chilli. With an expansive menu ranging from bowls and sides to wontons and roasts, it’s a great spot for lunch and dinner if you’re hankering for some hawker food at Ann Siang. Mushroom-lovers will love the deep umami flavour of the Mushroom Noodles, which feature three types of mushrooms: Shimeiji, oyster, and shiitake. For something with a little more bite, opt for the SIgnature Char Siu Noodles, where plump pieces of pork belly feature. If you love to heat things up, the Mala Bah Chor Noodles come with pork mince and a jammy, lava egg that presents varying textures and flavours in one bowl. Here for the wontons? Choose from six types of wontons, boiled or fried. Great for sharing, the XO Sauce Fried Wontons are moreish, with the distinct XO sauce flavour coming through each crisp bite. Another great option for large groups, the roast meat platter will have your dining pals fighting for every last bit of char siu and roasted pork belly. (Sep 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mala Bah Chor Noodles, Mushroom Noodles, Signature Char Siu Noodles, XO Sauce Fried Wontons

• ABOUT

    At the heart of Singapore’s bustling party hub in Clarke Quay lies Warehouse, a venue for lovers of music, food and fun. Featuring flat screens throughout the area and a massive 150-inch projector screen backed by a powerful audio system, fans of traditional classic rock have to stop by to jam to the tunes of local music legends Zul and Tania. Diners who appreciate more modern sounds can choose to visit on different weeks as the Warehouse has a great rotation of wonderful guest bands every week playing an eclectic mix of genres. Serving a mix of traditional Western cuisine and classic Asian food, Warehouse specialises in dishing out delicious group platters made for sharing as you dance along to the groovy beats. Keep on rocking all night with the beer tower and unlimited nachos deal or fuel up with the Basket of Fries and Golden Fried Scampi. Other heartier menu options include customised pasta dishes, Vegetarian Lasagne and the mouthwatering Crispy Chicken Burger. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Golden Fried Scampi, Vegetarian Lasagne, Crispy Chicken Burger, Grilled Teriyaki Salmon

  • href

Menus: Beverage Menu  An Afternoon Soirée Menu (Daily 2-6pm)
Address: 320 Havelock RoadRobertson QuayThe Warehouse HotelSingapore (169628)                                                Map
html:
• ABOUT

    Our craft cocktail programme reflects the three key eras of the property’s past. Representing its incarnation as an 1895 warehouse, known in Asia as a godown, are rustic infusions that transport you to the heart of the old spice trade. Referencing Havelock Road’s time as Chiu Long Lo in Hokkien - or ‘Spirits Distillery Street’ are heavier concoctions. Flirty concoctions are inspired by the venue’s transformation into an iconic disco in the 1980s. These are supported by a curated selection of Asian craft beers, spirits and fine wines. (Jul 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Its Lobby Bar has also become the talk of the town. With an extensive whisky and bourbon collection, its craft cocktail programme is also a throwback to the property’s past. Their rustic infusions that transport you to the heart of the old spice trade include libations like the Singapore Sazerac (raisin bourbon, pandan bitters, rye, cognac, absinthe) and Barbarella (hibiscus gin, elderflower, rhubarb, earl grey tea)." – Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Forbidden Fruit, BB King, Barbarella, Kurobuta Char Siew, XO Crab Carrot Cake, Traditional Kueh Pie Tee

  • MENU & OFFERINGS

    Bar MenuThe cocktails are a taste of the three distinct eras of the warehouse’s past, from the frenetic height of the spice trade and the darker underbelly of godown culture to the giddy heyday of disco. These are supported by a selection of Asian craft beers, spirits and fine wines. When: Mon-Sun Time: 11am-10:30pmClick here to view the menu An Afternoon SoiréeIndulge in An Afternoon Soirée of daytime reveries, with free-flow cocktails and rosé and let yourself be seduced by a selection of secret concoctions from the Lobby Bar. When: Mon-Sun Time: 2-6pmClick here to view the menu

  • PRIVATE EVENTS & GROUP FUNCTIONS

    Heritage, design and culture converge under one roof, The Warehouse Hotel, creating an elegant and striking venue along the Singapore River. With three spaces to choose from, there are endless ways to celebrate – from blowout bashes to intimate gatherings with loved ones and even corporate events. This historic godown has seen it all. Spaces: The Den: up to 40 guests Furnished with artwork by local artist, Robert Zhao, and a library of curated collection of literature and art, this cosy, mood-lit space can be tailored to suit your event needs. From intimate gatherings to cocktail parties and product launches; this space is unlike any other. Po: up to 30 guests The more the merrier for the best popiah parties. Colleagues, family, or friends, all are welcome for private dinners at Popo's place. Lobby Bar: up to 120 guests An eclectic combination of design and comfort, The Lobby is where The Warehouse Hotel experience begins and ends. A beautiful and open space, kitted out with furniture crafted by the world's finest designers, it paints the perfect scene for any and all events - big or small. *Full buyouts available upon request. **Do note that due to safe distancing measures, capacities may vary during this time.

  • CASHLESS PAYMENT

    Please note that The Warehouse Hotel Lobby Bar is a cashless establishment. Payment modes accepted include Visa, Mastercard, Amex, JCB, UnionPay, GrabPay, PayLah, PayNow.

  • PO RESTAURANT RESERVATIONS

    For reservations at Po, please click here.

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    The freshest seafood, hand-me-down recipes and homemade pastas are what to expect at Waterfall Ristorante Italiano. Here, Southern Italian classics are served up with seasonal produce and sprinkles of la dolce vita. These are best paired with a bottle from the extensive wine collection that takes diners on a journey across Italy. Savour the house wine, Nero d'Avola, the most important red wine grape in Sicily, in the unique Boccalino. For coffee lovers, baristas are trained to brew the perfect Illy cuppa throughout the day. Situated in the Garden Wing, the restaurant reflects its ambience with greenery and fresh flowers. The colonial-era style interiors are designed like a home. The living room is at the front, with more intimate seating arrangements in the middle. In the rear are the communal tables. The gardens and free-form swimming pool of the hotel are visible from the inside, thanks to views that open out on 3 sides of the restaurant. For intimate dining, our Private Dining Room is available up to 8 persons. Waterfall Ristorante Italiano was also awarded the Ospitalità Italiana certification on 23 October 2020 by the government of Italy as a quality endorsement for signature Italian hospitality and authentic Italian cuisine that is built on history, tradition, and connection to its origin. (Nov 2020)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Nestled amidst the lush garden flora of the hotel, the aptly named Waterfall Ristorante Italiano offers diners a classy yet casual experience." -The Smart Local

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Burrata Pugliese, Carpaccio di Polipo, Mozzarella in Carrozza, Pizza Ai 4 Formaggi, Tagliatelle al Tartufo, Trancio di Dentice

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

html:
• ABOUT

    Going full-on industrial concept with hints of desi vibes, We Desi Indian Bistro brings home-style Indian cooking to the table with vibrant bold flavours and a colourful menu. The menu is curated with familiar and cozy recipes that calm the soul while energizing the body. Ghobi Manchurian, made of cauliflower florets dipped in spicy, sweet, and tangy sauce, is an appetiser you should not miss at We Desi. Alternatively, you can go for Schezwan Momos. Either chicken or vegetarian options are available, along with a deliciously spicy Schezwan sauce. Don't stop at their Schezwan Momos - try their Tandoori Momos for a unique twist of textures and taste with yogurt marinade and spicy chili dip. If you’re looking for a tasty main dish, go for the Keema Kofta Curry, which is a minced mutton meatball prepared in an onion and tomato sauce, resulting in a juicy, sweet, and tangy dish that won't disappoint. Or go for their Malabar Fish Curry for a mouthwatering dish that is perfectly paired with Naan or fragrant white rice. The restaurant also offers a wide selection of kebabs and tikkas, but the most popular are the Beef and Tandoori Chicken Kebabs, both perfectly marinated and grilled to perfection. For vegetarians, they also serve a Broccoli Tikka that is delicious and goes amazing with a mint yogurt dipping sauce. For dessert, finish off with a velvety smooth Mango Pudding to end off your dining experience on a sweet note. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ghobi Manchurian, Schezwan Momos, Keema Kofta Curry, Malabar Fish Curry, Broccoli Tikka

html:
• ABOUT

    The Wheeler’s Yard is more than your average cafe - it’s also a bicycle atelier and workshop. Borne out of a greater vision to encourage Singapore’s growing cycling culture, Wheeler’s Yard provides the perfect pit stop for cyclists using the Whampoa park connector to rest and grab a bite whilst admiring the stunning array of handmade urban bicycles available for sale. Not a cyclist? No worries, Wheeler’s Yard has also quickly become THE hot new coffee places for pedestrians too. Their iconic blue door, preserved from the 1980s, is one of its kind and has dominated Instagram feeds since the establishment opened its doors. The interior is just as “insta-worthy”, drawing you in with its sprawling space and unpolished floors, the perfect place to relax and grab a cuppa. Unsurprisingly, the space is also decorated tastefully with all things bicycles. Don’t forget to complete the experience with some delicious grub. The Ultimate Beef Yard Burger and Grilled Chicken especially are consistent crowd favourites and shouldn’t be missed! (Jun 2016)

  • SAVE 10% WITH CHOPE VOUCHERS

    Pre-purchase Chope Vouchers for Wheeler's Yard and get 10% off. This offer is not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • THE BUZZ

    “For a totally different cafe experience, hot foot it to Wheeler’s Yard. Located in an ultra hip warehouse space in a unit in an industrial park, this place screams Brooklyn, NYC.” -City Nomads “The kick-ass bike atelier-slash-hipster cafe is where to get your coffee and brunch fix while you wait for your darling two-wheeler to be repaired. No wheels? Come for the grub and caffeine like many others anyway and feast your eyes on the stunning rides on display.” -Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Ultimate Beef Yard Burger, Truffle Fries, Eggs Benedict, 60 Degree Chicken Breast

html:
• ABOUT

    Located right behind the iconic Masjid Sultan amidst the hustle and bustle of the lively Kampong Gelam area, The White Label’s classy French decor boasts elegant chandeliers, gold cutleries and marbled tables for an upscale French dining experience. With an aim to serve popular French cuisine made halal, the restaurant whips up a variety of classical French dishes, ranging from Duck Confit to Salmon Beurre Blanc. Their signature Prawn Pappardelle is a dish that is not to be missed out on. Made from lobster bisque reduction, the dish features huge and juicy grilled tiger prawns that will surely delight your taste buds. For meat lovers, indulge in the Shorts Ribs Bourguignon to satisfy your carnivorous cravings. Braised in a special sweet and spicy in house sauce, the fork tender beef short ribs melts in your mouth and leaves you coming back for more. Drop by during the weekend to have a taste of the classic Eggs Benedict and Souffle Pancakes series that make up the weekend brunch menu. Be it a romantic dinner for two or a celebratory meal for larger groups, The White Label is dedicated to serving authentic French dishes infused with local flavours for all. (Dec 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prawn Pappardelle, Shorts Ribs Bourguignon, Eggs Benedict, Souffle Pancakes

• PRESS RELEASE

    Featuring floor to ceiling windows, Wild Honey has dramatic and exciting views over the 'Times Square' of Singapore. This beautiful restaurant is reminiscent of a Brooklyn loft and boasts a copper, steel & reclaimed wood bar with counter seating. The main dining room features a glorious reclaimed oak long table the centrepieces of the space flanked by Wild Honey’s trademarks of elegant sofas and chairs with plush fabrics all accented with artwork and objects to bring to life the feeling of home. All time favourite dishes such as The Norwegian, European, Canadian and Parisienne sit alongside new favourites such as The Greek, Brooklyn Double Pastrami burger, & the Turkish. The menu continues to evolve and features and extensive range of vegetarian, gluten free, dairy free & vegan options such as The Californian that features eggplant bacon, The Amazon bowl & the spicy Korean salad that is grain and gluten free. These beautiful breakouts are matched with excellence in beverage service with bespoke coffee blends by Common man Coffee Roasters and teas by TWG, hand crafted mocktails and cocktails including the favourite Mandarin Wilderness, the new star Turmeric Latte & free flow champagne and Prosecco service. Beautiful Breakfasts. All Day. Everyday. (Sep 2018)

  • SAVE 20% WITH CHOPEDEALS

    Enjoy 20% off at Wild Honey at Mandarin Gallery when you purchase vouchers from ChopeDeals. Vouchers are not valid with 'Chope Exclusives', other discounts and promotions. Click here to purchase.

  • THE BUZZ

    "Our side dishes came first and they were all excellent. The smoked salmon oozed flavor, had the right texture and thickness and was Fresh (capital "F" intentional); the sautéed field mushrooms were amazing - juicy, nicely seasoned and downright tasty (and this reviewer hates mushrooms). Ditto the grilled tomatoes." -SG Now "Wild Honey's all-day breakfast is worth the wait though, as are the culturally-inspired breakfast dishes. There's scrambled eggs with bagels, cream cheese and lox called "I Love New York" and waffles with fruit called - what else? - The Belgian." Signature dishes include a good old fashioned fry-up, the "American", and Wild Honey's version of eggs benedict called the "European"." -CNN Travel "The folks at Wild Honey are passionate about breakfast and are proud to serve up a slew of all day breakfast options. Start your meal with one of their savoury dishes but make sure to leave some space for dessert. Try their Belgian (with grilled mango, blueberries and coconut cream) or Caribbean waffles (coconut with passionfruit crème, sliced bananas and toasted coconut flakes)." -Honeycombers "What might make Wild Honey a success is the fact that its dishes don't feel too obviously like breakfast - at least not in a city where breakfasts tend to be of the economy mee, soft boiled eggs and kaya toast variety." -Time Out Singapore

    The Greek, Brooklyn Double Pastrami burger, The Turkish, The Californian, The Amazon Bowl

A Halal-certified restaurant, it is an ideal dining place for a cosy meal with family, friends, and business partners. Located on Level 2. Open daily. Lunch: 12pm to 2.30pm, Dinner: 6.00pm to 10.00pm, à la carte from 12pm to 10pm Enjoy a delightful selection of the very best of local Asian as well as International cuisines, passionately prepared by our team of talented Chefs at Window on the Park.Window on the Park restaurant is the place where you can savour perennial favourites like Singapore Nyonya Laksa and Chicken Satay with condiments at the buffet whilst indulging in the ever-popular Shell Out Seafood Combo that is prepared in a variety of styles. Window on the Park buffet also features a delicious Afternoon High Tea set, perfect for whiling the afternoon away with as you gather with friends and loved ones. • ABOUT

    This cozy hangout on the ground floor of a conservation shophouse promises delicious food and good wines put together by a team of industry veterans. From the kitchen comes Asian-style bites that are familiar yet innovative at the same time. Start dinner with the Pork and Seafood Roll Bite, a modern spin on Hei Zou. The deep-fried Pork and Seafood Roll here is rich with bounty from the sea and land, prepared with minced pork belly and diced sea prawns, mixed with crunchy turnips and cuttlefish paste. Eat this together with the refreshing homemade achar that is served on the side. Another dish to try is the Foie Gras Lotus Leaf Rice, a decadent dish of seared goose liver mixed with rice perfumed with garlic, sesame oil, and porcini mushrooms, wrapped in a fragrant lotus leaf. Pair these delectable bites with fruit-forward wines bursting with notes of ripe cherries, raspberries, and toasted oak.At TWGF, wines are imported directly from wineries around the world. With the economy of scale, elimination of multiple tiers of middlemen, and good relationships with wineries, they are able to continuously provide affordable, high-quality wines to all guests. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hei Zou (Pork & Seafood Roll), Foie Gras Lotus Leaf Rice, Roast Pork Belly (Antibiotic Free & No Added Hormones), Iberico “Bah Kut Teh” Risotto

html:
• ABOUT

    In case the name wasn’t enough of a hint, the rows of wine bottles lining the walls should be a clue as to how seriously Wine Universe Restaurant & Bar takes its vino. Set up by Swiss vintner, Dominique Giroud, and Swiss owner, Claude Dizerens, the space is a restaurant, bar, and wine cellar rolled into one. The inside is furnished in a modern style with plenty of dark accents and simple lines – perhaps all the better to highlight the food and drink. However, if you’re in the mood for ambiance that’s a little more laidback, the sidewalk al fresco area might be more to your liking. It’s not often that Switzerland comes to mind when you’re in the mood for wine but that’s exactly what Wine Universe hopes to change. Besides the usual suspects from France and Italy, their incredibly extensive wine selection – easily over 50 types of wine – also introduces several Swiss options that often go overlooked. Worried about getting a little tipsy with only drinks and no nosh? Try some of the contemporary dishes on offer. Taking inspiration from the Swiss culinary culture, the menu comprises of items like Wiener Schnitzel, Escalope Viennoise, Raclette, Matterhorn Rösti, and more. Not only does the lack of excessive crowds mean that the restaurant is a great venue to hang out at, the food and, most importantly, wine are also fantastic representations of the Swiss gastronomic landscape. (Dec 2015)

  • THE BUZZ

    “With warm, professional service; an airy, modern indoor/outdoor setting; and an actual wine library…the magic act is truly complete.” -SG Now

    At Winery, we believe food and wine unite people and form enduring friendships, setting the table for a life well-lived. Let us whisk you away on an epicurean adventure through our aisles of contemporary Asian And European tapas. The Winery has got you covered no matter what you’re after. But it’s not just the food that’s catching people’s attention, as the wine list is masterfully curated by local award-winning sommelier, making sure that every sip and every bite go together perfectly to create a dining experience that’s not to be missed. (Feb 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Housing a Modern-European restaurant, bar and wine retail store under one roof, Winestone serves affordable wines and authentic Modern-European plates inspired by the gastronomic wonders all over Europe. The name is derived from two elements: the expansive and carefully curated selection of quality wines, as well as, the signature hearty dishes served on stone boards. With a concept revolving around the keywords: simple, attractive, authentic and affordable, one can expect quality wines starting at just $8 a glass and $38 a bottle, including take-home options that can be bought directly from the retail store at the corner of the restaurant. While you are there, be sure to dig into signatures like the Mixed Platter that serves some of the finest cold cuts, cheese, olives and bread at just $32. Other signatures includes the decadent Rigatoni Prawn, which promises to leave the delightful tangy flavours of a rich sauce accompanied by al dente pasta and crunch fresh prawns. A vegetarian alternative of this dish is also available upon request. The Pan-Seared Cod Fish is another new favourite, presenting a golden-brown gleaming cod surrounded by a bed of sautéed spinach soaked in a light fish velouté with fresh clam juice and finished with a generous squeeze of lemon, erupting the senses with a myriad of flavours. Opens daily, except Mondays, from 12pm until 3pm and 5pm until 10pm. Winestone is a sophisticated and chic space that is perfect for a romantic night out, or a gathering with a group of friends over a drink or two. (Nov 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mixed Platter, Rigatoni Prawn, Ragout Tagliatelle, Winestone Pizza, Winestone Signature Burger, Beef Tenderloin, Braised Seafood Risotto, Chocolate Ganache Mud Pie

html:
• ABOUT

    Wings Bar was built in 2012 for the people who enjoy good times, great ribs and baskets of tasty wings. With as many as eleven flavours of wings to choose from, order a variety of different flavoured platters to fill you up. Have a penchant for all things fried? The menu at Wings Bar is filled with battered fish fillets, crunchy Mozzarella Sticks, Popcorn Shrimp and a variety of other fried delights you simply cannot resist. A mouthwatering option made for sharing among family and friends is the Crispy Platter. Featuring a delectable mix of signature Jumbo Onion Rings, Chicken Tenders, Popcorn Shrimp and salted fries, this massive platter is the ultimate indulgence for all. Wings Bar Pulled Pork Wrap is a tasty crowd favourite served with chunky fries and coleslaw. Perfectly rolled in a soft wrap, the slow smoked pork is drizzled in the bar’s tantalising Wings Honey BBQ Bourbon sauce and layered with a blend of cheeses for a wonderful burst of flavour. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Platter, Chicken Tenders, Popcorn Shrimp, Pulled Pork Wrap

html:
• ABOUT

    Now you no longer have to sweat it out while enjoying hawker classics like Curry Fish Head and Black Pepper Crab. This restaurant focuses on flavour and finesse, with all their dishes undergoing a fiery treatment to preserve the wok hei taste we know and love. The menu here isn’t just familiar fare, though. There are a number of unique creations on the menu that incorporate timeless techniques with fresh flavours to create never-before-seen dishes. The Crispy Passionfruit Prawn is one such dish. With the sweetness of the passionfruit and the crunch of deep-fried prawns, this dish has a unique flavour that only gets better with every bite. The Coffee Spare Ribs is another tantalizing dish that combines salty and sweet for a dish that is sure to perk you up during lunch. Diners who prefer to stick to popular dishes will be pleased with the selection on offer here. The Black Pepper Crab offers the familiar earthy spice we are so fond of, while the Sambal Kangkong is crisp, spicy, and best enjoyed with a bowl of Jasmine rice. The Claypot Curry Chicken is a crowd favourite - and for good reason. The Wok Master’s curry gravy is aromatic and spicy, and coats every piece of tender chicken and potato. (Dec 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Passionfruit Prawn, Coffee Spare Ribs, Black Pepper Crab, Sambal Kangkong, Claypot Curry Chicken

  • ABOUT

    A fuss-free alternative to the traditional Wok Master restaurant, this casual eatery at Mapletree Business City known as Wok Master Express is a local Chinese restaurant dishing up tasty and affordable fare. From all-time classics such as Sambal Kang Kong to hot favourites such as Salted Egg Pork Ribs, all dishes here at Wok Master Express go through a blazing fire in the wok to achieve that essential ‘Wok Hei” flavour that everyone loves. Dig into a hearty breakfast of juicy Prawn Dumplings, crunchy Fried Spring Roll and more with the eatery’s wide variety of dim sum delights. Set options such as Laksa Set, Mee Siam and Ipoh Hor Fun are also available on the extensive menu. Meat lovers can look forward to the signature Crispy Pork Belly Rice. Perfectly sliced, the succulent pieces of tender pork belly are set atop a bed of soft, fluffy grains of short rice for a delicious dining experience. Alternatively, opt for the Curry Chicken with Rice for a fiery rendition of chunky potatoes, chicken wings and flavourful coconut milk. A mainstay in the Wok Master Express kitchen, the two claypot dishes are the star of the menu. Retaining the nostalgic flavour of the past, this tasty mix of chicken with spring onions rewards with a burst of flavours and is a great dish for sharing with family and friends. (Mar 2021)

From the humble roots of a traditional coffee and toast cafe, we have grown to a casual family oriented Zi-Char concept at Wok Master, and now to a refined fine dining concept at Wok Palace. Wok Palace strives to provide a unique menu with exciting new dishes as well as our evergreen Zi-char favorites. In a more comfortable environment with VIP rooms, we hope to provide a new dining experience to our current and new customers. (Jul 2019)

    Specialising in authentic Chinese cuisine with a modern flair, WOK °15 Kitchen is one of the exceptional dining gems hidden at ONE°15 Marina Sentosa Cove. Indulge in sophisticated and distinctive cooking as you overlook a scenic view of the waterfront and immerse yourself in an outstanding dining experience. A cosy yet luxurious atmosphere, it is the perfect place for intimate gatherings with family and friends alike. One of Singapore’s most popular dishes, Chilli Crab, is a star item on the menu. Bite into firm, fragrant crab meat, and don’t forget to ration your mantou – the sauce is so fragrant and piquant that you’ll probably want to soak up every last drop! We also highly recommend the Double-boiled ‘Sakura Chicken’ Soup with Tian Shan Snow Lotus; apart from its great nutritional value, the texture and complex flavours are sure to satisfy any palate. (Dec 2020)

• ABOUT

    Located in Wisma Atria, this is a great place to unwind in between shopping trips. The menu consists of cafe fare jazzed up with upscale ingredients. Expect foie gras, aioli, and Iberico ham. From the bright lights to the plush upholstery of the interior, the restaurant simply screams sophistication. Boasting an Egg Confit to Dashi Risotto, diners can savour an array of exciting fusion dishes that will win them over to Wonderland. The Egg Confit is a great way to whet your appetite before your mains arrive. Made with eggs, crispy potato, truffle jus, and potato mousseline. The mixture of textures in this dish give it a unique mouthfeel that you’ll want to savour. The light eggs and hearty potatoes make for an unlikely but delicious combination. Continuing with the unique dish trend, try the Dashi Risotto. Made with Miso Chicken Dashi, seaweed furikake, arborio rice, and mushroom, the recipe here puts a Japanese spin on an Italian staple. Meat lovers can indulge in the Iberico Pork. Served with earthy garlic chips and creamy aioli, the buttery taste of the pork will leave you craving for more long after the last bite. (April 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Egg Confit, Dashi Risotto, Iberico Pork, Beef Ragu Spaghetti, Duck Fat Potato

html:
• ABOUT

    If you are in search for an experimental, avant garde take on steak, Wooloomooloo is not the place for you. Instead, Wooloomooloo is among the best classic refineries of steakdom in this hemisphere, with a name from Down Under, and years of experience from the namesake Hong Kong restaurant group. Including everything that has made steakhouses its own genre - premium cuts, elegant décor and classic trimmings - Wooloomooloo is set to "steak" its claim as one of the premier houses in Singapore. From the 3rd floor of the Raffles City Shopping Center, Wooloomooloo boasts a picturesque view of Stamford Road, St. Andrew's Cathedral, and for Formula One enthusiasts, Turn 9 of the only night race in the world. There is much to be proud of, with an expansive lounge and dining area flanked by handsome leather seating and stacked wood touches that have become iconic. Aboriginal dot paintings pay homage to the Aussie title while an impressive meat case and open kitchen pay homage to the other source of the restaurant's greatness, its remarkable steaks. With more offerings than it has O's, the range is well-varied and precisely prepared - think jumbo prawn cocktails, a mammoth Australian Black Angus Tomahawk, a highly sought after USDA prime rib eye, and a gorgeous bread and butter pudding if there ever was one. Take our word for it, when it comes to steak, go classic. Go Wooloomooloo. (Jun 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Starters are outstanding: deliciously creamy yellow fin tuna and spanner crab tartare ($29) and jumbo prawn cocktail ($29), seriously large and meaty and served with a horseradishy tomato dip. But we're mainly here for the beef: an Australian Black Angus ribeye steak ($62) and a USDA 150-day wet-aged ribeye ($74)." -Expat Living "The formula is solid and simple: dark leather furnishings with a fresh wood motif, soft lighting to emphasise the view, plus, of course, top-quality Aussie beef. Let the meat sweats begin." -Time Out Singapore "The steaks of course, are the stars of Wooloomooloo, seasoned with sea salt, broiled and then served with four choices of homemade sauces (Red Wine Madeira, Au Jus, Peppercorn and Mushroom) or gourmet mustards (Dijon, English, Granary and Green Peppercorn). Cut variety is plentiful, catering to even the most ravenous of meat-eaters (including a 20-ounce porterhouse and tomahawk for two)." -Lifestyle Asia "Some days you just need some good steak. This established grill (originally from Hong Kong) serves premium Aussie and USDA steaks and grill faves, hitting all the right spots!" -The Honeycombers

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Tuna & Spanner Crab, Jumbo Prawn Cocktail, Australian Black Angus Tomahawk, Bread & Butter Pudding

    Our menu features all the big hitters of the Korean culinary tradition: fresh Bibimbap with beef, eggs and plenty of chili; Korean fried chicken twice fried to create that extra crispy skin, tossed in your sauce of choice, and finally, meat grilled at your table accompanied by plenty of banchan sides. Finish your meal with some Bingsu or Injeolmi – and don’t forget to leave before trying some ginseng tea, as we are the only restaurant in Singapore that sells it! Come on over and let us treat you to a Korean feast here on Lorong Kilat in Bukit Timah. (Jul 2019)

html:
• ABOUT

    Nestled in the heart of Ang Mo Kio, Workbench Bistro aims to satisfy with its industrial decor and its crowd-pleasing menu. Small and cosy, this place is ideal for evening waffle dates, or for just sitting with a cold drink in one hand, watching one of the oldest neighborhoods in Singapore go by. The hipster cafe trend has resulted in several must-have items on every self-respecting local cafe menu. A salted egg dish or two, a crab dish of some kind, truffle fries, craft beer. In this aspect, Workbench Bistro does not disappoint. It has not two, but four salted egg dishes on offer -- Salted Egg Chicken Pasta, Salted Egg Chicken Burger, Salted Egg Wings, and Salted Egg Wedges. The salted egg sauce is delightfully savory, and pairs well with the meats it comes with. There are two crab dishes, Crab Meat Linguine and Crab Cake Burger, that come chock full of fresh crab meat. If you come in a group, a must-order for sharing is the Signature Truffle Fries, which has that unmistakable aroma of truffle that is both appetizing and addictive. With the variety of craft beers available, and fluffy waffles for dessert, Workbench Bistro will undoubtedly make any cafe hopper very satisfied. (Sep 2016)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Salted Egg Wings, Pulled Pork Burger, Crab Meat Linguine, Signature Truffle Fries, Crab Cake Burger

  • ABOUT

    This traditional Japanese Sushi and Chirashi Restaurant is here to bring a taste of japan and fantastic flavours to the plate. With ingredients airflown twice weekly, you’re guaranteed the freshest ingredients only with Xchange Chirashi, all at affordable prices. With a selection of ala carte and omakase menus, you will be spoilt for choice. We like that Xchange Chirashi's Omakase set comes with 8 different courses of seasonal dishes, so you will never eat the same thing twice. Uni lovers, rejoice! Offering only the freshest of ingredients, ordering Uni here is a must. With a creamy texture and fresh ocean flavours, it will definitely leave you craving more. Offering over 9 kinds of fish and seasonal choices, check in with their staff for the day's picks and order a seasonal sashimi platter for an unexpected treat. There are several options at this restaurant, so if you can't choose, try their Omakase Sashimi, which features the chef’s choice. For sushi lovers, go for their Nigiri Set to have a little of everything and fully enjoy the fresh ingredients Xhange Chirashi offers. Our favourites are their Aburi Nigiri Set which features torched sushi, and also their value for money Tokusen Nigiri Set which features premium assorted nigiri with tamagoyaki and one makimono. For rice lovers, indulge with their chirashi bowls for maximum flavour. Those in the mood to spend a little more can opt for the Tokusen Chirashi, which is a premium seafood selection including uni, ikura, and fresh shrimp with natural sweetness from fresh ingredients. For regular bowls, their Tekka bowl is a fan favourite with thick slices of tuna topped with ikura for an umami finish. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Aburi Nigiri Set, Tokusen Nigiri Set, Tokusen Chirashi Bowl, Tekka Bowl, Omakase Sashimi

  • ABOUT

    Incorporating & infusing cooking styles influenced by Italian, French & Spanish cuisines, Xchange Restaurant and Bar has successfully engineered and created their own Modern European Cuisine with a flair. Pick from a classic variety of all day brunch selections, like their Grilled Chicken & Egg Sandwich or Crispy Fried Chicken Belgian Waffles for a classic hearty breakfast that can never go wrong. For indulgence, their Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict is the perfect creamy meal for anytime of the day and full of delicious flavour. Or enjoy the best of breakfast options with their Xchange Breakfast Platter that features chorizo sausage, bacon strips and eggs. Signature pastas that you must try are their Uni Ikura Truffle Carbonara that brings the umami and Truffle Mushroom Fettuccine, that leaves your tastebuds with a silky creamy finish. Both amazing ways of utilising truffle, Xchange expertly combines ingredients to create dishes that excites your tastebuds without you feeling bored. The other must try is their Chef’s Speciality Live Grouper, a Sicilian classic that’s baked in a salt crust and cooked to perfection. The meat is tender and soft and makes for a homely and comforting dish to bring out the countryside flavours. For meat options, their classic Angus Beef Sirloin Steak is paired with a red wine gravy and cooked to your preferred doneness with a smokey char. For dessert, go for their boozy Tipsy Tiramisu to end off your meal on a sweet and aromatic note. (Feb 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict, Truffle Mushroom Fettuccine, Uni Ikura Truffle Carbonara, Angus Beef Sirloin Steak

• ABOUT

    Founded by Jacky Yu, nicknamed ‘Hong Kong’s Jamie Oliver’, Xi Yan Shaw rides on his years of food experience as a food critic and cooking instructor. His impressive resume includes representing China at the food expo event, Bocuse D’or, alongside greats like Pierre Hermes and being selected by Phaidon to appear as one of the world’s top ten master chefs in a publication that also highlights Gordon Ramsay and Alain Duccase.Working off the fundamentals of Chinese cooking as created by Chef Yu, Xi Yan’s modern Chinese cuisine employs only the freshest ingredients which are then transformed into comforting fare. Enjoy familiar dishes given a creative twist – Salivating Spicy Chicken, Yunnan Ham Niang Dou Fu in Special Broth, and Steamed Cod Fish with Pickled Chili on Rice Noodles are but some of the mouth-watering items on offer and you’ll be spoilt for choice.The extensive food range – varied enough that you’d need to bring a large group or come back several more times – combined with a friendly and relaxed atmosphere makes Xi Yan Shaw a convenient place in the heart of Orchard Road where you can enjoy quality casual Chinese meals at affordable prices. (Mar 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Unlike the parent private dining restaurant in Craig Road, where you are required to make a booking and should ideally allocate a few hours to savour the extensive dinner set menus, the new eatery in Shaw Centre is the relaxed version. You can walk in without a reservation and order just a bowl of noodles or a few dishes from the a la carte menu. Even better, your bill is quite likely to be much lower." -SoShiok

• PRESS RELEASE

    Xian De Lai Hotpot in Singapore is an award-winning Asian restaurant which serves authentic Chinese hotpot and steamboat dishes. A Singaporean favourite ever since opening back in 2003, this Bugis eatery is one of the oldest hotpot restaurants in the city. Located on the popular Liang Seah Street, this spacious restaurant is perfect for intimate dinners for two, family meals, large groups and everything in between. You’ll find nine different soup bases to choose from and over 80 different ingredients to add extra flavour, this ensuring customers can create the hotpot they’ve always wanted. All the bases are brewed daily to guarantee both freshness and the best possible flavours. So what are you waiting for? If you’re in the mood for a hotpot steamboat head on down to Bugis and give Xian De Lai Hotpot a try today. Just don’t forget to book your table in advance. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Eat-All-You-Can Hotpot

html:
• ABOUT

    If you ask us, we can’t think of a meal that’s more comforting than a bubbling cauldron of fiery-hot soup. And when that craving strikes, there’s one name that soars above its competition – Xiao Long Kan Hotpot . Hailing from Chengdu, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot is the brainchild of F&B veteran Lao Wu. Better known as Old Man Wu, this bright entrepreneur wanted to create an eating space centred around providing the best ingredients and flavours for diners. And what happens next is history, as this burgeoning empire succeeded beyond all expectations and has new restaurants popping up all over the continent. Located in Bedok, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot is a place where you’ll be treated like a member of the imperial dynasty. From the warm and attentive service to the rich and opulent decor showcasing Chinese lanterns, wooden lattice panels, and gorgeous wall-sized paintings, get ready to be whisked away from the humdrum of everyday life and into a dining experience like no other. Load up on a variety of top-quality ingredients to go alongside your spicy hotpot. We love the tender Beef Slices or the Lady Finger Wrapped Pork. The freshly made Tofu is another go-to pick that complements the spice-laden soup perfectly. An ever-growing chain, Xiao Long Kan Hotpot has made a splash among local hotpot aficionados for its deeply satisfying and lip-smacking fare. (Sep 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pork Wrapped Lady's finger, A-Grade Lean Beef, Sheep Stomach, Meatballs

html:
• ABOUT

    Xiao Ya Tou, or XYT, is hard to miss. Its distinctive red lanterns, plastic chairs, and loud decor just call out to you as you walk past, not unlike the pervy men in the past who used to line this very street leering at the ladies of the night who used to operate around the area. XYT’s food, too, is loud, bold and in-your-face. Start your meal with the all-time classic, Braised Duck. At XYT, the meat of the duck is tender, yet provides enough of a bite to allow you to savour the juice of the sinews. To share, you will not regret ordering a Lu Rou Fan (braised meat on rice), which, at XYT, uses minced wagyu instead of the normal pork. The ubiquitous street food is thus upgraded to an almost unrecognisable form, but it is an evolution that we daresay is worth the calories. As the sun sets on Duxton Hill and lights from other eating establishments flicker on around you, sit back and reminisce about the days of old Duxton as you enjoy the retro charm with a cocktail or two from the XYT bar. (Feb 2017)

  • THE BUZZ

    "You may chuckle at the presentation or the combination of ingredients, but you'll coo at the feeling it gives you." -The New Paper "This quirky fun spot also offers late night Sliders (bao style) to go with your cocktails to complete the drinking den feel." -Sassy Mama

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Otak Otak Rolls, Braised Baby Spinach, XYT Lu Rou Fan, Twice-Cooked Angus Short Ribs, Truffle Roast Duck

  • PROMOTIONS

    Happy Hour promotion daily from opening till 8pm.

  • ABOUT

    Located in Chinatown Point is Xing Hua, an authentic Hokkien Restaurant that serves a plethora of delectable dishes to impress the masses. Serving a wide dimsum menu, Xing Hua is great for tea time getaways with their Xiao Long Bao (or Fish Caviar Xiao Long Bao if you’re fancy) and crispy Golden Seafood Rolls. But don’t let their Dim Sum menu get all the attention. Xing Hua serves a whole host of mains that you can feast on to your heart’s delight. For starters, try their Chilled Drunken Chicken with Chinese Wine, a delightfully tender and juicy all-time favourite. Xing Hua’s delicately soft Pickled Pepper Chicken Feet is another must-try option as well. Their signature dishes include their hearty and savoury Heng Hwa Lor Mee, a braised noodle dish that is warm and comforting. If noodles are not your thing, their Putian Signature Seafood Fried Rice is a great main for sharing. With fresh seafood mixed with fragrant aromatics and stir-fried till brown, this delicious dish can be eaten alone or with sides. Xing Hua also serves a spread of ala carte dishes that you can feast on. Try their Deep Fried Duck with Yam, a savoury-sweet dish that’s crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. For a more unorthodox dish, we recommend their Seaweed Oyster, delicately deep-fried so that the oysters on the inside stay plump and juicy. After a sumptuous meal, their Roselle Jelly is just the thing to help ease all their delicious and hearty dishes down to finish off on a sweet note. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Mapo Tofu, Mocha Pork Ribs, Deep Fried Duck with Yam, Salted Egg with Prawn Ball, Heng Hwa Lor Mee

  • ABOUT

    Xperience is where socialites come to wine and dine, meet and eat. A vibrant all-day café, restaurant and bar located in the heart of Singapore’s bustling CBD, Xperience is known for its tantalizing cuisine and attentive service. Our culinary designers use fresh and flavoursome produce to present a variety of International dishes, perfectly paired with our sommelier’s handpicked selection of fine wines. Satisfy your cravings for all-time favourites on the refreshing a la carte menu, or spice up your lunch meeting with a dynamic seasonal set menu which never fails to surprise and delight. With a magnificent 20-foot molteni oven that sits centre stage, diners can sit back and enjoy the show as tasty temptations are skilfully prepared before them. (Mar 2020)

    Say hello to SO/ dining electrifying experiences. The renowned MOTHER OF ALL BRUNCHES 3.0 takes on a new spin. Indulge in an overflowing tower brunch with all new creations including papadom nachos, half roasted chicken with homemade barbecue sauce, crispy, juicy pork porchetta and tender Australian striploin. To top it off, the SO/ Tribe ignites your tower with a chocolate waterfall to tempt and delight. Let the messy fun eating begin!     This Easter, indulge in an egg-travagant feast - the renowned Instagram-worthy tower brunches are here with a twist! Begin with the base tier filled everyone's brunch favourites - cured artisanal meats and cheese, smoked salmon guacamole croissant, the quintessential devil eggs and brioche French toast. Thereafter, meat lovers rejoice with a second tier of gourmet sausages, crispy pork roulade, lobster, juicy prawns and even bacon spinach frittata. Finally, Easter would not be complete with a curated dessert spread of carrot & walnut cake, brownies and hot cross buns. Delicious carvings await with garlic roast chicken, Australian striploin and Roasted lamb leg. Craving something from the ocean? Top up for the seafood platter at $138++ featuring freshly shucked oysters, mussels and prawns. Celebrate Easter with free-flow champagne and bespoke gin cocktails to kick it up a notch.Come dressed to impress in your Easter best and stand a chance to win a 1-Night Stay at the thrilling SO/Bangkok.     If pancakes are your thing, you’re in the right place! We don’t just make pancakes, we make stacks. We make them sweet, savoury and boozy – because that’s the SO/ way. From Singapore’s first alcoholic pancake stack infused with coffee liqueur dalgona cream and paired with six mini Nespresso martinis to the classic shakshuka and even a shared brunch board, brunch never looked this good. html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Roll up your sleeves, ladies and gentlemen, because it’s time to get down and dirty at this popular gem of a yakiniku restaurant. It’s pretty much a given that red meat-lovers will have the time of their lives at Yakiniku Ohji, which offers a luscious spread of Wagyu beef cuts that can be grilled to tender perfection over charcoal fires. Admire the exquisite marbling that comes with beef of superb quality, and watch as it slowly cooks over your gridiron; the fact that the restaurant uses charcoal fires gives an exquisite charred facet to the taste of the meat. What truly sets Yakiniku Ohji apart from other similar restaurants, however, is the fact that it imports the entire cattle – this allows the restaurant to offer up a selection of rare cuts, each more flavoursome and succulent than the last. Don’t forget to reserve your favourites, though, because some parts are limited in quantity and liable to be snapped up early! To get to the meat of the matter (pun shamelessly intended), it’s a rare person who won’t enjoy a visit to this restaurant – so what’re you waiting for? Make your way down to Yakiniku Ohji today! (Feb 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Arabiki Sausage, Angus Beef, US Tenderloin, US Kalbi, Marinated Pork Kalbi

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/yakiniku-ohji-clementi
name: Yakiniku Ohji (Clementi)

html:
• ABOUT

    Yakizen is located just a few streets away from the well-known Riverside Boat Quay. They offer a value-for-money lunch menu by day and a relaxed Izakaya by night. Yakizen is a modern Izakaya that immersed fine dining selection into an affordable family restaurant. In the afternoon, the restaurant draws a crowd from the value-for-money lunch menu from $7.80+. They also serve bento sets with miso soup and free flow salad, and green tea. As the sun goes down, they serve yakitori, which pairs very well with sake. Their yakitori is the must-try and value-for-money dish starting from $2.30+. If you are an oyster lover, you can try their super fresh oyster. For a beef lover, never leave the restaurant without ordering their Gyu Aburi Don. The beef is incredibly tender and melts in the mouth with Maze Gohan (a mix of sushi rice and Yakizen special sauce) at the bottom. (Mar 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pitan Tofu, Salmon Tataki, Yakizen Maki, Beef Tataki, Gyu Aburi Don and Yakitori

html:
• ABOUT

    Since opening in 2015, Yàn has more than lived up to its given meaning, ‘’, by being a veritable ‘feast’ of conviviality and exquisite Cantonese flavors, served with sincerity and heart. Helmed by Head Chef Ng Sen Tio, the restaurant showcases a spectrum of dining enjoyment featuring hearty Cantonese classics and favorites. Located within the National Gallery Singapore, the restaurant’s elegant interiors alludes to its artistic surroundings, featuring modern décor complementing the overall dining experience. The 2,700 sq ft space seats up to 154 and is divided into the main dining hall with an adjacent flexible dining area and 3 private rooms, perfect for any group or event. Serving authentic Cantonese cuisine, expect heartwarming dishes to elegant plates made to impress. Its chinoiserie chic interior design reflects this sense of largesse; be it a business power lunch, convivial dinner, wedding celebration or corporate event, the dining experience at Yàn, truly is a feast for the stomach, eyes, and soul. (Mar 2021)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Some of Yan's innovative dishes include suckling pig done in three ways, a deconstructed Mini Buddha Jumps Over The Wall and fried live prawns with a ball-shaped mound of crispy noodles. It will also serve dim sum for brunch and lunch." -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Roast Suckling Pig 3 Ways, Yan Peking Duck, Mini Buddha Jumps Over The Wall, Dim Sum Selection

  • ABOUT

    A Chinese restaurant located in the West, Yan Lai Ju Chinese Restaurant is a stone’s throw away from Jurong East Mrt. Helmed by two experienced chefs from China and Malaysia, both chefs have more than 30 years of combined experience in the culinary world. While one hails from Northeastern China and specialises in Sichuan and Dongbei cuisines, another is skilled in whipping up local dishes and seafood options. Decked out in elegant Chinese decor, Yan Lai Ju Chinese Restaurant is a great place to meet with friends and dine out with family. The restaurant also features private KTV rooms that can accommodate up to 12 people — perfect for family gatherings or business dining. Whet your appetite with a bowl of Hometown Cold and Sauced Dish. Made for sharing, this dish is a tasty starter that will have you raising your hands for more. Other signature menu items here include Mala Crayfish, Steamed Fish Head with Two Chopped Chilli, Garlic Pork Ribs, and more. (Jan 2021)

html:
• ABOUT

    Yan Ting is one of the city’s most ethereal Cantonese restaurants, tucked away in the regal St. Regis hotel. It’s a favourite amongst discerning diners looking for a quiet and discreet location for a luxurious and refined dimsum brunch, or more elaborate Cantonese feasts for special occasions. Expect the height of fine Chinese cuisine, shot through with the balance and richness of pure Cantonese cuisine. Nothing says special occasion quite like a Braised Whole Abalone in Superior Oyster Sauce, an entire lobe of the meaty treasure in an umami broth, paired with crunchy seasonal greens. A similar, less wallet-busting dish is the Braised Sea Supreme Cucumber with Corn Broth, a lovely blend of savoury and sweet flavours with the incomparable texture of high quality sea cucumber. Cantonese cuisine is nothing without a soup centrepiece, and here there’s a stunning Double-boiled Sea Whelk Consommé with Garlic, served in a teapot for some extra theatre with the deep oceaney flavours. Meat dishes here come with a similarly high-end flourish. Think Pan-Fried Chicken with Morel in Superior Soy Sauce, a humble poultry dish given a dramatic gourmet kick with the addition of rare, earthy morels. Moving further along this French direction, two great cuisines meet in the form of a Pan-Seared A9 Wagyu Beef Fillet with Mushroom Sauce. If it’s dimsum and traditional Cantonese roasts you’re after, lunch and brunch on the weekends is the best time to hit up this joint, with its popular buffet options. Either way, this is a meal that will stick around in your belly and mind with its commitment to fine ingredients, lovingly and innovatively prepared. (Jan 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Yan Ting restaurant prepares classic Cantonese dishes according to time-honoured recipes, but presents them in beautiful contemporary style.” -The Smart Local “Dim sum aside, the crispy roast pork was the best I’ve ever had” -Expat Living Singapore

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Pan-Fried Chicken with Morel in Superior Soy Sauce, Pan-Seared A9 Wagyu Beef Fillet with Mushroom Sauce, Braised Whole Abalone in Superior Oyster Sauce, Dimsum, Roast Pork, Double-boiled Sea Whelk Consommé with Garlic,

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/yan-ting
name: Yan Ting (The St. Regis Singapore)

  • ABOUT

    Yantra has established itself as the premier fine-dining Indian restaurant in Singapore, having won numerous accolades such as Singapore Tatler Best Restaurants in 2009, 2010, 2011 and 2012 and the Best Restaurant Concept Award (Asian) in 2011 by Epicurean Star Award. Now in celebration of its 8th anniversary, it seems fitting that Yantra has collaborated with world-renowned Chef Hemant Oberoi, who has cooked for the likes of world leaders and celebrities such as Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, Margaret Thatcher, Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie. This is not your typical North India - the dishes are inspired by flavours from all over India, but with a contemporary twist. One stellar example, the Chicken Tikka Fondue, is the perfect marriage between chicken tikka marinated in spices and yogurt, and a tantalizing cheese fondue. From the Seafood Rassa to the Thepla Tacos, the dishes are also telling of Yantra’s unyielding conviction of using the freshest ingredients and spices hand-picked and flown in from India. Yantra also turns fine dining up a notch with an interior that conveys an effortless sophistication and elegance, a clever reflection of its food. The extended bar which boasts of an imaginative range of specialty cocktails like the Tandoor Mojito and intriguing whiskies from Scotland’s finest whisky producing regions is also majorly impressive. Enough said, we’re sold on this unparalleled dining experience! (Jun 2016)

  • THE BUZZ

    “Its willingness to veer away from run-of-the-mill dishes and experiment with unconventional ingredients also ensures there’s always something new for diners to look forward to.” -Lifestyle Asia “Even traditional dishes turn out a little different from what you get at other restaurants here. An example is the Chicken Biryani, which is cooked and served in a glass pot that can withstand high temperatures in the oven.” -The Straits Times

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Seafood Rassa, Quinoa Chaat, Ganderi Kebabs, Grazing Goat, Ghee Roast Chicken, Maartaban Ka Meat

  • TRIPADVISOR CERTIFICATE OF EXCELLENCE

    This restaurant was awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence in 2017 for its outstanding service and quality while maintaining as a favourite among reviewers on TripAdvisor, the world's largest travel site.

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/yantra
name: Yantra

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Nestled on the enchanted hill overlooking Pearl’s Hill City Park, Yanxi Dim Sum & Hotpot Restaurant ushers in a new era of Dim Sum and Hot Pot dining experience for the gourmands in all of us. Under the stewardship of the newly appointed Group Executive Chef, Chef Chan Wai Keung brings four decades of gastronomic excellence to the restaurant. Soup bases are made from scratch daily with the freshest ingredient, double-boiled and simmered for hours. With a repertoire of soup bases on offer, such as the authentic Mala Soup, tangy Tomato Soup and the well balanced Pickled Cabbage Soup, Yanxi Signature Buddha-Jumps-Over-The-Wall is the crowd’s favourite. Brewed using the finest selection of ingredients and herbs, such as Ginseng, it nourishes and is flavoursome. We are excited to showcase the master’s four decades of culinary virtuosity. Elevating the dining experience at Yanxi, we are proud to offer a selection of bespoke dim sum specially curated by new Head Chef, Chef Ben Yapp. A trailblazer in revitalising dim sum for a new generation, his unique creation and interpretation of traditional classic dim sum is an epicurean joy. (Oct 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Hokkaido Jellyfish Salad in Aged Balsamic Vinegar, Artisanal Truffle Mushroom Fortune Bag, Quail Egg & Bonito Flakes Siew Mai, Jackfruit Sago with Caramelised Banana Fritters, Yanxi Treasure Pearl Soup, Imperial Elixir Youth Soup

html:
• PRESS RELEASE

    Located along the Marina Bay waterfront, Yardbird Southern Table & Bar brings the best of American culture and cuisine to Singapore in a casual and inviting atmosphere overlooking the glistening Marina Bay waters. Diners can enjoy classic American dishes, including the famous 100-year-old recipe Lewellyn's Fine Fried Chicken, Shrimp 'N' Grits, Buttermilk Biscuits, Butter Lettuce and Grilled Mango Salad, as well as new American home-favourites such as Jambalaya, Southern BBQ Shrimp, and Muffuletta Salad. Amongst the classic southern favourites, Yardbird Southern Table & Bar offers selections with an inventive spin on local cuisine inspired by Kunkel's travels to Singapore. The restaurant also boasts one of Asia's most impressive selections of bourbon and many sought-after spirits from around the globe. Among the multitude of signature bourbon options, guests will discover rare favourites such as Pappy Van Winkle, Jefferson's Aged at Sea and rare expressions of Blanton's. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "With its large portions, heavy mains, and a reliance on the deep-fryer, food at Yardbird is definitely made to be shared. So gather your friends and family, and delve into the warmth of Southern cuisine and hospitality." -City Nomads "No boring 'ol Caesar salads here; Yardbird offers a full vegetarian menu that'll please any leaf-loving fiend. With a selection of six starters, five entrees and up to eight sides and snacks, it's a meat-free feast you won't forget." -Honeycombers "As per Yardbird's century-old recipe, the chicken had first been brined for 27 hours, dredged in a secret blend of flour and spices such as paprika and cayenne pepper, and finally deep fried till crunchy. The result was a surprisingly light and thin skin that yielded a crisp bite before breaking apart to reveal smooth flesh within." -Lifestyle Asia

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Fried Green Tomato & Crispy Pork Belly, Deviled Eggs, Butter Lettuce & Grilled Mango Salad, Shrimp 'N' Grits, Lewellyn's Fine Fried Chicken, Chicken 'N' Watermelon 'N' Waffles, Skillet Cornbread, Dark Chocolate Bourbon

  • DAILY SPECIALS

html:
• ABOUT

    Opened by veteran Chinese Muslim chef Yassin Ng, this restaurant brings together everything Singaporeans love under one roof - seafood, spice, and the kampung spirit. Having worked in a medley of hawker kitchens - first as a waiter and then as a chef - gave Chef Ng the necessary expertise to craft halal versions of hawker classics. The menu at Yassin Kampung features a range of famous local dishes such as Chilli Crab and Fish Head Curry, and some with a contemporary twist - like the Buttermilk Salted Egg Yolk Chicken. There are sets available for groups of up to 10 people in a communal dining style - everyone gets a bowl of rice and a range of main dishes. The Chilli Crab here is a must-try. Served piping hot, this dish consists of tender crab meat in a rich, spicy gravy and served with deep fried buns. Use the buns to mop up your plate, or enjoy them on their own - the subtle sweetness of the buns cleanse the palate for the following dishes.The Grilled Tiger Prawn is another crowd favourite. Whole prawns are grilled in-shell with oil and spices to tender perfection. The flesh of the prawn is buttery and perfect with a serve of Jasmine rice. (Aug 2018)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Chilli Crab, Crispy Oat Prawn, Butter Milk Salted Egg Yolk Chicken

• ABOUT

    Located in Marina Square, level 2 Dining Edition, Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan is a Chinese restaurant that specialises in Huai Yang / Jiang Nan cuisine. Offering multiple deals a week, the restaurant serves a wide selection of appetizers, mains and dim sum dishes as well. Start your meal with the Yechun Steamed Pork Dumpling or dim sum of your choice from a wide selection of Dumplings and Buns (including the award-winning 3-diced bun which was created for the Qing Emperor). For something with a hint of spice, opt for the Poached Sliced Beef in Sze Chuan Style, where thinly sliced beef pieces are cooked in the restaurant’s famous sweet and spicy broth. For those looking for a healthier option, Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan offers a fragrant Tonic Herbal Claypot Chicken and Pig Stomach Soup, a herbal concoction that will surely comfort the senses and improve your immunity. The Wok-Fried Four Season Vegetables are also great for those looking for a tasty plate of greens. Yangzhou Fried Rice is an award-winning main that please all nationalities. Desserts at Yechun Xiao Jiang Nan are also healthy, with vegetarian options that cater to your non-meat eating friends. Order the Pan Fried Red Bean Pancake or the White Fungus Soup with Red Dates for a sweet end to a scrumptious meal. (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Yechun Steamed Pork Dumpling, Poached Sliced Beef in Sze Chuan Style, Claypot Chicken and Pig Stomach Stew, White Fungus Soup with Red Dates

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/yechun-xiao-jiang-nan

html:
• About

    With more than 150 outlets across countries such as the Philippines, Qatar, China, and Saudi Arabia, Yellow Cab Pizza Co. now brings a slice of New York to our little red dot with their exciting variety of pizzas, pastas, and more. Step into the restaurant and the iconic yellow traffic light and flashing Walk/Don’t Walk sign greets you. It’s clear that the industrial chic, interior featuring custom-made lamps and bike handlebar stools, are a clear nod to New York’s urban landscape. Famed for its signature New York style pizzas that are large, wide, and thin Yellow Cab Pizza Co. remains to its brand with the use of premium ingredients and generous toppings. Even their pizza dough is prepared fresh daily! The classic pizza here’s definitely New York’s Finest, featuring heapings of pork pepperoni, beef salami, ground beef, Italian sausage, ham, and fresh vegetables on a crispy medium-thick crust. For something a little more unique, the Dear Darla Roasted Garlic + Ricotta Cheese thin crust pizza can only be found at the Singapore outlet. The ricotta cheese creates rich textures while the roasted garlic elevates the taste profile with its fragrant flavour, making this a pizza you don’t want to miss! In the mood for some pasta? The Charlie Chan Chicken Pasta, featuring tender chicken strips, plump shiitake mushrooms, and roasted peanuts in a spicy oriental sauce, is another stellar option that’s uniquely Yellow Cab. Guess it’s time to hop right in! (Jan 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    New York’s Finest, NY Classic, Manhattan Meatlovers, Dear Darla, Chicken Alfredo Pasta, Charlie Chan Chicken Pasta, Hot Wings, Twice Baked Potato Halves

  • href

html:
• ABOUT

    The food here follows the clean eating philosophy adopted at The Garcha Group, which means you won’t find any additives or artificial flavourings in chef Sebastian Goh’s food. A cold starter of organic vine-ripened tomatoes, for instance, are served with their skins thoughtfully removed as the red skins are believed to contain inflammatory properties. The tomatoes are then soaked in a house-made plum and herbal juice, rendering them sweet and refreshing. Roast duck is a popular mainstay of Chinese restaurants, and the one at Yellow Pot is first marinated for two days in a fermented beancurd paste, then roasted over hickory wood so the meat is aromatic and tender with a glistening layer of crispy skin. Vegetables are not an afterthought here, too. Try the sweet and sour eggplant, where the aubergine is braised and coated with a delicious housemade sauce of hot bean paste, honey, vinegar, and Nanyang soya sauce brewed by a local company. (Sep 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Braised Duck Spring Roll, Roast Duck, Roast Pork Rack, Wok-fried Tiger Prawns XO, Stir-fried Mee Sua

html:
• ABOUT

    Located within Duxton Reserve Hotel, Yellow Pot is well known for delivering traditional Chinese flavours with a modernised twist that favours responsibly sourced ingredients. Promising an immersive gastronomic experience like no other, come down to witness the restaurant’s rich culinary philosophy, warm hospitality and traditional favourites in a breathtaking setting. Clad in a striking palette of black, gold and yellow, the 50-seat restaurant lives up to its name with cheeky embellishments of a smattering of yellow pots of various sizes and configurations. An avid believer of eating clean, chef Sebastian Goh whips up dishes that are free of MSG, additives or artificial flavourings. Start your meal by sharing Wok-fried Chicken with Broccoli Cashew. Extremely flavoursome and juicy, enjoy a mouthful of different textures with every bite of this yummy dish. To fill up your bellies, the Braised Ee-Fu Noodle with Wild Mushroom and Crab Meat is a stunning dish that delights with its generous serving of tangy noodles and chewy pieces of crab meat. End your meal on a sweet note with Yellow Pot’s Chinese Sweet Cake. (Feb 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Wok-Fried Tiger Prawns XO, Signature Roast Duck, Wok-Seared Organic Grass-Fed Beef Tenderloin, Crispy Sichuan Chicken

html:
• ABOUT

    Serving extraordinary seafood at great prices, Yi Jia South Village Seafood Restaurant is the perfect location for a celebratory meal with friends or family. Featuring a laid back experience in a friendly neighbourhood setting, the restaurant is well-known for dishing out Zi Char delights. A dish that is not to be missed is the Prawn Balls in Honeydew. Unique to Yi Jia South Village Seafood restaurant, the fritters are served in a hollowed out melon and tastes like sweet and sour prawn balls. The live mussels are also an excellent choice. Juicy and big, the mussels are steamed to perfection before being topped off with soy sauce and garlic. Local favourites such as Salted Egg Crab, Fish Head Steamboat and Curry Fish Head are also delectable dishes that can be found at the restaurant. Located along MacPherson Road, Yi Jia South Village Restaurant is open seven days a week for lunch, dinner and drinks, so be sure to drop by for a meal if you happen to be in the Tai Seng area! (Feb 2020)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Prawn Balls in Honeydew, Salted Egg Crab, Curry Fish Head

  • ABOUT

    Yi Qian Private Dining, with its elegant furnishings fit for royalty, provides more than 100 sumptuous dishes that will delight your palate. Among the appetizers to try is the Crispy Eggplant with Pork Floss, which is crispy on the outside and has soft, juicy flesh to sink your teeth into. Tossed in sweet pork floss, this dish is an addictive appetiser that you cannot get enough of. Engage your senses with their fried Shark’s Fin Soup with Crabmeat served in Teapot. This unique 2-part dish consists of stir-fried shark’s fin and halibut fish, served alongside a teapot of superior soup that’s bursting with flavour. Tip: take a bite of halibut and follow up with a sip of soup for a divine combination that marries the flavours together in perfect harmony. The Peking Duck is the crowd's favorite signature dish here, with tender flesh and crackling skin that’s wrapped in paper-thin crepe and hoisin sauce. A classic favourite done right, this dish is loved by those young and old, and perfect for bringing a pop of colour to the table. Offering a variety of live seafood as well, guests can choose from different types of fish and shellfish cooked in the method of your choice. A savoury and sumptuous addition to your meal, their Coral Trout in Superior Soya Sauce is available at a seasonal price. For the ultimate indulgence, order the Double Boiled Bird's Nest with Crystal Sugar to end on a luxuriously sweet and healthy note. (Mar 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Eggplant with Pork Floss, Shark’s Fin Soup with Crabmeat served in Teapot, Peking Duck, Coral Trout in Superior Soya Sauce, Double Boiled Bird’s Nest with Crystal Sugar

  • href

    https://www.chope.co/singapore-restaurants/restaurant/yi-qian-private-dining
name: Yi Qian Private Dining

html:
• ABOUT

    Yin At The Riverhouse joins the Clarke Quay nightlife enclave, bringing with it a selection of hand-crafted modern Asian cocktails and Chinese tapas. It sits in front of The Riverhouse, a 140-year-old heritage building which was formerly a secret society den. The Chinese-style architecture is a perfect complement to Yin At The Riverhouse's offerings, and acts as a great backdrop for the gram. The drinks here are certainly one-of-a-kind — you'll find cocktails served in teapots and even one with boba. Crowd favourites include Rendezvous, a floral and fruity concoction with gin, Yuzu sake, and melon liqueur, as well as the refreshing Dragon Glass that combines yuzu juice and dragonfruit puree with spirits. Those who love longan red date tea must try the "High" Tea, a cocktail that recreates the drink but with a dash of rum. After trying two or three drinks, you'll probably feel peckish. Yin At The Riverhouse has got you covered with a selection of Chinese and Greek dishes from Mimi's Modern Chinese Kitchen and Zorba respectively. Grab a few small plates for the table, like the Honey Char Siew, Bandit Chicken Wings, and Crispy Sichuan Beef Slices. If you're craving something heartier, the Angus Dry Pasta or Truffle Fried Rice might just do the trick. (Dec 2019)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Crispy Sichuan Beef Slices, Angus Dry ‘pasta’, Honey Char Siew, Bandit Chicken Wings

  • DRINKS WE LOVE

    Rendezvous, Secret Garden, Dragon Glass, The ‘High’ Tea

  • ABOUT

    Located within Ngee Ann City is You Are My Sunshine, a casual Korean-western fusion cafe that brings you good vibes and the best of both worlds. With a menu that embraces sustainable and healthy eating and drinking, you’re in for a delicious food journey with You Are My Sunshine. For starters, go for their Cured Salmon and Prawn Salad or the Savory Watermelon Cubes. A little unorthodox, this dish is ready to transform your views on cooked watermelon as you enjoy this sweet, savoury, and refreshing dish. For mains, treat yourself to their Alfredo Bulgogi Fettuccine, a creamy, spicy, and beefy pasta dish. Unwind with their delicious tea options and sides. For vegan options, try their Vegan Popcorn Bites with Yangnyeom, a satisfying ‘meaty’ side that you can snack on whilst you recharge. If you have a sweet tooth, we recommend their Jiggly Souffle Pancake that you can pair with a topping of your choice. (Dec 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Savoury Watermelon Cubes, Smoked Salmon Benedict, Alfredo Bulgogi Fettuccine, Hake and Chips with Salmon Tartare, Seared Iberico Pork Jowl

html:
• ABOUT

    Set in a preserved colonial bungalow, this unique spot offers an intimate dining experience far from the rush of the city. With an elegant interior, attentive service and delicious modern European fare, this restaurant and bar would not be out of place on the Champs Elysees. The brunch menu here features an array of beloved staples from pancakes to eggs Benedict. Dig in to a stack of soft pancakes served with light chantilly cream and fresh fruit, or nosh on a soft poached egg served on a buttery croissant and and tangy Hollandaise sauce. The mains don’t disappoint either. Up for something unique? Give their Canard a l’Orange a try. Tender duck breast is done to perfection and served with a fresh, citrusy orange sauce. The Angus Beef Tenderloin is heaven on a plate for carnivores - fresh meat cooked to perfection and served with a rich port wine sauce and crisp greens. Diners who prefer a tipple with their meal will be delighted by the range of handcrafted cocktails on offer here, as well as the wallet-friendly happy hour deals. The Sangria Sour is a unique concoction of citrus, wine and whisky that is just as easy on the eyes as it is on the palate.

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Fries, Crab Cake,YOUNGS Big Breakfast, YOUNGS Waffle Stacker, Crab & Eggs Benedict, YOUNGS Salad, Foie Gras, Chicken Roulade, Canard a l'Orange, Mussels Pot, Frutti di Mare Pizza

  • TAKEAWAYS / DELIVERY AVAILABLE

    The restaurant will be open for takeaways / delivery instead. Takeaway Operating Hours Mon-Sun:12:00-9:00pm

html:
• ABOUT

    Tucked along Zion Road is Yujin Izakaya, a lively hangout where one and all are received as friends. The industrial-chic space features a bar that opens to the five-footway and main street, beckoning with the glow of display fridges showcasing an enticing range of sake. Immerse in this casual laid-back enclave where one can enjoy an eclectic mix of Japanese Izakaya food over a round of beer or sake. The menu spans inspired cold and hot appetisers, smokey grilled vegetable, meat, and seafood dishes, beautifully singed skewered items, and light desserts. Here, there are no rules. Just a fun, vibrant space for all to unwind – be it just to throw back a solitary cup of sake or two to mark the close of the day, or to gather with those near and dear to partake in a feast. It is a place for friends, by friends – and you are invited. (Jan 2022)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Truffle Chawanmushi, Katsu Sando, Eringi, Tsukune, Gyu Kalbi, Reba, Tomorokoshi, Tontoro

• ABOUT

    A well-known and much-loved destination for Dim Sum, Yum Cha in Changi satisfies grandpa, tiny tykes and everyone in between with classic Cantonese cuisine. There's a reason why Yum Cha always seems to be alive with hungry patrons, and that has a lot to do with their dim sum. Tried-and-true renditions of Xiao Long Bao, Prawn Dumplings, Fish Roe Siew Mai and more come piping hot from the kitchen, rolled in by traditional push cart to excited diners. The classics are certainly excellent, but Yum Cha also excels in trendier items like Malay Cake from Hong Kong, and Crispy Red Bean with Banana, which they challenge their kitchens to introduce to the menu every now and then. All are solid in taste with recipes very similar to those you grew up with, tossing you back into a haze of tasty nostalgia (or perhaps that's just a food coma). The setting is apt for the retro dishes, with round marble tables and basic wooden chairs that recall traditional Chinese dining. (Jun 2018)

  • THE BUZZ

    "Not a weekend goes by that doesn't see this popular restaurant packing in the crowds. With a name like this, you don’t need a degree in rocket science to guess what it specializes in." -SG Now

There's a reason why Yum Cha always seems to be alive with hungry patrons, and that has a lot to do with their dim sum. Tried-and-true renditions of Xiao Long Bao, Prawn Dumplings, Fish Roe Siew Mai and more come piping hot from the kitchen, rolled in by traditional push cart to excited diners. The classics are certainly excellent, but Yum Cha also excels in trendier items like Malay Cake from Hong Kong, and Crispy Red Bean with Banana, which they challenge their kitchens to introduce to the menu every now and then. All are solid in taste with recipes very similar to those you grew up with, tossing you back into a haze of tasty nostalgia (or perhaps that's just a food coma). The setting is apt for the retro dishes, with round marble tables and basic wooden chairs that recall traditional Chinese dining. Yum Cha has much more up their chefs' sleeves than just dim sum, however. Take part in the "Tapino" dining style, gathered around the hotpot. The rich broth and communal atmosphere truly give the place a feeling of home. At the original Chinatown outlet, delight in the hi-tea a la carte buffet with over 60 items to choose from. At only $23.80++ for adults and $16.80++ for kids, it's a value that can't be beat and will have everyone saying "yum"(cha)! (Sep 2014)

  • ABOUT

    Hipster food doesn’t get any better than this: grain bowls topped with rich, flavourful, comforting ingredients, well-made “fast food” with gourmet touches, innovative snacks, and punchy coffee to wash it all down with. This Bugis cafe and bistro delivers on the promise of “yum” in its name. Try the Chicken Shogayaki Bowl, tender chunks of chicken thigh, a comforting garlic ginger sauce, shredded seaweed, and pickled ginger top a bowlful of chewy long grains, making for warm, chickeny mouthfuls. Then there’s the Smoked Salmon Bowl, think a massive sushi roll in a bowl: vinegared rice is topped with fatty smoked Norwegian salmon and creamy avocado, then garnished with tobiko, and a zingy sprinkling of lemon zest. For a carb bomb of a different sort, try the Beef Burger, fluffy brioche buns filled with a rich grilled patty, fat mushroom, all enrobed by some melty Emmental cheese. Pair all that with some Shitake Tempura, tender shiitake mushrooms battered till crispy and served with mayo and a squeeze of lemon. Wash it all down with a helping of the house Espresso, and some Tempura Ice Cream, a magical battered block of creamy heaven served with salted caramel sauce. Comfort food at its best! (Jun 2017)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Soft Shell Crab Burger, Chili Crab Mee, Beef Burger, Deluxe Burger, YC Shibuya Toast

  • ABOUT

    Find the best of both worlds nestled in the heart of Bencoolen’s Art District at Yuugo with a fusion menu that serves a mix of Japanese and Western delights. Featuring minimalist decor and a casual vibe, look forward to engaging in meaningful conversations with your friends and loved ones as you munch on waffles, gelatos and a wide selection of delectable bites. Start off with a light starter dish of Cold Angel Hair with Ikura and Truffle Oil to satisfy your pasta cravings. Pair with a plate of Torched Beef Cubes and Truffle Fries to share around the table before diving into delicious Japanese bentos, dons and pizzas. Chef recommendations include the Unadon, Tempura Bento as well as the 10 inch Mushroom Pizza. Dropping by for a late breakfast or early lunch? The All Day Brunch menu option is the perfect mix of tasty hotdogs, eggs and fluffy bread to fill you up! Don’t forget to leave enough room to stomach the array of desserts available on Yuugo’s extensive menu. Crowd favourites such as the Apple Crumble and Waffle with Ice Cream are luscious treats drenched in sweet maple syrup you will not be able to resist. (Nov 2021)

  • DISHES WE LOVE

    Torched Beef Cubes, Tempura Bento, Mushroom Pizza, Apple Crumble
